The collective action was organized by groups that make up the Memory, Truth, and Justice Movement.

On 14 July 2023, in Buenos Aires - Comuna 1 (Ciudad Autonoma de Buenos Aires) residents of Villa 31 blocked the entrance to the Retiro terminal to demand that authorities actively search for a girl who disappeared on July 10. Participants burned tires in front of the terminal after first going to the headquarters of the Ministry of Education.

On 14 July 2023, in Trelew (Rawson, Chubut), neighbors marched from the Public Services Regulatory Agency building to the municipality to repudiate the implementation of a mechanized system in all transportation in Chubut. Protesters argue that the implementation has no legal basis.

On 14 July 2023, in Buenos Aires - Comuna 14 (Ciudad Autonoma de Buenos Aires), passengers protested at the Jorge Newbery Airport to demand the rescheduling of flights after the cancellation of their original itineraries. The action took place within the framework of the work stoppage of baggage staff at other Argentine airports.

On 14 July 2023, in Ituzaingo (Buenos Aires), prisoners at the 4th Police Station clashed with the prison police in a rally that lasted at least five hours. The prisoners took two police officers hostage, who were later released. At least 21 detainees fled during the confrontation. There were no casualties.

On 14 July 2023, in Riberalta (Beni), members of the Special Force for the Fight against Drug Trafficking (FELCN) and of the Government Ministry carried out an operative on the shore of Madre de Dios River, to arrest illegal gold miners. A total of 49 miners were arrested and 30 boats were burned. Residents also claimed that they used tear gas against them.

On 14 July 2023, in Santa Cruz de la Sierra (Santa Cruz), a group of municipal workers carrying out an operative of sidewalk control of informal merchants clashed against merchants, after the municipal workers were rude and threw their products. One merchant was injured, as well as three municipal workers.

On 14 July 2023, in Arapiraca (Alagoas), a man was shot and killed by two individuals at the Senador Teotonio Vilela neighborhood. The deceased had a police record for criminal association (unspecified). Motivations and identity of the perpetrators are unknown. 1 fatality.

Around 14 July 2023 (as reported), in Manaus - East Zone (Amazonas), a man was killed and dismembered by unknown individuals and his body parts were found inside a fridge. The body had blunt and gunshot wounds. Circumstances of death are unknown. 1 fatality.

On 14 July 2023, in Manaus - North Zone (Amazonas), a man suspected of theft was beaten up and severely injured by residents in the Braga Mendes community, Cidade de Deus neighborhood. The victim was taken to a hospital by emergency responders.

Around 14 July 2023 (as reported), in Caucaia (Ceara), a man and a woman were shot and killed and their bodies were found in their home at the Lagoa do Barro neighborhood. Both had a police record of drug trafficking. 2 fatalities.

On 14 July 2023, in Rio de Janeiro - Central Zone (Rio de Janeiro), unknown shooters exchanged fire in the Jamaica locality, Benfica neighborhood. Unknown casualties.

On 14 July 2023, in Porto Alegre (Rio Grande do Sul), nurses gathered in front of a hospital in the Santana neighborhood to demand the payment of delayed wages.

On 14 July 2023, in Guarulhos (Sao Paulo), approximately 60 residents held a demonstration on the Fernao Dias highway, demanding justice for the death of a Traffic Engineering Company worker who was shot dead by an off-duty police officer in the Sao Paulo North Zone (coded separately). Demonstrators blocked both lanes for two hours and burned objects on the road.

The police arrived after a report of an armed individual in the club was made. The suspect was shot and killed at the scene. 1 fatality.
On 14 July 2023, in Taubate (Sao Paulo), medical students held a protest, denouncing working conditions and a lack of funding at the Municipal University Hospital.
On 14 July 2023, in Pedra Branca (Laranjeiras, Sergipe), citizens gathered at the BR-101 highway to demand for better road safety for pedestrians.

On 14 July 2023, in Puerto Montt (Los Lagos), members of the Love Syndrome Foundation protested against lack of economic resources. Authorities stated that without financing they will have to close the foundation affecting 60 children and their families.

On 14 July 2023, in Catemu (Valparaiso), nearly 400 miners and several workers at Catemu mine gathered at Chagres bridge and marched through the streets towards the Catemu square demanding the authorities to rectify the report made by Environmental Assessment Service (SEA) which recommended the closure of the Catemu Plant due to environmental problems. Protesters stated that the report has mistakes. The march takes place days before the vote by the Valparaiso Environmental Evaluation Commission in which authorities must take a decision.

On 14 July 2023, in Concepcion (Biobio), individuals threw stones at buses of the Rengo Lientur Line near the San Sebastian University. Four vehicles ended up damaged. One of the affected bus drivers stated that stones hit very close to the driver's window. Another driver was attacked when he was picking up passengers in the sector. After the attacks, the drivers decided to reduce the bus frequency. Truck drivers also demanded more police presence in the area.

On 14 July 2023, between Galapa and Baranoa municipalities (coded to Galapa, Atlantico), a group of farmers blocked the highway to demand to the government to hand them over the land they were awarded and to evict the person who is occupying the properties.

On 14 July 2023, in Bogota - La Candelaria (Bogota, D.C.), bus drivers protested in front of the mayor's office to demand to the mayor of the city to retract the statement in which she said that bus drivers should be responsible for reprimanding people who do not pay for the bus ticket and blamed them for this issue. They said that that responsibility is not established in their contracts. They also demanded more security. The protest took place after a bus driver was stabbed by two passengers after reprimanding them for not paying the bus ticket. They also had demands related to labor conditions, salaries, contracts, disciplinary procedures and the consortium that has the license to operate the bus public transportation system in the city.

On 14 July 2023, in Bogota - Antonio Narino (Bogota, D.C.), motorcycle drivers protested on Caracas Avenue between 1st and 2nd South Streets against increases in fuel prices, insecurity, and mobility problems.
On 14 July 2023, in Bogota - Chapinero (Bogota, D.C.), motorcycle drivers protested on 7th Avenue with 53rd Street against increases in fuel prices, insecurity, and mobility problems.

On 14 July 2023, in Bogota - Teusaquillo (Bogota, D.C.), motorcycle drivers protested on La Esperanza Avenue in front of the Ministry of Transportation against increases in fuel prices, insecurity, and mobility problems. Another group protested in front of the Virgilio Barco Library.

On 14 July 2023, in Bogota - Fontibon (Bogota, D.C.), a group of motorcycle drivers demonstrated on El Dorado Avenue towards El dorado International Airport against increases in fuel prices insecurity, and mobility problems.

On 14 July 2023, in Manizales (Caldas), tourism and transportation workers and farmers marched on Santander Avenue to Bolivar Square to demand the re-opening of the Los Nevados Natural Park after it was closed temporarily over changes in the activity of the Nevado del Ruiz Volcano. The demonstrators said that the Colombian Geological Service has already changed the level of the alert to yellow and the park has not been opened.

On 14 July 2023, in Mingueo (La Guajira), a group of residents blocked the highway to protest against the Air-e electricity company over high prices and the suspension of the electricity service for many users. They also repudiated the closure of an Air-e office in the village. Finally, they demanded to municipal authorities to return the ambulance that had been donated by a company to Mingueo after it was taken to operate in the municipal seat of Dibulla.

On 14 July 2023, in the rural area of Rosas municipality (Cauca), the mayor's son was kidnapped by unidentified armed individuals in the Florida vereda. The whereabouts of the victim are unknown. The area is known for the presence of armed groups.

On 14 July 2023, in Cuenca (Azuay), merchants blocked the Cuenca - Pasaje highway near Control Sur bus stop with burning tires and woods as a demonstration to voice their grievance about the prohibition of interparish, canton and provincial buses to take passengers in the sector.

On 14 July 2023, in Nemby (Central), parents of students at the Maria Auxiliadora Elementary School in the Mbocayaty neighborhood, organized in the School Cooperator Association (ACES), protested to denounce alleged anomalies in the construction of classrooms and railings. They denounce the construction company and the ministerial authorities for corruption.

On 14 July 2023, in Tacna (Tacna), family members of a woman who died in Hipolito Unanue Regional Hospital staged a demonstration outside the hospital to demand justice in the case of the woman that they believe died due to medical negligence.

On 14 July 2023, in Lima - Santa Anita (Lima), merchants at the Gran Mercado Mayorista staged a demonstration outside the market doors, that were closed by the municipal markets company, to voice their grievances about the rise of cost of entry and exit of cargo trucks. Police officers stopped them from entering the market and clashed with them.

On 14 July 2023, in Requena (Loreto), around 80 civil construction workers at two construction companies staged a demonstration to demand their company to be hired for the country road Requena - Lago Avispa. Both group of workers clashed and threw stuff at each other to remove the other company from the sector.

More officers arrived to the sector to identify a possible clandestine grave. Two people were captured in connection to this attack. 1 fatality.

On 13 July 2023, in Macapa (Amapa), an adolescent was shot and killed in the Sao Lazaro neighborhood by two armed individuals. Before opening fire, the suspects asked if the victim was a gang member, which he denied. Police described the attack as an execution. 1 fatality.

The suspects belong to a drug trafficking group. 1 fatality.

On 13 July 2023, in Pacaraima (Roraima), a Venezuelan woman was shot and killed by an armed individual, who was in the company of a female accomplice. The victim was leaving a taxi in front of her home when the attack occurred. The taxi driver got out to remove her luggage from the trunk, and the attacker demanded she leave the passenger seat, and when she disobeyed the order and tried to move to the back seat, she was shot four times. Another passenger was beaten up by the armed suspect and forced to get out of the car. The suspects then fled. There are no reports on the identity of the perpetrators or the attack's motivation. 1 fatality.

On 13 July 2023, in Sao Paulo - North Zone (Sao Paulo), an off-duty police officer shot a Traffic Engineering Company worker in the head and killed him in the Santana neighborhood. The worker was installing a traffic sign, which was caught by intense wind and hit the police officer. The officer began arguing with the victim and shot him. Residents held a protest the following day (coded separately). 1 fatality.

On 13 July 2023, in Sao Paulo - South Zone (Sao Paulo), four armed suspects on two motorcycles opened fire (drive-by) on a group of people outside a bar in the Jardim Ipiranga neighborhood, Campo Limpo region. Three men were killed. 3 fatalities.
On 13 July 2023, in Taubate (Sao Paulo), public cleaning service workers held a protest and a strike, demanding the payment of late salaries.

On 13 July 2023, in Puerto Montt (Los Lagos), Mapuche Indigenous people protested outside of the Los Lagos Guarantee Court and the Prosecutor's office. Protesters painted with spray both buildings alluding to the freedom of a Mapuche prisoner who has been in preventive detention since December 2021 due to an investigation for the crime against a police officer in the Mafil commune and illegal possession of weapons (coded separately).
On 13 July 2023, in Antofagasta (Antofagasta), workers at the Fluitek Marco company protested with banners against the suspected hiring of replacements.

On 13 July 2023, in Puerto Montt (Los Lagos), workers at Cosal Construction Company gathered outside of the city hall demanding the payment of their salaries. Protesters argued that the creation of a protected area does not allow the installation of desalination plants in their commune, which can cause serious problems due to water scarcity. Residents also delivered a petition letter and stated that they do not feel represented by the people who attended meetings about the project.

On 13 July 2023, in Bogota - Chapinero (Bogota, D.C.), a group of residents, city councilors, urban planners, and local experts gathered on 7th Avenue with 72nd Street to protest against the 'Corredor Verde' infrastructure project. They claim that the mayor of the city does not listen to their petitions and concerns regarding the project.

On 13 July 2023, in Aremasain (La Guajira), at least 15 parents at a school for Wayuu Indigenous students blocked the entrance to the institution to protest against the expulsion of ten students who had posted on social media a video recorded at the premises of the school that, according to the directives, was against the rules, morals and decency. Protesters demanded that the students be reintegrated into the school.

The attack occurred as the prisoner's girlfriend and the driver picked him up from prison, as he was allowed to leave for the day for work. Police believe the attack was motivated by drug trafficking disputes. Another prisoner on a semi-open regime for drug trafficking convictions was identified as a suspect by authorities. 1 fatality.

Police officers were present, and a clash almost occurred, but the former president pleaded not to fight against the police.

Authorities also seized seven motorcycles, six guns and one grenade. 1 fatality.

On 10 July 2023, in Manaus - Central West Zone (Amazonas), a man suspected of theft was beaten up and injured by residents at a gas station on the Jacira Reis street. The suspect was detained by police.

Around 10 July 2023 (as reported), in Parintins (Amazonas), a man was killed by unknown individuals and his body was found in a stream in the Uniao neighborhood with signs of torture and hands tied up. Circumstances of death are unknown. 1 fatality.

Around 10 July 2023 (as reported), in Anapolis (Goias), a man was killed by unknown individuals and his body was found near a park with stab wounds and partially burnt. The victim was a drug user and had a drug debt. 1 fatality.

On 10 July 2023, in Jatai (Goias), two armed individuals on a motorcycle opened fire against the driver of a car in a drive-by shooting. The victim lost control of the vehicle, hit a fence and died. Authorship and motivation of the attack are unknown. 1 fatality.

On 10 July 2023, in Nova Mutum (Mato Grosso), a man was superficially injured in a drive-by shooting in the Jardim das Palmeiras neighborhood by two armed individuals on a motorcycle. There are no reports on the identity of the perpetrators or the attack's motivation.

actor1: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
notes: On 10 July 2023, in Santa Fe de Minas (Minas Gerais), drug trafficking suspects exchanged fire with military police during an intervention in the Lajedo neighborhood. Two suspects were arrested immediately and a third was arrested on 11 July 2023. Police seized portions of drugs. There were no fatalities.

Around 10 July 2023 (as reported), in the rural area of Uberaba municipality (Minas Gerais), a man was killed by unknown individuals and his body was found in a field near the BR-050 highway with gunshot wounds and with his arms and legs tied up. The victim had been missing since 2 July 2023. Circumstances of death are unknown. 1 fatality.

actor1: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
notes: Property destruction: On 10 July 2023, in the rural area of Carnaubeira da Penha (Pernambuco), the military police burned a crop of 4.8 thousand marijuana plants.

On 10 July 2023, in Luis Correia (Piaui), a woman was kidnapped from her home at the Brejinho community by four unidentified armed men. The police claims she was taken because she had a relationship with the member of a rival group on which the gang wanted information. Her whereabouts are unknown.
tags: women targeted: relatives of targeted groups or persons

actor2: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
notes: On 10 July 2023, in Duque de Caxias (Rio de Janeiro), suspects linked to organized crime exchanged fire with military police officers during an operation in the Gramacho neighborhood. The shootout continued in the Lagoinha neighborhood, where one suspect was injured. Between two and four suspects were killed. Police seized a pistol, ammunition, drugs, and a vehicle. At least 2 fatalities.

Around 10 July 2023 (as reported), in Resende (Rio de Janeiro), unknown suspects killed a person. The body was found charred, with gunshot wounds, and hands and feet tied in the Vila Verde neighborhood. 1 fatality.

On 10 July 2023, in Rio Bonito (Rio de Janeiro), drug traffickers physically assaulted and tortured a woman in the Rio Vermelho area. The woman was attacked with kicks, punches, blows from a stick and a brick to the head. The perpetrators accused the victim of being an informant. One suspect was later captured and arrested. There were no fatalities.

On 10 July 2023, in Rio de Janeiro - North Zone (Rio de Janeiro), a group of drug traffickers opened fire on an application-based motorcycle taxi driver in the Cidade Alta community, Cordovil neighborhood. The victim was passing by a drug selling point after he made a delivery, and was told to pull over and was interrogated by the drug traffickers, and then was shot at and injured after the perpetrators discovered that he was the son of a military police officer. There were no fatalities.

On 10 July 2023, in Rio de Janeiro - North Zone (Rio de Janeiro), unknown shooters exchanged fire in the Engenho de Dentro and Manguinhos neighborhoods and the Urubu community, Piedade neighborhood. Unknown casualties.
On 10 July 2023, in Rio de Janeiro - West Zone (Rio de Janeiro), unknown shooters exchanged fire in the Campo Grande neighborhood. Unknown casualties.

assoc_actor_1: PSOL: Socialism and Liberty Party; Government of Brazil (2023-)
notes: On 10 July 2023, in Natal (Rio Grande do Norte), citizens of the Lagoa Seca neighborhood gathered to demonstrate against the cutting of trees at the Jaguarari Avenue, which are being removed to turn the road into a one-way street. A councilmember (PSOL) participated in the protest.

On 10 July 2023, in Sao Bernardo do Campo (Sao Paulo), two hooded and armed suspects abducted a man from a gas station. A third person arrived on foot and assisted the two suspects in the abduction, by helping to force the victim into the car. The whereabouts of the victim are not known.

actor2: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
notes: On 10 July 2023, in Sao Vicente (Sao Paulo), armed suspects exchanged fire with military police during an operation in the Dique do Picarro community. Two military police officers were shot and injured, and a female civilian was injured by a stray bullet. There were no fatalities.

On 10 July 2023, in Concepcion (Biobio), residents of the Lorenzo Arenas neighborhood erected incendiary barricades on the railway demanding citizen security and against the high crime rates in the area. Demonstrators also gathered on Fenix street with banners before moving to the railway where they prevented the trains' regular traffic.

On 10 July 2023, in Concepcion (Biobio), relatives and friends of an old man murdered in the Las Canchas sector gathered outside of Court demanding justice for the victim. The group of people are members of the Association of Relatives of Victims in Biobio.

On 10 July 2023, in Alto Hospicio (Tarapaca), residents of the El Boro neighborhood protested against the death of a neighbour who resisted the robbery of his car. Protesters demanded justice for the crime and stated that there are high crime rates in the area. Residents demanded greater police presence.

assoc_actor_1: Health Workers (Chile); AFUSAM: Association of Municipal Health Workers; CONFUSAM: National Confederation of Municipal Health Officials of Chile
notes: On 10 July 2023, in Villa Alemana (Valparaiso), unionized health workers with CONFUSAM and AFUSAM arrived at city hall demanding salary improvements and better working conditions. Protesters handed in a petition letter and met with the mayor to address their demands.

On 10 July 2023, in Calama (Antofagasta), about 100 truck drivers, relatives and friends of a truck driver shot in Bolivia after he went to recover his truck stole in Calama, marched through the streets against violence and the theft of vehicles which are taken to Bolivia through unauthorized roads. Protesters arrived at the Provincial Delegation building demanding economic resources for the repatriation of the man.
On 10 July 2023, in El Tanque (Santander), a group of locals blocked the Bucaramanga - La Matanza road at the Tanque bridge to protest against the school transportation service for students.
On 10 July 2023, in Bogota - La Candelaria (Bogota, D.C.), a group of people protested in the city center on 12th street. There is no further information about the motives of the protest.

On 10 July 2023, in Bogota - Tunjuelito (Bogota, D.C.), a group of people protested blocking the Southern Highway in the Venecia neighborhood. There is no further information about the motives of the protest.

Around 10 July 2023 (as reported), in Santiago de Cali (Valle del Cauca), a group of members of the LGBTQ+ community held a 'kissathon' to protest for their rights and to be able to show public demonstrations of affection without discrimination. They said that after the 2 July pride month march (coded separately) they felt repudiated when some participants showed affection in public.

source: El Colombiano; El Tiempo (Colombia); RCN Radio
notes: On 10 July 2023, in Frontino (Antioquia), a man was shot and killed by Gulf Clan members in the Tone neighborhood. The perpetrators drove the victim to the place of execution and shot him there, leaving the body on the street. The victim had been kidnapped on 9 July by the Gulf Clan (coded separately). The attack would be related to social cleansing perpetrated by the group in the west of Antioquia. The victim had a criminal record of theft and drug dealing. 1 fatality.

source: El Colombiano; El Tiempo (Colombia); RCN Radio
notes: On 10 July 2023, in the rural area of Canasgordas municipality (Antioquia), a man was shot and killed by Gulf Clan members in the Canelito vereda. The perpetrators drove the victim to the place of execution and shot him there. The victim had been kidnapped on 9 July by the Gulf Clan in Frontino municipality (coded separately). The attack would be related to social cleansing perpetrated by the group in the west of Antioquia. The victim had a criminal record of theft and drug dealing. 1 fatality.

On 10 July 2023, in Natagaima (Tolima), a group of Indigenous people blocked the Girardot - Neiva highway to protest against problems with the electricity and drinking water services in the rural area they live in. They say that the services are cut for several hours a day.

Around 10 July 2023 (as reported), in Jurado municipality (Choco), military and police forces clashed with Gulf Clan members during an operation against the group. Two Gulf Clan members were killed in the clash. Afterward, nine members of the group who were discovered nearby by security forces turned themselves in, including two leaders. Authorities also seized four weapons. 2 fatalities.

On 10 July 2023, in Mariquita (Tolima), hundreds of residents marched from Concordia Park to Jose Celestino Mutis Square to protest against increasing insecurity and high homicide rates caused by gangs.

On 10 July 2023, near the Tomarrazon (Treinta) corregimiento (La Guajira), a farmer was shot and killed by two unidentified armed individuals. It was known that the victim was talking to the perpetrators before he was killed. There is no further information on the motives and perpetrators of the attack. 1 fatality.

Defusal: Around 10 July 2023 (as reported), in the rural area of Tame municipality (Arauca), military forces deactivated two explosive devices planted by the ELN in the Santa Ines vereda that were going to be used to attack members of security forces.

assoc_actor_2: Former FARC: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia
notes: On 10 July 2023, in the rural area of Toribio municipality (Cauca), unidentified armed individuals shot and killed a former FARC member in the Tierreros vereda. There is no further information on the motives and perpetrators of the attack but there is presence of the ELN and FARC dissident groups in the area. 1 fatality.

Around 10 July 2023 (as reported), in the rural area of Villanueva municipality (La Guajira), a group of farmers protested blocking the way of workers at the Edensa company in the Eneal vereda. They protested against the bad state of the road that goes to Los Zajones and Las Flores veredas which they said has been caused by the circulation of heavy transportation vehicles property of Edensa on it. They demanded to the company to repair the road.

actor1: FARC Dissident: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia Dissident Faction
notes: On 10 July 2023, in the rural area of Algeciras municipality (Huila), a Venezuelan man was shot dead and his body was found in Las Dams vereda with six gunshot wounds and next to a note signed by a FARC dissident group that said that the victim was killed fir being a drug dealer, which has not been confirmed. Forensic investigations indicated that the victim was killed earlier on the same day the body was found. 1 fatality.

Around 10 July 2023 (as reported), in the rural area of Olaya municipality (Antioquia), two men were shot and killed and their bodies were found in the Quebrada Seca vereda. The attack was attributed to the Gulf Clan. The attack would be related to social cleansing perpetrated by the group in the west of Antioquia. The victims had a criminal record of theft and drug dealing. 2 fatalities.

On 10 July 2023, in the vicinity of Victoria municipality (Caldas), a group of people blocked the La Dorada - Honda highway to protest against the Miel 2 hydroelectric plan infrastructure project over environmental concerns. They demanded a meeting with the Environmental Ministry.

On 10 July 2023, in Aremasain (La Guajira), parents at a school for Wayuu Indigenous students blocked the entrance to the institution to protest against the expulsion of ten students who had posted on social media a video recorded at the premises of the school that, according to the directives, was against the rules, morals and decency. Protesters demanded that the students be reintegrated into the school.

On 10 July 2023, in Medellin - Central East (Antioquia), a group of health workers protested in front of city hall demanding the renewal of the contract of more than 300 workers of the 'Medellin Takes Care of Me' social program. The contracts expired on 31 May and they have not received an answer from authorities to the date. They said that vulnerable communities that are beneficiaries of the program are being affected by this problem.

On 10 July 2023, in Tierralta municipality (Cordoba), suspected Gulf Clan members opened fire on the tires of a bus of public service with 18 passengers inside. Authorities are investigating if the attack was related to a theft or to extortion retaliations. There were no casualties.

On 10 July 2023, in the rural area of Tibu municipality (Norte de Santander), there was an armed clash between members of the military forces and an unidentified armed group in the Puerto Las Palmas vereda. One civilian was injured in the clash. 30 families were forcibly displaced and they reported that members of security forces beat two of them. There were no fatalities.
On 10 July 2023, in Acevedo municipality (Huila), military forces clashed with the Frontier Command in the context of a military operation against the group. There were no casualties.

On 10 July 2023, in Santo Domingo de los Colorados (Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas), residents of the Santa Martha sector entered the house of a man that was accused of sexually assaulting a person with disabilities, took out his belongings to the street and burned them. Police officers intervened and dispersed them.

On 10 July 2023, around Asuncion municipality (Jujuy), workers at the Paraguayan Communications Company (Copaco) protested to demand the appointment of a new president for the entity. The demonstrators also demand payment of their salaries, which have been in arrears, and repudiated nepotism in the company.

On 10 July 2023, in Mollendo (Arequipa), parents of students at Carlos M. Febres school staged a demonstration outside Alto Inclan hospital to demand the governor a solution about the classrooms that have not been constructed since last year.

On 10 July 2023, in Lima - Comas (Lima), dozens of residents staged a demonstration at Pasamayito highway at Curva del Diablo sector to demand the local government to carry out maintenance and improvements on the highway. The sector is prone to accidents, and the demonstration happened after two busses crashed.

On 10 July 2023, in Caracas - Libertador (Distrito Capital), a group of relatives of a woman killed four months before in a suspected femicide, protested to demand justice for her. The protesters gathered outside the Public Ministry Office, by Carabobo Park.

source: 800 Noticias; Cactus 24; El Carabobeno; La Patilla; La Voz
notes: On 10 July 2023, near San Felix (Falcon), military air forces shot down an aircraft in flight from Mexico thought to belong to an unidentified criminal group linked to drug trafficking. The aircraft entered Venezuelan airspace without authorization, flying at low altitude, with its radio and transponder switched off. The pilot of the airplane was killed. 1 fatality.

assoc_actor_2: Prisoners (Venezuela); Police Forces of Venezuela (1999-) Prison Guards
notes: On 10 July 2023, in Cumana (Sucre), a riot broke out between prisoners of the CDP Municipal Police Prison. Prison guards police intervened to de-escalate the situation. Two prisoners were injured and taken to hospital for treatment. The motivations for this brawl are unknown. There were no fatalities.

source: El Diario (Venezuela); La Prensa del Tachira
notes: On 10 July 2023, near San Jose de Bolivar (Tachira), a group of residents of Quebrada Grande and El Sinara protested to demand the repair of a local road that gets damaged every time there is heavy rain. The protesters call for the installation of a temporary bridge.

On 9 July 2023, in Guatemala City, Guatemala, around 40 domestic workers staged a protest in the Obelisco Square in zone 10 to demand better working conditions. Women members of the Support Center for Domestic Workers (CENTRACAP) said that their work is not being acknowledged by the society.

On 9 July 2023, in Omoa municipality, Cortes, unidentified armed men shot and killed two men in their private residence in Tulian Campo community. According to witnesses, several armed men entered their house and started shooting. One of the victims was also a security guard. The reason for the killing is unknown. 2 fatalities.

On 9 July 2023, in Tocoa, Colon, unidentified armed men shot and killed two men after entering a restaurant in Tocoa, a third victim was severely injured. One of the victims was the son of a former councillor, though this information has not been confirmed by authorities. The reason for the killing is unknown. 2 fatalities.

On 9 July 2023, in Managua, Managua, police arrested a Catholic priest on the Northern Road. The motivation for his arrest was not disclosed. Members of the Catholic church have been subjected to constant attacks by the government for their association with the political opposition in the country.

On 9 July 2023, in Mejicanos, San Salvador, two members of Barrio 18 Revolucionarios beat a man and the victim died later in the hospital. The motivation for the attack is unknown. No more information is provided by the source. 1 fatality.

On 9 July 2023, in General Pinto (Buenos Aires), relatives and neighbors of a murdered young man rioted in the local Communal Police headquarters to demand justice, security, and the continuation of the apprehension of the aggressor. The participants confronted the police, who responded with tear gas, stones, and rubber bullets to disperse the crowd. A group of rioters deviated from the march to set fire to the house of the alleged murderer, and the police station.

source: Diario El Dia; El Libertador; El Observador
notes: On 9 July 2023, in Resistencia (San Fernando, Chaco), more than 400 protesters, mostly relatives and friends of a missing journalist, presumably a victim of femicide, marched from the Prosecutor's Office to the city center to demand justice. The protesters demand an acceleration of the investigation, which accuses influential local social leaders, and the negation of house arrest to them.

On 9 July 2023, in Purmamarca (Tumbaya, Jujuy), Protesters blocked the roads to repudiate the provincial constitutional reform promoted by Governor Morales. Participants allowed vehicular traffic every six hours.

On 9 July 2023, in Abra Pampa (Cochinoca, Jujuy), protesters blocked National Route 9 to repudiate the provincial constitutional reform promoted by Governor Morales. Participants allowed vehicular traffic every six hours. In this blockade, a civilian died of a cardiorespiratory arrest while waiting for the road to be released.

On 9 July 2023, in Tilcara (Jujuy), protesters blocked the roads to repudiate the provincial constitutional reform promoted by Governor Morales. Participants allowed vehicular traffic every six hours.

On 9 July 2023, in Uquia (Humahuaca, Jujuy), protesters blocked routes to the north of the town to repudiate the provincial constitutional reform promoted by Governor Morales. Participants allowed vehicular traffic every six hours.

On 9 July 2023, in Iturbe (Humahuaca, Jujuy), protesters blocked the roads to repudiate the provincial constitutional reform promoted by Governor Morales. Participants allowed vehicular traffic every six hours.

On 9 July 2023, in Coranzuli (Susques, Jujuy), protesters blocked routes to the north of the town to repudiate the provincial constitutional reform promoted by Governor Morales. Participants allowed vehicular traffic every twelve hours.

On 9 July 2023, in El Moreno (Tumbaya, Jujuy), protesters blocked routes to the north of the town to repudiate the provincial constitutional reform promoted by Governor Morales. Participants allowed vehicular traffic every two hours.

On 9 July 2023, in Susques (Jujuy), protesters blocked routes to the north of the town to repudiate the provincial constitutional reform promoted by Governor Morales. Participants allowed vehicular traffic every eight hours.

On 9 July 2023, in Tusaquillas (Cochinoca, Jujuy), protesters blocked routes to the north of the town to repudiate the provincial constitutional reform promoted by Governor Morales. Participants allowed vehicular traffic every hour.

On 9 July 2023, in Quillacollo (Cochabamba), for the fifth consecutive day, farmers residents of the Cotapachi Agrarian Central blocked the municipal land fill as a demonstration to demand the local government a plan to improve the trash management and to move the land fill.

On 9 July 2023, in Oruro (Oruro), for the fourth consecutive day, unionized heavy cargo transportation workers blocked different streets and highway as a demonstration to demand the release of two drivers that were arrested for transporting illicit substances.

On 9 July 2023, in Maceio (Alagoas), a man was shot and injured by four armed individuals at the Jardim Petropolis neighborhood. The target of the attack had a warrant out for his arrest (unspecified) and had a police record of homicide. Motivations and identity of the perpetrators are unknown. There were no fatalities.

On 9 July 2023, in Laranjal do Jari (Amapa), a man was stabbed and killed by unknown individuals. The victim was a drug user and used to commit theft to support his addiction. One suspect was arrested hours after the attack. 1 fatality.

actor1: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
notes: On 9 July 2023, in Manaus - East Zone (Amazonas), members of the CV exchanged fire with military police in the Bela Vista community, Puraquequara neighborhood. One CV member was shot and killed. The group was planning an attack against rival gang members. 1 fatality.

On 9 July 2023, in Feira de Santana (Bahia), two unidentified armed groups engaged in a shootout during the Bando Anunciador de Sant'Ana parade, at the city's center. Three civilians were injured by stray bullets. There were no fatalities.
On 9 July 2023, in Goiania (Goias), a man suspected of sexual harassment was beaten up and injured by people in the Jardim Goias neighborhood. The man was arrested by military police.

On 9 July 2023, in Barra do Bugres (Mato Grosso), a man was shot and killed inside a bar by two armed individuals. There are no reports on the identity of the perpetrators or the attack's motivation. 1 fatality.

Around 9 July 2023 (as reported), in Peixoto de Azevedo (Mato Grosso), a man was killed and decapitated by unknown individuals and his body was found on the MT-322 highway. Circumstances of death are unknown. 1 fatality.

On 9 July 2023, in Dourados (Mato Grosso do Sul), a man was injured in a drive-by shooting on the Albino Torraca street by armed individuals in a car. Authorship and motivation of the attack are unknown. There were no fatalities.

Around 9 July 2023 (as reported), in Navirai (Mato Grosso do Sul), a Paraguayan woman was killed by unknown individuals and her burnt body was found inside a residence with blunt wounds. The residence was set on fire. The residence was a meeting point for drug users. 1 fatality.

Around 9 July 2023 (as reported), in Campo Belo (Minas Gerais), a man was shot approximately 20 times and killed in a drive-by shooting in the Floresta neighborhood by four armed individuals in a car. Authorship and motivation of the attack are unknown. 1 fatality.

On 9 July 2023, in Foz do Iguacu (Parana), family members and friends carried out a protest to demand justice for the case of a municipal guard affiliated with the PT who was shot to death at his birthday party by a Bolsonaro supporter who was an off-duty prison guard on 9 July 2022 (coded separately).

Around 9 July 2023 (as reported), in Barra do Pirai (Rio de Janeiro), at least one drug trafficker killed a man, and his body was found on a soccer field with signs of beating and gunshot wounds in the Vargem Alegre district. The victim had just robbed a bakery before being killed. Police arrested several individuals and seized a firearm and drugs. 1 fatality.
On 9 July 2023, in Duque de Caxias (Rio de Janeiro), unknown shooters exchanged fire in the Praca da Prainha neighborhood. Unknown casualties.
On 9 July 2023, in Rio de Janeiro - Central Zone (Rio de Janeiro), unknown shooters exchanged fire in the Rio Comprido neighborhood. Unknown casualties.
On 9 July 2023, in Rio de Janeiro - North Zone (Rio de Janeiro), unknown shooters exchanged fire in the Pilares neighborhood. Unknown casualties.

actor1: Police Forces of Brazil (2023-) Civil Police
assoc_actor_2: Women (Brazil); Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
source: G1; Globo Extra; Informe Agora; R7
notes: On 9 July 2023, in Rio de Janeiro - West Zone (Rio de Janeiro), a civil police officer opened fire in a residential area following a complaint about loud music in the Jacarepagua neighborhood. One off-duty military police officer and two civilian women were shot and injured. The officer claimed his gun fell and fired accidentally, though this is not confirmed. The officer fled the scene after the shooting. There were no fatalities.
On 9 July 2023, in Rio de Janeiro - West Zone (Rio de Janeiro), unknown shooters exchanged fire in the Taquara and Vila Valquiere neighborhoods. Unknown casualties.

On 9 July 2023, in Porto Velho (Rondonia), an adolescent was injured in a drive-by shooting in the Lagoinha neighborhood by an armed individual on a motorcycle. Police believe the attack was motivated by rivalries between drug trafficking groups. There were no fatalities.

Around 9 July 2023 (as reported), in Boa Vista (Roraima), a Venezuelan man was killed and decapitated and his body was found rolled in tarp on the side of the road in the 13 de Setembro neighborhood. Police believe the victim was killed by Venezuelans. 1 fatality.
On 9 July 2023, in Cubatao (Sao Paulo), friends and relatives of victims in a traffic accident held a protest, demanding more security on the Rodovia Anchieta highway.

Property destruction: On 9 July 2023, in Pillanlelbun (Araucania), seven hooded individuals set the employer's house and a tractor on fire in the Quintrilpe farm. Perpetrators intimidated two men that were inside the house and stole a shotgun and a cell phone before the attack. A pamphlet in which the National Mapuche Liberation (LNM) took responsibility for the attack was found at the scene. The group demanded freedom for the Mapuche prisoners and alluded to the anniversary of the death of the member of the CAM killed by police in Carahue (coded separately).

Property destruction: On 9 July 2023, in the rural area of Perquenco commune (Araucania), the same seven hooded individuals who committed an arson attack in Pillanlelbun (coded separately), arrived at the Dona Nena farm on Route S-328. Perpetrators forced the keeper to enter a house while they went to set fire to a warehouse, offices, a container, five tractors and fumigators. A pamphlet in which the National Mapuche Liberation (LNM) took responsibility for the attack was found at the scene. The group demanded freedom for the Mapuche prisoners and alluded to the anniversary of the death of the member of the CAM killed by police in Carahue (coded separately).

actor2: FARC Dissident - 48th Front: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia Dissident Faction (48th Front - Pedro Martinez)
notes: Around 9 July 2023 (as reported), in the rural area of Albania municipality (Caqueta), military forces clashed with members of the FARC dissident group 48th front in the Bella Aurora vereda. Five FARC dissidents were arrested, including one group leader involved in drug-trafficking, unspecified attacks against the civilian population, and several clashes with the Carolina Ramirez FARC dissident faction. Authorities seized weapons and other equipment. There were no casualties.

Around 9 July 2023 (as reported), in the rural area of Puerto Guzman municipality (Putumayo), military forces clashed with members of an unidentified armed group in La Pradera vereda. One member of the group was injured, taken to a hospital for treatment and arrested. Several other people were also arrested. There were no fatalities.

On 9 July 2023, in Cartagena (Bolivar), residents of the Asturia neighborhood blocked Circunvalar Avenue because that had been six days without drinking water. They demanded solutions to this problem.

On 9 July 2023, in Frontino municipality (Antioquia), Gulf Clan members kidnapped two men. Both victims were shot dead on 10 July in the municipal seat of Frontino (coded separately) and in Canasgordas municipality (coded separately). The attacks would be related to social cleansing perpetrated by the group in the west of Antioquia. The victims had a criminal record of theft and drug dealing.

Around 9 July 2023 (as reported), around Montelibano municipality (Cordoba), three men were kidnapped by Gulf Clan members. The victims were rescued during a military operation in Lorica municipality days later (coded separately). The victims reported that the intention of the perpetrators was killing them over settling of scores.

actor1: FARC Dissident: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia Dissident Faction
notes: On 9 July 2023, in the rural area of Cajibio municipality (Cauca), suspected members of a FARC dissident group shot and killed a man for not stopping at an illegal checkpoint they had installed in the Aurelia vereda. The area is known for the presence of armed groups. 1 fatality.

On 9 July 2023, in the rural area of Caloto municipality (Cauca), unidentified armed individuals opened fire against the house of a mayoral pre-candidate for Caloto municipality. The candidate is also a former health and social development secretary, former agriculture and social development secretary, former treasury secretary and former acting mayor of Suarez and Caloto municipalities. There were no casualties.

On 9 July 2023, in Guayaquil (Guayas), at least eight residents of the Los Esteros sector at the south of the city captured, stripped of his clothes and beat up a man who was captured after he stole from a woman.

On 8 July 2023, in Guatemala City, Guatemala, dozens of people, including students, staged a protest in zone 1 to demand the officialization of the electoral results, which were suspended by order of the Electoral Supreme Tribunal.
On 8 July 2023, in Cofradia, Cortes, armed men on a motorcycle shot and killed a rancher in front of a veterinary (drive-by). The reason for the killing is unknown. 1 fatality

assoc_actor_2: Police Forces of Honduras (2022-); Labor Group (Honduras)
notes: On 8 July 2023, in Jutiapa, Danli, two unidentified armed men shot and killed an off-duty police officer and the President of a labor union in front of a local market. The reason for the killing is unknown. 2 fatalities.

On 8 July 2023, in Comayaguela, Francisco Morazan, a group of residents beat a man after he killed another individual in a party in colonia 3 de Mayo. The National Police arrived at the scene and prevented the angry mob from killing him.

On 8 July 2023, in Comodoro Rivadavia (Escalante, Chubut), ATeCh-affiliated teachers protested outside the local cultural center, where a book fair was taking place, to demand better wages and school infrastructure. Teachers pointed out that some schools even do not have heating.

On 8 July 2023, in Comodoro Rivadavia (Escalante, Chubut), relatives and friends of an oil company worker who suffered a work accident and later died marched through the city streets. Protesters marched from School 83 Plaza to the nearby Cultural Center, expressing their concerns about the company's inadequate job security measures for their employees.

On 8 July 2023, around San Salvador de Jujuy (Dr. Manuel Belgrano, Jujuy), protesters blocked roads in the province to repudiate the provincial constitutional reform. The source do not specify the locations of at least ten provincial and national roadblocks.

On 8 July 2023, in Rio Cuarto (Cordoba), relatives and friends of a missing teenager protested at the Departmental Unit headquarters to demand more significant action in the search for the young woman.

On 8 July 2023, in Quillacollo (Cochabamba), for the fourth consecutive day, farmers residents of the Cotapachi Agrarian Central blocked the municipal land fill as a demonstration to demand the local government a plan to improve the trash management and to move the land fill.

On 8 July 2023, in Cochabamba (Cochabamba), pedestrians of America avenue captured and beat up a man that had recently robbed a store. They later burned the motorcycle the man used, and turned the man to the police.

On 8 July 2023, in Concepcion (Santa Cruz), for the third consecutive day, residents and the local mayor marched through the city and blocked the highway that connects to Santa Cruz de la Sierra as a demonstration to demand the arrest of a man that sexually assaulted an Ayorean Indigenous girl. They also demanded more police officers assigned to the district and the construction of a police module.

On 8 July 2023, in Oruro (Oruro), for the third consecutive day, unionized heavy cargo transportation workers blocked different streets and highway as a demonstration to demand the release of two drivers that were arrested for transporting illicit substances.

On 8 July 2023, in Igaci (Alagoas), a man was killed in a drive-by shooting by unknown individuals in a car at the Sitio Dionisio neighborhood. Motivations and identity of the perpetrators are unknown. 1 fatality.

On 8 July 2023, in Manaus - North Zone (Amazonas), a man was tossed out of a car by armed individuals in the Mutirao neighborhood, shot in the face and killed. The suspects also ran over the body with the car. A note was left at the scene indicating the name of the next target. Authorship and motivation of the attack are unknown. 1 fatality.

Around 8 July 2023 (as reported), in Manaus - West Zone (Amazonas), a man was killed by unknown individuals and his body was found in a stream in the Gloria neighborhood with 14 gunshot wounds and hands tied up. Circumstances of death are unknown. 1 fatality.

source: Portal do Holanda; Portal Marcos Santos
notes: On 8 July 2023, in Manaus - West Zone (Amazonas), a man was removed from his residence by drug traffickers and taken to the Compensa neighborhood, where he was tied up, tortured, shot six times, and injured in a drug trafficking tribunal. The motivation for the attack was that the victim was accused of several thefts in the area. The victim was abandoned by the suspects and was rescued by military police, who took the victim to a hospital. There were no fatalities.
On 8 July 2023, in Rio Preto da Eva (Amazonas), a man was shot and killed at a bridge by two armed individuals. Authorship and motivation of the attack are unknown. 1 fatality.

On 8 July 2023, in Fortaleza (Ceara), two teenager brothers were shot and killed by gang members who controlled the Caucaia neighborhood. The children were the siblings of a member of a rival faction and were killed in a drug trafficking tribunal. 2 fatalities.

actor1: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
notes: On 8 July 2023, in Vitoria (Espirito Santo), drug traffickers exchanged fire with military police in the Penha neighborhood. One civilian man was killed in the crossfire. 1 fatality.

actor1: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
notes: On 8 July 2023, in Goiania (Goias), a drug trafficker exchanged fire with military police during his arrest operation on warrants for murder, drug trafficking, and other charges, in the Rio Formoso sector. The drug trafficker was killed. 1 fatality.

actor1: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
notes: On 8 July 2023, in Satubinha (Maranhao), three drug traffickers engaged in a shootout with the military police as they tried to flee from the officers. One of the suspects was shot and killed, and was a suspect in the killing a retired police officer the day prior (coded separately). The other two suspects fled and were killed in a shootout on 12 July in Olho d'Agua das Cunhas (coded separately). 1 fatality.

Around 8 July 2023 (as reported), in the rural area of Nortelandia municipality (Mato Grosso), a person was killed and their body found decapitated and in an advanced state of decomposition floating in Paraguaizinho River. Circumstances of death are unknown. 1 fatality.

actor1: Police Forces of Brazil (2023-) Federal Police
notes: Property destruction: On 8 July 2023, in the rural are of Itaquirai municipality (Mato Grosso do Sul), federal police seized 1,017kg of marijuana hidden inside a truck following a chase on the BR-487 highway. A person was arrested.

On 8 July 2023, in Campo Belo (Minas Gerais), five armed individuals invaded a private residence in the Residencial neighborhood looking for a man. The group opened fire in the residence, but no one was injured. Authorship and motivation of the attack are unknown. The attackers fled in vehicles, one of which was recognized as participating in an armed clash with another armed group in the Feira neighborhood later that day (coded separately).

On 8 July 2023, in Campo Belo (Minas Gerais), a shoot-out between unknown armed individuals took place in the Feira neighborhood. There were no fatalities. Shooters in a car were recognized to have participated in an attempted attack earlier that day in a residence in the Residencial neighborhood (coded separately).

On 8 July 2023, in Cataguases (Minas Gerais), family members and friends of a woman who was hit by a truck on 2 July 2023 and did not survive the injuries carried out a march to demand justice for her case.

On 8 July 2023, in Divinopolis (Minas Gerais), a man was killed in a drive-by shooting in the Nacoes neighborhood by an armed individual on a motorcycle. The deceased had a police record for several offences, including drug trafficking, and had left prison on 28 June 2023. Authorship is unknown. 1 fatality.

actor1: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
notes: On 8 July 2023, in Altamira (Para), two members of a drug trafficking group exchanged fire with military police during their arrest operation in the Boa Esperanca neighborhood. Both drug traffickers were killed. The pair had carried out an attack against a couple on 28 June 2023 (coded separately). 2 fatalities.

On 8 July 2023, in Ananindeua (Para), a man was killed in a drive-by shooting in the 40 Horas neighborhood by two armed individuals on a motorcycle. Authorship and motivation of the attack are unknown. 1 fatality.

On 8 July 2023, in Bebelandia (Santa Rita, Paraiba), a former mayoral candidate was shot and killed by two individuals who came to his business establishment. Identity of the perpetrators and motivations are unknown, but the police are investigating the possibility of connection to organized crime in the area. 1 fatality.

source: Folha de S. Paulo; G1; Globo Extra; Informe Agora
notes: On 8 July 2023, in Nova Iguacu (Rio de Janeiro), the Varao police militia exchanged fire with Zinho police militia in the Jardim Pernambuco neighborhood during a birthday party attended by Zinho police militia members. A boy was killed. The rival groups are competing for the control of the territory. 1 fatality.

On 8 July 2023, in Nova Iguacu (Rio de Janeiro), members of a police militia passing by in a vehicle shot and killed a rival police militia member in the Austin neighborhood (drive-by). Another man was killed, and a woman was shot and injured. 2 fatalities.

On 8 July 2023, in Rio de Janeiro - North Zone (Rio de Janeiro), unknown shooters exchanged fire in the Morro do Divino community, Campinho neighborhood and the Manguinhos and Higienopolis neighborhoods. Unknown casualties.

On 8 July 2023, in Rio de Janeiro - West Zone (Rio de Janeiro), members of the Zinho police militia exchanged fire with the Nanan police militia in the Sao Fernando community, Santa Cruz neighborhood. Unknown casualties.

On 8 July 2023, in Rio de Janeiro - West Zone (Rio de Janeiro), unknown shooters exchanged fire in the Chacrinha community, Vila Valquiere neighborhood and the Cosmos and Praca Seca neighborhoods. Unknown casualties.
On 8 July 2023, in Itirapina (Sao Paulo), an armed suspect passing by on a motorcycle shot and killed a man in the Jardim Nova Itirapina neighborhood (drive-by). 1 fatality.

actor1: Police Forces of Brazil (2023-) Civil Police
notes: On 8 July 2023, in Gurupi (Tocantins), two drug traffickers exchanged fire with civil police forces in the Joao Lisboa da Cruz sector. One officer was superficially injured and one suspect was killed. The other suspect was arrested. Police seized portions of drugs, cash and ammunition. 1 fatality.

actor1: FARC Dissident - Jorge Briceno Front: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia Dissident Faction (Jorge Briceno Front)
notes: Around 8 July 2023 (weekend of), in Algeciras (Huila), two unidentified armed individuals on a motorcycle threw a grenade at a supermarket. Three civilians were injured and taken to hospital for treatment. Authorities said that the attack was perpetrated by the Jorge Briceno FARC dissident group because the supermarket owner did not pay extortion money. There were no fatalities.

assoc_actor_2: Wayuu Indigenous Group (Colombia); Unidentified Communal Group (Colombia)
notes: Around 8 July 2023 (weekend of), in Barrancas municipality (La Guajira), several unidentified armed individuals shot at a Wayuu Indigenous social leader of the Nuevo Espinal Indigenous Reserve when he was traveling on his motorcycle in the Las Casitas sector. The leader was not injured as he managed to escape in his vehicle. Other four members of Nuevo Espinal Indigenous community have been killed by armed groups in unspecified attacks in the past. There were no casualties.

source: El Tiempo (Colombia); Radio Nacional De Colombia
notes: On 8 July 2023, in the rural area of Becerril municipality (Cesar), unidentified armed individuals attacked a woman member of the Yukpa Indigenous community who was the legal advisor of the Sokorpa Indigenous Reserve in the Roncon sector. The perpetrators opened fire on the National Protection Unit (UNP) vehicle assigned to members of the community for their protection. Two UNP bodyguards were also in the car. Nobody was injured in the attack. Yukpa Indigenous people have received threats in the past related to legal disputes over land. The area is known for the presence of armed groups. There were no casualties.
tags: women targeted: activists/human rights defenders/social leaders

actor1: FARC Dissident - Dagoberto Ramos: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia Dissident Faction (Dagoberto Ramos)
notes: Looting: Around 8 July 2023 (as reported), in the rural area of Gabriel Lopez corregimiento (Cauca), armed members of the Dagoberto Ramos FARC dissident group intercepted deputies of the Cauca departmental assembly when they were traveling in a vehicle in the Chuscales vereda. The FARC dissidents stole the car.

On 8 July 2023, in Manizales (Caldas), around 600 members of the LGBTQ+ community marched throughout the city to demand the respect and protection of their rights and the approval of an integral law for transgender people. This took place in the context of the commemoration of International Pride Month.

actor1: FARC Dissident - Jorge Briceno Front: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia Dissident Faction (Jorge Briceno Front)
