source: El Espectador; El Universal (Colombia); INDEPAZ; UNOCHA
notes: On 8 July 2023, near La Aguililla village (Caqueta), a former FARC member, who was also president of a Council of Communal Action (JAC) was shot and killed. The victim had gone missing after leaving a meeting with other JAC members and was found dead later that day with a note signed by the Jorge Briceno FARC dissident group, aligned with Gentil Duarte FARC dissidents. The specific motives of the attack are unknown. 1 fatality.

On 8 July 2023, in Tulua (Valle del Cauca), two unidentified armed individuals shot dead a municipal traffic agent near the local market. The Oficina de Tulua gang claimed responsibility for the attack. The motives are unknown. 1 fatality.

On 8 July 2023, in Santander de Quilichao (Cauca), several unidentified armed individuals shot and killed two men and injured another in the Villa Colombia neighborhood. There is no further information on the motives and perpetrators of the attack but the area is known for the presence of armed groups. 2 fatalities.

actor1: FARC Dissident: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia Dissident Faction
notes: Non-violent activity: Around 8 July 2023 (weekend of), in Granario (Caqueta), members of a FARC dissident group installed an illegal checkpoint on the Orteguaza River. They intercepted several civilians, forced them to get off the boats and asked them about their presence in the area.

Around 8 July 2023 (as reported), in Quibdo (Choco), a person was shot and killed and their body was found in the Samper neighborhood. There is no further information on the motives and perpetrators of the attack but the area is known for the presence of armed groups. 1 fatality.

On 8 July 2023, in Asuncion (Asuncion), relatives of victims of medical negligence from the Social Welfare Institute protested in front of the city's Central Hospital to denounce that the Public Ministry does not investigate their cases despite audits confirming some doctors' malpractice.

On 8 July 2023, in Asuncion (Asuncion), members of the Authentic Radical Liberal Party (PLRA) protested at the intersection of Mcal. Lopez and Yegros streets to demand punishment of legislators whom they accuse of acts of corruption. In the protest, which took place as part of celebrating the party's anniversary, the demonstrators denounced the legislators' alliances with the Colorado Party.

On 8 July 2023, in Santa Rosa de Pion (Cajamarca), family members of the mayor attacked police officers who were instructed to arrest the mayor for endangering public security and possession of dangerous materials.
On 8 July 2023, in Lima - San Juan de Miraflores (Lima), residents captured two men who had committed a robbery in El Parque streets. They damaged their car and police officers rescued the two men.

On 8 July 2023, in Buenos Aires (Ancash), members of the Evangelical congregation of the Senor Jesucristo church staged a demonstration outside the Santa Justice Module to demand authorities that the land where the church is located not to be taken away, and to support the pastor that was accused of the crime of aggravated usurpation.

assoc_actor_2: PSUV: United Socialist Party of Venezuela
source: Caraota Digital; Diario 2001; Diario Primicia; El Diario de Guayana
notes: On 8 July 2023, in La Paragua (Bolivar), several unidentified crime group suspects shot and killed the local leader of the PSUV political party inside his house, in the San Pedro sector. The victim had already been the target of an armed attack in June 2023 (coded separately). There is no further information at this point in time. 1 fatality.

On 8 July 2023, in Santa Maria de Upata (Bolivar), a group of artisanal miners blocked the Troncal 10 road in protest to demand permission to work in the El Cuming mine. The roadblock was lifted after several hours.

Around 8 July 2023 (as reported), in El Socorro municipality (Guarico), a joint unit of Guarico state and CICPC police shot and killed an unidentified crime group suspect, during an armed confrontation in the La Arana sector on the road that connects Santa Maria de Ipire to El Soccoro. The suspect resisted authority and was injured in the gunfire; he was pronounced dead in hospital. The deceased was linked to homicide and theft. Police collected a gun and a flashbang that the shooter had attempted to detonate. 1 fatality.

source: Efecto Cocuyo; El Carabobeno; El Nacional (Venezuela); La Patilla
notes: Around 8 July 2023 (as reported), near Cazorla (Guarico), four men were shot and killed by members of El Fiebre gang, and their bodies found with tied hands and multiple gunshot wounds to the head, in a forested area in the vicinity of the Medano Alto sector. The four victims were members of an unidentified criminal group operating in the area. Authorities suggest the attack was motivated by territorial disputes. The wife of one of the victims claims that her husband was dragged out of their house overnight, that she was told to stay indoors, and that shortly after she heard around 100 shots being fired. There is no further information at this point in time. 4 fatalities.

On 7 July 2023, in Catacamas, Olancho, police officers entered a woman's home saying they needed to do a raid since there were reports that she was involved in drug trafficking. After searching everything and not finding anything, they undressed and beat her.

On 7 July 2023, in Tegucigalpa, Distrito Central, 911 workers protested for the lack of payments and missing salary readjustments, while denouncing that the new president of the audit commission has already violated their rights. According to the protesters, members from the Liberty and Refoundation Party (Libre) have intimidated them.

Security measures: On 7 July 2023, in Honduras, (coded to Tegucigalpa, Distrito Central). Police Forces carried out Operacion Cabanas XI at the national level. Police Forces have been carrying out home invasions with judicial authorization, and arrest warrants for different crimes. Officers have arrested members of maras and gangs, confiscated weapons, drugs, and cash. Operations are focused in the departments of Colon, Cortes, Yoro, Francisco Morazan, Intibuca, Lempira, La Paz, El Paraiso and Olancho.

On 7 July 2023, in Azacualpa municipality, Santa Barbara, unidentified armed men in a vehicle shot and killed a man in La Saban community (drive-by). The reason for the shooting is unknown. 1 fatality.
On 7 July 2023, in Arenal, Yoro, various residents of Arenal beat a thief who was attempting to steal goods from a local store. He was severely beaten and taken to the hospital by police forces.

On 7 July 2023, near Rosita, Costa Caribe, unidentified attackers shot and injured a park ranger and member of the Wilu community (Mayangna indigenous group) in the Bosawas Reservation. He was abducted and killed by the unidentified attackers after going hunting with members of his community. The reports state that the armed men could be armed settlers. 1 fatality.

On 7 July 2023, in Capira, Panama Oeste, students at two local schools staged a protest to demand that the Ministry of Education acts regarding the poor building conditions of their schools. Protesters blocked the Interamerican road.

assoc_actor_1: MOVIR: Movement of Victims of the Regime
source: Diario Co Latino; El Mundo (El Salvador); La Prensa Grafica
notes: On 7 July 2023, in San Salvador, San Salvador, members of MOVIR staged a protest to demand the release of their relatives, who were arrested since the implementation of the State of Emergency. Protesters gathered in Divino Salvador del Mundo Park square, but were asked to move it to the Cuscatlan Park.

assoc_actor_1: Piquetero Unit; Labor Group (Argentina); Polo Obrero; MST: Workers' Socialist Movement; MTL: Territorial Liberation Movement; Barrios de Pie; MLS: Freemen of the South Movement; FOL: Front of Organizations in Action; MTR: Teresa Rodriguez Movement; FAR: Red Burn Front; FOB: Federation of Basis' Organizations
notes: Around 7 July 2023 (as reported), in La Rioja (Capital), social organizations linked to the Piquetero Unit (UP) marched to the State's House and the Ministry of Social Development Offices to demand budget increases for social programs and food supplies for the community food programs. Demonstrators denounced the diversion of funds from these programs to settle external debts with the International Monetary Fund (IMF). The protest was part of a collective action coordinated with demonstrations in several cities of the country. The Piquetero Unit includes the organizations Polo Obrero, MST, MTL, Barrios de Pie; MLS, FOL, MTR, FAR, and FOB.

On 7 July 2023, in Villa Maria (General San Martin, Cordoba), teachers and alumni, students, and parents marched to reject the dismissal of the director of the Jose Ingenieros elementary school, accused of mistreatment. The participants demand that the director be reinstated to his work.

On 7 July 2023, in Buenos Aires - Comuna 12 (Ciudad Autonoma de Buenos Aires), residents of Barrio Once protested in rejection of the impediment to transportation in the context of the work stoppage of carriers. The demonstrators blocked the Pueyrredon avenue.

On 7 July 2023, in Comodoro Rivadavia (Escalante, Chubut), parents of students from School No. 731 protested inside the educational institution to demand that the director be removed from her position due to accusations of abuse and poor administration. The police were present at the scene but did not intervene in the action.

assoc_actor_1: Labor Group (Argentina); UTA: Union of Tramway Workers
notes: On 7 July 2023, in Ingeniero Maschwitz (Escobar, Buenos Aires), workers of line 60, grouped in the Union of Tramway Workers (UTA), protested by closing the roads of the Pan-American highway to demand payment of their labor benefits. The collective action took place in the context of a transportation regional strike demanding better working conditions for the workers.

On 7 July 2023, in Concepcion (Santa Cruz), for the second consecutive day, residents and the local mayor marched through the city and blocked the highway that connects to Santa Cruz de la Sierra as a demonstration to demand the arrest of a man that sexually assaulted an Ayorean Indigenous girl. They also demanded more police officers assigned to the district and the construction of a police module.

Around 7 July 2023 (as reported), in Manaus - West Zone (Amazonas), a man was killed and decapitated by members of the CV and his body was found in the Compensa 2 neighborhood with gunshot wounds. The head was found inside a trash can nearby. Video footage of the killing was posted on social media. The deceased was a member of FDN. 1 fatality.

On 7 July 2023, in Manaus - Central West Zone (Amazonas), a couple were shot and killed inside their private residence in the Alvorada neighborhood by two armed individuals. The male victim had been receiving death threats (circumstances unknown). He also had a police record for robbery. Authorship and motivation of the attack are unknown. 2 fatalities.

On 7 July 2023, in Lassance (Minas Gerais), a man was shot and killed by two armed individuals. Both suspects were arrested and one admitted the killing was motivated by drug trafficking territorial disputes. A third suspect was also arrested. 1 fatality.

Around 7 July 2023 (as reported), in Rio de Janeiro - North Zone (Rio de Janeiro), Pure Third Command exchanged fire with the Red Command in the Morro do Urubu community, Pilares neighborhood. One Red Command suspect was shot and killed in the clash. 1 fatality.

actor1: Police Forces of Brazil (2023-) Civil Police
notes: Property destruction: On 7 July 2023, in Caxias do Sul (Rio Grande do Sul), civil police officers dismantled a drug lab in the Primeiro de Maio neighborhood. Eight people were arrested.
On 7 July 2023, in Rio de Janeiro - Central Zone (Rio de Janeiro), unknown suspects exchanged fire in the Rio Comprido and Mangueira neighborhoods. Unknown casualties.

On 7 July 2023, in Rio de Janeiro - North Zone (Rio de Janeiro), unknown suspects exchanged fire in the Pedreira Complex, and the Parada de Lucas, Cordovil, Bras de Pina, and Pavuna neighborhoods. Unknown casualties.
On 7 July 2023, in Rio de Janeiro - West Zone (Rio de Janeiro), unknown suspects exchanged fire in Praca Seca neighborhood. Unknown casualties.

On 7 July 2023, in Rio Branco (Acre), a shoot-out between rival drug trafficking groups took place in the Cidade do Povo housing complex. One suspect was killed and another was injured in the clash. 1 fatality.

On 7 July 2023, in Barra do Pirai (Rio de Janeiro), two armed suspects shot and killed a drug trafficker in the Santo Antonio neighborhood. The event was motivated by a clash between rival drug trafficking factions. 1 fatality.

On 7 July 2023, in Presidente Prudente (Sao Paulo), stallholder vendors held a protest, lamenting that their requests for stalls had been denied by the municipality. They called for the mayor to return their ability to work.

On 7 July 2023, in Salvador - Suburbio/Ilhas (Bahia), BDM and CV engaged in a shootout in the Plataforma neighborhood. A man was shot and killed by an off-duty police officer during the shoot-out. The police claim the deceased had involvement with the gangs. 1 fatality.
Around 7 July 2023 (as reported), in Santo Antonio do Taua (Para), people set a wood bridge on fire to demonstrate against its poor conditions.

actor2: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) UPP: Pacifying Police Unit
notes: On 7 July 2023, in Niteroi - North (Rio de Janeiro), a group of armed suspects exchanged fire with military police officers in the Barreto neighborhood. One suspect was shot and injured, and two suspects were arrested. Police seized a pistol, a large quantity of drugs, cash, a radio communicator. There were no fatalities.

On 7 July 2023, in Joao Pessoa (Paraiba), a man was shot in a drive-by shooting perpetrated by individuals in a car in the Estados neighborhood. Identity of perpetrators and motivations are unknown. There were no fatalities.

On 7 July 2023, in Maceio (Alagoas), a man was shot and killed in a drive-by shooting by two individuals dressed as police officers in a car in the Ipioca neighborhood. Identity of the perpetrators and motivations are unknown. 1 fatality.

On 7 July 2023, in Nova Granada (Sao Paulo), two suspects on motorcycles shot a construction worker in the head at a construction site (drive-by). The motive for the event is not known. The suspects fled. 1 fatality.

actor2: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
notes: On 7 July 2023, in Rio das Ostras (Rio de Janeiro), a group of at least three armed suspects exchanged fire with military police in the Palmital neighborhood. One suspect was injured. Police arrested at least one suspect. There were no fatalities.

actor2: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) UPP: Pacifying Police Unit
source: G1; Globo Extra; Informe Agora; OTT-RJ; R7
notes: On 7 July 2023, in Rio de Janeiro - North Zone (Rio de Janeiro), armed suspects exchanged fire with UPP military police officers in the Manguinhos neighborhood. A military police officer was shot and injured. Two municipal schools were closed. There were no fatalities.

On 7 July 2023, in Sete Quedas (Mato Grosso do Sul), about 500 family members and friends of a man who was shot to death and dismembered by a former girlfriend carried out a protest to demand justice for his case.

On 7 July 2023, in Rio de Janeiro - West Zone (Rio de Janeiro), members of the Zinho police militia exchanged fire with a rival police militia in the Reta do Joao 23 favela, in the Santa Cruz neighborhood. Unknown casualties.

On 7 July 2023, in Valparaiso (Valparaiso), 500 workers at the Amelia mine in Catemu commune held a demonstration and marched to the Regional Presidential Delegation building. Protesters then handed a petition letter in which they stated that the closure of the mine due to environmental recommendations from SEA (Environmental Assessment Service) will leave 1,400 workers unemployed.

On 7 July 2023, in Valparaiso (Valparaiso), unionized workers at Valparaiso Sporting Hippodrome protested at their workplace demanding improvements in their economic conditions after several rounds of negotiations. Protesters stated that despite the profits obtained by the local racetrack in recent years, an agreement has not been reached. 39 workers in the union began an indefinite strike.

On 7 July 2023, between Vilcun and Padre Las Casas communes (Araucania), unknown individuals shot at police units that were complying with a protection measure on the road near the Santa Rosa farm. A second attack took place in a property located one kilometer from the previous one. In both cases, police repelled the attack with their service weapons. A banner alluding to the Mapuche cause was found at the scene. There were no casualties.

On 7 July 2023, in Santiago - Estacion Central (Metropolitana), a group of neighbors attacked and hit a suspected thief on the streets. The event occurred when four people tried to steal a car from a man who resisted the robbery, and attacked one of the suspected thieves after they all tried to flee. The victim of the attempted robbery caught one of the suspects, beat him up, and took his knife and stabbed him. Residents of the area then joined in the beating of the suspected thief up until police arrived. The victim of the robbery was injured with a knife, and neighbors stated they heard shots before coming out of their houses. There were no fatalities.

source: El Colombiano; El Tiempo (Colombia); El Universal (Colombia)
notes: On 7 July 2023, in the rural area of Teorama municipality (Norte de Santander), 19 construction workers at the KMA company were kidnapped by suspected ELN members between La Floresta and Las Mercedes sectors. The workers were released eight hours later. The members of the armed group stole three machines used for the construction of roads. The company had received threats in the past.

On 7 July 2023, in Aguadas (Caldas), a relative of the mayor of the municipality was shot dead by unidentified individuals. There is no further information on the motives or perpetrators of the attack. 1 fatality.

Around 7 July 2023 (as reported), between Simiti and San Pablo municipalities (coded to Simiti, Bolivar), a man was shot dead and his body was found. The victim was a miner. There is no further information on the motives and perpetrators of the attack but there is presence of a FARC dissident group in the area. 1 fatality.

actor2: Police Forces of Colombia (2022-) UNDMO: National Unit for Dialogue and Maintenance of Order
notes: On 7 July 2023, in Valledupar (Cesar), a group of street vendors clashed with UNDMO officers during an eviction process in the Balneario Hurtado led by the mayor's office. Several people were injured and two rioters were arrested.

On 7 July 2023, in Anserma (Caldas), at least 200 members of an Indigenous community from the Loma Alta and El Rosario veredas marched through the city's streets to the mayor's office to demand land, healthcare and education. They demanded the awarding of property of a piece of land so that they can live there and grow crops.

On 7 July 2023, around Bogota - La Candelaria (Bogota, D.C.), hundreds of transgender people marched from the Santa Fe neighborhood (Santa Fe), to Bolivar Square to demand the protection of their rights and the approval of an integral law for transgender people. The march took place in the context of the commemoration of LGBTQ+ International Pride Month.

On 7 July 2023, in Lago Agrio canton (Sucumbios), cargo transportation and taxi cab drivers carried out a motorcade and blocked traffic around entrance points to the city of Nueva Loja as a demonstration to demand the reconstruction of highways and bridges in Napo, Orellana and Sucumbios provinces. Some made their way to the provincial government offices for a meeting with officials.

On 7 July 2023, in Loja (Loja), retired teachers staged a demonstration outside the provincial government to demand payment of their retirement incentive bonus that have not been paid in the required timeframe.

On 7 July 2023, in Ybycui (Paraguari), municipality workers protested at the mayor's office to demand payment of their salaries, which was delayed after several months, and repudiated threats they say they've received from the municipal executive. The protesters also started a work stoppage and demanded wage increases.

On 7 July 2023, in Asuncion (Asuncion), more than 25 members of the Ara Pyahu Mbya Guarani indigenous community, residents of the 3 de Febrero district and Caaguazu protested in front of the headquarters of the National Indigenous Institute (INDI) to demand electricity, drinking water, and food. A group of Indigenous people have been camping outside of the INDI headquarters for weeks.

On 7 July 2023, in Lima - Lima District (Lima), more than 400 workers of the Lima Municipality marched through the city to Mayor square as a demonstration to demand payment of part of their wages that is owed since January. Police officers stopped them from entering the square by physically pushing the group of demonstrators away from the area.

Around 7 July 2023 (as reported), in El Tocuyo (Lara), a group of workers at the Egidio Montesinos Hospital protested to demand payment of their food bonuses, and against the delays in the proceedings for the obtention of the retirement status and pensions, which affects at least 63 workers.

Around 7 July 2023 (as reported), in Caracas - Libertador (Distrito Capital), CICPC police forces shot and killed two unidentified crime group suspects, and arrested another, during an armed confrontation on Lecuna Avenue. The suspects were travelling in a stolen vehicle and resisted authority. A chase and a shooting ensued. The suspects belonged to a criminal group that carried out thefts and theft-related killings of taxi drivers of the Yummy Rides app. Police collected two guns and seized several stolen vehicles. 2 fatalities.

On 7 July 2023, in San Fernando de Apure (Apure), a group of demonstrators, including parents of students, and members of Protestant Christian groups such as the Evangelical Regional Council, protested against the current Venezuelan educational programme, and the implementation of sexual education programmes in schools. The protesters gathered by the Apure state Education Zone Office, where they handed in their own sexual education programme proposal, which according to them is based on science.

They demand an educational system based on science. The protesters gathered outside the Education Ministry, where they held prayers and handed in a letter with their demands.

On 5 July 2023, in San Jose de Jachal (Jachal, San Juan), residents from Pampa Vieja, Otra Banda, and Fical blocked the streets to denounce that the drinking water in their towns has arsenic levels higher than the codes for human consumption.

assoc_actor_1: SUTE: United Union of Education Workers; Teachers (Argentina)

The Piquetero Unit includes the organizations Polo Obrero, MST, MTL, Barrios de Pie; MLS, FOL, MTR, FAR, and FOB.

source: El Diario De La Pampa; La Arena
notes: On 5 July 2023, in Santa Rosa (Capital, La Pama), protesters demonstrated in front of the Directorate of Financial Aid for Social Action (Dafas) Building to demand justice for the femicide of a young woman last year. Participants ported signs demanding Not One [Woman] Less (Ni una menos) and clapped for five minutes to support the family demanding justice.
On 5 July 2023, in Santa Rosa (Capital, La Pampa), Popular Electricity Cooperative (CPE) workers protested to reject salary reductions agreed by the employer company.

On 5 July 2023, in Laboulaye (Presidente Roque Saenz Pena, Cordoba), around 3,000 protesters, including family and friends of a murdered teenager, marched with candles to demand justice and clarification of the crime.

On 5 July 2023, in Cordoba (Capital), members of the Disability Assembly marched from the Apross headquarters (social security offices) to Patio Olmos to demand salary improvements for care personnel according to inflation and social and labor inclusion measures for the sector.

On 5 July 2023, in Quillacollo (Cochabamba), farmers who are members of the Cotapachi Agrarian Central blocked the municipal land fill as a demonstration to demand the local government a plan to improve the trash management and to move the land fill.

On 5 July 2023, in Sabaya (Oruro), for the third consecutive day, heavy transportation drivers blocked the Oruro - Pisiga international highway as a demonstration to voice their concerns about international transport affecting their jobs by using unofficial stops.

On 5 July 2023, in Sucre (Chuquisaca), around 400 unionized workers members of the 15 de Mayo union marched through the city to Villa Bolivariana neighborhood to demand the return of decommissioned seeds that were taken days before in an operative carried out by the police.

On 5 July 2023, in Cochabamba (Cochabamba), for the second consecutive day, residents of districts 2, 4, 5, 7 and 8 from Quillacollo blocked Blanco Galindo, Victor Ustariz and Panamericana avenues as a demonstration to demand the elimination of the law that implemented a rise of the public cleaning rate into electricity bills.

On 5 July 2023, in Copacabanita (Oruro), residents from different sectors blocked the Oruro - Pisiga highway as a demonstration to demand the Bolivian Highways Administrator (ABC) to carry out an inspection of said highway.

On 5 July 2023, in Oruro (Oruro), residents of Vinto sector staged a demonstration at 10 de Febrero square to demand the removal of industries and companies without environmental licenses that have been operating since 2016 in the region.

On 5 July 2023, in Tiquipaya (Cochabamba), dozens of residents of Tiquipaya and Colcapirhua, which are bordering towns, clashed in an ongoing conflict of land borders between the municipalities. The clash was triggered by the paving of a road by the Tiquipaya municipal government in the Rumi Mayu community. Several people were injured.

actor1: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police

On 5 July 2023, in Aurora do Para (Para), municipal civil servants blocked the BR-010 highway by setting obstacles on fire to demand the renegotiation of the city's public debt.

actor1: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
notes: On 5 July 2023, in Jacunda (Para), a drug trafficking suspect exchanged fire with military police in the Boa Esperanca neighborhood. The drug trafficker was killed. Four more people were arrested. Police seized stolen objects, portions of drugs, cell phones, and a precision scale. 1 fatality.

actor1: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
notes: On 5 July 2023, in Murici (Alagoas), a man engaged in a shootout with the military police after he tried to flee as the officers investigated a tip that a killing would take place. The individual was shot and killed in the clash. He had a police record of drug trafficking and his body was found with guns, ammunition, and drugs. 1 fatality.

Around 5 July 2023 (as reported), in Alto Alegre municipality (Roraima), two miners were killed and their bodies were found in the Xirixana Indigenous community. Members of a mining association believe the victims were killed by Indigenous people. Illegal mining activities take place in the area. 2 fatalities.

actor1: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police

actor1: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police

Video footage of the event shows that the victim had his hands behind his back the entire time and did not offer resistance. The officers were suspended from field activities until an investigation is carried out.

On 5 July 2023, in Campina Grande (Paraiba), a man was tortured by a group because he was suspected to have stolen a propane tank and a cellphone at the Monte Santo neighborhood. Four suspects were arrested. There were no fatalities.

The lawyer was injured. There were no fatalities.

On 5 July 2023, in Barra Mansa (Rio de Janeiro), an unknown shooter opened fire on the Executive Director of the Autonomous Water and Sewage Service (Saae) in the Cotiara neighborhood. The victim was carrying out an eviction request and collection fees when he was shot. There were no fatalities.
On 5 July 2023, in Feira de Santana (Bahia), a man was shot and killed by four individuals in the Aviario district. Identity of the perpetrators and motivations are unknown. 1 fatality.

actor1: Police Forces of Brazil (2023-) Civil Police

Around 5 July 2023 (as reported), in Betim (Minas Gerais), an adolescent was killed by unknown individuals and his body was found in the Capelinha neighborhood with his throat slit open and his hands tied up. Circumstances of death are unknown. 1 fatality.
On 5 July 2023, in Rio de Janeiro - North Zone (Rio de Janeiro), unknown suspects exchanged fire in the Engenho Novo, Pilares, and Botafogo neighborhood. Unknown casualties.
On 5 July 2023, in Rio de Janeiro - West Zone (Rio de Janeiro), unknown suspects exchanged fire in the Freguesia neighborhood. Unknown casualties.

Around 5 July 2023 (as reported), in Tucuma (Para), a man and his mother were killed and their bodies were found in a landfill on the PA-279 highway with signs of torture. The male victim was involved in drug trafficking activities, which is why police believe the killings were motivated by disputes between rival drug trafficking groups. 2 fatalities.

notes: On 5 July 2023, in Angra dos Reis (Rio de Janeiro), at least two drug traffickers exchanged fire with military police officers on patrol in the Morro da Gloria II favela. Two suspects were killed. Police seized a pistol, two radio communicators, a grenade, and drugs. 2 fatalities.

On 5 July 2023, in Brasilia (Distrito Federal), a man was killed and his mother was injured in a drive-by shooting in the Sobradinho region by armed individuals in a car. The fatal victim was wearing a monitoring anklet (charges not reported). Authorship and motivation of the attack are unknown. 1 fatality.

On 5 July 2023, in Manaus - Central West Zone (Amazonas), a man was shot and killed in the Paz neighborhood by an unknown armed individual. The deceased was involved in drug trafficking activities. 1 fatality.
On 5 July 2023, in Varzea Grande (Mato Grosso), municipal civil servants carried out a march to demand salary readjustment.

On 5 July 2023, in Jardim (Mato Grosso do Sul), a man was injured in a drive-by shooting in the Vila Angelica neighborhood by armed individuals in a car. Authorship and motivation of the attack are unknown. There were no fatalities.
On 5 July 2023, in Nobres (Mato Grosso), a member of the CV was shot and killed by two unknown armed individuals who invaded his private residence in the Jardim Petropolis neighborhood. 1 fatality.

On 5 July 2023, in Leme (Sao Paulo), two armed suspects shot a man several times and severely injured him in the Jardim Amalia neighborhood. The victim was shot 14 times, which might indicate an execution. There were no fatalities.

On 5 July 2023, in Porto Alegre (Rio Grande do Sul), three people were shot and killed by armed individuals in the Restinga neighborhood. Five suspects were arrested. Two victims had a police record for drug trafficking. 3 fatalities.

actor2: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
notes: On 5 July 2023, in Resende (Rio de Janeiro), drug traffickers exchanged fire with military police officers in the Baixada da Olaria neighborhood. On 5 July 2023, in Simplicio Mendes (Piaui), a man was shot and killed in a drive-by shooting by two individuals on a motorcycle in the Sao Francisco neighborhood. Identity of the perpetrators and motivations are unknown. The deceased had an extensive criminal record. 1 fatality.

On 5 July 2023, in Tres Rios (Rio de Janeiro), several armed suspects passing by in a vehicle shot and killed two men in different locations within the Habitat neighborhood (drive-by). Three suspects were arrested the following day and police seized cocaine, marijuana tablets, cash, and three firearm replicas. 2 fatalities.

actor2: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
notes: On 5 July 2023, in Rio de Janeiro - West Zone (Rio de Janeiro), armed suspects exchanged fire with military police officers in the Chacrinha favela, Praca Seca neighborhood. Suspects threw a grenade at military police officers. No one was injured. There were no fatalities.

On 5 July 2023, in Duque de Caxias (Rio de Janeiro), relatives of a refinery worker who was shot and killed by military police held a protest, demanding justice for his death, and denouncing the police's accusations of his involvement with drug trafficking.

On 5 July 2023, in Maceio (Alagoas), a group gathered at the city's center to demand for safe housing in the Vergel do Lago neighborhood through the municipality's aid program. The march happened in the morning and blocked a crossroad.

On 5 July 2023, in Santiago (Metropolitana), workers protested blocking the Los Heroes metro station demanding salary improvements. As part of the protest, a man tied himself up at the entrance of the train at Los Heroes metro station.
On 5 July 2023, in the rural area of Ocana municipality (Norte de Santander), a cattle farmer was kidnapped by the ELN. His whereabouts are unknown.

Around 5 July 2023 (as reported), in Segovia municipality (Antioquia), Gulf Clan members kidnapped a man who was fleeing from his home in the Arenales vereda due to clashes between the ELN and FARC dissidents and the Gulf Clan (coded separately). The man was released shortly after.

On 5 July 2023, in Giron (Santander), a group of motorcycle drivers demonstrated repudiating the death of a man who crashed on his motorcycle when he was being chased by municipal traffic officers in Bucaramanga over a traffic violation after one of the officers threw a transit cone at him. In the evening hours, rioters threw rocks and vandalized the municipal transit department causing damage to the property.

On 5 July 2023, in Floridablanca (Santander), around 300 motorcycle drivers demonstrated at the main square repudiating the death of a man who crashed on his motorcycle when he was being chased by municipal traffic officers in Bucaramanga over a traffic violation after one of the officers threw a transit cone at him. Rioters threw stones at the municipal transit department causing damage to the property. The riot occurred during the morning hours, so the building was likely occupied by workers at the time.

assoc_actor_1: FARC Dissident: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia Dissident Faction
notes: On 5 July 2023, in the rural area of Segovia municipality (Antioquia), for the seventh consecutive day, ELN and FARC dissident members clashed with Gulf Clan members in the Arenales vereda. As a result, around 200 residents of the area were forcibly displaced to nearby locations, 500 Indigenous people are at risk of displacement. Authorities said that the clashes are related to territorial disputes between the groups. Casualties unknown.

On 5 July 2023, in Fortul (Arauca), ELN members ambushed with firearms and artisanal explosive devices police and military officers at the local police station for around 10 minutes. Civilians were caught in the crossfire. There were no casualties.

On 5 July 2023, in the rural area of Jamundi municipality (Valle del Cauca), a social leader who was also the chief of the Volunteer Fire Department of the municipality was shot and killed by unidentified armed individuals on a motorcycle (drive-by shooting) who intercepted the car he was traveling in. There is no further information on the motives and perpetrators of the attack but there is presence of armed groups in the area. 1 fatality.

On 5 July 2023, in Samaniego (Narino), unidentified armed individuals shot and killed a man in El Monumento sector. There is no further information on the motives and perpetrators of the attack but there is presence of armed groups in the area. 1 fatality.

notes: On 5 July 2023, in the rural area of Ricaurte municipality (Narino), an Indigenous social leader member of the Indigenous Guard was shot and killed by unidentified armed individuals. The victim was also a former governor of El Palmar Indigenous Reserve and the brother of the current governor of the same reserve. The victim was also a member of the Comunes Party and a relative of a former FARC member. There is no further information on the motives and perpetrators of the attack but there is presence of the ELN and Second Marquetalia in the Area. 1 fatality.

Weapons seizure: Around 5 July 2023 (as reported), in the rural area of Morales municipality (Bolivar), military forces dismantled an illegal weapons' factory belonging to the ELN in the Mina Nero vereda.

Looting: On 5 July 2023, in Tibu (Norte de Santander), ELN members broke into an Agrarian Bank and stole 35 million Colombian Pesos after intimidating the workers. Simultaneously, other members of the group raised an ELN flag in front of the mayor's office.

Property destruction: On 5 July 2023, in the rural area of Puerto Libertador municipality (Cordoba), military forces destroyed a clandestine laboratory used for the production of cocaine base belonging to the Gulf Clan in La Cristalina vereda.

On 5 July 2023, in Bogota - Chapinero (Bogota, D.C.), a group of retired members of the military forces protested on 73rd Street with 13th avenue to demand to the government the payment of the mid-year bonus they are owed.

On 5 July 2023, in Bogota - La Candelaria (Bogota, D.C.), a group of retired members of the military forces protested on 12th street in the city center to demand to the government the payment of the mid-year bonus they are owed.

On 5 July 2023, in Albania municipality (La Guajira), for the second consecutive day, a group of former workers at the Cerrejon mining company blocked the railroad to demand the reintegration to the company after they say they were fired without any justification.

On 5 July 2023, near Betoyes corregimiento (Arauca), ELN members detonated an explosive device in La Ye sector. Authorities said that the target of the attack were members of security forces, however, nobody was affected by the detonation. There were no casualties.
On 5 July 2023, in Bogota - Santa Fe (Bogota, D.C.), a group of members of a human rights organization protested on 10th Avenue with 4th Street, however, the reasons behind the protest are unknown.

On 5 July 2023, in Chitaga municipality (Norte de Santander), for the second consecutive day, residents from La Esperanza municipality blocked the highway at the Tropezon sector to protest against the plans of the government of installing a landfill in their area. Protesters were concerned about the environmental impacts that the landfill would bring to the community.

On 5 July 2023, in Guarne (Antioquia), a group of people, including relatives of the victim, protested to demand justice for a woman who was found dead with signs of violence and sexual abuse in a suspected case of femicide.

On 5 July 2023, in Ituango (Antioquia), 10 people gathered at the main square to protest and demand to the government to take action in the face of high violence rates and a humanitarian crisis caused by the actions of armed groups in the municipality. They reported inaction from municipal, regional and national authorities.

On 5 July 2023, in La Esperanza municipality (Norte de Santander), for the second consecutive day, locals blocked the El Playon - San Alberto highway in the Medio Vijagual sector to protest against the plans of the government of installing a landfill in the area. Protesters were concerned about the environmental impacts that the landfill would bring to the community.

On 5 July 2023, between Monteria and Planeta Rica municipalities (coded to Monteria, Cordoba), residents at the Loma Grande sector blocked the highway to protest against the Urbaser company and local authorities over the non-compliance of agreements that had been reached with the community regarding the removal of waste waters produced by a landfill located in the sector.

On 5 July 2023, in Arroyito (Azotey, Concepcion), relatives of a police officer kidnapped nine years ago by the Paraguayan People's Army (EPP) held a march to demand information about his whereabouts.

On 5 July 2023, in Curuguaty (Canindeyu), teachers protested in front of the local Health Unit to demand better conditions in the medical center, more equipment and medicines, and more state investment in the health sector.

On 5 July 2023, in Chimbote (Ancash), family members, friends and merchants colleagues of a merchant that was arrested for allegedly being part of a robbery staged a demonstration outside the courtroom to demand his release and new evidence to be considered, which they say shows that he was only the owner of the car but did not commit the crime.

On 5 July 2023, in Nazca (Cusco), security technicians, ambulance drivers and cleaning workers of the Ricardo Cruzado Rivarola hospital staged a demonstration to demand formal contracts to be given to them, after they have worked for several years for the minimum wage, and risked their health working during the coronavirus pandemic while working for the minimum wage.

On 5 July 2023, in Ica (Ica), family members of a man that was killed in a car accident staged a demonstration outside the State Attorney offices after they released the driver because he was an elderly citizen. They demanded the dismissal or resignation of the state attorney and investigation of alleged irregularities in the case.

On 5 July 2023, in Iquitos (Loreto), residents of Nueva Vida sector staged a demonstration outside the San Juan Bautista district government to demand the mayor rehabilitate a carriageway that is currently in a poor condition and complicates their mobilization.

assoc_actor_2: Military Forces of Venezuela (1999-) GNB: Venezuelan National Guard
notes: Around 5 July 2023, near El Moralito (Zulia), a man was shot and killed, and his body found with multiple gunshot wounds, in an area close to the Cana Brava sector. The victim was a GNB military officer that had been abducted the day before from the estate of his father-in-law. It is thought that the perpetrators belong to an unidentified armed group, their motivations are unknown. There is no further information at this point in time. 1 fatality.

On 5 July 2023, in the rural area of Pedro Zaraza municipality (Guarico), Guarico state police forces shot and killed two unidentified crime group suspect, during an armed confrontation in a rural sector known as Taparito, by the Via Los Novillos road. The suspects resisted authority, initiated the shooting, and were killed in the gunfire. One of the deceased had an unspecified criminal record. Police collected two guns. 2 fatalities.

On 5 July 2023, in Ciudad Guayana (Bolivar), a group of demonstrators, including active and retired workers at companies belonging to the state-owned Venezuelan Corporation of Guayana (CVG), pensioners, and unionists, protested to demand the restoration of their benefits, observance of their collective labor agreements, and the immediate liberation of the unionists arrested for leading the Sidor metal workers' protests at the Pellas plant (Bolivar). The demonstration was staged outside the CVG headquarters.

source: El Diario De La Pampa; La Arena
notes: On 5 July 2023, in Cipolletti (General Roca, Rio Negro), around 1,500 protesters, including relatives, friends, and members of social and feminist organizations, marched from Justice Square through the center of the city to demand justice for the femicide of a young woman last year and asking for life imprisonment for the attacker. Protesters demanded an end to violence against women. The demonstration was organized by the Not One [Woman] Less Movement.
On 5 July 2023, in Purmamarca (Tumbaya, Jujuy), protesters blocked roads to repudiate the Jujuy provincial constitutional reform, which they described as restrictive of mobilization.
On 5 July 2023, in Tilcara (Jujuy), protesters blocked roads to repudiate the Jujuy provincial constitutional reform, which they described as restrictive of mobilization.

On 5 July 2023, in Abra Pampa (Cochinoca, Jujuy), protesters blocked roads to repudiate the Jujuy provincial constitutional reform, which they described as restrictive of mobilization.

On 5 July 2023, in San Salvador de Jujuy (Dr. Manuel Belgrano, Jujuy), thousands of teachers grouped in Adep marched to Plaza Belgrano to repudiate the constitutional reform of the province promoted by Governor Morales. The demonstrators, accompanied by unions, social movements, and student and Indigenous organizations, also called for the governor's resignation.

On 5 July 2023, in Perico (El Carmen, Jujuy), protesters blocked roads to repudiate the Jujuy provincial constitutional reform, which they described as restrictive of mobilization. Protesters have been intervened by the police.

On 5 July 2023, in Igarassu (Pernambuco), two unidentified armed suspects shot two girls, killing one and injuring the other, at the doorstep of their home at the Bela Vista neighborhood. The two perpetrators came looking for their neighbor and when the kids went to check the door after hearing their neighbor's name being called out, they opened fire. The original target was connected to drug trafficking. 1 fatality.

On 5 July 2023, in La Labranza (Norte de Santander), a farmer was kidnapped by ELN members at his farm after intimidating him and his family. The ELN demanded 10,000 million COP for his release. The victim managed to escape and contact his family and was found by military forces in Los Indios vereda.

assoc_actor_2: Labor Group (Colombia); Government of Colombia (2022-); Police Forces of Colombia (2022-) UNDMO: National Unit for Dialogue and Maintenance of Order
source: El Colombiano; El Tiempo (Colombia); Vanguardia Liberal
notes: On 5 July 2023, in Bucaramanga (Santander), thousands of motorcycle drivers demonstrated in several sectors of the city repudiating the death of a man who crashed on his motorcycle when he was being chased by municipal traffic officers over a traffic violation after one of the officers threw a transit cone at him. Rioters beat up the traffic official and set his motorcycle on fire. Rioters also threw stones and artisanal explosives at the municipal transit department, the mayor's office, and four official municipal vehicles with passengers inside, causing damage to property. They also blocked roads, set tires on fire, attacked UNDMO officers, buses and private vehicles with rocks, and destroyed public infrastructure throughout the city. A total of 10 people were arrested. Riots extended overnight to the early morning of 6 July. There were no fatalities.

assoc_actor_2: Unidentified Communal Group (Colombia); JAC: Council of Communal Action; Women (Colombia)
notes: On 5 July 2023, in the rural area of La Granja corregimiento (Antioquia), Gulf Clan members shot and killed a woman social leader who was also member of a Council of Communal Action (JAC) in El Capote vereda after taking her from her house. Several days later, five relatives of the victim and a social leader were evacuated from the area after receiving threats from the Gulf Clan since the day the leader was killed. 1 fatality.
tags: women targeted: activists/human rights defenders/social leaders

notes: On 5 July 2023, in Bucaramanga (Santander), an explosive device detonated at a police station injuring nine police officers. The perpetrators left the explosive on a police motorcycle parked outside the station and it detonated when one officer moved the vehicle. The attack also caused several damage to the station's infrastructure. The officers were taken to a hospital for treatment. Although initially it was believed that the attack was related to violent demonstrations that took place that day in the city (coded separately), the ELN released a statement in which it claimed responsibility for the attack. There were no fatalities.

Non-violent activity: On 5 July 2023, in Arenal (Bolivar), ELN members patrolled the streets installing billboards and distributing pamphlets to the population. They also installed illegal checkpoints and forced merchants to close their stores.

On 5 July 2023, in Altaquer (Narino), members of the Awa Indigenous community blocked the highway to protest against the violence and humanitarian crisis caused by the action of armed groups in Indigenous reserves. They demanded the presence of delegates from the national government. The roadblock was ongoing for eight days.

On 5 July 2023, in Santa Ana de Coro (Falcon), a group of residents of the El Bosque sector protested to demand solutions, from the Hidrofalcon water company, for the wastewater puddles and the stench they produce in their sector.

Around 4 July 2023 (as reported), in Belize City, Belize, a man was killed and his body was found in the Lords Ridge Cemetery. Police stated it was in retaliation for another crime and arrested two men in connection with the case. 1 fatality.

Security measures: On 4 July 2023, in Guatemala City, Guatemala, the government deployed 150 police and military officers near the Parque de la Industria in zone 1, where the authorities are carrying out the electoral review ordered by the Constitutional Court (CC).

Property destruction: On 4 July 2023, in Sico, Colon, military forces discovered an alleged drug plane. The aircraft was found empty, but it is estimated that it had been unloaded with at least 600 kilos of alleged cocaine from Venezuela.

On 4 July 2023, in Panama City, Panama, former employees of the Ministry of Commerce and Industry staged a protest at the premises of the Ministry to demand the payment of a Seniority Bonus, which was approved in 2021.

On 4 July 2023, in La Chorrera, Panama, and for the second consecutive day, students and former students at a local schools staged a protest at the premises of the local office of the Ministry of Education to demand that authorities provide new facilities, rooms, and finalize the building reforms. In addition, they demanded running water, the appointment of janitors, among others.

On 4 July 2023, in San Salvador, San Salvador, employees of a construction company staged a protest on the underpass Redondel Integracion to demand the payment of their salaries. Protesters blocked access to the city.

The Piquetero Unit includes the organizations Polo Obrero, MST, MTL, Barrios de Pie; MLS, FOL, MTR, FAR, and FOB.

On 4 July 2023, in La Plata (Buenos Aires), the Self-convened Teacher Assembly members marched from Plaza Moreno to the General Directorate of Culture and Education to demand better working conditions, school infrastructure, and more security in public education.

On 4 July 2023, in La Plata (Buenos Aires), parents of Secondary School No. 93 protested to reject the display of what they say is 'pornographic' material in the teaching of Comprehensive Sexual Education (ESI). The police were present in the face of the tension of the protesters but did not intervene significantly.

assoc_actor_1: Piquetero Unit; Labor Group (Argentina); Polo Obrero; MST: Workers' Socialist Movement; MTL: Territorial Liberation Movement; Barrios de Pie; MLS: Freemen of the South Movement; FOL: Front of Organizations in Action; MTR: Teresa Rodriguez Movement; FAR: Red Burn Front; FOB: Federation of Basis' Organizations
notes: On 4 July 2023, in Mar del Plata (General Pueyrredon, Buenos Aires), social organizations linked to the Piquetero Unit (UP) demonstrated in Unzue and blocked Route 2 and Route 11 to demand budget increases for social programs and food supplies for the community food programs. Similar protests took place in Villarino in Pedro Luro Street and Hilario Azcasubi street. Demonstrators denounced the diversion of funds from these programs to settle external debts with the International Monetary Fund (IMF). The protest was part of a collective action coordinated with demonstrations in several cities of the country. The Piquetero Unit includes the organizations Polo Obrero, MST, MTL, Barrios de Pie; MLS, FOL, MTR, FAR, and FOB.

On 4 July 2023, in Berisso (Buenos Aires), municipal employees, members of the Berisso Municipal Workers Union, protested for the second consecutive day at the intersection of Genova and Calle 158 to demand better working conditions from the local government. The demonstrators announced more protests as a measure of pressure.

assoc_actor_1: Piquetero Unit; Labor Group (Argentina); Polo Obrero; MST: Workers' Socialist Movement; MTL: Territorial Liberation Movement; Barrios de Pie; MLS: Freemen of the South Movement; FOL: Front of Organizations in Action; MTR: Teresa Rodriguez Movement; FAR: Red Burn Front; FOB: Federation of Basis' Organizations
notes: On 4 July 2023, in Bahia Blanca (Buenos Aires), social organizations linked to the Piquetero Unit (UP) demonstrated blocking Route 3 to demand budget increases for social programs and food supplies for the community food programs. Demonstrators denounced the diversion of funds from these programs to settle external debts with the International Monetary Fund (IMF).
