assoc_actor_1: Piquetero Unit; Labor Group (Argentina); Polo Obrero; MST: Workers' Socialist Movement; MTL: Territorial Liberation Movement; Barrios de Pie; MLS: Freemen of the South Movement; FOL: Front of Organizations in Action; MTR: Teresa Rodriguez Movement; FAR: Red Burn Front; FOB: Federation of Basis' Organizations
source: Diario El Dia; Indymedia Argentina; La Nacion (Argentina); La Prensa (Argentina); La Voz del Interior (Argentina)
notes: On 4 July 2023, in Buenos Aires - Comuna 3 (Ciudad Autonoma de Buenos Aires), social organizations linked to the Piquetero Unit (UP) marched from the Puerreydon Bridge to the Ministry of Social Development, passing through several avenues of the city, to demand an increase in social programs , particularly children's dining rooms. Participants also burned tires in front of the Ministry and shouted slogans such as: 'Not with the food of the kids!'. Not with the food of the kids' The event was part of a nationwide mobilization. While the collective action was taking place, leaders of the UP had meetings with the authorities from Minister of Social Development, reaching an agreement later that day in favor of their demands. The Piquetero Unit includes the organizations Polo Obrero, MST, MTL, Barrios de Pie; MLS, FOL, MTR, FAR, and FOB.
On 4 July 2023, in Cochabamba (Cochabamba), dozens of retired workers staged a demonstration to voice their concerns about the reduction of the amount of pension funds they are receiving.

On 4 July 2023, in El Alto (La Paz), unionized merchants members of the Retail Merchants and Shopkeepers of Southern El Alto Unique Federation blocked 23 different streets in the city as a demonstration to demand the mayor eliminate the transfer of passengers on certain sections of the route and to implement the functioning of Wayna Buses.
On 4 July 2023, in La Paz (La Paz), dozens of retired workers staged a demonstration to voice their concerns about the reduction of the amount of pension funds they are receiving.

source: El Diario (Bolivia); La Patria en Linea
notes: On 4 July 2023, in Sabaya (Oruro), for the second consecutive day, heavy transportation drivers blocked the Oruro - Pisiga international highway as a demonstration to voice their concerns about international transport affecting their jobs by using unofficial stops.

On 4 July 2023, in Sucre (Chuquisaca), more than 50 teachers and students of the Biochemistry subject of San Francisco Xavier University and animal rights defenders marched through the city as a demonstration to voice their grievances about what they say is the abuse of animals that are removed from the streets.

On 4 July 2023, in Cochabamba (Cochabamba), residents of districts 2, 4, 5, 7 and 8 from Quillacollo blocked Blanco Galindo, Victor Ustariz and Panamericana avenues as a demonstration to demand the elimination of the law that implemented a rise of the public cleaning rate into electricity bills.

On 4 July 2023, in El Alto (La Paz), parents of students of Walter Alpire Duran school staged a demonstration outside the District Education Management to demand the removal of four teachers that had been accused of psychologically abusing students.

actor1: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
notes: On 4 July 2023, in Belem (Para), armed individuals exchanged fire with military police in the Batista Campos neighborhood. One officer was injured and died from the injuries on 6 July 2023. The group was involved in a kidnapping (circumstances unknown). 1 fatality.
On 4 July 2023, in Belem (Para), people blocked the Arthur Bernardes avenue by setting obstacles on fire to demand the conclusion of a housing project.
On 4 July 2023, in Dourados (Mato Grosso do Sul), a suspected thief was beaten up and injured by residents in the Jardim Rincao neighborhood. The suspect was taken to a hospital by police.

On 4 July 2023, in Manaus - West Zone (Amazonas), a man was shot and killed the Santo Agostinho neighborhood by approximately eight armed individuals. The group was dressed as employees at a water and sanitation company. Authorship and motivation of the attack are unknown. 1 fatality.

On 4 July 2023, in Bebelandia (Santa Rita, Paraiba), a deputy councilman was shot and killed after being chased into a field. Identity of the perpetrators and motivations are unknown, but the police works with the possibility of connection to organized crime in the area. 1 fatality.

On 4 July 2023, in Maceio (Alagoas), a teenager was beaten by a group because he was suspected to have stolen a motorcycle and two cellphones at the Santos Dumont neighborhood. There were no fatalities.

On 4 July 2023, in Campinas (Sao Paulo), metalworkers held a protest outside the Labor Prosecution Office of the 15th region, resisting outsourcing spare parts distribution and remanufacturing sectors at a major car producing plant. Workers say it makes their work more precarious by lowering their wages and weakening their rights.
On 4 July 2023, in Manaus - West Zone (Amazonas), a suspected thief was beaten up and injured by residents in the Sao Jorge neighborhood. The suspect was taken to a hospital and later arrested.

actor2: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
source: Crimes News RJ; G1; Informe Agora; OTT-RJ; R7
notes: On 4 July 2023, in Rio de Janeiro - North Zone (Rio de Janeiro), Pure Third Command drug traffickers exchanged fire with military police officers in the Mare Complex. The drug trafficker leading operations in the Tres Rios area was shot and killed. A pregnant civilian was hit by a stray bullet and injured. Civilians complained that three private vehicles were damaged by police officers during the operation. Five suspects were arrested. Police seized two rifles, three pistols, two grenades, marijuana and marijuana plants, cocaine, and other drugs. Two family clinics and 22 schools were closed during the operation. Elsewhere, members of the Pure Third Command in a car exchanged fire with military police officers during an operation in the Pedreira Complex. Three suspects were shot and injured. Police seized a rifle, a pistol, a grenade, and a vehicle. 1 fatality.
On 4 July 2023, in Niteroi - North (Rio de Janeiro), unknown suspects exchanged fire in the Cubango neighborhood. Unknown casualties.
On 4 July 2023, in Rio de Janeiro - Central Zone (Rio de Janeiro), unknown suspects exchanged fire in the Benfica neighborhood. Unknown casualties.

On 4 July 2023, in Rio de Janeiro - North Zone (Rio de Janeiro), unknown suspects exchanged fire in the Andarai, Manguinhos, Pilares, and Bras de Pina neighborhoods. Shooting was also heard in the Faz Quem Quer community, Rocha Miranda neighborhood, the Morro do Fuba community, Cascadura neighborhood and the Jacarezinho neighborhood. Unknown casualties.

On 4 July 2023, in Rio de Janeiro - West Zone (Rio de Janeiro), unknown suspects exchanged fire in the Praca Seca, Realengo, and Tanque neighborhoods, and the Morro do Tirol favela. Unknown casualties.
On 4 July 2023, in Sao Jose dos Campos (Sao Paulo), public transport drivers held a protest. Bus departures were delayed. The cause of the protest is not known.

On 4 July 2023, in Duque de Caxias (Rio de Janeiro), three armed suspects shot and killed a manager of a Minha Casa Minha Vida housing complex in the Gramacho neighborhood. The event was described as an execution. A female civilian driving on the nearby road was hit by a stray bullet and injured. Police suspect the execution was motivated by a disagreement with local drug traffickers. 1 fatality.

actor2: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
source: G1; Informe Agora; O Sao Goncalo
notes: On 4 July 2023, in Niteroi - Oceanica (Rio de Janeiro), three drug traffickers exchanged fire with military police officers in Morro do Palacio community, Inga neighborhood. A civilian got caught in the crossfire and was shot and severely injured. Two suspects were arrested, and police seized two pistols, two radio communicators, and drugs. A third suspect was shot and injured but managed to escape. There were no fatalities.

On 4 July 2023, in Girau do Ponciano (Alagoas), a man was shot and killed in a drive-by shooting by two individuals on a motorcycle in the Pratinha neighborhood. Identity of the perpetrators and motivations are unknown. 1 fatality.

On 4 July 2023, in Porto Alegre (Rio Grande do Sul), a man was shot and killed in the Sarandi neighborhood by unknown armed individuals. The deceased had a police record for robbery and drug trafficking. Five suspects were arrested. 1 fatality.
On 4 July 2023, in Uberlandia (Minas Gerais), students at a state school carried out a protest to demand an investigation of a reported case of sexual harassment against students.

On 4 July 2023, in Boa Vista (Roraima), family members and friends of a man who was stabbed to death in a petty crime on 18 June 2023 gathered in front of the Courthouse in the Carana neighborhood to demand justice for his case.

On 4 July 2023, in Sao Paulo (Sao Paulo), Corinthians football fans held protests across the city by holding up banners, demanding for the removal of the club president. Some protesters even made threats to the president.
On 4 July 2023, in Saravena (Arauca), a man was abducted by unidentified armed individuals. The victim was a farmer. His whereabouts are unknown. The area is known for the presence of armed groups.

assoc_actor_1: FARC Dissident: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia Dissident Faction
notes: On 4 July 2023, in the rural area of Segovia municipality (Antioquia), for the sixth consecutive day, ELN and FARC dissident members clashed with Gulf Clan members in the Arenales vereda. As a result, around 200 residents of the area were forcibly displaced to nearby locations, 500 Indigenous people are at risk of displacement. Authorities said that the clashes are related to territorial disputes between the groups. Casualties unknown.

On 4 July 2023, in Petrolea (Norte de Santander), a police officer was shot dead by a sniper who opened fire against a police station. Authorities believe the attack was related to a 'pistol plan' by armed groups against members of the security forces in the department. Authorities believe that the attack was perpetrated by the ELN. 1 fatality.

source: El Colombiano; El Heraldo (Colombia); La Opinion (Colombia); W Radio
notes: On 4 July 2023, in El Zulia (Norte de Santander), two ELN members shot and killed two police officers at a commercial establishment in La Alejandra sector. Authorities believe the attack was related to a 'pistol plan' by armed groups against members of the security forces in the department. 2 fatalities.

On 4 July 2023, in the rural area of Puerto Santander municipality (Norte de Santander), military forces clashed with ELN members in El Dave vereda and arrested two members of the group. The soldiers had arrived in the area to make an inspection about an explosive device left by the group, however, military intelligence confirmed that the ELN members were in the area waiting for them to ambush them. There were no casualties.

Around 4 July 2023 (as reported), in the rural area of Caceres municipality (Antioquia), military forces clashed with Gulf Clan members in the Bejuquillo vereda in the context of an operation against the group. One leader of the Yeison Leudo Chaverra front was killed in the clash. A gun, two grenades, ammunition and a cell-phone were seized by authorities. 1 fatality.

assoc_actor_2: Former FARC: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia
notes: On 4 July 2023, in the rural area of Rovira municipality (Tolima), unidentified armed individuals shot and killed a former FARC member at a commercial establishment in the Altamira vereda. There is no further information on the motives and perpetrators of the attack. 1 fatality.

On 4 July 2023, in Toribio (Cauca), three unidentified armed individuals shot and killed an Indigenous youth social leader and human rights defender in a sector near the Isabelilla River. There is no further information on the motives and perpetrators of the attack but there is presence of the ELN and FARC dissidents in the area. 1 fatality.

On 4 July 2023, in El Palo (Cauca), an Indigenous social leader was shot and killed by unknown perpetrators. The victim was the legal representative of an Indigenous organization in Toribio municipality. The victim had received threats in the past and was under the protection of the National Protection Unit (UNP). There is no further information on the motives and perpetrators of the attack but there is presence of the ELN and FARC dissident groups in the area. 1 fatality.

assoc_actor_2: Unidentified Communal Group (Colombia); JAC: Council of Communal Action
notes: On 4 July 2023, in the rural area of Puerto Rico municipality (Caqueta), a social leader, who was also president of the Council of Communal Action (JAC) in El Recreo vereda, was shot dead by unidentified armed individuals. Another person was injured. There is no further information on the motives and perpetrators of the attack. 1 fatality.

assoc_actor_2: Unidentified Communal Group (Colombia); JAC: Council of Communal Action
notes: On 4 July 2023, in Quebrada del Medio (Antioquia), unidentified armed individuals shot and killed a social leader who was also a member of a Council of Communal Action (JAC). There is no further information on the motives and perpetrators of the attack but there is presence of the Gulf Clan, ELN and FARC dissident groups in the area. 1 fatality.

Property destruction: Around 4 July 2023 (as reported), in Narino department (coded to San Juan de Pasto), military forces destroyed 16 clandestine laboratories used for the production of cocaine. They also found and destroyed two shipyards used for the construction of semi-submersibles for the transportation of cocaine and seized four of these types of boats. There is no information about the armed groups associated with these.

assoc_actor_1: ASONAL: National Association of Officials and Employees of the Judicial Branch; Labor Group (Colombia); Lawyers (Colombia); Government of Colombia (2022-)
notes: On 4 July 2023, in Barranquilla (Atlantico), a group of judicial workers associated with the National Association of Officials and Employees of the Judicial Branch (ASONAL) and prosecutors from Soledad municipality protested in front of the General Attorney's Office on Paseo Bolivar avenue to repudiate a bomb threat by an organized crime group that happened the previous week that forced them to evacuate a public office building in Soledad. They demanded protection from the state in the face of constant intimidations from criminal groups and demanded more presence of security forces at their places of work.

On 4 July 2023, in Albania municipality (La Guajira), a group of former workers at the Cerrejon mining company blocked the railroad to demand the reintegration to the company after they say they were fired without any justification.

On 4 July 2023, in Bucaramanga (Santander), a group of artists protested in front of the governor's office building with artistic performances to repudiate the non-compliance of authorities with a contract signed with the Santander Department of Culture and Tourism for the services provided by the artists. They said that the government is paying them less than what was agreed upon in the contract.

On 4 July 2023, in Cucuta - Central (Norte de Santander), merchants and night commercial establishments owners protested in front of city hall against the shutdown of several establishments over non-compliance with the law and coexistence norms. Authorities said that they were not respecting norms regarding the volume of the music and they found that drug dealing was taking place inside the establishments. Protesters claim that authorities are being arbitrary and are not respecting their right to work.

On 4 July 2023, in the rural area of San Faustino corregimiento (Norte de Santander), 16 miners were injured by the detonation of a remote explosive device planted at an Indumax's oil residue purification plant by suspected ELN members. Only two miners were taken to a hospital and one of them died hours later from his injuries. According to authorities, two members of the group who planted the explosive arrived at the site and order everyone to evacuate before leaving the explosive there. 1 fatality.
On 4 July 2023, in Saravena municipality (Arauca), ELN members detonated two explosive devices. Nobody was injured. There were no casualties.

On 4 July 2023, in the rural area of Salamina municipality (Magdalena), a group of students, teachers and parents protested outside a school against the bad infrastructure conditions at the institution and the lack of school transportation for students. They demanded solutions from authorities and the presence of the mayor in the area.
On 4 July 2023, in Bogota - Fontibon (Bogota, D.C.), a group of residents at the Laredo neighborhood held a protest against the insecurity and high theft rates in the area.

On 4 July 2023, in Chitaga municipality (Norte de Santander), residents from La Esperanza municipality blocked the highway at the Tropezon sector to protest against the plans of the government of installing a landfill in their area. Protesters were concerned about the environmental impacts that the landfill would bring to the community.

On 4 July 2023, in La Esperanza municipality (Norte de Santander), locals blocked the El Playon - San Alberto highway in the Medio Vijagual sector to protest against the plans of the government of installing a landfill in the area. Protesters were concerned about the environmental impacts that the landfill would bring to the community.

On 4 July 2023, in Pereira (Risaralda), a group of residents in the Galan neighborhood blocked Del Rio Avenue to demand the installation of speed bumps that they have been requesting for two years. They also repudiated that the local administration installed improvised plastic speed bumps that have caused accidents in the area.

On 4 July 2023, near Vuelta Larga (Esmeraldas), dozens of residents of 50 Casas and Los Mangos neighborhoods demonstrated and lit tires on fire to block the highway that connects Esmeraldas and Atacames near La Tolita neighborhood, to demand local and national authorities deliver the aid promised to them since the previous month to help reconstruct after major flooding in the region.

On 4 July 2023, in Naranjal (Guayas), teachers, students and their parents marched through the city as a demonstration to demand changes to the education law, and demanding respect for the rights of teachers and students.

On 4 July 2023, near Puerto Casado (La Victoria, Alto Paraguay), Ayoreo indigenous communities blocked the PY15 Highway to demand the release of their leaders, arrested in a protest the previous week (coded separately).

On 4 July 2023, in Iquitos (Loreto), teachers and students of Simon Bolivar school and health workers of the 1 de Enero medical center blocked Putumayo street with burning tires as a demonstration to repudiate the amount of trash that is accumulated in front of the school and the health center.

On 4 July 2023, in Punchana (Loreto), residents staged a demonstration outside the local government offices to demand the intervention by the mayor and local authorities in an ongoing land conflict that they wait to settle to build their houses.
On 4 July 2023, near Mene de Mauroa (Falcon), a group of farmers blocked the Troncal 3 Falcon - Zulia road, at KM 7, in protest over fuel shortages.

On 4 July 2023, in Valencia (Carabobo), a group of demonstrators, including health workers, teachers, other state workers, and representatives of several unions, protested to demand better salaries and pensions, and payment of owed stipends. The protesters gathered in the Bolivar Avenue.

On 4 July 2023, in Campo Elias (Yaracuy), a group of teachers protested in support of some teachers of the Juan Vicente Gonzalez School that were harassed for partaking in protests over pay and working conditions.

source: La Patilla; OVCS: Observatorio Venezolano de Conflictividad Social
notes: Around 4 July 2023 (as reported), in San Fernando de Apure (Apure), a group of demonstrators, including teachers and education sector unionists, protested to demand better pay and working conditions. The protesters gathered in the Paseo Libertador Avenue, by the Fetrapure Union office.

actor2: Police Forces of Venezuela (1999-) CPNB: National Bolivarian Police
source: Diario 2001; La Patilla; Noticia al Minuto
notes: On 4 July 2023, in Caracas - Libertador (Distrito Capital), a group of women, and residents of the Carapita sector, grappled with three PNB police officers, and hurled rocks and other objects at them, to prevent the arrest of a woman for drug possession. That woman managed to escape, but a female rioter was arrested for injuring one of the officers with a rock. There is no further information at this point in time.

source: Diario de Los Andes; OVCS: Observatorio Venezolano de Conflictividad Social
notes: On 4 July 2023, in Valera (Trujillo), a group of teachers and education sector unionists protested to demand better pay and working conditions. They gathered in the Bolivar Square.

On 4 July 2023, in Merida (Merida), a group of demonstrators, including active and retired teachers, and multi-sector union representatives, protested against what they consider as constant breaches of their collective labor agreements, and to demand the recalculation of their holiday bonuses. The protesters marched to the Labor Inspectorate Office.

source: El Impulso; La Prensa de Lara; Reporte YA
notes: On 4 July 2023, in Barquisimeto (Lara), a group of residents of the El Cercado neighborhood protested over drinking water outages going on for at least five years. The protesters claim that the problem affects approximately 7200 families of several neighborhoods. They gathered by the Hidrolara water company offices. Another group of residents of the Brisas del Aeropuerto neighborhood protested with similar demands.
On 4 July 2023, in Caracas - Baruta (Miranda), a group of residents of the Parque Humboldt Avenue gathered by the Terras Plaza Mall in protest over ongoing water outages.

source: OVCS: Observatorio Venezolano de Conflictividad Social
notes: On 4 July 2023, in Monagas state (coded to Maturin), demonstrators protested with unspecified demands on issues related to water, petrol, labor, social security, and politics.

source: Comision Intereclesial de Justicia y Paz; El Diario (Colombia); El Espectador; El Tiempo (Colombia)
notes: Non-violent activity: On 4 July 2023, in the south of the Choco department (coded to Novita), the northwest front of the ELN declared a general curfew ('paro armado') for the Novita, Sipi, Istmina, Medio San Juan and Litoral del San Juan municipalities. The measure affected 52 Indigenous and Afro-Colombian communities (around 9,000 people) that are completely confined inside their homes. The ELN banned any land and river transportation. The curfew was suspended on 10 July.

assoc_actor_1: Government of Venezuela (1999-); AD: Democratic Action
notes: On 4 July 2023, in Coloncito (Tachira), a group of relatives and friends of two elderly women that were struck and killed by a car driven by a drunk driver in the Bella Vista sector on 2 July, and an elected council member of the AD political party, protested to demand justice for them, and to raise awareness about the numerous cases of drunk driving in the municipality.
On 3 July 2023, in Le Larivot, Cayenne, dozens of professionals held a protest in front of the Justice Palace to demand better working conditions. The protest was part of a national labor strike.

On 3 July 2023, in Georgetown, Demerara-Mahaica, citizens and members of the political opposition held a protest at the Revolution square to demand justice for the victim of alleged rape by the Minister of Local Government and Regional Development in 2022 (coded separately).
On 3 July 2023, in Olanchito, Yoro, unidentified armed men on a motorcycle shot and killed a man (drive-by). The reason for the shooting is unknown. 1 fatality.

On 3 July 2023, near Chitre, Herrera, teachers staged a protest by blocking the road on the Divisa cross to demand that the authorities of the Ministry of Education speed up the appointment of teachers.

On 3 July 2023, in La Chorrera, Panama, students and former students at a local schools staged a protest on the Avenue of the Americas to demand that authorities provide new facilities and finalize the building reforms. In addition, they demanded running water, the appointment of janitors, among others.

On 3 July 2023, in in Mendoza (Capital), health workers united in the Mendoza Association of Health Professionals (AMPROS) protested at the Notti Hospital. The protesters reject institutional abandonment and the consequent lack of protection for patients due to difficult working conditions for doctors.

On 3 July 2023, in Purmamarca (Tumbaya, Jujuy), protestors, mainly belonging to indigenous communities, blocked routes to reject the constitutional reform of the province and the repression to protestors in Humahuaca in the previous Saturday. The collective action is part of a wave of mobilization that has lasted for weeks around this claim.

source: La Nacion (Argentina); La Voz del Interior (Argentina); Tiempo Sur (Argentina)
notes: On 3 July 2023, in Laboulaye (Presidente Roque Saenz Pena, Cordoba), around 400 relatives and friends of a murdered teenager marched at night, after his burial, to demand justice and clarification of the crime. The mobilization started from the Malvinas Argentinas school, where the teenager studied, to the headquarters of the Laboulaye Courts. Students participated in the demonstration, porting candles and photos of the victim.

On 3 July 2023, in Berisso (Buenos Aires), municipal employees, members of the Berisso Municipal Workers Union, protested in Roma Bridge to demand better working conditions from the local government. The demonstrators announced more protests as a measure of pressure.

On 3 July 2023, in La Paz (La Paz), former workers of the Bolivian Airport Services (SABSA) company, which no longer exists, staged a demonstration to voice their grievances about the government giving them they payments of social benefits in different time frames.

On 3 July 2023, in Sabaya (Oruro), heavy transportation drivers blocked the Oruro - Pisiga international highway as a demonstration to voice their concerns about international transport affecting their jobs by using unofficial stops.

On 3 July 2023, in Cochabamba (Cochabamba), residents of the Alejo Calatayud Base Territorial Organization (OTB) blocked the intersection of Aroma and 16 de Julio avenues as a demonstration to voice their grievances about the mayor implementing a municipal decree that allows sidewalks to be used by merchants.

On 3 July 2023, in Oruro (Oruro), residents of District 4 blocked the streets outside the local government, the municipal council offices, and the Public Works offices as a demonstration to demand authorities to give them land deeds, approve building plans, and establish use of land of newly constructed urbanizations.

On 3 July 2023, in Santa Cruz de la Sierra (Santa Cruz), for the third consecutive day, hemodialysis patients of CHMA health center and their family members blocked the road in front of the center as a demonstration to demand payment from the Health Ministry to all of these health institutions, which have been pending for more than six months.

On 3 July 2023, in Tolata (Cochabamba), dozens of residents of Villa Copacabana sector staged a demonstration outside the Agrarian Reform National Institute (INRA) to repudiate an inspection being carried out by the institute to check for legal documents, claiming that INRA has been giving land deeds to land squatters.

actor1: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
notes: On 3 July 2023, in Cariacica (Espirito Santo), an armed individual exchanged fire with military police during a patrol in the Campo Grande neighborhood. The armed suspect was injured and taken to hospital. An accomplice of the suspect also opened fire against military police, but he escaped. The suspects had shot and injured a man moments earlier (coded separately). There were no fatalities.

actor2: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
notes: On 3 July 2023, in Brasilia (Distrito Federal), health workers carried out a march to demand the enforcement of a bill which granted health workers a national minimum wage. One protester was arrested by military police.

actor1: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
notes: On 3 July 2023, in the rural area of Pedra Branca do Amapari municipality (Amapa), an armed individual exchanged fire with military police during his arrest operation. The armed suspect was killed. Another suspect, his brother, was arrested. The pair had killed two people on 30 June 2023 (coded separately). 1 fatality.

actor1: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
notes: On 3 July 2023, between the cities of Porto Grande and Pedra Branca do Amapari (Amapa), a member of a drug trafficking group exchanged fire with military police in the Nova Canaa region. The drug trafficker was killed. Police seized firearms and portions of drugs. 1 fatality.

On 3 July 2023, in Juiz de Fora (Minas Gerais), a man was shot and killed in the Miguel Marinho neighborhood by armed individuals. Two suspects were identified, but not arrested. Attack motivation is unknown. 1 fatality.

On 3 July 2023, in Nazare da Mata (Pernambuco), a man was shot and killed by two individuals who found him at the gas station where he worked. Identity of the perpetrators and motivations are unknown. 1 fatality.

actor1: Police Forces of Brazil (2023-) Civil Police
notes: On 3 July 2023, in Uruara (Para), three armed individuals exchanged fire with civil police officers during an operation at Biblia square. One suspect and one officer were injured and taken to hospital, but both eventually died from the injuries. The other suspects escaped. Hours later, a second clash broke between another suspect and the civil police in the Pimentolandia neighborhood. The suspect was killed. 3 fatalities.

On 3 July 2023, in Blumenau (Santa Catarina), about 50 alternative transportation workers carried out a protest against accusations made by regular public transportation workers that their work is illegal.
On 3 July 2023, in Niteroi - North (Rio de Janeiro), unknown suspects exchanged fire in the Cubango neighborhood. Unknown casualties.

On 3 July 2023, in Vitoria (Espirito Santo), a man was shot and killed and two more people were shot and injured by drug traffickers in the Estrelinha neighborhood. The victims were not involved in illegal activities. 1 fatality.

On 3 July 2023, in Cariacica (Espirito Santo), public transportations workers gathered in front of a bus company garage and blocked the exits to protest against buses not having air conditioning, as was agreed with City Hall.
On 3 July 2023, in Rio de Janeiro - North Zone (Rio de Janeiro), unknown suspects exchanged fire in the Andarai neighborhood. Unknown casualties.
On 3 July 2023, in Rio de Janeiro - West Zone (Rio de Janeiro), unknown suspects exchanged fire in the Vila Valquiere neighborhood. Unknown casualties.

actor2: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
notes: On 3 July 2023, in Angra dos Reis (Rio de Janeiro), at least two drug traffickers exchanged fire with military police officers on patrol in the Sapinhatuba III neighborhood. Two suspects were killed. Police seized two pistols, radio communicators, ammunition, marijuana, cocaine, and crack. 2 fatalities.

On 3 July 2023, in Cariacica (Espirito Santo), a man was shot and injured in the Campo Grande neighborhood by an armed individual who had the aid of two accomplices. One suspect was detained after clashing with military police (coded separately). Attack motivation is unknown. There were no fatalities.

actor2: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
notes: On 3 July 2023, in Japeri (Sao Paulo), armed suspects exchanged fire with military police officer in the Sao Jorge community. A police officer was shot and injured. A suspect was also injured. Police seized a rifle. 1 fatality.
On 3 July 2023, in Vitoria (Espirito Santo), a suspected thief was beaten up and injured by residents in the Jardim da Penha neighborhood. The suspect was taken to a hospital and later arrested.

On 3 July 2023, in Joao Pessoa (Paraiba), three individuals were shot and one of them killed in a drive-by shooting perpetrated by two individuals in a car in the Distrito Mecanico neighborhood. The man who was killed had been formerly incarcerated. Two suspects were arrested. Police believe the attack was motivated by a score settlement. 1 fatality.

On 3 July 2023, in Manaus - West Zone (Amazonas), a man was shot and injured in a drive-by shooting in the Vila da Prata neighborhood by two armed individuals on a motorcycle. The victim died from the injuries a few hours later. Authorship and motivation of the attack are unknown. 1 fatality.

On 3 July 2023, in Pombal (Paraiba), a man was shot and killed in a drive-by shooting perpetrated by two armed individuals on a motorcycle. The man had been the target of a failed killing attempt two days prior. Identity of the perpetrators and motivations are unknown. 1 fatality.

On 3 July 2023, in Sao Leopoldo (Rio Grande do Sul), a man was killed in a drive-by shooting in the Rio dos Sinos neighborhood by two armed individuals on a motorcycle. One suspect stepped out of the motorcycle and shot the victim more times. The victim was a prisoner of the semi-open regime (charges not reported). Authorship and motivation of the attack are unknown. 1 fatality.

source: Folha de Boa Vista; G1; Portal do Holanda
notes: On 3 July 2023, in Yanomami Indigenous Territory (Roraima), armed individuals carried out an attack in the Parima region. One Indigenous child was killed and five Indigenous people were injured, including a local indigenous leader. Police believe the attack was carried out by indigenous people from other communities, sponsored by illegal miners. Illegal mining activities take place in the area. 1 fatality.
On 3 July 2023, in Londrina (Parana), parents of students at a state school carried out a protest to demand an investigation of sexual harassment cases reported in the school.

actor2: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
notes: On 3 July 2023, in Sao Goncalo - Monjolo (Rio de Janeiro), at least two armed suspects exchanged fire with military police in the Brejal favela, Jardim Bom Retiro neighborhood. Two suspects were arrested, and police seized a pistol, two radio communicators, and a small quantity of drugs. There were no fatalities.

actor2: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
notes: On 3 July 2023, in Sao Goncalo - Ipiiba (Rio de Janeiro), at least two armed suspects exchanged fire with military police in the Alto do Monte locality in the Alma favela, Coelho neighborhood. One suspect was arrested, and police seized a pistol, a radio communicator, and drugs. There were no fatalities.

On 3 July 2023, in Fortul municipality (Arauca), ELN members kidnapped an off-duty woman member of the military forces and her two sons when she was traveling to Arauca municipality in a vehicle. It was known that one of the children had autism spectrum disorder. The victims were released on 7 July by the ELN to a humanitarian mission formed by the Catholic Church and the Ombudsman's Office.

assoc_actor_1: FARC Dissident: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia Dissident Faction
notes: On 3 July 2023, in the rural area of Segovia municipality (Antioquia), for the fifth consecutive day, ELN and FARC dissident members clashed with Gulf Clan members in the Arenales vereda. As a result, around 200 residents of the area were forcibly displaced to nearby locations, 500 Indigenous people are at risk of displacement. Authorities said that the clashes are related to territorial disputes between the groups. Casualties unknown.

actor1: FARC Dissident - Jaime Martinez: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia Dissident Faction (Jaime Martinez)
notes: On 3 July 2023, in the rural area of Buenaventura municipality (Valle del Cauca), Jaime Martinez FARC dissidents ambushed with firearms members of the navy while they were navigating on the Naya River killing one official. 1 fatality.

On 3 July 2023, in Cucutilla (Norte de Santander), a group of four people, including the patient and three family members, beat up a woman doctor whom they accused of medical malpractice and causing a miscarriage on the patient who was pregnant. According to the doctor, the patient had arrived on 30 June with spotting and sent her home to rest while she waited for medical exams scheduled for the 3rd but the patient did not follow the instructions. However, the patient and her relatives arrived on the day of the exams and attacked the doctor. There were no fatalities.
On 3 July 2023, in Barbacoas municipality (Narino), there was an armed clash between unidentified armed groups in the Nunalbi Alto Ulbi Indigenous Reserve. Casualties unknown.

On 3 July 2023, in Quibdo (Choco), an Afro-Colombian man was shot dead by unknown perpetrators in the San Vicente neighborhood. There is no further information on the motives and perpetrators of the attack but the area is known for the presence of armed groups. 1 fatality.

source: El Pais (Colombia); INDEPAZ; Sucesos Cauca; UNOCHA
notes: On 3 July 2023, in Corinto municipality (Cauca), unidentified armed individuals shot and killed three men, two of whom were brothers, on the Corinto - Caloto road in La Moroquera sector. The perpetrators intercepted the vehicle in which the victims were traveling in and forced them to get out before killing them. There is no further information on the motives and perpetrators of the attack but there is presence of several armed groups, in the area. 3 fatalities.

Around 3 July 2023 (as reported), in Quibdo (Choco), an Afro-Colombian man was killed and his body was found on the Atrato River with signs of violence. There is no further information on the motives and perpetrators of the attack but the area is known for the presence of armed groups. 1 fatality.

On 3 July 2023, in Panama de Arauca (Arauca), members of an unidentified armed group attacked a military base by detonating two explosive devices. Material damage was caused. There were no casualties.

On 3 July 2023, in Portoviejo (Manabi), hundreds of residents marched through the city as a demonstration to show their support for the mayor (Avanza), after the Electoral Tribunal (TCE) suspended his participation rights for an electoral infraction committed in the local and regional authorities election.

On 3 July 2023, in Santa Rosa del Mbutuy (Caaguazu), teachers and parents from the San Jose Obrero, San Miguel Arcangel, and San Agustin schools demonstrated in front of the departmental headquarters of the Ministry of Education and Sciences (MEC) to demand a reallocation of job positions in schools. Protesters claim that people outside the institutions were hired.

On 3 July 2023, in Lima - Independencia (Lima), transportation workers blocked the bus lanes near Naranjal station as a demonstration to demand the Urban Transport Authority (ATU) to change the bus routes assigned to their company.

On 3 July 2023, in Chilca (Junin), residents of Azapampa sector staged a demonstration outside the Regional Government offices to demand a dialogue with the governor to discuss the budget allocation for potable water and sewage systems for their sector.
On 3 July 2023, in Iquitos (Loreto), residents of El Bambu human settlement in San Juan Bautista neighborhood staged a demonstration to demand authorities to level the terrain in their sector.

On 3 July 2023, in Montevideo (Montevideo), soccer players from the First and Second Division of Uruguayan women's soccer protested in front of the Mutual Uruguayan de Futbolistas Profesionales (MUFP) to demand better conditions for training and equitable investment by the Uruguayan Soccer Association (AUF).

On 3 July 2023, in Puerto La Cruz (Anzoategui), a group of demonstrators, including health workers, the Movement of Health Workers (Motrasalud), and relatives of a health worker arrested under accusations of stealing medicines from the Luis Razetti Hospital in Barcelona (Anzoategui), protested to demand his liberation. The protesters gathered by the Public Ministry Office.

source: La Prensa de Lara; Reporte YA
notes: On 3 July 2023, in Barquisimeto (Lara), a group of health workers, mostly women, protested to demand better pay and working conditions, and against workplace harassment. They gathered outside the Razetti Medical Centre.

assoc_actor_2: Labor Group (Venezuela); PSUV: United Socialist Party of Venezuela
notes: On 3 July 2023, in Barinas (Barinas), a group of workers at the UNELLEZ University protested by the institution's main entrance to demand better pay and working conditions. Another group of UNELLEZ University workers, mostly PSUV supporters, attended the protest to counter-demonstrate, insult, intimidate, and discourage the demonstrators, but the event carried on without any incidents.

On 3 July 2023, in Ciudad Guayana (Bolivar), a group of demonstrators, including retired workers at the Caroni townhall, and pensioners, protested to demand payment of food bonuses and the renewal of their collective labor agreement. The protesters gathered by the Palacio Municipal building.

On 3 July 2023, in Los Teques (Miranda), a group of demonstrators, including teachers, health workers, and other state workers, protested to demand better pay and working conditions, payment of owed holiday bonuses, and the renewal of their collective labor agreements. The protesters gathered outside the FVM Miranda Tuy union headquarters.

On 3 July 2023, in Caracas - Libertador (Distrito Capital), dozens of demonstrators, including active and retired teachers and workers at the Central University of Venezuela (UCV), and the Simon Bolivar University, protested to demand better pay and working conditions, and the repeal of the National Budget Office (ONAPRE) instruction. The protesters gathered by the gates of the Tamanaco entrance to the UCV campus.

On 3 July 2023, in Humahuaca (Jujuy), around 300 teachers, mainly organized in Adep, marched to demand salary improvements and repudiate the provincial constitutional reform. Protesters reported government threats following their activism.

On 3 July 2023, in the rural area of El Llanito corregimiento (Santander), ELN members detonated an explosive device next to the ECOPETROL State Oil Company pipelines in the Campo Gala vereda. The detonation damaged one pipeline used for industrial water injection. A simultaneous and similar event took place in El Centro corregimiento (coded separately). The ELN released a statement in which it claimed responsibility for the attack. There were no casualties.

On 3 July 2023, in the rural area of El Centro corregimiento (Santander), ELN members detonated an explosive device next to the ECOPETROL State Oil Company pipelines in the Campo 5 vereda. The detonation damaged one pipeline used for industrial water injection. A simultaneous and similar event took place in El Llanito corregimiento (coded separately). The ELN released a statement in which it claimed responsibility for the attack. There were no casualties.

On 3 July 2023, in the rural area of Istmina municipality (Choco), members of an unidentified armed group arrived at the Chambacu Afro-Colombian community and shot and killed a person and injured another. 172 people were forcibly displaced because of this. 1 fatality.

On 3 July 2023, in Pampatar (Nueva Esparta), a group of fishers protested to demand a higher price for their octopus catches. The protesters argue that the wholesalers in the region are refusing to buy their production at previously agreed prices.

On 2 July 2023, in Belize City, Belize, there was an armed clash between two unidentified armed men on Rivero Street. As a result of the clash, one of the armed men was killed. The victim was a minor. The source indicates that a bystander was shot and injured in the incident. Police believes the clash was part of gang-rivalry. 1 fatality, 1 injured.

On 2 July 2023, near Rosita, Costa Caribe, four armed attackers shot and injured a park ranger and member of the Mayangna indigenous group in the Betlenhem indigenous community. He died two days later in the hospital. The reports state that the armed men could be armed settlers. 1 fatality.
On 2 July 2023, in Bocas del Toro, Bocas del Toro, hundreds of people staged a demonstration on the Changuinola road against land invasion and in the defense of private property.

source: Diario De Cuyo; El Territorio; La Capital (Argentina); La Voz del Interior (Argentina)
notes: On 2 July 2023, around San Pedro Pescador (1 de Mayo, Chaco), around 300 protesters, including friends and relatives of a disappeared journalist, allegedly a victim of femicide, marched from the General Belgrano bridge in Corrientes to the San Pedro Pescador neighborhood to demand justice, investigation, and international support to clarify the case. The demonstrators emphasized the interprovincial support for the justice demand (Chacho and Corrientes) and strictly avoided blocking the roads. They also demanded that suspect political leaders' properties, managed as part of a foundation, be distributed among the population. The organization Madres del Dolor supported the collective action, which police officers guarded.

On 2 July 2023, in Santa Cruz de la Sierra (Santa Cruz), for the second consecutive day, hemodialysis patients of CHMA health center and their family members blocked the road in front of the center as a demonstration to demand payment from the Health Ministry to all of these health institutions, which have been pending for more than six months.
On 2 July 2023, in Fortaleza (Ceara), a group gathered on a car tour to demand for the establishment of a minimum wage for nursing professionals. The demonstration ended at the Mucuripe neighborhood.

actor1: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
notes: On 2 July 2023, in Fortaleza (Ceara), a boy was shot by the military police as they carried out an operation in the Papicu neighborhood. Police claim there was a shoot-out. However, witnesses stated otherwise. There were no fatalities.
On 2 July 2023, in Picos (Piaui), three individuals engaged in a shootout with an unknown group at a gas station in the Junco neighbourhood. One of the three was shot and killed. 1 fatality.
On 2 July 2023, in Rio de Janeiro - North Zone (Rio de Janeiro), unknown suspects exchanged fire in the Morro da Primavera community, Cavalcante neighborhood. Unknown casualties.

On 2 July 2023, in Boa Vista (Roraima), two armed individuals opened fire against a group of people in a drive-by shooting in the Santa Tereza neighborhood. A Brazilian child and two Venezuelan men were injured. Authorship and motivation of the attack are unknown. There were no fatalities.

On 2 July 2023, in Canoas (Rio Grande do Sul), a man was shot and killed in the Mathias Velho neighborhood by unknown armed individuals. The deceased had a police record for robbery and drug trafficking. Another person was shot and injured. 1 fatality.

On 2 July 2023, in Catole do Rocha (Paraiba), a man was shot and killed in a drive-by shooting perpetrated by two armed individuals on a motorcycle at the Tancredo Nerves neighborhood. Identity of the perpetrators and motivations are unknown. 1 fatality.

Around 2 July 2023 (as reported), in Manaus - Central South Zone (Amazonas), a man was killed by unknown individuals and his body was found in the Chapada neighborhood with signs of torture and with his hands tied up with chains. Circumstances of death are unknown. 1 fatality.

On 2 July 2023, in Salvador (Bahia), a group made of Jair Bolsonaro's (PL) supporters gathered on a motorcycle tour to remember Bahia's Independence Holiday and show support to the former head of state.

actor2: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
notes: On 2 July 2023, in Rio de Janeiro - North Zone (Rio de Janeiro), armed suspects exchanged fire with military police in the Morro do 18 community, Agua Santa neighborhood. Unknown casualties.

On 2 July 2023, in Diadema (Sao Paulo), around 50 relatives and friends held a protest in the Favela Naval community, demanding justice and paying tribute to the death of two men who were killed by two off-duty military police officers three months prior. At the start of the protest, 10 military police vehicles arrived at the scene and tried to prevent the start of the demonstration by intimidating the protesters.

On 2 July 2023, in Valparaiso (Valparaiso), retired people, residents, students, cyclists and neighborhood councils gathered at Civica del Puerto square in protest against transport service quality, and demanded concrete measures for mistreatment, problems with the buses frequency and the general services provided by private companies to the community. Several social organizations and authorities are working on solutions.

On 2 July 2023, in San Antonio (Valparaiso), relatives and friends of two cousins who died in a car accident gathered at Llolleo square and marched towards Barrancas square demanding justice. Protesters stated that a high-speed car crashed into the victims and threw them into a ditch on the side of the highway on 11 February. Protesters also argued that they know that the person was drunk at the moment of the accident and that he is eluding justice as he comes from a rich family.

Property destruction: On 2 July 2023, in General Lopez (Araucania), unknown individuals set a warehouse and a backhoe on fire in La Granja farm. A pamphlet was found at the scene in which Weichan Auka Mapu (WAM) took responsibility for the attack. The group demanded freedom for the Mapuche prisoners and mentioned their hatred to colonists, including the name of a deputy. The property has a 12-hour night protection measure and police were outside of the owner's house, but were not present where the machinery was located.

On 2 July 2023, in Santiago - Providencia (Metropolitana), a group of unknown individuals erected burning barricades outside of the Democratic Revolution (DR) headquarters. Firefighters arrived and controlled the fire, and there was no damage to the building. This takes place in the context of controversy in the allocation of state funds to several foundations during the constitutional plebiscite of 2022.

On 2 July 2023, in Fortul municipality (Arauca), an unidentified armed group kidnapped three people, two of whom were husband and wife. The whereabouts of the victims are unknown. The area is known for the presence of armed groups.

assoc_actor_1: FARC Dissident: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia Dissident Faction
notes: On 2 July 2023, in the rural area of Segovia municipality (Antioquia), for the fourth consecutive day, ELN and FARC dissident members clashed with Gulf Clan members in the Arenales vereda. As a result, around 200 residents of the area were forcibly displaced to nearby locations, 500 Indigenous people are at risk of displacement. Authorities said that the clashes are related to territorial disputes between the groups. Casualties unknown.

On 2 July 2023, in Ibague (Tolima), two groups of land occupiers in the Villa Resistencia sector, Ciudadela Simon Bolivar neighborhood, clashed with firearms. The clash was related to land disputes and land grabbing. Casualties unknown.

On 2 July 2023, in Quibdo (Choco), an Afro-Colombian man was shot and killed by unknown perpetrators in the Minuto de Dios neighborhood. There is no further information on the motives and perpetrators of the attack but the area is known for the presence of armed groups. 1 fatality.

Around 2 July 2023 (as reported), in Quibdo (Choco), an Afro-Colombian man was shot dead and his body was found in the Alameda neighborhood. There is no further information on the motives and perpetrators of the attack but the area is known for the presence of armed groups. 1 fatality.

On 2 July 2023, in the rural area of Silvia municipality (Cauca), two unidentified hooded and armed individuals shot and killed an Indigenous man inside his house in the Farallones vereda. There is no further information on the motives and perpetrators of the attack but the area is known for the presence of armed groups. 1 fatality.

On 2 July 2023, in Guachene (Cauca), unidentified armed individuals shot and killed a man at his house in Las Palmas neighborhood. There is no further information on the motives and perpetrators of the attack but the area is known for the presence of armed groups. 1 fatality.

On 2 July 2023, in Guachene (Cauca), unidentified armed individuals shot and killed a man and injured another in the Villa Lilia neighborhood. There is no further information on the motives and perpetrators of the attack but the area is known for the presence of armed groups. 1 fatality.

source: El Colombiano; El Tiempo (Colombia); Sucesos Cauca; UNOCHA
notes: On 2 July 2023, in the rural area of Caldono municipality (Cauca), unidentified hooded and armed individuals opened fire 36 times on the vehicle in which a Catholic priest and other church members were traveling in, in La Piscina sector. Both victims were on returning to the municipal seat after participating in a church activity. The men were severely injured in the attack and taken to a hospital in Popayan for medical assistance. There is no further information on the motives and perpetrators of the attack but there is presence of the ELN and FARC dissident groups in the area. There were no fatalities.

On 2 July 2023, around San Antonio corregimiento (Cauca), unidentified armed individuals on a motorcycle (drive-by shooting) shot and killed a man dedicated to artisanal mining when he was traveling in a vehicle from San Antonio to the municipal seat. There is no further information on the motives and perpetrators of the attack but the area is known for the presence of armed groups. 1 fatality.

assoc_actor_1: Refugees/IDPs (Colombia); Former FARC: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia
notes: Displacement: On 2 July 2023, in Vista Hermosa municipality (coded to Vistahermosa, Meta), around 170 families formed by former FARC members were forcibly displaced from the Georgina Ortiz reincorporation camp to Granada municipality because of threats and violence from armed groups in the area. The former FARC members and their families were accompanied by a convoy formed by the UN, OEA, UNP and ARN to guarantee their security.

Non-violent activity: On 2 July 2023, in Cerro Alto (Cauca), members of an unidentified armed group patrolled the streets of the village. There is presence of the ELN and FARC dissident groups in the area.

notes: On 2 July 2023, in Bogota - Teusaquillo (Bogota, D.C.), more than 100,000 members of the LGBTQ+ community marched from the city council to Simon Bolivar Park to demand more rights, equality, and respect for the life of members of the community. They also demanded the approval of an integral law for transgender people. The mayor (AV) of the city participated in the march. Another group of LGBTQ+ people marched in a counter-demonstration with a different approach in which they repudiated all kinds of violence against members of the community. There was a minor clash between sa small group of members of both groups, however, the situation was controlled by public employees. The march took place in the context of the commemoration of International Pride Month.

On 2 July 2023, in Barranquilla (Atlantico), around 6,000 members of the LGBTQ+ community marched to Peace Square to demand the protection of their rights, the respect of their life and the approval of an integral law for transgender people. The march took place in the context of the commemoration of International Pride Month.

On 2 July 2023, in Cartagena (Bolivar), members of the LGBTQ+ community marched to demand the protection of their rights, the respect of their life and the approval of an integral law for transgender people. The march took place in the context of the commemoration of International Pride Month.

On 2 July 2023, in Cucuta - Northeast (Norte de Santander), more than 10,000 members of the LGBTQ+ community marched to Banderas Square to demand the protection of their rights, the respect of their life and the approval of an integral law for transgender people. Around 2 July 2023 (as reported), in Sincelejo (Sucre), a group of teachers protested outside the Las Penitas hospital to repudiate the bad healthcare service provided by the Medicine Integral Sucre healthcare provider. Relatives of a teacher who is a patient at the hospital were also present.
On 2 July 2023, in Capiata (Central), residents of Posta Ybycua protested to demand the completion of the construction works of a Family Health unit that has been months behind schedule.

On 2 July 2023, in Camana (Arequipa), workers unionized with the Civil Construction Workers Union of Camana clashed between themselves during the union leader elections, after the former manager of the electoral committee destroyed the minutes book, in what some of the members say was an attempt to destroy evidence of irregularities of the electoral process. Police arrived at the scene to control the situation, and the election of the new board of directors was suspended.

On 2 July 2023, in Huanuco (Huanuco), residents who are members of the Cultural Partner Association marched through the city as a demonstration to demand transportation workers and pedestrians keep the city clean from litter.

actor1: Military Forces of Venezuela (1999-) GNB: Venezuelan National Guard

source: El Nacional (Venezuela); El Pitazo; El Universal (Venezuela); La Patilla
notes: On 2 July 2023, in Caracas - Libertador (Distrito Capital), dozens of demonstrators, including LGBTQ+ and human rights activists, residents, Venezuelan public figures, and European Union representatives, took to the streets to demand equal rights, same-sex marriage, and respect for their identity, and against any form of discrimination. The march began in the Francisco de Miranda Avenue, and ended by the National Electoral Council (CNE), in Venezuela Square.

Around 2 July 2023 (as reported), in Villa del Rosario (Norte de Santander), unidentified individuals attacked the municipal transit department by detonating a remote explosive device left outside the premises of the institution. Nobody was harmed in the attack since there were no people inside the building, however, severe material damage was caused by the blast. The ELN released a statement in which it claimed responsibility for the attack days later, confirming the hypothesis by authorities. There were no casualties.

On 2 July 2023, in the rural area of Istmina municipality (Choco), there was an armed clash between two unidentified armed groups. 172 Afro-Colombian people were forcibly displaced because of it. Casualties unknown.

On 2 July 2023, in El Amparo de Apure (Apure), unidentified armed individuals abducted two men, Colombian nationals, from their homes in the Raul Leoni Primero and the Matapalo neighborhoods. One of the victims, who was a social leader, was shot dead by the group in Arauca, Colombia, on 14 July after being transported through the border by his kidnappers (coded separately). There is no information on the identity or the motivations of the perpetrators, but the area is known for the presence of Colombian armed groups.

On 1 July 2023, in San Pedro Sula, Cortes, armed individuals shot and injured a lawyer in Los Andes neighborhood. The lawyer's car had at least three shot holes in the front glass and two other holes in the passenger door. The reason for the killing is unknown. No fatalities.

On 1 July 2023, in Tegucigalpa, Francisco Morazan, two armed individuals shot a group of people in Juan Pablo II Boulevard. The attack could be related to a territorial dispute over the sale of drugs between an organized criminal group and independent vendors who used that place for the sale and distribution of drugs. 3 injured, 1 fatality.
On 1 July 2023, in Tegucigalpa, Francisco Morazan, armed men on a motorcycle shot and injured a taxi driver in colonia Villa Nueva (drive-by). The reason for the shooting is unknown. 1 wounded.

On 1 July 2023, in Panama City, Panama, people staged a protest outside the Legislative Assembly. The protest was carried out on the day of the opening of the sessions and protesters included labor groups, environmental activists, students, and civil society organizations. Demands included the end of mining contracts, better management of public funds, and medicines.

On 1 July 2023, in Panama City, Panama, more than 15,000 people staged a demonstration on occasion of Pride Month. Protesters demanded more rights for the LGBTI community, and in particular, for the approval of same-sex marriage.

On 1 July 2023, in El Caulote, Cuscatlan, there was an armed clash between at least one member of Barrio 18 Surenos and police officers. A gang member was killed. The officers were patrolling the area when the gang member turned up and opened fire for no apparent reason. 1 fatality.

source: El Mundo (El Salvador); La Prensa Grafica
notes: Property destruction: Around 1 July 2023 (as reported), off coast of San Luis La Herradura, La Paz, military forces seized more than one ton of cocaine that were transported in one low profile vessel (LPV) some 900 km from the coast at the height of the Jaltepeque Estuary. Three Mexican and three Ecuadoran men were arrested.

Around 1 July 2023 (as reported), in Mendoza (Capital), delivery workers protested to reject the initiatives to create a union around labor activity. The protesters point out that in the current conditions, they have greater freedoms.

On 1 July 2023, in Purmamarca (Tumbaya, Jujuy), protestors, mainly belonging to indigenous communities, blocked routes to reject the constitutional reform of the province. The collective action is part of a wave of mobilization that has lasted for weeks around this claim.

On 1 July 2023, in Tilcara (Jujuy), protestors, mainly belonging to indigenous communities, blocked routes to reject the constitutional reform of the province. The collective action is part of a wave of mobilization that has lasted for weeks around this claim.

On 1 July 2023, in San Salvador de Jujuy (Dr. Manuel Belgrano, Jujuy), teachers protested in front of the Ministry of Education headquarters in the province. The protest is part of a wave of mobilization against the provincial constitutional reform and teachers claims to ameliorate working conditions.

On 1 July 2023, in Abra Pampa (Cochinoca, Jujuy), students occupied secondary school facilities to reject the constitutional reform of the province. The collective action is part of a wave of mobilization that has lasted for weeks around this claim.

On 1 July 2023, in Laboulaye (Presidente Roque Saenz Pena, Cordoba), protesters, including family and friends of a missing teenager, marched to the Departmental Regional Unit Police Headquarters to demand actions to find the boy not seen since Thursday, and was later discovered to have been murdered.

On 1 July 2023, in Buenos Aires - Comuna 12 (Ciudad Autonoma de Buenos Aires), protesters from animal rights organizations protested to demand that the sale of pets be banned online. The collective action started from Parque Saavedra and culminated in the offices of a renowned online sales site.

On 1 July 2023, in Buenos Aires - Comuna 1 (Ciudad Autonoma de Buenos Aires), hundreds of protestors marched from the Rodolfo Walsh subway station to Moreno 1431 in commemoration of the Montoneros attack, which left 24 dead during the dictatorship. The protesters are demanding the name change of this station, which pays homage to the alleged perpetrator of the massacre, according to what they said. The march was organized by the Association of Lawyers for Justice and Harmony; the Association of Family and Friends of Victims of Terrorism in Argentina (Afavita) and the Cruz del Sur Study Center.

On 1 July 2023, in Trelew (Rawson, Chubut), members of the LGBTIQ+ collective marched from the Welsh Woman's monument against trans femicides and trans homicides. The protesters also demanded more rights and access to health, housing, and education.

On 1 July 2023, in Comodoro Rivadavia (Escalante, Chubut), teachers organized in Atech (Chubut Education Workers Association) Regional Sur, and educational community members marched with torches from Avenida Alsina and San Martin to the city center to demand better education and working conditions for teachers.

On 1 July 2023, in Bahia Blanca (Buenos Aires), parents, teachers, and students protested in Plaza Rivadavia to demand continuity of classes in the context of widespread teacher strikes. The protesters demand equality in the pace of teaching between public and private schools, and more cleaning in the school infrastructure.

source: El Diario De La Pampa; Indymedia Argentina
notes: On 1 July 2023, in Humahuaca (Jujuy), demonstrators protested to demand from the local Deliberative Council a declaration of rejection of the constitutional reform, restrictive of mobilization. When the councilors left the municipality, they were booed by the protesters. The Police intervened with rubber bullets and tear gas, leaving at least four injured, particularly a protester who lost his eye. Some participants were detained.

On 1 July 2023, in La Paz (La Paz), administrative workers of the Oil Health Fund (CPS) staged a demonstration outside the main CPS hospital in Obrajes sector to demand the resignation of three authorities of the institution that are carrying out what they say is poor administration.

On 1 July 2023, in Cochabamba (Cochabamba), LGBTQ+ residents marched through the city as a demonstration to demand respect for their rights, to promote inclusion and to make visible gender identity. This demonstration was held as commemoration of the International Pride Day.

On 1 July 2023, in Santa Cruz de la Sierra (Santa Cruz), hemodialysis patients of CHMA health center and their family members blocked the road in front of the center as a demonstration to demand payment from the Health Ministry to all of these health institutions, which have been pending for more than six months.

On 1 July 2023, in Porto Velho (Rondonia), two men were shot and killed in the Planalto neighborhood by armed individuals, in the context of rivalries between organized criminal groups. One suspect was detained on 3 July 2023. 2 fatalities.
On 1 July 2023, in Santana do Ipanema (Alagoas) a man was killed in a drive-by shooting by two individuals on a motorcycle. Identity of perpetrators and motivations are unknown. 1 fatality.

On 1 July 2023, in Sao Paulo - South Zone (Sao Paulo), three armed suspects killed an application driver outside his home. The victim was shot by more than 20 shots and the event was described as an execution. 1 fatality.

On 1 July 2023, in El Bordo (Cauca), unidentified armed individuals on a motorcycle (drive-by shooting), shot and killed a homeless man in the main square. On 1 July 2023, in El Bordo (Cauca), unidentified armed individuals shot and killed two men and injured another in the Postobon Bajo neighborhood. There is no further information on the motives and perpetrators of the attack but the area is known for the presence of armed groups. 2 fatalities.

On 1 July 2023, in El Cairo (Cauca), a group of farmers blocked the Pan-American highway to protest against Smurfit Kappa paper-based packing company due to environmental effects that the company's operation in the area is causing on water sources and crops.

On 1 July 2023, in La Maria (Cauca), a group of Misak Indigenous people blocked the Pan-American highway to protest against the assembly that the Regional Indigenous Council of Cauca (CRIC) planned to carry out in the following days in La Maria.

On 1 July 2023, in El Gallinero (Valle del Cauca), a group of protesters blocked the Buga - Buenaventura highway. There is no further information on the reasons behind the protest. Police officers were present but did not intervene.

On 1 July 2023, in Guayaquil (Guayas), thousands of LGBTQ+ residents marched through the center of the city as a demonstration to demand respect for their rights, to promote inclusion and to make visible gender identity. This demonstration was held as commemoration of the International Pride Day.

notes: On 1 July 2023, in Asuncion (Asuncion), thousands of protesters marched through the city center with local diplomats, including the ambassadors of Chile, the U.S., and the U.K., and politicians (unspecified), to demonstrate in the context of LGBTQ+ Pride Day and demand rights, freedom, and respect for the community. The march, which departed from Libertad Square to the surrounding streets, was organized by Panambi, Somosgay y Gaylatino.

On 1 July 2023, in Lima - Lima District (Lima), hundreds of LGBTQ+ residents and supporters marched through the center of the city to Alameda square as a demonstration to demand respect for their rights, to promote inclusion and to make visible gender identity. This demonstration was held as commemoration of the International Pride Day.

source: Diario Version Final (Venezuela); El Cooperante; El Pitazo; La Patilla; Noticia al Minuto
notes: On 1 July 2023, in Maracaibo (Zulia), a member of the El Mauricio Gang shot and killed two workers, during an attack outside the Centro Ferretero La 3 hardware store, in the Circunvalacion 3 Avenue. Two gang members arrived at the premises on a motorcycle, one dismounted and opened fire on the two men, who were loading a truck with cement sacks, and then they drove away. The victims were employees of a business customer of the hardware store; one of them died at the scene, the other one shortly after admission in hospital. The perpetrators were arrested in a nearby location following a police chase, one of them was a teenage boy. The Centro Ferretero La 3 hardware store had received extortion threats from the El Mauricio Gang in the weeks prior, and had been already attacked overnight on June 1 (coded separately). 2 fatalities.

On 1 July 2023, near Churuguara (Falcon), CICPC police forces clashed with members of the El Pelon Gang, during an armed confrontation in the Las Dos Quebradas de San Pablo rural sector. A police officer was injured. There is no further information at this point in time.

source: Efecto Cocuyo; El Carabobeno; El Impulso; La Patilla
notes: Property destruction: Around 1 July 2023 (as reported), in Jesus Maria Semprun municipality (coded to Casigua El Cubo), military forces discovered and destroyed an aircraft thought to belong to unidentified criminal groups linked to drug trafficking, on a makeshift airstrip in an area close to the border with Colombia.

source: 800 Noticias; Caraota Digital; Diario 2001; Diario Version Final (Venezuela)
notes: On 1 July 2023, in Maracaibo (Zulia), a grenade was hurled at the roof of a house, in the Los Robles neighborhood, Luis Hurtado Higuera parish. Its detonation killed an elderly woman who lived on the premises, and extensive property damage. There is no information on the identity or motivations of the attackers. 1 fatality.

On 1 July 2023, in Cabudare (Lara), a group of residents of the Dona Barbara sector, in the Colinas del Sur neighborhood, protested over water outages going on for at least 30 years, according to the protesters. These problems affect 198 families.

On 1 July 2023, in Barbacoas municipality (Narino), there was an armed clash between unidentified armed groups in the Nunalbi Alto Ulbi Indigenous Reserve. As a result, an Awa Indigenous man who was caught in the clash was killed, and a second person was injured and taken to hospital. As a result, 95 people were forcibly displaced. 1 fatality.

On 30 June 2023, in El Carmen, La Paz, dozens of truck drivers carrying rocks and sand staged a protest at the height of the KM 38 of the Litoral road. Demonstrators protested against the fines imposed by the municipality of San Luis Talpa to those who extract sand from the local rivers. Police arrived in site and arrested two truck drivers.

On 30 June 2023, in La Plata - Los Hornos (Buenos Aires), students and parents at a school number 72 blocked a road with barricades and setting tires on fire to demonstrate against infrastructure problems at the institution and against the lack of stoves and natural gas service. A driver had a discussion with the demonstrators and run over the barricades, however, he did not run over any demonstrators. Police forces were present but did not intervene.

Around 30 June 2023 (as reported), in Comodoro Rivadavia (Chubut), parents at the 707 Technical School protested outside the premises of the institution in the Ciudad Yapeyu sector against infrastructure problems at the school and the lack of solutions from authorities. They also protested against the lack of technical classes and workshops for some students.

On 30 June 2023, in Estanislao del Campo (Formosa), members of an Indigenous group who were supporters of an independent candidate for mayor blocked National Route 81 to protest against the results of the local elections after the candidate they supported lost by seven votes.

On 30 June 2023, in San Salvador de Jujuy (Jujuy), a multitude of state workers, social and human rights organizations and Indigenous people marched to the governor's office to repudiate the approval of the constitutional reform that places restrictions on the right to protest. A separate protest occurred later that day called by UCR political leaders against the national demonstrations and calling for peace (coded separately).

On 30 June 2023, in Oruro (Oruro), residents and merchants of Junin street blocked the access to the street as a demonstration to voice their grievance about the attempt of moving the merchant booths to Adolfo Mier street.

On 30 June 2023, in Santa Cruz de la Sierra (Santa Cruz), parents and family members of victims of sexual abuse staged a demonstration on 24 de Septiembre square and outside the State Attorney offices to repudiate the cases of abuse that have been registered, and to demand not to normalize cases of abuse on underage residents and calling for justice in the cases.

On 30 June 2023, in Santa Fe (Santa Cruz), for the third consecutive day, residents blocked the Santa Cruz - Cochabamba highway as a demonstration to demand the judges and state attorneys that released a man be suspended. The man had confessed to being guilty of killing a boy days prior.

On 30 June 2023, in Aracaju (Sergipe), a non-specified number of locals from the Sao Jose neighborhood carried out a demonstration by blocking the Naufragos highway with tires set on fire to demand the construction of a sewage system in their neighborhoods and denouncing the different problems that they are facing due to the lack of a proper sanitation system in the region.

On 30 June 2023, in Brasilia (Distrito Federal), nurses and other health technicians carried out a march to demand the enforcement of a bill which granted health workers a national minimum wage.
