A pamphlet was found at the scene in which the Mapuche Malleco Resistance (RMM) took responsibility for the attack and demanded freedom for the Mapuche prisoners.

On 29 June 2023, in Santiago - Estacion Central (Metropolitana), a group of supporters of a soccer club attacked delivery men and damaged their motorcycles and helmets on Alameda street at General Velasquez street. Workers had foreign nationality.

On 29 June 2023, in Copiapo (Atacama), parents and students' representatives gathered outside of the Local Public Education Service (SLEP) against infrastructure problems in the Alejandro Rivera Commercial school. Protesters stated that students have had to go to another educational facility, the Mercedes Fritis school due to the problems in their school. Protesters delivered a petition letter to the authorities.

On 29 June 2023, in San Antonio (Valparaiso), retired teachers gathered at Barrancas square in front of the Presidential Delegation building demanding the payment of the historical debt. The debt comes from 1982 when teachers were not included in a salary increase that all public employees in the country received.

On 29 June 2023, in Santiago - Los Cerrillos (Metropolitana), residents erected incendiary barricades on Avenida Lo Errazuriz against the lack of electric supply in the area. Demonstrators stated that the lack of light increased the insecurity rates in the neighborhood, including a double homicide near the municipal park the night before. Residents demanded greater security measures, police presence and electric supply.

On 29 June 2023, in Puerto Colombia (Atlantico), armed individuals broke into a house in Villa Campestre and opened fire on the people on the premises, killing three of them, and injuring a fourth. All four victims were family members. Authorities claimed the incident was committed by Tren de Aragua members and is related to retaliations between local gangs the Tren de Aragua operating in the city. The group left behind a grenade and rifles. 3 fatalities.

On 29 June 2023, in Cartagena (Bolivar), a group of people and members of a labor union protested against delays and non-compliance in the delivery of a housing project. The group demanded the intervention of local authorities to resolve their situation.

actor2: FARC Dissident - Carlos Patino Front: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia Dissident Faction (Carlos Patino Front)
notes: Around 29 June 2023 (as reported), in the rural area of Balboa municipality (Cauca), military forces clashed with militants of the FARC Carlos Patino dissidence. In subsequent searches, security forces found and destroyed several trenches in La Bermeja area that belonged to this armed group and were used to attack the soldiers. There were no fatalities.

Around 29 June 2023 (as reported), in the rural area of Cucuta municipality (Norte de Santander), residents of the veredas of Buena Esperanza, Agua Clara, Puerto Villamizar, Guaramito, San Faustino, Palmarito and Banco de Agua protested by blocking the Cucuta - Puerto Santander highway to demand improvements in road infrastructure in the area.

actor2: Police Forces of Colombia (2022-) UNDMO: National Unit for Dialogue and Maintenance of Order
notes: On 29 June 2023, in Bucaramanga (Santander), demonstrators and UNDMO agents clashed as the community demonstrated against the demolition of a bridge linking two municipalities. The mayor announced the destruction of the bridge due to risk of collapse, but the rioters claimed that it will affect the mobility of more than 5,000 people.

On 29 June 2023, in La Mana (Cotopaxi), residents captured and beat up a man that was known as an extortionist in the sector, and who had threatened to kill a local shop owner that refused to pay. There were no fatalities.
On 29 June 2023, in Guayaquil (Guayas), residents of Suburbio sector captured, tied up and beat up a man that allegedly robbed rearside mirrors of cars.

On 29 June 2023, in Santo Domingo de los Colorados (Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas), residents captured and beat up two men that had attempted to rob a local business. The residents cut them with broken glass. Police officers took the two men to a hospital.

On 29 June 2023, in Caazapa (Caazapa), a group of people, including retired workers, insured by the Social Security Institute (IPS) protested outside the premises of the institution in Caazapa against the lack of equipment and poor infrastructure conditions at a new healthcare center. They demanded the hiring of more medical personnel and specialists. They also denounced irregularities in the construction of the new hospital.

On 29 June 2023, in Cusco (Cusco), family members of a young man that was killed and found dismembered staged a demonstration outside the Superior Court offices to demand authorities a faster investigation, the maximum sentence to the responsible, and to find the whole body, as only parts have been found.

On 29 June 2023, in Sapallanga (Junin), family members of a taxi cab driver that was injured in a car accident caused by the former mayor, blocked the main highway of the city to demand the former mayor be responsible for paying the medical expenses of the man and the two passengers injured in the accident.

On 29 June 2023, in Lima - Lima District (Lima), hundreds of students and teachers of the Fine Arts National School, The Jose Maria Arguedas Folklore National School, the Dramatic Arts National School and the National Ballet School, staged a demonstration outside the Congress and Economy and Finance Ministry offices to voice their grievances about the budget cuts for the next two years to their schools.

On 29 June 2023, in Barcelona (Anzoategui), for the fourth consecutive day, a group of health workers of the Luis Razetti Hospital protested to demand the liberation of a colleague arrested under accusations of stealing medicines from the hospital. The protesters argue that the hospital has not had that sort of medicines in at least three months, and that the medication found on the worker belonged to him. The protest was staged inside the Luis Razetti Hospital.

On 29 June 2023, in Valencia (Carabobo), a group of demonstrators, including swimming coaches, athletes, and residents, protested to demand the reopening of the La Isabelica swimming pool complex, closed down at the beginning of the coronavirus pandemic.

On 29 June 2023, in Caracas - Libertador (Distrito Capital), a group of state workers and unionists protested to demand the liberation of the two unionists arrested recently for leading the protests at the Pellas plant (Bolivar) (coded separately). The demonstration was staged outside the Public Ministry Office.

source: El Carabobeno; El Nacional (Venezuela); La Voz
notes: On 29 June 2023, in Caracas - Libertador (Distrito Capital), a group of demonstrators, including fishers, and tourism sector workers, protested against the construction of a road in the Morrocoy National Park (Falcon). The protesters argue that the building of this infrastructure breaches environmental regulations, depletes the flora of the area, and pollutes the national park. The protesters demand the halting of the construction works. They gathered by the Public Ministry Office, where they handed in a letter with their demands.

Around 29 June 2023 (as reported), in Punto Fijo (Falcon), a group of drivers blocked the Luis Beltran Prieto Figueroa Avenue in protest over fuel shortages. The protesters had been queuing for several hours to refuel at the Brisas de Paraguana petrol station, but the tanker truck that was meant to supply the petrol station that day did not arrive.

On 29 June 2023, in Camoruco (Lara), a group of residents of Quebrada Arriba, in El Blanco parish, protested against the power and water outages going on for several weeks, and to demand the repair of the village's ambulance. The protesters blocked the Troncal 17 road in the Puricaure sector.

On 29 June 2023, in Merida (Merida), a group of demonstrators, including teachers, university workers, and unionists, staged a pot-banging protest to demand better pay and working conditions. The protesters gathered by the Merida state Education Zone Office.
On 29 June 2023, in Tovar (Merida), a group of teachers protested and staged a prayer to demand better pay and working conditions. The Merida auxiliary bishop was present.

source: Diario de Los Andes; La Patilla
notes: On 29 June 2023, in San Cristobal (Tachira), hundreds of demonstrators, including public transport workers, taxi drivers, and merchants, staged a motorcade around the city in protest against the recent decision of the government of allowing interurban coaches operate from the San Antonio del Tachira bus station, without stopping at the San Cristobal bus station, leaving the latter without travelers. Taxi drivers and merchants of the San Cristobal bus station are also affected by the lack of customers. The demonstrators also protested outside the Tachira state Governor's Residence, and by the San Cristobal townhall, where they handed in a letter with their demands. Anti-riot police forces were present but there was no intervention.

source: Noticia al Minuto; Somos Noticias COL
notes: Around 29 June 2023 (as reported), in Cabimas municipality (Zulia), a group of families that have been waiting 12 years for the completion of the El Barroso apartment building, protested after the announcement by the regional authorities that only a selected number of those families would be allocated a flat. The construction works of that building have almost been completed.

Around 29 June 2023 (as reported), in Bachaquero (Zulia), a group of cancer and renal patients, and their relatives, protested to demand subsidized fuel. The demonstrators claim that they cannot afford transporting their relatives to the different hospitals where they receive their treatments at unsubsidized prices.

notes: On 29 June 2023, in Cayenne, Cayenne, overnight, at least 20 people, including armed individuals, held a demonstration to decry the killing of a young man by the police in Metropolitan France. During the mobilization, rioters set up barricades of burning debris in Mont-Lucas, Crique, and several other neighborhoods. Police forces intervened using tear gas to disperse the rioters, who threw stones against the officers. A man who was not taking part in the demonstration was shot and killed by a stray bullet fired by the rioters. He was on the terrace of his apartment. He was said to be a government worker. Some drivers were robbed. Police arrested several people. 1 fatality.

On 29 June 2023, in Salvador - Barra/Pituba (Bahia), two rival drug trafficking gangs engaged in a shootout at the Alto das Pombas neighborhood. The clash was caused by a territory dispute between the CV, who controls Alto das Pombas, and BDM, who controls the neighboring Calabar. One person was shot and killed and four others were injured. 1 fatality.

On 29 June 2023, in Macapa (Amapa), a man was shot and killed by three armed individuals. One suspect was arrested on 5 July 2023 and admitted he had planned to rob the victim to pay a drug debt. The suspect also had a police record for drug trafficking and was a fugitive from the penitentiary system. 1 fatality.
Around 29 June 2023, in Duque de Caxias (Rio de Janeiro), a couple were killed, and their bodies were found in the Campos Eliseos neighborhood. The woman was a long-term drug user. 2 fatalities.

actor1: Police Forces of Brazil (2023-) Civil Police

On 29 June 2023, in Porto Velho (Rondonia), a man was shot and injured in the Cristal da Calama housing complex by an armed individual, in the context of rivalries between organized criminal groups. The suspect was detained on 3 July 2023. There were no fatalities.

Authorities said that the clashes are related to territorial disputes between the groups. 1 fatality split over 3 days.

On 29 June 2023, in Miranda (Cauca), unidentified armed individuals on a motorcycle (drive-by shooting) shot and killed two men at the main square of the municipal seat. The victims were taken to the hospital but both died before arriving. There is no further information on the motives and perpetrators of the attack but there is presence of several armed groups, in the area. 2 fatalities.

notes: On 29 June 2023, in Bajo Sicue (Bolivar), a woman member of a Council of Communal Action (JAC), was shot dead by unknown perpetrators. The body was found on 30 June with the hands tied, a gunshot wound in the head and signs of being strangled or being hanged. Forensic doctors determined that the victim was killed on the 29th. There is no further information on the motives and perpetrators of the attack but there is presence of a FARC dissident group in the area. 1 fatality.
tags: women targeted: activists/human rights defenders/social leaders

notes: Around 29 June 2023 (as reported), in Guarulhos (Sao Paulo), the body of the leader of the Red Command Manaus faction was found buried in a clandestine grave. On 29 June 2023, in Betoyes (Arauca), unidentified armed individuals on a motorcycle opened fire against the local police station. There is presence of the ELN and FARC dissidents in the area. There were no casualties.

assoc_actor_2: PSUV: United Socialist Party of Venezuela
notes: On 29 June 2023, in La Paragua (Bolivar), two unidentified crime group suspects attempted to shoot and kill the local leader of the PSUV political party, his wife, and two daughters, outside their house in the San Pedro sector. The victims were opening their garage door when they were intercepted by the two armed individuals. The wife of the PSUV leader, still inside their private car, reversed the vehicle and hit the attackers, enabling her husband to escape and seek help. The suspects managed to escape. On 8 July 2023, several unidentified crime group suspects shot and killed the main target of this assassination attempt, the local PSUV leader, during another attack inside his house (coded separately). There were no casualties.

On 28 June 2023, in Pacayas, Alvarado, for the third consecutive day, a group of students and parents of schoolchildren staged a protest for the appointment of a new headmaster and closed the access to the school facilities. Protesters demanded that the Ministry of Education remove her and appoint a new one, as they argued that the current one is not valid.

On 28 June 2023, in San Pablo, San Jose, a group of school parents from a local school staged a protest against the school's administrative staff for their alleged lack of action in a case that involves a minor harassing her classmates. Protesters demanded that the minor who harasses her classmates received psychological help.

On 28 June 2023, in Las Mercedes, Quetzaltenango, people staged a protest at the height of KM 219 on the RD-QUE-03. Protesters denounced that the elections carried out on 25 June 2023 were fraudulent.
On 28 June 2023, in El Asintal, Retalhuleu, people staged a demonstration against the results of the elections and blocked the CA-2 West at the height of KM 190.
On 28 June 2023, in Cuyotenango, Suchitepequez, people staged a demonstration against the results of the elections and blocked the CA-2 West at the height of KM 168.

On 28 June 2023, in Santa Rosa de Copan, Copan, unidentified individuals in a vehicle shot and killed a man while he was driving (drive-by). The armed men chased the victim who crashed with another vehicle, leaving two people injured. The victim had been previously arrested last week for illegal possession of weapons, but was released by the authorities. 1 fatality.

On 28 June 2023, near Corinto, Omoa, three people were killed in the border between Guatemala and Honduras. Their death seems to be related to territory disputes between criminal groups for the control of smuggling routes. 3 fatalities

On 28 June 2023, in San Pedro Sula, Cortes, an armed individual shot a lawyer in the courthouse parking lot. The gunman failed and was captured together with other two suspects. According to the lawyer, the criminal act is due to some cases that he has won. No fatalities.

On 28 June 2023, in Tegucigalpa, Francisco Morazan, a group of supporters of the Liberty and Refoundation Party (LIBRE) demonstrated demanding the dismissal of several ministers including Health, Social Investment, and Infrastructure in front of the Health Secretary in Tegucigalpa.
On 28 June 2023, in Changuinola, Bocas de Toro, for the second day, people staged a protest by blocking access to the city after police evicted people in the Finca 4 district (coded separately).
On 28 June 2023, in Pedasi, Los Santos, students and teachers from a local school and local residents staged a protest to demand that authorities reconnect the water service in the area.

On 28 June 2023, in Mariato, Veraguas, students, teachers and school parents staged a protest on the road from Mariato to Santiago to demand that authorities solve the poor state of the campus and the completion of the work that should have been delivered several years ago.

On 28 June 2023, in Rosario (Santa Fe), transgender men and non-binary people marched from the Cordoba and San Martin Avenues to repudiate the killing of members of the LGBTQ+ community and to demand justice for the victims. On 28 June 2023, in El Alto (La Paz), members of more than 40 social organizations blocked the La Paz - El Alto highway as a demonstration against the mayor for the lack of impactful works, issues with trash collection and the raise of public transport fare.

On 28 June 2023, in La Paz (La Paz), LGBTQ+ residents marched through the city as a demonstration to demand respect for their rights. This demonstration was held as commemoration of the International Pride Day.

On 28 June 2023, in La Guardia (Santa Cruz), residents of Cumbre de las Americas neighborhood captured two men that had been robbing a house. They tied them to a post, and burned down their motorcycle. They later turned them to the police.

The identity of perpetrators is unknown but Indigenous Militias are often responsible for similar attacks in the Araucania region. There were no fatalities.

On 28 June 2023, in Concepcion (Biobio), members of the LGBTQ+ community gathered at Peru square and marched through Lincoyan street towards Los Carrera avenue in the 2023 Pride March. Protesters marched under several gender-based slogans.

On 28 June 2023, in Santiago - Lo Espejo (Metropolitana), a group of unionized public officials with FETRAMUCH interrupted with fists and blows a session of the Municipal Council and demanded the exit of a councilor for suspected physical assault against a co-worker. The group also rebuked the mayor for holding a session with a member of the Municipal Council with an open investigation.

On 28 June 2023, in Temuco (Araucania), women members of the Feminist Network of La Araucania gathered outside of the Seremi de la Mujer in protest against the public appearances of the mayor of Cunco who has an investigation for suspected sexual abuse. Protesters stated that public officials who have judicial processes related to situations of sexual harassment and abuse, should not participate in public events and activities.

On 28 June 2023, in San Antonio (Valparaiso), relatives of a man found dead last November in his house protested at the prosecutor's office demanding celerity in the case. The man was found tied to a cabin and with several stab wounds. Relatives believe that his wife is the suspected murderer. Protesters stated that they want justice and arrived at the office with banners and drums.

Other: On 28 June 2023, in the rural area of Las Auras corregimiento (Antioquia), dozens of farmers verbally harassed a group of two platoons of 70 soldiers and forced them to leave the area of La Velez where they were conducting operations. Subsequent investigations indicated that the farmers were forced by FARC 36th Front dissidents operating in the area to expel the members of the security forces.

assoc_actor_2: Former FARC: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia
notes: Around 28 June 2023 (as reported), in Flor Amarillo (Arauca), unidentified armed individuals shot and killed a former FARC member. The men forced the victim out of his house and subsequently shot him to death. Although the perpetrators have not been confirmed, the area is known for the presence of armed groups. 1 fatality.
On 28 June 2023, in Barranquilla (Atlantico), citizens and members of the LGBTQ+ community gathered for the Pride parade to call for the rights of LGBTQ+ people.
On 28 June 2023, in Bogota - La Candelaria (Bogota, D.C.), citizens protested near 12th and 13th streets. There is no further information on this event.

On 28 June 2023, in Cartagena (Bolivar), teachers protested for the second consecutive day delays in the payment of their wages. The group gathered near the municipality and urged authorities to pay the debt.

On 28 June 2023, in Cartagena (Bolivar), people with disabilities protested against the lack of enforcement of the law that regulates the inclusion of people with disabilities in work and school environments and general infrastructure.

On 28 June 2023, in the rural area of Balboa municipality (Cauca), military forces clashed with members of an unidentified armed group for the third consecutive day. There is no further information on this event. Casualties unknown.

On 28 June 2023, in Popayan (Cauca), unidentified individuals threw a grenade at members of the police forces after the latter requested them to stop to conduct a search. Two officers were injured by the blast. Although the perpetrators have not been confirmed, the area is known for the presence of armed groups. There were no fatalities.

On 28 June 2023, in the rural area of Suarez municipality (Cauca), an unidentified armed group attacked a group of policemen at a checkpoint. The perpetrators opened fire from a nearby wooded area. Although the perpetrators have not been confirmed, the area is known for the presence of armed groups. There were no fatalities.

On 28 June 2023, in Valledupar (Cesar), traders and food and beverage vendors of the Balneario blocked the road to protest because they are not allowed to do their work due to the civil works that are being carried out in the area.

On 28 June 2023, in Lloro (Choco), unidentified armed individuals on a motorcycle threw a grenade at a police station. Although the perpetrators have not been confirmed, the area is known for the presence of armed groups. There were no fatalities or injuries.

source: El Colombiano; El Heraldo (Colombia); RCN Radio
notes: Around 28 June 2023 (as reported), in Playa De Oro (Choco), riots broke out when police carried out an operation against illegal mining. Miners and police clashed after the former accused the officers of setting fire to between 5 and 7 heavy machines used by the workers. The rioters held 22 to 23 officers involved in the operation captive for several hours.

Property destruction: On 28 June 2023, in the rural area of Chinu municipality (Cordoba), six unidentified armed individuals set fire to machinery used for road repairs on the road towards El Volante. The perpetrators arrived at the place on a motorcycle, threatened the workers and then burned the machinery. Authorities reported that members of the Gulf Clan have been visiting the area, but their involvement in the incident has not been confirmed. The area is known for the presence of ELN and Gulf Clan members.
On 28 June 2023, in Bucaramanga (Santander), citizens and members of the LGBTQ+ community gathered for the Pride parade to demand the rights of LGBTQ+ people.
On 28 June 2023, in Sincelejo (Sucre), residents of the Sierra Flor neighborhood blocked a bridge in the town to protest because the passing of heavy vehicles in the area is damaging the structure.
On 28 June 2023, in Ibague (Tolima), citizens and members of the LGBTQ+ community gathered for the Pride parade to demand the rights of LGBTQ+ people.
On 28 June 2023, in Ambato (Tungurahua), residents of Augusto N. Martinez parish captured and beat up a man that had been robbing a house. The man was later turned to the police.

On 28 June 2023, in Asuncion (Asuncion), nursing and ob-gyn professors at the Asuncion National University protested in front of the principal's office to demand a raise in salaries according to inflation rates.

On 28 June 2023, in Yanac (Ancash), dozens of parents of students of El Salitre school staged a demonstration by taking control of the school campus to demand the destitution of the dean due to poor management of the institution and lack of accountability.

On 28 June 2023, in Buenos Aires (Ancash), leaders of the Casuarinas Urbanization staged a demonstration outside the police station to demand the capture of alleged robbers that go around their sector on motorcycles.

On 28 June 2023, in Arequipa (Arequipa), a group of residents attacked workers of the Superintendence of Ground Transportation of People, Cargo and Goods (SUTRAN) that were carrying out a contraband control in La Joya del Sur SAC bus terminal in Jose Luis Bustamante y Rivero district, after they found unauthorized boarding and unboarding of different busses. The workers were injured.

On 28 June 2023, in Huancayo (Junin), residents of Jose Galvez neighborhood of Chilca district captured, stripped of his clothes and beat up a man that was accused of robbing a cellphone. Local police officers (Serenos) later took the man.

On 28 June 2023, in Lima - Lima District (Lima), dozens of students, deans, teachers, former students and teachers, and academic advisors of La Molina Agrarian National University (UNALM) and Mayor San Marcos National University (UNMSM) staged a demonstration outside the Congress offices to repudiate the law project 4828/2022 that allows the Jauja National University to be established in their universities' campus.

On 28 June 2023, in Punchana (Loreto), residents of Nuevo Bellavista, San Pedro and San Pablo human settlements staged a demonstration beside the pedestrian bridge to demand that the construction company to hire the residents as workers of the project.

On 28 June 2023, in Iquitos (Loreto), LGBTQ+ residents, their family and friends marched from 28 de Julio square through the city as a demonstration to demand respect for their rights. This demonstration was held as commemoration of the International Pride Day.

On 28 June 2023, in Sullana (Piura), a group of fumigators and workers of the dengue campaign staged a demonstration outside the Luciano Castillo Colonna Health Center to demand payment of their wages owed for more than two months.

On 28 June 2023, in Barcelona (Anzoategui), for the third consecutive day, a group of health workers of the Luis Razetti Hospital protested to demand the liberation of a colleague arrested under accusations of stealing medicines from the hospital. The protesters argue that the hospital has not had that sort of medicines in at least three months, and that the medication found on the worker belonged to him. The demonstration was staged outside the Barcelona Palace of Justice.

On 28 June 2023, in Ciudad Guayana (Bolivar), a group of demonstrators, including workers at the state-owned SIDOR steelmaker company, unionists, and relatives of the two unionists arrested on 11 June for leading the protests at the Pellas plant (Bolivar) (coded separately), protested to demand their liberation. The demonstrators gathered outside the CVG headquarters.

On 28 June 2023, in Mariara (Carabobo), Carabobo state police shot and killed an unidentified crime group suspect, during an armed confrontation in the La Fajina sector. The suspect resisted authority and initiated the shooting. He was injured in the gunfire and pronounced dead in hospital. Police collected a gun and an IED in his possession. 1 fatality.

On 28 June 2023, in Caracas - Libertador (Distrito Capital), CICPC police forces shot and killed a member of the El Neiker Junquito Gang, during an armed confrontation in the Los Rosales sector, Santa Rosalia parish. The suspect resisted authority and initiated the shooting. He was injured in the gunfire and pronounced dead in hospital. The deceased had a criminal record for vehicle thefts. Police collected a gun. 1 fatality.

On 28 June 2023, in Merida (Merida), a group of demonstrators, including LGBTQ+ activists, and residents, took to the streets to demand respect and tolerance. The march took place on International LGBTQ+ Pride Day.

On 28 June 2023, in San Cristobal (Tachira), a group of demonstrators, including public transport workers and merchants, protested against the recent decision of the government of allowing interurban coaches operate from the San Antonio del Tachira bus station, without stopping at the San Cristobal bus station, leaving the latter without travelers.

actor1: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
notes: On 28 June 2023, in Feira de Santana (Bahia), military police engaged in a shootout with three men after they fled an approach in the Campo Limpo neighborhood. The individuals were found with approximately 1 kg of marijuana. 3 fatalities.

actor1: Police Forces of Brazil (2023-) Federal Police
notes: Property destruction: On 28 June 2023, in Cupira (Pernambuco), thousands of smuggled cigarette packs were seized by the federal police. Sources differ on the exact amount of merchandise apprehended. A man was arrested.

assoc_actor_1: Military Forces of Venezuela (1999-) GNB: Venezuelan National Guard
source: Cactus 24; La Verdad de Vargas; Noticia al Minuto
notes: Around 28 June 2023 (as reported), in San Francisco (Zulia), a joint unit of CICPC police and GNB military forces shot and killed two members of the El Jose Leonardo Gang, during an armed confrontation in the Ciudad del Sol neighborhood. The suspects initiated the shooting and were killed in the gunfire. Police collected two guns and an extortion letter signed by the Jose Leonardo Gang. 2 fatalities.

assoc_actor_1: Teachers (Venezuela); FVM: Venezuelan Federation of Teachers
notes: On 28 June 2023, in San Jose de Barlovento (Miranda), a group of teachers, and FVM representatives, summoned by the Miranda state branch of the Venezuelan Teachers' Union (Sinvema Miranda), gathered to demand better pay and working conditions, the implementation of medical and burial insurance plans, the renewal of their collective labor agreement, and an improvement in the national educational system.

On 28 June 2023, in Altamira (Para), a man was shot and killed and a woman was injured in the Vista Alegre neighborhood by two members of a drug trafficking group who invaded their private residence. Attack motivation is unknown. 1 fatality.

Around 28 June 2023 (week of), in Macapa (Amapa), a man was injured in a drive-by shooting in the Marabaixo II neighborhood by armed individuals in a car. The victim is a drug user, which is why police believe the attack was carried out by drug traffickers. The victim was killed in a second attack on 12 July 2023 (coded separately).There were no fatalities.

On 27 June 2023, in Pacayas, Alvarado, for the second consecutive day, a group of students and parents of schoolchildren staged a protest for the appointment of a new headmaster and closed the access to the school facilities. Protesters demanded that the Ministry of Education remove her and appoint a new one, as they argued that the current one is not valid.

assoc_actor_1: CREO: Commitment, Renovation, and Order Party
notes: On 27 June 2023, in Guatemala City, 300 people, including supporters of the Creo political party, staged a protest at the facilities of the Supreme Electoral Tribunal in zone 1. The protesters argued that the municipal elections were fraudulent and demanded that the authorities conduct a public vote count; or to carry out the municipal election again in the second presidential round.

On 27 June 2023, in Palencia, Guatemala, people staged a demonstration against the results of the municipal elections, arguing that it was a fraudulent election. Police officers intervened to disperse the demonstrators, who were causing disturbances and threw tear gas on them.

On 27 June 2023, in Santa Cruz Mulua, Retalhuleu, residents of San Andres Villa Seca and Santa Cruz Mulua staged a demonstration by blocking the CA-2 at KM 178.5. The people were demonstrating against the results of the municipal elections, claiming that they were fraudulent. Police officers were deployed to the area to disperse the demonstrators and threw tear gas at them, injuring four people. Moments later, the demonstrators returned, leading to clashes between security forces and rioters. One of the sources indicated that a girl was killed, but the information was not confirmed. 4 injured.

On 27 June 2023, in El Carrizo, Choluteca, farmers of the area demonstrated against a company developing an agroindustrial project, they blocked the road using logs, stones and flags. They said they had been forced to buy equipment that the company did not use and now demand the job they were promised.

On 27 June 2023, in Tegucigalpa, Francisco Morazan, residents of Las Crucitas neighborhood demonstrated against an eviction court order. The Mayor's office said that it will be setting up a shelter for the more than 60 people who have been evicted.

source: Al Dia; Critica (Panama); Dia a Dia; GardaWorld; La Estrella de Panama (Panama)
notes: On 27 June 2023, in Changuinola, Bocas de Toro, rioters clashed with police officers who arrived in the area to evict 200 people who were trespassing on private property in the Finca 4 district. Rioters also threw rocks at police cars and an ambulance, and Molotov bombs at police. During the riots, rioters continued to block the road and the Torres Bridge. 19 people were arrested. 9 people were injured, including 5 police officers.

On 27 June 2023, in San Salvador, members of the Communities of Faith Organized in Action (COFOA) demonstrated outside the Legislative Assembly building to demand the approval of a new law regulating land subdivision.
Around 27 June 2023 (as reported), in Metalio, Sonsonate, a man was killed and his dismembered body was found inside a bag near the Cauta River. No more detail is provided by the source. 1 fatality.

On 27 June 2023, in Fiambala (Catamarca), a group of people blocked an access road to the city to demand to the government to award them the property of the lands they live in so that they can develop tourism and agriculture projects. They also repudiate that the government favors big corporations for the awarding of land property instead of local residents.

On 27 June 2023, in Abra Pampa (Jujuy), teachers and public and private workers blocked the highway to repudiate the approval of a constitutional reform that places restrictions on the right to protest and to repudiate the repression by police officers against demonstrators around the provincial legislature on 20 June (coded separately).

On 27 June 2023, in San Salvador de Jujuy (Jujuy), hundreds of teachers associated with the Provincial Teachers Association (ADEP), public and private workers, labor unions, social organizations and members of Indigenous communities marched to the governor's office to repudiate the approval of a constitutional reform that places restrictions on the right to protest and to repudiate the repression by police officers against demonstrators around the provincial legislature on 20 June (coded separately).

On 27 June 2023, in Perico (Jujuy), teachers and public and private workers blocked the highway to repudiate the approval of a constitutional reform that places restrictions on the right to protest and to repudiate the repression by police officers against demonstrators around the provincial legislature on 20 June (coded separately).

On 27 June 2023, in Humahuaca (Jujuy), teachers and public and private workers blocked the highway to repudiate the approval of a constitutional reform that places restrictions on the right to protest and to repudiate the repression by police officers against demonstrators around the provincial legislature on 20 June (coded separately).

On 27 June 2023, in Libertador General San Martin (Jujuy), teachers and public and private workers blocked the highway to repudiate the approval of a constitutional reform that places restrictions on the right to protest and to repudiate the repression by police officers against demonstrators around the provincial legislature on 20 June (coded separately).

On 27 June 2023, in Palpala municipality (Jujuy), teachers and public and private workers blocked Route 66 in the Pongo Farm sector to repudiate the approval of a constitutional reform that places restrictions on the right to protest and to repudiate the repression by police officers against demonstrators around the provincial legislature on 20 June (coded separately).

On 27 June 2023, in San Pedro de Jujuy (Jujuy), teachers and public and private workers blocked the highway to repudiate the approval of a constitutional reform that places restrictions on the right to protest and to repudiate the repression by police officers against demonstrators around the provincial legislature on 20 June (coded separately).

On 27 June 2023, in Tilcara (Jujuy), teachers and public and private workers blocked the highway to repudiate the approval of a constitutional reform that places restrictions on the right to protest and to repudiate the repression by police officers against demonstrators around the provincial legislature on 20 June (coded separately).

On 27 June 2023, in Purmamarca (Jujuy), teachers and public and private workers blocked the highway to repudiate the approval of a constitutional reform that places restrictions on the right to protest and to repudiate the repression by police officers against demonstrators around the provincial legislature on 20 June (coded separately).

On 27 June 2023, in La Quiaca (Jujuy), teachers and public and private workers blocked the highway to repudiate the approval of a constitutional reform that places restrictions on the right to protest and to repudiate the repression by police officers against demonstrators around the provincial legislature on 20 June (coded separately).
On 27 June 2023, in Mendoza (Mendoza), merchants at the Mendoza Persian Fair protested on Godoy Cruz Avenue to demand a new place to work after the fair building was destroyed by a fire in February.

On 27 June 2023, in Tarabuco (Chuquisaca), for the fourth consecutive day, around 400 residents blocked the Sucre - Monteagudo highway as a demonstration to demand the resignation of the mayor due to poor management of the local government.

On 27 June 2023, in Cochabamba (Cochabamba), urban teachers staged a demonstration in 14 de Septiembre square to voice their grievances about the Urban Education Workers Confederation (CTEUB) and the Education ministry of carrying out unilateral agreements.

On 27 June 2023, in La Paz (La Paz), for the second consecutive day, parents of students of Nino Jesus school in Villa Salome sector staged a demonstration to demand the government start the construction of a new infrastructure, to return spaces previously of the school and a perimeter wall.

On 27 June 2023, in Oruro (Oruro), sex workers and members of the Creando Women's collective marched around 10 de Febrero square to voice their grievances about the attempt of the local government to remove the brothels in the Casco Minero sector.

On 27 June 2023, in Villazon (Potosi), lawyers who are members of the Villazon Lawyers School (ICAV) and civic leaders took control of the Justice House offices to demand the Magistrate Council to implement a civil judge that has been lacking for more than half a year. They locked the entrances of the offices as part of the demonstration.

On 27 June 2023, in Santa Cruz de la Sierra (Santa Cruz), parents of students and neighborhoods' boards members marched through the center of the city to demand the mayor fulfill his campaign promises, specifically regarding the needs of the education sector like improvements in infrastructure and security for students.

On 27 June 2023, between the cities of Cuiaba and Santo Antonio do Leverger (Mato Grosso), about 300 fishers blocked the MT-040 highway to protest against the approval of a bill which suspended certain fishing activities in the state for five years.

On 27 June 2023, in Jacobina (Bahia), a man was stoned to death by four suspects who were chasing a relative of the victim and when he tried to intervene he was attacked to death with stones and bricks. The suspects fled after the attack. The motivation behind the attack and its perpetrators are unknown. 1 fatality.

On 27 June 2023, in Fortaleza (Ceara), a non-specified group of people from the nursing sector held a demonstration in the surroundings of the Municipal House demanding a meeting with the local government to discuss better salaries and salaries adjustments.

actor1: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
notes: On 27 June 2023, in Torres (Rio Grande do Sul), two armed individuals exchanged fire with military police following a chase on the ERS-389 highway. Both suspects were killed. The pair had just attempted to kill a man (coded separately). Police seized firearms, ammunition, and cell phones. 2 fatalities.

actor1: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
notes: On 27 June 2023, in Manaus - South Zone (Amazonas), two men were beaten up and injured by military police in the Betania neighborhood. The officers entered the victims' private residence without a warrant to search for drugs, kept the victims detained in the police vehicle for no reason and then took them to a police station. During a preliminary hearing, a judge confirmed signs of torture and unlawful police practices.
On 27 June 2023, in Rio de Janeiro - Central Zone (Rio de Janeiro), unknown suspects exchanged fire in the Cidade Nova and Benfica neighborhoods. Unknown casualties.

On 27 June 2023, in Rio de Janeiro - North Zone (Rio de Janeiro), unknown suspects exchanged fire in the Pavuna, Vicente de Carvalho, Engenho Novo, Manguinhos, and Botafogo neighborhoods, as well as in the Morro do Juramento community, Tomas Coelho neighborhood. Unknown casualties.

On 27 June 2023, in Torres (Rio Grande do Sul), a man was shot and injured in the Sao Jorge neighborhood by two armed individuals. The perpetrators were shot to death in a clash with police (coded separately). Attack motivation is unknown. There were no fatalities.
On 27 June 2023, in Rio de Janeiro - West Zone (Rio de Janeiro), unknown suspects exchanged fire in the Tanque, Jardim Sulacap, and Praca Seca neighborhoods. Unknown casualties.

On 27 June 2023, in Manaus (Amazonas), moto-delivery workers gathered in front of the municipal health department to protest against discriminatory remarks made by one of their servants against delivery workers.

actor1: Police Forces of Brazil (2023-) Civil Police
assoc_actor_1: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
notes: Property destruction: On 27 June 2023, in Rio de Janeiro - North Zone (Rio de Janeiro), a task force of civil and military police along the officials from Rio de Janeiro City Hall, seized over 100 tons of telephone cables in a house in the Manguinhos neighborhood. Due to the valuable copper in the wires, the material was being used as a source of income for organized crime.

On 27 June 2023, in Manaus - East Zone (Amazonas), a drug trafficker was killed in a drive-by shooting in front of her private residence in the Coroado neighborhood by two armed individuals on a motorcycle. Pictures of the target were circulating on social media with a X on it, indicating she was tagged to die. 1 fatality.

assoc_actor_1: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police; Police Forces of Brazil (2023-) Civil Police
notes: On 27 June 2023, in Belo Horizonte (Minas Gerais), military and civil police officers gathered in front of the Legislative Assembly to demand salary readjustment.

On 27 June 2023, in Maceio (Alagoas), a man was shot to death in the Jacintinho neighborhood by unknown shooters who broke into the victim's house and opened fire killing him. The victim had criminal records for drug trafficking and police believes there is a possibility the attack was related to this activities. The motivation behind the attack and its perpetrators are still under investigation. 1 fatality.

actor2: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
notes: On 27 June 2023, in Angra dos Reis (Rio de Janeiro), drug traffickers exchanged fire with military police in the Sapinhatuba 1 and Sapinhatuba 3 neighborhoods. At least two suspects were shot and killed, and third was injured. Police seized two guns, drugs, a ballistic vest, and five motorcycles. 2 fatalities.

actor2: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
notes: On 27 June 2023, in Madeiro (Piaui), there was a shoot-out between the military police and an armed suspect during a police operation aiming to arrest the suspect who fled after shooting against the officers and injured one of them. The policeman was taken to the hospital. There were no fatalities.

On 27 June 2023, in Ponta Pora (Mato Grosso do Sul), two siblings were shot and killed near a car wash by unknown armed individuals. At least one deceased had a police record for drug trafficking. 2 fatalities.

On 27 June 2023, in Rio de Janeiro - Central Zone (Rio de Janeiro), state school teachers held a protest on the Francisco Bicalho Avenue as a part of a strike that has been ongoing for 42 days. Traffic was blocked.

On 27 June 2023, in Volta Redonda (Rio de Janeiro), two armed suspects shot and killed a man sitting in a vehicle in the Vila Americana neighborhood. The target had six criminal notes for drug trafficking. 1 fatality.

On 27 June 2023, in Santiago (Metropolitana), about 20 hooded individuals erected incendiary barricades and threw Molotov cocktails outside of the Barros Borgono School. Police dispersed the crowd with water cannons.

On 27 June 2023, in Santiago - Maipu (Metropolitana), 400 workers at a fair held a demonstration on Camino a Rinconada street. Demonstrators erected barricades and threw Molotov cocktails at police units. Police arrested two people. The fair workers stated that since 24 June there have been detours due to work on the streets where the fair was located and that this is affecting their work. Workers stated that their working permits were cancelled by the municipality and that they were not relocated. Authorities stated that workers did not want to be relocated.

On 27 June 2023, around Medellin - Central East (Antioquia), about 100 taxi drivers protested against the increase in gasoline prices. The group traveled through different areas of the city to the administration center in La Alpujarra.

source: El Diario (Colombia); La Voz del Rio Arauca; Vanguardia Liberal
notes: On 27 June 2023, in the rural area of Arauquita municipality (Arauca), military forces clashed with ELN militants between the municipality and Puerto Rondon near the Manantiales vereda (Arauca), resulting in the death of six ELN members. Security forces also seized several equipment and supplies from the armed group. 6 fatalities.
On 27 June 2023, in Bogota - La Candelaria (Bogota, D.C.), rice growers protested in front of the Ministry of Agriculture due to disagreements on the implementation of economic aid for the group.
On 27 June 2023, in Cartagena (Bolivar), teachers protested delays in the payment of their wages. The group gathered near the municipality and urged authorities to pay the debt.

On 27 June 2023, in Cartagena (Bolivar), protesters blocked the road in the industrial zone of Mamonal to protest the eviction of a plot of land in the area. The group was demanding their right to housing.

assoc_actor_1: PU: Social Party of National Unity; Government of Colombia (2022-)
notes: On 27 June 2023, in the rural area of Manizales municipality (Caldas), people blocked the La Estrella toll booth on the road that connects the area with the municipality of Neira to protest against the deficient road infrastructure, despite the payment of tolls. A councilwoman member of the U party participated in the protest.

On 27 June 2023, in the rural area of Balboa municipality (Cauca), military forces clashed with members of an unidentified armed group for the second consecutive day. There is no further information on this event. Casualties unknown.

On 27 June 2023, in the rural area of Albania municipality (La Guajira), former workers of the El Cerrejon coal mine protested their dismissal from the company. The group blocked a railroad track to demand better compensation.

On 27 June 2023, in the rural area of Mallama municipality (coded to Providencia, Narino), unidentified armed individuals shot and killed an upholsterer in a drive-by shooting. The perpetrators opened fire on the victim while he was in his store. The incident is believed to be related to an extortion payment by a group. Although the perpetrators have not been confirmed, the area is known for the presence of armed groups. 1 fatality.

On 27 June 2023, in Cucuta - West (Norte de Santander),unidentified armed individuals shot and killed three members of the same family. The perpetrators broke into the victims' house and opened fire on them. Although the perpetrators have not been confirmed, the area is known for the presence of armed groups. 3 fatalities.

On 27 June 2023, in Guayaquil (Guayas), family members of residents that were arbitrarily arrested and tortured in Communitarian Police Units (UPC) staged a demonstration outside the State Attorney's offices to demand justice in their cases.

On 27 June 2023, in Ambato (Tungurahua), residents of El Pisque sector captured and beat up a man that they say had robbed and assaulted an elderly citizen. The man was later turned to police officers and taken to a police station.

On 27 June 2023, in Fuerte Olimpo (Alto Paraguay), friends and family of a couple who lost their baby during birth at the local hospital protested to demand to the Health Ministry to investigate the case and intervene in the hospital. They claim that the baby died due to medical malpractice by an ob-gyn. They also demanded that the healthcare service is improved and that the deaths of children are stopped.

On 27 June 2023, in Ciudad del Este (Alto Parana), police forces clashed with a group of rioters during an eviction process in the Belen sector. Rioters threw stones and Molotov cocktails at the officers and in return they used tear gas and fired rubber bullets. There were no casualties.

On 27 June 2023, in Asuncion (Asuncion), residents from San Lazaro, Itacua, San Alfredo, Paso Horqueta, Puentesino and Belen (in Concepcion), led by the mayors of the municipalities, protested outside the premises of the Public Works and Communications Ministry against the bad state of the Concepcion - Vallemi highway. They demanded the construction of a new road. Police officers beat up and arrested some demonstrators when they tried to enter the ministry building.

On 27 June 2023, in Santa Maria de Fe (Misiones), farmers blocked the highway to demand the Yacyreta Binational Entity (EBY) to transfer the money for a productive project so that they can plant their crops.
On 27 June 2023, in San Pedro de Ycuamandiyu (San Pedro), friends and family of a woman killed by her stepfather on 27 June 2022 protested to demand justice for the femicide.

On 27 June 2023, in Trujillo (La Libertad), parents of students of Pedro Mercedes Urena school staged a demonstration outside the campus to demand the intervention of authorities in the cases of bullying that have been registered in school.

On 27 June 2023, in Iquitos (Loreto), unionized civil construction workers of San Juan Bautista district staged a demonstration outside the construction of the Peru Technologic University (UTP) campus to demand to be hired for the works.

On 27 June 2023, in Iquitos (Loreto), unionized teachers members of the Loreto Region Magisterial Bases Workers Syndicate (SITER LORETO) marched through the city to the 28 de Julio square as a demonstration to voice their grievance about the privatization plan of public schools, the changes of public workers regime, and their workers' right to be taken.

On 27 June 2023, in Iquitos (Loreto), representatives and residents of 21 villages of Cabo Lopez sector marched towards Belen district as a demonstration to voice their grievance about the increase of insecurity and to demand an update of the land deeds they posses.

On 27 June 2023, in Barcelona (Anzoategui), for the second consecutive day, a group of demonstrators, including health workers of the Luis Razetti Hospital, and the Movement of Health Workers (Motrasalud), protested to demand the liberation of a colleague arrested under accusations of stealing medicines from the hospital. The protesters argue that the hospital has not had that sort of medicines in at least three months, and that the medication found on the worker belonged to him. They gathered by the local Anzoategui state police station.

On 27 June 2023, in Zuata (Aragua), CICPC police forces shot and killed an unidentified crime group suspect, during an armed confrontation in the Madre Maria sector. The suspect resisted authority, and initiated the shooting. He was injured in the gunfire and pronounce dead in hospital. The man was linked to at least two abductions (coded separately), and was being sought for extortion threats and arms trafficking. Police collected a gun. 1 fatality.

source: Diario Primicia; Diario Version Final (Venezuela); El Carabobeno; La Patilla; Noticia al Minuto
notes: On 27 June 2023, in Tocuyito (Carabobo), a group of residents tied a man with mental disabilities to a horse, after accusing him of carrying out a bicycle theft. The victim was dragged around the village behind the horse, and a video of the scene was posted on social media. The man suffered numerous life threatening bruises and wounds. Three suspects were arrested for this days later.

On 27 June 2023, in Valencia (Carabobo), Carabobo state police forces shot and killed an unidentified crime group suspect, during an armed confrontation in the Los Samanes neighborhood. The suspect was injured in the gunfire and pronounced dead in hospital; he had an unspecified criminal record. Police collected a gun. 1 fatality.

On 27 June 2023, in Caracas - Libertador (Distrito Capital), a group of demonstrators, including active and retired teachers and health workers, and pensioners, protested to demand better pay and pensions, payment of owed stipends, and the renewal of their collective labor agreements. The protesters gathered by the IPASME Office.
On 27 June 2023, in San Juan de los Morros (Guarico), a group of transport workers blocked the Acosta Carles Avenue in protest after a week of no supply of subsidized petrol.

On 27 June 2023, in Merida (Merida), a group of demonstrators, including residents and civil society representatives, protested to demand and adequate and stable supply of fuel for farmers, and against the threats and intimidation suffered by some of them for protesting over fuel scarcity. The demonstrators gathered by the Public Ministry Office.

On 27 June 2023, in Maracaibo (Zulia), for the second consecutive day, a group of university students protested to demand observance of the reduced-price public transport fares for students, which some public transport drivers refuse to comply with. These drivers argue that the government is not reimbursing them for the reduced-price tickets, and that they cannot afford to pay for petrol with those fares. The protesters marched around the city center.

source: El Pitazo; La Patilla; Noticia al Minuto
notes: On 27 June 2023, in Maracaibo (Zulia), a group of Yukpa Indigenous people protested to demand justice for the three Indigenous leaders arrested during a protest in the Rafael Urdaneta Bridge 12 days before (coded separately), and their liberation. The protesters gathered by the Maracaibo Palace of Justice.

source: Diario 2001; Diario Version Final (Venezuela); Noticia al Minuto
notes: On 27 June 2023, in Maracaibo (Zulia), CICPC police forces shot and killed a member of the El Caracas Gang, during an armed confrontation in the Guanipa Matos neighborhood, Idelfonso Vasquez parish. The suspect resisted authority, attempted to escape, and was injured in the gunfire; he was pronounced dead in hospital. The deceased was linked to theft. Police collected a gun. 1 fatality.

actor1: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
notes: On 27 June 2023, in Candeias (Bahia), military police engaged in a shootout with drug traffickers during an operation in the Dom Avelar neighbourhood. An officer was injured. There were no fatalities.
Looting: On 27 June 2023, in Sao Vicente (Sao Paulo), around 15 men looted a supermarket in the Jardim Nosso Lar neighborhood. One suspect was arrested while the rest escaped.

On 27 June 2023, in Huaquillas (El Oro), during the inauguration of a Citizen Revolution Movement (MRC) local office, unidentified assailants threw an crude explosive, that was later activated and exploded. Dozens of people were present, however no one was injured and no material damage was reported.

On 26 June 2023, in Pacayas, Alvarado, a group of students and parents of schoolchildren staged a protest for the appointment of a new headmaster. Protesters demanded that the Ministry of Education remove her and appoint a new one, as they argued that the current one is not valid.

On 26 June 2023, in Raxruha, Alta Verapaz, people staged a demonstration against the results of the municipal elections held the day before and held hostage an unknown number of people in a voting station. Police officers were deployed to rescue them, though no interactions with rioters were reported.

On 26 June 2023, in Santa Catalina La Tinta, Alta Verapaz, members of Let's Go Guatemala (Vamos party) participating in the counting of ballots set on fire the ballots and clashed with members of the police and military forces. Rioters rejected the results of the municipal election. Rioters threw stones, sticks, and rocks at the security forces, resulting in a military officer injured. No more detail is provided by the source.

On 26 June 2023, in Cahabon, Alta Verapaz, people staged a demonstration against the results of the elections held the day before and broke into a polling station, took the ballots, and burned them. Police officers were deployed in the area and threw tear gas on the rioters, who responding by shooting on them. No more detail was provided by the sources.

On 26 June 2023, in Tactic, Alta Verapaz, people staged a demonstration against the results of the municipal elections held the day before. Rioters, mostly people from five communities living in the area, broke into the polling station, took the ballots, and set them on fire in front of the municipal building. Anti riot police were deployed.
Around 26 June 2023 (week of), in Camotan, Chiquimula, people staged a demonstration against the results of the municipal elections and blocked the roads. In addition, they burned voting ballots.
Around 26 June 2023 (week of), in Jocotan, Chiquimula, people staged a demonstration against the results of the municipal elections.

On 26 June 2023, in San Jose municipality (coded to Puerto San Jose), Escuintla, a group of rioters burned the ballots at the polling station in a private school (methods unknown). No more information is provided by the source.

On 26 June 2023, in Amatitlan, Guatemala, people protested against the results of the mayor's election held the day before. The protest took place in front of the municipal building. The demonstrators claimed that people from other municipalities had been brought to Amatitlan to vote. Police were deployed, but no incidents occurred.

On 26 June 2023, in Chinautla, Guatemala, people staged a demonstration against the results of the mayor's election held the day before. The people claimed there had been fraud and demanded a recount of the ballots. Later in the day, rioters blocked several streets and set fire to three garbage trucks, ballots, municipal cars and voting material in the voting stations. Firefighters and police were deployed. 20 people were arrested.

On 26 June 2023, in Guatemala City, Guatemala, two armed men shot and killed a man and injured other two in zone 17. The victims were intercepted by the armed men who opened fire for no apparent reason. No more detail is provided by the source. 1 fatality, 2 injured.

On 26 June 2023, in San Miguel Acatan, Huehuetenango, people who rejected the elections results staged a demonstration at the local police station, vandalized it, and set it on fire. As a result, one police officer was injured. 1 injured.

On 26 June 2023, in Nuevo San Carlos, Retalhuleu, a group of rioters violently disrupted the polling station in the village of Candelaria Xolhuitz (methods unknown). No more information is provided by the source.

On 26 June 2023, in Concepcion Tutuapa, San Marcos, rioters demonstrated in the city center and set the municipal building on fire, arguing it was in demonstration against the results of the municipal election. Rioters threw rocks on the people who tried to stop the fire, as well as on police officers in the area.
Around 26 June 2023 (week of), in Rio Bravo, Suchitepequez, people staged a demonstration against the results of the municipal elections.

Around 26 June 2023 (week of), in Samayac, Suchitepequez, people staged a demonstration against the results of the municipal elections. Rioters set on fire voting ballots. Police intervened and threw tear gas against the rioters.
Around 26 June 2023 (week of), in San Pablo Jocopilas, Suchitepequez, people staged a demonstration against the results of the municipal elections and vandalized the residency of the mayor.

Around 26 June 2023 (as reported), in Puerto Cortes, Cortes, unidentified armed individuals shot and killed a taxi driver. His body was found between El Porvenir and Rio Mar inside his car. 1 fatality.
On 26 June 2023, in San Pedro Sula, Cortes, an unidentified individual stabbed to death a taxi driver. The reason for the killing is unknown. 1 fatality.

On 26 June 2023, in Tegucigalpa, Francisco Morazan, women dressed in black marched in front of the Public Ministry to protest against over 228 femicides recorded this year in the country, demanding effective punishments and protection for women from the authorities.
On 26 June 2023, in Tegucigalpa, Francisco Morazan, unidentified armed men shot a bus from a car (drive-by). The reason for the attack is unknown. There were no fatalities.

On 26 June 2023, in Caldera, Chiriqui, people staged a protest on the Transismic road to demand that authorities fix the road, as agreed with the government in 2022. Protesters argued that the poor condition of the roads has generated difficulties in the resident's mobility, safety, and finances.

On 26 June 2023, in La Chorrera, Panama Oeste, parents of the school held a protest to demand that the authorities appoint two teachers, guards, inspectors and administrative staff. The protesters blocked access to the school.

assoc_actor_1: FPDS: Popular Front Dario Santillan; Polo Obrero; MST: Workers' Socialist Movement; MTR: Teresa Rodriguez Movement; Labor Group (Argentina); New MAS: Movement for Socialism (Argentina)
notes: On 26 June 2023, in Avellaneda (Buenos Aires), members of social organizations such as FPDS, Polo Obrero, MST, MTR and New MAS blocked the Pueyrredon Bridge to demonstrate in commemoration of the killing of Piquetero leaders by police forces during a violent demonstration in the same place in 2002.

On 26 June 2023, in La Plata - Central (Buenos Aires), a group of students at the Legion School blocked the road outside the institution to protest against the constitutional reform approved by the Jujuy Provincial Legislature which limits the right to protest.

On 26 June 2023, in Abra Pampa (Jujuy), members of an Indigenous group blocked the highway to protest against the constitutional reform approved by the provincial legislature that limits the right to protest, against the extraction of natural resources and to demand better salaries.

On 26 June 2023, in Perico (Jujuy), members of an Indigenous group blocked highway 66 to protest against the constitutional reform approved by the provincial legislature that limits the right to protest, against the extraction of natural resources and to demand better salaries.

On 26 June 2023, around Purmamarca (Jujuy), members of an Indigenous group blocked the highway to protest against the constitutional reform approved by the provincial legislature that limits the right to protest, against the extraction of natural resources and to demand better salaries.

On 26 June 2023, in San Miguel de Tucuman (Tucuman), members of FPDS marched from the Santa Fe and Munecas intersection to Independencia Square to demonstrate in commemoration of the killing of Piquetero leaders by police forces during a violent demonstration in 2002 in Avellaneda (Buenos Aires).

On 26 June 2023, in San Miguel de Tucuman (Tucuman), former workers at the Provincial Mutual Organization marched from Independencia Square to the Federal Court to protest because they were fired without cause. They claimed they were fired for political reasons.

On 26 June 2023, in Tarabuco (Chuquisaca), for the third consecutive day, residents blocked the Sucre - Monteagudo highway as a demonstration to demand the resignation of the mayor due to poor management of the local government.

On 26 June 2023, in Cochabamba (Cochabamba), residents of Montecillo Bajo, in Tiquipaya, staged a demonstration at 14 de Septiembre square to demand the signature of the agreement between the Potable Water and Sewage Municipal Service (SEMAPA) and Misicuni company to provide the district with potable water services.

On 26 June 2023, in La Paz (La Paz), former workers of the Bolivian Airport Services (SABSA) company blocked the center of the city as a demonstration to demand their severance payments to be paid, that have been pending for more than a year.

On 26 June 2023, in La Paz (La Paz), parents of students of Nino Jesus school in Villa Salome sector staged a demonstration to demand the government start the construction of a new infrastructure, to return spaces previously of the school and a perimeter wall. During the demonstration they tied up the school director to the school's flag mast.

On 26 June 2023, in Oruro (Oruro), merchants from different markets marched through the center of the city to 10 de Febrero square, blocking and closing the local government and other government entities offices as a demonstration to voice their grievances about the new market attempting to be built near the bus station.

actor2: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
source: Crimes News RJ; Folha de S. Paulo; G1; Globo Extra; Informe Agora; OTT-RJ; R7
notes: On 26 June 2023, in Rio de Janeiro - South Zone (Rio de Janeiro), Red Command exchanged fire with military police in the Rocinha favela, during an operation aiming to arrest fugitive armed suspects from other Brazilian states and removing barricades from the community. One male civilian was shot and injured. Seven schools and some health clinics were closed, and traffic was blocked. Police seized a firearm, a grenade, and marijuana. There were no fatalities.

On 26 June 2023, in Rio de Janeiro - West Zone (Rio de Janeiro), the CV exchanged fire with police officers on patrol in the Vila Kennedy neighborhood. Two suspects were killed and five were arrested. Police seized five pistols, ammunition, radios, and drugs. 2 fatalities.

On 26 June 2023, in Altamira (Para), fishers occupied the Brazilian Institute for the Environment (Ibama) building to demand the payment of a financial compensation from a energy company. The protesters claim fish started disappearing after the company built a hydroelectric power plant in the area.
On 26 June 2023, in Boituva (Sao Paulo), two armed suspects shot and severely injured a man with three shots in the Vila Ginasial neighborhood. There were no fatalities.

actor1: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
notes: On 26 June 2023, in Manaus - East Zone (Amazonas), four drug trafficking suspects exchanged fire with military police in the Santa Ines neighborhood. One suspect was killed and the others escaped. Police seized a firearm, portions of drugs, and cash. 1 fatality.
On 26 June 2023, in Duque de Caxias (Rio de Janeiro), unknown suspects exchanged fire in the Corte Oito community, Vila Centenario neighborhood. Unknown casualties.

On 26 June 2023, in Rio de Janeiro - North Zone (Rio de Janeiro), unknown suspects exchanged fire in the Meier neighborhood and the Morro do Juramento community, Tomas Coelho neighborhood. Unknown casualties.

On 26 June 2023, in Palmas (Tocantins), a man was shot and killed in the Lago Sul sector by an armed individual who arrived with an accomplice on a motorcycle. One suspect was arrested. Attack motivation is unknown. 1 fatality.

On 26 June 2023, in Santa Cruz do Sul (Rio Grande do Sul), a woman was shot and killed inside her private residence in the Sao Joao neighborhood by two armed individuals. The pair was looking for the victim's husband, but since he was not found, they shot her instead. The pair also killed the victim's dog. There are no reports on the identity of the perpetrators or the attack's motivation. 1 fatality.
tags: women targeted: relatives of targeted groups or persons

notes: On 26 June 2023, in Manaus - East Zone (Amazonas), two suspected thieves were beaten up and injured by residents in the Grande Vitoria neighborhood. One suspect escaped and the other died from the injuries minutes after the attack. 1 fatality.

Around 26 June 2023 (as reported), in Manaus - East Zone (Amazonas), a man was killed by unknown individuals and his body was found in the Colonia Antonio Aleixo neighborhood with gunshot wounds and hands tied up. The victim had been missing for about three days. Family members of the victim believe he was killed by drug traffickers who had mistaken him for a member of a rival group. 1 fatality.

On 26 June 2023, in Manaus - West Zone (Amazonas), a man was shot and killed in the Compensa neighborhood by armed individuals. The victim had a drug debt with drug traffickers, which could have motivated his killing. 1 fatality.
On 26 June 2023, in Rio de Janeiro - West Zone (Rio de Janeiro), unknown suspects exchanged fire at Canhao Square in the Realengo neighborhood. Unknown casualties.

Around 26 June 2023 (as reported), in Manaus - Central South Zone (Amazonas), moto-delivery workers gathered in front of a residential complex in the Aleixo neighborhood to demand justice for the case of a delivery worker who was verbally and physically abused by a resident.

Around 26 June 2023 (as reported), in Conquista D'Oeste municipality (Mato Grosso), two people were killed by unknown individuals and their bodies were found in the Sarare Indigenous territory. One of the victims was decapitated. The area is known for illegal gold mining and the presence of organized criminal groups. Circumstances of death are unknown. 2 fatalities.
Around 26 June 2023 (as reported), in Itaquaquecetuba (Sao Paulo), a man was abducted and killed. The body was found with signs of execution. 1 fatality.

actor2: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
assoc_actor_2: Police Forces of Brazil (2023-) Civil Police
notes: On 26 June 2023, in Alexandria (Rio Grande do Norte), there was a shoot-out between armed suspects and military and civil police forces after police chased the suspects and they clashed in a car that was previously reported as stolen. The two suspects were shot and injured during the clash and were taken to the hospital but did not survive the injuries. Police believe the suspects were part of a local gang and both had criminal records. 2 fatalities.
On 26 June 2023, in Santos (Sao Paulo), dockers held a protest outside the Port Museum, demanding the founding of employment registers.
On 26 June 2023, in Manaus - West Zone (Amazonas), a shoot-out between rival drug trafficking groups took place in the Parque Riachuelo community. One gang member was killed in the clash. 1 fatality.

source: Bahia 190; Bahia Extremo Sul; Bnews (Brazil); G1
notes: Around 26 June 2023 (as reported), in Eunapolis (Bahia), a man was killed and his body was found after he was abducted the day before with four other people (coded separately). The victim was found with signs of torture and firearm gunshots. Police believe the attack was linked to the victim being part of a drug trafficking gang and that the attack is linked to drug trafficking disputes. The motivation behind the attack and its perpetrators are unknown. 1 fatality.

On 26 June 2023, in Maceio (Alagoas), a man was shot to death in the Novo Mundo neighborhood by unknown shooters. The victim had criminal records for drug trafficking and had been imprisoned for this reason. The motivation behind the attack and its perpetrators are unknown. 1 fatality.

On 26 June 2023, in Maceio (Alagoas), a man was shot to death in the Cidade Universitaria neighborhood by unknown shooters. The victim had criminal records for drug trafficking. The motivation behind the attack and its perpetrators are under investigation. 1 fatality.
On 26 June 2023, in the rural area of Rio Branco municipality (Acre), people blocked a highway to demand better infrastructure in wetlands, such as draining systems and the building of bridges.
On 26 June 2023, in Vacaria (Rio Grande do Sul), a man was shot and killed on the BR-116 highway by an unknown armed individual. The deceased had a police record for drug trafficking. 1 fatality.

Looting: On 26 June 2023, in Sao Paulo - Central Zone (Sao Paulo), at least 20 drug users, drug traffickers, and people in a situation of homelessness looted a market in the area known as Cracolandia after a police operation to combat drug trafficking. Police arrested two people and seized drugs, a precision scale, and cash. There were no casualties.

On 26 June 2023, in Varzea Grande (Mato Grosso), armed individuals in a car opened fire against the passenger of another car in a drive-by shooting. The victim stepped out of the vehicle and ran, but was chased after by the suspects, shot and killed. Authorship and motivation of the attack are unknown. 1 fatality.
On 26 June 2023, in Bogota - Engativa (Bogota, D.C.), citizens protested near the Calle 80. There is no further information on this event.
On 26 June 2023, in Bogota - Fontibon (Bogota, D.C.), citizens blocked Avenida Centenario to protest. There is no further information about this event.
On 26 June 2023, in Cartagena (Bolivar), informal vendors protested against the increased police operation to remove them from public space. The group demanded their right to work.
On 26 June 2023, in the rural area of Balboa municipality (Cauca), a minor was injured when she stepped on a mine planted by an unidentified armed group. There were no fatalities.

On 26 June 2023, in the rural area of Balboa municipality (Cauca), military forces clashed with members of an unidentified armed group. There is no further information on this event. Casualties unknown.
