notes: Around 26 June 2023 (as reported), in the rural area of El Bordo corregimiento (Cauca), militants of the FARC dissident faction Carlos Patino abducted a former FARC when the woman was near the Betania vereda. The victim was held captive for one day and then handed over to a humanitarian commission. The victim was a member of the Comunes Party.

On 26 June 2023, in the rural area of La Maria corregimiento (Cauca), Misak Indigenous people blocked the Pan-American Highway to protest against the holding of a Nasa regional Indigenous meeting in their territory.

On 26 June 2023, in the rural area of Puerto Tejada municipality (Cauca), residents blocked the Pan-American Highway to protest against a water cut that affected the population for more than six days.

Around 26 June 2023 (as reported), in the rural area of Gigante municipality (Huila), a social leader member of an organization of people affected by the construction of the dam was killed by a gunshot. There is no further information on this event. 1 fatality.

Around 26 June 2023 (as reported), in Riohacha (La Guajira), more than 300 teachers protested in front of the municipality, while a second group of Wayuu Indigenous people from the Suman protested at the same time to demand their right to decent housing. Both groups demanded a meeting with Colombian President Gustavo Petro.

Around 26 June 2023 (as reported), in Tasajeras (Magdalena), residents barricaded a road with burning tires and other objects to demonstrate against a drinking water cut that has affected the area for 7 days.
Around 26 June 2023 (as reported), in Cucuta (Norte de Santander), taxi drivers protested. There is no further information on this event.

On 26 June 2023, in Mariquita (Tolima), rural residents and members of the local JAC protested against the poor road infrastructure of local roads and demanded better infrastructure with the municipal seat.

On 26 June 2023, in Quito - Eugenio Espejo (Pichincha), members of the Ecuador Dialysis Centers Association (ASODIALISIS EC) and unionized health workers staged a demonstration outside Zarzuela building to demand payment of their services that have been pending for more than eight months by the government, the social security institute (IESS) and Health ministry.

On 26 June 2023, in Presidente Franco (Alto Parana), residents at the Santa Ines neighborhood protested blocking the access of trucks to the quarries on the Monday River. They said that these quarries are illegal and demanded an intervention from authorities.

assoc_actor_2: Government of Peru (2022-); AP: Popular Action; Police Forces of Peru (2022-)
notes: On 26 June 2023, in Arequipa (Arequipa), residents of Apipa threw rocks, bottles and dirt at a congress member (Popular Action) during an event in the Cerro Colorado district where he was explaining the new schedule for the construction of a potable water and sewage projects in the sector. Police officers intervened with tear gas to protect the congress member.

On 26 June 2023, in Huancayo (Junin), parents of students of Jose Carlos Mariategui school staged a demonstration outside the campus to demand the return of the money that the treasurer of the Regional Association APAFAS allegedly took from the school's budget.

On 26 June 2023, in Montevideo (Montevideo), unionized ANCAP (National Administration of Fuels, Alcohol, and Cement) workers protested at the La Tablada plant to protest against the public bidding for the Portland Cement company.

On 26 June 2023, in Barcelona (Anzoategui), a group of demonstrators, including health workers of the Luis Razetti Hospital, and the Movement of Health Workers (Motrasalud), protested to demand the liberation of a colleague arrested under accusations of stealing medicines from the hospital. The protesters argue that the hospital has not had that sort of medicines in at least three months, and that the medication found on the worker belonged to him. They gathered by the local Anzoategui state police station.

On 26 June 2023, in San Fernando de Apure (Apure), a group of demonstrators, including teachers and the Union of Education Workers (Sindite), protested to demand better pay and working conditions. The protesters gathered by the Apure state Public Prosecutor's Office, in the Paseo Libertador Avenue.

source: Correo del Caroni; El Diario de Guayana; La Patilla
notes: On 26 June 2023, in El Callao (Bolivar), for the fourth consecutive day, a group of approximately 30 miners and residents continued blocking the Troncal 10 road in protest over the arrest of nine artisanal miners by DGCIM military forces, in unclear circumstances. The protesters demand their liberation. That evening, the roadblock was lifted, and traffic was restored.

On 26 June 2023, in Caracas - Libertador (Distrito Capital), a group of demonstrators, including state workers and unionists, protested to demand the liberation of the two unionists arrested recently for leading the protests at the Pellas plant (Bolivar) (coded separately), respect for their labor rights, and better pay and working conditions. Transport workers were also present, and demanded better roads and subsidized fuel. The protesters marched to the Ministry of Industry.

On 26 June 2023, in San Juan de los Morros (Guarico), a group of demonstrators, including retired teachers and pensioners, protested to demand higher pensions, and payment of owed stipends. The protesters gathered by the seat of the Guarico state government.

On 26 June 2023, in Maracaibo (Zulia), a group of university students protested to demand observance of the reduced-price public transport fares for students, which some public transport drivers refuse to comply with. These drivers argue that the government is not reimbursing them for the reduced-price tickets, and that they cannot afford to pay for petrol with those fares.

source: Diario 2001; El Pitazo; Noticia al Minuto

The suspect was thought to be the perpetrator of the killing of a teenage girl, in a drive-by shooting in the weeks prior (coded separately). There is no further information at this point in time. 1 fatality.

source: CR Hoy; La Nacion (Costa Rica); La Teja
notes: On 25 June 2023, in San Jose, San Jose, thousands of people staged a demonstration on the occasion of Pride Day LGBTQ+. Demonstrators, including members of the LGBTQ community and civil society organizations, demanded the end of discrimination and exclusion.

On 25 June 2023, in Guatemala City, Guatemala, rioters threw an unknown number of Molotov bombs into a polling station in zone 10. Police stated that it was a bottle filled with alcohol, and not a Molotov bomb. Later that day, rioters threw a home-made explosive device in a polling station in zone 16. Also in Guatemala City, a group of people set up a car on fire in the polling station Los Arcos in zone 13. No more detail is provided by the source. The motivation for the actions was not reported. There were no casualties.

On 25 June 2023, in San Jose del Golfo, Guatemala, police forces clashed with rioters. The clashes started the day before following riots for reports of irregularities during the electoral process (coded separately). Due to the ongoing riots, elections were suspended in this location. There were no fatalities.

On 25 June 2023, in Sayaxche, Peten, rioters set on fire a school that was functioning as polling station. The report indicated that the rioters who set fire to the school were unhappy with the preliminary election results.

On 25 June 2023, in San Mateo, Quetzaltenango, 100 rioters gathered outside a polling station and some of them tried violently to break into the station to verify the vote-counting process. Police officers were deployed to prevent them from trespassing. No more detail is provided by the source.

source: BBC News; El Heraldo (Honduras); GardaWorld; La Prensa (Honduras); La Tribuna (Honduras)
notes: Security measures: On 25 June 2023, in Choloma, Cortes the authorities declared a special curfew starting 25 June. The measure is aimed at combatting gang violence and it would last for 15 days extendable. This announcement follows a mass shooting at a billiard hall in the town's Victoria area on June 24, which left 13 people dead. Additional security, including checkpoints, will be established in the affected areas and the President announced police operations aimed to control violent acts in areas under heavy presence of gangs.

On 25 June 2023, in Tegucigalpa, Francisco Morazan, several unidentified armed men shot and killed three individuals in Villa Nueva neighborhood. Two were killed in the place of the shooting, the other one (5 year old) died while being taken to a medical center. The reason for the killing is unknown. 3 fatalities.
On 25 June 2023, in Panama City, Panama, hundreds of catholic people staged a demonstration in the defense of life and family.

On 25 June 2023, in Eunapolis (Bahia), five people were abducted by unknown perpetrators. One of the victims was found dead the day after the kidnapping (coded separately) and the another was still missing. Three were released with signs of violence on their bodies. The motivation behind the attack and its perpetrators are unknown. There were no fatalities.

notes: Property destruction: On 25 June 2023, in Juiz de Fora (Minas Gerais), military police seized more than one ton of marijuana hidden inside a truck loaded with grass during an inspection. One person was arrested.
On 25 June 2023, in Itaborai (Rio de Janeiro), several suspects shot and injured a woman, and left her at the door of a hospital. The victim was severely injured. There were no fatalities.

On 25 June 2023, in Manaus - East Zone (Amazonas), a man was shot and killed in the Jorge Teixeira neighborhood by two unknown armed individuals. The victim had recently left prison (charges not reported). The location where the killing occurred is known as the 'hill of sacrifice'. 1 fatality.

On 25 June 2023, in Maceio (Alagoas), a man was stoned to death in the Cidade Universitaria neighborhood by two individuals. The man was attacked after he had allegedly stolen a motorcycle with another men and two individual chased after them in a car and hit the victim with a stone killing him. The perpetrators behind the attack are unknown. 1 fatality.

On 25 June 2023, in Rio de Janeiro - North Zone (Rio de Janeiro), unknown suspects exchanged fire in the Morro do Divino community, Campinho neighborhood and the Morro do Fuba community, Cascadura neighborhood. Unknown casualties.

On 25 June 2023, in Passo de Torres (Santa Catarina), six armed individuals opened fire against a man in the Praia Azul neighborhood. The victim was not injured. The victim believes he was mistaken for his brother. Likewise, another man was shot and killed by two armed individuals who invaded his private residence. The pair fled with two more accomplices. There are no reports on the identity of the perpetrators or the attack's motivation. 1 fatality.

On 25 June 2023, in Joao Pessoa (Paraiba), a man was shot to death in a drive-by shooting the Jacare neighborhood by three armed men in a car who opened fire against the victim killing him and fled after the attack. The victim had criminal records for homicide and police believe the attack was linked to debts between criminality. The motivation behind the attack and its perpetrators are unknown. 1 fatality.

On 25 June 2023, in Manaus - East Zone (Amazonas), a man was killed in a drive-by shooting in the Sao Jose neighborhood by two armed individuals on a motorcycle. Authorship and motivation of the attack are unknown. 1 fatality.

On 25 June 2023, in Belo Horizonte (Minas Gerais), a member of a drug trafficking group opened fire against a fellow gang member in the Mangueiras neighborhood. The target of the attack escaped. One civilian man and his daughter were injured by stray bullets, and the child died from the injuries hours later. 1 fatality.

On 25 June 2023, in Manaus - West Zone (Amazonas), two men were shot and killed in the Ponta Negra neighborhood by two armed individuals. Authorship and motivation of the attack are unknown. One victim was the brother of a well-known drug trafficker. 2 fatalities.
On 25 June 2023, in Campinas (Sao Paulo), thousands members and supporters of the LGBTQ+ community held a protest in the city center, demanding for improved rights for the minority.

On 25 June 2023, in Fortaleza (Ceara), thousands of people, including members of the LGBTQ+ community, gathered in the Beira-Mar Av., to carry out a demonstration on pride day celebration that takes place in the city every year since 1999.

actor2: Police Forces of Brazil (2023-) Civil Police
notes: On 25 June 2023, in Guaruja (Sao Paulo), armed suspects exchanged fire with civil police at a clandestine funk dance in the Vila Edna neighborhood. No one was injured. Police arrested 29 people suspected of drug trafficking and seized a firearm simulacrum, speakers, cell phones, four motorcycles, 23 bicycles, cocaine, and marijuana. There were no fatalities.

On 25 June 2023, in Macapa (Amapa), a man was shot and killed in the Araxa neighborhood by an armed individual who arrived with three accomplices. The victim had a police record for drug trafficking and had been receiving death threats. Police believe his killing was motivated by rivalries between drug trafficking groups. 1 fatality.

On 25 June 2023, in Campo Maior (Piaui), a man was shot to death in the Cidade Nova neighborhood by an armed suspect. Police stated the victim had criminal records for drug trafficking and homicide. The motivation behind the attack and its perpetrators are still under investigation. 1 fatality.

actor2: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
notes: On 25 June 2023, in Maceio (Alagoas), there was a shoot-out between the military police and armed suspects in the Cleto Marques Luz Complex after a police search attempt. Four suspects were shot and killed during the clash. 4 fatalities.

On 25 June 2023, in Parauapebas (Para), an armed individual chased after a man in the Vila Rica neighborhood. The target of the attack was shot and injured. The perpetrator, with the aid of an accomplice, also stabbed the victim to death. The deceased had a police record for domestic violence, homicide, and drug trafficking. 1 fatality.

On 25 June 2023, in Porto de Moz (Para), a woman was injured in a drive-by shooting by two armed individuals on a motorcycle. There are no reports on the identity of the perpetrators or the attack's motivation. There were no fatalities.

On 25 June 2023, in Presidente Prudente (Sao Paulo), two armed suspects passing by in a vehicle opened fire and severely injured a man with several shots in the Vila Marina neighborhood (drive-by). There were no fatalities.

source: G1; Globo Extra; O Sao Goncalo; R7
notes: Around 25 June 2023 (as reported), in Rio de Janeiro - West Zone (Rio de Janeiro), a man was shot and killed, and his body was found in his own car, with hands and feet tied in the Bangu neighborhood. The car had been parked in front of his house. 1 fatality.

On 25 June 2023, between the cities of Sapezal and Campos de Julio (Mato Grosso), more than 400 Enawene-nawe Indigenous people carried out a protest against a hydroelectric power plant built in the area. Private security dispersed the demonstrators with rubber bullets, and at least 20 Indigenous people were injured. Some vehicles from the demonstrators were either destroyed or seized.

On 25 June 2023, in Salvador - Suburbio/Ilhas (Bahia), a boy was killed by drug traffickers and his body was found with signs of torture in the Praia Grande neighborhood. The victim was delivering food in the Peripero and Mirantes neighborhoods the night before his death when he was abducted by the same armed suspects and his body was found the day after. Witnesses stated the attack was linked to rivalry between the Bonde do Maluco (BDM) and Red Command (CV) gangs. 1 fatality.

On 25 June 2023, in Rio de Janeiro - West Zone (Rio de Janeiro), family members, friends, and residents held a protest in the Realengo neighborhood. The protesters demanded justice for the death of a girl from medical negligence.

On 25 June 2023, in Sao Luis (Maranhao), four people were shot outside a local bar in the Estiva neighborhood by at least seven armed suspects in a car and on a motorcycle, who opened fire severely injuring three of the victims, among them a minor, and injuring another who was taken to the hospital, and fled after the attack. The victims did not have criminal records. The motivation behind the attack and its perpetrators are unknown. 3 fatalities.

On 25 June 2023, in Tres Rios (Rio de Janeiro), two armed suspects passing by on a motorcycle shot and killed two men in the Mirante Sul locality (drive-by). The motivation of the event is not known. 2 fatalities.

On 25 June 2023, in the rural area of Tucuma municipality (Para), a man was killed in a drive-by shooting in the Matadouro region by armed individuals on a motorcycle. After killing the victim, the suspects beheaded the body, threw the body in a well and placed the head on a spike. The attack occurred after the victim accused one of the perpetrators of robbery. Three suspects were arrested on 26 June 2023. 1 fatality.

Property destruction: On 25 June 2023, in Inspector Fernandez (Araucania), four hooded individuals set a car on fire on Route R-71. The identity of perpetrators is unknown but Indigenous Militias are often responsible for similar attacks in the Araucania region.

On 25 June 2023, in Santiago (Metropolitana), more than 180,000 members of the LGBTQ+ community gathered at Italia square and marched towards the city center in the 2023 Pride March. Protesters demanded a more egalitarian country free of discrimination, and marched in memory of people killed because of their sexual orientation, gender identity or expression. The Homosexual Integration and Liberation Movement (Movilh) organized the march and demanded the National Congress to approve the reform of the Zamudio Law.

On 25 June 2023, in Cusco (Cusco), residents and family members of a young man that was killed and found dismembered staged a demonstration in Mayor square to demand authorities a faster investigation and find the whole body, as only parts have been found.

source: Correo del Caroni; El Diario de Guayana; La Patilla

source: Cactus 24; Diario Version Final (Venezuela); La Voz
notes: On 25 June 2023, in Caracas - Libertador (Distrito Capital), two unidentified crime group suspects beat, shot and killed a man that was working in a fast food stand, in an attack in the Baralt Avenue. The suspects arrived on scene on a motorcycle, dismounted, struck the victim several times on the head with their guns, shot him, and then fled the area. It is suspected that the killing is a settling of scores, possibly involving criminal group activity. 1 fatality.

On 25 June 2023, in Caracas - Baruta (Miranda), a group of residents of the Colinas de Bello Monte neighborhood protested against the poor street conditions, the deterioration of essential services, and insecurity they suffer in their sector. The protest took place during an official event in the Oberon Square organized by the Baruta Townhall and the Embassy of Argentina.
On 25 June 2023, in El Danto (Zulia), a group of drivers blocked the Troncal 17 Lara - Zulia Highway in protest over fuel scarcity. The roadblock was staged by the Palma Zuliana petrol station.

On 25 June 2023, in Feira de Santana (Bahia), a man was shot multiple times and killed by at least two individuals in the Diadema neighborhood. The police claim the target was linked to drug trafficking gangs in Itatim. Identity of perpetrators and motivations are unknown. 1 fatality.

On 25 June 2023, in Cabedelo (Paraiba), a man was shot and killed by in a drive-by shooting by three armed suspects in the Jacare neighbourhood. Identity of perpetrates are unknown, but the victim was a suspect of homicide and the police claim the attack might have been motivated by a score settlement. 1 fatality.

On 25 June 2023, between Saravena and Arauquita municipalities (coded to Arauquita, Arauca), a Venezuelan man was kidnapped by unidentified individuals. The victim was released on 6 July. It is believed that the ELN was behind the kidnapping.

On 25 June 2023, in Manaus - South Zone (Amazonas), a suspected thief was shot and killed on the Quintino Bocaiuva street by three drug traffickers. One suspect was arrested on 11 July 2023. 1 fatality.

On 25 June 2023, in Novo Hamburgo (Rio Grande do Sul), two drug users were shot in the hands and injured in the Primavera neighborhood by a drug trafficker due to a drug debt. The drug trafficker was arrested on 6 July 2023. There were no fatalities.

On 24 June 2023, in Belize City, Belize, unidentified attackers shot and killed a man in the Saint Martin area. The source indicate that the attack is related to gang-rivalry. No more detail is provided by the source. 1 fatality.

On 24 June 2023, in Guatemala City, Guatemala, unidentified attackers shot and killed a moto taxi driver in colonia Hermano Pedro in zone 25. The motivation for the attack is unknown. No more detail is provided by the source. 1 fatality.

On 24 June 2023, in San Jose del Golfo, Guatemala, local residents attacked people traveling in three buses, claiming that they were people who had been brought from other places to vote. Police fired tear gas at the rioters and a clash between rioters and officers ensued. The clashes continued until the following day (coded separately). Due to the riots, elections were suspended in this location. There were no fatalities.

source: La Hora (Guatemala); La Republica (Guatemala); Prensa Comunitaria
notes: On 24 June 2023, in San Martin Zapotitlan, Retalhuleu, around 200 rioters from the Cabal political party set fire to ballots to prevent voters from other departments from being brought to the polling station to vote. Clashes were reported between rioters and police (methods unknown), and nine people received tear gas. One of the reports indicates that the rioters were women. 11 people were arrested.

On 24 June 2023, in Puerto Cortes, Cortes, a group of armed individual attacked a group of mototaxi drivers who answered the attack in La Roca sector. Three people were injured and 1 killed. 1 fatality

source: El Heraldo (Honduras); El Pais (Honduras); La Prensa (Honduras)

On 24 June 2023, in Santa Rita, Santa Barbara, unidentified armed men on a motorcycle shot and killed a 16 year-old (drive-by). The reason for the killing is unknown. 1 fatality.

On 24 June 2023, in Colon, Colon, lawyers, teachers, students, homemaker, and local politicians participated in a demonstration to demand a reduction in the electricity fare. Protesters argued that the new fares are abusive.

source: El Mundo (El Salvador); El Salvador.com; La Prensa Grafica

Protesters demanded that authorities approve an identity law and denounced the increase in violence against members of the LGBT community.

On 24 June 2023, in Icoaraci (Belem, Para), a man was shot at least 20 times and killed in the Cruzeiro neighborhood by unknown armed individuals. The victim had been receiving death threats. However, the individual's involvement in this militia have not been confirmed. 1 fatality.

On 24 June 2023, in Itanhaem (Sao Paulo), unknown perpetrators killed a woman, and her body was found in her apartment with her arms and legs tied, and her head covered. The victim had struggled physically against the attacker. 1 fatality.

On 24 June 2023, in Jacunda (Para), a man was killed in a drive-by shooting in the Boa Esperanca neighborhood by two armed individuals on a motorcycle. There are no reports on the identity of the perpetrators or the attack's motivation. 1 fatality.

On 24 June 2023, in Salvador - Pau de Lima (Bahia), there was an intense shoot-out between unknown shooters in the Vale dos Lagos neighborhood. One person was shot and killed during the clash and another was injured. It was unknown whether the victims were involved in the clash. 1 fatality.

Around 24 June 2023 (as reported), in Manaus - West Zone (Amazonas), a man was killed by unknown individuals and his body was found in the Taruma neighborhood with gunshot wounds, signs of torture, and with his hands tied up. Circumstances of death are unknown. 1 fatality.

With the suspects police seized two firearms, ammunition, and drugs. 2 fatalities.

On 24 June 2023, in Palmas (Tocantins), a man was killed in a drive-by shooting in the Morada do Sol 2 sector by four armed individuals on two motorcycles. The victim had been the target of a previous killing attempt (unknown circumstances). Authorship and motivation of the attack are unknown. 1 fatality.

On 24 June 2023, in Pocos de Caldas (Minas Gerais), unknown armed individuals opened fire against two siblings in the Cascatinha neighborhood. One of them died. Both had a police record for several offences, including drug trafficking. 1 fatality.

Around 24 June 2023 (as reported), in Porto Alegre (Rio Grande do Sul), a person was killed and dismembered by unknown individuals and their body parts were found inside a plastic bag in the Cascata neighborhood. The victim's torso was also partially burnt. Circumstances of death are unknown. 1 fatality.

notes: On 24 June 2023, in Recife (Pernambuco), there was a shoot-out between a prison guard officer and at least one armed suspect in the Dois Unidos neighborhood. The officer and the suspect were shot and injured during the clash and were taken to the hospital but the officer did not survive the injuries. The suspect was later arrested. A woman was also injured by a stray bullet and was also taken to a health care unit. 1 fatality.
On 24 June 2023, in Santo Antonio da Platina (Parana), two individuals blew up a bank. No valuables were taken and the pair fled after the explosion.

notes: Property destruction: On 24 June 2023, in Sao Jose do Rio Preto (Sao Paulo), federal highway police seized around 3 tons of marijuana hidden in a load of cotton feathers. The driver was arrested for drug trafficking.

notes: Around 24 June 2023 (weekend of), in Sao Paulo - South Zone (Sao Paulo), several armed suspects exchanged fire with military police officers during a four-kilometer vehicle chase that ended in the Jabaquara neighborhood. Two suspects were arrested. There were no fatalities.

actor2: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
notes: On 24 June 2023, in Teresina (Piaui), military police forces exchanged fire with four armed suspects in the Ceramica Cil locality after a police search attempt to which the suspects responded shooting against the officers. Four of them were shot and injured during the clash and were taken to the hospital, where one of them later died. 1 fatality.

On 24 June 2023, in Cartagena (Valparaiso), an unknown group of people destroyed and robbed a firefighters' mausoleum in the Cartagena Cemetery. Perpetrators carried out a series of damages in the marble and Catholic ornaments, in addition to breaking religious images.
On 24 June 2023, in Cartagena (Bolivar), demonstrators set fire to barricades to block a road near the industrial zone of Mamonal to demand their right to housing. The police dispersed the group.

Non-violent activity: Around 24 June 2023 (as reported), in Bajo Baudo municipality (Choco), an unidentified armed group patrolled several Indigenous reserve areas. The incident followed an armed clash that took place around 21 June (coded separately).
Around 24 June 2023 (as reported), in Bucaramanga (Santander), rioters attacked a man suspected of committing a robbery. The victim was beaten before being handed over to police officers.

On 24 June 2023, in Loja (Loja), LGBTQ+ residents marched through the city to San Sebastian square against discrimination and to demand equal labor opportunities to their community. This demonstration was held as commemoration of the International Pride Day.

On 24 June 2023, in Asuncion (Asuncion), a group of residents at the San Cristobal and Villa Mora neighborhood held a demonstration against the loud noises generated by commercial establishments in the area. Demonstrators claimed that they can not sleep because of these noises. They demanded solutions from authorities.

On 24 June 2023, in Nemby (Central), a group of residents demonstrated outside the mayor's house against the decision of the mayor to close the road that goes to his private residence. Demonstrators also denounced irregularities in public bidding processes. They also demanded school lunches for students at public schools. They demanded the resignation of the mayor as well. Demonstrators clashed with the police.

On 24 June 2023, in Buenos Aires (Ancash), dozens of parents of El Salitre school of Caceres district staged a demonstration outside the Santa Local Education Management Unit to demand the destitution of the manager of the entity due to poor management and lack of accountability.

On 24 June 2023, in Lima - Lima District (Lima), hundreds of students, members of citizens' movements, politicians (unspecified) and residents marched through Abancay avenue to San Martin square as a demonstration to demand the closure of congress, calling for general elections, and for the resignation of President Dina Boluarte. During the demonstration, residents clashed with police officers.

source: Correo del Caroni; El Diario de Guayana; La Patilla
notes: On 24 June 2023, in El Callao (Bolivar), for the second consecutive day, a group of approximately 30 miners and residents continued blocking the Troncal 10 road in protest over the arrest of nine artisanal miners by DGCIM military forces, in unclear circumstances. The protesters demand their liberation. The roadblock was staged in the La Increible sector.

On 24 June 2023, in El Tucuco (Zulia), a group of Yukpa Indigenous people demonstrated and hurled hats at the Deputy Minister for Indigenous Peoples, and then there was a minor scruffle between the group and her entourage, during a meeting that was being held at the Irapa School to discuss the selling of Yukpa Indigenous handcrafted objects to the authorities. The turmoil began when the Deputy Minister announced that they would be paying 3 USD apiece instead of 5 USD, as previously agreed. Following the incident, an audio surfaced threatening to restrain the government delegation from leaving the area, but this did not actually occurr, and GNB military forces escorted the delegation from the area.

source: El Heraldo (Honduras); La Prensa (Honduras); La Tribuna (Honduras)
notes: On 24 June 2023, in Choloma, Cortes, various unidentified armed men dressed in police clothing shot and killed a group of union leaders and factory workers in a billiards establishment in Victoria neighborhood, Oswaldo Lopez Arellano area. 11 people died immediately and four were injured, two of them died later in the hospital. Their death seems to be related to complaints made after announcements of closure of the maquila. Police has arrested five suspects members of the B-18 Gang who were involved in this attack. 13 fatalities.

source: Bahia 190; Folha do Estado da Bahia; G1; Meio Norte
notes: On 24 June 2023, in Feira de Santana (Bahia), two teenage girls were tortured, shot and killed by gang members after being mistaken for individuals who lived in an area controlled by a rival group. 2 fatalities.

On 23 June 2023, in Guatemala City, Guatemala, two armed men on a motorcycle shot and injured two women who were standing in a bus stop in colonia Atlantida in zone 18, in a drive-by shooting incident. The motivation for the attack is unknown. 2 injured.

On 23 June 2023, in Le Larivot, Cayenne, 30 employees protested in front of the Air France company facilities to decry the lack of qualified staff, as most of the contracts are for interns. The protest was part of a labor strike.

On 23 June 2023, in San Pedro Sula, Cortes, several unidentified armed men on a motorcycle shot and killed a man in the La Guardia neighborhood while he stopped with his car at the traffic lights (drive-by). The reason for the killing is unknown. 1 fatality.

On 23 June 2023, in Tocoa, Colon, a group of residents from the municipality of Salama protested outside the city courts demanding justice for the recent killing of a young woman during a birthday party in their community.

On 23 June 2023, in Tecoluca municipality, San Vicente, members of the military forces arrested a farmer, and member of the Movement for the Defense of the Tecolucan Lands (MDT) as part of the so-called 'War on Gangs' operation. The detainee was arrested in the Guajoyo community. This arrest was carried out after the entry into force of the State of Exception approved by the Legislative Assembly at the request of President Bukele.

On 23 June 2023, in Avellaneda (Buenos Aires), workers at private security companies protested blocking the Dario Santillan and Maximiliano Kosteki train station demanding to become part of the permanent staff.

On 23 June 2023, in La Plata - Lisandro Olmos (Buenos Aires), residents protested blocking 44 avenue at 173 street demanding citizen security. Protesters stated they are tired of robberies and demanded more police presence.

On 23 June 2023, in Sucre (Chuquisaca), unionized workers of Concretec company, subsidiary of Fancesa, from Santa Cruz staged a demonstration outside the Fancesa board of directors offices to demand accountability about the future of their company, which is going through financial difficulties.

On 23 June 2023, in Santa Fe (Santa Cruz), residents and students of different schools marched through the city as a demonstration to demand justice in the case of a male student that was sexually assaulted and killed by a man, and demanding a change in judges and police offices so the man can receive an according sentence.

On 23 June 2023, in Capinota (Cochabamba), land squatters from Sarco Cucho blocked the entrances to three milk farms with stones as a demonstration to demand authorities sign a document in which the farms owners would have to give their land deeds to the residents. According to a farm owner, they beat up milk farm workers and their family members when they were attempting to take control of lands.

On 23 June 2023, in Puerto Pailas (Santa Cruz), residents blocked the Bioceanic highway bridge in the city as a demonstration to demand authorities finish the construction of the Okinawa Uno - Parque Industrial highway.
On 23 June 2023, in Okinawa Uno (Santa Cruz), residents blocked Banegas bridge as a demonstration to demand authorities finish the construction of the Okinawa Uno - Parque Industrial highway.
On 23 June 2023, in Brasilia (Distrito Federal), fishers carried out a protest against the approval of a bill that aims to suspend certain fishing activities for five years in Mato Grosso state.

On 23 June 2023, in Rio de Janeiro - Central Zone (Rio de Janeiro), civil society, Indigenous communities (unspecified), and residents held a protest in the Cinelandia neighborhood, resisting governmental cuts to the environmental protection.

On 23 June 2023, in Joao Pessoa (Paraiba), a man was shot to death inside his house in the Alto do Ceu neighborhood by at least two armed suspects who broke into the victim's house and opened fire while the victim was asleep. Police say the victim was a drug user. The motivation behind the attack and its perpetrators are unknown. 1 fatality.

On 23 June 2023, in Manaus - North Zone (Amazonas), a man was shot and killed in the Novo Aleixo neighborhood by an armed individual. The victim used to belong to a gang, but had abandoned that lifestyle. The victim had been the target of three previous killing attempts (circumstances not reported). 1 fatality.

On 23 June 2023, in Rondonopolis (Mato Grosso), three people were shot and injured in the Jardim Belo Horizonte neighborhood by members of a drug trafficking group. The group was looking for a specific person, but since he was not found they attacked the victims instead.

actor1: Police Forces of Brazil (2023-) Federal Police
notes: Property destruction: On 23 June 2023, in Cascavel (Parana), federal police seized 3,004kg of marijuana hidden inside a truck during an inspection on the BR-277 highway. The police also seized two riffles and ammunition. A person was arrested.
On 23 June 2023, in Duque de Caxias (Rio de Janeiro), unknown shooters exchanged fire in the Jardim Primavera neighborhood. Unknown casualties.
Around 23 June 2023 (as reported), in Nova Iguacu (Rio de Janeiro), unknown perpetrators killed a man. His body was found on train tracks with signs of torture. 1 fatality.
On 23 June 2023, in Rio de Janeiro - Central Zone (Rio de Janeiro), unknown shooters exchanged fire in the Rio Comprido neighborhood. Unknown casualties.

On 23 June 2023, in Rio de Janeiro - North Zone (Rio de Janeiro), unknown shooters exchanged fire in the Cidade Alta community, Cordovil neighborhood, the Quitungo community, Bras de Pina neighborhood, and in the Morro do Barbante community, Ilha do Governador neighborhood. Shooting was also heard in the Campinho, Meier, Del Castilho, and Penha neighborhoods. Unknown casualties.
On 23 June 2023, in Rio de Janeiro - West Zone (Rio de Janeiro), unknown shooters exchanged fire in the Praca Seca, Recreio dos Bandeirantes and Cidade de Deus neighborhoods. Unknown casualties.

On 23 June 2023, in Aracatuba (Sao Paulo), two armed suspects broke into a home, shot, and killed a man and a woman, and fled on a motorcycle in the area around the Jardim Brasil and Vila Industrial neighborhoods. 2 fatalities.

actor2: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
notes: On 23 June 2023, in Campinas (Sao Paulo), a military police officer was hit in the head with a brick while making an arrest of a suspected drug trafficker in the Jardim Paranapanema neighborhood. An armed confrontation then took place involving other suspects who arrived to prevent the arrest, and they opened fire. The officer was treated for his injuries and one suspect was fatally shot. Large quantities of drugs and weapons were seized from the suspect's home, and at least two occupants of the home were arrested. 1 fatality.

actor2: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
notes: On 23 June 2023, in Sao Jose dos Campos (Sao Paulo), two armed suspects exchanged fire with military police officers outside a nightclub in the city center. One suspect was shot and injured and the other fled. There were no fatalities.

On 23 June 2023, in San Antonio (Valparaiso), more than 100 residents of the Placilla irregular occupation gathered at city hall demanding a measure to the lack of electric supply. On the corner of Uno Norte street and Barros Luco street, a group of people set a tire on fire and demonstrated in the parking lot of the city hall.

On 23 June 2023, in Arica (Arica y Parinacota), nearly 200 unionized fishing industry workers gathered at Arica Port and marched towards the Presidential Delegation building demanding the Government to declare the Fishing Catastrophe Zone in order to face the economic crisis. Protesters stated that they have been six months without being able to fish due to bad weather among other problems that are affecting more than 400 families from the whole industry.

Around 23 June 2023 (as reported), in Ocana (Norte de Santander), a group of demonstrators, including residents and merchants, protested to demand the liberation of two merchants abducted in recent weeks (coded separately), and against the insecurity they suffer.

On 23 June 2023, in the rural area of Altaquer corregimiento (Narino), an Awa Indigenous man was killed, and five other people were injured, by the detonation of a landmine planted by armed groups around the Vegas Chagui Chimbuza Indigenous Reserve. The area is known for the presence of armed groups. 1 fatality.

Around 23 June 2023 (as reported), in Cartagena del Chaira municipality (Caqueta), several armed individuals shot and killed a farmer, after dragging him out of his house in a rural area of the municipality. There is no further information on the identity or the motivations of the perpetrators, but the area is known for the presence of armed groups. 1 fatality.

On 23 June 2023, in Cucuta - East (Norte de Santander), two unidentified armed suspects on motorcycles opened fire on a man driving a vehicle, in a drive-by shooting in the San Luis neighborhood. The victim, a shoe shop owner, was headed to the San Mateo neighborhood when he was intercepted by the suspects. The man was injured in the gunfire, but managed to drive towards the local police station where he was assisted by officials. The identity of the perpetrators was not established but the area is known for the presence of armed groups that carry out extortion threats on local business owners.

source: El Colombiano; El Espectador; El Pais (Colombia); El Tiempo (Colombia)
notes: On 23 June 2023, in Santa Luisa (El Cerrito, Valle del Cauca), military forces clashed with unidentified armed group suspects, during an armed confrontation in a rural area known as the El Fuerte estate. When the exchange of fire began, the military units were escorting a group of journalists that were covering an official event in the area, but they were all put to safety. The armed confrontation lasted two hours. Casualties unknown.

Around 23 June 2023 (as reported), in Medellin - Central West (Antioquia), a vigilante group of residents of the Laureles neighborhood beat and immobilized a man who they accused of attempting to carry out a theft. Police were called on scene and proceeded to arrest the man and transport him to hospital for treatment.

On 23 June 2023, in Cusco province (Cusco), local residents marched as a demonstration to demand the closure of congress, calling for general elections, and for the resignation of President Dina Boluarte. The demonstration was carried out during the Inti Raymi celebrations.

On 23 June 2023, in Lima - Lima District (Lima), supporters of former president Pedro Castillo staged a demonstration outside the Judicial Power offices to demand the closure of congress, calling for general elections, and for the resignation of President Dina Boluarte.

source: OVCS: Observatorio Venezolano de Conflictividad Social
notes: On 23 June 2023, in Anzoategui state (coded to Barcelona), demonstrators protested with unspecified demands on issues related to labor, housing, justice, water, and political participation.

source: OVCS: Observatorio Venezolano de Conflictividad Social
notes: On 23 June 2023, in Sucre state (coded to Cumana), demonstrators protested with unspecified demands on issues related to labor, housing, justice, water, and political participation.

On 23 June 2023, in El Limon (Monagas), for the second consecutive day, a group of residents blocked the local road in protest to demand its paving, and an improvement in street lighting and drinking water supply. Traffic was blocked during several hours.

source: OVCS: Observatorio Venezolano de Conflictividad Social
notes: On 23 June 2023, in Miranda state (coded to Los Teques), demonstrators protested with unspecified demands on issues related to labor, housing, justice, water, and political participation.

source: OVCS: Observatorio Venezolano de Conflictividad Social
notes: On 23 June 2023, in Carabobo state (coded to Valencia), demonstrators protested with unspecified demands on issues related to labor, housing, justice, water, and political participation.

assoc_actor_2: Unidentified Communal Group (Colombia); JAC: Council of Communal Action; Former Government of Colombia (2022-)
notes: Around 23 June 2023, in Tello municipality (Huila), a social leader, former elected councilman, and actual president of the local JAC body, was shot and killed, and his body found in a rural area known as the La Batea sector, Mesa Redonda vereda. The victim had been dragged out of the vehicle in which he was travelling alone, and was shot and killed nearby. The identity of the perpetrators is unknown, but there is presence of ELN and FARC Second Marquetalia in the area. 1 fatality.
On 23 June 2023, in Guatemala City, Guatemala, two armed men shot and killed the driver of a garbage collector truck in zone 16. Police believe the attack could be related to extortion. 1 fatality.

Around 23 June 2023 (as reported), in Melchor de Mencos, Peten, a man was killed and his body was found in El Mirador neighborhood. The corpse was partially charred. No more detail is provided by the source. 1 fatality.

On 23 June 2023, in Georgetown, Demerara-Mahaica, for the second consecutive day, members of the Red Thread Women Organization, led by the United Bridge Builder's Mission movement (UBBM), held a protest with banners in front of the office of the Director of Public Prosecutions (DPP) to demand justice for the victim of alleged rape by the Minister of Local Government and Regional Development in 2022 (coded separately).

On 23 June 2023, in San Pedro Sula, Cortes, according to witnesses, a group of unidentified armed men dressed in police clothing broke into a home in the San Jose neighborhood and kidnapped a woman. The whereabouts of the victim is unknown.

On 23 June 2023, around Purmamarca municipality (Jujuy), members of an Indigenous group blocked the highway to protest against the extraction of lithium and the constitutional reform approved by the provincial legislature which limits the right to protest. They also demanded the resignation of the governor and to stop the persecution of Indigenous people.

On 23 June 2023, in San Miguel de Tucuman (Tucuman), more than 30 former workers at the Provincial Mutual Organization protested at the premises of the institution because they were fired without cause. They claimed they were fired for political reasons.

actor1: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
notes: On 23 June 2023, in Rio Largo (Alagoas), a man was shot to death by military police forces in the Cruzeiro do Sul neighborhood during police patrol in the area. The victim was throwing stones at cars and police forces tried to approach him but he reacted to the search and was shot to death. Witnesses stated the officers approached the man with excessive violence and that the victim was had psychiatric problems. 1 fatality.

actor1: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
notes: On 23 June 2023, in Capanema (Para), a drug trafficking suspect exchanged fire with military police during an operation in the Jose Rodrigues housing complex. The suspect was killed. 1 fatality.

On 23 June 2023, in Rio de Janeiro - North Zone (Rio de Janeiro), nursing professionals held a protest outside the Bonsucesso General Hospital, in the Bonsucesso neighborhood. The workers demand the application of a national minimum wage for the profession.

actor1: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
notes: Property destruction: On 23 June 2023, in Lajeado (Rio Grande do Sul), military police seized 1.2 tons of marijuana hidden inside an abandoned warehouse in the Morro 25 neighborhood during an operation. No arrests were made.

On 23 June 2023, in Belem (Para), a teenage girl was shot and killed in the Guama neighborhood by an armed individual who then fled with an accomplice on a motorcycle. The victim was a drug user and two days before her killing she was beaten up by unknown individuals after giving away the location of a drug trafficking spot. 1 fatality.

On 23 June 2023, in Santana (Amapa), a man was shot and killed in the Provedor neighborhood by four armed individuals. The deceased had a police record for robbery, and had returned to the city the day before being killed. Police believe he was killed by members of a drug trafficking group. 1 fatality.
On 23 June 2023, in Angra dos Reis (Rio de Janeiro), several armed suspects passing by on a motorcycle shot and killed a man in the Parque Belem neighborhood (drive-by). 1 fatality.

On 23 June 2023, in Feira de Santana (Bahia), a man was shot to death in a drive-by shooting in the Conceicao neighborhood by two armed suspects in a motorcycle who fled after the attack. The motivation behind the attack and its perpetrators are unknown. 1 fatality.

On 23 June 2023, in Salvador - Suburbio/Ilhas (Bahia), there was a shoot-out between unknown shooters in the Fazenda Coutos neighborhood. A woman was shot and injured by a stray bullet and was taken to the hospital but did not survive the injuries. 1 fatality.

On 23 June 2023, in Manaus - North Zone (Amazonas), a woman was killed in a drive-by shooting in the Mutirao neighborhood by four armed individuals on two motorcycles. Authorship and motivation of the attack are unknown. 1 fatality.

On 23 June 2023, in Presidente Prudente (Sao Paulo), residents attacked an intoxicated driver in an attempted lynching after he ran over a child in the Parque Residencial Francisco Belo Galindo community. The target was injured, and the attackers also set fire to his vehicle. There were no fatalities.

On 23 June 2023, in Sao Joaquim de Bicas (Minas Gerais), a drug trafficker was shot and killed by armed individuals in the context of territorial disputes between rival drug trafficking groups. 1 fatality.

source: Massa News; O Popular do Parana; Tamandare Noticias
notes: On 23 June 2023, in Araucaria (Parana), a woman was shot and killed inside a bar in the Iguacu neighborhood by two armed individuals. The victim had a police record for drug trafficking and had been receiving death threats. 1 fatality.

actor2: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
notes: On 23 June 2023, in Cabo Frio (Rio de Janeiro), drug traffickers exchanged fire with military police during an operation in the Monte Alegre neighborhood. Police were dismantling camps used for drug trafficking in a wooded area, seizing drugs, documents, tents, camouflage clothes, and other camping equipment. The suspects escaped. There were no fatalities.

Around 23 June 2023 (as reported), in Ribas do Rio Pardo (Mato Grosso do Sul), a man was killed by unknown individuals and his body was found near a stream with signs of violence and a gunshot wound to the back of the head. Circumstances of death are unknown. 1 fatality.

On 23 June 2023, in Sao Leopoldo (Rio Grande do Sul), a man was shot 30 times and killed in the Santos Dumont neighborhood by three or four armed individuals. The victim had left prison that day, where he had served time for homicide and drug trafficking. The victim's mother was injured by stray bullets. There are no reports on the identity of the perpetrators. 1 fatality.

Around 23 June 2023 (as reported), in Sinop (Mato Grosso), a man was killed by unknown individuals and his body was found in a swamp with gunshot wounds and with his hands and feet tied up. Circumstances of death are unknown. 1 fatality.

On 23 June 2023, in Cartagena (Bolivar), a group of workers and residents at the Mamonal industrial sector blocked the Carretera a Mamonal Road in protest to demand the companies operating there to source their workforce locally and demanding housing rights. The protest was staged by the Policarpa sector. Police physically dispersed the group and removed them from the road.

Property destruction: Around 23 June 2023 (as reported), in the rural area of Caloto municipality (Cauca), hooded men trespassed a private property and set fire to the protected area Hacienda Japio. The perpetrators left a flag referring to environmental protection and calling themselves the 'Grandchildren of Manuel Lame'.

Around 23 June 2023 (as reported), in the rural area of Buenavista municipality (Cordoba), Gulf Clan militants clashed with military soldiers. The two men opened fire from a motorcycle. Following the drive-by shooting, security forces detained them. One of the detainees is a suspect in the murder of a former soldier who was decapitated around 25 May (coded separately). The military collected weapons from the suspects. There were no fatalities.

On 23 June 2023, in Altaquer (Narino), Indigenous people blocked the road for the third consecutive day to protest against increased violence against community members by armed groups. The group gathered after the explosion of a land mine (coded separately) and an armed confrontation (coded separately) affected several members of the ethnic group.

source: Diario del Sur (Colombia); El Pais (Colombia); UNOCHA
notes: On 23 June 2023, in the rural area of Ricaurte municipality (Narino), an Indigenous Awa was injured and later died, and two more were injured when one of them stepped on an anti-personnel mine planted by an unidentified armed group near the La Cuchilla area in the Resguardo de Vegas Chagui Chimbuza. The victim died due to the severity of the injuries. 1 fatality.

source: Correo del Caroni; Diario Primicia; El Diario de Guayana; La Patilla
notes: On 23 June 2023, in El Callao (Bolivar), a group of approximately 30 miners and residents blocked the Troncal 10 road in protest over the arrest of nine artisanal miners by DGCIM military forces, in unclear circumstances, the day before. The protesters demand their liberation. The roadblock was staged in the La Increible sector.

assoc_actor_1: Police Forces of Venezuela (1999-) CPNB: National Bolivarian Police; Military Forces of Venezuela (1999-) GNB: Venezuelan National Guard
notes: On 23 June 2023, in the rural area of Santa Elena (Union, Falcon), a joint unit of Falcon state and PNB police, as well as GNB military forces, clashed with members of the Los Chicateros Gang, during an armed confrontation. The security forces encountered the suspects by a house, and a shooting ensued. One of the gunmen was arrested, the rest managed to escape. Police collected a gun. There were no casualties.

On 22 June 2023, in Georgetown, Demerara-Mahaica, members of the Amerindian People's Association (APA) and the Red Thread Women Organization held a protest with banners in front of the Arthur Chung Conference Centre (ACC) to demand justice for the victim of an alleged rape by the Minister of Local Government and Regional Development in 2022 (coded separately).

On 22 June 2023, in El Progreso, Yoro, a group of workers from farms that have been recently invaded by peasant groups occupied the La Democracia bridge in protest. They demanded government intervention to resolve this pressing land issue.
Around 22 June 2023, in La Ceiba, Atlantida, a man was killed and his body was found tied up in a vacant lot in the Marisol neighborhood. The reason for the killing is unknown. 1 fatality.

On 22 June 2023, in San Pedro Sula, Cortes, around eight unidentified armed men shot and killed the former wife of a deceased drug trafficker, and her two security guards in a bakery in the Rio de Pedras neighborhood. The woman had been previously incarcerated for money laundering. The reason for the killing is unknown. 3 fatalities.

On 22 June 2023, in Santa Cruz de Yojoa, Cortes, two unidentified armed men forcefully took a father and his son away from their home and shot and killed them. The reason for the killing is unknown. 2 fatalities.

On 22 June 2023, in Comayaguela, Francisco Morazan, various unidentified armed men shot and killed a man after breaking into his home in the Altos de la Laguna neighborhood. The reason for the killing is unknown. 1 fatality.

On 22 June 2023, in Tegucigalpa, Francisco Morazan, two unidentified armed men shot and killed a man in a parking near a local supermarket in the La Concordia neighborhood. The reason for the killing is unknown. 1 fatality.

On 22 June 2023, in Tepusteca, Yoro, two unidentified armed men shot and killed an elderly woman and her niece after breaking into their home. The reason for the killing is unknown. Police forces arrested one of the assailants on the following day. 2 fatalities.

Property destruction: On 22 June 2023, in Olanchito municipality, Yoro, military forces seized a marijuana plantation in the protected area of the Yoro National Park containing approximately 15,000 individual marijuana plants spread over five hectares of land near the San Jeronimo community.

On 22 June 2023, in La Ceiba, Atlantida, a group of parents from the Fraternidad school in the Bonitillo neighborhood occupied the Departmental Education Authority in rejection of the assignment of new teachers demanding instead the assignment of teachers that are familiar and known to them.

On 22 June 2023, in Bonito Oriental, Colon, a group of residents of El Antigual took to the roads and blocked the passage between the departments of Colon and Olancho to protest against the lack of electricity in the past 10 days. The protesters demanded an immediate solution to the problem, as their products have been damaged due to the prolonged power outage.

On 22 June 2023, in Panama City, Panama, retirees and pensioners affiliated with the organization FECHA staged a protest in solidarity with oncology patients at the National Oncology Institute (ION). The protesters argued that there are not enough medicines for people suffering from cancer. Later in the day, they marched to the Supreme Court of Justice to demand that the court rule on a bill related to the illegal withholding of salaries of public servants and private sector workers.

assoc_actor_1: ATE: Association of State Workers; Labor Group (Argentina)
notes: On 22 June 2023, near San Carlos de Bariloche commune (Rio Negro), individuals members of ATE blocked national route 22 and the provincial route 6 in protest against police repression in the Jujuy region (coded separately) after the recently approved constitutional reform that changes the protest regulations, among other things.

On 22 June 2023, in Villa Dolores (Catamarca), public sector workers protested blocking the traffic on Presidente Castillo roundabout near the Tres Puentes sector with salary demands for the second consecutive day. Protesters stated they suffer labor persecution.

assoc_actor_1: CTA-A: Argentine Workers' Central Union - Autonomous; ATE: Association of State Workers; Labor Group (Argentina); CCC: Class Combat Movement; Evita Movement; PCR: Revolutionary Communist Party; Students (Argentina); Indigenous Group (Argentina); CTERA: Confederation of Education Workers of the Republic of Argentina; Teachers (Argentina)
notes: On 22 June 2023, in Santa Rosa (La Pampa), several unions, Indigenous people, students, and social organizations gathered at San Martin square and marched towards the city hall against police repression in the Jujuy region (coded separately) after the recently approved constitutional reform that changes the protest regulations, among other things. The CTA-Autonomous, ATE La Pampa, CCC L.P., ADU, Movement Evita L.P, PTP, PCR, JCR, SiTraSaP, Luz y Fuerza L.P., Sataidita L.P. and SiTeP participated in the protest. The Utelpa union also protested in the city, but did not participate in the march for political discrepancies with other unions. Utelpa held an act in front of the union headquarters in the context of the national teachers strike proposed by CTERA in protest against police repression, salary improvements for teachers and rejection of the constitutional reform.

assoc_actor_1: CTA: Argentine Workers' Central Union; Evita Movement; Patria Grande Front; JP: Peronist Youth; Labor Group (Argentina)
notes: On 22 June 2023, in San Luis (San Luis), social organizations and unions gathered at Post Office on Junin street at Ilia street and marched towards the headquarters of the Radical Civic Union against police repression in the Jujuy region (coded separately) after the recently approved constitutional reform that changes the protest regulations, among other things. The march went to San Martin street at Pringles street where they blocked the traffic and carried out some artistic activities. The CTA, Suena el Bajo Artistas, Movimiento Evita, Movimiento Octubre, ASDE, 25 de Mayo Social Organization, ADU, San Luis Independiente, Frente Patria Grande and Juventud Peronist participated in the march.

assoc_actor_1: CTA: Argentine Workers' Central Union; SOEME: Union Of Minority and Education Workers and Employees; Teachers (Argentina); ATE: Association of State Workers; Labor Group (Argentina); Indigenous Group (Argentina)
notes: On 22 June 2023, in Esquel (Chubut), teachers' unions, Indigenous people, and social organizations marched against the police repression in the Jujuy region (coded separately) after the recently approved constitutional reform that changes the protest regulations, among other things. The CTA, Soeme, ATE and ATECh were the unions that participated in the march. The protest took place within the context of the national and provincial strike of education workers.

assoc_actor_1: CTERA: Confederation of Education Workers of the Republic of Argentina; Teachers (Argentina); ATE: Association of State Workers; Labor Group (Argentina)
notes: On 22 June 2023, in San Carlos de Bariloche (Rio Negro), about 200 people members of several unions gathered at Moreno street and at Onelli street and marched towards the Council against police repression in the Jujuy region (coded separately) after the recently approved constitutional reform that changes the protest regulations, among other things. The CTERA, ATE, ADUNC, Unter, ASSPUR and SOYEM unions participated in the protest.

On 22 June 2023, in Villa Mercedes (San Luis), social organizations and unions marched through the streets against police repression in the Jujuy region (coded separately) after the recently approved constitutional reform that changes the protest regulations, among other things.

assoc_actor_1: SADOP: Union of Private Teachers; Teachers (Argentina); AMET: Association of Technical Teaching Institutions
notes: On 22 June 2023, in Rawson (Chubut), unionized teachers with ATECh (Chubut Education Workers Association) marched towards the Ministry of Economy office with salary demands. The Argentine Union of Private Teachers (Sadop) and the Chubut Technical Education Teachers Union (AMET) also participated in the protest.

assoc_actor_1: SADOP: Union of Private Teachers; Teachers (Argentina); Students (Argentina); Catholic Christian Group (Argentina); CCC: Class Combat Movement
notes: On 22 June 2023, in Rosario (Santa Fe), more than 30,000 people including SADOP and CCC unions, students, social, and Catholic organizations marched towards San Martin square against recent violent acts in the city, such as attacks on schools, social clubs, and churches. Protesters demanded concrete measures to the citizen security situation. Several protesters blocked the streets in different points of the city. Protesters also chanted against the police repression in the Jujuy region and demanded freedom for the arrested in the 20 June protests (coded separately).

On 22 June 2023, in San Salvador de Jujuy (Jujuy), social organizations and unions marched through the streets towards the Government building in protest against police repression in the Jujuy region (coded separately) after the recently approved constitutional reform that changes the protest regulations, among other things. Teachers participated in the march and chanted 'Up with wages, down with the reform' in the context of the education workers national strike. Health workers, the Luz y Fuerza union, and La Bancaria also participated in the protest.

assoc_actor_1: UTA: Union of Tramway Workers; Labor Group (Argentina)
notes: On 22 June 2023, in Trelew (Chubut), workers with UTA marched through the streets towards the city hall with salary demands. After the march, UTA and the Argentine Federation of Passenger Automotive Transporters (Fatap) signed a salary agreement and the strike ended.

On 22 June 2023, in Merlo (San Luis), social organizations and unions marched through the streets against police repression in the Jujuy region (coded separately) after the recently approved constitutional reform that changes the protest regulations, among other things.
On 22 June 2023, in San Miguel de Tucuman (Tucuman), locals protested blocking the Lucas Cordoba bridge in protest against the incidents in the Jujuy region (coded separately).

On 22 June 2023, in Cochabamba (Cochabamba), family members and friends of people with autism staged a demonstration outside the metropolitan train station to demand a fair disability identification process for young residents on the autism spectrum.

On 22 June 2023, in Oruro (Oruro), Vito community residents blocked a highway as a demonstration to demand the Oruro Municipal Autonomous Government (GAMO) to enforce their functions against land squatters and illegal constructions in private lands.

On 22 June 2023, in Santa Cruz de la Sierra (Santa Cruz), parents of students of a private school and concerned citizens staged a demonstration outside the school to voice their grievances about a group sexual assault of a student done by five older students. They demanded a swift and fair investigation on the case.

On 22 June 2023, in Santa Fe (Santa Cruz), residents blocked the highway to Santa Cruz as a demonstration to demand justice in the case of a child that was missing for six days and later found dead with sexual assault injuries, and to demand the punishment to the responsible. A group of demonstrators went to the house of the presumed responsible and burned it, while the man's wife and daughters were inside. There were no fatalities.
On 22 June 2023, in Manaus - East Zone (Amazonas), a man suspected of theft was beaten up, shot and killed by residents in the Armando Mendes neighborhood. 1 fatality.

On 22 June 2023, in the rural area of Teotonio Vilela (Alagoas), a man was shot to death inside his house in Abobrera, rural area of the municipality by four armed men who were passing themselves off as police officers and rang the victim's doorbell, and then opened fire killing him. The motivation behind the attack and its per perpetrators are unknown. 1 fatality.

actor2: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
notes: On 22 June 2023, in Maragogi (Alagoas), there was a shoot-out between the military police and a drug trafficker in the Sao Bento locality, rural area of the municipality during a police search approach. The suspect was shot and injured during the clash and was taken to the hospital but did not survive the injuries. With him police seized a firearm, portions of drugs and some cash. 1 fatality.

On 22 June 2023, in Maceio (Alagoas), a group of people, including parents of a municipal daycare center in the Benedito Bentes neighborhood carried out a demonstration by blocking some streets with burning debris, demanding more security in the area after a series of robberies in the area. A group of journalists who were covering the demonstration were attacked by a person on a motorcycle who was trying to pass-by the demonstrators and injured the journalists and a demonstrator by later throwing punches at them. There is no information on the severity of the injuries incurred.

On 22 June 2023, in Salvador - Itapua (Bahia), a group of people, including street vendors who were planning on working in a public event that was going to take place in the city carried out a demonstration in the surroundings of the Exposicoes Park, in the Itapua neighborhood repudiating the short notice of not being able to work in the event.

On 22 June 2023, in Manaus - North Zone (Amazonas), a man was shot at least 17 times and killed in the Cidade de Deus neighborhood by two armed individuals who invaded his private residence. Authorship and motivation of the attack are unknown. 1 fatality.

actor1: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
notes: On 22 June 2023, in Alta Floresta (Mato Grosso), drug traffickers exchanged fire with military police during their arrest operation. Three suspects were killed. Hours later, two more suspects from the same group clashed with police on the MT-325 highway. Both suspects were also killed.
