Around 21 June 2023 (as reported), in Cartagena (Bolivar), about 50 students protested outside a local school to demand infrastructure improvements. Protestors denounced the poor condition of the school's classrooms and the delay on the part of the school authorities to make repairs.

Around 21 June 2023 (as reported), in the rural area of Valledupar municipality (Cesar), a man was killed and his body was found on the Guatapuri River. This is the second body found in less than a week in the same area. Although the perpetrators have not been confirmed, the area is known for the presence of armed groups. 1 fatality.

On 21 June 2023, in Bolivar (Carchi), white and red onion farmers blocked the North Pan-American highway as a demonstration to demand more control of the contraband of these products that are sold cheaper in the country and affect their income.

On 21 June 2023, in Guayaquil (Guayas), dozens of rice farmers staged a demonstration outside the Guayas government offices to demand their rice to be bought instead of importing rice. They claim that big industries are hoarding their products to create scarcity and get the permission of the government of importing rice.

assoc_actor_1: OTEP-SN: Organization of Education Workers of Paraguay National Union; Teachers (Paraguay)
notes: On 21 June 2023, in Concepcion (Concepcion), unionized teachers with OTEP-SN protested demanding the payment of salaries and denounced irregularities in the Departmental Directorate that represents the Ministry of Education. Protesters also demanded measures to control violence in educational institutions.

On 21 June 2023, in Chiclayo (Lambayeque), unionized workers members of the Tax Administration National Superintendence (SUNAT) marched through the city as a demonstration to demand the government fulfill the collective agreements. They also voiced their concern about the budget cuts to finance collective contracts.

On 21 June 2023, in Chimbote (Ancash), workers of the Women and Vulnerable People Ministry Aurora National Program staged a demonstration at Armas square to demand an increase in wages and to improve working conditions.

On 21 June 2023, in Montevideo (Montevideo), unionized teachers marched through the streets demanding salary improvements, better infrastructure and against a cut in the education budget. Teachers are on a 24-hour national strike. Protesters criticized the management of the head of the National Administration of Public Education (ANEP), and they also chanted against the Government for the water crisis.

source: Diario Primicia; El Diario (Venezuela); Reporte YA
notes: On 21 June 2023, in Ciudad Guayana (Bolivar), a group of demonstrators, including active and retired workers at companies belonging to the state-owned Venezuelan Corporation of Guayana (CVG), pensioners, and unionists, protested to demand to demand proof of life on the two unionists arrested for leading the protests at the Pellas plant (Bolivar), their immediate release, and respect for their labor rights and trade union autonomy. The protesters gathered by the CVG headquarters.

On 21 June 2023, in Caracas - Libertador (Distrito Capital), a group of demonstrators, including health workers representatives and other unionists, protested to demand information about the physical condition of the two unionists arrested for leading the protests at the Pellas plant (Bolivar), to call for a fair trial, and for their relatives to be permitted to visit them in prison. The protesters gathered outside the Ombudsman Office, where they handed in a letter with their demands.

On 21 June 2023, in San Fernando de Apure (Apure), a group of approximately 60 lawyers protested against the arrest of a lawyer two days before for demanding the initiation of hearings regarding a court case against a client. The protesters gathered outside the Apure state Criminal Court, where they filed a complaint. The lawyer was released shortly after.

On 21 June 2023, in Mariara (Carabobo), Carabobo state police forces shot and killed a member of the Los Guaricheros Gang, during an armed confrontation with several of them in the Las Vueltas sector, La Guaricha neighborhood. The suspects resisted authority, a shooting ensued, and one of them was injured in the gunfire. He was pronounced dead in hospital. Police collected a gun. 1 fatality.

On 21 June 2023, in Merida (Merida), a group of demonstrators, including teachers and unionists, protested to demand better pay and working conditions. The protesters gathered in the Judo intersection.

On 21 June 2023, in Carupano (Sucre), two unidentified crime group suspects on a motorcycle shot and killed a man while he was travelling in his car, in a drive-by shooting in the Rebullen sector, Macarapana neighborhood. The perpetrators intercepted the victim, who tried to speak with them, and shot him three times to the head before fleeing the area. The victim was the son of a former deputy education minister and had an unspecified criminal record involving drugs. Police believe the killing is a settling of scores. 1 fatality.

On 21 June 2023, in Camoruco (Lara), a group of drivers blocked the Troncal 17 road in protest over the difficulties they find in refueling. The protest was staged by the Puricaure petrol station, whose workers were refusing to allow them to refuel claiming power outages, despite having been supplied petrol that day.

On 21 June 2023, in Pedro Gonzalez (Nueva Esparta), for the second consecutive day, a group of residents of the Matasiete parish blocked a street in protest over piped water outages going on for at least three months.

On 21 June 2023, in Teosinte, Chalatenango, members of the military forces attacked and injured a farmer for no apparent reason. The circumstances around the attack are not provided by the source. 1 injured.

On 21 June 2023, in Mogi das Cruzes (Sao Paulo), a transwoman was assaulted and pushed out of a moving car in the central area of the city. The victim is a drug user and was injured. There were no fatalities.

Around 21 June 2023 (week of), in Varzea Grande (Mato Grosso), students at a university carried out a protest to demand justice for the case of a student who has been called homophobic slurs in the university and threatened with violence.

On 21 June 2023, in Arapiraca (Alagoas), a man was injured by five gunshots after two individuals approached as he left work in the Jardim Esperanca neighbourhood. Identity of perpetrators and motivations are unknown.

source: Bahia 190; Bnews (Brazil); Folha do Estado da Bahia
notes: On 21 June 2023, in Feira de Santana (Bahia), a man was shot and killed after individuals forced entry into his home in the Gabriela neighbourhood. Identity of perpetrators and motivations are unknown. Police found a precision scale to measure drugs alongside the victim's body. Nevertheless, it is unknown whether he was engaged in drug trafficking activities. 1 fatality.

On 21 June 2023, in Teresina (Piaui), a boy was shot and killed by individuals who filmed the execution and shared with the community. Two perpetrators were arrested and they were involved in drug trafficking activities. 1 fatality.

On 21 June 2023, in the Santa Fe De Antioquia municipality (Antioquia), members of the Gulf Clan abducted a male heavy machinery operator while he was working. The victim managed to escape from the kidnappers around June 26 and was later found by security forces near the municipality of Olaya (Antioquia).

On 21 June 2023, in Fortul (Arauca), unidentified armed individuals abducted a man. No further information is available on this event. Although the perpetrators have not been confirmed, the area is known for the presence of the ELN. The victim's whereabouts are still unknown.

Around 21 June 2023 (week of), in Bogota (Bogota, D.C.), police forces arrested 23 members of the Tren de Aragua gang in a operation in the city. The arrest included two main members of the group who continued to carry out illegal activities from inside a prison.

Defusal: Around 21 June 2023 (as reported), in the rural area of Rosas municipality (Cauca), ELN militants planted an explosive device on the road that connects the municipal capital with the La Sierra sector. The road was closed for several hours before military personnel arrived to control the device.
On 21 June 2023, in Bajo Baudo municipality (Choco), two unidentified armed groups clashed for the second consecutive day, leaving several civilians caught in the crossfire. Casualties unknown.

On 21 June 2023, in Altaquer (Narino), Indigenous people blocked the road to protest against increased violence against community members by armed groups. The group gathered after a land mine explosion (coded separately) and an armed confrontation (coded separately) affected several members of the ethnic group.

Around 21 June 2023 (week of), in the rural area of Altaquer corregimiento (Narino), two unidentified armed groups clashed, causing the displacement of more than 185 Indigenous families. There is no further information on this event. Casualties are unknown.

Other: On 21 June 2023, in Tegucigalpa, Francisco Morazan, the sitting president of Honduras Xiomara Castro removed the Minister of Security Ramon Sabillon from his role, following a mass killing occurred in the Women's Center of Social Adaptation (PNFAS) the day before in Tamara, where 46 women inmates were killed and burned in a series of targeted executions (coded separately). The Military Police of Public Order (PMOP) assumed the direction of all the penal centers of the country (25 in total) and the intervention could extend to more than a year. Firearms, cell phone chargers, projectiles, fragmentation grenades, cash, amongst other items have been confiscated inside the prisons.

On 21 June 2023, in Belem (Para), a teenage girl was beaten up and injured by two individuals after giving away the location of a drug trafficking spot. She was shot to death two days later (coded separately). The victim was a drug user.

assoc_actor_1: Students (Costa Rica); Teachers (Costa Rica); Labor Group (Costa Rica)
source: Amprensa; CR Hoy; La Nacion (Costa Rica); La Teja; Teletica
notes: On 20 June 2023, in San Jose, San Jose, hundreds of people staged a demonstration against budget cuts for public education. Protesters marched to the Legislative Assembly. In addition, they demanded more budget allocation, and the resignation of the Minister of Education. The student's federation of the University of Costa Rica (UCR), the National University (UNA), teaching unions, the National Council of Deans (CONARE), the National Distance Learning University (UNED), professors and students participated in the protest.

On 20 June 2023, in Chisec municipality, Alta Verapaz, more than 300 residents from communities located in Ixcan, Quiche and Reina Uspantan staged a protest by blocking the Northern Transversal Strip at the height of KM 445 to demand that authorities finalize the construction of the road that connects Ixcan and Chicaman. Police officers were deployed in the area but no incidents were reported.

source: El Heraldo (Honduras); El Pais (Honduras); La Prensa (Honduras); La Tribuna (Honduras)
notes: On 20 June 2023, in Tamara, Francisco Morazan, at least 11 women detainees and members of the Barrio 18 Gang shot and knifed other women inmates of the Women's Center of Social Adaptation (PNFAS) and set fire to different cells after locking victims in them, resulting in the death of 46 detainees. Preliminary reports indicated that the killings and the burning were selective and that most of the targets were imprisoned women members of the Mara Salvatrucha Gang. It remains unclear whether all of the assailants and victims were exclusively Barrio 18 and Mara Salvatrucha members. 46 fatalities.

source: El Mundo (El Salvador); La Prensa Grafica
notes: On 20 June 2023, in Atiquizaya, Ahuachapan, three members of the MS-13 gang shot and killed a minor in the Lomas de Alarcon area. The victim, the son of a former police officer, was returning from dropping off his father at a bus stop when the armed men appeared and opened fire for no apparent reason. The source did not provide further details. 1 fatality.

On 20 June 2023, in Zacatecoluca, Zacatecoluca, residents of the canton of Ulapa staged a protest at the municipal building to demand that the authorities repair the main road in their canton. The protesters argued that the Major had made the promised of fixing the roads, but there has been no news in this regard.

assoc_actor_1: MST: Workers' Socialist Movement; PTS: Socialist Workers' Party; PO: Workers' Party; Piquetero Unit; MTR: Teresa Rodriguez Movement; Labor Group (Argentina); Polo Obrero; MTL: Territorial Liberation Movement; Barrios de Pie; MLS: Freemen of the South Movement; FOL: Front of Organizations in Action; FAR: Red Burn Front; FOB: Federation of Basis' Organizations
notes: On 20 June 2023, in Mar del Plata (Buenos Aires), political groups and social organizations marched through the streets towards the city center in rejection of the constitutional reform that changes demonstration regulations in the Jujuy region, and against the police action against civilians (coded separately). A group of demonstrators passed by Colon square and attacked with stones and blunt elements the Republican Proposal (PRO) headquarters. Individuals also vandalized walls with spray. A group of people held banners with slogans against multinational companies in the Jujuy region, arguing that constitutional reforms look to favor the extraction industry. The MST, the PTS, the Partido Obrero, Frente de Lucha Piquetero and the MTR participated in the event.

assoc_actor_1: CTA-A: Argentine Workers' Central Union - Autonomous; Labor Group (Argentina); UTEP: Union of Workers of the Popular Economy; FNC: National Peasants Federation (Argentina); Farmers (Argentina); PCR: Revolutionary Communist Party; JCR: Revolutionary Communist Youth; Students (Argentina); CCC: Class Combat Movement; Barrios de Pie; FPDS: Popular Front Dario Santillan; Evita Movement
notes: On 20 June 2023, in La Plata (Buenos Aires), social and political organizations protested blocking 7th street and 50th street in support of the protests in the Jujuy region against a constitutional reform (coded separately). Protesters chanted 'Resist Jujuy, down with the reform'. The protest was organized by CEPA (Corriente Estudiantil Popular Anti-imperialist), JCR (Revolutionary Communist Youth), CTA Autonoma La Plata, UTEP La Plata, FNC (National Peasant Federation) and PCR (Revolutionary Communist Party).

assoc_actor_1: Labor Group (Argentina); Teachers (Argentina); PO: Workers' Party; Mothers of Plaza de Mayo; Women (Argentina)
notes: On 20 June 2023, in Viedma (Rio Negro), the Neuquen and Rio Negro Multisectoral protested in support of the protests in the Jujuy region and demanded the end of police repression (coded separately). Protesters blocked the bridge that connects Viedma and Cipolletti communes for three hours. The Workers' Party (PO), Aten (Association of Education Workers of Neuquen), Unter (Union of Education Workers of Rio Negro) and the Association of Mothers of the Plaza de Mayo Neuquen and Alto Valle were present to demand the non-criminalization of the protest.

On 20 June 2023, in Rosario (Santa Fe), gauchos protested on National Flag Day after authorities did not let them march in the celebration on Pellegrini street at Belgrano avenue. The Gaucho Parade tried to arrive to the Flag Monument when police dispersed the group and hit one protester.

On 20 June 2023, in Rosario (Santa Fe), activists and political leaders from the Justicialist Party (PJ) protested with a symbolic act demanding measures to protect the Luduena stream. Protesters stated that the stream carries heavy contamination rates due to industrial activity.

On 20 June 2023, in Buenos Aires (Ciudad Autonoma de Buenos Aires), social organizations, political movements such as Workers Party (PO), and Indigenous people gathered at the Obelisk monument at marched through 9 de Julio avenue towards the Jujuy House in repudiation of the constitutional reform that changes protest regulations in the Jujuy region and against the police action against the protesters (coded separately). Protesters also demanded freedom for the arrested during the protests.

assoc_actor_1: RNM: Multisectoral National Network; Indigenous Group (Argentina)
notes: On 20 June 2023, in Cordoba (Cordoba), Indigenous people, social organizations, and left-wing political movements from several communes marched towards the capital and gathered in front of the Jujuy house to support the protests in the Jujuy region (coded separately), and demanding the end of police repression. The march was organized by the Multisectoral Cordoba, together with the UEPC (Union of Educators of the Province of Cordoba).

On 20 June 2023, in Rivadavia (San Juan), residents blocked Moron street and Yornet street demanding citizen security in the La Bebida neighborhood. Protesters assured that they will clear the streets until they have answers as they have suffered robberies for more than a year in the area and after speaking with the authorities they have not noticed any changes.

On 20 June 2023, in Oruro (Oruro), members of neighborhoods boards and merchants of Caso de Minero sector blocked a highway as a demonstration to demand the local government to fulfil municipal decree 114/09 which gives the regulation for control of the sale and consumption of alcoholic beverages and to remove brothels from their sector.

On 20 June 2023, in Sucre (Chuquisaca), workers who are members of the Original Peoples of Chuquisaca Federation of Workers (FUTPOCH) marched through the city to reject the annulment of their juridic rights carried out by the governor. Members of the National Coordinating Committee for the Defense of the Political Constitution of the State of Bolivia (CONALPADECO) and We are all Bolivia (BST) political party marched as a counter demonstration to support the governor's decision.

assoc_actor_1: CUT: Unified Workers' Central; Labor Group (Brazil)
notes: On 20 June 2023, in Porto Alegre (Rio Grande do Sul), hundreds of members of CUT and other labor unions gathered in front of the Central Bank, in the historic center, to demand the resignation of the Bank's president and more effective policies for economic and social growth.

On 20 June 2023, in Porto Alegre (Rio Grande do Sul), state civil servants gathered in front of the Legislative Assembly to protest against the approval of a bill regarding the health plan of civil servants.

assoc_actor_1: MTST: Homeless Workers' Movement; CMP: Central of Popular Movements
source: Agencia Brasil; Brasil de Fato; G1
notes: On 20 June 2023, in Sao Paulo - Central Zone (Sao Paulo), social movements and civil society held a protest at Republica Square, resisting the first-round approval of the Strategic Master Plan, a piece of municipal legislation that outlines a 15-year plan for the development of the city. Protesters claim the plan privileges the real estate market over other stakeholders, shouting 'Sao Paulo is not for sale'. The Homeless Workers' Movement (MTST) and the Central of Popular Movements (CMP) were present.

notes: On 20 June 2023, in Miranda (Mato Grosso do Sul), a suspect wanted on criminal charges (unspecified) exchanged fire with military and civil police during his arrest operation in the Maria do Rosario neighborhood. The suspect was injured and taken to a hospital. There were no fatalities.

On 20 June 2023, in Viana (Espirito Santo), an inmate, who is transgender, was killed inside a detainment facility by unknown individuals. The victim was serving time for drug trafficking. One suspect was identified. 1 fatality.

On 20 June 2023, in Maceio (Alagoas), a group of health care workers of a local hospital carried out a demonstration for a second day in a row blocking the Fernandes Lima Av., by setting tires on fire demanding the payment of their salaries since March and also demanding the payment of their holidays bonuses. Military police was present but no intervention was reported.

On 20 June 2023, in Joao Pessoa (Paraiba), motorcycle app drivers carried out a demonstration in the surroundings of the local City Council demanding the regularization of motorcycle app transportation. Demonstrators were demanding to meet with representatives to reach an agreement regarding the issue.

On 20 June 2023, in Teresina (Piaui), a group of teachers carried out a demonstration in the surrounding of the municipal department of education demanding the payment of their salaries and better infrastructure in public schools.

Around 20 June 2023 (as reported), in Eunapolis (Bahia), a transgender person was killed and her body was found near Vaquejada park. The victim was abducted by four suspects the same day after she left a party with two other people and her body was later found with severe signs of violence and gunshot wounds. The other two people were released. The motivation behind the attack and its perpetrators are unknown. 1 fatality.

On 20 June 2023, in Macapa (Amapa), a man was shot and killed in the Congos neighborhood by an armed individual. Police described the attack as an execution. The area where the attack occurred is known for the presence of organized criminal groups. There are no reports on the identity of the perpetrators. 1 fatality.

notes: On 20 June 2023, in Oiapoque (Amapa), a member of a drug trafficking group exchanged fire with military police during an operation in the Ilha Bela community. The drug trafficker was killed. A second suspect was arrested. 1 fatality.

On 20 June 2023, in Itacoatiara (Amazonas), a man was shot and killed in the Jauari neighborhood by three armed individuals. There are no reports on the identity of the perpetrators or the attack's motivation. 1 fatality.

On 20 June 2023, in Serra (Espirito Santo), three people were injured in a drive-by shooting in the Novo Porto Canoa neighborhood by armed individuals in a car. There are no reports on the identity of the perpetrators or the attack's motivation.

On 20 June 2023, in Juara (Mato Grosso), an adolescent was abducted and tied up by three members of a drug trafficking group. The victim was going to be beaten up due to a drug debt, but police forces intervened and rescued the victim. Six drug traffickers were arrested.

actor1: Police Forces of Brazil (2023-) Civil Police
notes: Property destruction: On 20 June 2023, in Itaum (Dourados, Mato Grosso do Sul), civil police seized more than one ton of marijuana hidden inside a vehicle during an operation. Two people were arrested.

notes: On 20 June 2023, in Braganca (Para), a member of a drug trafficking group exchanged fire with civil police during his arrest operation. The drug trafficker was killed. 1 fatality.

On 20 June 2023, in Maraba (Para), a woman was shot and killed in a drive-by shooting in the Nucleo Nova Maraba neighborhood by two armed individuals on a motorcycle. The victim had a police record for robbery. There are no reports on the identity of the perpetrators or the attack's motivation. 1 fatality.

On 20 June 2023, in Rio de Janeiro - North Zone (Rio de Janeiro), unknown shooters exchanged fire in the Pilares, Manguinhos, and Higienopolis neighborhoods and the Morro do Serena community, Penha Circular neighborhood. Unknown casualties.

On 20 June 2023, in Joinville (Santa Catarina), an adolescent was shot and killed in the Vila Cubatao neighborhood by two armed individuals. There are no reports on the identity of the perpetrators or the attack's motivation. 1 fatality.

On 20 June 2023, in Chacao (Los Lagos), workers at the Chacao Bridge protested blocking the access to the facilities after failing to reach a salary agreement with the Hyundai company. On 20 June 2023, in San Antonio (Valparaiso), residents of an irregular occupation protested outside of the city hall, the Presidential Delegation and in front of the Chilquinta company offices after being 15 days without electric supply. Protesters stated that although there have been advances, the solution has not arrived.

On 20 June 2023, near Encarnacion commune (Itapua), custom carriers closed access to the San Roque Gonzalez de Santa Cruz International Bridge in protest against low traffic at the border due to Argentinian holidays. Protesters stated that the situation is affecting 78 officials, including teachers in special areas, administrative workers, maintenance and cleaning personnel.

On 20 June 2023, in Iquitos (Loreto), workers of the infrastructure maintenance of Max Augustin stadium blocked the Calvo de Araujo avenue with burning tires as a demonstration to demand the construction company pay their salaries.

On 20 June 2023, in Lima - Ate (Lima), residents staged a demonstration to demand the removal of the concrete blocks and walls placed in Central highway to finish the works of the Line 2 of the subway, that was finished several months ago.

On 20 June 2023, in Araya (Sucre), a group of retired workers at the Salinas de Araya salt mine protested to demand payment of owed stipends, better access to medicines, and improved medical attention. The protesters gathered by the Unidad I premises of the salt mine.

source: El Diario (Venezuela); OVCS: Observatorio Venezolano de Conflictividad Social; VPItv
notes: On 20 June 2023, in Valera (Trujillo), a group of public transport workers protested to demand the liberation of two of their colleagues arrested for hoarding petrol at home.

Around 20 June 2023 (as reported), in Pedro Camejo municipality (coded to San Juan de Payara, Apure), military air forces shot down an aircraft in flight from Mexico thought to belong to unidentified criminal groups linked to drug trafficking. The aircraft left Cozumel (Mexico) bound for Curacao, but the radio and transponder were switched off mid flight, and its course was changed, entering Venezuelan airspace without authorization. Casualties unknown.

On 20 June 2023, in Barinas (Barinas), for the second consecutive day, a group of demonstrators, including teachers and other workers at the UNELLEZ University, protested to demand better pay, medical and burial insurance plans, and payment of medicines and other owed stipends. Likewise, they rejected the arrests of two SIDOR unionists for leading the protests at the Pellas plant (Bolivar). The protesters gathered by the UNELLEZ University main entrance.

On 20 June 2023, in Maracaibo (Zulia), a group of Yukpa Indigenous people gathered to demand information about the whereabouts of the three Indigenous leaders arrested during a protest in the Rafael Urdaneta Bridge days before (coded separately). The protesters demand speaking to the Minister for Indigenous Peoples or with the Mara (Zulia) mayor. They gathered in the Bolivar Square.

actor2: Military Forces of Venezuela (1999-) GNB: Venezuelan National Guard
notes: On 20 June 2023, in Pedro Gonzalez (Nueva Esparta), a group of residents of the Matasiete parish blocked a street in protest over piped water outages going on for at least three months. The protest was dispersed by GNB military forces. There were no casualties.

source: OVCS: Observatorio Venezolano de Conflictividad Social
notes: On 20 June 2023, in Miranda state (coded to Los Teques), demonstrators protested with unspecified demands on issues related to housing, justice, petrol, healthcare, and education.

source: OVCS: Observatorio Venezolano de Conflictividad Social; Reporte YA
notes: On 20 June 2023, in Maturin (Monagas), a group of residents of the Orocual sector blocked a street in protest over power outages going on for more than 36 hours. The protesters claim that at least five neighborhoods are affected.

source: Diario de Los Andes; OVCS: Observatorio Venezolano de Conflictividad Social
notes: On 20 June 2023, in Motatan (Trujillo), a group of residents of the Giraluna neighborhood blocked the Principal Motatan Avenue in protest to demand the repair of the Pinto Salinas - Giraluna Bridge which collapsed in January 2023 due to heavy rain.

assoc_actor_1: MAR: Rebel Argentina Movement; Indigenous Group (Argentina); Teachers (Argentina); Labor Group (Argentina)
source: Diario El Dia; El Diario de Carlos Paz; La Nacion (Argentina)
notes: On 20 June 2023, in San Salvador de Jujuy (Jujuy), Indigenous people, unionized teachers, public sector workers and social organizations marched with Argentinian flags against the constitutional reform that changes demonstration regulations, among other things. Demonstrators tried to destroy with blunt objects the Jujuy Legislature where the constitutional reform was being approved. Police tried to disperse the crowd with pellets and tear gas. The demonstration caused the burning of three cars, and the looting of eight commercial premises and public buildings. About 170 people were injured and at least 68 people arrested. One person member of Rebel Argentina Movement (MAR) has a serious head injury. Among the people injured, there are municipal workers, journalists from TELAM and TN Channel and political activists. Some with pellet wounds and others were attacked by demonstrators. In addition, a prosecutor ruled the clearance of the national routes 9, 34, 52 and 66 that connect the Jujuy region with the rest of the country and that are blocked since the weekend due to dissatisfaction with the constitutional reform.

On 20 June 2023, in Nueva Granada municipality (Magdalena), two armed individuals on a motorcycle shot and killed a former elected councilman, in a drive-by shooting between the Pueblito los Andes and the La Gloria corregimientos. The victim was travelling in his car when he was intercepted and shot at by the perpetrators, in an area known as the El Chuzo y las Tinas. There is no information on the identity or motivations of the attackers. 1 fatality.

On 20 June 2023, in Manaus - Central West Zone (Amazonas), a man was tortured and injured in the Redencao neighborhood by unknown armed individuals. The victim was beaten up, shot, and thrown from a vehicle; he believed to have been mistaken for someone else. The victim died from the injuries on 24 June 2023. There are no reports on the identity of the perpetrators. 1 fatality.

On 20 June 2023, in Joao Pessoa (Paraiba), at least two perpetrators shot and killed a man with 12 shots in the Mandacaru neighbourhood. Identity of perpetrators and motivations are unknown. 1 fatality.

On 20 June 2023, in Cubara (Boyaca), an unidentified armed group attacked the military base, resulting in the wounding of one soldier. Although the perpetrators have not been confirmed, armed groups operate in the border area with Arauca department. There were no fatalities.
On 20 June 2023, in Bajo Baudo municipality (Choco), two unidentified armed groups clashed, leaving several civilians caught in the crossfire. Casualties unknown.

On 20 June 2023, between Arauca and Tame municipalities (coded to Arauca, Arauca), a man was kidnapped by unidentified armed individuals. The whereabouts of the victim are unknown. There is no further information on the motives and perpetrators but the area is known for the presence of armed groups. A lot of civilians in the region have been kidnapped by the ELN.

On 19 June 2023, in Chimaltenango, Chimaltenango, two armed men shot and killed two men and a boy, and wounded a woman and another boy in the Colonia El Cerrito in zone 7. (drive-by). The motivation for the attack is unknown. No more detail is provided by the source. 2 injured, 3 fatalities.
On 19 June 2023, in Santa Cruz del Quiche, Quiche, bus drivers staged a protest by blocking access to the city, demanding that authorities install two bridges on a main road.
On 19 June 2023, in Guatemala City, Guatemala, parents of schoolchildren staged a protest in zone 15 to demand that authorities appoint teachers in a school located in the colonia Tecun Uman.

On 19 June 2023, in Georgetown, Demerara-Mahaica, members of the civil society and the political opposition held a protest in front of the Ministry of Local Government on Fort Street to demand justice for the victim of an alleged rape by the Minister of Local Government and Regional Development in 2022 (coded separately), as well as the firing of the politician.

On 19 June 2023, in Ilama, Santa Barbara, various armed inmates and members of the Barrio 18 Gang clashed in the maximum security prison known as El Pozo, leaving one of the prisoners dead and two wounded. The reason for the clash is related to ingang rivalry. 1 fatality. 2 wounded.
On 19 June 2023, in San Pedro Sula, Cortes, military forces arrested a leader of the Barrio 18 Gang and coordinator of the whole Chamelecon sector, in the Suyapa neighborhood of Chamelecon.

On 19 June 2023, in Cofradia, Cortes, a group of residents staged a protest demanding that their community becomes the 299th municipality of Honduras. They argued that they had been neglected for years and are now demanding their own authorities and control over their own budget.

On 19 June 2023, in Panama City, Panama, hematology patients with critical, chronic and degenerative diseases of the Social Security Office staged a protest at the premises of the Social Security Office to demand that the authorities provide medicines suffering from any of the abovementioned diseases. Members of the National Federation of Associations for Critical, Chronic and Degenerative Diseases (FENAECCD) participated in the protest.

On 19 June 2023, in San Carlos de Bariloche (Rio Negro), workers members of the UTHGRA (Union of Tourism, Hotel and Gastronomy Workers of the Argentine Republic) protested outside of a hotel against lack of personnel. Protesters stated that they have been negotiating for more than two months and they did not reach any agreement.

assoc_actor_1: UTA: Union of Tramway Workers; Labor Group (Argentina)
notes: On 19 June 2023, near Santa Rosa commune (La Pampa), transporters with UTA (Union of Tramway Workers) blocked Route 5 with salary demands. The protest took place during the 48-hour strike from medium-distance transporters. The road was cleared on 22 June after reaching an agreement with the authorities.

On 19 June 2023, in Resistencia (Chaco), hundreds of people, including relatives of a missing woman and residents of Resistencia commune gathered at 25 de Mayo square and marched through the streets with pink balloons to commemorate the woman missing since 1 June. The woman's mother stated there is no hope of finding her alive, so she decided to march pacifically. The woman was last seen when she was entering the home of her in-laws, who are political activists related to the Chaco Governor. Seven people are arrested for the case, including her husband. Elsewhere in the city, about 200 residents of the Santa Ines neighborhood protested in front of the police station where the husband is detained. Neighbors are in the place with drums and snares shouting 'murderer'.

On 19 June 2023, in Oruro (Oruro), unionized merchants members of the Oruro Departmental Federation of Workers marched through the center of the city and stopped at the local government offices to demand the enforcement of Law 108 that prohibits new positions placed for informal merchants.

On 19 June 2023, in Potosi (Potosi), unionized transportation workers blocked different streets of the city to demand the restructuring of the Transport Municipal Council, and the resignation of the president of the entity.

On 19 June 2023, in Santa Cruz de la Sierra (Santa Cruz), unionized merchants of La Ramada market blocked the entrances to the local government offices as a demonstration to demand the mayor to guarantee basic services, including water and electricity, to allow the entrance of interprovincial bus lines, and respect and enforcement of the market spaces from informal merchants.

On 19 June 2023, in Rio de Janeiro - South Zone (Rio de Janeiro), nursing professionals and nursing technicians held a protest in the Jardim Botanico neighborhood, demanding for the application of the nursing national minimum wage. The protest blocked all lanes of Jardim Botanico Street.

On 19 June 2023, in Goiania (Goias), about 15 app delivery workers gathered in front of a restaurant in the Celina Park sector to protest against a delivery worker being verbally abused by the restaurant owner.
On 19 June 2023, in Belo Horizonte (Minas Gerais), state civil servants gathered for a demonstration in the Legislative Assembly to demand salary readjustment.

On 19 June 2023, in Cubatao (Sao Paulo), access controllers of schools and health units held a protest outside City Hall, demanding the payment of their late wages and benefits. The protest was part of a strike, including school closures.

actor1: Police Forces of Brazil (2023-) Federal Police
assoc_actor_1: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
source: Correio do Povo; Portal Costa Oeste
notes: Property destruction: On 19 June 2023, in Sao Jose das Palmeiras (Parana), federal and military police seized four tons of marijuana hidden inside a truck during an inspection on the PR-317 highway. One person was arrested.

On 19 June 2023, in Belem (Para), students at a federal university blocked an avenue in the Terra Firme neighborhood by setting obstacles on fire to demonstrate against the suspension of public transportation on campus and to demonstrate against the deanship's administration.

actor2: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
source: Bahia 190; Bahia Extremo Sul; Bnews (Brazil); G1
notes: On 19 June 2023, in Salvador - Tancredo Neves (Bahia), there was a shoot-out between the military police and member of the Red Command (CV) gang at Buracao locality, in the Tancredo Neves neighborhood during a police operation, after the CV members clashed with members of the Bonde do Maluco (coded separately), in the Macaco locality. During the clash four suspects were shot and injured, and two police officers were also injured. They were all taken to the hospital but the suspects did not survive the injuries. Police seized 13 machine guns, a grenade, chargers, ammunition, and drugs. 4 fatalities.

On 19 June 2023, in Maceio (Alagoas), a group of health care workers of a local hospital carried out a demonstration at Fernandes Lima Av., by setting tires on fire blocking the street demanding the payment of their salaries and holidays bonuses.

On 19 June 2023, in Rio Largo (Alagoas), a man was shot to death in the Brasil Novo neighborhood outside his house by two armed suspects, who according to witnesses called the victim's doorbell and then opened fire killing him and fled after the attack. The motivation behind the attack and its perpetrators are unknown. 1 fatality.

On 19 June 2023, in Joao Pessoa (Paraiba), a fisherman was shot to death at Bessa beach by two armed men who opened fire against the victim and fled in a car. The victim was a former prisoner convicted for theft. The motivation behind the attack and its perpetrators are unknown. 1 fatality.

On 19 June 2023, in Natal (Rio Grande do Norte), a man was shot to death in the Bom Pastor neighborhood by three armed men who opened fire against the victim who fled after the attack. The victim had criminal records for drug trafficking and was currently serving a semi-opened sentence for the same chargers. The motivation behind the attack and its perpetrators are unknown. 1 fatality.
Around 19 June 2023 (as reported), in Codajas (Amazonas), a man suspected of theft was shot in the hands and injured by approximately four drug traffickers in a drug trafficking tribunal.

Around 19 June 2023 (as reported), in Itacoatiara (Amazonas), a man was killed by unknown individuals and his body was found in a wooded area in the Jauari 2 neighborhood with signs of torture and stab wounds in the neck. Circumstances of death are unknown. 1 fatality.

Around 19 June 2023 (as reported), in Manaus - South Zone (Amazonas), a man was killed by members of the CV and his body was found in the Nossa Senhora Aparecida neighborhood with signs of torture, broken arms and legs, and with a bag over his head. The victim was also tied up. A note was left with the body indicating the victim was killed as a warning to thieves. 1 fatality.

On 19 June 2023, in Sorriso (Mato Grosso), a man was shot 11 times and killed by three members of the CV who invaded his private residence in the Novo Horizonte neighborhood. The victim was a drug user. 1 fatality.

actor1: Police Forces of Brazil (2023-) Federal Police
notes: Property destruction: Around 19 June 2023 (as reported), in Campo Grande (Mato Grosso do Sul), federal police seized 6,841kg of marijuana hidden inside a truck during an inspection on the BR-060 highway. One person was arrested.

On 19 June 2023, in Campo Grande (Mato Grosso do Sul), a member of a drug trafficking group was shot 35 times and killed in a drive-by shooting in the Nova Lima neighborhood by two armed individuals on a motorcycle. 1 fatality.

assoc_actor_2: Former Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
notes: On 19 June 2023, in Igarape-Miri (Para), a former military police officer was shot and killed inside his private residence by unknown armed individuals. There are no reports on the identity of the perpetrators or the attack's motivation. 1 fatality.

actor2: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
assoc_actor_2: Police Forces of Brazil (2023-) Civil Police
notes: On 19 June 2023, in Marica (Rio de Janeiro), armed suspects exchanged fire with military and civil police who arrived to the Risca Faca community to save a woman from being subjected to a drug trafficking crime tribunal. There were no fatalities.

source: Informe Agora; O Dia (Brazil); O Sao Goncalo; OTT-RJ; R7
notes: On 19 June 2023, in Rio de Janeiro - Central Zone (Rio de Janeiro), unknown shooters exchanged fire in the Fallet-Fogueteiro community, Rio Comprido neighborhood, near the Santa Teresa neighborhood. A woman was hit and killed by a stray bullet while she was riding through the area in a vehicle. 1 fatality.

On 19 June 2023, in Rio de Janeiro - North Zone (Rio de Janeiro), unknown shooters exchanged fire in the Morro do Fuba community, Cascadura neighborhood and the Juramentinho community, Tomas Coelho neighborhood, and the Grajau and Costa Barros neighborhoods. Shooting was also heard in the Engenho de Dentro and Cachambi neighborhoods. Unknown casualties.

actor2: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
notes: On 19 June 2023, in Rio de Janeiro - West Zone (Rio de Janeiro), armed suspects exchanged fire with military police in the 48 community, Bangu neighborhood. One suspect was killed, and a suspect and a military police officer were injured. Two suspects were arrested, and police seized two rifles and camouflage clothes. Police arrived to the area after a clash occurred between the Red Command and Pure Third Command earlier the same day (coded separately). 1 fatality.

On 19 June 2023, in Rio de Janeiro - West Zone (Rio de Janeiro), Red Command exchanged fire with Pure Third Command in the Santo Andre and 48 communities, in the Bangu neighborhood. Unknown casualties.

On 19 June 2023, in Porto Velho (Rondonia), a woman was killed in a drive-by shooting in the Areia Branca neighborhood by two armed individuals on a motorcycle. There are no reports on the identity of the perpetrators or the attack's motivation. 1 fatality.

On 19 June 2023, in Porto Velho (Rondonia), a man was shot and killed in the Cidade Nova neighborhood by two armed individuals. The victim was a former prisoner with drug trafficking convictions. There are no reports on the identity of the perpetrators or the attack's motivation. 1 fatality.

On 19 June 2023, in Palmas (Tocantins), a man was shot and killed in the Aureny III neighborhood by two armed individuals who chased after him. The victim had a police record for assault. There are no reports on the identity of the perpetrators or the attack's motivation. 1 fatality.

On 19 June 2023, in Salvador - Barra/Pituba (Bahia), a group of people and relatives of a man killed the day before by a military police officer (coded separately), carried out a demonstration at Anita Garibaldi Av., repudiating the killing and denying the statement of the officers who argue the victim had a firearm and opened fire against the officers and therefore was shot.

assoc_actor_1: Government of Chile (2022-); PC: Citizen Power; SC: Social Convergence Party
notes: On 19 June 2023, in Valparaiso (Valparaiso), social leaders, a deputy from Citizen Power (PC) and a regional councilor from Social Convergence (SC) gathered outside of the Regional Delegation Building in protest against the strike threat of a minibus company in response to the series of robberies suffered. Protesters stated that the bus company wouldn't have suffered robberies if they had complied with the legislation that obliges them to install the electronic validators and demanded the SEREMI of Transport a definitive deadline to the company for the installation of these devices that would avoid the use of money and therefore being exposed to criminals.

On 19 June 2023, in Puerto Montt (Los Lagos), students at the Los Lagos University marched in the city center demanding the removal of two teachers due to accusations of verbal abuse and suspected sexual abuse. Protesters stated that they submitted formal complaints but they have not received any response from the authorities.

On 19 June 2023, in Santiago - Nunoa (Metropolitana), students occupied the Augusto D'Halmar school in protest against an investigation made to a teacher which caused her suspension. Protesters demanded the teacher's return in order to continue with the regular activities.

On 19 June 2023, in Concepcion (Biobio), residents of the Pedro del Rio neighborhood protested with black flags against leaks and humidity in their apartments. Authorities stated that they will provide a solution.

assoc_actor_2: Guardia Indigena (Colombia); Indigenous Group (Colombia); Unidentified Communal Group (Colombia)
source: INDEPAZ; Sucesos Cauca; UNOCHA; W Radio
notes: Around 19 June 2023 (as reported), in the rural area of Caldono municipality (Cauca), unidentified armed individuals opened fire on a group of civilians, wounding one member of the Guardia Indigena and killing another. The fatality was an authority in his community and had previously reported threats in 2022 from the FARC dissident faction Jaime Martinez. However, it has not been confirmed that this group is responsible, as other armed groups have a presence in the area. 1 fatality.

On 19 June 2023, in El Copey (Cesar), a suspected militant of the Gulf Clan shot and killed a farmer who was a social leader. A hooded individual broke into the victim's house, sneaked up behind him and fired three shots. The victim was a candidate for councilman. The previous week he had reported death threats from the Gulf Clan. 1 fatality.

assoc_actor_2: Police Forces of Colombia (2022-) UNP: National Unit for Protection; Former FARC: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia
notes: Around 19 June 2023 (as reported), in La Plata (Huila), an unidentified armed individual shot and killed a former FARC and current UNP officer. The victim was attacked in a local restaurant. It is unclear whether he was on duty at the time of the incident. 1 fatality.

actor2: Police Forces of Colombia (2022-) UNDMO: National Unit for Dialogue and Maintenance of Order
notes: Around 19 June 2023 (as reported), in Castilla la Nueva (Meta), riots broke out when UNDMO agents attempted to control a fight. The rioters attacked the agents with stones and other objects, injuring four of them.

Around 19 June 2023 (as reported), in the rural area of Santa Fe De Antioquia municipality (Antioquia), a man was killed and his body was found floating in the Cauca River. The victim had been reported missing in previous days in the Bolombolo corregimiento, Venecia municipality. Although the perpetrators have not been confirmed, the area is known for the presence of the Gulf Clan.

Around 19 June 2023 (as reported), in Popayan (Cauca), pedestrians chased and beat a man who tried to kidnap a child in the Pandiaguando neighborhood. The man was handed over to the police who arrived in the area.

Around 19 June 2023 (as reported), in the rural area of La Llanada municipality (Narino), two unidentified armed groups clashed in the rural areas between the municipality and Los Andes municipality. Casualties unknown.

On 19 June 2023, in the rural area of Ricaurte municipality (Narino), an unidentified armed group attacked a police station near the Las Cruces sector. Although the perpetrators have not been confirmed, the area is known for the presence of armed groups. There were no fatalities.

On 19 June 2023, in Tibu (Norte de Santander), unidentified armed individuals abducted an off-duty military soldier. Although the perpetrators have not been confirmed, the area is known for the presence of armed groups. The whereabouts of the victim are still unknown.

Around 19 June 2023 (as reported), in the rural area of Valledupar municipality (Cesar), a man was killed and his dismembered body was found near the Cola de Caballo sector, on the Guatapuri River. The victim's body showed multiple signs of torture and had been shot in the head. Although the perpetrators have not been confirmed, the area is known for the presence of armed groups. 1 fatality.

On 19 June 2023, in El Roto (Esmeraldas), around 40 residents and fishers of several communities blocked the Esmeraldas - Quininde highway as a demonstration to demand the government for compensation due to the spill of diesel fuel the previous week in the sector that affected their work.

On 19 June 2023, in Asuncion (Paraguay), permit holders protested at Abasto Municipal Market demanding a change in the direction due to insecurity problems, dirt, and drug-trafficking inside the facilities.

On 19 June 2023, in Ayolas (Misiones), construction workers at the Ana Cua ART Consortium (Astaldi - Rovella - Tecnoedil) protested at their workplace demanding the signing of the collective contract agreement in order to end the strike that began two months prior. In the agreement, workers demanded salary readjustments and bonuses.

On 19 June 2023, in Ayolas (Misiones), workers at several economic sectors such as peasants and environmental officials protested in front of the Yacyreta Binational Entity (EBY) demanding the payment of two months of salaries and more progress of productive projects.

On 19 June 2023, in Pedro Juan Caballero (Amambay), students at Raul Pena school occupied the educational facilities demanding the return of the director denounced of mistreatment. Students argued that the situation never happened and they did not allow other students or teachers to enter the school.

On 19 June 2023, in Lima - Pachacamac (Lima), informal taxi drivers, known as 'colectiveros', marched through La Molina avenue as a demonstration to demand the regularization of all colectiveros and against the constant control operatives from the Callao and Lima Urban Transport Authority (ATU).

assoc_actor_1: Police Forces of Peru (2022-); Students (Peru); Labor Group (Peru); Women (Peru)
notes: On 19 June 2023, in Buenos Aires (Ancash), residents, police officers of the Family PNP Commissary, workers of the Women Emergency Center (CEM) and Women's Attention Center (CAM), and university students marched through the city as a demonstration to demand the stop of the cases of violence and cases of femicides.

On 19 June 2023, in Canelones (Canelones), residents from the El Sauce neighborhood protested against President Lacalle Pou and demanded a solution to the lack of drinking water. Protesters were present with banners and chanting 'water for the people.'

On 19 June 2023, in Caracas - Libertador (Distrito Capital), a group of state workers protested to demand the liberation of the two unionists arrested eight days before for leading the protests at the Pellas plant (Bolivar). The protesters gathered outside the Ombudsman Office.

source: Correo del Caroni; Diario Primicia; El Carabobeno; La Patilla
notes: On 19 June 2023, in Ciudad Guayana (Bolivar), a group of demonstrators, including workers at the state-owned SIDOR steelmaker company, residents, and relatives of the two unionists arrested eight days before for leading the protests at the Pellas plant (Bolivar), protested to demand proof of life on them, and their liberation. Their relatives have not spoken to the detainees since their arrest, their location is also unknown. The protesters gathered in the Monumento a la CVG Square.

assoc_actor_1: Teachers (Venezuela); FVM: Venezuelan Federation of Teachers; Labor Group (Venezuela)
notes: On 19 June 2023, in Los Teques (Miranda), a group of demonstrators, including teachers, FVM representatives, and other state workers, protested to demand better pay and working conditions, and the renewal of their collective labor agreement.

On 19 June 2023, between Guatire and Guarenas (Miranda), a group of demonstrators, including teachers and unionists, protested to demand better pay and working conditions, and the renewal of their collective labor agreement. The protesters gathered in the Intercomunal Guarenas - Guatire Avenue.

On 19 June 2023, in Barinas (Barinas), a group of demonstrators, including teachers and other workers at the UNELLEZ University, protested to demand better pay, medical and burial insurance plans, and payment of medicines and other owed stipends. UNELLEZ University students were also present, supporting the workers in their demands. The protesters gathered by the Punto Fresco roundabout.

The victim was found by residents of the area. There is no further information at this point in time. 1 fatality.

source: Diario 2001; El Carabobeno; El Pitazo; Noticia al Minuto
notes: On 19 June 2023, in Concepcion (Zulia), two members of the El Yiyi Gang on a motorcycle shot and killed two elderly people, a man and a woman, in a drive-by shooting in the La Yaguaza sector. The victims were just outside their house. The perpetrators escaped. It was later established that the killings were a settling of scores given that the couple were close relatives of the leader of another criminal gang, the El Mauricio Gang. There is no further information at this point in time. 2 fatalities.

The localities affected are Puerto Guzman (Putumayo); Cartagena del Chaira (Caqueta); Magui Payan (Narino); Bagado, Sipiu, Rio Iro and San Jose del Palmar (Choco); El Bagre and Taraza (Antioquia); Villeta (Cundinamarca); and Tibu and La Playa (Norte de Santander).
Around 19 June 2023 (as reported), in Campo Quijano (Salta), health workers blocked National Route 51 to demand better salaries.
On 19 June 2023, in Rio de Janeiro - West Zone (Rio de Janeiro), a police militia shot and killed a man in the Muzema neighborhood. The event was described as an execution. 1 fatality.
On 19 June 2023, in Salvador - Liberdade (Bahia), a man was shot and killed by drug traffickers who control the area in the Liberdade neighbourhood. Motivations are unknown. 1 fatality.
On 19 June 2023, in Valparaiso (Valparaiso), parents and students at the Speiro school protested on Puerto Montt street at Morris street in rejection of the closure of their school.

actor1: Military Forces of Venezuela (1999-) GNB: Venezuelan National Guard
notes: On 19 June 2023, in Barinas (Barinas), GNB military forces shot and killed two members of the El Marcial Gang, during an armed confrontation in the Los Cocos sector. There is no further information at this point in time. 2 fatalities.

On 18 June 2023, in Guatemala City, Guatemala, according to witnesses, armed men shot and killed one man and injured other two in a local disco in zone 1. The fatal victim is a student, member of the LGBT+ community, and member of the Organizing Committee of the parade of Sexual Diversity and Gender Identity in Guatemala and of the Association of Sancarlist Students of Diversity (AESDi). The motivation for the attack is unknown. No more detail is provided by the source. 1 fatality, 1 injured.

On 18 June 2023, in Tegucigalpa, Francisco Morazan, two unidentified armed men shot and killed a man inside his own home in the Villa Nueva neighborhood. The reason for the killing is unknown. 1 fatality.
On 18 June 2023, in Juticalpa, Olancho, two unidentified armed individuals shot and killed a man. The reason for the killing is unknown. 1 fatality.

On 18 June 2023, in La Ceiba, Atlantida, a group of residents of the Carmen Elena and Bella Vista neighborhoods have taken to the streets in protest to demand a water pump and tank from the National Autonomous Service of Aqueducts and Sewers (SANAA). These two neighborhoods had been affected by frequent power outages, exacerbating the lack of potable water.

On 18 June 2023, in Olanchito, Yoro, unidentified armed gang members clashed with police forces during a police operation leaving a police officer wounded. The operation resulted in the seizure of various firearms and military clothing. 1 wounded.

On 18 June 2023, in Oruro (Oruro), mining workers members of the Non Metals Mining Cooperative La Luminosa threw rocks and planted explosives (unspecified) in the surrounding area to prevent the entry of police officers and journalists who accompanied municipal officials that were placing protected green area signs in San Pedro hill. The officials were trying to enforce a constitutional resolution that prohibits granite extraction, but they have not been able to control the mining operations in the sector.

On 18 June 2023, in Maceio (Alagoas), a drug trafficker was shot to death inside the Carminha apartment complex, in the Benedito Bentes neighborhood by unknown shooters. The victim had a pending arrest warrant for drug trafficking. The motivation behind the attack and its perpetrators are unknown. 1 fatality.

On 18 June 2023, in Imperatriz (Maranhao), a man was shot to death inside a local hospital by two armed suspects who pretended to be patients and shot the victim inside who was recovering from a previous homicide attempt. The victim had criminal records. The motivation behind the attack and its perpetrators are unknown. 1 fatality.

On 18 June 2023, in Campos dos Goytacazes (Rio de Janeiro), shopkeepers and merchants held a protest in the Historic Center, lamenting structural problems which have led the trade to suffer from low demand. Protesters used coffins at the protest site to symbolize the death of local commerce. A group organized by a councilman (Brazil's Union Party) intervened with physical confrontations and dispersed the protest by destroying the coffins and other signs set up by the group of protesters, though it is not clear if the councilman was present.

On 18 June 2023, in Joao Pessoa (Paraiba), a man was shot to death in the Mangabeira neighborhood by two armed suspects who opened fire against the victim killing him and fled after the attack. The motivation behind the attack and its perpetrators are unknown. 1 fatality.

On 18 June 2023, in Simoes Filho (Bahia), a group of people, including relatives of a woman killed days earlier by her ex-partner carried out a demonstration calling for justice for the femicide, and for justice for all victims of what they called the epidemic of femicides in Brazil.

On 18 June 2023, in Macapa (Amapa), a shoot-out between rival drug trafficking groups took place in the Jardim Marco Zero neighborhood. A civilian man, who was mistaken for a gang member, was shot and killed in the crossfire. 1 fatality.

Around 18 June 2023 (as reported), in Manaus municipality (Amazonas), a man was killed by unknown individuals and his body was found on the AM-070 highway with signs of torture and stab wounds in the neck. Circumstances of death are unknown. 1 fatality.

On 18 June 2023, in Manaus - North Zone (Amazonas), a woman was killed in a drive-by shooting in the Nova Cidade neighborhood by two armed individuals on a motorcycle. There are no reports on the identity of the perpetrators or the attack's motivation. 1 fatality.

actor2: Police Forces of Brazil (2023-) Civil Police
assoc_actor_2: Police Forces of Brazil (2023-) Municipal Guards
notes: On 18 June 2023, in Manicore (Amazonas), two armed individuals opened fire against a civil police station. One civil police officer and a municipal guard who were inside the building were superficially injured by shards. There were no fatalities.

On 18 June 2023, in Belo Horizonte (Minas Gerais), dozens of people gathered in the Liberdade square and then carried out a march to protest against the approval of a bill that changes procedures regarding recognition and demarcation of Indigenous territories.
On 18 June 2023, in Belo Horizonte (Minas Gerais), about 400 cyclists carried out a protest to demand more road safety.

On 18 June 2023, in Belem (Para), a man was shot and killed in a drive-by shooting in the Pratinha I neighborhood by four armed individuals in a car. There are no reports on the identity of the perpetrators or the attack's motivation. 1 fatality.

actor1: Police Forces of Brazil (2023-) Federal Police
notes: Property destruction: On 18 June 2023, in Cruzeiro do Oeste (Parana), federal police seized 2,970kg of marijuana hidden inside a truck during an inspection on the PR-323 highway. One person was arrested.

On 18 June 2023, in Rio Claro (Sao Paulo), armed suspects shot and killed a man serving time for drug trafficking with at least six shots to the head in the Jardim Residencial das Palmeiras neighborhood. The target was on leave from prison. 1 fatality.

assoc_actor_2: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police

Over 50 shots were fired, and the event was described as an execution. 1 fatality.

On 18 June 2023, in Rio de Janeiro - North Zone (Rio de Janeiro), unknown shooters exchanged fire in the Costa Barros, and Jacarezinho neighborhoods, as well as the Barbante community, Ilha do Governador neighborhood and the Vila Kosmos neighborhood. Shooting was also heard in the Congonha community, Madureira neighborhood, the Morro do Juramento community, in Vicente de Carvalho neighborhood and the Campinho neighborhood. Unknown casualties.

On 18 June 2023, in Rio de Janeiro - West Zone (Rio de Janeiro), residents held a demonstration in the Catiri community, Bangu neighborhood, repudiating the fatal shooting of a male minor in the neighborhood earlier that evening in unknown circumstances. Demonstrators burned tires at Piquerobe Square and blocked traffic. The road was freed by police.

actor2: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
notes: On 18 June 2023, in Rio de Janeiro - West Zone (Rio de Janeiro), drug traffickers opened fire on military police in the Morro da Chacrinha community, Praca Seca neighborhood. Shots also hit and badly damaged a military police vehicle. Police hid in a residential house before reinforcements arrived. There were no fatalities.

On 18 June 2023, in Rio de Janeiro - West Zone (Rio de Janeiro), unknown shooters exchanged fire in 48 and Santo Andre communities in the Bangu neighborhood. Shooting was also heard in the Congo locality, Vila Kennedy neighborhood. Unknown casualties.
On 18 June 2023, in Sao Joao de Meriti (Rio de Janeiro), unknown shooters exchanged fire in the Parque Analandia neighborhood. Unknown casualties.

On 18 June 2023, in Porto Alegre (Rio Grande do Sul), two people were axed to death in the Vila Jardim neighborhood in the context of territorial disputes between rival drug trafficking groups. 2 fatalities.

Property destruction: On 18 June 2023, between Cunco and Melipeuco (Araucania), unknown individuals set an excavator on fire in the San Lorenzo farm. The identity of the perpetrators are unknown but Indigenous Militias are often responsible for similar attacks in the Araucania region.

Non-violent activity: Around 18 June 2023 (as reported), in Sotomayor (Narino), ELN militants patrolled the streets of the municipal capital. The armed men drove through the main streets on motorcycles. Witnesses assure that the armed men were asking for citizens' papers and other documents, and that they also conducted searches.

actor1: FARC Dissident - Mobile Column: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia Dissident Faction (Teofilo Forero Castro)
notes: Detonation: Around 18 June 2023 (as reported), in the rural area of Florencia municipality (Caqueta), two suspected members of the FARC dissident faction Teofilo Forero were injured after their explosive device was accidentally detonated in the Brisas Paradera vereda.

assoc_actor_2: Former FARC: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia
source: INDEPAZ; Sucesos Cauca; UNOCHA; W Radio
notes: On 18 June 2023, in Balboa (Cauca), unidentified armed individuals shot dead a former FARC member in the Bolivar neighborhood. Although the perpetrators have not been confirmed, the area is known for the presence of armed groups. 1 fatality.

On 18 June 2023, in Cartagena (Bolivar), an unidentified armed individual shot and wounded a social leader in the San Francisco neighborhood. The perpetrator briefly held a conversation with the victim before opening fire. The victim had reported death threats in the past. Although the perpetrators have not been confirmed, the area is known for the presence of armed groups. There were no fatalities.

Non-violent activity: Around 18 June 2023 (as reported), in the municipalities of Mompox, Margarita, San Fernando, and Hatillo de Loba (coded to Santa Cruz De Mompox, Bolivar), authorities documented the expansion of territory by members of the Gulf Clan. The armed group had carry out patrols limiting the right to free movement, impose hours for the closure of commerce and extort by charging illegal taxes.

Defusal: Around 18 June 2023 (as reported), in Puerto Villamizar (Norte de Santander), military forces deactivated four explosive devices planted by suspected militants of the ELN. Authorities suspected that the explosives, plated near school and other populated areas, were presumably intended to target members of the Gulf Clan.
Around 18 June 2023 (as reported), in the rural area of Caceres municipality (Antioquia), two unidentified armed groups clashed near Los Mangos vereda. Casualties unknown.

Around 18 June 2023 (as reported), in the rural area of Sipi municipality (Choco), two unidentified armed groups clashed, which caused the displacement of multiple civilians who were caught in the crossfire. There is no further information on this event. Casualties unknown.

On 18 June 2023, in Quito - Eugenio Espejo (Pichincha), armed residents of Comite del Pueblo parish and unidentified armed assailants clashed with guns and explosive devices (unspecified). The clash happened because the assailants had been extorting money from residents. Several homes were damaged by the explosions and gunfire. There were no fatalities.

On 18 June 2023, in Nazca (Cusco), workers of the company in charge of maintenance of the Shoungang Hierro mining company staged a demonstration to voice their grievance about not being paid their salaries, or bonuses.
Non-violent activity: On 18 June 2023, in Bajo Baudo municipality (Choco), an unidentified armed group patrolled several Indigenous reserve areas. There is no further information on this event.

On 18 June 2023, in Santiago de Cali (Valle del Cauca), members of the LGBTQ+ community marched to demand the approval of an integral law for transgender people. This took place in the context of the commemoration of International Pride Month.

On 17 June 2023, in Concepcion Las Minas, Chiquimula, two armed men shot and killed a councilmember candidate for the UNE political party in a drive-by shooting incident. The victim was in front of this store when two armed men on a motorcycle turned up and shot him dead. 1 fatality.

Around 17 June 2023 (as reported), in La Democracia, Huehuetenango, two people were killed and their bodies bearing gunshot wounds were found. Police believe the attack is related to another attack carried out in Santa Ana Huista, in which two people were killed and their bodies, burned (coded separately). The motivation for the attack is unknown. Police noted that one of the victims is related to a high-profile criminal, currently under detention. 2 fatalities.

Around 17 June 2023 (as reported), in Santa Ana Huista, Huehuetenango, two people were killed and their charred bodies were found on the Selegua bridge. One of the reports indicates that the victims were shot and killed, and their corpses burned, as well as a pick-up truck. Another report indicates that the victims were in their car when an armed commando turned up and opened fire for no apparent reason. The motivation for the attack is unknown. 2 fatalities.

On 17 June 2023, in Georgetown, Demerara-Mahaica, unidentified individuals set fire to a house. The arson attack was described as vigilante violence, as the property belonged to the suspect killer of a man during a brawl. There were no casualties.

Around 17 June 2023 (as reported), in Moroceli, El Paraiso, a prisoner and member of the Barrio 18 Gang was killed and his body was found in his prison cell in the maximum security prison known as La Tolva. The prisoners had arrived to the prison the previous day. The reason for the killing is unknown. Attacks and clashes between imprisoned members of rival gangs have increased in Honduras, leading the government to take special measures to guarantee order inside the prisons. 1 fatality.
On 17 June 2023, in Rio Chiquito, Cortes, unidentified armed men on a motorcycle shot and killed two men in a drive-by shooting. The reason for the killing is unknown. 2 fatalities.

Around 17 June 2023 (as reported), outside Comayaguela, Francisco Morazan, a man was killed and his body was found bound by arms by a river in the Venezuela neighborhood. The reason for the killing is unknown. 1 fatality.

On 17 June 2023, in San Juan municipality, Intibuca, several unidentified armed men aboard a vehicle shot and killed a boy in his father's mechanic workshop in a drive-by shooting. The reason for the killing is unknown. 1 fatality.

On 17 June 2023, in Reitoca, Francisco Morazan, unidentified gang members shot and wounded a man who then died on 23 June in the Escuela hospital due to the wounds received in the attack. The reason for the killing is unknown. 1 fatality.

On 17 June 2023, in Anaquilco, La Libertad, a member of the MS-13 attacked police officers with a bladed weapon. The police officers were patrolling the area when the gang member turned up and attacked them. One of the police officers opened fire and injured the gang member. No more detail is provided by the source.

source: El Mundo (El Salvador); La Prensa Grafica
notes: On 17 June 2023, in Aguacayo, Cuscatlan, there was an armed clash between members of an unidentified gang and police officers. As a result of the clash, one gang member was killed. The police officers were patrolling the area, when they arrived to a gang camp and armed men turned up and opened fire on them. No more detail is provided by the source. 1 fatality.

On 17 June 2023, in Perico (Jujuy), 50 members of the municipal workers' union and farmers erected incendiary barricades on the route 66 demanding salary improvements and against the constitutional reform that changes demonstration regulations, among other things. Near the Horacio Guzman airport, about 20 people are blocking the access.

On 17 June 2023, in Aguas Calientes (Jujuy), residents protested blocking the rural route 61. On 17 June 2023, in Buenos Aires - Comuna 5 (Ciudad Autonoma de Buenos Aires), police carried out an eviction procedure at Pringles house in the Almagro neighborhood. Six people were arrested for resisting and for attacks on police units. People living in the property stated that they have been living with their sons and daughters for more than a year, after having stayed in the street when escaping from situations of gender-based violence. A group of people and social activists gathered at the prosecutor's office demanding the release of the arrested arguing that the eviction procedure was irregular because the notification was not made.

On 17 June 2023, in San Roque (Jujuy), residents protested blocking the routes. The blockade takes place in the context of the protests carried out by Indigenous people and several labor and political groups against the constitutional reform that changes protests regulations, among other things.

notes: On 17 June 2023, in Purmamarca (Jujuy), Indigenous people and teachers members of La Pampa Education Workers Union (SITEP) associated with CTA-A and ATE protested blocking the 9th highway at 52nd highway against the recently approved constitutional reform that changes protests regulations, among others. Police tried to disperse the crowd and clear the route with pellets in at least four occasions. During the police action, more than 40 people were arrested including journalists and at least 10 were injured, including one man who lost an eye and a woman who has pellets wounds in her face, in her mouth, and in her eye. Teachers also participated in the protest as they have been protesting in recent weeks with salary demands.

On 17 June 2023, in Santa Rosa (La Pampa), prisoners held a demonstration inside of the Santa Rosa prison due to a visitors-related situation. Demonstrators tried damage the bars and the video surveillance system, and set fire to blankets and sheets. Police dispersed the crowd with tear gas. Prison guards did not let one woman in as she refused a palpation procedure. Police stated that the woman has a background of carrying objects that are not allowed.
