They attacked the leader and his working team with rocks, eggs and firecrackers inside the airport. Police officers were present but did not intervene.

Around 17 June 2023 (as reported), in Arapiraca (Alagoas), a man was stabbed and his body was found inside a construction in the Bom Sucesso neighborhood. The victim was a drug user. The motivation behind the attack and its perpetrators are unknown. 1 fatality.

actor2: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
notes: On 17 June 2023, in Bayeux (Paraiba), there was a shoot-out between the military police and three armed suspects in the Tambay neighborhood during police patrol in the area. One of the suspects was shot and injured during the clash and was taken to the hospital. The other suspects fled. With the minor police seized a firearm and ammunition. There were no fatalities.

On 17 June 2023, in Aroeiras (Paraiba), five people were shot in a drive-by shooting by armed suspects in a car who first shot and injured one of the victims in the hand, and then opened fire killing three people and injuring another one. Police believe the attack was linked to a dispute between rival gangs, though it is unknown if the victims were involved in criminal activity, according to police. The injured victims were taken to the hospital. The motivation behind the attack and its perpetrators are still under investigation. 3 fatalities.

actor1: Police Forces of Brazil (2023-) Federal Police
notes: Property destruction: On 17 June 2023, in Ponta Pora (Mato Grosso do Sul), federal police seized two tons of marijuana hidden inside a private property. No arrests were made.

On 17 June 2023, in Maraba (Para), a man was shot and killed in a drive-by shooting in the Independencia neighborhood by two armed individuals on a motorcycle. There are no reports on the identity of the perpetrators or the attack's motivation. 1 fatality.

actor1: Police Forces of Brazil (2023-) Federal Police
source: Globo Extra; Informe Agora; O Sao Goncalo; R7
notes: On 17 June 2023, in Duque de Caxias (Rio de Janeiro), a Federal Highway Police officer fired four shots and severely injured a woman in her vehicle near the access to the Linha Vermelha speedway on the Washington Luiz highway. Hours earlier on the same highway, a Federal Highway Police officer fired ten shots at another woman who died. The motivation of the attacks is not known. The officers were arrested and removed from their duties but one was released the next day. 1 fatality.

actor2: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
notes: On 17 June 2023, in Niteroi - North (Rio de Janeiro), six armed suspects exchanged fire with military police officers in the Fonseca neighborhood. All six suspects were arrested. Police seized two pistols, a shotgun, a revolver, ammunition, and drugs. There were no fatalities.

assoc_actor_2: Former Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
notes: On 17 June 2023, in Parati (Rio de Janeiro), unknown perpetrators shot and killed a former military police officer who was involved in drug trafficking, in the Mangueira neighborhood. The former soldier was removed in 2022 due to disciplinary issues and had been negotiating with drug traffickers about arms sales. 1 fatality.

actor2: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
notes: On 17 June 2023, Resende (Rio de Janeiro), a drug trafficker exchanged fire with military police officer in the Visconde de Maua region. Police seized cocaine and marijuana. There were no fatalities.

actor1: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) UPP: Pacifying Police Unit
notes: On 17 June 2023, in Rio de Janeiro - North Zone (Rio de Janeiro), two off-duty UPP military police officers fatally shot a man in the head after a fight at a nightclub in the Piedade neighborhood. A civilian woman was hit and injured by a stray bullet. One of the perpetrators was arrested. 1 fatality.

On 17 June 2023, in Rio de Janeiro - North Zone (Rio de Janeiro), unknown shooters exchanged fire in the Morro dos Macacos community, Vila Isabel neighborhood. Shooting was also heard in the Cinco Bocas community, Cordovil neighborhood and the Lins de Vasconcelos neighborhood. Unknown casualties.

On 17 June 2023, in Santos (Sao Paulo), Santos F.C. football fans held a protest outside the Pele training center in the Jabaquara neighborhood, calling for the departure of the team management after a string of losses.

source: Agencia Brasil; Brasil de Fato; G1
notes: On 17 June 2023, in Sao Paulo - Central Zone (Sao Paulo), residents held a protest outside the Sao Paulo Art Museum on Paulista Avenue in defense of the decriminalization and legalization of marijuana. The protesters called for an end to the war on drugs and emphasized it as an issue of race and class struggle.

actor2: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
notes: On 17 June 2023, in Lauro de Freitas (Bahia), there was a shoot-out between the military police and armed suspects in the Jardim Cidade Nova during police patrol in the area. The police chased after the two men and one of them was shot and injured during the clash and was taken to the hospital but did not survive the injuries. With him police seized a firearm and ammunition. The other man was arrested. Relatives of the fatal victim denied the victim had a weapon. 1 fatality.

assoc_actor_1: ORT: Williche Millalikan Territorial Resistance Organization
source: El Austral Osorno; El Austral Valdivia
notes: Property destruction: On 17 June 2023, in the rural are of Caman (Los Rios), six hooded individuals set more than 15 trucks on fire in a Wind Farm. Perpetrators threatened the workers before the attack. The Coordinadora Arauco Malleco (CAM) took responsibility for the attack through the ORT Williche Millalikan. The group also demanded the exit of the forestry companies from the area and the freedom of the Mapuche prisoners.

On 17 June 2023, near Ercilla commune (Araucania), unknown hooded individuals attacked a farmer in the Chamichaco farm. Perpetrators arrived in a van and shot repeatedly at the farmer damaging the tractor in which he was working, and causing him a minor injury in his ear. There have been several attacks in the Araucania region perpetrated by Indigenous groups who demand land rights. There were no fatalities.

notes: On 17 June 2023, in the rural area of Corinto municipality (Cauca), militants of the ELN and the Dagoberto Ramos FARC dissident faction clashed in a rural area between Corinto and Miranda. The armed fighting occurred in the sectors of Cilia La Calera, Caparrozal, Rionegro, and El Cabildo. Civilians were caught in the crossfire. Casualties unknown.

actor2: FARC Dissident - Second Marquetalia: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia Dissident Faction (Segunda Marquetalia)
notes: On 17 June 2023, in Palmar municipality (Narino), ELN militants and members of the FARC dissident faction Segunda Marquetalia clashed near the Awa Indigenous reservation area. Several armed clashes have been reported in the area in recent days, displacing some 1,400 members of the La Milagrosa, Vegas, Chagui Chimuza, Cuascuavi and Magui reservations. The number of casualties is unknown.

On 17 June 2023, in the rural area of Sipi municipality (Choco), ELN militants clashed with members of the Gulf Clan, resulting in the displacement of at least 234 Afro-Colombian people from the areas of Buenas Brisas, Barranconcito, and San Agustin. Casualties unknown.

On 17 June 2023, in Barrancabermeja (Santander), unidentified armed individuals shot and wounded a teacher in a drive-by shooting. The victim is the brother of a local councilman. Although the perpetrators have not been confirmed, the area is known for the presence of armed groups. There were no fatalities.

On 17 June 2023, in Buenaventura (Valle del Cauca), unidentified armed individuals broke into a house in Comuna 6 and opened fire on a group of people, killing three men. Police arrested nine of the perpetrators and seized machine guns and rifles. It is unclear whether the group clashed with the officers. Although the perpetrators have not been confirmed, the area is known for the presence of ELN, FARC dissident faction, among other armed groups.

actor1: FARC Dissident: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia Dissident Faction
notes: On 17 June 2023, in Suarez (Cauca), two suspected FARC dissidents shot and wounded two policemen who were at a checkpoint in the El Diamante area. Following the attack, the agents launched an operation in pursuit of the perpetrators, which resulted in a clash in the rural area of the municipality. There were no fatalities.

The armed men controlled all persons passing through the area for more than 4 hours.

Around 17 June 2023 (as reported), in Pelaya (Cesar), citizens protested in the streets following the abduction of a cattle rancher and a businesswoman (coded separately). Protesters demanded the release of the victim and demanded more security for civilians living in the area.

On 17 June 2023, in Pedro Juan Caballero (Amambay), a suspected member of the PCC (First Capital Command) was shot in the Mariscal Estigarribia neighborhood. The man was in a truck at the moment of the attack and police stated that he has criminal record for homicide, kidnapping and other acts. The victim received a shot in the face and his vehicle has several bullet holes. The man was involved in the death of a Brazilian businessman in 2018 committed by PCC members. There were no fatalities.

On 17 June 2023, in Ibague (Tolima), unidentified armed individuals clashed with police officers guarding the mayor of Piedras (Tolima). The perpetrators attacked the politician in a local restaurant, to which the officers reacted and a shootout ensued. Although the authorities declared the incident as an attempted robbery, the victim denounced that due to the circumstances of the attack the incident was possibly an attack. The politician and an officer were injured. There were no fatalities.

On 17 June 2023, in Santiago de Cali - Comuna 17 (Valle del Cauca), unidentified armed individuals clashed with police officers in the San Joaquin neighborhood when the former abducted a woman. The victim is the wife of a deceased Emcali union leader. It is unclear whether the event is related to her husband's role. The perpetrators broke into the victim's house and took her away. Police arrested one of the kidnappers. The victim was released around 23 June. The area is known for the presence of armed groups.

On 17 June 2023, in a rural area of San Carlos municipality (Cordoba), two members of the Gulf Clan shot and killed a woman, in an attack in the victim's house in an area known as Guacharacal corregimiento. Before fleeing the area, the perpetrators left a letter signed by the Gulf Clan. The motivations for the attack are not known. 1 fatality.

assoc_actor_1: ATE: Association of State Workers; Labor Group (Argentina)
notes: On 16 June 2023, in El Pantanillo (Catamarca), ATE members blocked National Route 38 to demand a raise in salaries amidst high inflation rates.

assoc_actor_1: ATE: Association of State Workers; Labor Group (Argentina)
notes: Around 16 June 2023 (as reported), in San Carlos de Bariloche (Rio Negro), ATE members demonstrated to demand a raise in salaries amidst high inflation rates.

location: San Fernando del Valle de Catamarca
notes: On 16 June 2023, in San Fernando del Valle de Catamarca (Catamarca), ATE and CTA members blocked National Route 38 to demand a raise in salaries amidst high inflation rates.

assoc_actor_1: CTA-A: Argentine Workers' Central Union - Autonomous; Labor Group (Argentina); MIJD: Independent Movement of Retirees and Unemployed
notes: On 16 June 2023, in Avellaneda (Buenos Aires), members of the CTA-A and MIJD blocked the Pueyrredon Bridge to demand a raise in salaries and to protest against the International Monetary Fund (IMF).

assoc_actor_1: CTA-A: Argentine Workers' Central Union - Autonomous; Labor Group (Argentina); MIJD: Independent Movement of Retirees and Unemployed
notes: On 16 June 2023, in Buenos Aires - Comuna 9 (Ciudad Autonoma de Buenos Aires), members of the CTA-A and MIJD blocked General Paz Avenue to demand a raise in salaries and to protest against the International Monetary Fund (IMF).

assoc_actor_1: CTA-A: Argentine Workers' Central Union - Autonomous; Labor Group (Argentina); MIJD: Independent Movement of Retirees and Unemployed
notes: On 16 June 2023, in Buenos Aires - Comuna 1 (Ciudad Autonoma de Buenos Aires), members of the CTA-A and MIJD demonstrated in the city center to demand a raise in salaries and to protest against the International Monetary Fund (IMF).

assoc_actor_1: CTA-A: Argentine Workers' Central Union - Autonomous; Labor Group (Argentina); MIJD: Independent Movement of Retirees and Unemployed
notes: On 16 June 2023, in Ezeiza (Buenos Aires), members of the CTA-A and MIJD blocked the Richieri highway to demand a raise in salaries and to protest against the International Monetary Fund (IMF).

assoc_actor_1: CTA-A: Argentine Workers' Central Union - Autonomous; Labor Group (Argentina); MIJD: Independent Movement of Retirees and Unemployed
notes: On 16 June 2023, between Buenos Aires and La Plata municipalities (coded to La Plata, Buenos Aires), members of the CTA-A and MIJD blocked the highway to demand a raise in salaries and to protest against the International Monetary Fund (IMF).

assoc_actor_1: CTA-A: Argentine Workers' Central Union - Autonomous; Labor Group (Argentina); MIJD: Independent Movement of Retirees and Unemployed
notes: On 16 June 2023, in Villa Madero (Buenos Aires), members of the CTA-A and MIJD blocked General Paz and Constituyentes intersection to demand a raise in salaries and to protest against the International Monetary Fund (IMF).

assoc_actor_1: CTA-A: Argentine Workers' Central Union - Autonomous; Labor Group (Argentina); MIJD: Independent Movement of Retirees and Unemployed
notes: On 16 June 2023, in Zarate (Buenos Aires), members of the CTA-A and MIJD blocked the round point to demand a raise in salaries and to protest against the International Monetary Fund (IMF).

On 16 June 2023, in La Quiaca (Jujuy), members of Indigenous communities blocked National Route 9 to protest against extractivism and to repudiate the constitutional reform approved by the provincial legislature and promoted by the governor which limits the right to protest.

On 16 June 2023, in Abra Pampa (Jujuy), teachers and members of Indigenous communities blocked the highway to repudiate the constitutional reform approved by the provincial legislature and promoted by the governor which limits the right to demonstrate. Police officers clashed with demonstrators.

assoc_actor_1: Labor Group (Argentina); ATE: Association of State Workers; CTA-A: Argentine Workers' Central Union - Autonomous
notes: On 16 June 2023, in Comodoro Rivadavia (Chubut), CTA-A and ATE members marched to the city center to demand a raise in salaries amidst high inflation rates and new salary negotiations and to protest against bad labor conditions.

On 16 June 2023, in La Plata - Villa Elvira (Buenos Aires), residents of the Villa Alba neighborhood blocked provincial route 11 setting tires on fire because they were without electricity service for several days.

Around 16 June 2023 (as reported), in Santa Rosa (La Pampa), security guards at the Securitas company associated with the Argentine Union of Admission and Permanence Control Workers (SUTCAPRA) protested outside La Anonima supermarket against delays in salary settlements, the violation of union rights, mistreatment against employees and lack of shift renewals.

assoc_actor_1: Teachers (Argentina); CTA-A: Argentine Workers' Central Union - Autonomous; Labor Group (Argentina); ATE: Association of State Workers
notes: On 16 June 2023, in General Pico (La Pampa), dozens of unionized teachers members of La Pampa Education Workers Union (SITEP) associated with CTA-A and ATE demonstrated in San Martin Square to demand a raise in salaries and pensions amidst high inflation rates and against the repression against teachers who have been demonstrating in Salta and Jujuy provinces. They also had demands related to the closure of rural schools in the province, violence at schools and modifications in the education system.

assoc_actor_1: Teachers (Argentina); CTA-A: Argentine Workers' Central Union - Autonomous; Labor Group (Argentina); ATE: Association of State Workers
notes: On 16 June 2023, in Santa Rosa (La Pampa), unionized teachers members of La Pampa Education Workers Union (SITEP) associated with CTA-A and ATE marched to city hall to demand a raise in salaries and pensions amidst high inflation rates and against the repression against teachers who have been demonstrating in Salta and Jujuy provinces. They also had demands related to the closure of rural schools in the province, violence at schools and modifications in the education system.

assoc_actor_1: Teachers (Argentina); Labor Group (Argentina); Indigenous Group (Argentina); CGT: General Confederation of Labour; CTA: Argentine Workers' Central Union
source: El Diario De La Pampa; La Arena; La Capital (Argentina)
notes: On 16 June 2023, in San Salvador de Jujuy (Jujuy), a multitude of teachers, labor unions, social, political and human rights organizations, and members of Indigenous communities marched to the governor's office to repudiate the constitutional reform approved by the provincial legislature and promoted by the governor which limits the right to protest and to demand a raise in salaries. CGT and CTA members joined the march. Police officers were present but did not intervene.

Around 16 June 2023 (as reported), in Resistencia (Chaco), friends and family of victims of violence and crime protested in front of the Prosecutor's Office to demand justice and to repudiate impunity.

On 16 June 2023, in Cochabamba (Cochabamba), Fassil Bank workers staged a demonstration outside the Financial System Supervision Authority (ASFI) to demand payment of their owed salaries and social benefits immediately and not in differed payments like they intend to give them.

On 16 June 2023, in Santa Cruz de la Sierra (Santa Cruz), Fassil Bank workers marched from 24 de Septiembre square to the Department Work Management offices to demand payment of their owed salaries and social benefits immediately and not in differed payments like they intend to give them.

On 16 June 2023, in Salvador - Barra/Pituba (Bahia), members of the Red Command (CV) gang invaded territory controlled by the rival gang Bonde do Maluco and a clash took place in the Calabar neighborhood. One suspect, who had criminal records for drug trafficking, was shot and killed during the clash. Witnesses stated the body was taken by the CV members to a local cemetery, where the body was later found by military police forces. Another person, not specified if involved in the clash was also shot and injured and was taken to the hospital. 1 fatality.

actor1: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
notes: On 16 June 2023, in Macapa (Amapa), three armed individuals exchanged fire with military police in the Pacoval neighborhood. All three armed suspects were killed. The trio might have been involved in attacks carried out the night before in Macapa and Santana municipalities (coded separately). 3 fatalities.

On 16 June 2023, in Sao Paulo - Central Zone (Sao Paulo), members of the Afro-Brazilian movement held a protest outside City Council, demanding for the removal of a Avante party councilman who had made a xenophobic remarks in a speech in 2022.

On 16 June 2023, in Natal (Rio Grande do Norte), a group of workers of the highway public transportation system gathered outside the union's building demanding the resolution of a pending wage demand and negotiation that is ongoing since the beginning of the year. Demonstrators were calling for a meeting and negotiation regarding their salaries, or otherwise they will call a general strike.

On 16 June 2023, in Petropolis (Rio de Janeiro), residents held a protest in the Morro da Oficina community, Alto da Serra neighborhood, demanding the execution of public works after promises from the government, and the payment of compensation for victims of severe flooding.

On 16 June 2023, in Angra dos Reis (Rio de Janeiro), two armed suspects opened fire in a nightclub in the Parque Mambucaba neighborhood. One man was killed, another man was injured, and two women were injured. 1 fatality.

On 16 June 2023, in Bayeux (Paraiba), an adolescent was shot to death in a local barber shop while he was working by two armed men who opened fire killing the victim. The motivation behind the attack and its perpetrators are unknown. 1 fatality.
On 16 June 2023, in Duque de Caxias (Rio de Janeiro), unknown shooters exchanged fire in the Vila Centenario neighborhood. Unknown casualties.
On 16 June 2023, in Rio de Janeiro - Central Zone (Rio de Janeiro), unknown shooters exchanged fire in the Benfica neighborhood. Unknown casualties.

On 16 June 2023, in Rio de Janeiro - North Zone (Rio de Janeiro), unknown shooters exchanged fire in the Jacarezinho, Guadalupe, Vila Kosmos, Cordovil, Anchieta, Manguinhos, and Madureira neighborhoods. Unknown casualties.
On 16 June 2023, in Rio de Janeiro - West Zone (Rio de Janeiro), unknown shooters exchanged fire in the Padre Miguel neighborhood. A civilian woman was found dead at the scene. 1 fatality.

On 16 June 2023, in Rio de Janeiro - West Zone (Rio de Janeiro), unknown shooters exchanged fire in the Morro do Jordao community, Tanque neighborhood and the Vila Valquiere neighborhood. Unknown casualties.

actor2: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
notes: On 16 June 2023, in Rio de Janeiro - North Zone (Rio de Janeiro), armed suspects exchanged fire with military police officers during an operation to combat cargo and vehicle theft in the Chapadao Complex, in the Pavuna neighborhood. A student was hit by a stray bullet that entered the grounds of a private school. 13 suspects were arrested, and police seized 24 vehicles. There were no fatalities.

On 16 June 2023, in Rio de Janeiro - West Zone (Rio de Janeiro), armed suspects passing by in a vehicle opened fire on a group of people in the Campo Grande neighborhood (drive-by). A police militia suspect was shot and killed, and four civilians were wounded. One of the wounded was a pregnant woman who had an emergency caesarean section as a result. 1 fatality.

Property destruction: On 16 June 2023, in San Miguel (Biobio), unknown individuals set three summer houses on fire on Route P72S. Two houses were completely burned but the fire of a third summer house was controlled by firefighters. Police are investigating whether the theft of a van in the Mirador de Peleco sector is related to the attack. The identity of perpetrators is unknown but Indigenous Militias are often responsible for similar attacks in the Biobio region.

On 16 June 2023, in Osorno (Los Lagos), students at the Carmela Carvajal school protested in front of the city hall demanding infrastructure improvements. Protesters stated that they are tired of sharing classrooms with other school which caused overcrowding and demanded the resumption of the improvement works in the campus located on Bilbao street.

On 16 June 2023, in Santiago - Providencia (Metropolitana), students and representatives of students protested outside of the El Vergel school against an eventual closure of the school. The educational community have been protesting for a few weeks, as protesters stated that they have not received a reliable answer on this subject since on April 28th the Municipality announced that school will not receive new students and there are doubts that schools complies with the infrastructure conditions required by the Ministry of Education. The municipality stated through a statement that the information is false.

On 16 June 2023, in Alto Hospicio (Tarapaca), hundreds of elderly people marched through the streets demanding more empathy and respect. The march ended at a Cultural Center where authorities carried out activities in commemoration of the Day of Awareness of Abuse and Mistreatment in Old Age.

On 16 June 2023, in Arica (Arica y Parinacota), hundreds of elderly people marched with banners through 21 de Mayo pedestrian street towards San Marcos Cathedral demanding more empathy and respect. The march was called 'No Mistreatment of Older Adults' and was organized by members of clubs and groups of elderly people. The march took place in commemoration of the Day of Awareness of Abuse and Mistreatment in Old Age.

On 16 June 2023, in Temuco (Araucania), more than 500 elderly people marched through the streets for their rights. Protesters also demanded more respect and better treatment. The march took place in commemoration of the Day of Awareness of Abuse and Mistreatment in Old Age.

On 16 June 2023, in Santiago - Estacion Central (Metropolitana), unknown individuals held a demonstration outside of Santiago University. Demonstrators threw around 60 Molotov cocktails at the streets, and police dispersed the crowd using water cannons. A citizen saw demonstrators leaving the educational facilities. Some Molotov cocktails reached local stores and businesses, and one person had one shoe on fire, leading to merchants clashing with demonstrators. The reasons for the demonstration are unknown.

Property destruction: On 16 June 2023, on the road between Curacautin and Lautaro (Araucania), hooded individuals set a house on fire. A pamphlet was found at the scene in which Mapuche Malleco Resistance (RMM) took responsibility for the attack and alluded to the transfer of the Mapuche prisoners to the Rancagua, Puerto Montt and Concepcion prisons after the incidents in the Angol prison (coded separately). Perpetrators also alluded to President Gabriel Boric's measures to reduce insecurity in the region.
On 16 June 2023, in Malambo (Atlantico), dozens of students at 13 public schools marched throughout the city to demand justice for the killing of a girl student during an armed robbery.
On 16 June 2023, in Isabel Lopez (Atlantico), students at the Jose Consuegra Higgins School protested over the lack of drinking water at the premises of the institution.

Property destruction: On 16 June 2023, near Quibdo municipality (Choco), ELN members intercepted a bus of public service in La Troje sector, forced the passengers out and then set the vehicle on fire.

actor2: FARC Dissident - Dagoberto Ramos: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia Dissident Faction (Dagoberto Ramos)
notes: On 16 June 2023, between Corinto and Miranda municipalities (Cauca), ELN forces clashed with members of the Dagoberto Ramos FARC dissident group between the Rio Negro and El Cabildo veredas. Casualties unknown.

Around 16 June 2023 (as reported), in the rural area of Inza municipality (Cauca), a farmer was shot dead by unidentified armed individuals in San Jose vereda. The motives and perpetrators of the attack are unknown but there is presence of a FARC dissident group in the area. 1 fatality.

actor1: FARC Dissident: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia Dissident Faction
notes: On 16 June 2023, in Suarez (Cauca), FARC dissidents ambushed police officers and a clash broke out in the Machaquero Diamante neighborhood. Two police officers were injured and a member of the group was killed. 1 fatality.

On 16 June 2023, in Carrillo (Cordoba), members of the Zenu Indigenous community blocked the highway to demand a previous consultation process for the building of the Lorica - Cerete Highway. The protesters retained the machinery of the consortium in charge of the project and also temporarily held some of its workers.

On 16 June 2023, in Cartagena (Bolivar), a multitude of residents in the Blas de Lezo neighborhood protested outside the police inspection building to demand that a sculpture with the name of the neighborhood is not removed. They said that the sculpture does not infringe the non-occupation of public space norms and that behind the lawsuit to remove it are political interests since it was donated by a mayoral candidate. The demonstration took place as a hearing to define the outcome of the lawsuit was taking place inside the police inspection.

On 16 June 2023, in Cartagena (Bolivar), around 30 people gathered outside the Bahia San Carlos apartment complex project to protest against anomalies in the construction of the building and the lack of willingness of the construction company to negotiate with potential buyers. They claimed that the company is not accepting to wait until the government transfers allowances to buyers, even when they had to wait four years for the apartments to be ready, after delays from the company.

Around 16 June 2023 (as reported), in Inza (Cauca), friends and family of a man killed in the San Jose vereda (coded separately) marched throughout the municipal seat to repudiate the attack and to demand justice.

On 16 June 2023, in Natagaima municipality (Tolima), residents blocked a national route to protest against the bad state of the roads, the bad healthcare service provided at the local hospital, and a waste treatment plant that is causing negative environmental impacts in the area.
Around 16 June 2023 (as reported), in Pelaya (Cesar), residents held a candlelight vigil to demonstrate against the kidnapping of a cattle farmer (coded separately) and to demand his release.

On 16 June 2023, in Cuenca (Azuay), pedestrians around the center of the city captured two men who had tried to rob a man. They flipped the car that the robbers used, with them inside. Police officers captured one of the men and the other one escaped. The man was taken to a police station.

On 16 June 2023, in Quito - Eloy Alfaro (Pichincha), around 150 residents of Solanda sector marched with torches through Jose Maria Aleman street as a demonstration to voice their concerns about the increase of insecurity and demanded more security in their sector.

On 16 June 2023, in Quito - Eugenio Espejo (Pichincha), residents of Armero neighborhood marched through Mariscal Sucre avenue as a demonstration to reject the increasing amount of criminal activity and demanded more patrols and the implementation of a Community Police Unit (UPC) in their sector.

On 16 June 2023, in Ayolas (Misiones), for the second consecutive day, workers at the Yacyreta Binational Entity (EBY) protested outside the premises of the institution to demand the payment of salaries they are owed and the renewal of contracts.

On 16 June 2023, in Encarnacion (Itapua), students at the San Isidro and Heroes de Chaco schools protested in front of the Justice Palace to demand justice for the femicide of a student by her boyfriend.
On 16 June 2023, in Chiclayo (Lambayeque), workers at the National Penitentiary Institute (INPE) staged a demonstration outside the local prison to demand a raise of salaries and bonuses.

On 16 June 2023, in Tacna (Tacna), dozens of elderly residents marched to the Civic center as a demonstration to demand authorities respect for their rights, and the construction of a health center for elder citizens. The demonstration was carried out in commemoration of the International Day for Older Persons.

On 16 June 2023, in Iquitos (Loreto), elderly residents marched through the city as a demonstration to demand authorities respect for their rights and to be treated appropriately. The demonstration was carried out in commemoration of the International Day for Older Persons.

source: OVCS: Observatorio Venezolano de Conflictividad Social
notes: On 16 June 2023, in San Juan de los Morros (Guarico), a group of retired workers and pensioners, protested to demand better pensions and living conditions, and the liberation of imprisoned unionists.

On 16 June 2023, in Palma Sola (Carabobo), Carabobo state police forces shot and killed a member of the El Oswaldito (Carabobo) gang, during an armed confrontation with several of them in the La Volkswagen sector. The suspects resisted authority and a shooting ensued. One of them was killed in the gunfire, the rest escaped. The deceased was sought for homicide and had an unspecified criminal record. Police collected a gun. 1 fatality.

On 16 June 2023, in San Francisco (Zulia), two unidentified crime group suspects on a motorcycle opened fire on a teenage girl and a boy, killing the girl and injuring the boy, in a drive-by shooting in the Democracia neighborhood, Jose Domingo Rus parish. The victims were taken to hospital for treatment, where the teenage girl was pronounced dead. The suspects escaped. The motivations for the attack are unknown. 1 fatality.

On 16 June 2023, in Barinas (Barinas), a group of teachers protested to demand elections for the board of directors of the CADEBA Regional Teachers' Insurance Fund, and payment of owed stipends. The protesters accuse the current upper management of corruption.

On 16 June 2023, in Caucagua (Miranda), a group of teachers protested to demand better pay and working conditions, and the renewal of their collective labor agreement. The protesters blocked the access road to the town intermittently. PNB police were present but there was no intervention.

source: El Diario (Venezuela); OVCS: Observatorio Venezolano de Conflictividad Social
notes: On 16 June 2023, in Tovar (Merida), a group of education sector workers marched in protest to demand better pay and working conditions.

source: OVCS: Observatorio Venezolano de Conflictividad Social; VPItv
notes: On 16 June 2023, in Guigue (Carabobo), a group of demonstrators, including university sector workers, other state workers, and unionists, protested to demand better pay and working conditions, and the cessation of threats and persecution against unionist leaders for participating in the labor action.

On 16 June 2023, in San Francisco municipality (Zulia), for the second consecutive day, a group of Yukpa Indigenous people protested in KM 18 of the Via a Perija road to demand the return of three vehicles and their load of artisan objects, seized by PNB police in the early hours of the day before while dispersing another protest of the same group in the General Rafael Urdaneta Bridge (coded separately). They also called for permission to travel to the Maracaibo courthouse to report the injuries occurred during that police intervention, and demanded information about the wellbeing of the seven demonstrators arrested. The protesters argued that without their vehicles they couldn't return to their homes in the Sierra de Perija (Zulia). This was part of their ongoing protests that week to demand permission to travel to Caracas to sell their production of artisan objects to the government (coded separately).

source: OVCS: Observatorio Venezolano de Conflictividad Social
notes: On 16 June 2023, in Lara state (coded to Barquisimeto), protesters demonstrated with unspecified demands on issues related to labor, housing, Indigenous peoples' rights, and political participation.

On 16 June 2023, in El Palotal (Tachira), a group of residents of the Carrillo sector blocked the Via Palotal road in protest over power outages going on for at least eight days. The blackout was caused by the breakdown of an electric transformer in the area.

source: OVCS: Observatorio Venezolano de Conflictividad Social
notes: On 16 June 2023, in Trujillo state (coded to Trujillo), protesters demonstrated with unspecified demands on issues related to labor, housing, Indigenous peoples' rights, and political participation.

source: El Diario (Venezuela); OVCS: Observatorio Venezolano de Conflictividad Social; Que Pasa en Venezuela
notes: On 16 June 2023, near San Pablo municipality (Yaracuy), a group of residents blocked the Troncal 1 road in protest over fuel shortages. The protest was staged by the HF San Pablo petrol station.

On 16 June 2023, in Dulce Nombre, Copan, unidentified armed men shot and killed a father and his underage son while they were riding a motorcycle. The reason for the killing a territorial dispute related to drug sales. 2 fatalities.
On 16 June 2023, in Amarateca, Francisco Morazan, unidentified armed men posing as customers shot and killed a moto taxi driver. The reason for the killing is unknown. 1 fatality.
On 16 June 2023, in Panama City, Panama, members affiliated with the beer union staged a protest to demand that their employer complies with the collective agreement between them.

assoc_actor_1: Labor Group (Belize); CWU: Christian Workers' Union; Christian Group (Belize)
notes: On 16 June 2023, in Belize City, Belize, workers affiliated with the Christian Workers' Union (CWU) staged a protest at the Port of Belize against the port authority lack of compliance with a directive issued by the Essential Services Arbitration Tribunal (ESAT) by which stevedores must be compensated after the transfer of the sugar-loading operations to the Big Creek port.

On 16 June 2023, in Sacaba (Cochabamba), residents of Colinas de Andalucia urbanization staged a demonstration to voice their concerns about land squatters taking protected lands from San Pedro hill. More than 30 land squatters came in previous days to take lands owned by the residents.

source: Crimes News RJ; G1; Informe Agora; OTT-RJ
notes: On 16 June 2023, in Rio de Janeiro - North Zone (Rio de Janeiro), the Red Command exchanged fire with the Pure Third Command in the Morro dos Macacos community, Vila Isabel neighborhood. Unknown casualties.

actor2: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
notes: On 16 June 2023, in Feira Nova (Pernambuco), there was a shoot-out between the military police and drug traffickers in the SE-170 road during a police search approach that the suspects evaded. Two suspects were shot and injured during the clash and were taken to the hospital where they later died. Police seized two firearms and portions of drugs. 2 fatalities.

On 16 June 2023, in Macapa (Amapa), a drug trafficker was shot and killed in the Perpetuo Socorro neighborhood by two armed individuals. Police believe the attack was motivated by a settling of scores. Authorship of the attack is unknown. 1 fatality.
Around 16 June 2023 (as reported), in Manaus - East Zone (Amazonas), a transgender person suspected of theft was beaten up and injured by drug traffickers in a drug trafficking tribunal.

On 16 June 2023, in Governador Valadares (Minas Gerais), a woman was shot 30 times and killed inside her own commercial establishment by an armed individual who then fled with an accomplice on a motorcycle. Authorship and motivation of the attack are unknown. 1 fatality.

On 16 June 2023, in Jequitinhonha (Minas Gerais), two men were shot and killed by five drug traffickers in the context of territorial disputes. At least one deceased was also a drug trafficker, who had been receiving death threats from rivals. 2 fatalities.
On 16 June 2023, in Belem (Para), a member of a drug trafficking group was shot and killed in the Terra Firme neighborhood by unknown armed individuals. 1 fatality.

actor1: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
notes: On 16 June 2023, in Limoeiro do Ajuru (Para), two members of a drug trafficking group exchanged fire with military police in the Nova Limoeiro neighborhood. Both drug traffickers were killed. Police seized a firearm, ammunition and portions of drugs. 2 fatalities.

On 16 June 2023, in Niteroi - Praias da Baia (Rio de Janeiro), Pure Third Command drug traffickers attacked the Morro do Estado community controlled by the Red Command, engaging in an armed confrontation. Unknown casualties.

On 16 June 2023, in Porto Velho (Rondonia), a man was killed in a drive-by shooting in the Sao Joao Bosco neighborhood by two armed individuals on a motorcycle. The victim was wearing a monitoring anklet (charges not reported). There are no reports on the identity of the perpetrators or the attack's motivation. 1 fatality.

Around 16 June 2023 (as reported), in Rio das Antas (Santa Catarina), a woman was killed and dismembered by unknown individuals and her body parts were found in a wooded area over the course of two days. Circumstances of death are unknown. 1 fatality.

On 16 June 2023, in Barreiras (Bahia), a man was shot to death by at least one armed suspect who fled in a motorcycle after the attack. The victim had criminal records for drug trafficking. The motivation behind the attack and its perpetrators are under investigation. 1 fatality.

actor2: FARC Dissident - Second Marquetalia: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia Dissident Faction (Segunda Marquetalia)
assoc_actor_2: FARC Dissident - 30th Front: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia Dissident Faction (30th Front)
notes: Around 16 June 2023 (as reported), in the rural area of Ricaurte municipality (Narino), the ELN, Second Marquetalia, and 30th Front FARC dissidents clashed for the fourth consecutive day. The groups planted landmines in the area. 450 Awa Indigenous people were forcibly displaced as a result. Casualties unknown.

On 16 June 2023, in Candelaria (Valle del Cauca), unidentified individuals threw an explosive device at a police station in the Poblado Campestre area. The explosion caused multiple damages to the structure and the nearby houses. Although the perpetrators have not been confirmed, the area is known for the presence of armed groups. There were no fatalities.

Around 16 June 2023 (as reported), in the rural area of Pelaya municipality (Cesar), unidentified armed subjects abducted a businesswoman. The perpetrators intercepted the victim on a road that connects the municipal capital with the Costillita corregimiento. The victim's whereabouts are still unknown. Although the perpetrators have not been confirmed, the area is known for the presence of ELN, Gulf Clan, and FARC dissident factions.

On 16 June 2023, in Caracas - Baruta (Miranda), a group of state workers protested to demand better pay and living conditions. The protesters marched around the Las Mercedes neighborhood, one of the most affluent in the country, to put the spotlight on the inequality in Venezuela. SEBIN police forces were present but there was no intervention.

On 16 June 2023, in Santiago de Veraguas, Veraguas, a group of criminal law students staged a sit-in protest for eight days at the Legal Medicine and Forensic Sciences of Veraguas against the approval of a resolution on the requirements for experts in criminal investigations and security.
On 16 June 2023, in Santiago (Metropolitana), housing debtors protested near the President Gabriel Boric's house. The reasons for the protest are unknown.

source: El Heraldo (Colombia); El Tiempo (Colombia); RCN Radio
notes: On 16 June 2023, in the rural area of Pelaya municipality (Cesar), a cattle rancher was abducted by unidentified armed men from his farm in the Cano Sucio district. The victim was released around June 27. The area is known for the presence of armed groups.

Displacement: Around 16 June 2023 (as reported), in the rural area of El Dovio municipality (Valle del Cauca), approximately 550 Embera Chami Indigenous people were forcibly displaced following multiple threats by an unidentified armed group.

Around 16 June 2023 (as reported), in Pedro Juan Caballero (Amambay), the leader of a drug-trafficking organization was shot and killed and his body was found with several gunshot wounds near the Justice Palace. The body was dumped from a vehicle onto the street. Investigations by authorities indicate that the deceased had links with the PCC. Authorities also identified the deceased's chief of security and his brother-in-law, who were members of his criminal organization, as the perpetrators of the attack and believe that they killed him to take his place. 1 fatality.

On 15 June 2023, in San Miguel de Tucuman (Tucuman), a group of people demonstrated outside a Volkswagen store to repudiate increases in savings plan fees. Demonstrators threw stones at the building. Police officers were present but did not intervene.

On 15 June 2023, in Concepcion (Biobio), students at Concepcion University protested with banners against recent cases of gender-based violence in the educational facilities. Students began a strike in 35 careers. The protest began in response to complaints of sexual harassment in the Department of Metallurgical Engineering in April. Students demanded the resignation of the director of Gender Equity. Several faculties paralyzed their classes such as Social Sciences, Education, Architecture, Urbanism and Geography, among others.

On 15 June 2023, in Valparaiso (Valparaiso), hundreds of teachers with College of Teachers Union Teachers marched through the streets in protest against the SLEP (Local Public Education Service) for poor infrastructure in 40 educational facilities. The protest takes place in the context of the national assembly of the Magisterium, where teachers will schedule protests. Protesters stated that in addition to infrastructure problems, the SLEP did not deliver the educational resources until June, arguing that in March, April and May, the schools had no resources.

On 15 June 2023, in San Antonio (Valparaiso), residents from the Cerro Alegre neighborhood gathered on Arturo Prat street at Ernesto Riquelme street to protest against successive power outages. Protesters stated that more than 100 families are affected by the poor condition of the transformer that regulates the electric charge in the sector. The electric company Chilquinta argued that the theft of energy collapses the network.

On 15 June 2023, in Cartagena (Bolivar), students, parents, and teachers at a school in the Nuevo Bosque neighborhood marched in the area to protest against the accumulation of garbage, drug consumption and the unlawful parking of cars around the school. The roadblock lasted at least 12 hours.

Around 15 June 2023 (as reported), in Carora (Lara), a group of transport drivers blocked the Via a Aregue road in protest over fuel scarcity. The protest was staged by the El Robledal petrol station.

Additional demands included better pay and working conditions.

On 15 June 2023, in Punta Cardon (Falcon), a group of demonstrators, including residents and workers of the El Estadio sector, protested against the eviction of a family from an abandoned plot of land they occupied 20 years prior. In that site, the family had built their house, and had set up a concrete construction block manufacturing business which currently employs six people. The original owner of the land, who appeared recently, demands an exorbitant sum of money for the ownership, which the family cannot pay.

A ministerial convoy was travelling to Machiques (Zulia) that day, to meet with a delegation of indigenous group leaders to address their demands, following a series of protests over the selling of artisan objects to the government as a means of raising funds for their communities. Students and residents of the area were also present.

source: Diario Version Final (Venezuela); El Pitazo; Reporte YA

This was part of their ongoing protests that week to demand permission to travel to Caracas to sell their production of artisan objects to the government (coded separately). The roadblock was staged in KM 18, by the GNB military outpost at the Los Dulces sector, and the intention was to block the advance of a ministerial convoy that was travelling to Machiques (Zulia) that day, to meet with a delegation of indigenous group leaders to address their demands.

On 15 June 2023, in Barcelona (Anzoategui), a group of residents of the Rosa Ines sector protested over power outages going on for at least 10 days. The protesters claim that approximately 180 families are affected by this problem.

They also demanded road safety measures to prevent accidents in the area. A group of rioters who tried to pass through the roadblock got out of the vehicle and beat up one of the demonstrators with a tree branch. The demonstrators was injured and taken to hospital. There were no fatalities.

On 14 June 2023, in Esquel 8Chubut), Mapuche Indigenous people marched to demand the removal of a waste treatment plant from the area surrounding their community. The plant is causing environmental and water pollution in the area. They also repudiated the lack of solutions from municipal and national authorities.

On 14 June 2023, in La Plata - Central (Buenos Aires), students, parents, and teachers at the secondary school number 27 protested outside the premises of the institution against the lack of heating, which has caused students to attend classes in very low temperatures.
On 14 June 2023, in Cholila (Chubut), members of the Chubut Teacher's Association (ATECH) marched to demand a raise in salaries and to request new salary negotiations.

On 14 June 2023, in Comodoro Rivadavia (Chubut), members of the Chubut Teacher's Association (ATECH) marched from School number 83 to San Martin Square to demand a raise in salaries and to request new salary negotiations.
On 14 June 2023, in Cushamen (Chubut), members of the Chubut Teacher's Association (ATECH) marched to demand a raise in salaries and to request new salary negotiations.
On 14 June 2023, in Puerto Madryn (Chubut), members of the Chubut Teacher's Association (ATECH) marched to demand a raise in salaries and to request new salary negotiations.
On 14 June 2023, in Rio Mayo (Chubut), members of the Chubut Teacher's Association (ATECH) marched to demand a raise in salaries and to request new salary negotiations.

On 14 June 2023, in Trelew (Chubut), members of the Chubut Teacher's Association (ATECH) marched to demand a raise in salaries and to request new salary negotiations, more investment of resources in public education and improvements to school infrastructure.

On 14 June 2023, around Trevelin municipality (Chubut), members of the Chubut Teacher's Association caravanned from Esquel to Trevelin to demand a raise in salaries and to request new salary negotiations.

assoc_actor_1: UOM: Metallurgical Workers Union; Labor Group (Argentina)
notes: On 14 June 2023, in Villa Constitucion (Santa Fe), Acindar company contractors associated with UOM protested outside the premises of the company to demand a raise in salaries to the level of the employees' salary.

On 14 June 2023, in Resistencia (Chaco), thousands of demonstrators marched to the main square of the city to demand justice for the femicide and disappearance of a woman. They also demanded a life sentence for the people involved. Seven people have been arrested in the case, including the boyfriend of the victim and his parents who are leaders of the Piquetero movement and also candidates for the provincial legislature and for mayor of the city. Demonstrators also repudiated the links between the current provincial government and social movements since the Piquetero leaders arrested were close with the governor of Chaco. Members of the Not One Less movement and friends and family of the victim also participated in the march.

On 14 June 2023, in Presidencia Roque Saenz Pena (Chaco), demonstrators marched to demand justice for the femicide and disappearance of a woman. Seven people have been arrested in the case, including the boyfriend of the victim and his parents who are leaders of the Piquetero movement and also candidates for the provincial legislature and for mayor of the city.

On 14 June 2023, in Cochabamba (Cochabamba), residents of Portales Base Territorial Organization (OTB) staged a demonstration in Cantarrana sector to voice their grievances about land squatters holding fake documents in their sector that is inside the Tunari National Park.

On 14 June 2023, in Pontes e Lacerda (Mato Grosso), five people were abducted and tortured by four members of the CV due to a drug debt. All four CV members were arrested by police. There were no fatalities.

actor1: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
notes: On 14 June 2023, in Aripuana (Mato Grosso), two armed individuals exchanged fire with military police during a patrol on the MT-418 highway. Both suspects were killed. The pair had a police record for several offences, including drug trafficking. Police seized two firearms. 2 fatalities.

actor1: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
notes: On 14 June 2023, in Maraba (Para), three drug trafficking suspects exchanged fire with military police in the Nova Maraba neighborhood. One suspect was killed and the others were arrested. Police seized a firearm, ammunition and a portion of cocaine. 1 fatality.

actor1: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
notes: Property destruction: On 14 June 2023, in the rural area of Ponta Pora municipality (Mato Grosso do Sul), military police seized 1,214kg of marijuana hidden inside a truck during an inspection on the MS-164 highway. No arrests were made.

actor1: Police Forces of Brazil (2023-) Federal Police
notes: Property destruction: On 14 June 2023, in Guia Lopes da Laguna (Mato Grosso do Sul), federal police seized 13.3 tons of marijuana hidden inside a truck during an inspection on the BR-267 highway. One person was arrested.

actor2: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
notes: On 14 June 2023, in Rio de Janeiro - Central Zone (Rio de Janeiro), teachers held a protest outside the State Department of Education in the city center. Military police intimidated protesters while dispersing the demonstration, pushing teachers against a fence and pointing guns at them during the act.

On 14 June 2023, in Aracaju (Sergipe), for a second day in a row, a group of traffic officers workers gathered outside the City Council to demonstrate against a proposed career plan sent to the House by the city government and demanding the withdrawn of the bill.

On 14 June 2023, in Mossoro (Rio Grande do Norte), a non-specified group of local administration workers gathered outside the City Hall to demonstrate against legislation that changes the working conditions of public sector workers, excluding some of their working rights.
On 14 June 2023, in Belem (Para), students and their parents gathered in the Princesa Izabel square, Condor neighborhood, to demand better school transportation services.

On 14 June 2023, in Belo Horizonte (Minas Gerais), retired teachers carried out a protest in front of the Legislative Assembly against the payment of a compulsory social security contribution and to demand salary readjustment for teachers.

On 14 June 2023, in Buerarema (Bahia), a non-specified group of teachers gathered at the entrance of the municipality, blocking the BR-101 highway to demonstrate against the lack of salary readjustment and the leveling of salaries that undergraduate teachers have with mid-level teachers. According to demonstrators, there was a dismantling of the base salary that leveled all professionals, which would bypass the career plan.

On 14 June 2023, in Sao Vicente (Sao Paulo), around 30 mothers held a protest in front of the railway track near the border with Cubatao, resisting stationary trains that block the only passage from their community to the city. Protesters lament they prevent them from taking their children to school and going to medical appointments.

On 14 June 2023, in Maraba (Para), family members and friends of a woman who was involved in a car crash on 29 May 2023 and did not survive the injuries carried out a protest to demand better road signaling.

On 14 June 2023, in Maceio (Alagoas), a delivery service man was shot to death in the Grutao region while the man was trying to deliver an order to one of the suspects who opened fire against the victim. The suspects fled in a car after the attack. The motivation behind the attack and its perpetrators are unknown. 1 fatality.

On 14 June 2023, in Resende (Rio de Janeiro), four armed suspects abducted a man from his house in the Novo Surubi neighborhood. The man was taken to the Nova Alegria neighborhood and shot dead. The suspects fled. 1 fatality.
On 14 June 2023, in Tres Rios (Rio de Janeiro), heavily armed suspects surrounded and shot and killed a man on the border of the Cantagalo and Favelinha neighborhoods. 1 fatality.

On 14 June 2023, in Rio de Janeiro - North Zone (Rio de Janeiro), unknown shooters exchanged fire in the Vigario Geral, Pavuna, and Jacarezinho neighborhoods. Shooting was also heard in the Mare Complex. Unknown casualties.
On 14 June 2023, in Rio de Janeiro - West Zone (Rio de Janeiro), unknown shooters exchanged fire in the Senador Camara neighborhood. Unknown casualties.

On 14 June 2023, in Macapa (Amapa), an adolescent was shot and killed inside a hair salon in the Araxa neighborhood by an armed individual. Police believes the attack was motivated by drug trafficking disputes. 1 fatality.

On 14 June 2023, in Serra (Espirito Santo), a civilian was shot and killed in the Novo Porto Canoa neighborhood in the context of territorial disputes between rival drug trafficking groups. 1 fatality.

actor2: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
assoc_actor_2: Police Forces of Brazil (2023-) Municipal Guards
notes: On 14 June 2023, in Ibateguara (Alagoas), there was a shoot-out between the military police and municipal guards and a drug trafficker in Rocadinho community, rural area of the municipality during a police operation. The suspect, accused of being part of a drug trafficking organization, had criminal records for drug trafficking and illegal possession of weapons. The suspect was taken to the hospital but did not survive the injuries. Police seized a firearm, two machine guns, ammunition, a precision scale, and portions of different drugs. Two other suspects were arrested during the operation. 1 fatality.

actor2: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
notes: On 14 June 2023, in Salvador - Liberdade (Bahia), there was a shoot-out between the military police and drug traffickers at Rocinha community, in the IAPI neighborhood during police patrol in the area. Two suspects were shot and injured and taken to the hospital but did not survive the injuries. With them police seized two pistols, chargers, ammunition, portions of drugs, and some cash. A civilian was shot and injured by a stray bullet during the clash. 2 fatalities.

Around 14 June 2023 (as reported), in Manaus - East Zone (Amazonas), a man was killed and dismembered by unknown individuals and his body parts were found in the Distrito Industrial neighborhood. Circumstances of death are unknown. 1 fatality.

Around 14 June 2023 (as reported), in Sao Goncalo - (Rio de Janeiro), a person was found entirely burnt at the back seat of a charred vehicle in the Largo da Ideia neighborhood. The victim had escaped a kidnapping attempt immediately prior to the attack, though there is no further information. 1 fatality.

actor2: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
notes: On 14 June 2023, in Quatis (Rio de Janeiro), armed suspects exchanged fire with military police in the Jardim Independencia neighborhood. No one was injured and one man was arrested. There were no fatalities.

source: Folha de S. Paulo; G1; Globo Extra; Informe Agora; OTT-RJ; R7
notes: On 14 June 2023, in Rio de Janeiro - North Zone (Rio de Janeiro), three armed suspects exchanged fire with military police officers during a chase in the Alemao Complex after failing a police checkpoint in the Olaria neighborhood. A military police officer was shot and killed. 1 fatality.

actor2: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
notes: On 14 June 2023, in Sao Joao de Meriti (Rio de Janeiro), armed suspects exchanged fire with military police in the Jardim Meriti neighborhood. Unknown casualties.
