notes: On 14 June 2023, in Sao Paulo - South Zone (Sao Paulo), four armed suspects opened fire on a military police officer during an approach in the Campo Limpo neighborhood. The officer was hit three times and injured. There were no fatalities.

On 14 June 2023, in Lavras (Minas Gerais), a man was shot and killed in the Santa Efigenia neighborhood by two armed individuals. One suspect was detained. The victim had a police record for drug trafficking. 1 fatality.

On 14 June 2023, in Manaus - South Zone (Amazonas), a man was shot and killed in a drive-by shooting in the Morro da Liberdade neighborhood by two unknown armed individuals in a car. The deceased had a police record for homicide and drug trafficking. 1 fatality.

On 14 June 2023, in Sao Miguel do Iguacu (Parana), a fugitive from the penitentiary system was shot and killed by unknown armed individuals between the Urussanga and Santa Rosa do Ocoi communities. The deceased had a police record for drug trafficking. 1 fatality.

Property destruction: On 14 June 2023, in San Jose de la Mariquina (Los Rios), unknown individuals destroyed a bridge's side supports with chainsaws. The bridge is used by vehicles to get to several properties and sectors of a forestry company. The identity of perpetrators is unknown but Indigenous Militias are often responsible for similar attacks in the Los Rios region.

On 14 June 2023, in Tranaquepe (Biobio), five armed individuals tried to ambush a vehicle on the route that connects Tirua and Canete. The victim sped up after seeing the armed individuals, the group shot him with pellets causing him injuries in his arm. The car had bullet holes on the front and sides. The man works at the CyQ company. The identity of perpetrators is unknown but Indigenous Militias are often responsible for similar attacks in the Biobio region. There were no fatalities.

On 14 June 2023, in Antofagasta (Antofagasta), representatives of students and students protested with banners outside of Las Rocas school against suspected child abuse. The situation occurred during a medical procedure carried out by students at the Santo Tomas University. Protesters stated that students were questioned regarding the size of their genitals, that they were exposed to inappropriate images and that girls were forced to show the chest area. Authorities stated that there is misinformation about what happened and that none of the students were touched.

On 14 June 2023, in Concon (Valparaiso), representatives of students and students at SEK school protested outside of the educational facilities against the board's decision to paralyze the school regular activities after a failed collective agreement with workers. The closure will affect 110 workers and more than 800 students.

On 14 June 2023, in Concepcion (Biobio), about 400 unionized fishers gathered at Caleta Lo Rojas in Coronel and marched towards the Regional Presidential Delegation demanding changes in the fishing industry legislation. Protesters stated that within the petitions is the need for a pension, as well as the recognition of women in the fishing industry.

On 14 June 2023, in Santiago (Metropolitana), about 10,000 teachers with the College of Teachers Union gathered at Baquedano square and marched through several streets, passing by Almagro park and arriving at Los Heroes square. Teachers from several Metropolitan communes participated in the march and began a 24-hour stoppage as a protest to demand the Government to put an end to labor stress, to find a solution to school violence, greater coverage for mental health, the payment of the historical debt, a retirement bonus, among others.

On 14 June 2023, in Placilla (Valparaiso), residents protested in front of Chilquinta electric company demanding a solution as they have been without electric supply for more than a week due to a transformer failure. Protesters stated that they live in Cumbres de Placilla camp and that the problem is affecting 509 families.

On 14 June 2023, in Ibague (Tolima), bus drivers marched to city hall with demand related to the implementation of a new transportation system in the city and the inability of the new operator of buying all buses. They also protested against the non-compliance of authorities with agreements that had been reached in December 2022.

On 14 June 2023, in Pasacaballos, Bolivar, students protested in a education institution and closed the premises to demand a change of principal and better conditions for their school. The Education Secretary announced a meeting both with the current principal and the students to find solutions.

Around 14 June 2023 (as reported), in Caldas, Antioquia, a man was killed and his body found. The area is known for the presence of armed groups. Although there are no reports around the identity of the perpetrator and the circumstances of death, or crime motivation, the MO identified is said to be characteristic of groups such as La Terraza, Los Triana, and Los Pesebreros. 1 fatality.

Around 14 June 2023 (as reported), in Copacabana, Antioquia, a woman was killed and her body found near the North Highway. The area is known for the presence of armed groups. Although there are no reports around the identity of the perpetrator and the circumstances of death, or crime motivation, the MO identified is said to be characteristic of groups such as La Terraza, Los Triana, and Los Pesebreros. 1 fatality.
On 14 June 2023, in the rural area of Montebonito corregimiento (Caldas), a farmer was shot dead by unknown perpetrators. There is no further information on the motives of the attack. 1 fatality.

Property destruction: On 14 June 2023, in Sabaletas (Valle del Cauca), members of an unidentified armed group set construction machinery on fire. Armed groups had been intimidating and threatening construction workers in the area.

actor1: FARC Dissident - 33rd Front: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia Dissident Faction (33rd Front)
notes: Other: Around 14 June 2023 (as reported), in the rural area of Versalles corregimiento (Norte de Santander), 33rd Front FARC dissidents and the ELN inaugurated a road and a bridge that was built by the group in an event between the Barrancas and Chiquinquira veredas in which members of the community participated. This was known through a video posted on social media.

On 14 June 2023, in Natagaima municipality (Tolima), residents blocked a national route to protest against the bad state of the roads, the bad healthcare service provided at the local hospital, and a waste treatment plant that is causing negative environmental impacts in the area.

On 14 June 2023, in Quito - Quitumbe (Pichincha), around 200 residents of Chillogallo captured and beat up three men who had attempted to rob a store. Police officers rescued the men and took them to a police station.
On 14 June 2023, in Encarnacion (Itapua), 80 students at the San Isidro and Heroes de Chaco schools protested to demand justice for the femicide of a student by her boyfriend.

assoc_actor_1: CGTP: Workers' General Confederation of Peru; Labor Group (Peru)
notes: On 14 June 2023, in Iquitos (Loreto), unionized workers members of the Workers' General Confederation of Peru (CGTP) marched through the city as a demonstration to demand a dialogue with authorities to resolve the collective pact and social debt payment that the government has with the union.

assoc_actor_1: CGTP: Workers' General Confederation of Peru; Labor Group (Peru)
notes: On 14 June 2023, in Lima - Lima District (Lima), residents, unionized workers members of the Workers' General Confederation of Peru (CGTP), FENAOMP, FENTAP, SITENTEL, and other unions staged a demonstration in San Martin and Dos de Mayo squares to demand the closure of congress, calling for general elections, and for the resignation of President Dina Boluarte.

On 14 June 2023, in Arequipa Province (Arequipa), union workers of civil construction union and the Arequipa Department Workers Federation (FDTA) marched as a demonstration to demand the closure of congress, calling for general elections, and for the resignation of President Dina Boluarte.

On 14 June 2023, in Cambio Puente (Ancash), workers at the National Penitentiary Institute (INPE) staged a demonstration outside the local prison to demand the incorporation of CAS contract workers and the removal of the president and human resources manager of INPE.

On 14 June 2023, in Trujillo (La Libertad), dozens of residents, both supporters and against the provincial mayor (We are Peru), staged a demonstration outside the Justice Superior Court offices in Natasha Alta urbanization staged a demonstration during the audience that determines if the mayor was going to be condemned or not for defamation crime.

On 14 June 2023, in Arequipa (Arequipa), dozens of residents blocked the Anashuayco bridge of the Arequipa - Puno highway as a demonstration to demand the closure of congress, calling for general elections, and for the resignation of President Dina Boluarte.

On 14 June 2023, in Puerto de Lomas (Arequipa), fishers members of OSPA ABEMALOS blocked the South Panamerican highway with burning tires and rocks as a demonstration to demand a solution on an ongoing border and sea space problems between Lomas and Marcona districts.
On 14 June 2023, in Chiclayo (Lambayeque), parents of students at Mater Admirabilis school staged a demonstration to voice their concern of the delay of the reconstruction of the school campus.
On 14 June 2023, in Huancayo province (Junin), residents staged a demonstration to demand the closure of congress, calling for general elections, and for the resignation of President Dina Boluarte.

On 14 June 2023, in Jimbe (Ancash), parents of students at El Salitre school staged a demonstration outside the Caceres District Municipal government to demand the immediate restart of the school reconstruction works.

On 14 June 2023, in Juliaca (Puno), residents staged a demonstration outside the Jorge Chavez health center to demand the closure of congress, calling for general elections, and for the resignation of President Dina Boluarte.

On 14 June 2023, in Punta de Mata (Monagas), approximately 3,000 demonstrators, including oil sector workers and unionists at the Division Punta de Mata plant, protested to demand better pay and working conditions.

On 14 June 2023, in Caracas - Libertador (Distrito Capital), a group of demonstrators, including state workers and human rights activists, protested to demand the liberation of two unionists of the SIDOR steelmaker company who were arrested during the weekend for leading the protests at the Pellas plant (Bolivar). The protesters gathered by the Public Ministry Office.

On 14 June 2023, in Ciudad Guayana (Bolivar), a group of demonstrators, including workers at companies belonging to the state-owned Venezuelan Corporation of Guayana (CVG), and unionists, protested to demand the immediate liberation of the unionists arrested for leading the Sidor metal workers' protests at the Pellas plant, as well as better pay and working conditions. The protesters marched around Puerto Ordaz towards the CVG headquarters and the Palace of Justice. Police and military forces were present but there was no intervention.

On 14 June 2023, in Miranda (Carabobo), for the second consecutive day, a group of workers at the Indulac Miranda C.A dairy producer company protested to demand better pay and working conditions, and the renewal of their collective labor agreement.

actor1: Military Forces of Venezuela (1999-) GNB: Venezuelan National Guard
notes: Around 14 June 2023 (as reported), in Cabimas (Zulia), GNB military forces shot and killed a member of the Yeiko Masacre Gang, during an armed confrontation in the Punto Fijo neighborhood, Las Parcelitas sector. The deceased was linked to extortion threats. The soldiers recovered a gun. 1 fatality.

assoc_actor_1: Teachers (Venezuela); FVM: Venezuelan Federation of Teachers
notes: On 14 June 2023, in Merida (Merida), a group of demonstrators, including education sector workers, and FVM representatives, protested to demand better pay and working conditions. The protesters gathered in the Las Americas Avenue, outside the IVSS Social Security Office.

source: OVCS: Observatorio Venezolano de Conflictividad Social; VPItv
notes: On 14 June 2023, in Barquisimeto (Lara), a group of demonstrators, including active and retired education sector workers, and unionists, protested to demand better pay and working conditions, and the renewal of their collective labor agreement. The protesters gathered by the Lara state Education Zone Office.

On 14 June 2023, in Puerto Ayacucho (Amazonas), a group of demonstrators, including education sector workers, and unionists, protested to demand better pay and working conditions. The protesters marched down the Orinoco Avenue to the Bolivar Square.

source: OVCS: Observatorio Venezolano de Conflictividad Social
notes: On 14 June 2023, in Cumana (Sucre), demonstrators protested with unspecified demands on issues related to labor, justice, housing, and Indigenous peoples' rights.
On 14 June 2023, in Las Palmitas (Lara), a group of drivers blocked the Troncal 17 road in protest over fuel scarcity. The protest was staged by the La Entrada petrol station.

On 14 June 2023, in Maracay (Aragua), a group of residents of the Los Samanes sector blocked the Fuerzas Aereas Avenue during a pot-banging protest over power outages going on for approximately six days.

On 14 June 2023, in Urena (Tachira), an unidentified crime group suspect on a motorcycle hurled a grenade at the premises of the El Gran Chaparron night club, in the Plaza Vieja sector. Its detonation caused significant property damage to the facade and the front door of the building. During the attack, there was only a manager of the business present, a Colombian woman, she came out unscathed. The motivations for the attack are unknown. There were no casualties.
On 14 June 2023, in Valera (Trujillo), a group of motorcyclists staged a motorcade in protest over what they deem as discrimination when it comes to refueling.

Property destruction: On 14 June 2023, in Raxruha municipality, Alta Verapaz, police and military forces found and destroyed 29,809 coca plants, 1,000 pounds of coca leaves ready for processing, and a narco laboratory in the Secajpur caserio.

Looting: On 14 June 2023, in El Tejar, Chimaltenango, two unidentified attackers on a motorcycle opened fire on the office of the Cabal Political Party (drive-by). A threatening note against the local candidate was left. The motivation for the attack is unknown. There were no casualties or injured.
On 14 June 2023, in Guatemala City, Guatemala, around 100 health workers staged a protest at the Roosevelt Hospital in zone 11 demanding better salaries.

On 14 June 2023, in Guatemala City, Guatemala, according to witnesses, unidentified attackers shot and killed a man and a teenager in colonia Renacimiento municipal in zone 18. The report states that the victim had a criminal record and it was a direct attack against him, and that the teenager was one of his attackers. 2 fatalities.
Property destruction: On 14 June 2023, in Livingston municipality, Izabal, police and military forces found and destroyed four coca harvesting camps bearing 56,800 coca plants.

On 14 June 2023, in Santa Elena de la Cruz, Peten, at least six armed men in two cars broke into a house in the Tercera Lotificacion neighborhood and killed six men. Authorities found five packs with drugs inside the house. Another source indicates that it was an armed clash between criminal groups that disputed for the control of the sale of cocaine. According to one of the reports, some of the victims were Mexicans, though this has not been confirmed by the authorities. 6 fatalities.

Around 14 June 2023 (as reported), in Karasabai, Upper Takutu-Upper Essequibo, four student teenage boys set fire to the St Angela's Girl's Hotel. They were arrested for attacking a public building. The students threatened to set the building on fire after a caretaker had chased them off the premises.

On 14 June 2023, in La Ceiba, Atlantida, members of the Union of Workers in Medicine, Hospitals, and Similar (SITRAMEDHY) occupied the facilities of the Departmental Health Authority denouncing the director for abuse of authority.

On 14 June 2023, in La Ceiba, Atlantida, a group of residents of the Irias Navas neighborhood protested outside the facilities of the Honduras Energy Company (EEH) demanding a resolution to the ongoing power outages.

On 14 June 2023, in San Juan Pueblo, Atlantida, a group of residents blocked traffic on the CA-13 highway and shot and damaged power transformers in demonstration to demand a resolution to the energy crisis generated by frequent power outages.

On 14 June 2023, in Saba municipality, Colon, a group of residents protested demanding a resolution to the ongoing power outages. The exact nature of the protest and its location in the municipality was not reported.

On 14 June 2023, in Sonaguera, Colon, a group of residents from the Puente Alto community blocked traffic and burned tires on the CA-13 highway in demonstration, demanding a resolution to the ongoing energy crisis in the region.

On 14 June 2023, in Tocoa municipality, Colon, a group of residents protested demanding a resolution to the ongoing power outages. The exact nature of the protest and its location in the municipality was not reported.

On 14 June 2023, in Choloma, Cortes, police forces clashed with members of the Barrio 18 Gang in a police operation in the San Francisco neighborhood killing a gang leader and arresting another underage gang member. 1 fatality.

On 14 June 2023, in San Pedro Sula, Cortes, unidentified armed men shot from a moving vehicle and wounded a man driving his car on the northern boulevard (drive-by). The reason for the shooting is unknown. 1 wounded.

On 14 June 2023, in San Pedro Sula, Cortes, police forces arrested two members of the Los Aguacates Gang, one of whom believed to be the gang's second-in-command, for the killing of six individuals occurred in the Santa Martha neighborhood two young individuals arrested on 14 June as responsible for the massacre in the Santa Martha neighborhood on 11 June (coded separately).
On 14 June 2023, in La Flecha, Santa Barbara, a group of residents protested against the ongoing power outages. Police shot against the protesters to disperse the protest wounding several.
On 14 June 2023, in Olanchito, Yoro, unidentified armed men shot and killed a taxi driver. The reason for the killing is unknown. 1 fatality.

On 14 June 2023, in Olanchito municipality, Yoro, a group of residents protested demanding a resolution to the ongoing power outages. The exact nature of the protest and its location in the municipality was not reported.
On 14 June 2023, in Nueva Providencia, Colon, people staged a protest on the Transismic Road to demand the reconnection of the drinking water service.

actor2: FARC Dissident - Second Marquetalia: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia Dissident Faction (Segunda Marquetalia)
assoc_actor_2: FARC Dissident - 30th Front: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia Dissident Faction (30th Front)
notes: Around 14 June 2023 (as reported), in the rural area of Ricaurte municipality (Narino), the ELN, Second Marquetalia, and 30th Front FARC dissidents clashed for the second consecutive day. The groups planted landmines in the area. 450 Awa Indigenous people were forcibly displaced as a result. Casualties unknown.

assoc_actor_2: Women (Colombia); UC: Unity for Carolina Movement
notes: Around 14 June 2023 (as reported), in the rural area of Carolina del Principe municipality (Antioquia), unidentified armed individuals abducted a mayoral candidate for the UC political party along with her niece. The perpetrators intercepted the victim's vehicle on a road, tied them up, and locked them in the trunk. Subsequently the group abandoned the victims in a spot in the rural area of the municipality of Santo Domingo, mentioning that they had mistaken the identity of the candidate. Although the perpetrators have not been confirmed, the area is known for the presence of armed groups.

Around 14 June 2023 (week of), in the rural area of Remedios and Segovia municipalities (coded to Remedios, Antioquia), at least eight children have been forcibly recruited by an unidentified armed group in the area. The whereabouts of the victims are still unknown.

Around 14 June 2023 (week of), in Santiago de Cali - Comuna 4 (Valle del Cauca), people protested the abduction of a public worker from Ombudsman's office (coded separately(. The group gathered to demand the release of the victim.

On 14 June 2023, in Araya (Sucre), a group of retired workers at the Salinas de Araya salt mine protested to demand payment of owed stipends, better access to medicines, and improved medical attention. The protesters gathered by the Unidad I premises of the salt mine, and symbolically locked its front gate with chains.
On 14 June 2023, in Turmero (Aragua), a group of residents of the La Fuente neighborhood protested over water outages going on for at least 15 days.

On 14 June 2023, in Presidente Prudente (Sao Paulo), an armed suspect shot and killed a man in front of his house in the Parque dos Pinheiros neighborhood. The attack was motivated by a drug debt and the perpetrator had previously made death threats. 1 fatality.

Around 14 June 2023, in Concepcion (Biobio), students at Concepcion University began an occupation of four faculties as a protest demanding the restructuring of the Gender Directorate. Protesters also demanded infrastructure improvements, among other things. On 28 June authorities stated that they had been meeting short-term demands in order to end the occupation.

Non-violent activity: On 14 June 2023, in a rural area of Remedios municipality (Antioquia), members of the Gulf Clan set up checkpoints on the road that connects the municipality with the area of Segovia, and in the Aporreado, El Diamante and Rio Bagre areas of the municipality. The Remedios mayor's office confirmed that the armed group was prohibiting the transport of gasoline to the north of the municipality. Similar incidents have been reported in the municipality of Puerto Lopez (Bolivar).

On 14 June 2023, in Minas (Lavalleja), unionized ANCAP (National Administration of Fuels, Alcohol, and Cement) workers protested at a company's plant against the public bidding for the Portland Cement company.

source: Comision Intereclesial de Justicia y Paz; Diario del Sur (Colombia)
notes: On 14 June 2023, in the rural area of Puerto Caicedo municipality (Putumayo), CDF members shot and killed two Awa Indigenous men after taking them from their homes. Their bodies were found by residents of the San Diego vereda, meters away from the Putumayo river, with tied hands. The deceased were also victims of forced displacement from the Narino department. The motivations for the attack are unknown. 2 fatalities.

actor1: FARC Dissident - Second Marquetalia: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia Dissident Faction (Segunda Marquetalia)
source: El Espectador; El Pais; El Tiempo (Colombia); El Universal (Colombia); La Patria; UNOCHA
notes: On 14 June 2023, in Mesetas (Meta), the Second Marquetalia of the FARC kidnapped three members of the Humanitarian Demining Mission after luring them to el Trique vereda and requesting a big ransom for their release. The victims were rescued that same afternoon.

assoc_actor_1: Farmers (Colombia); Indigenous Group (Colombia); JAC: Council of Communal Action
notes: On 14 June 2023, in Zona Bananera municipality (coded to San Jose de Kennedy, Magdalena), for the second consecutive day, a group of demonstrators, including farmers, JAC representatives, and Indigenous people from the Sierra Nevada region, blocked the Troncal de Oriente to demand the repair of the local infrastructure and essential services damaged during the heavy rains of May and early June 2023. Following negotiations with the Magdalena state government that evening, the protesters lifted the roadblock.
Around 14 June 2023 (as reported), in Riohacha (La Guajira), a group of approximately 30 workers of the Air-e company protested to demand payment of owed salaries and bonuses.

On 14 June 2023, in Monteria (Cordoba), a group of demonstrators, including teachers and education sector unionists, protested to demand payment of owed stipends corresponding to a retroactive salary increase. Other demonstrations with similar demands were staged in unspecified municipalities of the department.

On 13 June 2023, in Rosario (Santa Fe), members of environmental, social, political, and labor union organizations marched to repudiate the social and environmental consequences of the extractivist economic model and to defend an agroecological model and food sovereignty.
On 13 June 2023, in Santa Rosa (La Pampa), workers at the Popular Electricity Cooperative (CPE) protested in front of the premises of the company to demand a raise in salaries.

On 13 June 2023, in La Plata - Central (Buenos Aires), students and parents at the Vicente de Paul School protested outside the premises of the institution against the lack of heating, which has caused students to attend classes in very low temperatures, and other infrastructure and maintenance problems at the school.

On 13 June 2023, in La Plata - Tolosa (Buenos Aires), students and parents at Secondary School number 11 protested outside the premises of the institution to demand the restitution of natural gas service at the school, which has caused students to have to attend their classes without heating amidst very low temperatures.

On 13 June 2023, in Posadas (Misiones), for the second consecutive day, around 70 teachers affiliated with the Front of Education Workers in Struggle (FTEL) protested in front of the General Council of Education to demand a raise in salaries. Demonstrators broke into the building and hours later were evicted by police officers who had a judge's order.

On 13 June 2023, in San Salvador de Jujuy (Jujuy), thousands of unionized teachers demonstrated on provincial route 1 and on the Memory Park to demand a raise in salaries amidst high inflation rates and to repudiate an executive decision issued by the Jujuy governor that limits the right to protest.

assoc_actor_1: Teachers (Argentina); CTERA: Confederation of Education Workers of the Republic of Argentina; CTA: Argentine Workers' Central Union; Labor Group (Argentina)
notes: On 13 June 2023, in Buenos Aires - Comuna 1 (Ciudad Autonoma de Buenos Aires), unionized teachers from Jujuy province associated with CTERA demonstrated outside the Jujuy House in El Retiro neighborhood to demand a raise in salaries amidst high inflation rates and to repudiate an executive decision issued by the Jujuy governor that limits the right to protest. CTA and Milagro Sala Front members joined the protest in support of the teachers.

assoc_actor_1: Teachers (Argentina); Labor Group (Argentina); Students (Argentina); SADOP: Union of Private Teachers
notes: On 13 June 2023, in Rosario (Santa Fe), thousands of teachers associated with the Santa Fe Teacher's Association (AMSAFE) and SADOP, members of labor organizations, students, and social organization members marched to San Martin Square to protest against insecurity and violent attacks, extortions and threats against schools perpetrated by organized crime groups.

On 13 June 2023, in Berazategui (Buenos Aires), a group of members of social organizations blocked the Buenos Aires - La Plata highway to protest against poverty and hunger and demanded the government the opening of a social program that provides supplies and food to community kitchens.

On 13 June 2023, in Santa Cruz de la Sierra (Santa Cruz), municipality workers staged a demonstration demanding better working conditions. They have previously won a lawsuit that would provide them with benefits, but have not been fulfilled for two years.

On 13 June 2023, in Quillacollo (Cochabamba), leaders of ten districts staged a demonstration outside the local government offices to demand the removal of the new public cleaning charges in the electricity charges.

On 13 June 2023, in Santa Rosa del Sara (Santa Cruz), for the second consecutive day, residents blocked the Santa Cruz - Cochabamba highway at the 80KM as a demonstration to demand the culmination of the construction of the Santa Rosa - Galilea - Los Andes highway.
On 13 June 2023, in Iranduba (Amazonas), a shoot-out between members of the CV and a rival group took place in the Morada do Sol neighborhood. One CV member was arrested. There were no fatalities.

source: Crimes News RJ; G1; Globo Extra; R7
notes: On 13 June 2023, in Queimados (Rio de Janeiro), Red Command drug traffickers exchanged fire with police militia during an invasion in the Jardim da Fonte neighborhood. A bus carrying civilians was hit, but no one was injured. The local police militia has a partnership with the Pure Third Command in the area, which includes sharing profits. There were no fatalities.

actor1: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
notes: On 13 June 2023, in Santa Maria do Para (Para), a man was shot and killed in the city center by a military officer who then fled with the help of an accomplice on a motorcycle. Both suspects were arrested. The officer claimed the victim had plans to kill police officers, but no involvement in illegal activities was confirmed. 1 fatality.

actor1: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
notes: On 13 June 2023, in Rio de Janeiro - North Zone (Rio de Janeiro), military police officers exchanged fire with the Red Command in the Sao Pedro locality, Morro do Fuba community, Cascadura neighborhood. A high-ranking Red Command suspect was shot and killed. 1 fatality.

actor1: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
actor2: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
notes: On 13 June 2023, in Santa Maria do Para (Para), a military officer exchanged fire with other military police officers during his arrest operation. The officer had just shot a man to death with the help of an accomplice (coded separately). Both the officer and the accomplice were arrested. There were no fatalities.

actor1: Police Forces of Brazil (2023-) Federal Police
notes: Property destruction: On 13 June 2023, in Campo Largo (Parana), federal police officers seized approximately two tons of marijuana hidden inside a truck loaded with tires during an inspection on the BR-277 highway. The driver tried to escape and a chase ensued, but he was arrested on the PR-423 highway.

assoc_actor_1: Former Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
notes: On 13 June 2023, in Piracicaba (Sao Paulo), a private security guard opened fire on a group of minors in a wooded area near a quarry after an argument. The perpetrator was a retired military police officer and was arrested. Police seized a weapon and motorcycles. No one was hurt. There were no fatalities.

On 13 June 2023, in Cuiaba (Mato Grosso), more than 1,000 fishers carried out a protest in the Legislative Assembly against the approval of a bill which suspends fishing activities for five years, given the risk of extinction of several fish species.

On 13 June 2023, in Aracaju (Sergipe), a group of traffic officers workers gathered outside the City Council to demonstrate against a proposed career plan sent to the House by the city government. According to the demonstrators, the City Hall's proposal is different from what was previously negotiated with the sector and were requesting to be included in the discussion.
On 13 June 2023, in Belem (Para), municipal civil servants carried out a march to demand salary readjustment and restructuring of labor benefits.

On 13 June 2023, in Belo Horizonte (Minas Gerais), about 70 members of labor unions and social movements gathered in the Sete de Setembro square to protest against the approval of a bill regarding procedures of recognition and demarcation of indigenous territories, and to protest against the approval of a fiscal responsibility draft bill.
On 13 June 2023, in Porto Alegre (Rio Grande do Sul), about 100 business workers carried out a protest against the presence of informal sellers near their stores.

On 13 June 2023, in Sao Paulo - Central Zone (Sao Paulo), merchants and traders held a protest in the Praca Princesa Isabel Square, an area known as 'Cracolandia', lamenting the disruptions caused by the drug users in the area, as well as municipal guard measures including frequent use of tear gas. The protesters called for more security in the area.

On 13 June 2023, in Macae (Rio de Janeiro), more than 2000 municipal teachers held a protest marching from the Verissimo de Melo square to City Hall, demanding salary increases in line with inflation and for improved working conditions. A strike is schedule for 15 June.

On 13 June 2023, in Porto Alegre (Rio Grande do Sul), people set objects on fire in the historic center to demonstrate against the approval of a bill that changed procedures regarding recognition and demarcation of indigenous territories.

On 13 June 2023, in Belem (Para), a man was shot and killed in the Parque Verde neighborhood by an armed individual who then fled with an accomplice on a motorcycle. The victim had a police record for robbery and homicide. Authorship and motivation of the attack are unknown. 1 fatality.

On 13 June 2023, in Ribeirao Bonito (Sao Paulo), unknown suspects stabbed a trans person to death, and their body was found naked from the waist down, with bone fractures in the hands and other signs of beating in the Jardim Heliana I neighborhood. 1 fatality.
On 13 June 2023, in Sao Roque (Sao Paulo), two armed suspects shot and killed a woman in her own home. The motive of the attack is not known. 1 fatality.

On 13 June 2023, in Arapiraca (Alagoas), unknown shooters exchanged fire in the Planalto neighborhood. Two men were shot by stray bullets. One of the victims died and the other was taken to the hospital. 1 fatality.
On 13 June 2023, in Belford Roxo (Rio de Janeiro), unknown shooters exchanged fire in the Vila Pauline neighborhood. Unknown casualties.

On 13 June 2023, in Rio de Janeiro - North Zone (Rio de Janeiro), unknown shooters exchanged fire in the Quintino Bocaiuva, and Iraja neighborhoods. Shooting was also heard in the Israel Complex, Cordovil neighborhood. Unknown casualties.
On 13 June 2023, in Rio de Janeiro - West Zone (Rio de Janeiro), unknown shooters exchanged fire in the Praca Seca, Pechincha, Senador Camara, and Campinho neighborhoods. Unknown casualties.

On 13 June 2023, in Santa Maria do Suacui (Minas Gerais), a man was shot and killed by a drug trafficker in the Sao Jose neighborhood due to a drug debt. The drug trafficker was identified, but not arrested. 1 fatality.

On 13 June 2023, in Salvador - Barra/Pituba (Bahia), there was a shoot-out between local rival gangs near Lord Cochrane square, in the Federacao neighborhood. Four suspects were shot and injured and taken to the hospital but two did not survive the injuries. Police believe the attack was linked to drug trafficking rival gangs. The motivation behind the attack and its perpetrators are unknown. 2 fatalities.

On 13 June 2023, in Cariacica (Espirito Santo), a man was shot and killed inside a car repair shop in the Vila Independencia neighborhood by an armed individual. The victim was working at the shop when the attack occurred. The victim had a police record for drug trafficking, but had abandoned that lifestyle. 1 fatality.

On 13 June 2023, in Manaus - North Zone (Amazonas), a man was killed in a drive-by shooting in the Fazendinha community, Cidade de Deus neighborhood, by two armed individuals on a motorcycle. There are no reports on the identity of the perpetrators or the attack's motivation. 1 fatality.

On 13 June 2023, in Rio de Janeiro - West Zone (Rio de Janeiro), drug traffickers shot and killed a male civilian in the Gardenia Azul community, Rio das Pedras neighborhood. The victim was not involved in criminal activity. The area is controlled by police militia. 1 fatality.

On 13 June 2023, in Salvador - Tancredo Neves (Bahia), a family of 6 was held hostage by armed drug trafficking suspects in the Engomadeira neighborhood after the suspects realized the presence of military police officer in the area. After two hours of negotiation, the family was released and the suspects were arrested. With them police seized three pistols, ammunition, large portions of drugs, six cell phones and some cash.

actor2: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
notes: On 13 June 2023, in Angra dos Reis (Rio de Janeiro), armed suspects exchanged fire with military police in the Morro da Gloria neighborhood. Unknown casualties.

notes: On 13 June 2023, in Japeri (Rio de Janeiro), a group of armed suspects exchanged fire with military police officers during a patrol in the Guadu neighborhood. One suspect was shot and killed, and a military police officer was injured. Police seized three rifles, three radio communicators, and a grenade. 1 fatality.

actor2: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
notes: On 13 June 2023, in Lauro de Freitas (Bahia), there was a shoot-out between the military police and armed suspects in the Miragem neighborhood during a police control, after the officers noticed a family being abducted. The police chased after the suspects and two suspects fled and one was arrested. No further information was reported regarding the kidnapping. There were no fatalities.

actor2: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
notes: On 13 June 2023, in Sao Joao de Meriti (Rio de Janeiro), armed suspects exchanged fire with military police officers in the Vila Ruth community. Three suspects were killed and fourth was injured. Shortly after, another confrontation took place, and all suspects were injured. Overall, two suspects were arrested, and police seized four pistols, four radio communicators, and a large amount of drugs. 3 fatalities.

Around 13 June 2023 (as reported), in Sao Jose de Almeida village (Jaboticatubas, Minas Gerais), a man was shot and killed by unknown armed individuals. The deceased had a police record for drug trafficking. 1 fatality.

On 13 June 2023, in Itaperuna (Rio de Janeiro), a drug trafficker shot and injured another drug trafficker in the Niteroi neighborhood after a disagreement about whether the injured man could discontinue his affiliation with drug trafficking. The man was injured by seven shots. The perpetrator was arrested. There were no fatalities.

source: El Austral Osorno; El Mercurio Valparaiso
notes: On 13 June 2023, in Confluencia (Nuble), an explosive device damaged a railway bridge over the Itata river. The rails are broken and the structure is completely damaged. The M18O (18th of October Movement) took responsibility for the attack through a public statement.

On 13 June 2023, in San Pedro de la Paz (Biobio), representatives of students at Galvarino school protested outside of the municipal council demanding the definitive replacement of the establishment. Protesters called the establishment the 'igloo' school after the poor conditions in the educational facilities regarding temperature and other infrastructure problems. The school has been presenting problems for five years and a series of measures have been taken, but the replacement of the property has not been completed.

On 13 June 2023, in San Pedro de la Paz (Biobio), residents protested at the municipal council demanding regulations for sports competitions in Laguna Grande. The Pan-American Games 2023 are using the lagoon for rowing and canoeing competitions and protesters stated that the body of water will be affected, causing environmental issues. Protesters delivered a petition letter to the municipal authorities.

On 13 June 2023, in Santiago (Metropolitana), citizens members of Fuerza Pobladora de Chile movement protested demanding the purchase of land to build a housing project. Protesters erected barricades and blocked the traffic between Santa Rosa avenue and Americo Vespucio avenue. Protesters stated that authorities are putting obstacles and bureaucratic excuses for not buying the land.

assoc_actor_2: Unidentified Communal Group (Colombia); Lawyers (Colombia); Police Forces of Colombia (2022-) UNP: National Unit for Protection; Labor Group (Colombia)
source: El Pais (Colombia); RCN Radio; W Radio
notes: On 13 June 2023, in Tulua (Valle del Cauca), members of the Oficina de Tulua Gang shot and injured a political social leader and lawyer inside a mall. The leader's UNP bodyguard and a taxi driver who assisted him were also injured, as well as one of the attackers. The leader was taken to hospital where he died from his injuries on 15 June. There is no further information on the motives and perpetrators of the attack but the area is known for the presence of armed groups. 1 fatality.

Property destruction: Around 13 June 2023 (between 10 - 13 June), in the rural area of Corinto municipality (Cauca), members of an Indigenous community broke into a farm and set on fire the crops after intimidating the workers. The attack was related to land disputes.

Around 13 June 2023 (as reported), between Argelia and Balboa municipalities (coded to Balboa, Cauca), a man was shot and killed and his body was found in the El Filo sector with signs of torture. There is no further information on the motives and perpetrators of the attack but the area is known for the presence of armed groups. 1 fatality.

Property destruction: Around 13 June 2023 (between 10 - 13 June), in the rural area of Miranda municipality (Cauca), members of an Indigenous community broke into a farm and set on fire the crops after intimidating the workers. The attack was related to land disputes.

assoc_actor_2: FARC Dissident - 30th Front: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia Dissident Faction (30th Front)
notes: Around 13 June 2023 (as reported), in the rural area of Ricaurte municipality (Narino), the ELN, Second Marquetalia and 30th Front FARC dissidents clashed. The groups planted landmines in the area. 450 Awa Indigenous people were forcibly displaced as a result. Casualties unknown.

On 13 June 2023, in the rural area of Guachene municipality (Cauca), militants of an unidentified armed group kidnapped two security guards at the La Cabana sugar cane plantation and stole a vehicle and some work equipment from the guards. The security guards were released hours later in Corinto municipality. The event would be related to land disputes. The area is known for the presence of armed groups. There were no casualties.

On 13 June 2023, in Ibague, Tolima, several representatives of Indigenous communities demonstrated and tried to break into the governor's office in Tolima to demand that the governor hears their demands. They knocked down some fences on carretera tercera. A discussion table was agreed to be had with the leaders of the Movement of Indigenous Authorities of the Southwest (AISO) to go over several things that concern the Indigenous communities.

assoc_actor_1: CONAIE: Confederation of Indigenous Nationalities of Ecuador; Indigenous Group (Ecuador)
notes: On 13 June 2023, in Quito - Eugenio Espejo (Pichincha), Indigenous citizens members of Confederation of Indigenous Nationalities of Ecuador (CONAIE), anti-mining organizations, and ecologists collectives members marched from El Arbolito park to the Constitutional Court (CC) offices as a demonstration to reject Decree 754 claiming its unconstitutional.

On 13 June 2023, in Cuenca (Azuay), residents of the Tu Eres Pedro sector captured, tied to a metal structure, and beat up a man who had attempted to rob a store. They also threw gasoline on the man with the intention to burn him, but police officers rescued him.

Around 13 June 2023 (as reported), in Paso Yobai (Guaira), yerba mate farmers from Guaira and Caazapa departments protested in front of the municipality to demand fair prices for the commercialization of yerba mate leaves. They said that the current prices do not outweigh the costs of production and demanded authorities to mediate in negotiations with traders to increase the prices of the product.

On 13 June 2023, in Asuncion (Asuncion), unionized municipal security guards protested in front of the city hall against the outsourcing of the security service. They said that the municipality is intending to hire a private security company thus privatizing the service.
On 13 June 2023, in Ciudad del Este (Alto Parana), truck drivers marched from Peace Square to Route PY02 to demand more security and justice amidst high theft rates.
On 13 June 2023, in Encarnacion (Itapua), students at the San Isidro and Heroes de Chaco schools protested to demand justice for the femicide of a student by her boyfriend.

On 13 June 2023, in Iquitos (Loreto), heath workers from different areas of the regional hospital staged a demonstration to demand the resignation of the manager and officials, due to the use of budget for paying new officials that take money from different sectors of the hospital.

On 13 June 2023, in Chimbote (Ancash), construction workers at Miguel Grau school staged a demonstration in El Acero urbanization by burning tires on the street, to voice their grievances about the lack of payment of their salaries for their work.

On 13 June 2023, in Montevideo (Montevideo), unionized workers at the State Sanitary Works (OSE) company demonstrated outside the premises of the institution on Carlos Roxlo Street against the Arazati drinking water plant project. Demonstrators clashed with police officers, vandalized the OSE building, and threw smoke bombs. Demonstrators claim that the project does not guarantee the drinking water supply, that it is unconstitutional, and that it privatizes the water supply service.

On 13 June 2023, in Ciudad Guayana (Bolivar), for the sixth consecutive day, workers at the state-owned SIDOR steelmaker company, and unionists, workers at the state-owned SIDOR steelmaker company, and unionists, protested to demand better pay and working conditions. The protest was staged at the Pellas Plant, where on 7 June the workers had announced they would be going on strike. That evening, the series of protests came to an end at the plant, following the announcement of judicial and disciplinary measures against 19 workers for partaking in the labor action; operations also resumed.

On 13 June 2023, in Maracaibo (Zulia), a group of demonstrators, including freight and public transport drivers, blocked the Circunvalacion 1 road in protest to demand the reopening of the General Rafael Urdaneta Bridge over Lake Maracaibo. The bridge was being blocked, for the second consecutive day, by protesting Yukpa Indigenous people (coded separately). Traffic on the bridge resumed shortly after, when the drivers decided to get in their vehicles and make their way through the bridge; the Yukpa Indigenous people just moved to a side of the road and left the area.

On 13 June 2023, in Miranda (Carabobo), a group of workers at the Indulac Miranda C.A dairy producer company protested to demand better pay and working conditions, and the renewal of their collective labor agreement.

assoc_actor_1: Labor Group (Venezuela); PSUV: United Socialist Party of Venezuela; Government of Venezuela (1999-)
notes: On 13 June 2023, in Ciudad Guayana (Bolivar), a group of demonstrators, including state workers, unionists, the Bolivar state governor (PSUV) and other officials, as well as PSUV supporters, marched in support of the government. The protest consisted in a march around Alta Vista.

source: Caraota Digital; Diario Version Final (Venezuela); El Pitazo; La Patilla
notes: On 13 June 2023, in Maracaibo (Zulia), for the second consecutive day, a group of over 100 Yukpa Indigenous people blocked the General Rafael Urdaneta Bridge over Lake Maracaibo in protest to demand permission to travel to Caracas to sell their production of artisan objects to the government. The day before the Minister for Indigenous Peoples had promised them money for their goods, to be paid that day, but the exchange did not happen. After approximately six hours, following a protest of freight and public transport drivers (coded separately), the Yukpa Indigenous moved to one side of the bridge, and traffic resumed.

source: OVCS: Observatorio Venezolano de Conflictividad Social
notes: On 13 June 2023, in Barquisimeto (Lara), a group of residents protested over fuel scarcity.

notes: On 13 June 2023, in Portuguesa state (coded to Guanare), demonstrators protested with unspecified demands on issues related to labor, water, housing, and Indigenous peoples' rights.
On 13 June 2023, in Caujarao (Falcon), a group of residents of the La Bombita sector blocked the Troncal 4 road in protest over power outages going on for more than two weeks.

source: OVCS: Observatorio Venezolano de Conflictividad Social
notes: On 13 June 2023, in Aragua state (coded to Maracay), demonstrators protested with unspecified demands on issues related to labor, water, housing, and Indigenous peoples' rights.

On 13 June 2023, in Guatemala City, Guatemala, several unidentified attackers shot and injured a person in zone 1. No more detail is provided by the source. The motivation for the attack is unknown. 1 injured.

On 13 June 2023, in Santa Cruz Barillas, Huehuetenango, there was an armed clash between a group of farmers and private security officers. As a result of the clash, two people were killed and four people were injured. The report states that the farmers were trying to invade a private farm. 2 fatalities, 4 injured.

On 13 June 2023, in Antigua Guatemala, Sacatepequez, two unidentified attackers on a motorcycle shot and killed a man in La Azotea alley in a drive-by shooting incident. The motivation for the attack is unknown. No more detail is provided by the source. 1 fatality.

On 13 June 2023, in El Cerinal, Santa Rosa, fifty people beat up and tried to lynch a man after accusing him of stealing a television and a stove. Police officers rescued the victim moments later. 1 injured.

assoc_actor_1: Labor Group (French Guiana); Health Workers (French Guiana)
notes: On 13 June 2023, in Kourou, Cayenne, health workers, other employees from the Kourou hospital center, and trade union representatives held a protest to demand the departure of the management team, among other specific claims. The protest was part of a labor strike that started that day.

On 13 June 2023, outside Tela, Atlantida, armed members of the Los Pelones Gang shot and killed three men believed to have stolen African palm fruit, in an African palm field in the Ramal del Tigre area. Two days later police forces arrested six members of the gang for their alleged involvement in the shooting. The gang members were also investigated for conducting other criminal activities in the region, including land usurpation, homicides, threats, and drug trafficking. Various firearms and drugs were seized from the group during the operation. 3 fatalities.
On 13 June 2023, in Sonaguera, Colon, a group of residents blocked traffic and burned tires on the CA-13 highway in demonstration against the ongoing power outages affecting their neighborhoods.
On 13 June 2023, in San Pedro Sula, Cortes, a group of residents blocked traffic in protest around the Cemcol neighborhood against ongoing power outages in their neighborhoods.

On 13 June 2023, in Tatumbla, Francisco Morazan, a group of migrants from various nationalities blocked traffic in protest against excessive fees charged by Hondurans providing transportation services to migrate towards the Unites States.

Property destruction: On 13 June 2023, outside Limones, Olancho, military forces seized a coca plantation spread over 49 hectares of land and containing around 560,000 individual coca plants, and a drug processing lab.

On 13 June 2023, in Las Tablas, Los Santos, people staged a protest against the gold mining project of Cerro Quema and demanded its closure to protect the environment. Protesters marched from the local seat of the University of Panama to the Carlos Lucas Lopez paseo. Members of the Santeno Front against Mining, students and professors, ranchers, and members of civil society participated in the protest.

On 13 June 2023, in San Miguelito, Panama, employees of a local company staged a protest to demand the payment of the installments to the Social Security Fund (CSS). The company's lack of payment prevented the workers from receiving medical aid.

Around 13 June 2023 (as reported), in Ourinhos (Sao Paulo), a man was killed, and his body was found in a state of decomposition, hanging by the feet in a wooded area. The victim was serving time in the prison semi-open regime in Bauru for trafficking and theft and had been missing since 13 June. The victim left to collect a debt the last time he was seen. 1 fatality.

Around 13 June 2023 (as reported), in Sincelejo (Sucre), farmers and inhabitants of the municipality of Morroa protested against the lack of drinking water in the area where they live. The group marched through the streets on donkeys demanding a solution.
On 13 June 2023, in La Punta de los Remedios (La Guajira), riots broke out when police attempted to arrest a man. The rioters attacked the officers, injuring one of them.

assoc_actor_2: PODE: We Can; Government of Brazil (2023-)
source: Folha PE; G1; Portal Agreste Violento
notes: On 13 June 2023, in Serra Talhada (Pernambuco), the mayor of Santa Cruz da Baixa Verde (PODE) municipality was shot to death inside his car in the city center by unknown armed suspects in a car. The motivation behind the attack and its perpetrators are unknown. 1 fatality.

assoc_actor_2: Government of Ecuador (2021-); MRC: Citizen Revolution Movement
notes: On 13 June 2023, in Esmeraldas (Esmeraldas), a local council member of Citizen Revolution Movement (MRC) was shot several times by unidentified armed assailants in a motorcycle. The council member was taken to a hospital were he was stabilized, but died on 17 June 2023. 1 fatality.

assoc_actor_1: Farmers (Colombia); Indigenous Group (Colombia); JAC: Council of Communal Action
notes: On 13 June 2023, in Zona Bananera municipality (coded to San Jose de Kennedy, Magdalena), a group of demonstrators, including farmers, JAC representatives, and Indigenous people from the Sierra Nevada region, blocked the Troncal de Oriente to demand the repair of the local infrastructure and essential services damaged during the heavy rains of May and early June 2023.

assoc_actor_1: Police Forces of Colombia (2022-) UNP: National Unit for Protection
notes: On 13 June 2023, in Riohacha (La Guajira), a group of approximately 150 UNP officials protested over poor working conditions, and against the three-month delays of salary payments.

On 13 June 2023, in Maicao (La Guajira), a Wayuu Indigenous man, who is also motorcycle taxi driver, was shot and killed an his body found by his motorcycle, in an attack in the Parrantial Viejo neighborhood. There is no information on the identity or motivations of the attackers. 1 fatality.

On 13 June 2023, in Prado Sevilla corregimiento (Magdalena), two unidentified armed individuals on a motorcycle shot and killed a former elected councilman, in a drive-by shooting by the victim's house in the Los Cauchos sector. There is no information on the identity or motivations of the attackers. 1 fatality.

Around 13 June 2023 (as reported), in Toledo municipality (Norte de Santander), a farmer was shot and killed, and his body found in the El Porvenir - Canoas vereda, in the rural corregimiento of Gibraltar. There is no further information on the identity or the motivations of the perpetrators, but the area is known for the presence of armed groups. 1 fatality.

Around 13 June 2023 (as reported), in the rural area of the Sampues municipality (coded to Mateo Perez, Sucre), approximately 50 students at the University of Sucre blocked the Troncal 25 road in protest over ongoing water outages, and to demand the construction of a pedestrian bridge. The roadblock was staged by the University of Sucre Agricultural Sciences School, also known as the Granja Perico.

On 13 June 2023, in Hato Nuevo municipality (coded to Hatonuevo, La Guajira), a group of residents of the Canabrava community blocked the Via Hatonuevo - Cuestecitas road in protest to demand the construction of a well.

source: El Colombiano; El Espectador; El Pais; El Tiempo (Colombia); La Patria; UNOCHA; Vanguardia Liberal
notes: On 13 June 2023, between Saravena and Arauquita municipalities (coded to Saravena), ELN members kidnapped the wife of a military officer when she was traveling in a taxi. The ELN members also took the taxi driver. The victim was handed over to a humanitarian commission on June 18.
