actor2: FARC Dissident - Carlos Patino Front: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia Dissident Faction (Carlos Patino Front)
notes: On 13 June 2023, in the rural area of Argelia municipality (Cauca), there were clashes between the military forces and the Carlos Patino FARC dissident group in La Cacharra, Buena Vista and Los Pinos veredas. Civilians were confined inside their homes because of the clashes. Casualties unknown.

actor1: Police Forces of Venezuela (1999-) CPNB: National Bolivarian Police
notes: On 13 June 2023, in Santa Ana de Coro (Falcon), PNB police forces shot and killed a member of the El Chatico gang, during an armed confrontation occurred in the early hours in the Ezequiel Zamora sector. The suspect resisted authority and initiated the shooting. He was injured in the gunfire and pronounced dead in hospital. The deceased had a criminal record for armed theft. Police collected a gun. 1 fatality.

Around 12 June 2023 (as reported), in Buenos Aires - Comuna 3 (Ciudad Autonoma de Buenos Aires), subway operators protested outside the premises of Buenos Aires Subway (SBASE) in the Balvanera neighborhood against the presence of asbestos in the subway facilities which has caused a health problem. They demanded solutions from authorities. Students and teachers also participated in the protest in support of the operators.

On 12 June 2023, in La Plata - Central (Buenos Aires), students and parents at Elementary School number 102 protested outside the premises of the institution to demand the restitution of natural gas service at the school, which has caused students to have to attend their classes without heating amidst very low temperatures.

On 12 June 2023, in La Plata - Central (Buenos Aires), students at the Cristo Rey School protested at the premises of the institution to repudiate the layoff of a teacher without just cause. They claim that she was fired because she was going to become a delegate of the SADOP union.

On 12 June 2023, in La Plata - Villa Elvira (Buenos Aires), students and parents at Elementary School number 84 protested outside the premises of the institution to demand the restitution of natural gas service at the school, which has caused students to have to attend their classes without heating amidst very low temperatures.

On 12 June 2023, in Rosario (Santa Fe), students at the General San Martin Technical School protested against insecurity and theft outside and inside the premises of the institution. They demanded security measures from authorities.
On 12 June 2023, in Salta (Salta), teachers and health workers blocked National Route 51 to demand a raise in salaries amidst high inflation rates.

assoc_actor_1: Teachers (Argentina); Labor Group (Argentina); CTA: Argentine Workers' Central Union; ATE: Association of State Workers; Health Workers (Argentina); FOL: Front of Organizations in Action; SADOP: Union of Private Teachers
notes: On 12 June 2023, in San Salvador de Jujuy (Jujuy), around 15,000 unionized teachers, municipal and state workers, health workers and members of social organizations marched throughout the city to demand better salaries and to repudiate the executive decision issued by the governor which limits the right to protest. ATE, CTA, SADOP and FOL members also participated in the protest.

On 12 June 2023, in Comodoro Rivadavia (Chubut), a group of mothers at the Marine Biology school protested outside the premises of the Department of Public Works building to demand answers over the delays in the public bidding process for the construction of a new school building.

On 12 June 2023, in San Luis (San Luis), friends and family of a girl who disappeared on 14 June 2021 demonstrated to demand that the girl be found by authorities. They repudiated the lack of answers from authorities and the justice system.

assoc_actor_1: Teachers (Argentina); Government of Argentina (2019-); JxC: Together for Change
notes: On 12 June 2023, in Posadas (Misiones), around 100 teachers affiliated with the Front of Education Workers in Struggle (FTEL) marched to the General Council of Education to demand a raise in salaries. Demonstrators intercepted the provincial minister of education to prevent him from entering the building. Police forces were present but did not intervene. An elected councilman from JxC (not yet assumed office) participated in the protest in support of the teachers.

On 12 June 2023, in Cochabamba (Cochabamba), Aderta radio taxi workers staged a demonstration to voice their concern about mobile application drivers that they consider is disloyal competition and demand the mayor and national authorities to regulate these application drivers.

On 12 June 2023, in Sucre (Chuquisaca), unionized heavy transport drivers staged a demonstration outside the Fancesa administrative offices to demand payment of the owed freight costs for more than two months.
On 12 June 2023, in Cochabamba (Cochabamba), parents of students blocked the entrance to the FEXCO 2023 international fair to demand more teaching positions and against the closure of a school.
On 12 June 2023, in Okinawa Uno (Santa Cruz), residents blocked Banegas bridge as a demonstration to demand authorities to finish the construction of the Okinawa Uno - Parque Industrial highway.

On 12 June 2023, in Puerto Pailas (Santa Cruz), residents from four municipalities blocked the Bioceanic highway bridge in the city as a demonstration to demand authorities to finish the construction of the Okinawa Uno - Parque Industrial highway.

On 12 June 2023, in Santa Rosa del Sara (Santa Cruz), residents blocked the Santa Cruz - Cochabamba highway at the 80KM as a demonstration to demand the culmination of the construction of the Santa Rosa - Galilea - Los Andes highway.

On 12 June 2023, in Niteroi - Oceanica (Rio de Janeiro), the Pure Third Command invaded the Morro do Estado community in the Inga neighborhood and exchanged fire with the Red Command. Unknown casualties.

actor1: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
assoc_actor_1: Police Forces of Brazil (2023-) Civil Police
notes: On 12 June 2023, in Altamira (Para), two members of the CV exchanged fire with military and civil police during their arrest operation in the Buriti neighborhood. Both CV members were killed. Police seized two firearms, a precision scale, portions of drugs, ammunition and vehicles. 2 fatalities.
On 12 June 2023, in Sao Jose dos Campos (Sao Paulo), oil workers held a protest outside the Henrique Lage refinery, calling for an investigation into the death of an outsourced worker.

On 12 June 2023, in Sapucaia do Sul (Rio Grande do Sul), about 40 members of the MST and of social movements gathered in front of multinational company BASF to protest against its use of slave labor, after 85 workers were rescued from slave labor conditions in Uruguaiana.

On 12 June 2023, in Manaus - East Zone (Amazonas), residents of the Mauazinho neighborhood carried out a protest to demand justice for the case of a motorcycle driver who was hit by a bus and did not survive the injuries.

On 12 June 2023, in Natal (Rio Grande do Norte), a group of people, including relatives of a man killed in 2020 by military police officers (coded separately), staged a demonstration in the surroundings of the State Court of Justice calling for justice in the case and demanding celerity in the process against the officers who are still awaiting trial.

On 12 June 2023, in Sao Paulo - East Zone (Sao Paulo), residents of an occupied land held a demonstration against land repossession in the Iguatemi neighborhood. Demonstrators constructed burning barricades to prevent the passage of the military police. Real estate developers planned to enforce repossession warrants on around 400 houses on 13 June.

On 12 June 2023, in Araci (Bahia), three people were shot in the local market of the municipality by two armed hooded men who entered the market and opened fire against the victims. A man died after the attack and two other people were taken to the hospital. The motivation behind the attack and its perpetrators are unknown. 1 fatality.

On 12 June 2023, in Maceio (Alagoas), two adolescents were shot in the Jacintinho neighborhood by an armed suspect who according to a witness was waiting for the victims and attacked them killing one and severely injuring the other one who was taken to the hospital. Another suspect waited on a motorcycle to flee the scene with the shooter. Relatives of the fatal victim stated the minor had received threats from unknown suspects. The motivation behind the attack and its perpetrators are unknown. 1 fatality.
On 12 June 2023, in Sao Jose do Rio Preto (Sao Paulo), two armed suspects shot and injured a male minor in the Caic Apartment Complex. The perpetrators fled. There were no fatalities.
On 12 June 2023, in Rio de Janeiro - North Zone (Rio de Janeiro), unknown shooters exchanged fire in the Campinho neighborhood and the Pedreira Complex, Pavuna neighborhood. Unknown casualties.
On 12 June 2023, in Rio de Janeiro - West Zone (Rio de Janeiro), unknown shooters exchanged fire in the Cidade de Deus neighborhood. Unknown casualties.

On 12 June 2023, in Monteiro (Ceara), a woman was shot to death after leaving a bar in the Mutirao neighborhood by unknown armed suspects. Police believes the attack was linked with drug trafficking since at least four brothers of the victim had been killed for drug trafficking involvement, though it is not clear if the woman was involved in this activity. The motivation behind the attack still under investigation and the perpetrators are unknown. 1 fatality.
tags: women targeted: relatives of targeted groups or persons

notes: On 12 June 2023, in Porto Alegre (Rio Grande do Sul), a drug trafficker was shot and killed in the Mario Quintana neighborhood by two members of a rival drug trafficking group. 1 fatality.

On 12 June 2023, in Manaus - South Zone (Amazonas), a man was shot and killed in the Santa Luzia neighborhood by two armed individuals. Police described the attack as an execution. There are no reports on the identity of the perpetrators or the attack's motivation. 1 fatality.

Around 12 June 2023 (as reported), in Marituba (Para), a man was killed by unknown individuals and his body was found near the Uriboca River with gunshot wounds. Police described the attack as an execution. Circumstances of death are unknown. 1 fatality.

actor2: Police Forces of Brazil (2023-) Civil Police
notes: On 12 June 2023, in Volta Redonda (Rio de Janeiro), suspected drug traffickers exchanged fire with civil police in the Belmonte neighborhood. The suspects fled. Police seized ammunition, materials for packaging drugs, and a large amount of drugs. There were no fatalities.

On 12 June 2023, in Porto Alegre (Rio Grande do Sul), a man was shot and killed in the Rubem Berta neighborhood by unknown armed individuals. The deceased had a police record for drug trafficking. Two civilians were injured by stray bullets. 1 fatality.

On 12 June 2023, in Barra do Pirai (Rio de Janeiro), unknown suspects shot and killed a man, and his body was found on a dirt road in the Cantao neighborhood. The target had a criminal record of association with drug trafficking and torture. 1 fatality.
On 12 June 2023, in Queimados (Rio de Janeiro), drug traffickers exchanged fire with police militia in the Jardim da Fonte neighborhood. Unknown casualties.

Property destruction: On 12 June 2023, near Cayucupil (Biobio), unknown individuals damaged the La Esperanza bridge, located 5km outside of Cayucupil. Police stated that perpetrators tried to set a trap against them. Individuals used chainsaws to damage the bridge, they also used burned tires and used a felled tree to block the bridge for several hours. The identity of perpetrators is unknown but Indigenous Militias are often responsible for similar attacks in the Biobio region.

On 12 June 2023, in Valparaiso (Valparaiso), unionized fishers gathered at Prat dock demanding to be included in a new deal regarding the Terminal Two expansion project. Fishers also stated that they want to be heard in the context of the environmental requirements in the project.

On 12 June 2023, in Quibdo (Choco), a man was shot dead by unknown individuals. There is no further information on the motives and perpetrators of the attack but the area is known for the presence of armed groups. 1 fatality.

Around 12 June 2023 (as reported), in San Pelayo, Cordoba, a social leader who advocates for farmers and land restitution and was kidnapped the previous Friday 9 June (coded separately) was found dead in Bongamella. 1 fatality.

Around 12 June 2023 (as reported), in the rural area of Solano municipality (Caqueta), a man was shot and killed by an unidentified armed group after being kidnapped. There is no further information on the motives and perpetrators of the attack but there is presence of FARC dissidents and the Frontier Command in the area. 1 fatality.

On 12 June 2023, in Cartagena, Bolivar, dozens of people protested at the public prosecutor's office in Crespo against an alleged bad procedure in the census and compensation payments to residents of Mirador de San Francisco who were affected by a geological fault in this department in 2011.

On 12 June 2023, in Quito - Eugenio Espejo (Pichincha), supporters of a politician who had announced his candidature for president marched through Eloy Alfaro street towards the National Electoral Council (CNE) for him to formally subscribe his candidature.

On 12 June 2023, in Quito - Manuela Saenz (Pichincha), residents marched from Teatro square towards the local government offices as a demonstration to commemorate the International Day against Underage Work.

On 12 June 2023, in Nemby (Central), residents marched to the municipality to demand transparency in the management of public resources and to demand the resignation of the mayor. They claimed that there are irregularities in public contracts. They also demanded answers about the non-payment of salaries to municipal workers.

On 12 June 2023, in Zungarococha (Loreto), residents, students, and teachers at the Peruvian Amazon National University (UNAP) and civil construction workers blocked the Iquitos - Nauta highway at the 5.5 KM with burning tires as a demonstration to demand the conclusion of the construction of Quistococha - Llanchama highway.

On 12 June 2023, in Punchana (Loreto), residents of 24 human settlements staged a demonstration outside the regional government offices to demand fulfillment of the potable water and sewage projects that were promised more than six months before.

On 12 June 2023, in Trujillo (La Libertad), residents of Pataz marched through the city as a demonstration to demand the installation of a military base, a police station and a Justice module in their city.

On 12 June 2023, in Tocuyito (Carabobo), CICPC police forces shot and killed an unidentified crime group suspect, during an armed confrontation with several of them in the San Luis de la Culata neighborhood. The suspects had gathered by the Jardines del Recuerdo cemetery when they were intercepted by the patrolling police unit. The men resisted authority and a shooting ensued. One of them was injured in the gunfire and pronounced dead in hospital, the rest escaped. Police collected a gun. 1 fatality.

source: Que Pasa en Venezuela; Reporte YA
notes: On 12 June 2023, in San Carlos (Cojedes), a group of demonstrators, including active and retired teachers, pensioners, and unionists, protested to demand better pay and working conditions.

source: Caraota Digital; Diario Version Final (Venezuela); El Nacional (Venezuela); El Pitazo; La Patilla
notes: On 12 June 2023, in Maracaibo (Zulia), a group of over 100 Yukpa Indigenous people blocked the General Rafael Urdaneta Bridge over Lake Maracaibo in protest to demand permission to travel to Caracas to sell their production of artisan objects to the government. PNB police initially closed off the bridge to all incoming traffic but eventually they reopened the toll gates, only to see the Yukpa Indigenous people block the bridge with their vehicles. Several hours later, and following successful negotiations with the Minister for Indigenous Peoples who promised them money, the protesters left the area.

actor2: Military Forces of Venezuela (1999-) GNB: Venezuelan National Guard
assoc_actor_2: Police Forces of Venezuela (1999-); Police Forces of Venezuela (1999-) CPNB: National Bolivarian Police
source: Diario Primicia; El Nacional (Venezuela); El Pitazo; La Patilla; OVCS: Observatorio Venezolano de Conflictividad Social; VPItv
notes: On 12 June 2023, in Ciudad Guayana (Bolivar), for the fifth consecutive day, workers at the state-owned SIDOR steelmaker company, and unionists, protested over pay and working conditions at the Pellas Plant. That day, the protest consisted in a march, seconded by other CVG workers, to also demand the immediate liberation of the three unionists imprisoned during the weekend in unclear circumstances. The workers marched down the Guayana Avenue, and as they were making their way back to the plant, they were met by GNB military, and PNB and Bolivar state police forces that attempted to block their entry and with whom they grappled. Additionally, some journalists that were covering the event claimed to have been threatened by the security forces. In the end, the workers left and continued their march towards the Palace of Justice instead. There were no casualties.

source: OVCS: Observatorio Venezolano de Conflictividad Social
notes: On 12 June 2023, in Barinas state (coded to Barinas), demonstrators protested with unspecified demands on issues related to labor, social security, housing, the environment, justice, and Indigenous peoples' rights.

source: OVCS: Observatorio Venezolano de Conflictividad Social
notes: On 12 June 2023, in Sucre state (coded to Cumana), demonstrators protested with unspecified demands on issues related to labor, social security, housing, the environment, justice, and Indigenous peoples' rights.

source: El Diario (Venezuela); Que Pasa en Venezuela; Reporte YA
notes: On 12 June 2023, in Boca de Rio Chiquito (Monagas), a group of residents blocked the Troncal 1 road in protest over power outages going on for almost 24 hours.

source: OVCS: Observatorio Venezolano de Conflictividad Social
notes: On 12 June 2023, in Merida state (coded to Merida), demonstrators protested with unspecified demands on issues related to labor, social security, housing, the environment, justice, and Indigenous peoples' rights.

source: OVCS: Observatorio Venezolano de Conflictividad Social
notes: On 12 June 2023, in Amazonas state (coded to Puerto Ayacucho), demonstrators protested with unspecified demands on issues related to labor, social security, housing, the environment, justice, and Indigenous peoples' rights.

On 12 June 2023, in San Julian, Alta Verapaz, four unidentified attackers on a motorcycle opened fire on another car in motion with two people in it (drive-by) on the road from Tactic to Tamahu. The motivation for the attack is unknown. No more detail is provided by the source. There were no casualties.

On 12 June 2023, in Guatemala City, Guatemala, a member of Barrio-18 gang shot and killed a woman and injured another woman and a girl in colonia Paraiso 2 in zone 18. The motivation for the attack is unknown. No more detail is provided by the source. 1 fatality, 2 injured.

On 12 June 2023, in Guatemala City, Guatemala, unidentified attackers shot and killed a woman and her husband in zone 21. The woman was a member of the CABAL political party, and the attack was perpetrated after the victims participated in a training organized by the abovementioned political party. 2 fatalities.

On 12 June 2023, in Barberena, Santa Rosa, unidentified attackers on a motorcycle opened fire on another car in motion (drive-by) in colonia Gardenia. The motivation for the attack is unknown. No more detail is provided by the source. The occupants of the attacked vehicle were injured, though the number of victims was not reported.

On 12 June 2023, in Remire-Montjoly, Cayenne, 27 workers protested to decry the management of the company's direction. Protesters formed a picket outside the Argos company facilities. This was part of a labor strike that lasted until 15 June.

Property destruction: On 12 June 2023, around Rio Viejo, Atlantida, Yoro, police forces seized coca and marijuana plantations, as well as a narco-laboratory. The operation was conducted by the Honduran Armed Forces as part of the National Security Plan 'Solution Against Crime,' with support from the Military Police. One of the seizures took place in the protected area of Cordillera de Pico Bonito, where approximately 120,000 fully grown coca bushes were found, along with a wooden structure used as a narco-laboratory. Another plantation of around 40,000 mature marijuana plants ready for harvesting spread over around 3.5 hectares of land was seized in the Rio Blanco sector.

On 12 June 2023, in Choluteca, Choluteca, members of the Revolutionaries of the South organization affiliated with the Liberty and Refoundation (LIBRE) party, occupied the facilities of the Regional Health Department to demand the removal of employees affiliated with the National Party of Honduras (PNH).
Around 12 June 2023 (as reported), in Sonaguera, Colon, a boy was killed and his body was found decapitated. The reason for the killing is unknown. 1 fatality.

On 12 June 2023, in Choloma, Cortes, a group of parents and students attending the Mario Ugarte Technical Center protested in front of the city hall, demanding the payment of at least five months back wages to the school's staff.
On 12 June 2023, in San Pedro Sula, Cortes, several unidentified armed men shot and killed three men inside a bar in the Barandillas neighborhood. The reason for the killing is unknown. 3 fatalities.

On 12 June 2023, in Danli, El Paraiso, a group of health care workers occupied the facilities of the Departmental Health Authority in protest, demanding the removal of the warehouse manager for violating their labor rights.

On 12 June 2023, in Tegucigalpa, Francisco Morazan, more than 160 teachers took over the premises of the National Institute of Teachers' Retirement (INPREMA) in protest, demanding their right to retirement. The teachers, who have worked for many years and are facing various health issues, are requesting their retirement benefits as they have reached the required age and years of service.

On 12 June 2023, in Tegucigalpa, Francisco Morazan, unidentified armed men shot and killed a taxi driver in the Humuya neighborhood. Also in Tegucigalpa, unidentified armed men shot and killed a taxi driver in front of the Maya residential complex. The reason for the killing is unknown. 2 fatalities.
On 12 June 2023, in Ilama, Santa Barbara, imprisoned armed gang members from two opposing gangs clashed in a shootout inside the maximum-security prison known as El Pozo. There were no fatalities.

On 12 June 2023, outside Macuelizo, Santa Barbara, a group of residents from Azacualpa, Macuelizo, and Nueva Frontera blocked traffic and burned tires on the CA-4 highway in demonstration for ten hours. They demanded improved electricity service in the area. After negotiations with members of the National Police, the demonstrators lifted their blockade, securing a promise from the electricity company (EEH) to address the power supply issue. The constant power outages have caused damage to appliances and raised concerns among the affected population.

On 12 June 2023, in Tonosi, Los Santos, students, school parents, teachers, and administrative personnel of a local school staged a protest against the gold mining project of Cerro Quema, demanding protection for the environment.

On 12 June 2023, in Panama City, Panama, students and members of the Student Reform University Association (AURE) staged a protest at the seat of the Unit of Control of Multitudes (UMC) in the Ancon neighborhood, to demand the release of five students arrested after a protest staged days before against the new gold mining contract of Cerro Quema (coded separately). In addition, they protested against the Cerro Quema gold mining contract and the high cost of the basic food basket, among others.

On 12 June 2023, in El Nance, Panama Oeste, students, school parents and teachers at a local school staged a protest on the Interamerican Road to demand that the government builds a pedestrian bridge for students.

assoc_actor_1: MOVIR: Movement of Victims of the Regime; Labor Group (El Salvador); Women (El Salvador)
notes: On 12 June 2023, in San Salvador, San Salvador, people staged a protest at the premises of Legal Medicine Office to demand that authorities report on the number and circumstances of people who died under detention after having been arbitrary detained during the State of Exception. The Movement of Victims of the Regime, the Committee of Relatives of Political Prisoners of El Salvador (COFAPPES) and the National Union of Workers, Social and Popular Organizations of El Salvador (UNITRASAL), participated in the protest. Women headed the protest.

On 12 June 2023, in San Salvador, San Salvador, people staged a demonstration at the Metropolitan Cathedral to demand the release of the so-called Santa Marta leaders, who were arrested in January 2023 (coded separately). Residents and community organizations of Santa Marta participated in the demonstration.

actor2: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
notes: On 12 June 2023, in Guaruja (Sao Paulo), armed suspects exchanged fire with military police during an operation targeting drug trafficking in the Vila Baiana neighborhood. An off-duty Afro-Brazilian military soldier who was sitting with the suspects got into a fight with the officers and was shot and killed by military police. His family claim this was because he was black. Two suspects were arrested, and police seized weapons and drugs. 1 fatality.

assoc_actor_2: Government of Colombia (2022-); PLC: Colombian Liberal Party
notes: Property destruction: On 12 June 2023, in San Cayetano (Norte de Santander), unidentified individuals set on fire the vehicle of a PLC councilman who is also a candidate for mayor. A group of residents managed to put off the fire. The perpetrators painted the name ELN on the vehicle.

On 12 June 2023, in the rural area of Jambalo municipality (Cauca), unidentified armed individuals shot and killed an Indigenous man and his wife in Los Picachos vereda. There is no further information on the motives and perpetrators of the attack but there is presence of FARC dissident groups in the area. 2 fatalities.

On 12 June 2023, in La Parada, Norte de Santander, a man was shot and killed in Los Mangos trocha. His body was found the following day. Although the identity of the perpetrators is unknown, the authorities are trying to determine which armed group might have been responsible for the incident. The area is known for the presence of armed groups such as the ELN and the El Tren de Aragua gang. 1 fatality.

On 12 June 2023, in Maicao (La Guajira), two unidentified armed individuals on a motorcycle shot and killed two Wayuu Indigenous women, and injured their father, in a drive-by shooting at their home in the Alfonso Lopez neighborhood. It is thought that the father was the initial target of the attack, but his daughters attempted to defend him from the shooters and were shot dead. The father died from his injuries a month later on 11 July. There is no information on the identity or motivations of the attackers. 3 fatalities.
tags: women targeted: relatives of targeted groups or persons

notes: On 11 June 2023, in Resistencia (Chaco), hundreds of people marched to a police station to demand justice for the femicide and disappearance of a woman. Seven people have been arrested in the case, including the boyfriend of the victim and his parents who are leaders of the Piquetero movement and also candidates for the provincial legislature and for mayor of the city.

On 11 June 2023, in Guayaramerin (Beni), 200 residents attacked workers of the National Hydrocarbons Agency (ANH) and journalists of Bolivia TV while they were carrying out a routinary fuel contraband control.

actor1: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
notes: On 11 June 2023, in Atalaia (Alagoas), a man was beaten for an hour by a military police officer in the Integrated Public Security Center. Witnesses stated the victim was approached by the officer who was with another officer and arrested the victim and beat him inside the institution. Additionally, the victim and witnesses stated the man had been aggressively approached by the same officer in the past. An internal investigation has been opened to determine if excessive force was used. There were no fatalities.

assoc_actor_1: LGBTQ+ (Brazil); PCB: Brazilian Communist Party; PSTU: United Socialist Workers' Party; PSOL: Socialism and Liberty Party; PT: Workers' Party; Government of Brazil (2023-)
source: Brasil de Fato; Folha de S. Paulo; G1
notes: On 11 June 2023, in Sao Paulo - Central Zone (Sao Paulo), approximately 4 million LGBTQ+ people and allies held a protest parade in honor of LGBTQ+ Pride on Paulista Avenue. Protesters called for improved rights for the community, especially in the realm of social assistance. They also called for trans participation in sports. The protesters booed when there were mentions of the former President (PL). The Minister of Human Rights and Citizenship under the President (PT) participated in the opening of the protest. Groups from the United Socialist Workers' Party (PSTU), Brazilian Communist Party (PCB), and the Socialism and Liberty Party (PSOL) also took part.
On 11 June 2023, in Mucajai (Roraima), a suspected thief was tied up, beaten up and injured by residents. The suspect was taken to a hospital by police and later arrested.

On 11 June 2023, in Manaus - Central South Zone (Amazonas), a man was abducted from the Flores neighborhood by three armed individuals. The victim was forced into a car and was being taken to the Taruma neighborhood to be executed, but he was able to draw police attention and was rescued. The three suspects were arrested. Abduction motivation is unknown.

On 11 June 2023, in Rio de Janeiro - North Zone (Rio de Janeiro), unknown shooters exchanged fire in the Israel Complex, Cordovil neighborhood, and the Morro dos Macacos community, Vila Isabel neighborhood. Shooting was also heard in the Campinho, Engenho Novo, and Jacarezinho neighborhoods. Unknown casualties.
On 11 June 2023, in Rio de Janeiro - West Zone (Rio de Janeiro), unknown shooters exchanged fire in the Campo de Areia community, Jacarepagua neighborhood. Unknown casualties.

Around 11 June 2023 (as reported), in Manaus - North Zone (Amazonas), a man was killed and dismembered by drug traffickers and his body parts were found in the Novo Aleixo neighborhood. The victim was a drug user and was killed in a drug trafficking tribunal. The victim had been missing since 20 April 2023. 1 fatality.

On 11 June 2023, in Sao Joao Evangelista (Minas Gerais), a man was killed in a drive-by shooting in the Centenario neighborhood by three armed individuals on two motorcycles. Two suspects were arrested, one of them was involved in drug trafficking activities. Attack motivation is unknown. 1 fatality.

On 11 June 2023, in Maceio (Alagoas), two men were shot and injured in the Cruzeiro do Sul and in the Tabuleiro do Martins neighborhoods. According the witnesses the attack was perpetuated in a drive-by shooting by armed men who opened fire from a car. The victims were taken to the hospital. The motivation behind the attack and its perpetrators are unknown. There were no fatalities.
On 11 June 2023, in Queimados (Rio de Janeiro), unknown shooters shot and killed two civilians in the Nova Cidade neighborhood. The perpetrators had confused them for drug traffickers. 2 fatalities.

On 11 June 2023, in Queimados (Rio de Janeiro), unknown perpetrators shot and killed a man outside a bar in the Sao Roque neighborhood. The event was described as an execution and locals report he was part of a local police militia. 1 fatality.

On 11 June 2023, in Volta Redonda (Rio de Janeiro), unknown suspects shot and killed a drug trafficker, and his body was found on the margins of the Contorno highway. The target had had a disagreement with members of a rival drug trafficking faction earlier that day in the Pinheiral municipality. 1 fatality.

Property destruction: On 11 June 2023, in Tirua commune (Biobio), at least five hooded individuals set two forestry trucks on fire on Route P-742 that connects Canihual with Tirua. Perpetrators forced the drivers out before the attack. The identity of perpetrators is unknown but Indigenous Militias are often responsible for similar attacks in the Biobio region.

On 11 June 2023, in Corral (Los Rios), residents gathered at La Aguada school and marched towards the city center in Corral with flags and banners demanding a quick solution to the lack of water supply. Protesters stated that there are delays in the works regarding the restoring of the service, after almost a month without water supply affecting about 1,200 people. Residents have been protesting on the sector's bridge, blocking traffic.

Property destruction: Around 11 June 2023 (as reported), in Don Matias municipality (Antioquia), unidentified individuals set on fire a truck. There is no further information but the area is known for the presence of armed groups.

Around 11 June 2023 (as reported), in Los Llanos (Cauca), a man was shot and killed and his body was found. The victim had been kidnapped around Popayan municipality on 2 June (coded separately). There is no further information on the perpetrators but the area is known for the presence of armed groups. 1 fatality.

On 11 June 2023, in Palmira, Valle del Cauca, a taxi driver was killed and found dead in his car in Piles vereda. The area is known for the presence of armed groups. There are no reports on the identity of the perpetrators. 1 fatality.

On 11 June 2023, in Ibague, Tolima, residents of the Arboleda Campestre Residential Complex (CRAC) protested against the administrator for irregularities and the damages present in the infrastructure of their residential complex.
On 11 June 2023, in Santo Tomas, Atlantico, people took to the streets to protest against the way in which a teacher was beaten after being accused of raping a minor and to demand justice.
On 11 June 2023, in Simiti, Bolivar, residents took to the streets to demand that the armed groups stop violence against civilians who have been victims of assassinations and extorsions.

On 11 June 2023, in Lagunas (Cajamarca), farmers, members of citizens' organizations, and environmental activists staged a demonstration in front of the Alto Peru lagoons to commemorate the intangibility declaration of the lagoons in the sector, and alerted extraction projects the government is giving opening to in the sector.
On 11 June 2023, in Punchana (Loreto), residents of Juan del Cuadro human settlement burned down a motorcycle used by three men that were accused of being robbers.

On 11 June 2023, in Lima - Jesus Maria (Lima), parents members of the Childhood Cancer Law Collective staged a demonstration outside Edgardo Rebagliati hospital to voice their grievances about the lack of hospital beds available, the delays in orders of medicine for chemotherapy and the lack of Magnetic Resonance tests.

On 11 June 2023, in Lima - La Victoria (Lima), parents members of the Childhood Cancer Law Collective staged a demonstration outside Guillermo Almenara hospital to voice their grievances about the lack of hospital beds available, the delays in orders of medicine for chemotherapy and the lack of Magnetic Resonance tests.

notes: Around 11 June 2023 (as reported), in Romulo Gallegos municipality (coded to Elorza, Apure), military air forces shot down an aircraft in flight over Apure state thought to belong to unidentified criminal groups linked to drug trafficking, and weapon smuggling. Casualties unknown.

On 11 June 2023, in Caracas - Sucre (Miranda), two unidentified crime group suspects on a motorcycle opened fire on three men, killing one and injuring the other two, in a drive-by shooting in the La Dolorita parish. The attack took place in the early hours, the suspects escaped. One of the victims was pronounced dead in hospital, the remaining two received medical attention. There is no further information at this point in time. 1 fatality.

Three unionists were arrested during the early hours of that day by the DGCIM in unclear circumstances; one of them was liberated shortly after, the remaining two were prosecuted in Caracas.

actor2: Police Forces of Venezuela (1999-) CPNB: National Bolivarian Police
source: Caraota Digital; El Nacional (Venezuela); El Pitazo
notes: On 11 June 2023, in La Villa del Rosario (Zulia), a group of Yukpa Indigenous people clashed with PNB police, in the early hours, at the police outpost by the Jalisco sector in the Troncal 6 road. Their intention was to reach Maracaibo, as part of their ongoing demonstrations that week to demand permission to travel to Caracas to sell their production of artisan objects to the government (coded separately). In the end, they forced their way through the checkpoint, and continued their journey. Eight police officers were injured.

Around 11 June 2023 (as reported), in San Juan de los Morros (Guarico), a group of residents of the Valle Verde sector protested over power outages going on for 16 days. The protesters gathered outside the Corpoelec power company offices, and demand the replacement of at least three electric transformers in the area.

On 11 June 2023, in Zacapa, Zacapa, unidentified attackers killed a journalist using a bladed weapon inside the municipal market. One source indicates that the attack could be related to the political activity of the journalist, as he would upload on his Facebook page articles related to the work of a candidate. 1 fatality.

On 11 June 2023, in Zacapa, Zacapa, unidentified men on a motorcycle shot and killed a woman in a drive-by shooting incident in La Cruz de Mayo neighborhood. The victim was on her motorcycle at the moment of the attack. 1 fatality.

On 11 June 2023, in Choloma, Cortes, police officers clashed with armed members of the Barrio 18 Gang during a security operation conducted in the San Francisco neighborhood, where the gang is believed to have control, killing a gang member and wounding another. Preliminary police investigations revealed the likely reason for the shooting to be a vengeance against the Mara Salvatrucha Gang, who has control over the territory where the shooting happened, for the recent killing of the father of a member of the Los Aguacates Gang. 6 fatalities. 1 wounded.

Around 11 June 2023 (as reported), in the rural area of Santa Rosa del Sur municipality (Bolivar), two unidentified armed groups clashed near Los Robles vereda. The armed confrontation resulted in the confinement of at least 64 people living in the area. Casualties unknown.

On 11 June 2023, in Orpua (Choco), ELN members abducted five people after entering the village and opening fire indiscriminately against civilians. The whereabouts of the victims are unknown. On 9 June 2023, in Iquitos (Loreto), family members of a man that died in a work accident staged a demonstration in Bolivar street to demand the Provincial government make a statement over the death of the worker, for justice in the case and to carry out an investigation to have a clear understanding of what happened.
On 9 June 2023, in Barinas (Barinas), a group of teachers protested to demand better pay and working conditions. The protesters gathered by the 23 de Enero Avenue.

Around 9 June 2023 (as reported), in Ciudad Guayana (Bolivar), a vigilante group of residents of the Villa Abejal sector beat and immobilized a man who they accused of attempting to steal a motorcycle. Police arrived on scene, arrested the suspect, and took him to hospital for treatment.

On 9 June 2023, in Valencia (Carabobo), a group of demonstrators, including active and retired teachers, and pensioners, protested to demand better pay and working conditions, and against the threats and intimidation suffered by some of their colleagues for partaking in the labor action. The protesters marched down the Henry Ford Avenue to the La Isabelica market.

Around 9 June 2023 (as reported), in Corozo Pando (Guarico), a group of residents protested against the decision of the authorities of making some petrol stations non-subsidized. Going forward fuel will have to be paid in US Dollars, at prices completely unaffordable for them.

On 9 June 2023, in La Asuncion (Nueva Esparta), a group of workers from the Nueva Esparta state Legislative Council protested to demand payment of owed stipends. The protesters argue that they haven't been paid in six months, and blame the National Budget Office (ONAPRE).

On 9 June 2023, in Maracaibo (Zulia), a group of teachers and unionists protested to demand better pay and working conditions, and the renewal of their collective labor agreement. The protesters gathered by the Galerias Mall.

All four CV members and the remaining abducted PCC member were arrested. 2 fatalities.

Around 9 June 2023 (as reported), in Manaus - East Zone (Amazonas), a man was killed and his body was found in the Jorge Teixeira neighborhood with signs of torture, a plastic bag over his head, and with his hands and feet tied up. The deceased's body was tossed out of a car by unknown individuals. A note was left with the body indicating that the killing was result of a dispute between the CV and the PCC. 1 fatality.

On 9 June 2023, in Antofagasta (Antofagasta), students at the Domingo Herrera B-13 school began an occupation of the educational facilities which lasted until 13 June, demanding the CMDS (Municipal Corporation for Social Development) and the school's board solutions over infrastructure problems and security-related issues. Students also stated that they are suffering mistreatment and bad practices from teachers. Authorities met with the students to address these problems on 13 June.

Around 9 June 2023 (as reported), in the rural area of San Lorenzo municipality (Cauca), ELN members shot and killed a man in the Florida vereda after forcibly taking him from his house. Before being killed, the perpetrators told the family that they were going to kill the man because they did not want people from El Plateado (Argelia municipality) in the area. The ELN had already threatened the man telling him he had to leave the municipality in the past. 1 fatality.

On 9 June 2023, in Arboletes, Antioquia, a social leader who advocates for farmers and land restitution was kidnapped on his way to Cordoba. His security detail was disarmed and set free. The area is known for the presence of rebel armed groups. There are no reports on the identity of the perpetrators. The victim was found dead three days later (coded separately).

Around 9 June 2023 (as reported), in the rural area of Olaya Herrera municipality (Narino), there was a clash between two unidentified armed groups in El Diviso sector. As a result, 80 Afro-Colombian people were forcibly displaced to the municipal seat. Casualties unknown.

On 9 June 2023, in 7 de Junio (Loreto), for the fourth consecutive day, Indigenous citizens who are members of the Bajo Puinahua Conservation and Development Indigenous Association (AIDECOBAP) blocked the Puinahua river as a demonstration to reject the Development Fund Regulation agreements.

According to the demonstrators, that day approximately some of the approximately 1,000 protesters were met at the gates of the plant by at least 50 GNB military officers who attempted to disperse them by threatening the workers with using live ammunition against them. Information is unclear at this stage but it is thought that the protest continued. There were no casualties.

On 9 June 2023, in Guatemala municipality (coded to Guatemala City), Guatemala, unidentified attackers shot and killed a taxi driver at the height of KM 6.54 of the road to the Atlantic. No more detail is provided by the source. 1 fatality.

On 9 June 2023, in Bogota (Bogota, D.C.), the national government reached a temporary ceasefire agreement with the ELN in all the Colombian territory. The ceasefire is set to begin on 6 July 2023 and ends on 3 August 2023. The agreement suspends any offensive military and intelligence operation by the ELN against security forces and vice versa.

A group of people out of the 21 families that were still living in the plot erected barricades and threw two Molotov cocktails at police. The mayor stated that the people living in the occupied plot now have a permanent home in a housing project and a subsidy for rent for more than 12 months paid by the State.

On 8 June 2023, in Iquitos (Loreto), leaders and members of the Loreto Regional Health Management Workers Union (SUTRA GERESA), including health workers, staged a demonstration outside the Regional Health Management offices to demand a change of workers of the entity, and to voice their concerns about wages disparities between CAS contract workers.

On 8 June 2023, in Paysandu (Paysandu), workers at the ANCAP company protested at one of the company's cement plants to demand that the public bidding for Portland Cement is suspended. They claim that the bidding is unconstitutional.

On 8 June 2023, in San Fernando de Apure (Apure), a group of teachers protested to demand better pay and working conditions, and against the new adjustments to bonuses and benefits for state workers announced by the government, which they argue to be insufficient. The protesters gathered in the San Fernando Boulevard.

assoc_actor_1: Broad Front of Women Venezuela Libre; Women (Venezuela)
notes: On 8 June 2023, in Ciudad Guayana (Bolivar), a group of women belonging to the Broad Front of Women organization protested to demand the refurbishing and reopening of the Menca de Leoni Pediatric Hospital. The hospital was closed five years before and now serves, according to the demonstrators, as a refuge for criminals.

assoc_actor_1: Teachers (Venezuela); FVM: Venezuelan Federation of Teachers
notes: On 8 June 2023, in Ciudad Guayana (Bolivar), a group of demonstrators, including teachers, and FVM representatives, protested to demand better pay and working conditions, and the renewal of their collective labor agreement. The protesters gathered in the Las Banderas Square.

source: Caraota Digital; Diario 2001; El Carabobeno; El Pitazo; La Patilla
notes: Around 8 June 2023 (as reported), in Valencia (Carabobo), several members of the El Leo Maracay Gang abducted several members of a family, inside their house in the Parque Valencia neighborhood. They were released the same day by PNB police forces, during a security operation that left five armed suspects dead (coded separately). Motivations for the abduction are not known at this early stage.

actor1: Police Forces of Venezuela (1999-) CPNB: National Bolivarian Police
source: Caraota Digital; Diario 2001; El Carabobeno; El Pitazo; La Patilla
notes: On 8 June 2023, in Valencia (Carabobo), PNB police forces shot and killed five members of the El Leo Maracay gang, and arrested another one, during an armed clash in the Parque Valencia neighborhood. A rescue mission had been launched following reports of a hostage situation in the area. The suspects resisted authority and were injured in the gunfire. They were all pronounced dead in hospital. The family was liberated; contradicting reports mention that some of them could have been injured, although this wasn't officially confirmed. Police seized an assault rifle and four guns. 5 fatalities.

On 8 June 2023, in Caracas - Libertador (Distrito Capital), a group of demonstrators and human rights activists protested to demand justice for for a case of fishers and migrants who had disappeared in 2015 and the launching of a public inquiry to determine responsibilities. Relatives of at least 150 fishers and migrants took part in the event. They have been missing since 2015 after setting sail in Venezuelan waters, in some cases bound for other countries. The protesters blame human trafficking gangs. The demonstrators gathered outside the Public Ministry Office.
On 8 June 2023, in El Supi (Falcon), a group of residents blocked a road in protest over ongoing drinking water outages.
On 8 June 2023, in Tiraya (Falcon), a group of residents blocked a road in protest over ongoing drinking water outages.

Around 8 June 2023 (as reported), in Calabozo (Guarico), a group of demonstrators, including residents, teachers, and relatives of a girl who committed suicide after suffering sexual abuse from her grandfather during an extended period of time, protested to demand justice for her. The protesters gathered outside the local courthouse and then marched to the CICPC police station.

Around 8 June 2023 (as reported), in San Juan de los Morros (Guarico), a group of cancer patients of the Dr. Ramon Millan Hospital protested to demand the repair of the equipment needed for their treatments.

source: OVCS: Observatorio Venezolano de Conflictividad Social; VPItv
notes: On 8 June 2023, in Merida (Merida), a group of teachers protested to demand better pay and working conditions, and against the constant power outages they suffer. The protesters gathered by the Corpoelec power company office.

Around 8 June 2023 (as reported), in Nueva Bolivia (Merida), a group of residents of the Tulio Febres Cordero municipality, and of the neighboring Sucre municipality in Zulia state, blocked the Troncal 1 road for several hours in protest over delays in fuel distribution. The roadblock was staged at the Torondoy Bridge.

On 8 June 2023, in Ciudad Ojeda (Zulia), a group of demonstrators, including active and retired oil sector workers, and pensioners, protested to demand better pay and working conditions, an increase in food bonuses, and the restoration of their medical insurance plans. The protesters marched from the Rafael Urdaneta docks to the Bolivar Square.

On 8 June 2023, in Maracaibo (Zulia), a group of Yukpa Indigenous women demonstrated to demand the liberation of their husbands and other members of their communities arrested during prior demonstrations that week. The women gathered outside the Maracaibo courthouse and threatened workers with bows and arrows. Yupka Indigenous people from the Sierra de Perija (Zulia) had staged several demonstrations that week to demand permission to travel to Caracas to speak with the authorities about their situation, and to demand the authorities to buy their production of artisan objects off them (coded separately). There were no casualties.

actor2: Police Forces of Venezuela (1999-) CPNB: National Bolivarian Police
source: Diario Version Final (Venezuela); Noticia al Minuto
notes: On 8 June 2023, in La Villa del Rosario (Zulia), a group of Yupka Indigenous people clashed with PNB police at the police outpost by the Jalisco sector in the Troncal 6 road. The rioters had blocked the road at a nearby location as part of their ongoing demonstrations that week to demand permission to travel to Caracas to speak with the authorities about their situation, and to sell their production of artisan objects (coded separately). In the end, they managed to overrun the police and leave the area. There were no casualties.

On 8 June 2023, in Resistencia (Chaco), a group of supporters of a candidate for provincial legislator and a woman candidate for mayor (both PJ) blocked the access to a police station to prevent the deposition of a collaborator of the candidates, who are being investigated for covering the femicide of a woman by their son. The demonstrators broke into the building in support of the family.

On 8 June 2023, in Placilla (Valparaiso), a detonation of an explosive device caused damage to a high-tension tower from an electric company located in Las Cenizas farm. The explosive device was set at one of the bases of the tower, which left behind some steel twisted as a result of the high release of energy, but without the structure being in danger of falling. The M18O (18th of October Movement) took responsibility for the attack through a public statement.

On 8 June 2023, in 7 de Junio (Loreto), for the third consecutive day, Indigenous citizens who are members of the Bajo Puinahua Conservation and Development Indigenous Association (AIDECOBAP) blocked the Puinahua river as a demonstration to reject the Development Fund Regulation agreements.

On 8 June 2023, in Ciudad Guayana (Bolivar), workers at the state-owned SIDOR steelmaker company, and unionists, protested to demand better pay and working conditions. The protest was staged at the Pellas Plant, where on 7 June the workers had announced they would be going on strike.

On 8 June 2023, in Belize City, Belize, two men shot and injured a woman in the Complex Basketball Court in McKenzie Street. The victim was watching a basketball match when the two men turned up and opened fire. The two attackers were teenagers. Police stated that it was a gang-rivalry related attack. 1 injured.
On 8 June 2023, in Grecia, Alajuela, dozens of people staged a protest against the closure of the local soccer stadium. Entrepreneurs, sportsmen and their relatives participated in the demonstration.

source: Diario Co Latino; El Mundo (El Salvador); La Prensa Grafica

The detainee was arrested in the El Icacal beach. This arrest was carried out after the entry into force of the State of Exception approved by the Legislative Assembly at the request of President Bukele.
On 8 June 2023, in Cucuta - Northwest (Norte de Santander), residents of the Chapinero neighborhood blocked the road in protest against the poor road infrastructure in the area.

On 8 June 2023, in Bretana (Loreto), Indigenous members of the Autonomous Authorities Board captured the District Mayor and the local registrar, and forcibly took them to the main square of the city, as a demonstration to demand the mayor not to make any agreements with Bajo Puinahua Conservation and Development Indigenous Association (AIDECOBAP). This comes after AIDECOBAP blocked Pinahua river and captured two ships to reject the Development Fund Regulation agreements (coded separately).

On 8 June 2023, in Rio Negro Province (coded to San Carlos de Bariloche), health workers associated with the Rio Negro Public Health Union Association (ASSPUR) demonstrated to demand for better salaries and labor conditions.

assoc_actor_2: Former FARC: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia
notes: Around 8 June 2023 (as reported), in Timba (Cauca), a former FARC member was kidnapped by an unidentified armed group. The victim received threats in May 2023. The whereabouts of the victim are unknown. The area is known for the presence of armed groups.

On 8 June 2023, in Santa Ana de Coro (Falcon), a group of drivers blocked the Variante Sur Jose Leonardo Chirino road in protest over the difficulties they find in refueling at the Las Brisas de El Isiro petrol station.

Around 7 June 2023 (as reported), in San Luis, San Rosa, two police officers were found killed floating in the river. The police officers were investigating a local gang. The motivation for the attack is unknown. No more detail is provided by the source. 2 fatalities.

On 7 June 2023, in Guatemala City, Guatemala, residents of the Nueva Trinidad community staged a protest at the Presidential house in zone 1. Protesters, who are members of the Maya Popti' indigenous groups and were victims of the eruption of the Volcan de Fuego, demanded that the government provides them housing facilities, as they have been living in temporary shelters since 2018.

On 7 June 2023, in Quiche department (coded to Playa Grande Ixcan), Quiche, bus drivers staged a protest by blocking streets in 20 out of the 21 municipalities in the department. Protesters demanded the government to fix the roads in the department.
On 7 June 2023, in Villa Canales, Guatemala, people staged a protest to demand that authorities fix the draining system in the area and resume the provision of drinking water service.

Around 7 June 2023 (as reported), in San Marcos, Santa Barbara, two members of the Mara Salvatrucha Gang were killed and their bodies were found in a dump in the San Francisco village. Preliminary investigations noted that the victims were kidnapped from their homes and were later executed, suggesting the involvement of a rival gang. The reason for the killing is unknown. 2 fatalities.

assoc_actor_1: Labor Group (Honduras); LIBRE: Liberty and Refoundation
notes: On 7 June 2023, in Tegucigalpa, Francisco Morazan, a group of supporters of the Liberty and Refoundation Party (LIBRE) occupied the administrative offices of the Alonso Suazo Health Center in protest. The occupation was carried out in protest against the alleged failure to provide promised job positions and the influence of the vice minister's sister in the allocation of positions within the health center. The occupiers clarified that their actions were not hindering patient care, as only the administrative and human resources offices were occupied, and they expressed a willingness to end the occupation if their concerns were addressed.

On 7 June 2023, in San Pedro Sula, Cortes, a group of residents of the El Ocotillo neighborhood demonstrated against frequent power outages in the area. Demonstrators clashed with military police forces with stones and also flattened the tires of law enforcement's vehicles. Military police officers proceeded to beat demonstrators and one of them was shot and killed. 1 fatality. 2 wounded.

On 7 June 2023, in San Sebastian Salitrillo, Santa Ana, military officers arrested a member of MS-13, member of the so-called 'First Generation gang members.' He was arrested for being the founder of the Salitrillos Locotes Salvatruchos, Holliwood Locos Salvatruchos, Gauchos Locos Salvatruchos, and Wanders Locos Salvatruchos gangs. The arrests were carried out as part of the so-called 'War on Gangs' operation and was carried out during the State of Exception approved by the Legislative Assembly at the request of President Bukele.

source: Diario Co Latino; El Mundo (El Salvador)

On 7 June 2023, in Rawson (Chubut), members of the Chubut Teacher's Association marched to the provincial ministry of education to demand salary negotiations with authorities.

On 7 June 2023, in San Salvador de Jujuy (Jujuy), teachers protested in front of the Ministry of Education to demand a raise in salaries and rejected the new salary proposal made by the provincial government. On 7 June 2023, in San Juan (San Juan), parents at the Manuel Belgrano School protested outside the premises of the institution to demand the removal of a 4th-grade teacher who was found guilty of sexual assault against a minor in the year 1998.

On 7 June 2023, in Rosario (Santa Fe), thousands of teachers, members of the Santa Fe Teacher's Association, marched to the provincial Ministry of Education to repudiate violent attacks against schools perpetrated by drug trafficking groups and to demand solutions from authorities. The protest took place after a child was shot and injured in an attack outside a school the day before. The governor said that the constant shoot-outs against the institutions are related to retaliations by organized crime groups over an increase of controls in prisons. Students also participated in the protest with demands related to school infrastructure.

On 7 June 2023, in Camiri district (Santa Cruz), for the second consecutive day, residents and farmers of Brecha 5, Montegrande, Canaverales 1 and 2 communities blocked the highway towards Camiri city at the 45 KM as a demonstration to voice their grievance about the decision of building a landfill, that they claim is on their productive sector and would affect their plantations and cattle.

On 7 June 2023, in Rio Branco (Acre), Indigenous people gathered in front of the Legislative Assembly to protest against changes in procedures regarding recognition and demarcation of Indigenous territories.

On 7 June 2023, in Delmiro Gouveia (Alagoas), a man was beaten by a group of people after the individual had tried to rob the same group in the city center. One of the members of the group who beat up the suspect was also injured and taken to the hospital, though the circumstances of the how the injuries were sustained is unknown. The victim was also taken to the hospital. There were no fatalities.

A pamphlet was found at the scene in which the Mapuche Lavkenche Resistance (RML) took responsibility for the attack.

On 7 June 2023, in Coronel (Biobio), workers at the CRC Coronel (a juvenile detention center) occupied some Sename (National Service for Minors) offices in protest against aggressions suffered inside the facilities. Workers argued that they received constant attacks from the young prisoners due to drug use and trafficking inside the premises. Protesters stated that they feel abandoned since they have spent years denouncing these kinds of situations.

On 7 June 2023, in Talcahuano (Biobio), 30 parents, students, and representatives of students erected barricades outside of the Villa Centinela Sur school against suspected child abuse after some students held a sex education talk made by a Health Center, where there was touching and intimate questions, in addition to the projection of a film for adults. Demonstrators gathered under the slogan 'don't touch our children.'

On 7 June 2023, in Santiago (Metropolitana), the Team Patriota movement protested against the Constitutional Council in the vicinity of the former Constitutional Congress building. The group held banners and flags in the context of the installation of the council in charge of drafting a new Constitution. Protesters sang the National Anthem and made allusions to the dictator Augusto Pinochet.

On 7 June 2023, in Santiago (Metropolitana), the Association of Fathers and Mothers for the Truth protested against the Affective Sexuality Guide and Comprehensive Sexual Education (ESI) on Teatinos street. A group of people yelled homophobic insults at the Minister of Education as he was passing by.

On 7 June 2023, in San Antonio (Valparaiso), students at the Commercial Institute marched towards the city hall in protest against the lack of teachers. Protesters stated that the filing of medical licenses by teachers has left students without classes or academic activities and demanded the authorities to find replacements. Protesters met with the mayor to address these problems.

assoc_actor_1: ANFUP: National Association of Penitentiary Officials; Police Forces of Chile (2022-) Prison Guards
notes: On 7 June 2023, in Valparaiso (Valparaiso), unionized prison guards with ANFUP and relatives of prison guards who died during service protested outside of the Valparaiso prison. Protesters demanded better working conditions, including mental health programs, more economic resources, better infrastructure, among others. The protest takes place in the context of the suicide of a 20-year-old prison guard inside the prison four days prior.

assoc_actor_1: CH: Humane Colombia; CUT: Central Union of Workers; Labor Group (Colombia); Teachers (Colombia)
notes: On 7 June 2023, in Medellin - Central East (Antioquia), about 2,000 teachers, union workers affiliated to the CUT, and other citizens protested to show their support to President Gustavo Petro (CH) and the health, pension, agrarian and educational reforms promoted by his government. Protesters marched from various points in the city in the direction of La Alpujarra. Protesters insulted some journalists covering the event, but no physical aggressions were reported. Rioters threw stones at the protesters. The group denounced that the incident took place in front of police officers who ignored the incident. This was part of the nationwide demonstrations called by Petro.

On 7 June 2023, in Medellin - Northwest (Antioquia), students at the National University (El Volador Campus) clashed with police as part of nationwide demonstrations called by President Gustavo Petro (CH). The students blocked traffic and the university building was evacuated when an improvised explosive device exploded on the premises. Seven people were arrested.

Around 7 June 2023 (as reported), Coquitos (Turbo, Antioquia), military forces clashed with Gulf Clan militants near the Coquitos vereda. One Gulf Clan member was killed in the armed clash. 1 fatality.

On 7 June 2023, in Arauca department (coded to Arauca, Arauca), farmers and other citizens blocked different roads in the department for the second consecutive day to protest against the lack of investment and adequate infrastructure for health, education and housing in the department. The protesters also expressed their environmental concerns about the contamination of water sources used by the communities.

Protesters insulted some journalists covering the event, but no physical aggressions were reported. This was part of nationwide demonstrations called by Petro.

Protesters marched from various points in the city in the direction of Bolivar square. The president and vice-president joined the marchers among other members of the government. This was part of the nationwide demonstrations called by Petro.

Around 7 June 2023 (as reported), in Huisito (Cauca), two unidentified armed groups clashed, resulting in the death of three militia members. Two victims were children who had been forcibly recruited. 3 fatalities.

Around 7 June 2023 (as reported), in Valledupar (Cesar), family members and other citizens organized a caravan protest to demand the release of a cattle rancher abducted on April 24 by the ELN (coded separately).

On 7 June 2023, in La Guajira department (coded to Riohacha, La Guajira), Wayuu Indigenous people protested for the second consecutive day against deficiencies in education, health, and infrastructure in their communities. The group blocked multiple roads and railways across the department.

On 7 June 2023, in Riohacha municipality (La Guajira), residents of the La Florida locality protested against power outages in the area. The group blocked the Riohacha-Cuestecita road for several hours.

On 7 June 2023, in Riohacha (La Guajira), residents of the La Rancheria and 7 Agosto neighborhoods protested against power outages in the area. The group blocked the offices of the energy company Air-e d for several hours.

On 7 June 2023, in Puerto Villamil (Galapagos), residents and family members of a man that was involved in a traffic accident staged a demonstration to voice their concern on how long it took emergency personal to rescue the man, after it took them almost a full day to aid him.

On 7 June 2023, in Buenos Aires (Ancash), parents of students staged a demonstration outside the local police station to demand more security in Las Delicias human settlement due to the increasing criminal activity that affects students.

On 7 June 2023, in Majes District (coded to El Pedregal, Arequipa), residents carried out a 'flag wash' (a Peruvian symbolic protest, to wash the flag of corruption) as a demonstration to demand the closure of congress, calling for general elections, and for the resignation of President Dina Boluarte.

On 7 June 2023, in Huancavelica (Huancavelica), unionized civil construction workers marched through the city as a demonstration to demand the restart of works by the Regional government that are currently paralyzed.

On 7 June 2023, in Huancayo province (Junin), residents members of the Unitary Fight Command marched and carried out a 'flag wash' (a Peruvian symbolic protest, to wash the flag of corruption) as a demonstration to demand the closure of congress, calling for general elections, and for the resignation of President Dina Boluarte.

On 7 June 2023, in Lima - Lima District (Lima), residents members of the 9 de Enero Victims and Martyrs Association and social organizations staged a demonstration to demand the closure of congress, calling for general elections, and for the resignation of President Dina Boluarte.
On 7 June 2023, in Lima - Los Olivos (Lima), residents captured and beat up a man that robbed a worker. They later took the man to the Sol de Oro police station.
On 7 June 2023, in Ilave district (Puno), residents staged a demonstration to demand the closure of congress, calling for general elections, and for the resignation of President Dina Boluarte.
On 7 June 2023, in Huancane province (Puno), residents staged a demonstration to demand the closure of congress, calling for general elections, and for the resignation of President Dina Boluarte.

On 7 June 2023, in Juliaca (Puno), family members and friends of the victims of the riots against Dina Boluarte in January 2023 marched through the city stretching a 120 meters flag as a demonstration to demand justice and rejected the current government. The 9 de Enero Victims and Martyrs Association participated. They raised a white and black flag in commemoration of the victims.

On 7 June 2023, in Puerto La Cruz (Anzoategui), a group of residents of the Oropeza Castillo neighborhood protested against the collapse of the local sewage system, which has led to the deterioration of sanitation, and the appearance of stagnant and polluted water puddles. The protesters claim that they have not been able to use their taps or toilets at home for at least 15 days, and blame the Hidrocaribe water company. They gathered in the Circunvalacion Avenue. Police were present but there was no intervention.

source: Correo del Caroni; Diario Primicia; La Patilla
notes: On 7 June 2023, in Ciudad Guayana (Bolivar), a group of demonstrators, including active and retired state workers, and pensioners of companies belonging to the state-owned Venezuelan Corporation of Guayana (CVG), protested to demand payment of owed stipends related to forced early retirement processes, and better pay and working conditions. The protesters gathered outside the CVG headquarters and then marched to the Palace of Justice, where workers at the Sidor company filed an appeal.

On 7 June 2023, in Caracas - Sucre (Miranda), Sucre state police forces shot and killed two unidentified crime group suspects, during an armed clash in the Union neighborhood, Petare parish. The suspects were by the house of another police officer for unspecified reasons when they were intercepted by the patrolling police unit. They resisted authority and were injured in the gunfire; they were both pronounced dead in hospital. Police collected two guns. 2 fatalities.

Around 7 June 2023 (as reported), in Zapara (Zulia), a group of 100 families, mostly fishers, residents of the Zapara and the San Carlos islands, protested to demand the liberation of three fishers arrested by GNB military officers and accused of fuel smuggling. Likewise, they protested against the ongoing power outages and fuel shortages in the area.

On 7 June 2023, in Cabimas (Zulia), a group of active and retired oil sector workers protested to demand better pay and working conditions, the renewal of their collective labor agreement, and the restoration of their medical insurance plans. The protesters gathered in the Las Salinas docks.

Around 7 June 2023 (as reported), in Esquel (Chubut), teachers demonstrated to demand a raise in salaries amidst high inflation rates. Students and parents also participated in the protest in support of teachers.

Around 7 June 2023 (as reported), in Puerto Madryn (Chubut), teachers demonstrated to demand a raise in salaries amidst high inflation rates. Students and parents also participated in the protest in support of teachers.

actor1: Police Forces of Brazil (2023-) Civil Police
notes: Property destruction: On 7 June 2023, in Araucaria (Parana), civil police agents dismantled a cocaine lab in the Thomaz Coelho neighborhood. Two people were arrested.

On 7 June 2023, in Buenos Aires (Cauca), unidentified armed individuals shot and killed a man inside his house. There is no further information on the motives and perpetrators of the attack but the area is known for the presence of armed groups. 1 fatality.

Around 7 June 2023 (as reported), in Novita municipality (Choco), an Afro-Colombian man was shot and killed and his body was found on the Novita - San Lorenzo road. The victim was the son of a social worker. There is no further information on the motives and perpetrators of the attack but the area is known for the presence of armed groups. 1 fatality.

On 7 June 2023, in 7 de Junio (Loreto), for the second consecutive day, Indigenous citizens who are members of the Bajo Puinahua Conservation and Development Indigenous Association (AIDECOBAP) blocked the Puinahua river as a demonstration to reject the Development Fund Regulation agreements.

notes: On 7 June 2023, in San Justo (Buenos Aires), health workers associated with APTS protested in San Justo Square to demand better salaries.

On 7 June 2023, in Resistencia (Chaco), health workers associated with the Association of Professionals, Technicians and Auxiliaries of Public Health of Chaco (APTASCH) protested at the Culture Center to demand better salaries and labor conditions.

assoc_actor_1: Health Workers (Argentina); SIPRUS: Union of University Health Professionals
notes: On 7 June 2023, in Reconquista (Santa Fe), health workers associated with SIPRUS protested at CAPS B La Loma to demand better salaries, to be transferred to permanent staff and compliance with agreements reached with authorities in the past.
