notes: On 7 June 2023, in San Miguel de Tucuman (Tucuman), health workers associated with SITAS marched to Urquiza Square to demand better salaries and labor conditions and to stop the persecution of labor unions.

Around 7 June 2023 (week of), in Curitiba (Parana), family members and friends of people shot to death during police operations in 2017 and 2022 carried out a protest to demand justice for their cases.

assoc_actor_1: Teachers (Chile); Labor Group (Chile); College of Teachers Union
notes: On 7 June 2023, in Punta Arenas (Los Lagos), unionized teachers and education workers at Industrial School, Magallanes University and several educational facilities gathered at El Ovejero monument and marched towards Armas square demanding the full payment of their salaries. A group of protesters gathered in front of the house of President Boric's parents. The College of Teachers Union participated in the protest.

On 6 June 2023, in El Ceibo, Peten, there was an armed clash between a group of armed men and military and police officers. The security forces were transferring a suspected drug criminal to the local tribunal when a group of 10 cars with armed men turned up and ambushed them. The armed clash was triggered when security forces sought shelter in the military station in the area. As a result of the clash, two armed men were killed and two others, arrested. Police believe that the accomplices of the drug criminal were trying to rescue him. 2 fatalities.

On 6 June 2023, in Retalhuleu, Retalhuleu, armed men on a motorcycle opened fire on another car in a drive-by shooting incident on the road to the Copepe canton. The motivation for the attack is unknown. No more detail was provided by the source. There were no casualties or injured.
Property destruction: Around 6 June 2023 (as reported), in Pamaria, Totonicapan, members of the police forces found and seized 19.122 marijuana bushes.
Property destruction: Around 6 June 2023 (as reported), in Gualan municipality, Zacapa, members of the police forces found, and seized 7.440 marijuana bushes in the woods of Plan Grande area.

Around 6 June 2023 (as reported), in El Chan, Guatemala, rioters tried to set a house on fire of alleged perpetrators of an attack earlier that day (coded separately) and threw a home-made bomb in colonia Las Maravillas. One bystander was injured. No more detail is provided by the source. 1 injured.

On 6 June 2023, in Cayenne, Cayenne, around 50 strikers, mostly teachers and other public workers from the education sector called by a trade union, held a protest against the pension reform. Protests with the same demands were held simultaneously in other parts of French Guiana (coded separately).

On 6 June 2023, in Saint-Laurent-du-Maroni, Saint-Laurent-du-Maroni, around 20 strikers, mostly teachers and other public workers from the education sector called by a trade union, held a protest with banners against the pension reform. Protests with the same demands were held simultaneously in other parts of French Guiana (coded separately).

Around 6 June 2023 (as reported), in Choloma, Cortes, a man was killed and his body was found bound by arms and legs on the banks of a river that runs between the Rubi neighborhood and Concepcion district. The reason for the killing is unknown. 1 fatality.

On 6 June 2023, in Comayaguela, Francisco Morazan, unidentified armed men driving two vehicles shot against a criminal defense lawyer who was part of the legal team of the last president of Honduras, along with a police escort and a mason, as they were leaving the lawyer's residence in the Modelo neighborhood, wounding the lawyer and the police escort. Preliminary police investigations indicated gangs as the main suspects due to previous threats received by the victim and his wife, who had been under protection since 2018. 2 wounded.

On 6 June 2023, in Siguatepeque, Comayagua, a group of employees organized in a union occupied the facilities of the National University of Forestry Sciences (UNACIFOR) in protest. They demanded transparency from the authorities regarding the budget allocated for the position of Vice Chancellor for International Affairs, which had been vacant for four years.
On 6 June 2023, in Choloma, Cortes, a group of residents protested on the northern boulevard due to ongoing electricity shortages affecting their neighborhoods.

On 6 June 2023, in El Durazno, Francisco Morazan, a group of parents of students at the Jose Trinidad Cabanas school protested outside the school demanding the appointment of a teacher for the third grade. The protesters claimed that the authorities at the Ministry of Education have not addressed this issue, causing a delay in providing education to hundreds of students.

assoc_actor_1: Labor Group (Panama); SUNTRACS: Single Union of Construction and Associated Workers
notes: On 6 June 2023, in San Miguelito, Panama, employees of a construction company in charge of building housing facilities in the area staged a protest by blocking the Northern corridor. Demonstrators, including affiliated members with SUNTRACS, demanded that authorities resume the construction of the project, and added that workers fear they might lose their jobs.

On 6 June 2023, in La Chorrera, Panama Oeste, truck drivers, farmers and teachers from the Capira district staged a protest at the regional office of the Ministry of Public Works to demand that authorities build a new road in their district.

On 6 June 2023, in Panama City, Panama, environmental defenders staged a protest at the Ministry of Environment against the gold mining project of a local company in the Quema hill, in de Los Santos province.

On 6 June 2023, in Panama City, Panama, students' members of the Student Reform University Association (AURE) demonstrated on the Transismic road against the high cost of living and in rejection of a new mining contract. Police arrived on site and asked the demonstrators to finish their rally. In response, students threw stones at the police cars that were deployed in the area, who responded by throwing tear gas against them. The Movement for Popular Unity (MUP) participated in the demonstration.

On 6 June 2023, in San Salvador, San Salvador, dozens of people staged a demonstration on the occasion of the World Environment Day. Protesters asked the government to approve measures to guarantee food security in the country, and the end of environmental contamination. Protesters marched from the Cuscatlan Square Park to the Presidential House. Women headed the demonstration. New Dawn Association of El Salvador (ANADES), and Foro del Agua participated in the protest.

On 6 June 2023, in Feijo (Acre), four members of a drug trafficking group invaded a hospital and opened fire against private security agents. On 6 June 2023, outside Horcones (Biobio), fishers protested blocking Route 160 against the non-payment of the full bonus agreed with the Government due to the 'red tide' situation months ago. On 6 June 2023, near Coronel commune (Biobio), residents of Patagual protested blocking La Madera route for the second consecutive day against the burial of sea lions dead of bird flu near the Patagual valley. Protesters stated that authorities have not complied with the deadlines agreed to remove the animals from the area. The burial is taking place near an underground water spring, which is used by them to supply themselves. They fear sanitary and health risks. 13 sea lions were unearthed from Patagual and there are still 187 left.

On 6 June 2023, in Valdivia (Los Rios), parents and students at Juan Sebastian Bach music school protested outside of the educational facilities over several infrastructure deficiencies. Protesters stated that there are problems with bathrooms, windows, leaks, improvement of spaces and an electrical problem. source: OVCS: Observatorio Venezolano de Conflictividad Social
notes: On 6 June 2023, in Monagas state (coded to Maturin), demonstrators protested with unspecified demands on issues related to labor, healthcare, housing, justice, and water.

source: OVCS: Observatorio Venezolano de Conflictividad Social
notes: On 6 June 2023, in Nueva Esparta state (coded to Porlamar), demonstrators protested with unspecified demands on issues related to labor, healthcare, housing, justice, and water.

source: OVCS: Observatorio Venezolano de Conflictividad Social; VPItv
notes: On 6 June 2023, in Trujillo state (coded to Trujillo), a group of teachers protested to demand better pay and working conditions, and the renewal of their collective labor agreement.

source: El Nacional (Venezuela); El Pitazo; Noticia al Minuto
notes: On 6 June 2023, in Maracaibo (Zulia), a group of Yukpa Indigenous people blocked the General Rafael Urdaneta Bridge over Lake Maracaibo with burning tires to demand permission to travel to Caracas to speak with the authorities about their situation in their Sierra de Perija communities, and to demand the authorities to buy their production of artisan objects off them. Traffic was blocked for several hours. Police and military forces were present but there was no intervention. That evening, following negotiations with the security forces, the demonstrators left the area. There were no casualties.
On 6 June 2023, in San Salvador de Jujuy (Jujuy), unionized teachers marched to demand a raise in salaries and to repudiate the reform that seeks to limit the right to protest.

On 6 June 2023, in San Pedro Ayampuc, Guatemala, unidentified attackers shot and injured a couple in colonia Las Maravillas. In addition, a bystander was shot and injured by a stray bullet. The motivation for the attack is unknown. Moments later, rioters tried to set on fire the attackers' house (coded separately). 3 injured.

On 6 June 2023, in La Esperanza, La Paz, there was an armed clash between members of MS-13 gang and police officers. As a result of the clash, one police officer and a gang member were shot and injured. The police officers were in a prevention operation in the area when a group of armed men attacked them. Three gang members were arrested. No more detail is provided by the source. The gang member died later in the hospital. 1 fatality, 1 injured.

assoc_actor_2: Government of Bolivia (2020-); Women (Bolivia); Sumate Alliance
notes: On 6 June 2023, in Cochabamba (Cochabamba), at least 30 supporters of the mayor (Sumate) beat up a woman council member (Sumate) at 14 de Septiembre square, for being a dissident of the mayor's political party, and calling for her resignation. The councilwoman was taken to hospital and treated for her injuries.
tags: crowd size=at least 30; local administrators; women targeted: politicians

notes: Around 6 June 2023 (as reported), in la Playa de Belen (coded to La Playa, Norte de Santander), an unidentified armed group clashed with police forces when the former attempted to attack the local mayor. The attackers opened fire on the mayor's office when the attack was repelled by police. According to other reports, the attack was aimed at police officers. Civilians were caught in the crossfire, as festivities were taking place at the time of the incident. There were no fatalities.

assoc_actor_2: Government of Guatemala (2020-); UCN: National Change Union; Labor Group (Guatemala)
notes: On 6 June 2023, in Gualan, Zapaca, two unidentified attackers shot and killed a municipal trustee in La Estacion neighborhood. The victim, who was elected to serve for the government for the UCN and currently supports VAMOS political party, was in his store when two armed men turned up and shot him dead and injured one of his employees. The motivation for the attack is unknown. No more detail is provided by the source. 1 fatality, 1 injured.

On 6 June 2023, in the rural area of Puerto Asis municipality (Putumayo), an unidentified armed group shot and killed a man in the Perla Amazonica area. The incident is suspected to be related to a social cleansing carried out by an armed group. Although the perpetrators have not been confirmed, the area is known for the presence of the CDF. 1 fatality.
On 6 June 2023, in Santa Ana de Coro (Falcon), residents blocked the Troncal 4 road with tires in protest over fuel scarcity.
On 5 June 2023, in Siquinala, Escuintla, people staged a protest at the height of KM 69.5 of the route CA-02 West to demand that authorities appoint teachers in a local school.
Around 5 June 2023 (as reported), outside Saba Colon, a woman was killed and her body was found burned along the CA-13 highway. The reason for the killing is unknown. 1 fatality.
On 5 June 2023, in Comayaguela, Francisco Morazan, two unidentified armed men shot and killed a man in the Nueva Capital neighborhood. The reason for the killing is unknown. 1 fatality.
On 5 June 2023, in Tegucigalpa, Francisco Morazan, unidentified armed men shot and killed a taxi-driver in the 28 de marzo neighborhood. The reason for the killing is unknown. 1 fatality.

On 5 June 2023, in La Ceiba, Atlantida, a group of peasants protested outside of the city courts demanding the release of a pastor who was arrested during a recent police eviction operation. The arrest was made in connection with the eviction of around 35 families from the Corsa ranch in the community of La Bomba, municipality of Jutiapa, in the department of Atlantida, which took place peacefully after negotiations between police officials and the invaders.

On 5 June 2023, in Comayagua, Comayagua, a group of supporters of the Liberty and Refoundation Party (LIBRE) occupied the facilities of the regional health office to protest and demand the dismissal of personnel affiliated with the National Party of Honduras (PNH). They specifically called for the removal of the legal representative and the head of human resources of the state institution.

On 5 June 2023, in Quebrada de Arena, Colon, a group of residents blocked the CA-13 highway to protest against the installation of a municipal landfill in their area, citing concerns about environmental pollution and health risks.

On 5 June 2023, in Omoa, Cortes, for the second consecutive day, a group of residents of the Tegucigalpita village blocked traffic on a bridge in the area to protest against frequent power outages. They demanded that the authorities of the National Electric Energy Company (ENEE) and the Honduran Energy Company (EEH) resolve this issue, which has resulted in damaged appliances and financial losses.

On 5 June 2023, in San Pedro Sula, Cortes, a group of residents of the Bosques de Jucutuma neighborhood protested against ongoing power outages they have been experiencing for the past three months. The residents also complained about damages to their appliance and threatened to continue protesting in other parts of the city if authorities do not provide a prompt solution.
On 5 June 2023, in Quebrada Ancha, Colon, people - mostly women - staged a protest to demand authorities the provision of drinking water service in the area.
On 5 June 2023, in Maria Chiquita, Colon, people staged a protest to demand that authorities begin the construction of the road in the area of Quebrada Lopez.
On 5 June 2023, in Zacatecoluca, La Paz, students staged a demonstration on the occasion of the World Environment Day and demanded the protection of the environment.

Around 5 June 2023 (week of), in Kwamalasamutu, Sipaliwini), indigenous peoples from the Trio de Kwamalasamutu community held a protest against the national government. Protesters decried the marginalization of indigenous peoples, among other claims.

assoc_actor_1: Women (Argentina); LGBTQ+ (Argentina); Labor Group (Argentina); Not One [Woman] Less (Argentina)
notes: On 5 June 2023, in La Plata - Central (Buenos Aires), women members of the Not One Less movement, members of the LGBTQ+ community, and members of political and labor union organizations marched from Moreno Square to the municipality to protest against gender-based violence. This was part of nationwide demonstrations.

On 5 June 2023, in Saladillo (Buenos Aires), relatives of a victim of femicide marched from the Functional Instruction and Trial Unit to the municipality to demand justice for the victim. The woman was killed by her co-worker, who had been harassing her, at her workplace on 1 June.
On 5 June 2023, in Rada Tilly (Chubut), unionized municipal workers demonstrated in one of the city's access points to demand better salaries.

On 5 June 2023, in Cordoba (Cordoba), unionized workers at the Argentinian Planes Factory (FADEA) held a protest outside and inside the premises of the company to demand better salaries and working conditions. They also protested against the non-compliance of the company with agreements that had been reached earlier in 2023 and against a reduction in the company's production. Members of the Aeronautical Personnel Association (APA) and the Air Worker's Union (STA) participated in the protest.

On 5 June 2023, in San Salvador de Jujuy (Jujuy), teachers marched to city hall to demand a raise in salaries and rejected the new salary proposal made by the provincial government. They also repudiated a reform that seeks to limit the right to protest. Protesters reported intimidation by the police.

On 5 June 2023, in San Rafael (Mendoza), a group of people blocked the San Martin and Telles Meneses intersection to demand the approval of a law that would implement the payment of salaries for workers at community kitchens around the country.

On 5 June 2023, in Salta (Salta), teachers and health workers protested in four different sectors of the city to demand a raise in salaries and new salary negotiations with authorities. They also repudiated the law approved by the provincial legislature that limit the right to protest. Social and political organizations also participated in the demonstrations in support of the teachers and health workers.
On 5 June 2023, in Salta (Salta), municipal workers demonstrated on Paraguay Avenue in front of the municipal Civic Center to demand a raise in salaries and salary negotiations.

On 5 June 2023, in Villa Media Agua (San Juan), parents and students at the Sarmiento Agrotechnical School protested outside the premises of the institution against the overcrowding of students. They said that 600 students attend the school but the building only has a capacity for 200, therefore, some students have to take their classes outside or take turns to do so. They also protested against the lack of electricity in an area of the school, poor infrastructure conditions and the lack of teachers and cleaning personnel.

On 5 June 2023, in Cochabamba (Cochabamba), residents of the ThiKa Katu Base Territorial Organization (OTB) blocked the bridges on Ecologica and Circunvalacion avenues as a demonstration to demand the maintenance of a road that has been pending for more than 10 years.

On 5 June 2023, in Tiquipaya (Cochabamba), residents marched through the city as a demonstration to voice their concern about the lack of potable water systems they have to receive water from the new Misicuni damn.

On 5 June 2023, in El Alto (La Paz), residents and representatives of the Neighborhood Boards Federations (FEJUVE) blocked the entrance of the city as a demonstration to reject the unilateral increase of the public transport fares.

On 5 June 2023, in La Paz (La Paz), health workers of the Oil Health Fund (CPS) blocked 20 de Octubre avenue and the entrance of Obrajes hospital as a demonstration to demand the dismissal of the National Director of the hospital.

On 5 June 2023, in Santa Cruz de la Sierra (Santa Cruz), unionized merchants staged a demonstration outside the Quinta Municipal building to demand authorities control informal merchants that are using public spaces in markets to sell their products.

On 5 June 2023, in Puerto Suarez (Santa Cruz), unionized workers members of the Industrial Technicians in Petroleum Construction in Bolivia blocked the Bioceanic highway near Punta de Carretera sector as a demonstration to demand work improvements in the Mutun Steel Plant. They also demanded unitary prices to be implemented and the hiring of local workers for the project.

On 5 June 2023, in Canapi (Alagoas), a man was shot to death in a drive-by shooting in the Mutirao neighborhood by armed suspects who approached the victim in a motorcycle and opened fire, killing him. The suspects fled after the attack. The victim was a city councilman's brother. The motivation behind the attack and its perpetrators are unknown. 1 fatality.

On 5 June 2023, in Maceio (Alagoas), a man was shot to death in the Santa Lucia neighborhood by unknown shooters. He was shot five times, three times in the head. The victim was a drug user and had unspecified criminal records. The motivation behind the attack and its perpetrators are unknown. 1 fatality.

actor1: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
notes: On 5 June 2023, in Macapa (Amapa), members of a drug trafficking group exchanged fire with military police in the Jardim Marco Zero neighborhood. One local drug trafficking leader was killed. 1 fatality.

On 5 June 2023, in Macapa (Amapa), a man was injured in a drive-by shooting in the Mestre Oscar housing complex by armed individuals in a car. There are no reports on the identity of the perpetrators or the attack's motivation.

On 5 June 2023, in Colatina (Espirito Santo), an adolescent was shot and injured in the Ayrton Senna neighborhood by an armed individual. Five people involved in the attempt were arrested, and they were also charged with drug trafficking. Attack motivation is unknown.

On 5 June 2023, in Sao Luis (Maranhao), a non-specified group of people carried out a demonstration blocking the MA-201 highway, near Sao Joao river by setting different objects on fire repudiating the running over of a child a few days earlier. Military police were present but no intervention was reported.

On 5 June 2023, in Sao Luis (Maranhao), a non-specified group of people staged a demonstration by blocking the BR-135 highway, 1,5 Km. Demonstrators were demanding better infrastructure and intervention from the local administration to Vila Itamar and Recanto Verde neighborhoods. Among other demands, demonstrators were demanding a better health care center, better public and school transportation.

On 5 June 2023, in Cuiaba (Mato Grosso), a man was abducted from the Jardim Florianopolis neighborhood by four members of the CV. The victim was forced into a car and taken to a stream between the Ouro Fino and Serra Dourada neighborhoods, where he was tortured and injured due to a drug debt. The victim was rescued by police.

On 5 June 2023, in Belo Horizonte (Minas Gerais), health workers gathered in front of a hospital to protest against changes in their schedule. The protesters claim shift hours increased without increase in pay.

assoc_actor_1: MAB: Movement of People Affected by Dams
source: Brasil de Fato; Estado de Minas
notes: On 5 June 2023, in Belo Horizonte (Minas Gerais), hundreds of MAB members gathered in front of a Courthouse to protest against an appeal filed by a mining company regarding settlement payment to people affected by dam collapses.

assoc_actor_2: Former Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
notes: On 5 June 2023, in Teofilo Otoni (Minas Gerais), a former military officer was killed in a drive-by shooting in the Joaquim Pedrosa neighborhood by two armed individuals on a motorcycle. The victim was expelled from the military years prior due to drug trafficking charges. There are no reports on the identity of the perpetrators. 1 fatality.

On 5 June 2023, in Belem (Para), an armed individual in a car opened fire against three people in the Reduto neighborhood in a drive-by shooting. One person from the group fired back. There were no fatalities.

On 5 June 2023, in Congo (Paraiba), a woman was choked to death and had signs of sexual violence. Two suspects were arrested accused of being involved in the attack. Both the victim and the suspects had links with drugs. One of the perpetrators claim that he was forced under duress by an organized criminal group to kill the woman, but this is not confirmed. 1 fatality.

assoc_actor_1: Pankararu Indigenous Group (Brazil); Xucuru Kariri Indigenous Group (Brazil); Indigenous Group (Brazil)
notes: On 5 June 2023, in Recife (Pernambuco), a non-specified group of Indigenous people, including members of the Xucuru Cariri, Pankararu, and Fulnio communities, gathered at Praca do Derby to carry out a demonstration by marching through the city repudiating a bill that was going to be voted in the Federal Supreme Court about Indigenous territories delimitation. The demonstration took place in a day of protest with the same demands in different cities of the country.

On 5 June 2023, in Recife (Pernambuco), a non-specified group of people gathered to carry out a demonstration in the Pina neighborhood by marching towards Herculano Bandeiram Av., repudiating the killing of a woman and a girl days before in a shoot-out that too place in the neighborhood (coded separately), demanding justice to clarify the case, and calling for more security in their neighborhood.

actor2: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
notes: On 5 June 2023, in Rio de Janeiro - North Zone (Rio de Janeiro), armed suspects exchanged fire with military police during an operation in the Chapadao Complex. One man was injured. Police seized a rifle, a pistol, and drugs.

source: Crimes News RJ; Informe Agora; OTT-RJ
notes: On 5 June 2023, in Rio de Janeiro - North Zone (Rio de Janeiro), Red Command members exchanged fire with the Pure Third Command in in the Morro do Campinho and Morro do Fuba communities in the Campinho neighborhood. Unknown casualties.

On 5 June 2023, in Rio de Janeiro - North Zone (Rio de Janeiro), unknown shooters exchanged fire in the Quintino Bocaiuva neighborhood and the Morro do Urubu community in the Piedade neighborhood. Unknown casualties.

actor2: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
notes: On 5 June 2023, in Rio de Janeiro - West Zone (Rio de Janeiro), armed suspects exchanged fire with military police in the Chacrinha community, Praca Seca neighborhood. Three suspects were killed, and a fourth suspect was injured. Police seized a rifle, two pistols, and two grenades. 3 fatalities.

source: G1; Globo Extra; Informe Agora; O Sao Goncalo
notes: On 5 June 2023, in Rio de Janeiro - West Zone (Rio de Janeiro), at least two armed suspects captured two men, tied them up, and shot them to death in the Gardenia Azul neighborhood. The neighborhood is the site of a territorial contest between two armed groups and is primarily controlled by the Red Command. 2 fatalities.

actor2: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
notes: On 5 June 2023, in Rio de Janeiro - West Zone (Rio de Janeiro), military police officers exchanged fire with the Red Command in the Bateau Mouche community, Praca Seca neighborhood. One suspect was shot and killed. 1 fatality.
On 5 June 2023, in Rio de Janeiro - West Zone (Rio de Janeiro), unknown shooters exchanged fire in the Vila Valqueire neighborhood. Unknown casualties.

actor1: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
notes: Property destruction: On 5 June 2023, in Andradina (Sao Paulo), military highway police seized 2,3 tons of marijuana from a truck on the Marechal Rondon highway (SP-300). The driver was arrested for drug trafficking.

On 5 June 2023, in Lorena (Sao Paulo), unknown perpetrators shot and killed a man in the Santo Antonio neighborhood. The victim had a history of drug trafficking and a small amount of marijuana. 1 fatality.

actor2: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
notes: On 5 June 2023, in Santos (Sao Paulo), armed suspects on a motorcycle exchanged fire with military police during a vehicle chase after disobeying a stop order in the Castelo neighborhood. One suspect was killed, and another was injured. 1 fatality.

On 5 June 2023, in Palmas (Tocantins), a man was killed in a drive-by shooting in the Jardim Aureny I neighborhood by two armed individuals on a motorcycle. The deceased had a police record (charges not reported) and portions of drugs were found with him. There are no reports on the identity of the perpetrators. 1 fatality.

On 5 June 2023, near Coronel commune (Biobio), about 20 residents from Patagual protested blocking La Madera route against the burial of sea lions dead of bird flu near the Patagual valley. Protesters stated that despite reaching an agreement with authorities, the removal of the dead animals has not happened. The burial is taking place near an underground water spring, which is used by them to supply themselves with water. They fear serious sanitary and health risks.

On 5 June 2023, in Panguipulli (Los Rios), nearly 100 unionized teachers marched through the streets in protest against the non-compliance with a series of demands over working conditions. Protesters stated that there is a lack of replacement teachers and the need of contract regularization in addition to lack of supplies and materials, among others. Teachers began an indefinite strike. The College of Teachers Union organized the march.

assoc_actor_1: ANFUP: National Association of Penitentiary Officials; Police Forces of Chile (2022-) Prison Guards
notes: On 5 June 2023, in Valparaiso (Valparaiso), unionized prison guards with ANFUP erected incendiary barricades outside of the Valparaiso Penitentiary Complex demanding improvements in mental health treatments. This event takes place in the context of the suicide of a 20-year-old prison guard three days ago. Director of the union stated that workers also demand better working conditions regarding labor journey and infrastructure.

On 5 June 2023, in Vina del Mar (Valparaiso), residents from Miraflores protested blocking the Uno North avenue near Miraflores square against illegal occupations in the neighborhood. Protesters stated that those occupations have increased insecurity. They argued that shootings and fireworks have taken over the streets and some neighbors have been attacked by illegal occupants of property in the Abetos sector.

Around 5 June 2023 (as reported), in the rural area of La Pedrera (Amazonas), a health worker and health promoter for the Indigenous community Curare was killed. His body was found floating in a river. There are no further details on the attack or potential perpetrators, but the area is known for the presence of armed groups. 1 fatality.

On 5 June 2023, in Barranquilla (Atlantico), about 500 people physically assaulted a teacher accused of sexually abusing a minors in the Meisel neighborhood. Police forces intervened to take the man away, prompting a clash between rioters and officers.
On 5 June 2023, in Galapa (Atlantico), citizens blocked the La Cordialidad highway to protest against Aguacaribe and a water cut that has been going on for more than a week.

source: El Tiempo (Colombia); INDEPAZ; UNOCHA; W Radio
notes: Around 5 June 2023 (as reported), in the rural area of El Tambo municipality (Cauca), a social leader and his wife were killed and their bodies found near the El Hoyo and Navarro sector. The victims had been reported missing on 31 May after leaving their home to go to work. The victim was a teacher at a school in Pueblo Nuevo and a member of several social organizations in the area. The bodies of two other people were found in the same grave, but the victims have not been identified. Although the perpetrators have not been confirmed, the area is known for the presence of armed groups. 4 fatalities.

assoc_actor_2: Unidentified Communal Group (Colombia); JAC: Council of Communal Action
source: El Tiempo (Colombia); INDEPAZ; UNOCHA; W Radio
notes: Around 5 June 2023 (as reported), in the rural area of La Vega municipality (Cauca), a social leader was stabbed to death and his body was found near the Los Uvos sector. The victim was a member of the JAC of the Villa Nueva Paraiso neighborhood in Sucre (Cauca). His body also had multiple signs of torture. Although the perpetrators have not been confirmed, the area is known for the presence of armed groups. 1 fatality.

On 5 June 2023, in the rural area of Tucurinca municipality (Magdalena), a group of truckers and drivers blocked the Troncal del Oriente highway to protest against the large number of speed cameras on this road. The protesters claim that the cameras do not reflect the reality of the speed limits, causing them significant economic losses due to the increasing number of fines.

On 5 June 2023, in Cucuta - North (Norte de Santander), an ELN militant shot and killed a man working at a pet store in the Brisas del Norte neighborhood. Two other members of the same family were killed on 7 February (coded separately) and 26 February (coded separately). The family was displaced from their residency in El Zulia following threats from the armed group. 1 fatality.

assoc_actor_2: Police Forces of Colombia (2022-) UNP: National Unit for Protection
notes: Around 5 June 2023 (as reported), in Tibu municipality (Norte de Santander), unidentified armed individuals abducted a member of the UNP while the victim was off duty at his home. The victim's whereabouts are still unknown. Although the perpetrators have not been confirmed, the area is known for the presence of armed groups.

On 5 June 2023, in Quito - Eugenio Espejo (Pichincha), family members and friends of a woman that has been missing for five years staged a demonstration outside the state attorney offices to demand a faster investigation of the woman's whereabouts.

assoc_actor_1: ANR-PC: National Republican Association - Colorado Party; Government of Paraguay (2013-)
notes: On 5 June 2023, in Salto del Guaira (Canindeyu), around 5,000 people marched throughout the city over environmental concerns to demand higher compensation to the Itaipu Binational Hydroelectric Plant for the disappearance of seven waterfalls. The construction of the plant caused the disappearance of the waterfalls in 1984 and even though a compensation law was approved, demonstrators claimed that it is not enough compared to what other cities have received. They also demanded the inclusion of a compensation section in the Itaipu treaty. Two ANR-PC councilmen and other councilmen of the municipal and departmental government participated in the demonstration.

On 5 June 2023, in Arequipa (Arequipa), residents of Pachacutec sector in Cerro Colorado district captured, stripped of his clothes and beat up a man that they accused of a recent robbery. Police officers later rescued the man and took him to a police station.

On 5 June 2023, in Arequipa (Arequipa), residents of Mariano Melgar district staged a demonstration for the second consecutive day outside the Jerusalen police station to voice their grievances about police officers rescuing a man accused of robbery the previous day without letting them punish him.

On 5 June 2023, in Ica (Ica), hundreds of residents of Vivienda Digna sector, in Tierra Prometida, marched through the city as a demonstration to voice their concern about the mayor denying their land deeds that several families have been waiting for close to a decade.

On 5 June 2023, in Huancayo (Junin), residents staged a demonstration outside the SATH (Huancayo Tax Administration Service) offices to demand the resignation of the entity manager for alleged irregularities and for not having the required profile for the position. The demonstrators brought a donkey, which they say represented the mayor.

On 5 June 2023, in Ciudad Guayana (Bolivar), a group of workers at the Sural CA company, producer of electrical conductors and inactive for the past six years, and unionists, protested after the announcement of its new owners of suspending food ticket payments. Colombian investors acquired the company recently, and announced that operations would restart promptly, however, these haven't resumed yet. The protesters gathered outside the Labor Inspectorate Office, where they filed an appeal.

actor1: Police Forces of Venezuela (1999-) CPNB: National Bolivarian Police
source: Diario Primicia; El Cooperante; El Diario de Guayana
notes: On 5 June 2023, in Ciudad Bolivar (Bolivar), PNB police forces shot and killed two members of the El Brayli gang, including their leader, during an armed clash in the Venezuela neighborhood, Marhuanta parish. The suspects resisted authority and initiated the shooting. They were injured in the gunfire and pronounced dead in hospital. The deceased were thought to be the perpetrators of the killing of a Bolivar state police officer in December 2022 (coded separately), and were linked to extortion threats. Police collected two guns and a grenade. 2 fatalities.

On 5 June 2023, in Valencia (Carabobo), a group of demonstrators, including health and education sector workers, and other state workers, protested to demand better pay and working conditions, observance of their collective labor agreements, and payment of owed food tickets and other stipends. The protesters gathered by the Chamber of Commerce and then marched to the seat of the Carabobo state government, where they handed in a letter with their demands. Police were present but there was no intervention.

On 5 June 2023, in Caracas - Libertador (Distrito Capital), a group of former workers of the National Assembly, laid off in 2021, protested to demand the reinstatement of 220 of them, as per the March 2022 ruling of the Labor Inspectorate Office. Over 1000 workers were laid off in total. The protesters gathered outside the Labor Ministry Office.
On 5 June 2023, in Churuguara (Falcon), a group of residents protested over ongoing water outages, outside the townhall. GNB military forces were present but there was no intervention.

On 5 June 2023, in Miranda municipality (coded to Carazao, Falcon), a group of fishers and residents of Rio Seco blocked the Troncal 3 road in protest to demand compensation from the state-owned PDVSA oil company for the numerous oil spills that have taken place in the Gulf of Coro. These spills affect fisheries and the environment.

On 5 June 2023, in Caracas - Baruta (Miranda), a group of transport workers blocked the Hoyo de la Puerta road in protest over the poor state of it, and to demand its paving. Traffic was blocked for several hours.
On 5 June 2023, in Los Teques (Miranda), a group of teachers protested to demand better pay and working conditions, and the renewal of their collective labor agreement.

On 5 June 2023, in Caucaguita (Miranda), an unspecified number of unidentified crime group suspects shot and killed two men during a party, in an attack in the La I sector. Witnesses claim the victims were intercepted by several armed men who without further interaction opened fire at them. They were shot in their faces at least ten times each. Motivations for the attack are unknown. There is no further information at this point in time. 2 fatalities.

On 5 June 2023, in San Cristobal (Tachira), a group of medical students at the Los Andes University (ULA) protested against the closing of the auditorium of the San Cristobal Central Hospital, where they used to attend class. This decision came from the hospital's management. Going forward the auditorium will only host official events. The protest was staged outside the San Cristobal Central Hospital.

source: Diario Version Final (Venezuela); El Pitazo; Noticia al Minuto
notes: On 5 June 2023, in Maracaibo (Zulia), for the second consecutive day, a group of approximately 60 Yukpa Indigenous people blocked the Maracaibo bus station to demand permission to travel to Caracas to speak with the authorities about their situation in their Sierra de Perija communities, and to demand the authorities to buy their production of artisan objects off them. Some tires were burned, and a few rocks were thrown at the buses parked inside. That evening, following negotiations with the authorities, the demonstrators left the area. There were no casualties.
On 5 June 2023, in Lomas de Zamora (Buenos Aires), more than 700 teachers protested to repudiate a violent attack by rioters on 31 May (coded separately) against kindergarten teachers at two schools.

Around 5 June 2023 (as reported), in the rural area of Olaya Herrera municipality (Narino), there was a clash between two unidentified armed groups. As a result, 400 Afro-Colombian people were forcibly displaced to the municipal seat. Casualties unknown.

On 5 June 2023, in Santa Lucia (Canelones), around 80 friends and family of a man who died after being sent home by a doctor in a suspected case of medical malpractice protested to demand justice in front of the hospital the deceased had gone to. They also demanded the resignation of the director and sub-director of the hospital.

assoc_actor_2: Government of Colombia (2022-); PLC: Colombian Liberal Party
notes: Around 5 June 2023 (as reported), in Santa Rita (Choco), unidentified armed individuals threw a grenade at the residence of the current mayor and member of the PLC. The victim was not in the premises at the time of the incident, but the explosion caused several damages to the house. Although the perpetrators have not been confirmed, the area is known for the presence of armed groups. There were no fatalities.

source: Abra Noticias; Comision Intereclesial de Justicia y Paz
notes: On 5 June 2023, in the rural area of Puerto Asis municipality (Putumayo), two men were killed in two separate incidents. In the El Baldio vereda, two men on motorcycles shot and killed a resident in a drive-by shooting. Meanwhile, in El Quebradon vereda, unidentified armed individuals broke into the victim's house and shot him dead. Although the perpetrators have not been confirmed, the area is known for the Carolina Ramirez FARC dissident faction and the CDF. 2 fatalities.

On 4 June 2023, in El Progreso, Yoro, four unidentified armed men shot and killed a member of the Los Aguacates gang in front of a hotel. The reason for the killing and the identity of the perpetrators is unknown. 1 fatality.

On 4 June 2023, in Omoa, Cortes, a group of residents of the Tegucigalpita village blocked traffic on a bridge in the area to protest against frequent power outages. They demanded that the authorities of the National Electric Energy Company (ENEE) and the Honduran Energy Company (EEH) resolve this issue, which has resulted in damaged appliances and financial losses.

On 4 June 2023, in Tegucigalpa, Francisco Morazan, a group of residents of the Centroamerica Oeste neighborhood blocked traffic and burned tires on the Fuerzas Armadas Boulevard in demonstration against shortages in water supply for the past six days. The residents complained that the shortage has also affected other neighborhoods in the capital.

On 4 June 2023, in Limon, Colon, two unidentified attackers shot and killed a man and injured a pre candidate for the Democratic Revolutionary Party. The report states that the victims were in the street when the attackers turned up and opened fire. The motivation for the attack is unknown. No more detail is provided by the source. 1 fatality, 1 injured.

On 4 June 2023, in Trelew (Chubut), residents marched to protest against animal cruelty after cases of dismemberment of dogs and cats were reported in the city. They also demanded the creation of a special unit to investigate these cases, the implementation of the Animal Cruelty Law, and justice.

Three suspects of the attack, two of whom were minors, were later arrested and drugs and weapons were seized with them. The suspects were arrested on homicide and drug trafficking charges. The motivation behind the attack is unknown. 1 fatality.

Around 4 June 2023 (as reported), in Maceio (Alagoas), a man was shot and his body was found by military police officers in the Tabuleiro do Martins neighborhood. The victim was attacked by two armed suspects who opened fire against the victim shooting him in the back of his head. Witnesses stated the perpetrators arrived on a motorcycle. The motivation behind the attack and its perpetrators are unknown. 1 fatality.

On 4 June 2023, in Macapa (Amapa), a man was shot and killed in the Novo Buritizal neighborhood by two armed individuals who chased after him. Authorship and motivation of the attack are unknown. 1 fatality.

notes: On 4 June 2023, in Sao Paulo - North Zone (Sao Paulo), a group formed of more than 200 representatives of 16 Indigenous ethnic groups, including the Guarani Mbya Indigenous community held a protest on km 20 of the Bandeirantes highway near the Pirituba region. They resisted the approval of Bill 490, which weakens the demarcation of Indigenous lands and could make further demarcation unviable. Unions, social movements, and political leaders from the Workers' Party (PT) were present. Sympathizers to the cause took the opportunity to express broader discontent with the state and city governments. A court decision prohibited the protest and a 20,000 reais fine was imposed. Military police physically dispersed the protest.

Around 4 June 2023 (as reported), in the rural are of Morales municipality (Bolivar), a man was killed and his body found in the rural area. A driver who had gotten into a discussion with protesters, who would not let him through, ran over the group of demonstrators injuring two of them. The driver was arrested but released shortly after. Around 3 June 2023 (as reported), in Villa Fiorito (Buenos Aires), residents blocked the Baradero highway setting tires on fire because they had spent eight days without electricity service.

On 3 June 2023, in Saladillo (Buenos Aires), relatives of a victim of femicide marched to 25 de Mayo Square to demand justice for the victim. The woman was killed by her co-worker, who had been harassing her at work on 1 June.

On 3 June 2023, in Puerto Madryn (Chubut), women members of the Not One Less movement demonstrated in San Martin Square against gender-based violence and demanded justice for femicide victims. Around 3 June 2023 (as reported), in Galapa (Atlantico), citizens blocked the La Cordialidad highway to protest against Aguacaribe and a water cut that has been going on for more than 5 days.

Around 3 June 2023 (as reported), in Playa Rica (Santa Rosa del Sur, Bolivar), a man was killed and his body found near Playa Rica corregimiento. It is suspected to be a case of social cleansing by an unidentified armed group, as near the body it was a sign stating that the man was killed for extorting money from residents, selling drugs and supporting paramilitary groups. Although the perpetrators have not been confirmed, the area is known for the presence of armed groups. 1 fatality.

Around 3 June 2023 (weekend of), in the rural area of Silvia municipality (Cauca), unidentified armed individuals killed an Indigenous person when a group arrived in the area to verify ongoing clashes between two armed groups in Asnenga vereda (coded separately). There are no further details on the attack or possible perpetrators. 1 fatality.

actor1: FARC Dissident - 19th Front: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia Dissident Faction (19th Front)
notes: Around 3 June 2023 (as reported), in Maicao municipality (La Guajira), suspected members of the 19th front of the FARC intercepted a car carrying seven female teachers and four underage students, stole the occupants' belongings and sexually abused a girl.
On 3 June 2023, in Ibague (Tolima), thousands of people protested to demand the protection of the department's natural resources and water resources.

On 3 June 2023, in Ambato (Tungurahua), parents of a woman that was sexually assaulted by a police officer staged a demonstration in the Communitarian Vigilance Unit (UVC) to demand justice in the case and punishment of the responsible.

On 3 June 2023, in Ciudad del Este (Alto Parana), protesters marched to demand a ban of people accused of sexual abuse against minors to be elected for office. They particularly referred to the cases of an elected senator and an elected councilman who are being investigated for sexually abusing girls. They also demanded more public policies to prevent these crimes and the implementation of sexual education in schools. The demonstration took place in the context of the National Day to Combat Sexual Abuse and Exploitation of Children and Teenagers.

On 3 June 2023, in Asuncion (Asuncion), protesters marched to Juan E. O'Leary Square to demand that people accused of sexual abuse against minors are not allowed to be elected for office. They particularly referred to the cases of an elected senator and an elected councilman who are being investigated for sexually abusing girls. They also demanded more public policies to prevent these crimes and the implementation of sexual education in schools. The demonstration took place in the context of the National Day to Combat Sexual Abuse and Exploitation of Children and Teenagers.

On 3 June 2023, in Encarnacion (Itapua), protesters marched to demand that people accused of sexual abuse against minors are not allowed to be elected for office. They particularly referred to the cases of an elected senator and an elected councilman who are being investigated for sexually abusing girls. They also demanded more public policies to prevent these crimes and the implementation of sexual education in schools. The demonstration took place in the context of the National Day to Combat Sexual Abuse and Exploitation of Children and Teenagers.

On 3 June 2023, in Tarma (Junin), dozens of parents of students of San Martin de Porras school staged a demonstration outside the UGEL offices to demand the return of the teaching position for the sports teacher.

On 3 June 2023, in Punchana (Loreto), residents of different human settlements staged a demonstration in Apoblapil sector to demand the Loreto Regional Government to deliver the sand they need to carry out the ground leveling projects that are still pending.

On 3 June 2023, in San Francisco (Zulia), for the second consecutive day, a group of Yukpa Indigenous people camped outside the La Coromoto PNB police station in protest to demand permission to travel to Caracas to speak with the authorities about their situation in their Sierra de Perija communities, and to demand the authorities to buy their production of artisan objects off them. The protesters argued that the police had compromised to buy their products, worth around 90,000 USD, but then failed to do so.

On 3 June 2023, in the rural area of El Diviso corregimiento (Narino), an Awa Indigenous man, a member of the Indigenous Guard, was injured by the detonation of a landmine planted by an unidentified armed group inside the Gran Sabalo Indigenous Reserve in El Verde sector. The area is known for the presence of armed groups. There were no fatalities.

actor1: FARC Dissident: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia Dissident Faction
notes: Around 3 June 2023 (as reported), in the rural area of Duitama municipality (Boyaca), suspected militants of a dissident faction of the FARC threw a grenade at a truck belonging to a company that refused to pay extortion money to the armed group. There were no fatalities.

actor1: FARC Dissident: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia Dissident Faction
notes: Around 3 June 2023 (as reported), in San Antonio (Tolima), unidentified armed individuals opened fire on three people in a drive-by shooting, wounding two and killing another. Authorities stated that the incident may be related to a pamphlet by a dissident faction of the FARC calling for a curfew and social cleansing. 1 fatality.

On 2 June 2023, in Israel, Quiche, members of Mayan indigenous communities, accompanied by community leaders demonstrated against the local mayor who made electoral promises to make people sign-up for his political party. A group of rioters held a driver and a machinery that was on his way to Machaquila, Peten. Rioters demanded the local mayor to comply with his promises, such as a dozen chickens to women and a nixtamal windmill to men who vote for him. Demonstrators said that they held the machinery and the driver until the mayor turns up.

actor2: Police Forces of France (2017-) French Guiana
notes: Non-violent activity: Around 2 June 2023 (as reported), in Cayenne, Cayenne, at least three armed individuals, described as members of an 'urban guerilla', set up barricades (nature unknown) and blocked the entrance to the Mont-Lucas neighborhood. The motivation for the action is unknown. 25 police intervened (methods unknown) and arrested them.

On 2 June 2023, in Saint-Laurent-du-Maroni, Saint-Laurent-du-Maroni, teachers, members of the educative community, and associations held a protest in front of the Paul-Jean Louis School against armed violence targeting the Vampires neighborhood. The protest was held a day after a former school student was shot and killed by a minor.

Property destruction: On 2 June 2023, outside Patuca, Olancho, military forces seized over 64,000 individual coca plantations spread over 5.6 hectares of land in a mountainous area in the sector of the Microcuenca Apacilagua.
On 2 June 2023, in Baracoa, Cortes, a group of residents staged a protest demanding the repair of embankments, the construction of a bridge, and an end to the power outages.

On 2 June 2023, in Cofradia, Cortes, a group of parents of students at the Osman Edilberto Marquez educational center protested demanding the appointment of teachers. The protesters claimed that the authorities of the Ministry of Education have not addressed this issue, causing delays in providing education to hundreds of students.

assoc_actor_1: Labor Group (Argentina); STIA: Union of Food Industries Workers; Fishers (Argentina)
notes: On 2 June 2023, in Puerto Madryn (Chubut), workers at the Greciamar fishing company associated with STIA protested outside the company's facilities to demand the continuation of temporary jobs created during the prawn season. They said that every year during that time of the year 300 temporary jobs are awarded but they required for them to be permanent.

On 2 June 2023, in La Plata - Central (Buenos Aires), a multitude of women members of the Not One Less movement, including members of the LGBTQ+ community, marched from Moreno to San Martin Square to protest against violence against women, femicides and to demand a judicial reform that properly addresses gendered-violence.

On 2 June 2023, in Ezeiza (Buenos Aires), around 50 people, residents of the Esteban Echavarria municipality, blocked Ricchieri Avenue at the Trebol Bridge and set tires on fire to demand solutions regarding the insecurity in the municipality. They also claimed that there have been intimidations and aggressions by the police but did not specify. Police officers were present but did not intervene. They demanded the presence of the Ministry of security as well.

On 2 June 2023, in Colomi (Cochabamba), residents captured and beat up two police officers who were in the city carrying out a control operative for illegal cars. During the attack of the residents, a police officer took out his gun, shot once to the air and a second time to the ground. The second shot hit a resident and injured him, which caused the people to become even more angered. The officers were beat up and their belongings taken. Three residents were arrested including the resident injured by the gun shot
On 2 June 2023, in Montero (Santa Cruz), workers at Fassil bank blocked La Amistad bridge as a demonstration to demand payment of their owned salaries and workers benefits.

On 2 June 2023, in Parotani (Cochabamba), residents and transportation workers at Valle Bajo sector blocked Parotani bridge with rocks, sticks, tires, and other objects as a demonstration to voice their concerns about the cut in the oil pipeline of the Bolivian Fiscal Oilfields (YPFB) that could affect and close the Itapaya gas station, which is the only one in the sector.

assoc_actor_1: MAS-IPSP: Movement for Socialism-Political Instrument for the Sovereignty of the Peoples
notes: On 2 June 2023, in La Paz (La Paz), around 150 supporters of Movement for Socialism (MAS) entered the Human Rights Permanent Assembly (APDHB) offices, removed all of the workers, and took control of the offices as a demonstration claiming that they were the real owners of the institution.

On 2 June 2023, in Villa Yapacani (Santa Cruz), for the third consecutive day, residents of Faja Norte sector marched through the city and then blocked the bridge over the river as a demonstration to demand the department government to five the sectorial and financing prioritization document for the maintenance of Faja Norte - Yapacani highway.

actor1: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
notes: On 2 June 2023, in Nova Andradina (Mato Grosso do Sul), a journalist was chased after, beaten up, and injured by four military police officers. The officers were not wearing uniforms, but claimed to be on-duty (undercover). The group accused the journalist of placing signs across the city celebrating the resignation of a military commander. The officers also illegally searched the victim's car. The victim believes the attack was motivated by his profession, since his area of work is focused on public security and criminality. An investigation of the case was requested.

actor2: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
source: Crimes News RJ; G1; Informe Agora; OTT-RJ; R7

One police officer was shot and killed, and another was severely injured. Three suspects were killed. One suspect was arrested. A demonstration followed nearby (coded separately). 3 fatalities.

actor2: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
notes: On 2 June 2023, in Resende (Rio de Janeiro), armed suspects linked to drug trafficking exchanged fire with military police in the Baixada Olaria neighborhood. Two suspects were arrested, and police seized a firearm, marijuana, crack, and cocaine. There were no fatalities.

actor2: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
notes: On 2 June 2023, in Rio de Janeiro - North Zone (Rio de Janeiro), armed suspects exchanged fire with military police in the Para-Pedro community, Colegio neighborhood. One civilian was killed, and a demonstration followed (coded separately). Police seized a radio communicator and drugs. Elsewhere, armed suspects exchanged fire with military police in the Lins Complex. At least 1 fatality.

actor2: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
notes: On 2 June 2023, in Rio de Janeiro - West Zone (Rio de Janeiro), armed suspects exchanged fire with military police in the Cidade de Deus neighborhood. Unknown casualties.
On 2 June 2023, in Rio de Janeiro - South Zone (Rio de Janeiro), unknown shooters exchanged fire in the Rocinha neighborhood. Unknown casualties.

On 2 June 2023, in Rio de Janeiro - West Zone (Rio de Janeiro), unknown shooters exchanged fire in the Bateau Mouche community, Praca Seca neighborhood and the Recreio dos Bandeirantes neighborhood. Unknown casualties.

On 2 June 2023, in Duque de Caxias (Rio de Janeiro), residents held a demonstration in the Mangueirinha Complex after an armed confrontation between the Red Command and military police officers nearby (coded separately). The demonstrators burned three buses.
On 2 June 2023, in Uberlandia (Minas Gerais), app drivers carried out a protest against the approval of a municipal bill that regulates app transportation services.

Around 2 June 2023 (as reported), in Ananindeua (Para), a man was tied up, tortured, and killed by unknown individuals and his body was found in the Curucamba neighborhood tied to a pole. The circumstances of the attack indicate the victim was killed in a drug trafficking tribunal. 1 fatality.

On 2 June 2023, in Salvador - Itapua (Bahia), people threw stones and set a microbus on fire in the Sao Cristovao neighborhood to demonstrate against an accident in which a woman was hit by the microbus and did not survive the injuries.

assoc_actor_2: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
notes: On 2 June 2023, in Saquarema (Rio de Janeiro), armed suspects abducted an off-duty military police corporal and his brother from the Ipitangas neighborhood and killed them. Their bodies were found in a car in the Palmital neighborhood. The victims were brothers of a military police officer who had been involved in the Guaratiba police militia and killed in 2019. The killings were described as executions. 2 fatalities.

On 2 June 2023, in Aracaju (Sergipe), a moto-delivery worker was killed in a drive-by shooting in the Bugio neighborhood by two hooded armed individuals in a car. The victim was working when the attack occurred. There are no reports on the identity of the perpetrators or the attack's motivation. 1 fatality.

On 2 June 2023, in Recife (Pernambuco), members of social movements carried out a march to demand justice for the case of an Afro-Brazilian child who fell down a building on 2 June 2020 and did not survive the injuries. The child's mother was a housekeeper and left the child with her boss to run errands at her boss request. The boss was charged with child neglect.

Property destruction: On 2 June 2023, between Victoria and Curacautin communes (Araucania), at least five individuals set a rural school on fire on Route CH-181 that connects the aforementioned communes near the Sanchez community. Perpetrators arrived at the scene in a van and spread out to spray fuel inside the establishment. A pamphlet was found at the scene in which Mapuche Malleco Resistance (RMM) took responsibility for the attack and alluded to the transfer of the Mapuche prisoners to the Rancagua, Puerto Montt and Concepcion prisons after the incidents in the Angol prison (coded separately).

assoc_actor_1: Government of Chile (2022-); Unidentified Communal Group (Chile)
notes: On 2 June 2023, in Temuco (Araucania), more than 50 leaders from rural sectors of the Teodoro Schmidt commune protested in front of the former city hall building against the poor state of rural roads. The protest was headed by the mayor of Teodoro Schmidt who demanded the Seremi of Public Works to repair the different rural routes.

assoc_actor_1: Teachers (Chile); College of Teachers Union; Students (Chile)
notes: On 2 June 2023, in Quintero (Valparaiso), unionized teachers with the College of Teachers Union, students and education workers protested marching through Normandie avenue towards the city hall against the recent cases of contamination in the commune that left 20 people affected. Protesters marched under the slogan 'We demand a pollution-free education. Schools close, when will industries?'. Protesters handed a petition letter to the mayor with several demands.

On 2 June 2023, from Coronel commune to Concepcion (Biobio), residents members of CORFAVIC (the Corporation of Families of Victims of Biobio) held a caravan protest from Coronel commune to Concepcion demanding a change in legislation, which allows the creation of an office for crime victims, which could be a contribution in judicial processes against the suspected perpetrators.

actor1: FARC Dissident - Carlos Patino Front: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia Dissident Faction (Carlos Patino Front)
notes: Movement of forces: Around 2 June 2023, in the rural area of Silvia municipality (Cauca), residents warned that armed groups such as Carlos Patino FARC dissident faction are arriving in this area of the department to support allied groups that are fighting for territorial control and drug trafficking routes.
On 2 June 2023, in La Pena (Bolivar), residents attacked a man who minutes earlier had killed another resident in a knife fight. The group beat the man before he was handed over to the police.
On 2 June 2023, in Bogota - Fontibon (Bogota, D.C.), citizens blocked Avenida Esperanza to protest and demand job stability for Aerocivil workers.
On 2 June 2023, in Medellin - Central East (Antioquia), residents of San Antonio Prado corregimiento protested in La Alpujarra against the excessive increase in housing taxes.
On 2 June 2023, in Bogota - Ciudad Bolivar (Bogota, D.C.), nearly 60 citizens blocked the street to protest. There is no further information on this event.
Around 2 June 2023 (as reported), in Maicao (La Guajira), citizens blocked the entrance of the Aguas de la Peninsula water company to protest against the increased frequency of water cuts.

On 2 June 2023, in Caacupe (Cordillera), nephrology patients protested outside the Caacupe hospital to demand the reintegration of a nephrology specialist who was transferred to another hospital. They said that the doctor that replaced him has no experience.

On 2 June 2023, in Piura (Piura), for the second consecutive day, health workers members of the Piura Medical Federation and members of social groups staged a demonstration to voice their grievance about the Health Minister not handling well the dengue infections in the sector, and demanded the minister's resignation.

On 2 June 2023, in Pataz (La Libertad), residents and artisan miners from different sectors of the district marched through the city to demand local authorities for solutions in security, due to the increase in criminal activity.

On 2 June 2023, in Buenos Aires (Ancash), parents of students of El Castillo school staged a demonstration outside the Local Education Management Unit (UGEL) offices to voice their concerns about the news that the school intends to reduce the quantity of teachers for primary.

On 2 June 2023, in Buenos Aires (Ancash), residents of sector 7 of the Casuarinas urbanization staged a demonstration to voice their grievances about irregularities in the streets and sidewalks project in their sector, that is already expensive and no sidewalks are being planned to be constructed.

Around 2 June 2023 (as reported), in Nueva Cua (Miranda), CICPC police forces shot and killed an unidentified crime group suspect, during an armed confrontation in the Mendoza Mora neighborhood. The suspect resisted authority and opened fire on the officers. He was injured in the gunfire and pronounced dead in hospital. The man was one of the top ten most wanted criminals in Miranda state; he was sought for homicide and theft. There is no further information at this point in time. 1 fatality.

assoc_actor_1: PSUV: United Socialist Party of Venezuela
source: Caraota Digital; El Carabobeno; La Patilla
notes: On 2 June 2023, in Valencia (Carabobo), a group of PSUV supporters pushed, shoved, and slapped pre-election candidate Henrique Capriles (PJ) during a political rally in the Santa Ines sector, Rafael Urdaneta parish. The politician left the area, and there was no further escalation. There were no casualties.
On 2 June 2023, in Puerto La Cruz (Anzoategui), a group of oil workers at the Refinacion Oriente Refinery protested to demand the restoration of their medical insurance plans.
On 2 June 2023, in Santa Teresa del Tuy (Miranda), a group of demonstrators, including state workers and unionists, protested to demand better pay and working conditions.
On 2 June 2023, in Caracas - Libertador (Distrito Capital), a group of residents of the La Candelaria parish protested against ongoing water outages, and the rise in water bills.

Around 2 June 2023 (as reported), in San Lucas Toliman, Solola, three people were killed and their bodies bearing several gunshot wounds were found inside a house. One of the victims was a candidate for councilman for the Victoria Political Party. The two other victims were hand tied and were employees of the candidate. The motivation for the attack is unknown. No more detail is provided by the source. 3 fatalities.

source: La Gaceta; La Voz del Interior (Argentina)
notes: On 2 June 2023, in San Miguel de Tucuman (Tucuman), women members of the Not One Less movement and members of the LGBTQ+ community marched from the Urquiza to Independencia Square to demand justice for victims of femicide, to protest against violence against women, gender discrimination, inequality, and sexism and to demand public policies with a gender approach. This was part of nationwide demonstrations.

On 2 June 2023, in La Plata - Central (Buenos Aires), teachers and parents at two rural schools protested in front of the Provincial Ministry of Transportation against the suspension of the school transportation service that picked up students from the Oliden and Poblet sectors. They said that because of that decision, several students had to change to schools closer to their homes and others have not been able to find a slot in them.

On 2 June 2023, in Cordoba (Cordoba), a multitude of women members of the Not One Less movement and members of the LGBTQ+ community marched throughout the city to protest against femicides and gender-based violence and to demand public policies with a gender approach. They also demanded the implementation of a gender perspective in the justice system, the modification of protection measures for women victims of violence and the improvement of women's economic situation. This was part of nationwide demonstrations.

On 2 June 2023, in Manaus - East Zone (Amazonas), an adolescent was shot and killed in the Jorge Teixeira neighborhood by two armed individuals. Authorship and motivation of the attack are unknown. 1 fatality.

On 2 June 2023, in the rural area of Baturite municipality (Ceara), four men were shot at Sao Sebastiao locality, in rural area of the municipality by unknown shooters who entered a home, killing three of the victims and injuring the fourth one who was taken to the hospital. The motivation behind the attack and its perpetrators are unknown. 1 fatality.

On 2 June 2023, in Timon (Maranhao), a man was beaten to death by locals after having robbed and killed a man in the Formosa neighborhood. The man was with another suspect who fled after the attack. 1 fatality.

On 2 June 2023, in Uberlandia (Minas Gerais), a man was killed in a drive-by shooting in the Tocantins neighborhood by two armed individuals on a motorcycle. There are no reports on the identity of the perpetrators or the attack's motivation. 1 fatality.

On 2 June 2023, in Castanhal (Para), a man was shot and killed by three armed individuals who invaded his private residence in the Santa Catarina neighborhood. The victim had a police record (charges not reported). Authorship and motivation of the attack are unknown. 1 fatality.

On 2 June 2023, in Recife (Pernambuco), five people were shot at Bode community, in the Pina neighborhood by at least four hooded men who opened fire killing a woman and a girl, and injuring three other people who were taken to the hospital. A relative of the fatal victims stated the attack was aimed at killing her nephew who had recently been released from prison after serving time for drug trafficking. It is not clear if he was present at the time. The perpetrators behind the attack are unknown. 2 fatalities.
