notes: On 2 June 2023, in Rio de Janeiro - North Zone (Rio de Janeiro), residents held a demonstrations in the Para-Pedro community, Colegio neighborhood, denouncing the death of a resident during a police action (coded separately). Demonstrators burned objects on the road and threw bottles and stones at military police. Three demonstrators were arrested.

On 2 June 2023, in Porto Velho (Rondonia), a man was shot and killed in the Cunia neighborhood by two armed individuals. The victim was working when the attack occurred. The victim was wearing a monitoring anklet (charges not reported). Police believes the attack was motivated by a settling of scores. 1 fatality.
On 2 June 2023, in Sao Paulo - North Zone (Sao Paulo), armed suspects passing by in a vehicle shot and killed a man in the Sao Domingos neighborhood (drive-by). 1 fatality.

On 2 June 2023, in Colonia Manuel Rodriguez (Araucania), four hooded individuals stole one truck from workers at an electric company. Police found the individuals driving the vehicle on Route R-334 and tried to stop them, but the individuals shot at the officers. The vehicle was found burned in the Colonia Manuel Rodriguez sector in the Angol commune. Two pamphlets were found at the scene against the transfer of Mapuche prisoners to the Puerto Montt, Rancagua, and Concepcion prisons after the incidents in the Angol prison (coded separately). Earlier, workers at the same company were ambushed by hooded individuals who stole the vehicle in which they were driving on the route that connects Traiguen with Quechereguas. There were no casualties.

actor1: FARC Dissident - Dagoberto Ramos: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia Dissident Faction (Dagoberto Ramos)
source: Sucesos Cauca; Vanguardia Liberal; W Radio
notes: On 2 June 2023, in Silvia municipality (Cauca), the Dagoberto Ramos FARC dissident faction and ELN militants clashed for the second consecutive day near an Indigenous reserve area near the veredas Toguengo and Asnenga. Casualties unknown.

Around 2 June 2023 (as reported), in El Bagre (Antioquia), Gulf Clan militants abducted the son of a miner. The perpetrators broke into the victim's house and took him away in an unknown direction. The victim's whereabouts are still unknown.

actor2: FARC Dissident: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia Dissident Faction
notes: On 2 June 2023, in Pascuita (Antioquia), Gulf Clan militants clashed with members of a dissident FARC faction. There is no further information on this event. Casualties unknown.
Around 2 June 2023, in Valdivia municipality (Antioquia), ELN militants clashed with members of the Gulf Clan. There is no further information on this event. Casualties unknown.

On 2 June 2023, in El Chembe (Ibague, Tolima), residents of the El Chembe vereda protested against the failure of the Empresa de Acueducto y Alcantarillado, Ibal, to comply with agreements on social investment in the area as a condition for the construction of a wastewater treatment plant.

On 2 June 2023, in Loboguerrero (Valle del Cauca), residents protested the lack of a sewage system and increased power outages in the town. The group blocked a road for several hours claiming that the authorities were still not meeting their demands.

On 2 June 2023, in Puerto Ayora (Galapagos), residents marched through the city to demand national authorities solve the shortage of food and basic necessity products in the island, that was caused due to the ships bringing these products from mainland burning down in the ocean.

source: Diario Version Final (Venezuela); El Pitazo; Noticia al Minuto
notes: Property destruction: On 2 June 2023, in Maracaibo (Zulia), two members of the El Caracas gang on a motorcycle opened fire on the premises of the Farmabien pharmacy, during an attack in the La Curva de Molina sector. The suspects fired four shots at the door of the shop, and left a letter with extortion threats addressed to the owner of the premises. The attack is related to extortion threats, involving criminal groups operating in the area. The attackers escaped. One of the perpetrators was shot and killed during an armed confrontation with the police days later (coded separately), the other one was arrested.

On 2 June 2023, in San Francisco (Zulia), a group of Yukpa Indigenous people camped outside the La Coromoto PNB police station in protest to demand permission to travel to Caracas to speak with the authorities about their situation in their Sierra de Perija communities, and to demand the authorities to buy their production of artisan objects off them. The protesters argued that the police had compromised to buy their products, worth around 90,000 USD, but then failed to do so.

On 2 June 2023, around Popayan municipality (Cauca), a man was kidnapped by unidentified armed individuals. The next day, the kidnappers called the victim's family to demand money for his release. The body of the man was found days later in El Tambo municipality (coded separately). There is no further information on the perpetrators but the area is known for the presence of armed groups.

On 2 June 2023, in Santiago de Cali, Valle del Cauca, two merchants were kidnapped. There are no reports on the identity of the perpetrators. The area is known for the presence of armed groups. The National Army managed to get them released after several days.

On 2 June 2023, in Manaus - West Zone (Amazonas), a shoot-out between the CV and members of a rival group took place in the Santo Agostinho neighborhood. There were no casualties. One CV member was arrested on 28 June 2023. The suspect had shot a man to death on 11 November 2022 (coded separately).

On 2 June 2023, outside Puerto Cortez, Cortes, a group of residents protested on the road connecting Puerto Cortez with San Pedro Sula, around the village of La Pozona. They demanded an end to the ongoing power outages in the area.

On 1 June 2023, in Liverpool, Limon, people staged a protest to demand attention from the government, including more jobs and the construction of a new hospital. The protest was organized by Limon Civil and Social Block. Another protest was carried out a few kilometers away (coded separately).

On 1 June 2023, in Moin, Limon, people staged a protest on the route 32 at the height of the entrance to the Free Trade Zone of Limon and the APM terminals. Protesters demanded attention from the government. The protest was organized by Limon Civil and Social Block. Another protest was carried out a few kilometers away (coded separately).

On 1 June 2023, in Guatemala City, Guatemala, there was a shooting between two police officers and at least two armed men in zone 1. The police officers were standing in a corner when the two armed men passed-by on motorcycle and opened fire on them (drive-by). As a result of the clash, one attacker was killed, and another was injured. No more information was provided by the source. 1 fatality, 1 injured.

On 1 June 2023, in Linden, Upper Demerara-Berbice, for the second consecutive day, at least 80 squatter residents from Hill Foot neighborhood burned tires and blocked the highway as a demonstration to decry the destruction of 20 houses the day before (coded separately). Two police officers were attacked during clashes with the rioters (nature of the attack unknown). A number of vehicles were vandalized. The houses had been illegally built on private property.
On 1 June 2023, in Comayaguela, Francisco Morazan, unidentified gang members shot and killed a man in the Ojo de Agua sector for selling drugs in adverse territory. 1 fatality.

On 1 June 2023, in Comayagua, Comayagua, police forces arrested five gang members, including the leader, of the Los Valoi Gang, a gang dedicated to human trafficking between Latin America to the United States.

On 1 June 2023, in La Ceiba, Atlantida, unidentified armed men shot and killed a renown lawyer and former judge. The motive for the killing is likely related to his professional activity given he had recently received death threats and had moved to La Ceiba from Roatan due to safety concerns. 1 fatality.
Property destruction: On 1 June 2023, outside Limon, Colon, police forces seized and eradicated a coca plantation spread across around 7 hectares of land in the mountainous region of El Escondido.

On 1 June 2023, in Tegucigalpa, Francisco Morazan, nursing professionals occupied the facilities of the Professional Nurses Association in protest due to the lack of a call for elections to choose their authorities. The nurses claim that the collegiate elections, which were supposed to take place in May, did not occur, and they demand the removal of the current leadership which they perceive as undemocratic.

On 1 June 2023, in San Pedro Sula, Cortes, the confederation of patronage organizations protested due to the ongoing power outages in the northern region of Honduras. The leaders of the patronage organizations demanded the removal of the Secretary of Energy and the manager of the National Electric Power Company (ENEE) for his inability to resolve the energy crisis. Also in San Pedro Sula, residents from several neighborhoods, including Jucutuma, San Jose del Boqueron, Rivera Hernandez, Ticamaya, and Ciudad Espana, blocked traffic on the eastern boulevard in protest demanding a solution to the ongoing power outages in their households.

On 1 June 2023, in Quimistan, Santa Barbara, a group of residents blocked traffic and burned tires on the CA-4 highway in demonstration against ongoing power outages. The residents claimed that they have been without electricity for three days with some expressing their frustration over damaged appliances.

Other: On 1 June 2023, in San Sebastian de Yali, Jinotega, the government closed and seized the Association of the daughters of Saint Louise de Marillac in the Holy Spirit, under the charges of 'breach of its obligations'. In the same act, expelled from the country the three nuns who run the Association. Members of the Catholic church have been subjected to constant attacks by the government for their association with the political opposition in the country.

On 1 June 2023, in Colon, Colon, firefighters staged a protest at the height of Cuatro Altos mall and on the la Comunidad de la Resurreccion overpass to demand the government complies with the agreement signed that implies salary increases and equipment for the force. Another protest was recorded in Ocu (coded separately).

On 1 June 2023, in Panama City, Panama, port workers staged a protest against a private company operating in the Rodman Port. As a result, members of the of the Industrial Union of Port and Land Cargo Service Workers (Sitrasecapot) attached to Union Convergence- who participated in the protest, also announced a strike.

On 1 June 2023, in Ocu, Herrera, firefighters from four provinces gathered in the cross to Divisa to stage a protest to demand that the government complies with the agreement signed that implies salary increases and equipment for the force. Protesters, that included firefighters from Herrera, Los Santos, Veraguas and Cocle, marched on the Interamerican road. Police officers were deployed in the area and kept the protesters from blocking the road. The protesters argued that police repressed the firefighters (methods unknown). Another protest was recorded in Colon (coded separately).

source: Critica (Panama); La Estrella de Panama (Panama); La Prensa (Panama)
notes: On 1 June 2023, in Panama City, Panama, truck drivers and members of the Dump Truck Association of Panama staged a protest by parking their trucks on the Cinta Costera and closing access to the Centenario Bridge. More protesters blocked the Centenero road, the Mercado de Mariscos, and the Balboa Avenue. Demonstrators protested against a transport tender from the Urban and Home Cleaning Authority. Police forces were deployed and arrested at least 25 drivers.

assoc_actor_1: MTP: National Police Worker's Movement; Police Forces of El Salvador (2019-); Labor Group (El Salvador); Farmers (El Salvador); Former Military Forces of El Salvador (2019-); Former FMLN: Farabundo Marti National Liberation Front; Indigenous Group (El Salvador)
notes: On 1 June 2023, in San Salvador, San Salvador, members of the National Alliance for El Salvador in Peace staged an anti-government demonstration in the Monument a la Constitucion in colonia Miramonte on the occasion of the fourth anniversary of the Bukele administration. Former military officers and war veterans, former FMLN veterans, farmers, the National Police Worker's Movement, the Union of Judicial Workers (SEJES), and the Rural and Indigenous Agricultural Bureau participated in the protest.

On 1 June 2023, in Comodoro Rivadavia (Chubut), taxi drivers protested in front of the city council to demand the suspension of digital app transportation services and more controls from authorities against them.
On 1 June 2023, in Salta (Salta), thousands of workers gathered outside the Provincial Legislature to protest against adjustment policies and repressive measures issued by the governor.

On 1 June 2023, in Villa Mascardi (Rio Negro), Mapuche Indigenous People demonstrated in support of the Lafken Winkul Mapu community in the land conflict between the Indigenous group and residents of the area. At the same moment and place, residents of the place accompanied by members of the NOS party demonstrated against the awarding of the land to the Indigenous community. The protest happened while an agreement about this matter was being negotiated in Buenos Aires.

location: San Fernando del Valle de Catamarca
notes: On 1 June 2023, in San Fernando del Valle de Catamarca (Catamarca), students at the Higher Institute of Arts and Communications (ISAC) marched to the Provincial Ministry of Education to protest against the lack of teachers, the poor conditions of the school's infrastructure, delays in payments to teachers, the bad labor conditions of maintenance personnel and problems with administrative processes. They also repudiated the presence of rats in the school.
On 1 June 2023, in Cordoba (Cordoba), a group of students and teachers at the Manuel Bergano y Monserrat schools protested with historic demands at the institution.

On 1 June 2023, in Trelew (Chubut), for the third consecutive day, teachers associated with the Chubut's Education Workers Association (ATECH) marched to demand a raise in salaries and to protest against the lack of resources invested in education.

On 1 June 2023, in Rosario (Santa Fe), teachers associated with the Santa Fe Teachers Association (AMSAFE) protested in front of the Provincial Ministry of Education premises to protest against the plan that seeks to increase the elementary school day by an hour around the country. They also demanded the payment of salaries they are owed.

On 1 June 2023, in Cordoba (Cordoba), a group of teachers and researchers at the Cordoba National University (UNC) protested on campus to demand better salaries and labor conditions. They also demanded admission to the teaching career of interim teachers with five years of seniority, the classification and hierarchization of some positions not included in the collective labor contract and that pre-university teachers are allowed to participate in the election of school authorities.

Around 1 June 2023 (as reported), in San Carlos de Bariloche (Rio Negro), a group of demonstrators blocked the Morales and San Martin intersection in front of the Department of Natural Parks and then marched to the Civic Center. They were demanding the signature of an agreement between the government and Mapuche Indigenous people about the land conflict over Villa Mascardi.
On 1 June 2023, in Rosario (Santa Fe), friends and family of a man killed during an armed robbery protested to demand justice for the victim on the intersection of Orono Boulevard and Uriburu Avenue.
On 1 June 2023, in Termas de Rio Hondo (Santiago del Estero), friends and family of a man who was killed protested outside the city's tribunals to demand justice for the victim.
On 1 June 2023, in Cochabamba (Cochabamba), workers at Fassil bank marched through the city as a demonstration to demand payment of their owned salaries and workers benefits.

On 1 June 2023, in Oruro (Oruro), workers at Fassil bank marched through the city towards the Financial System Authority (ASFI) offices as a demonstration to demand payment of their owned salaries and workers benefits for two months.
On 1 June 2023, in Santa Cruz de la Sierra (Santa Cruz), workers at Fassil bank marched through the city as a demonstration to demand payment of their owned salaries and workers benefits.

On 1 June 2023, in Kora Kora (Chuquisaca), residents of 12 de Octubre neighborhood board blocked the Sucre - Alcantari airport highway as a demonstration to demand maintenance of the streets in the sector.

On 1 June 2023, in Villa Yapacani (Santa Cruz), for the second consecutive day, residents of Faja Norte sector marched through the city and then blocked the bridge over the river as a demonstration to demand the department government to five the sectorial and financing prioritization document for the maintenance of Faja Norte - Yapacani highway.

On 1 June 2023, in Porto Velho (Rondonia), a member of the CV was shot and killed in the Caladinho neighborhood by an armed individual. Police believe the killing was motivated by rivalries between drug trafficking groups. 1 fatality.

actor2: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
notes: On 1 June 2023, in Angra dos Reis (Rio de Janeiro), two armed suspects involved in drug trafficking exchanged fire with military police officers in the Morro do Perez community. One suspect was shot and injured. Police seized a pistol and drugs. There were no fatalities.

actor2: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
notes: On 1 June 2023, in Resende (Rio de Janeiro), two drug traffickers exchanged fire with military police officers in the Baixada da Olaria neighborhood. One suspect was arrested, and police seized crack and cocaine. There were no fatalities.

actor2: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
source: Crimes News RJ; G1; Informe Agora; OTT-RJ
notes: On 1 June 2023, in Rio de Janeiro - North Zone (Rio de Janeiro), drug traffickers exchanged fire with military police officers during an operation aiming to curb the movement of the suspects and supress the theft of vehicles in the Serrinha Complex, Madureira neighborhood. Four suspects were injured during the clash and two of them died. Police seized a rifle, ammunition, and three pistols. After the confrontation, a protest took place in the area (coded separately). 2 fatalities.

actor2: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
notes: On 1 June 2023, in Sao Paulo - East Zone (Sao Paulo), two suspects got into a physical fight with two military police officers in the Sao Mateus neighborhood. The suspects used the officers' gun and opened fire on the two police officers, injuring them. Both suspects were arrested and one of them had a record for drug trafficking. There were no fatalities.

On 1 June 2023, in Duque de Caxias (Rio de Janeiro), unknown shooters exchanged fire in the Corte Oito community, the Barro Vermelho community, Gramacho neighborhood and the Lagoinha locality, Vila Leopoldina neighborhood. Unknown casualties.

On 1 June 2023, in Rio de Janeiro - North Zone (Rio de Janeiro), unknown shooters exchanged fire in the Morro dos Macacos community, Vila Isabel neighborhood and the Engenho Novo neighborhood. Shooting was also heard in the Lins Complex, Lins de Vasconcelos neighborhood and the Manguinhos and Parada de Lucas neighborhoods. Unknown casualties.

On 1 June 2023, in Rio de Janeiro - North Zone (Rio de Janeiro), a group of people held a protest denouncing a military police operation in the Serrinha Complex, Madureira neighborhood. The protest may have been organized by the suspects engaging in an armed confrontation with officers (coded separately) to divert the focus of the state forces during the operation.

On 1 June 2023, in Sao Paulo - Central Zone (Sao Paulo), municipal civil servants held a protest outside City Hall, demanding improvements in the annual salary readjustment index and better working conditions.

On 1 June 2023, in Maceio (Alagoas), a drug trafficker was shot and killed in the Tabuleiro do Martins neighborhood by an armed individual. Police believe his killing was motivated by rivalries between drug trafficking groups. The deceased had been the target of a previous killing attempt on 11 May 2023 (coded separately). 1 fatality.

On 1 June 2023, in Timon (Maranhao), two members of a drug trafficking group were shot and killed in the Vila Joao Reis neighborhood by members of a rival group who invaded their private residence. 2 fatalities.

On 1 June 2023, in Rio de Janeiro - Central Zone (Rio de Janeiro), teachers held a protest outside the state government headquarters, demanding the application of a national teachers' minimum wage and other demands concerning working hours.

On 1 June 2023, in Presidente Prudente (Sao Paulo), educators and students held a protest resisting the selection process for hiring education support agents outside the Municipal Department of Education, in the Jardim Morumbi neighborhood.

actor1: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
notes: On 1 June 2023, in Manaus - North Zone (Amazonas), an armed individual exchanged fire with military police forces in the Cidade de Deus neighborhood. The armed suspect was killed. Police seized a firearm, portions of drugs and four precision scales, indicating drug trafficking activities. 1 fatality.

actor1: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
notes: On 1 June 2023, in Aparecida de Goiania (Goias), a drug trafficker exchanged fire with military police forces in the Beira da Mata squat. The drug trafficker was killed. The deceased had killed a person and injured two more hours earlier due to drug trafficking territorial disputes (coded separately). 1 fatality.

On 1 June 2023, in Manaus - North Zone (Amazonas), a man suspected of theft was beaten up and injured by residents in the Nova Cidade neighborhood. The victim was taken to a hospital and later arrested by police.

actor1: Police Forces of Brazil (2023-) Civil Police
notes: Property destruction: On 1 June 2023, in Manaus - East Zone (Amazonas), civil police forces seized five riffles and 1.5 tons of marijuana hidden inside a moving truck during an operation in the Mauazinho neighborhood. One person was arrested.

source: Folha de S. Paulo; G1; Globo Extra; Informe Agora; OTT-RJ
notes: On 1 June 2023, in Rio de Janeiro - West Zone (Rio de Janeiro), the Zinho police militia exchanged fire with a rival police militia led by Nanan in the Guandu community, Santa Cruz neighborhood. Five people were found dead in the area. The event is linked to a territorial conflict between rival police militia groups in the area. Two other police militia members were shot and injured. 5 fatalities.

On 1 June 2023, in Manacapuru (Amazonas), a man was injured in a drive-by shooting in the Vale Verde neighborhood by armed individuals on a motorcycle. There are no reports on the identity of the perpetrators or the attack's motivation.

On 1 June 2023, in Engenheiro Caldas (Minas Gerais), a man was killed in a drive-by shooting in the city center by two armed individuals on a motorcycle. Portions of drugs were found with the victim, but it is not known if he was a drug user or drug trafficker. The perpetrators were identified, but not arrested. 1 fatality.

On 1 June 2023, in Londrina (Parana), at least two armed individuals opened fire against a driver in the Uniao da Vitoria neighborhood. The driver was killed. More than 100 shots hit the victim's car, indicating an execution. There are no reports on the identity of the perpetrators or the attack's motivation. 1 fatality.

On 1 June 2023, in La Serena (Coquimbo), members of the CEA Foundation protested in front of the city hall demanding economic resources to pay the rent of the facilities where they take care of children with ASD (Autism Spectrum Disorder). Protesters stated that more than 300 children are being affected by this situation.

On 1 June 2023, in Copiapo (Atacama), students at an Adventist school marched against the consumption of Tobacco in commemoration of the Day Without Smoking. Students held banners with slogans such as 'we are joining the initiative of the World Health Organization, to propose a healthy lifestyle', 'quit tobacco and all instances harmful to health'.

On 1 June 2023, in San Pablo (Los Lagos), 120 unionized teachers from nine urban and rural schools protested after receiving only 60% of their salary. Protesters also denounced the non-compliance with the payment of health contributions, AFP and other irregularities caused by the Daem (Municipal Education Administration Department). Teachers went on a strike keeping more than a thousand students without classes. The College of Teachers Union called for the protest and stated that they will take the issue to court.

On 1 June 2023, near La Aguada (Los Rios), locals protested blocking the traffic on O'Higgins street at Route T-400 demanding a solution to the contamination of drinking water. Protesters blocked the access to the Urales company, which they blame for water contamination. The company is in charge of a road project in the sector, and there is currently an investigation regarding a large amount of sediment that fell into the water. Authorities arrived at the scene and agreed to take measures to increase the amount of water they will deliver as an emergency while repairing takes place.

On 1 June 2023, in Santiago - Penalolen (Metropolitana), members of a housing committee protested with banners on Grecia avenue demanding the Ministry of Housing the resources to develop a housing project in the area. Three women suspended themselves from a bridge with a harness as part of the protest. Protesters stated that they will go to the city hall to 'demand an answer' from the mayor.

On 1 June 2023, in Valparaiso (Valparaiso), locals protested in several parts of the city in the context of President Boric's Public Account event. One of the protests took place near the Cardonal Market, where a group of people blocked the traffic. Police were present at the scene. Another protest was near the Grecia school, where protesters exchanged words with police after they didn't allow them to hold a march in the sector. Outside of the National Congress, in Victoria square, a group of people installed a banner in which they demanded the end of the AFPs (Administrators of pension funds).

Around 1 June 2023 (as reported), in San Jose de la Fragua (Caqueta), police forces arrested seven members of the CDF during a police operation. Among those detained is an important member of the armed group. There is no further information on whether confrontations took place during the event.

source: El Universal (Colombia); INDEPAZ; Sucesos Cauca; UNOCHA
notes: Around 1 June 2023 (as reported), in the rural area of Corinto municipality (Cauca), a social leader was killed and his body was found on a road near the Rio Sucio vereda. The victim, who was an active member of farmers' organizations in the municipality of Pradera, had reported multiple death threats. Although the perpetrators have not been confirmed, the area is known for the presence the Dagoberto Ramos FARC dissident faction. 1 fatality.

Looting: Around 1 June 2023 (as reported), in the rural area of Corinto municipality (Cauca), unidentified armed individuals stole a truck carrying a shipment of liquor. Perpetrators intercepted the vehicle, took down the driver and drove off in an unknown direction. There are no further details about the possible perpetrators, but the area is known for the presence of armed groups.

On 1 June 2023, in Ibague (Tolima), pensioned retired police officers protested against the poor service provided by the health insurance company. The group repudiated delays in the delivery of medicines among other problems.
On 1 June 2023, in Sopetran (Antioquia), parents and teachers protested for the fourth consecutive day the poor management of the institution and demanded the resignation of the school principal.

Around 1 June 2023 (as reported), in Caucasia (Antioquia), people gathered to protested against the killing of a young woman by a local armed group (coded separately). Protesters marched to repudiate this crime. They also called for an end to violence against young people in this sub-region.
On 1 June 2023, in Bogota - La Candelaria (Bogota, D.C.), people protested and marched to Plaza Bolivar. There is no further information about this event.
On 1 June 2023, in Toluviejo (Sucre), victims of armed conflict protested against the poor implementation of aid programs. The group chained themselves to the main gates of the major's office.

On 1 June 2023, in Guayaquil (Guayas), banana farmers staged a demonstration outside the Zone Government of the north of the city to demand respect to the minimum price of the box of banana, and to eliminate the 'code f' normative that would be the main problem of why their products are being bought for less.
On 1 June 2023, in Loja (Loja), transportation drivers who work for the National Telecommunications Corporation (CNT) staged a demonstration to demand payment of owed salaries for sixteen months.

On 1 June 2023, in Pirapey Km. 45 (Itapua), for the fourth consecutive day, Yerba Mate farmers partially blocked Route PY06 to demand better prices for the leaves. They said that the price was unilaterally fixed without consulting them.

assoc_actor_1: Teachers (Paraguay); OTEP-SN: Organization of Education Workers of Paraguay National Union
notes: On 1 June 2023, in Asuncion (Asuncion), for the second consecutive day, teachers associated with OTEP-SN protested in front of the Ministry of Education to repudiate the killing of the principal of a school in El Guaira by one of the students of the institution. They also demanded a protection law and better working conditions for teachers and rejected the militarization of schools. They also protested against the lack of psychologists and student counselors in schools.

On 1 June 2023, in Asuncion (Asuncion), women members of feminist organizations protested in front of the Public Ministry to demand to the General Attorney justice in the cases that involves a National Crusade elected senator with sexual abuse. The politician could still be sworn in as a senator on 30 June.

On 1 June 2023, in Trujillo (La Libertad), representatives of soup kitchens, people with disabilities, transportation and municipal workers staged a demonstration on Armas Square to demand the resignation of the provincial mayor. They claim that there are many changes in administration by the mayor, and that has caused that the investment of the province to be the smallest in the region.

On 1 June 2023, in Piura (Piura), dozens of residents marched from Merino Square through the city as a demonstration to voice their grievance about the Health Minister not handling well the dengue infections in the sector.

source: El Pitazo; OVCS: Observatorio Venezolano de Conflictividad Social
notes: On 1 June 2023, in Caracas - Libertador (Distrito Capital), a group of demonstrators, including state workers and unionists, protested to demand better pay and working conditions, and the repeal of the National Budget Office (ONAPRE) instruction. The protesters gathered inside the Office of University Sector Planning (OPSU).

On 1 June 2023, in Carirubana municipality (coded to Punto Fijo, Falcon), a group of active and retired oil sector workers at the Inver Azul CA company, which renders services to the state-owned PDVSA oil company, protested to demand payment of owed stipends. According to them, the owed amounts range between 600 and 4000 USD per worker. The protesters gathered outside the company's premises.

On 1 June 2023, in Mene Grande (Zulia), a group of public transport workers protested against the presence of unlicensed vehicles outside the Mene Grande bus station which, according to the protesters, steal clients from them, reducing their income. Following negotiations with the police, who compromised on carrying more license verifications of those vehicles, the protesters dispersed.

On 1 June 2023, in San Cristobal (Tachira), a group of medical students of the Los Andes University (ULA) protested against the closing of the auditorium of the San Cristobal Central Hospital, where they used to attend class. This decision came from the hospital's management. Going forward the auditorium will only host official events. The protest was staged by the San Cristobal Central Hospital.

On 1 June 2023, in Barinas (Barinas), a group of teachers protested to demand better pay and working conditions, the renewal of their collective labor agreement, and the cessation of threats and intimidation towards education sector workers for partaking in the labor action. The protesters gathered outside the Labor Inspectorate Office.

On 1 June 2023, in Valencia (Carabobo), a group of teachers protested to demand payment of owed stipends. The protesters claim that they weren't given this month's food tickets, which make up part of their pay. They gathered outside the Education Secretary Office.

On 1 June 2023, in Guarero (Zulia), a group of approximately 30 families, residents of the Sumain Wayuu and the El Taparito communities, blocked the Troncal 6 road for eight hours in protest over power outages. The protesters demand a new electric transformer.

On 1 June 2023, in Feira de Santana (Bahia), a man was shot and killed in the Gabriela neighborhood by unknown armed individuals. The victim had a police record for drug trafficking. Attack motivation is unknown. 1 fatality.

On 1 June 2023, in Palmarito corregimiento (Norte de Santander), ELN militants abducted and killed a fisher. The perpetrators abducted the victim from his home in Monteverde vereda. Less than 24 hours later, the victim's body was found on a rural road. The man was the son of a well-known social leader in the area. 1 fatality.

Around 1 June 2023 (as reported), in Canasgordas municipality (Antioquia), members of the Gulf Clan abducted a man. The victim was killed two days later by the armed group (coded separately). No further information is available on this event.

actor1: FARC Dissident - Dagoberto Ramos: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia Dissident Faction (Dagoberto Ramos)
notes: On 1 June 2023, in Silvia municipality (Cauca), the Dagoberto Ramos FARC dissident faction and ELN militants clashed near an Indigenous reserve area near the veredas Toguengo and Asnenga. Casualties unknown.

On 1 June 2023, in Pereira (Risaralda), students protested against delays in the appointment of teachers for their school. The protesters claimed that these delays affect the normal development of their school year.
Around 1 June 2023 (as reported), in Carmen de Bulira (Tolima), residents blocked the road to protest delays in the repaving of the road that connects the area to the city of Ibague.

On 1 June 2023, in San Salvador, San Salvador, two members of the Harrison Locos Salvatruchos gang killed a man in the San Jacinto neighborhood. The three men were departing in a bar when two men attacked the victim and killed him by throwing stones at him. 1 fatality.

Property destruction: On 1 June 2023, in Maracaibo (Zulia), members of the El Mauricio Gang opened fire on the facade of the Centro Ferretero La 3 hardware store, in an extortion related attack occurred overnight. There is no further information at this point in time. On 1 July the hardware store was attacked again, leaving two dead (coded separately).

On 1 June 2023, in Santiago (Metropolitana), more than 30 hooded individuals and people in white overalls held a demonstration on Arturo Prat street and inside the National Institute. Demonstrators threw at least 40 Molotov cocktails at police units and hit a police officer with blunt objects in the head. Individuals were attacking a woman on Alameda at Arturo Prat street when an off-duty police officer intervened to defend her. Some demonstrators also had metal weapons and an axe with which they destroyed the glass of a classroom door with students inside the educational facility. One person was arrested. The reasons for the demonstration are unknown.

Property destruction: On 31 May 2023, in Toledo district (coded to Toledo), Toledo, the Belizean Armed Forces destroyed an illegal airstrip in the Southern area of the district. The airstrip was used by gangs.
On 31 May 2023, in Guatemala City, Guatemala, dentistry students staged a protest in the San Carlos University campus in zone 12 to demand the resumption of classes and practices in clinics.

assoc_actor_1: Health Workers (French Guiana); Labor Group (French Guiana)
notes: On 31 May 2023, in Cayenne, Cayenne, health workers and other employees of the Cayenne hospital held a march to oppose the departure of the current head of the institution, that was scheduled to the month of July.

On 31 May 2023, in Linden, Upper Demerara-Berbice, scores of residents from Hill Foot neighborhood burned tires and debris and blocked the highway as a demonstration to prevent military forces from destroying 20 houses. A number of vehicles were vandalized, including a bulldozer. The houses were demolished moments later, as it had been ordered by court. The houses were illegally built on private property.

On 31 May 2023, in Cuyamel, Cortes, a group of residents blocked a road and burned tires in demonstration against frequent power outages that have damaged their appliances and disrupted their daily activities. The demonstrators expressed frustration with the lack of response to their complaints and demanded an end to the ongoing electricity crisis.

On 31 May 2023, in Chiriqui, Chiriqui, firefighters staged a protest to demand the government complies with the agreement signed that implies salary increases and equipment for the force. The protest was carried out on the international road on the Rio Chiriqui Viejo bridge.

On 31 May 2023, in Panama City, Panama, students staged a protest on the Transismic road. Demonstrators, members of the Student Reform University Association (AURE) protested against the high cost of living and in rejection of a new mining contract.

On 31 May 2023, near Diitabiki, Sipaliwini, 28 armed men attacked a group of six men working at a gold field in the Godo-Olo village. According to one worker, two armed men shot at him, although he escaped unharmed. The motivation of the attack was disagreement over lands allocations. There were no casualties.

Around 31 May 2023 (as reported), in Formosa (Formosa), a group of supporters of the Formosa governor (PJ) attacked members of the campaign of the candidate for governor and a candidate for councilman (JxC) in the San Jose Obrero neighborhood. The rioters threw rocks at the vehicle they were in. There were no casualties.

notes: On 31 May 2023, in Viedma (Rio Negro), members of the Mapuche Indigenous community and CTA-A blocked the Basilio Villarino Bridge to demand the release of four Mapuche women who have been detained since October 2022 in the context of the Villa Mascardi land conflict. They also demanded the dissolution of the Unified Command security forces.

On 31 May 2023, in Santa Rosa (La Pampa), a group of security guards associated with the Security and Related Personnel Union of the Patagonia (UPSAP) protested outside the Speluzzi Refrigeration Plant to demand the reintegration of two workers who had been fired and better labor conditions.

On 31 May 2023, in Comodoro Rivadavia (Chubut), a group of teachers and parents at the ENI 421 kindergarten protested outside the premises of the institution to demand improvements to the school infrastructure, heating and an increase in the food portions served to children.
On 31 May 2023, in Trelew (Chubut), for the second consecutive day, teachers associated with the Chubut's Education Workers Association (ATECH) marched to demand a raise in salaries.

On 31 May 2023, in San Juan (San Juan), a group of teachers demonstrated in support of teachers in Salta province, who have been demonstrating for two weeks demanding better salaries and working conditions and have been repressed by the police.

Health workers, students and public and private workers participated in the demonstration in support of the teachers.
On 31 May 2023, in Anelo (Neuquen), between 40 and 50 residents blocked Routes 7 and 17 to protest against the lack of natural gas and gas cylinders in the Vaca Muerta sector.

Around 31 May 2023 (as reported), in San Carlos de Bariloche (Rio Negro); friends and family of a woman who was found dead in January 2023 protested outside the Bariloche Prosecutor's Office to demand justice. The mother of the woman said that they rejected the version given by authorities of a suicide.

assoc_actor_1: Teachers (Argentina); Health Workers (Argentina); Students (Argentina); Labor Group (Argentina)
notes: On 31 May 2023, in Salta (Salta), teachers demonstrated in front of city hall to demand an increase in salaries, better labor conditions, the hiring of more teachers, improvements to school infrastructure, and more resources for school food programs. Health workers, students and public and private workers participated in the demonstration in support of the teachers. Police officers arrested a demonstrator who jumped over a fence to get into the government building. They also installed a camp outside the Provincial Legislature to protest against a draft bill that's being discussed that would put limits on the right to protest.
On 31 May 2023, in Cochabamba (Cochabamba), municipal slaughterhouse workers staged a demonstration outside the local government offices to demand payment of their owed and retained salaries.
On 31 May 2023, in La Paz (La Paz), workers at Fassil Bank staged a demonstration to demand payment of their owned salaries and workers benefits.
On 31 May 2023, in Santa Cruz de la Sierra (Santa Cruz), workers at Fassil Bank staged a demonstration to demand payment of their owned salaries and workers benefits.
On 31 May 2023, in Sucre (Chuquisaca), workers at Fassil Bank staged a demonstration to demand payment of their owned salaries and workers benefits.

On 31 May 2023, in Cochabamba (Cochabamba), supporters of the mayor of the city (Sumate), majority of them women, staged a demonstration against the designation of the president and secretary of the municipal council for being part of Movement for Socialism (MAS).

On 31 May 2023, in Montero (Santa Cruz), for the third consecutive day, residents blocked the La Amistad Bridge as a demonstration to voice their concerns of the deaths that happened due to land conflicts in Santagro, and demanding justice to the victims of the attacks.

On 31 May 2023, in Villa Yapacani (Santa Cruz), residents of the Faja Norte sector marched through the city and then blocked the bridge over the river as a demonstration to demand the department government to five the sectorial and financing prioritization document for the maintenance of Faja Norte - Yapacani highway.

On 31 May 2023, in Salvador - Liberdade (Bahia), three people from the same family - a man, a woman, and a child - were shot and killed in the Marechal Rondon neighborhood by members of the Cangaco gang. The group was going to kill only the man, who was a member of the BDM, but everybody in the residence was killed to eliminate witnesses. The child was the son of another BDM member. 3 fatalities.

actor1: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
notes: On 31 May 2023, in Salvador - Tancredo Neves (Bahia), members of the BDM exchanged fire with military police in the Sao Goncalo neighborhood. One BDM member was killed. Police seized a firearm, a gun charger, ammunition, and camouflaged gear. 1 fatality.

actor2: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
notes: On 31 May 2023, in Rio de Janeiro - Central Zone (Rio de Janeiro), armed suspects exchanged fire with military police in the Benfica neighborhood. The Linha Amarela road was blocked. One suspect was injured, and police seized a machine gun. There were no fatalities.

actor2: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
notes: On 31 May 2023, in Rio de Janeiro - North Zone (Rio de Janeiro), drug traffickers exchanged fire with military police in the Morro da Serrinha community, Madureira neighborhood. The area is controlled by the Pure Third Command. Moreover, armed suspects exchanged fire with military police in the Mare Complex. seized more than a ton of drugs. Unknown casualties.

On 31 May 2023, in Sao Lourenco da Mata (Pernambuco), a man was shot and killed in the Reserva Sao Lourenco housing complex, in the Muribara neighborhood, by two armed individuals. A civilian woman was injured by stray bullets. There are no reports on the identity of the perpetrators or the attack's motivation. 1 fatality.

On 31 May 2023, in Rio de Janeiro - West Zone (Rio de Janeiro), unknown shooters exchanged fire in the Morro dos Macacos community, Vila Isabel neighborhood and the Morro da Primavera community, Cavalcante neighborhood. Unknown casualties.

On 31 May 2023, in Potim (Sao Paulo), two armed suspects on a motorcycle opened fire on a drug trafficker at a market in the Morada dos Marque neighborhood. A butcher working in the market was hit by a stray bullet and injured. There were no fatalities.

On 31 May 2023, in Itacoatiara (Amazonas), four armed individuals chased after and opened fire against a man in the Sao Cristovao neighborhood. The victim might have been injured, but it was not confirmed. There are no reports on the identity of the perpetrators or the attack's motivation.

On 31 May 2023, in Campo Belo (Minas Gerais), a man was shot and killed inside a bar in the Feira neighborhood by four hooded armed individuals. There are no reports on the identity of the perpetrators or the attack's motivation. 1 fatality.

On 31 May 2023, in Sao Paulo - Central Zone (Sao Paulo), residents held a demonstration, demanding action from the city on a large crater in a street in the Liberdade neighborhood. Demonstrators complained about traffic and bad smells and burned objects on the road.

On 31 May 2023, Sao Paulo - Central Zone (Sao Paulo), members of the PSOL party protested during a plenary session of the City Council by holding a poster with a photo of the mayor (MBD) commenting on how the 'city is for sale'.

actor1: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
notes: On 31 May 2023, in Sao Desiderio (Bahia), a drug trafficker exchanged fire with military police in the Roda Velha neighborhood. The drug trafficker was killed. Police seized a firearm and portions of drugs. 1 fatality.

actor1: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
assoc_actor_1: Police Forces of Brazil (2023-) Civil Police
notes: On 31 May 2023, in Santana (Amapa), a member of a drug trafficking group exchanged fire with military and civil police forces during his arrest operation in the Paraiso neighborhood. The drug trafficker was killed. Police seized a firearm and ammunition. 1 fatality.

On 31 May 2023, in Santa Maria do Para (Para), a man was shot and killed inside a barber shop in the Baixada region by an armed individual. The deceased had recently been detained for drug trafficking. There are no reports on the identity of the perpetrator. 1 fatality.

On 31 May 2023, in Sao Paulo - South Zone (Sao Paulo), a few dozen residents held a protest outside Morumbi Stadium resisting the presence of the former President (PL). The protesters called the former President genocidal and racist.

On 31 May 2023, in Manaus - North Zone (Amazonas), a man was rescued by military police forces in the Novo Aleixo neighborhood. The victim was found with his hands and feet tied up and was about to executed in a drug trafficking tribunal. The perpetrators escaped.
On 31 May 2023, in Juiz de Fora (Minas Gerais), a man was shot and killed in the Progresso neighborhood by armed individuals in the context of drug trafficking disputes. 1 fatality.
On 31 May 2023, in Aparecida de Goiania (Goias), a drug trafficker killed a person and injured two more in the Comendador Walmor sector due to drug trafficking territorial disputes. 1 fatality.

Around 31 May 2023 (as reported), in the rural area of Itapecuru Mirim municipality (Maranhao), three men were killed by unknown individuals and their bodies were found in the Mandioca village with stab and gunshot wounds. Two victims were also decapitated. Circumstances of death are unknown. 3 fatalities.

On 31 May 2023, in Joao Pessoa (Paraiba), two men were injured in a drive-by shooting in the Rangel neighborhood by armed individuals on a motorcycle. There are no reports on the identity of the perpetrators or the attack's motivation.

source: Crimes News RJ; Folha de S. Paulo; Globo Extra; Informe Agora; R7
notes: On 31 May 2023, in Rio de Janeiro - North Zone (Rio de Janeiro), drug traffickers in vehicles exchanged fire in the Penha neighborhood. Two suspects were shot and killed, and a third was injured. A police officer who was passing by was hit by a stray bullet. 2 fatalities.

On 31 May 2023, in Manaus - South Zone (Amazonas), a man was tied up, shot, and injured by an armed individual in the Petropolis neighborhood. The victim was taken to hospital. The victim was a drug user. There are no reports on the identity of the perpetrator.

Around 31 May 2023 (as reported), in Manaus - West Zone (Amazonas), a man was killed by unknown individuals and his body was found in the Taruma neighborhood with blunt wounds, hands and feet tied up, and with a belt around his neck. Circumstances of death are unknown. 1 fatality.

On 31 May 2023, in Barreiras (Coruripe, Alagoas), a man was shot and killed by six armed individuals who invaded his private residence. The deceased had taken part in the killing of a drug trafficker (circumstances not reported) and had been receiving death threats from a local drug trafficking group because of it. 1 fatality.

On 31 May 2023, in Porto Velho (Rondonia), a man was injured in a drive-by shooting in the Olaria neighborhood by two armed individuals on a motorcycle. The victim was a prisoner of the semi-open regime (charges not reported). Authorship and motivation of the attack are unknown.

On 31 May 2023, in Petrolina (Pernambuco), residents of rural areas of the city blocked the BR-407 and the BR-428 highways to demand the building of an overpass on the PE-638 highway, which gives access to rural communities.

assoc_actor_1: ANEF: National Association of Tax Employees; Labor Group (Chile)
notes: On 31 May 2023, in Temuco (Araucania), unionized public sector workers at CORFO (Production Development Corporation) and members of ANEF protested outside of their workplace demanding the resignation of the regional director, who is accused of labor mistreatment. 17 workers signed a letter addressed to the central level requesting the dismissal of the director.
On 31 May 2023, in Concepcion (Biobio), bus drivers protested at their workplace demanding the State increase a bonus payment. The workers held a work stoppage to express their dissatisfaction.

On 31 May 2023, in Valdivia (Los Rios), a group of cyclists and students at the Austral University of Chile protested in the city center demanding justice for a man who died after being run over last week and demanded greater road safety for cyclists in the commune.

On 31 May 2023, in Calama (Antofagasta), more than 700 unionized teachers marched through the streets demanding the Government to comply with their demands. Protesters stated that their demands include the payment of the historical debt, a retirement bonus, public education financing system, bonus payment to differential teachers, work overload and school violence. This protest takes place in the context of the national strike and marches organized by the College of Teachers Union.

On 31 May 2023, in Tocopilla (Antofagasta), unionized teachers marched through the city center towards the Presidential Delegation building demanding the Government to comply with their demands. Protesters handed a petition letter in which they demanded the payment of the historical debt and a solution to work overload, the retirement incentive bonus, among others. This protest takes place in the context of the national strike and marches organized by the College of Teachers Union.

On 31 May 2023, in Temuco (Araucania), around 800 unionized teachers from several communes of the region marched through the streets demanding President Boric to address their demands such as work overload, retirement bonus payments and the payment of the historical debt. This protest takes place in the context of the national strike and marches organized by the College of Teachers Union.

On 31 May 2023, in Puerto Montt (Los Lagos), teachers gathered at the former Regional Intendency building and marched towards the city hall demanding improvements in public education. The demands are the historical debt, work overload, the retirement incentive bonus, the double teacher evaluation and violence in schools. Teachers demanded President Gabriel Boric address these problems. This protest takes place in the context of the national strike and marches organized by the College of Teachers Union.

On 31 May 2023, in Valdivia (Los Rios), more than 600 unionized teachers from several communes of the region marched towards the Presidential Delegation building passing by the Seremi de Education demanding the government to fulfill its campaign promises. Protesters demand President Boric to comply with the payment of the historical debt, a payment of a retirement incentive bonus and other bonuses to teachers. Protesters handed a petition letter addressed to President Gabriel Boric. This protest takes place in the context of the national strike and marches organized by the College of Teachers Union.

On 31 May 2023, in Santiago (Metropolitana), unionized teachers marched through the streets against President Boric and demanded him to comply with announcements in education that he made in Public Account 2022. Protesters stated that within the eight initiatives proposed by the Government, four of them are pending. This protest takes place in the context of the national strike and marches organized by the College of Teachers Union.

On 31 May 2023, in San Antonio (Valparaiso), around 300 unionized teachers from several communes gathered at the College of Teachers' headquarters and marched towards the Presidential Delegation building against the Government's lack of response to their demands including the payment of the historical debt, the payment of the retirement incentive bonus, among others. Protesters handed a petition letter to President Gabriel Boric. This protest takes place in the context of the national strike and marches organized by the College of Teachers Union.

On 31 May 2023, in Quintero (Valparaiso), teachers members of the College of Teachers Union and locals protested at Codelco against repeated episodes of contamination that have affected the residents under the slogan 'Government, we are dying. Education without contamination'. The protest takes place in the context of the ceremony for the end of operations of the Ventanas de Codelco refinery. The day before, 46 people were affected after presenting health symptoms attributable to environmental contamination.

On 31 May 2023, in Concepcion (Biobio), a housing committee from Lomas Coloradas commune protested outside of the Regional Government during the public account event demanding economic resources to carry out a project on a three-hectare plot. Protesters stated that 110 families are waiting for this housing project. Protesters argued that the Governor promised to help them during the campaign.

On 31 May 2023, in Iquique (Tarapaca), locals protested at 21 de mayo square against the delays in the construction of a regional cancer center. Protesters stated that they have been waiting for more than 20 years for the construction of the facility and demanded concrete solutions.

On 31 May 2023, in Santiago - Penalolen (Metropolitana), tens of locals erected barricades and blocked the traffic on the Vespucio Sur avenue near the Los Presidentes Metro station in protest against the high costs of living. Protesters also demanded the departure of the Minister of Finance. Police arrived at the scene and dispersed the protesters.

On 31 May 2023, in Concepcion (Biobio), about 200 friends, relatives, students and women staged a candlelight vigil at Tribunales square demanding justice for a woman who was found dead after being 22 days missing. The body was found in Lirquen a week ago. The group of people began shouting 'not one less'. The group moved to O'Higgins street at Tucapel street where they blocked the traffic. Later they marched through Anibal Pinto street at O'Higgins street where they erected incendiary barricades with garbage cans and rubbish. Another barricade was erected on Caupolican street. Police dispersed the crowd using water cannons. The group returned to the square where the vigil continued.

On 31 May 2023, in Santiago - San Joaquin (Metropolitana), locals detained a suspected thief after he was accused of a robbery against a woman. The group took his clothes off and hit him while they waited for the police to arrive. The man has Venezuelan nationality and was denounced for stealing cell phones in the sector. Police recovered the object stolen from the woman.

assoc_actor_2: Former AUC: United Self-Defence Forces of Colombia
notes: On 31 May 2023, in Barrancabermeja (Santander), unidentified armed individuals shot and killed a former AUC member in his home in the Minas del Paraiso neighborhood. The perpetrators broke into the victim's house and opened fire. There are no further details on the motives for the attack or the possible perpetrators, but the area is known for the presence of armed groups. 1 fatality.

On 31 May 2023, in Cartagena (Bolivar), unidentified armed individuals shot and killed in a drive-by shooting a man in his home in the Olaya Herrera neighborhood. The victim was a former member of the Armed Forces, but was no longer enrolled in the Army. He was currently working as a welder. A photo of the victim was published on the Internet stating that this would happen to all people who helped the Gulf Clan member arrested on 17 April, known as 'Gomelo'.

Around 31 May 2023 (as reported), in the rural area of Campo Hermoso corregimiento (Caqueta), a man was killed and his body found on the road that connects the area to the municipal capital. There are no further details on the reasons for the attack or the possible perpetrators, but the area is known for the presence of armed groups. 1 fatality.

source: El Tiempo (Colombia); El Universal (Colombia); INDEPAZ; UNOCHA
notes: Around 31 May 2023 (as reported), in the rural area of Timba corregimiento (Cauca), the body of a man who had been abducted by an unidentified armed group on 28 May was found (coded separately). Two of the other victims abducted were found one day before in Jamundi, Valle del Cauca (coded separately). The victims were on vacation in Jamundi. Although the perpetrators have not been confirmed, the area is known for the presence of Jaime Martinez FARC dissident faction.

Around 31 May 2023 (as reported), in Aguas Blancas (Cesar), a man was killed and his dismembered body was found inside an abandoned house. Authorities suspect that the victim is a Venezuelan citizen reported missing in previous days. There are no further details about the attack or the possible perpetrators, but the area is known for the presence of armed groups. 1 fatality.

actor1: FARC Dissident - Dario Gutierrez Front: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia Dissident Faction (Dario Gutierrez Front)
notes: Property destruction: On 31 May 2023, in the rural area of Baraya municipality (Huila), militants of the Dario Gutierrez FARC dissident faction intercepted an unarmed military caravan that was on a humanitarian demining operation in the Rio Blanco vereda. They forced the soldiers to get out of the vehicle and then set it on fire. In addition, the gunmen stole communication equipment, detectors, soldiers' personal protective equipment, and other equipment.

actor2: FARC Dissident - Second Marquetalia: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia Dissident Faction (Segunda Marquetalia)
assoc_actor_2: FARC Dissident - CCO Front: Western Coordinating Command (CCO)
notes: Property destruction: Around 31 May 2023 (as reported), in Tumaco, Mosquera, Olaya Herrera and Santa Barabara de Iscuande municipalities (coded to Tumaco, Narino), military forces found and destroyed 10 coca production facilities belonging to the FARC dissident faction Segunda Marquetalia and CCO. More than 3.5 tons of cocaine were seized in the operation.

Property destruction: On 31 May 2023, in the Coast of Tumaco (Narino), military forces seized and destroyed 2 tons of cocaine being transported in a semi-submarine. There is no further information on who the drugs belonged to, but the armed groups operating in the area finance themselves through drug trafficking. Three Colombian nationals were arrested.

On 31 May 2023, in Bugalagrande (Valle del Cauca), nearly 400 Indigenous people blocked access to the municipal palace in protest against the lack of public investment to improve the community's health and housing conditions.

Around 31 May 2023 (as reported), in Santa Marta (Magdalena), Colombian and Venezuelan citizens protested against the poor service provided by local hospitals. People blocked the streets in two different areas of the city (near Cehoca and El Prado hospitals) to voice concern about poor medical procedures performed on their relatives in those institutions.
On 31 May 2023, in Sopetran (Antioquia), parents and teachers protested for the third consecutive day the poor management of the institution and demanded the resignation of the school principal.

On 31 May 2023, in Plato municipality (Magdalena), residents blocked a nearby road to protest increasing power outages in the town. Local business owners and community leaders participated in the protests.
On 31 May 2023, in Puerto Colombia municipality (Atlantico), residents blocked the Barranquilla - Puerto Colombia highway at the Los Papiros toll booth to demand the removal of the toll booth.
On 31 May 2023, in Bogota - Chapinero (Bogota, D.C.), citizens protested near the Hippies Park. There is no further information about this event.
On 31 May 2023, in Bogota - Usme (Bogota, D.C.), citizens protested in the Tv. 3b Este & Dg. 59 Sur. There is no further information about this event.

On 31 May 2023, in Duran (Guayas), unidentified assailants threw an explosive artifact at the Duran Transit Authority offices. The explosion damaged several windows, injured and killed an unknown number of workers of the entity. This attack happened days after the attack to the mayor of the city.

On 31 May 2023, in Chone Municipality (Manabi), residents of the El Monito sector captured and burned alive three men that were involved in criminal activities. They burned them inside of a car and where found the next the by police officers. 3 fatalities.

On 31 May 2023, in Portoviejo (Manabi), residents of the El Puno sector in Fatima neighborhood blocked the highway towards Pachinche with rocks, sticks and glasses as a demonstration to voice their concern about the tanks with potable water for their sector to come to their sector, claiming that they usually skip it.

On 31 May 2023, in Pirapey Km. 45 (Itapua), for the third consecutive day, Yerba Mate farmers partially blocked Route PY06 to demand better prices for the leaves. They said that the price was unilaterally fixed without consulting them.

On 31 May 2023, in Ayolas (Misiones), members of the Misiones Farmers Organization (OCM) demonstrated to demand the renewal of contracts for cleaning works in the city, payment to the organization's suppliers by the Yacyreta Binational Entity (EBY) and 367 food kits.

On 31 May 2023, in Santa Maria de Fe (Misiones), farmers of different local associations blocked the highway to demand the delivery of food kits by the Yacyreta Binational Entity (EBY). There have been delays in the delivery of said kits, which are part of agreements between farmers and the government regarding family agriculture.

assoc_actor_1: Teachers (Paraguay); OTEP-SN: Organization of Education Workers of Paraguay National Union
notes: On 31 May 2023, in Asuncion (Asuncion), teachers associated with OTEP-SN protested in front of the Ministry of Education to repudiate the killing of the principal of a school in El Guaira by one of the students of the institution. They also demanded a protection law and better working conditions for teachers and rejected the militarization of schools. They also protested against the lack of psychologists and student counselors in schools.
On 31 May 2023, in Huancavelica (Huancavelica), doctors from the Acobamba province staged a demonstration to demand the construction of a new hospital that has been pending for several years.

assoc_actor_1: PIT-CNT: Inter-Union Plenary of Workers - National Convention of Workers; Labor Group (Uruguay)
notes: On 31 May 2023, in Montevideo (Montevideo), PIT-CNT members marched from city hall to Independencia Square to protest against the drinking water shortage crisis the city is facing. They demanded answers from government authorities and claimed that the crisis is not being caused by droughts but by the state of the water pipes and the massive layoffs at the State Sanitary Works (OSE) company.

actor1: Police Forces of Venezuela (1999-) CPNB: National Bolivarian Police
notes: On 31 May 2023, in Barquisimeto (Lara), PNB police forces shot and killed two unidentified crime group suspects, during an armed confrontation in the Las Veritas sector, El Cuji neighborhood. The suspects resisted authority and opened fire on the officers. They were injured in the gunfire and pronounced dead in hospital. Police collected two guns. There is no further information at this point in time. 2 fatalities.

On 31 May 2023, in Valencia (Carabobo), a group of health workers of the Barrio Adentro Mission protested against the deteriorating medical infrastructure, and to demand better pay and working conditions. The protesters gathered outside the Carabobeno Health Institute Foundation (INSALUD) premises.

On 31 May 2023, in Puerto La Cruz (Anzoategui), a group of oil sector workers protested to demand the restoration of certain benefits, the implementation of medical insurance plans, and better housing. The protesters gathered outside the Puerto La Cruz Oil Refinery.

On 31 May 2023, in Ciudad Guayana (Bolivar), a group of workers at the state-owned Ferrominera Orinoco mining company (FMO) staged a walkout and protested over pay reductions, and the poor quality served at the company's canteen.

On 31 May 2023, in Valencia (Carabobo), a group of PCV political party members and representatives protested against the potential judicial intervention of their party. This decision depends on the Venezuelan Supreme Court of Justice (TSJ). The protesters argue that it is an attempt by the PSUV authorities to take over the PCV party, following political and ideological disagreements. The protesters gathered outside the Palace of Justice.

source: El Carabobeno; El Diario (Venezuela); La Patilla
notes: On 31 May 2023, in Valencia (Carabobo), a group of residents of the El Trigal neighborhood protested over power outages going on for more than 40 hours, outside the Carabobo state Governor's House. Police were present but there was no intervention.

source: Diario Version Final (Venezuela); Radio Fe y Alegria
notes: On 31 May 2023, in Rabito (Zulia), a group of residents of the Santo Negro and Laguna de Pajaro communities blocked the Troncal 6 road in protest over power outages which, according to them, have extended for over four years. The protesters demand new electric transformers and a solution for the outages.

source: Diario Version Final (Venezuela); Radio Fe y Alegria
notes: On 31 May 2023, in Sinamaica (Zulia), a group of residents of the Villa Kai community blocked the Troncal 6 road in protest over power outages which, according to them, have extended for over four years. The protesters demand new electric transformers and a solution for the outages.

assoc_actor_1: Labor Group (Argentina); UOM: Metallurgical Workers Union
notes: Around 31 May 2023 (week of), in Chovet (Santa Fe), metallurgical workers at the FIRMAT company, members of UOM, protested outside the premises of one of the company's plants. They demanded that the company pays social security for workers and they claimed that FIRMAT has not done so for around 10 years.

On 31 May 2023, in Manizales (Caldas), citizens protested against delays in the completion of a BMX track. Protesters asked authorities to finish the works as soon as possible so that they could use the space again.

Looting: Around 31 May 2023 (as reported), in Campo Dos (Norte de Santander), unidentified armed individuals intercepted a truck carrying military material and stole the cargo. Although the perpetrators have not been confirmed, the area is known for the presence of armed groups.

On 31 May 2023, in Lomas de Zamora (Buenos Aires), a group of residents and parents at the school threw stones at teachers in the Kindergarten number 941 as they were demonstrating to repudiate a case of sexual abuse inside the premises of the institution. There were no casualties.

On 31 May 2023, in the rural area of Segovia municipality (Antioquia), there was a clash between two unidentified armed groups. As a result, 77 residents of the area were forcibly displaced to Puerto Lopez, in El Bagre municipality, in the following days. Casualties unknown.

On 30 May 2023, in Mixco, Guatemala, unidentified individuals shot and killed a taxi driver in colonia El Tesoro, in zone 10. The motivation for the attack is unknown. No more detail is provided by the source. 1 fatality.

On 30 May 2023, in Georgetown, Demerara-Mahaica, a group of teachers called by the Guyana Teachers Union (GTU) formed a picket and held banners during a protest outside the Ministry of Finance to demand higher wages, among other claims.

Around 30 May 2023 (as reported), in Nueva Armenia, Francisco Morazan, a woman was shot and killed and her body was found tied up near a stream of water. The reason for the killing and the identity of the perpetrators remain unknown. 1 fatality.

On 30 May 2023, in San Pedro Sula, Cortes, several unidentified armed men shot and killed a man while working at a mechanic workshop located on the 32nd Street of the Montefresco neighborhood. The motive for the killing is believed to be related to extortion. 1 fatality.

On 30 May 2023, in San Pedro Sula, Cortes, residents of the Reparto Lempira neighborhood blocked the 27th street and burned tires in demonstration after experiencing three consecutive days without electricity. The prolonged power outage prompted the community to voice their frustration and demand a resolution to the situation.

On 30 May 2023, in Sabanitas, Colon, for the second consecutive day, firefighters staged a protest to demand the government complies with the agreement signed that implies salary increases and equipment for the force.

On 30 May 2023, in Chitre, Herrera, relatives of prisoners staged a protest by blocking the road to Pese to demand that authorities finalize the construction of the prison in the area and also asked for better detention conditions for their relatives. Most of the protesters were women.

assoc_actor_1: Health Workers (Argentina); ATE: Association of State Workers; Labor Group (Argentina)
location: San Fernando del Valle de Catamarca
notes: On 30 May 2023, in San Fernando del Valle de Catamarca (Catamarca), health workers associated with ATE demonstrated in the city center to demand a raise in salaries and better labor conditions and protested against labor precariousness.

On 30 May 2023, in Rosario (Santa Fe), taxi drivers caravanned from the Cochabamba with Pellegrini intersection to the Lions Palace to demand more controls from authorities to digital app transportation services and other illegal taxi services.

On 30 May 2023, in Banda del Rio Sali (Tucuman), factory workers of the sugar sector associated with the Tucuman Sugar Industry Workers Federation (FOTIA) protested outside the premises of a production plant and then marched to the Lucas Cordoba Bridge and blocked it. They were demanding better salaries and working conditions.

assoc_actor_1: Labor Group (Argentina); UOCRA: Construction Workers' Union of Argentina
notes: On 30 May 2023, in Rawson (Chubut), a group of construction workers associated with UOCRA protested outside the Provincial Housing Institute (IPV) to demand that the company in charge of the construction of a building in Trelew pays them the salaries they are owed. The company alleges that the salaries have not been paid because the IPV has not deposited the money, however, the IPV claims they have.

assoc_actor_1: Labor Group (Argentina); UTA: Union of Tramway Workers
notes: On 30 May 2023, in Ingeniero Maschwitz (Buenos Aires), tramway drivers of line 60 associated with UTA blocked the Pan-American highway to demand a raise in salaries amidst high inflation rates.
On 30 May 2023, in Trelew (Chubut), a dozen teachers associated with the Chubut's Education Workers Association (ATECH) marched to demand a raise in salaries.

On 30 May 2023, in Rio Gallegos (Santa Cruz), a group of teachers associated with the Santa Cruz Teacher's Association (ADOSAC) gathered to demand a raise in salaries outside the Boxing Club, where an event organized by the provincial government for the commemoration of the National Kindergarten and Kindergarten Teachers' Day was taking place.

Around 30 May 2023 (as reported), in Salta (Salta), a group of teachers marched throughout the city to demand better salaries and labor conditions. Health workers also joined the protest with similar demands. They also repudiated the arrest and repression against teachers during demonstrations carried out the previous week (coded separately).

On 30 May 2023, in San Salvador de Jujuy (Jujuy), friends and family of a woman killed in 2011 and members of women's organizations marched to the governor's officer to demand justice for the victim and to demand that the case is re-investigated as a femicide. They also protested against femicides in general.
On 30 May 2023, in Rosario (Santa Fe), friends and family of a man killed at a grocery store on 3 May protested in the Tiro Suizo neighborhood to demand justice for the victim.
On 30 May 2023, in Rosario (Santa Fe), residents in the Agote sector protested to demand more security in the city. They also called on citizens to get involved in fighting insecurity.
On 30 May 2023, in Ckochis (Chuquisaca), transportation drivers blocked the Sucre - Alcantari airport as a demonstration to demand maintenance on the highway.
On 30 May 2023, in Kora Kora (Chuquisaca), transportation drivers blocked the Sucre - Alcantari airport as a demonstration to demand maintenance on the highway.
On 30 May 2023, in Sucre (Chuquisaca), transportation drivers blocked the Sucre - Alcantari airport as a demonstration to demand maintenance on the highway.

On 30 May 2023, in Montero (Santa Cruz), for the second consecutive day, residents blocked the La Amistad Bridge as a demonstration to voice their concerns of the deaths that happened due to land conflicts in Santagro, and demanding justice to the victims of the attacks.

assoc_actor_1: Anace Indigenous Group (Brazil); Tapeba Indigenous Group (Brazil)
notes: On 30 May 2023, in Caucaia (Ceara), Anace and Tapeba Indigenous people blocked the BR-222 and the CE-085 highways to protest against the approval of a bill that changes procedures regarding the recognition and demarcation of indigenous territories.

actor1: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
notes: Around 30 May 2023 (as reported), in Sao Paulo - North Zone (Sao Paulo), military police officers forced an Afro-Brazilian man to eat a hashish cigarette in the Brasilandia neighborhood. The officers also physically attacked the victim and another man with punches and tore his clothes. There were no fatalities.

On 30 May 2023, in Avai (Sao Paulo), Indigenous Guarani communities held a demonstration on the road that connects Avai to Duartina, resisting Bill 490, which would weaken the demarcation of indigenous lands and could make further demarcation unviable. The demonstrators set fire to trees and branches to block the road.

actor2: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
notes: On 30 May 2023, in Sao Goncalo - Sao Goncalo (Rio de Janeiro), drug traffickers exchanged fire with military police officers in the Buraco Quente community, Trindade neighborhood. One suspect was shot and killed in the clash. Police seized a pistol, a motorcycle, and drugs. One suspect was arrested. 1 fatality.

On 30 May 2023, in Palhoca (Santa Catarina), about 70 Indigenous people blocked the BR-101 highway by setting obstacles on fire to demonstrate against the approval of a bill that aims to change procedures regarding the recognition and demarcation of indigenous territories.

On 30 May 2023, in Bom Jesus do Tocantins (Para), Gaviao Indigenous people blocked the BR-222 highway to protest against the approval of a bill that aims to change procedures regarding the recognition and demarcation of indigenous territories.

actor2: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
source: Agencia Brasil; Brasil de Fato; Folha de S. Paulo; G1; Ponte Jornalismo; R7
notes: On 30 May 2023, in Sao Paulo - North Zone (Sao Paulo), around 500 Guarani Mbya Indigenous people held a demonstration on the Bandeirantes highway at km 20, by the Jaragua neighborhood. The demonstrators resisted Bill 490, which weakens the demarcation of indigenous lands and could make further demarcation unviable. Demonstrators set fire to the road and blocked traffic. Military police officers fire rubber bullets and used tear gas and water jets to disperse demonstrators and free the highway for traffic, after which demonstrators continued demonstrating by walking along the road. The demonstrators defended themselves with bamboo shields, bows, and arrows and there was physical confrontation. At least five indigenous demonstrators were injured, of which one was hit in the forehead with a rubber bullet.

On 30 May 2023, in Parati (Rio de Janeiro), around 200 Indigenous people from various ethnic groups held a protest on km 583 of the Rio-Santos highway (BR-101), resisting Bill 490, which weakens the demarcation of indigenous lands and could make further demarcation unviable. Protesters placed logs on the road to block traffic, but ambulances were allowed to pass.

On 30 May 2023, in Aracruz (Espirito Santo), Indigenous people blocked the ES-257 and the ES-456 highways to protest against the approval of a bill that aims to change procedures regarding the recognition and demarcation of indigenous territories.

actor1: Police Forces of Brazil (2023-) Federal Police
