On 30 May 2023, in Belo Horizonte (Minas Gerais), a man was shot and injured in Ventosa community by two armed individuals. Two civilians were injured by stray bullets. There are no reports on the identity of the perpetrators or the attack's motivation.
On 30 May 2023, in Mesquita (Rio de Janeiro), unknown shooters exchanged fire in the Chatuba locality. Unknown casualties.
On 30 May 2023, in Nova Iguacu (Rio de Janeiro), unknown shooters exchanged fire in the Jardim Paraiso neighborhood. Unknown casualties.

On 30 May 2023, in Rio de Janeiro - North Zone (Rio de Janeiro), unknown shooters exchanged fire in the Morro da Serrinha community, Madureira neighborhood and the Sampaio neighborhood. Shooting was also heard in the Morro do Fuba community, Cascadura neighborhood. Unknown casualties.

On 30 May 2023, in Paulinia (Sao Paulo), Indigenous communities held a demonstration, blocking the Zeferino Vaz highway (SP-330) at km 117. The demonstrators resisted Bill 490, which weakens the demarcation of Indigenous lands and could make further demarcation unviable. They set fire to tires on the highway.

On 30 May 2023, in Cuiaba (Mato Grosso), app delivery workers gathered in front of a funeral home and honked their horns to demand justice for the case of a delivery worker who was hit by a car and did not survive the injuries.

On 30 May 2023, in Brasilia (Distrito Federal), Paraguayan people who worked at the construction of the Itaipu hydroelectric plant gathered in front of the Itamaraty Palace to demand payment of labor rights from the Paraguayan government, during a meeting of southern cone chiefs of state.

On 30 May 2023, in Autazes (Amazonas), Mura Indigenous people carried out a protest on the AM-254 highway, near the Sao Felix community, against the approval of a bill that aims to change procedures regarding the recognition and demarcation of indigenous territories.

On 30 May 2023, in Vitoria (Espirito santo), students at a federal university blocked the access to the Goiabeiras and Maruipe campuses to protest against the closing of a university restaurant, following a protest about the food quality on 29 May 2023 (coded separately).

Around 30 May 2023 (as reported), in Estancia (Sergipe), a man was killed by drug traffickers and his body was found in the Porto d'Areia neighborhood. The victim had been missing since April 2023. According to investigations, the victim was a drug user and was killed by drug traffickers because he stole portions of drugs. Two suspects were arrested. 1 fatality.
On 30 May 2023, in Aracaju (Sergipe), municipal teachers gathered in front of the Municipal Chamber to demand salary readjustment.
On 30 May 2023, in Araripina (Pernambuco), municipal teachers gathered in the Frei Ibiapina square to demand salary readjustment and a new career plan.

actor1: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
notes: On 30 May 2023, in Benevides (Para), three drug trafficking suspects exchanged fire with military police in the Murinin region. One drug trafficker was killed and the others escaped. Police seized a firearm and portions of drugs. 1 fatality.

On 30 May 2023, in Sao Joao das Missoes (Minas Gerais), about 40 Xakriaba Indigenous people blocked the MGC-135 highway to protest against the approval of a bill that aims to change procedures regarding the recognition and demarcation of indigenous territories.

On 30 May 2023, in Brasilia (Distrito Federal), five Venezuelan people gathered in front of the Itamaraty Palace to protest against the presence of Nicolas Maduro in a meeting of southern cone chiefs of state.
On 30 May 2023, in Presidente Medici (Maranhao), about 100 people blocked the BR-316 highway to protest against the closing of a hospital in the city.

On 30 May 2023, in Sao Luiz (Roraima), a man was shot and killed by an armed individual who invaded his private residence. The victim used to belong to a drug trafficking group and had been receiving death threats since he took part in the killing of a gang member (circumstances not reported). 1 fatality.

On 30 May 2023, in Manaus - South Zone (Amazonas), hundreds of people gathered in the Sao Sebastiao region in the Centro neighborhood to protest against the approval of a bill that aims to change procedures regarding the recognition and demarcation of indigenous territories.

actor1: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
source: Folha de S. Paulo; G1; R7
notes: On 30 May 2023, in Igarata (Sao Paulo), a military police officer physically assaulted a female and two male civilians with punches after an argument about land property. The civilians had minor injuries. There were no fatalities.

actor1: Police Forces of Brazil (2023-) Federal Police
notes: Property destruction: On 30 May 2023, in Dourados municipality (Mato Grosso do Sul), federal police forces seized 1.1 tons of marijuana hidden inside a truck following a chase on the BR-463 highway. No arrests were made.

Around 30 May 2023 (as reported), in the rural area of Carutapera municipality (Maranhao), a man was killed by unknown individuals and his body was found inside a burnt car. Circumstances of death are unknown. 1 fatality.

On 30 May 2023, in Igarassu (Pernambuco), armed individuals in a car intercepted a taxi and opened fire against its five occupants in a drive-by shooting on the PE-035 highway. The taxi driver lost control of the vehicle and crashed it. The driver and a passenger were killed, and two more passengers were injured. There are no reports on the identity of the perpetrators or the attack's motivation. 2 fatalities.

actor1: Police Forces of Brazil (2023-) Federal Police
notes: Property destruction: On 30 May 2023, in Foz do Iguacu (Parana), federal police seized one ton of marijuana hidden inside a truck during an inspection. One person was arrested.

actor1: Police Forces of Brazil (2023-) Federal Police
notes: Property destruction: On 30 May 2023, in Ponta Grossa (Parana), federal police seized 450,000 packs of smuggled cigarettes hidden inside a truck during an inspection on the BR-376 highway. No arrests were made.

On 30 May 2023, in Foz do Iguacu (Parana), a suspected thief was tied up, beaten up, and injured by residents in the Vila Yolanda neighborhood. The victim was taken to a police station and later released.

Around 30 May 2023 (as reported), in Novo Hamburgo (Rio Grande do Sul), a man was killed by unknown individuals and his body was found in the Lomba Grande neighborhood with gunshot wounds. The victim was wearing a monitoring anklet (charges not reported). The attack had the characteristics of an execution. 1 fatality.

On 30 May 2023, in Camacari (Bahia), people blocked the BR-101 highway to protest against the approval of a bill that changes procedures regarding the recognition and demarcation of indigenous territories.

On 30 May 2023, in Aracruz (Espirito Santo), Indigenous people blocked the ES-010 highway by setting obstacles on fire to demonstrate against the approval of a bill that aims to change procedures regarding the recognition and demarcation of indigenous territories.

On 30 May 2023, in Belem (Para), unknown armed individuals opened fire against five members of an organized criminal group in the Marco neighborhood. Two members were killed, two more were injured and the fifth was arrested. According to police the group was planning to carry out attacks against state agents. 2 fatalities.

On 30 May 2023, in Barra Velha (Porto Seguro, Bahia), a Pataxo Indigenous man was shot and injured in the Barra Velha region by at least seven unknown armed individuals. The area where the attack occurred is being disputed by Indigenous people and farmers.

On 30 May 2023, in San Antonio (Valparaiso), patients and health workers protested at a local Hospital against dismissals due to lack of resources in public health service. In other health centers, workers expressed their dissatisfaction with the measure with posters and black balloons, but in the 30 de Marzo Hospital a spontaneous protest was carried out by patients in support of those dismissed. Some health workers will cease their functions at the end of the day and will leave 80 patients, including older adults without home care.

On 30 May 2023, in Iquique (Tarapaca), unionized teachers and workers at Humberstone school gathered in front of the city hall and marched with banners towards Prat square showing their dissatisfaction for not reaching an agreement with the Nebraska Foundation regarding collective contracts. The protest received support from parents and representatives of students that gave funds to maintain the strike.

On 30 May 2023, in Valparaiso (Valparaiso), hundreds of unionized teachers members of College of Teachers Union gathered at Sotomayor square and marched towards the Local Public Education Service (SLEP) in protest against poor infrastructure in several schools. Protesters stated that more than 30 schools have rooms that get rained on which will be a serious problem when winter arrives.

On 30 May 2023, in Curanilahue commune (Biobio), 150 unemployed women members of the Fuerza de Mujer Union blocked Route 160 demanding the continuity of employment programs. The protest took place near the Villa Alegre de Curanilahue roundabout. The blockade caused heavy traffic for more than two hours. Protesters stated that they had meetings with the Presidential Delegate but nothing has been solved.

On 30 May 2023, in Caucasia (Antioquia), suspected members of the Los Caparros opened fire in a drive-by shooting against a local store, killing a young worker at the store. Authorities believe the incident is related to an extortion payment. 1 fatality.

source: El Espectador; El Tiempo (Colombia); El Universal (Colombia); UNOCHA
notes: Around 30 May 2023 (as reported), in the rural area of Jamundi municipality (Valle del Cauca), the bodies of two out of three men who had been abducted by an unidentified armed group on 28 May (coded separately) were found near the Potrerito area. One of the victims' remains was located in the rural area of Timba, Cauca one day later (coded separately). The victims were on vacation in the area. Although the perpetrators have not been confirmed, the area is known for the presence of Jaime Martinez FARC dissident faction and Gulf Clan.

actor1: FARC Dissident - 1st Front: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia Dissident Faction (1st Front - Armando Rios)
notes: Security measures: Around 30 May 2023 (as reported), in Cartagena Del Chaira municipality (Caqueta), a dissident FARC faction of the EMC (also known as Frente Primero Armando Rios) introduced a system of identification cards for residents in the area. Civilians are forced to prove their identity by means of a document provided by the armed group and those who do not do so are forced to pay a fine.

Property destruction: Around 30 May 2023 (as reported), in San Roque (Norte de Santander), police forces found and seized a truck, three small vehicles and 10,500 gallons of gasoline belonging to the ELN. The seized materials were used for cocaine production.

Property destruction: On 30 May 2023, in the rural area of Buritica municipality (Antioquia), unidentified armed individuals set fire to two vehicles that belonged to the Zijin-Continental Gold mining company. There are no further details on the potential perpetrators, but the company had reported multiple attacks in the past by armed groups demanding payment of money to work in the area.

Around 30 May 2023, in Ibague (Tolima), rioters beat a man suspected of being involved in child sexual abuse. The victim was drawn to a house after a child reported to his parents that the man had contacted him by cell phone. There, the child's family carried out the attack. The man managed to escape the group and fled. There were no fatalities.
On 30 May 2023, in Cienaga (Magdalena), municipal workers protested delays in the payment of their wages. The group blocked the Troncal de occidente highway and urged the authorities to pay the debt.
On 30 May 2023, in Pereira (Risaralda), students and their parents protested at a local school to demand the removal of television antennas that are at risk of falling on the school building.
On 30 May 2023, in Sopetran (Antioquia), parents and teachers protested for the second consecutive day the poor management of the institution and demanded the resignation of the school principal.
On 30 May 2023, in Bogota - Teusaquillo (Bogota, D.C.), people marched from Cll 29 and 19 B Avenue to Caracas Avenue and 52nd Street to protest. There is no further information about this event.

On 30 May 2023, between San Gil and Cabrera municipalities (coded to San Gil, Santander), for the second consecutive day residents from the Cucharo, Volador and Ojo de Agua veredas (San Gil) and some residents from Cabrera blocked the road that connects both locations to protest against the bad state of the road caused by heavy trucks.

source: El Colombiano; La Voz del Rio Arauca
notes: On 30 May 2023, in the rural area of Saravena municipality (Arauca), the Cano Limon - Juncali oil pipeline was attacked with an explosive device near the La Pava vereda. There are no further details about the perpetrators but the area is known for the presence of armed groups. There were no casualties.

On 30 May 2023, in Quito - Eugenio Espejo (Pichincha), students at the Central university marched through the city as a demonstration to demand more security due to the increase of criminal activity in the city.

On 30 May 2023, in Ciudad del Este (Alto Parana), supporters of a CN elected senator protested in front of the city's justice palace to demand the release of the politician who is under arrest over his involvement in a robbery in October 2019, over leading a group of Indigenous people who attacked a family and its property in August 2022, and for being suspected of sexually abusing a minor.

On 30 May 2023, in Pirapey Km. 45 (Itapua), for the second consecutive day, Yerba Mate farmers partially blocked Route PY06 to demand better prices for the leaves. They said that the price was unilaterally fixed without consulting them.

assoc_actor_1: Health Workers (Paraguay); APE: Paraguayan Nursing Association
notes: On 30 May 2023, in Asuncion (Asuncion), around 50 nurses associated with APE protested outside the Ministry of Health demanding that the more than 1,100 professionals who participated in a contest to enter the nursing professional career but despite having achieved the minimum score required were left out are allowed to enter without any further contest. They also claim there were irregularities in the contest.

On 30 May 2023, in Asuncion (Asuncion), unionized retired workers protested in front of the Social Security Institute (IPS) to protest against what they call the squandering of resources at the institution and against the bad quality of the healthcare service provided. They also demanded a meeting with members of the IPS administrative council.
On 30 May 2023, in Acora district (Puno), farmers staged a demonstration to demand the closure of congress, calling for general elections, and for the resignation of President Dina Boluarte.

On 30 May 2023, in Ica (Ica), hundreds of public sector workers staged outside the Regional Government offices to demand the fulfilment of their collective contract agreements that they have been waiting for months, that include payments of benefits, provisions of uniforms, basic baskets and transportation.

On 30 May 2023, in Chimbote (Ancash), unionized provincial municipal workers staged a demonstration outside the provincial government to voice their grievance about the representatives of the mayor backing down on their proposal of a raise to the workers salaries. They claimed that the local authorities and representatives are mocking them.

On 30 May 2023, in Puno (Puno), Bellavista market merchants staged a demonstration in front of the Santa Rosa police station to demand the release of two merchants that were arrested for having contraband.

On 30 May 2023, in Ilave (Puno), Aymara Indigenous residents blocked the South Pan-American highway with burning tires as a demonstration to demand the closure of Congress, calling for general elections, and the resignation of President Dina Boluarte.

On 30 May 2023, in Yunguyo province (Puno), residents staged a demonstration to demand the closure of congress, calling for general elections, and for the resignation of President Dina Boluarte.

Around 30 May 2023 (as reported), in Sabana Grande (Trujillo), CICPC police forces shot and killed an unidentified crime group suspect, during an armed confrontation in the La Plaza sector, Granados parish. The suspect resisted authority and opened fire on the officers. He was injured in the gunfire and pronounced dead in hospital. The man was being investigated for a theft carried out a few days earlier, and was linked to extortion and other thefts. Police seized two vehicles. 1 fatality.

source: Diario Primicia; El Diario de Guayana
notes: Around 30 May 2023, in Ciudad Guayana (Bolivar), a man was shot and killed, and his body found with tied hands and feet, in the Chirica parish in San Felix. It is thought that the killing is a settling of scores, involving criminal activity. 1 fatality.

On 30 May 2023, in Porlamar (Nueva Esparta), a group of demonstrators, including retired state workers, pensioners, and unionists, protested to demand better pensions, and improved access to medicines and healthcare. The demonstrators gathered outside the Ombudsman Office.

source: OVCS: Observatorio Venezolano de Conflictividad Social
notes: On 30 May 2023, in Bolivar state (coded to Ciudad Bolivar), demonstrators protested with unspecified demands on issues related to labor, healthcare, and housing.
