notes: On 30 May 2023, in Valencia (Carabobo), a group of renal patients blocked the Las Ferias Avenue in protest over the constant power outages that hinders their dialysis procedures.

On 30 May 2023, in Barquisimeto (Lara), a group of human rights activists gathered outside the Ombudsman Office in protest over the continuous power outages and fluctuations in the area, and demanded the Ombudsman to intervene for them in finding a solution.

source: OVCS: Observatorio Venezolano de Conflictividad Social
notes: On 30 May 2023, in Miranda state (coded to Los Teques), demonstrators protested with unspecified demands on issues related to labor, healthcare, and housing.

source: OVCS: Observatorio Venezolano de Conflictividad Social
notes: On 30 May 2023, in Sucre state (coded to Cumana), demonstrators protested with unspecified demands on issues related to labor, healthcare, and housing.

On 30 May 2023, in the rural area of Tulua municipality (Valle del Cauca), unidentified armed individuals shot and killed two men in Mateguadua corregimiento. The perpetrators broke into the victims' house, locked the women in the bathroom, and shot dead both victims. Although the perpetrators and motivation for the attack have not been confirmed, the area is known for the presence of the FARC dissident faction Adan Izquierdo. 2 fatalities.

On 30 May 2023, in Montevideo (Montevideo), workers at the ANCAP company protested on 18 de Julio Avenue and Independencia Square to demand that the public bidding for Portland Cement is suspended. They claim that the bidding is unconstitutional.

On 30 May 2023, in Maringa (Parana), a man was shot more than 30 times and killed on the Sao Paulo avenue by armed individuals. The victim had a police record for robbery and drug trafficking. The victim had recently moved to the city from Curitiba due to death threats. Three suspects were arrested. Attack motivation is unknown. 1 fatality.

On 30 May 2023, between the cities of Manacapuru and Novo Airao (Amazonas), a member of a drug trafficking group was shot 10 times and killed at a bar on the AM-352 highway by three members of a rival group, who then fled with a fourth accomplice in a car. The perpetrators checked the victim's identity before opening fire. The victim had recently moved from Manaus due to death threats. 1 fatality.

On 30 May 2023, in Araguaina (Tocantins), a man was shot and killed in the Jardim Paulista sector by two drug traffickers due to a drug debt. The victim was a drug user. One suspect was arrested on 23 June 2023. 1 fatality.

On 29 May 2023, in Santa Cruz Mulua, Retalhuleu, farmers staged a protest by blocking the CA-2 West at the height of KM 178 to demand that the local governments that social programs and projects do not politicize their activities. Protesters argued that, ahead of the elections in June 2023, politicians only comply when the beneficiaries belong to their political party.

On 29 May 2023, in Retalhuleu municipality, Retalhuleu, people staged a protest against the decision of the Administrative Court that provided the suspension of the political party Citizen Prosperity in the 2023 elections. Protesters, mostly supporters of the Citizen Prosperity political party demonstrated by blocking the Castillo Armas bridge.

source: Kaieteur News; Loop News St. Lucia
notes: On 29 May 2023, in Georgetown, Demerara-Mahaica, a group of citizens held a protest in front of the office of the President, on Vlissingen Road, to demand the resignation of several ministers. This claim was demanded after a fire killed 19 children at a secondary school on 21 May. The protest was held while the main suspect responsible for the fire was having his first court appearance.

On 29 May 2023, outside La Labor, Ocotepeque, four unidentified armed men broke into a house and kidnapped an underage boy, leaving his mother tied up, in the community of San Juan. The motive behind the abduction remains unknown. The boy was found by police forces two days later in good health state. There were no fatalities.

On 29 May 2023, in Tegucigalpa, Francisco Morazan, two unidentified armed men shot and killed a man in a narrow alleyway between the La Estanzuela and Canaan neighborhoods. The reason for the killing is unknown. 1 fatality.

Property destruction: On 29 May 2023, outside Limon, Colon, military forces seized a coca plantation measuring around 7.7 hectares and containing around 90,000 coca bushes and a drug processing lab in a mountainous area around the municipality known as El Escondido.
On 29 May 2023, in El Chichicaste, El Paraiso, a group of students and parents from the Jose Trinidad Reyes school protested denouncing the lack of teachers in their educational establishment.

On 29 May 2023, in La Libertad, Comayagua, a group of moto-taxi drivers protested outside the town hall, demanding better regulation and distribution of their vehicles. They called on the Honduran Institute of Land Transportation (IHTT) to prohibit moto-taxis without legal operating permits from circulating.
On 29 May 2023, outside La Ceiba, Atlantida, communities from Esparta and Ceibita protested on the city's outskirts demanding job security for local doctors.

On 29 May 2023, in Tegucigalpa, Francisco Morazan, a group of parents of students attending the Alduvin Diaz Bonilla educational center in the Sagastume neighborhood, protested on the road towards the department of Olancho demanding the appointment of three teachers.

On 29 May 2023, in San Pedro Sula, Cortes, a group of residents of the Jucutuma and Ticamaya neighborhoods blocked traffic and burned tires in demonstration against power outages in the area, demanding a prompt restoration of electricity to their households.
On 29 May 2023, in Sabanitas, Colon, firefighters staged a protest to demand that the government complies with the agreement signed that implies salary increases and equipment for the force.

On 29 May 2023, in Candelaria de la Frontera, Santa Ana, a member of Barrio 18 Surenos beat a man to death and threw his body in the Morro River. The motivation for the attack is unknown. The gang member was arrested the following day. 1 fatality.

On 29 May 2023, in San Salvador, San Salvador, members of popular organizations staged an anti-government demonstration in the Cuscatlan Square Park on the occasion of the fourth year anniversary of the Bukele administration. The protest was organized by the social movement the Bloc of Resistance and Popular Rebellion (BRP).

On 29 May 2023, in Rosario (Santa Fe), members of the CCC marched to city hall to demand more works and housing projects for the neighborhoods that create jobs for residents. They also demanded meetings with authorities.

assoc_actor_1: Labor Group (Argentina); MTE: Excluded Workers Movement
notes: On 29 May 2023, in Rosario (Santa Fe), informal recyclers associated with MTE gathered outside the Department of Environment and Public Space to demand for their inclusion in the formal recycling system of the city. They also demanded compliance with agreements reached in the past.

On 29 May 2023, in La Plata - Manuel B. Gonnet (Buenos Aires), students and parents at School number 12 protested outside the premises of the institution against the lack of heating, and over infrastructure problems at the school.

On 29 May 2023, in La Plata - Tolosa (Buenos Aires), students, teachers and parents at High School number 11 demonstrated outside the premises of the school against the institution's lack of heating, and over infrastructure problems.

On 29 May 2023, in Trelew (Chubut), students and teachers at a night school number 784 marched to the Regional Unit to demand more security and more presence of police officers around the institution. This happened after a teacher at the school was the victim of a violent robbery when she was leaving the premises.

On 29 May 2023, in Florencio Varela (Buenos Aires), friends and family of a child who died after being run over by a car marched to the municipality and the prosecutor's office to demand justice and the arrest of the driver.

On 29 May 2023, in Encon (San Juan), a group of parents at the Albergue School protested outside the premises of the institution because their children are taking classes in a school hall due to the lack of classrooms.

On 29 May 2023, in Las Rosas (Santa Fe), a group of residents marched to show their support to the mayor and to demand to municipal workers to stop the occupation of the municipal property where the provision of public services is programmed and coordinated as part of a strike over the settlement of salaries.

On 29 May 2023, in Las Rosas (Santa Fe), police officers evicted a group of municipal workers who had occupied the municipal property where the provision of public services is programmed and coordinated as part of a strike over the settlement of salaries. Police officers used tear gas and rubber bullets and clashed with the workers. There were no casualties.
On 29 May 2023, in Colcapirhua (Cochabamba), residents blocked a highway as a demonstration to demand the widening of the highway near a company of Tiquipaya sector.

On 29 May 2023, in Montero (Santa Cruz), residents blocked the La Amistad Bridge as a demonstration to voice their concerns of the deaths that happened due to land conflicts in Santagro, and demanding justice to the victims of the attacks.

On 29 May 2023, in Trinidad (Beni), residents staged a demonstration to demand lower costs in electricity bills. They demanded also the resignation of authorities in charge of the electricity services.

actor1: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
notes: On 29 May 2023, in Lauro de Freitas (Bahia), members of the BDM exchanged fire with military police during a patrol in the Itinga neighborhood. The BDM members escaped. There were no fatalities.

source: Agencia Brasil; Folha de S. Paulo; R7
notes: On 29 May 2023, in Sao Paulo - Central Zone (Sao Paulo), Iraqi and Lebanese shopkeepers rioted on 25 de Marco Street in the historic center. Rioters physically fought and used bottles and knives, while a security guard fired shots into the air to restore order. The fight was motivated by a debt collection issue between shopkeepers. At least one person was injured by a knife. There were no fatalities.

On 29 May 2023, in Caruaru (Pernambuco), a man was shot and killed inside a commercial establishment in the Severino Afonso neighborhood by two armed individuals. The victim was working at the shop when the attack occurred. The shop owner was injured by stray bullets. There are no reports on the identity of the perpetrators or the attack's motivation. 1 fatality.

On 29 May 2023, in Caruaru (Pernambuco), two men were shot and killed in the Santa Rosa neighborhood by two armed individuals who invaded their private residence. The perpetrators introduced themselves as police agents. Authorship and motivation of the attack are unknown. 2 fatalities.

On 29 May 2023, in Pendencias (Rio Grande do Norte), a man was abducted by armed individuals and forced into a car. Hours later, the victim's body was found in the Vila Tocantins district, rural area of Porto do Mangue municipality, with gunshot wounds. Authorship and motivation of the attack are unknown. 1 fatality.

actor2: Police Forces of Brazil (2023-) Federal Police
notes: On 29 May 2023, in Rio de Janeiro - North Zone (Rio de Janeiro), drug traffickers opened fire on and injured a federal highway police officer on the BR-040 highway by the Cidade Alta neighborhood. There were no fatalities.

On 29 May 2023, in Cuiaba (Mato Grosso), hundreds of app delivery workers blocked the Fernando Correa avenue by setting obstacles on fire and then carried out a motorcade to demand justice for the case of a delivery worker who was hit by a car and did not survive the injuries.

On 29 May 2023, in Sao Paulo - Central Zone (Sao Paulo), Indigenous communities held a protest in the Largo Sao Francisco neighborhood, resisting Bill 490, which weakens the demarcation of indigenous lands and could make further demarcation unviable.
On 29 May 2023, in Campos dos Goytacazes (Rio de Janeiro), unknown suspects exchanged fire in the Aeroporto neighborhood, Guarus district. Unknown casualties.
On 29 May 2023, in Rio de Janeiro - Central Zone (Rio de Janeiro), unknown shooters exchanged fire in the Centro neighborhood, near Cinelandia. Unknown casualties.

On 29 May 2023, in Rio de Janeiro - North Zone (Rio de Janeiro), unknown shooters exchanged fire in the Morro do Juramento community, Vicente de Carvalho neighborhood, and in the Manguinhos, Guadalupe, and Bras de Pina neighborhoods. Shooting was also heard in the Sereno Complex, near the Morro do Sereno and Morro da Fe communities in the Penha neighborhood. Unknown casualties.

On 29 May 2023, in Rio de Janeiro - West Zone (Rio de Janeiro), unknown shooters exchanged fire in the Senador Camara and Cidade de Deus neighborhoods. Shooting was also heard near the Praca da Associacao community, Rio das Pedras neighborhood. Unknown casualties.

actor1: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
notes: On 29 May 2023, in Pocoes (Bahia), four drug traffickers exchanged fire with military police forces during an operation in the Bela Vista housing complex. All four drug traffickers were killed. Police seized firearms, gun chargers, ammunition, a knife, and a cell phone. 4 fatalities.
On 29 May 2023, in Recife (Pernambuco), carters carried out a protest against the seizure of their carts by City Hall. A municipal bill suspended animal-pulled carts in the city.
On 29 May 2023, in Itabela (Bahia), members of the MST carried out a march to protest against the enforcement of an eviction order.

assoc_actor_1: Police Forces of Brazil (2023-) Civil Police
notes: On 29 May 2023, in Recife (Pernambuco), civil police officers gathered at Derby square to demand salary readjustment and better working conditions.

On 29 May 2023, in Sao Paulo - East Zone (Sao Paulo), students at a state school in the Jardins Recanto das Rosas neighborhood held a protest demanding for the electricity in the school to repaired after two months, after thieves stole power wires.
On 29 May 2023, in Vitoria (Espirito Santo), students at a federal university gathered in front of the campus restaurant to protest against poor quality and high prices of the food served on campus.
On 29 May 2023, in Curitiba (Parana), students at a state school in the Boqueirao neighborhood carried out a protest against the removal of the school's director by the state department of education.

On 29 May 2023, in Caucaia (Ceara), a woman was shot and killed in the Conjunto Metropolitano neighborhood by members of a drug trafficking group. The group was looking for a relative of the victim, but since they were not found the group killed the woman instead. 1 fatality.
tags: women targeted: relatives of targeted groups or persons

notes: On 29 May 2023, in Assari (Barra do Bugres, Mato Grosso), a man was shot and killed by a drug trafficker due to a drug debt. The drug trafficker was arrested. The victim's brother, in revenge for his death, shot and injured the wife and child of the drug trafficker. 1 fatality.
On 29 May 2023, in Manaus - West Zone (Amazonas), state teachers blocked the Brasil avenue to demand salary readjustment and better working conditions.

actor1: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
notes: On 29 May 2023, in Senador Canedo (Goias), a member of a drug trafficking group exchanged fire with military police forces during a patrol on the GO-536 highway. The drug trafficker was killed. Police seized a firearm and a stolen motorcycle. 1 fatality.
On 29 May 2023, in Presidente Medici (Maranhao), people blocked the BR-316 highway by setting obstacles on fire to demonstrate against the closing of a hospital in the city.

On 29 May 2023, in Campina Grande (Paraiba), informal sellers gathered in front of a park and set obstacles on fire to demonstrate against their relocation by City Hall. The demonstrators demanded to be allowed to sell their products in the square.

On 29 May 2023, in Nanuque (Minas Gerais), a man was shot and killed by unknown armed individuals in the Sao Geraldo neighborhood. The victim was a drug user, which is why police believe in drug trafficking disputes as the attack motivation. 1 fatality.
On 29 May 2023, in Sao Paulo - East Zone (Sao Paulo), residents held a protest outside the Sao Mateus General Hospital, denouncing a lack of personnel, especially nurses.

On 29 May 2023, in Itacoatiara (Amazonas), a man was shot more than eight times and killed in a drive-by shooting in the Mamoud Amed neighborhood by two armed individuals on a motorcycle. Authorship and motivation are unknown. 1 fatality.

Around 29 May 2023 (as reported), in Santarem (Para), a man was killed and decapitated by unknown individuals and his body was found in the Piraquara community. Three suspects were detained and admitted they took the head to the person who ordered the killing as proof of the attack. The head was retrieved. Attack motivation is unknown. 1 fatality.

On 29 May 2023, in Alfredo Chaves (Espirito Santo), a man was shot more than 20 times (which indicates an execution) and killed in the Aparecida region by two armed individuals who invaded his private residence. There are no reports on the identity of the perpetrators or the attack's motivation. 1 fatality.

On 29 May 2023, in Punta Arenas (Magallanes), more than 60 vehicles in which fishing industry workers and local transporters held a caravan protest demanding a response from the Government on the future of aquaculture activity in the Magallanes region. The protesters passed through several streets around the city, and stopped outside of the house of President Boric's parents. Protesters showed their concern about the Law that creates the Biodiversity and Protected Areas Service which includes the exclusion of fishing activity and aquaculture in protected areas.

On 29 May 2023, in San Antonio (Valparaiso), health workers protested outside the Community Respiratory Center against a massive dismissal of workers in the municipal health centers. Protesters stated that the dismissed workers are 70 and the mayor assured that they are 55. Protesters argued that the situation is due to a smaller amount of economic resources and that they suffered work overload. Workers also demanded an increase in the budget.

On 29 May 2023, in Valparaiso (Valparaiso), students and teachers protested outside of the Technical High School against lack of resources and poor infrastructure. The school began a three-day strike agreed by the teachers, education assistants, students and parents, who also demanded the Valparaiso Local Public Education Service (SLEP) to address their demands.

actor1: FARC Dissident - Carlos Patino Front: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia Dissident Faction (Carlos Patino Front)
notes: Around 29 May 2023 (as reported), in El Plateado (Argelia, Cauca), militants of the Carlos Patino FARC dissident faction shot and killed a bar owner after the victim denied to play the music requested by the armed men. 1 fatality.

actor1: FARC Dissident: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia Dissident Faction
notes: Around 29 May 2023, in Calamar municipality (Guaviare), two suspected FARC dissident faction militants shot and killed a man, a social leader, who was recognized as one of the founders of San Miguel vereda. The victim was walking through the center of San Miguel when armed men opened fire on the victim when he refused to get on his motorcycle. 1 fatality.

source: Diario La Libertad; El Colombiano; El Tiempo (Colombia); INDEPAZ
notes: On 29 May 2023, in Soledad (Atlantico), unidentified armed individuals shot and killed three people in an attack in the Vina Rey neighborhood. Among the victims was a child, and a man with a criminal record for belonging to the ELN, but it is unclear whether he was still a member of this armed group. There are no further details on the potential perpetrators. 3 fatalities.

On 29 May 2023, in the rural area of Buritica municipality (Antioquia), unidentified armed individuals shot and injured a worker of the Zijin-Continental Gold mining company. The company had reported multiple attacks in the past by armed groups demanding payment of money to work in the area. There were no fatalities.

Around 29 May 2023 (as reported), in El Doncello (Caqueta), unidentified armed individuals shot and killed a man in the Camilo Torres neighborhood. The victim was a well-known musician in the area. There are no further details on the reasons for the attack or the possible perpetrators, but the area is known for the presence of armed groups. 1 fatality.

Around 29 May 2023 (as reported), in the rural area of Caloto municipality (Cauca), a young man was killed and his body was found near the El Nilo area. There are no further details on the reasons for the attack or potential perpetrators, but the area is known for the presence of FARC dissident factions.

Around 29 May 2023, in Calamar municipality (Guaviare), a man was killed and his body was found with multiple signs of torture near the Miraflores sector. There are no further details on the reasons for the attack or the possible perpetrators, but the area is known for the presence of armed groups. 1 fatality.

assoc_actor_1: FARC Dissident - Dagoberto Ramos: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia Dissident Faction (Dagoberto Ramos)
notes: Movement of forces: Around 29 May 2023 (as reported), in the rural area of Totoro municipality (Cauca), ELN militants interrupted a community activity and informed those present of their plan to patrol the territory in order to counter the actions of other armed groups. Residents expressed their fear of possible confrontations in Jambalo, Caldono and Silvia, as members of FARC dissident Dagoberto Ramos have been patrolling the Las Vueltas vereda.

actor1: FARC Dissident: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia Dissident Faction
notes: Property destruction: On 29 May 2023, in the rural area of Caldono municipality (Cauca), suspected militants FARC dissident faction set fire to a civilian vehicle driving on the route to Cali. The armed men intercepted the victim, forced him out of the car before burning it down.

Property destruction: On 29 May 2023, in the rural area of Pescador corregimiento (Cauca), three unidentified armed men set fire to a civilian vehicle. The perpetrators, who were dressed in military uniforms, intercepted the victim near the Puente Real vereda, forced him to get out of the car and then set it on fire. Although the perpetrators have not been confirmed, the area is known for the presence of armed groups.

On 29 May 2023, in Santiago de Cali - Comuna 19 (Valle del Cauca), a person was beaten up and injured by residents. The man was suspected of being involved in robbery minutes previous to the attack. Rioters also set fire to the victim's motorcycle. There were no fatalities.
On 29 May 2023, in Sopetran (Antioquia), parents and teachers protested the poor management of the institution and demanded the resignation of the school principal.

On 29 May 2023, in Santa Elena (Antioquia), for the second consecutive day, dozens of residents protested against the demolition of houses that, according to the district, did not have the required building permits.
On 29 May 2023, in Bogota - La Candelaria (Bogota, D.C.), people protested near the Museo de Oro bus station. There is no further information on this event.

Around 29 May 2023 (as reported), in Armenia (Quindio), the family of a girl killed by her stepfather gathered to protest against the reduction of the perpetrator's sentence after he reached an agreement with the prosecution office.

On 29 May 2023, between San Gil and Cabrera municipalities (coded to San Gil, Santander), residents from the Cucharo, Volador and Ojo de Agua veredas (San Gil) and some residents from Cabrera blocked the road that connects both locations to protest against the bad state of the road caused by heavy trucks.
Around 29 May 2023 (as reported), in Maicao (La Guajira), a group of demonstrations began an occupation three consecutive days the offices of the Air-E energy company due to increased outages.

On 29 May 2023, in Carabuela (Imbabura), Indigenous residents captured a traffic agent and a man who were accused of participating in the kidnapping and robbery of two underage kids in La Compania community. The agent and the man were subject to Indigenous Justice, in which they were beat up, whipped with nettle and thrown cold water.

On 29 May 2023, in Pirapey Km. 45 (Itapua), Yerba Mate farmers partially blocked Route PY06 to demand better prices for the leaves. They said that the price was unilaterally fixed without consulting them.

On 29 May 2023, in Asuncion (Asuncion), workers at the Paraguayan Communications Company (COPACO) demonstrate against the decision of the shareholders of postponing the general assembly in which they were supposed to approve or reject the 2022 financial report of the company. The company has losses of G 188,000 millions.

On 29 May 2023, in Iquitos (Loreto), unionized workers members of the Loreto Regional Government Unique Union (SUTRA GORE) blocked the entrances to their offices as a demonstration to demand the main government for the budget for the regional government for them to fulfil their collective contract agreements. The agreements include the increase of salaries, among other things.
On 29 May 2023, in Lima - San Juan de Lurigancho (Lima), residents of Valle del Mantaro captured, tied up to a light post, and beat up a man that had attempted to sexually assault a woman.

On 29 May 2023, in Piura (Piura), thousands of residents of Bello Horizonte, Hermanos Carcamo, Avitole, and 21 de Agosto sectors staged a demonstration to demand the EPS Grau potable water services provider company to re-establish stable services, due to several cuts for the past three years and forcing them to buy water.

assoc_actor_1: Farmers (Venezuela); PSUV: United Socialist Party of Venezuela; Women (Venezuela)
notes: On 29 May 2023, in Maturin (Monagas), a group of demonstrators, including members of the National Land Council (CNT), farming organizations, women farmers associations representatives, and PSUV supporters, gathered in support of the government in its land and agrarian policies. The demonstrators gathered by the regional office of the National Land Institute (INTI).

On 29 May 2023, in Barcelona (Anzoategui), a group of demonstrators, including retired state workers, pensioners, and unionists, protested to demand better pensions, and improved access to medicines and healthcare. The protesters blocked the Cajigal Avenue for over an hour. Some marched to the Ombudsman Office, where they handed in a letter with their demands. This demonstration was one of the several simultaneous nationwide protests held on the Venezuelan Day for Older Persons.

source: OVCS: Observatorio Venezolano de Conflictividad Social
notes: On 29 May 2023, in Apure state (coded to San Fernando de Apure), a group of demonstrators, including retired state workers, and pensioners, protested to demand better pensions, and improved access to medicines and healthcare. This demonstration was one of the several simultaneous nationwide protests held on the Venezuelan Day for Older Persons.

On 29 May 2023, in Barinas (Barinas), a group of demonstrators, including retired state workers and pensioners, protested to demand better pensions, and respect for their collective labor agreements. The protesters gathered in the intersection of the 23 de Enero and the Cruz Paredes avenues. This demonstration was one of the several simultaneous nationwide protests held on the Venezuelan Day for Older Persons.

On 29 May 2023, in Ciudad Guayana (Bolivar), a group of demonstrators, including retired state workers and pensioners, protested to demand better pensions, and improved access to medicines and healthcare. The protesters gathered by the IVSS Regional Public Health Insurance Fund, where they handed in a letter with their demands. This demonstration was one of the several simultaneous nationwide protests held on the Venezuelan Day for Older Persons.

On 29 May 2023, in Valencia (Carabobo), a group of demonstrators, including retired state workers and pensioners, protested to demand better pensions, and improved access to medicines and healthcare. They also rejected the new adjustments to bonuses and benefits for state workers announced by the government, which they argue to be insufficient, and especially unfair on them. The protesters gathered by the Pedro Gual School and then marched to the Labor Inspectorate Office, where they handed in a letter with their demands. This demonstration was one of the several simultaneous nationwide protests held on the Venezuelan Day for Older Persons.

source: OVCS: Observatorio Venezolano de Conflictividad Social
notes: On 29 May 2023, in San Carlos (Cojedes), a group of demonstrators, including retired state workers, and pensioners, protested to demand better pensions. This demonstration was one of the several simultaneous nationwide protests held on the Venezuelan Day for Older Persons.

On 29 May 2023, in Caracas - Libertador (Distrito Capital), dozens of demonstrators, including active and retired state workers, and pensioners, protested to demand better pay, pensions, and working conditions, and improved access to medicines and healthcare. The protesters marched from Carabobo Park to the Caracas Square. Anti-riot police were present but there was no intervention. This demonstration was one of the several simultaneous nationwide protests held on the Venezuelan Day for Older Persons.

On 29 May 2023, in Punto Fijo (Falcon), a group of demonstrators, including retired state workers and pensioners, protested to demand better pensions, and improved access to medicines and healthcare. The protesters gathered in the La Mujer Square and then marched to the Carirubana municipal hall, where they handed in a letter with their demands. This demonstration was one of the several simultaneous nationwide protests held on the Venezuelan Day for Older Persons.

On 29 May 2023, in San Juan de los Morros (Guarico), a group of demonstrators, including active and retired state workers, pensioners, and civil society representatives, protested to demand better pay, pensions, and working conditions, and improved access to medicines and healthcare. The protesters gathered in the Francisco Torrealba Square. This demonstration was one of the several simultaneous nationwide protests held on the Venezuelan Day for Older Persons.

On 29 May 2023, in Barquisimeto (Lara), a group of demonstrators, including active and retired state workers, pensioners, and unionists, protested to demand better pay and pensions. The protesters gathered in the Altagracia Square and then marched to the Labor Inspectorate Office. This demonstration was one of the several simultaneous nationwide protests held on the Venezuelan Day for Older Persons.

source: El Diario (Venezuela); OVCS: Observatorio Venezolano de Conflictividad Social
notes: On 29 May 2023, in Los Teques (Miranda), a group of demonstrators, including active and retired state workers, and pensioners, protested to demand better pensions, and improved access to medicines and healthcare. This demonstration was one of the several simultaneous nationwide protests held on the Venezuelan Day for Older Persons.

source: OVCS: Observatorio Venezolano de Conflictividad Social
notes: On 29 May 2023, in Maturin (Monagas), a group of demonstrators, including retired state workers, and pensioners, protested to demand better pensions. This demonstration was one of the several simultaneous nationwide protests held on the Venezuelan Day for Older Persons.

source: OVCS: Observatorio Venezolano de Conflictividad Social
notes: On 29 May 2023, in Portuguesa state (coded to Guanare), a group of demonstrators, including retired state workers, and pensioners, protested to demand better pensions, and improved access to medicines and healthcare. This demonstration was one of the several simultaneous nationwide protests held on the Venezuelan Day for Older Persons.

On 29 May 2023, in San Felipe (Yaracuy), a group of demonstrators, including retired state workers, and pensioners, protested to demand better pensions, and improved access to medicines and healthcare. The protesters gathered in the Bolivar Square. This demonstration was one of the several simultaneous nationwide protests held on the Venezuelan Day for Older Persons.

On 29 May 2023, in Maracay (Aragua), a group of demonstrators, including retired state workers, pensioners, teachers, and health workers, protested to demand better pensions, and improved access to medicines and healthcare. The protesters gathered in the Bolivar Avenue, and handed in a letter with their demands at the Department of Geriatric Medicine (SAGER). This demonstration was one of the several simultaneous nationwide protests held on the Venezuelan Day for Older Persons.

On 29 May 2023, in Merida (Merida), a group of demonstrators, including education sector workers, and other active and retired state workers, and pensioners, protested to demand better pay, pensions, and working conditions, and improved access to medicines and healthcare. The protesters gathered in the Bolivar Square and marched to the El Llano Square. This demonstration was one of the several simultaneous nationwide protests held on the Venezuelan Day for Older Persons.

source: Informativo Docente; OVCS: Observatorio Venezolano de Conflictividad Social
notes: On 29 May 2023, in Cumana (Sucre), a group of demonstrators, including teachers, retired state workers, and pensioners, protested to demand better pay, pensions, and working conditions, and improved access to medicines and healthcare. This demonstration was one of the several simultaneous nationwide protests held on the Venezuelan Day for Older Persons.

source: OVCS: Observatorio Venezolano de Conflictividad Social
notes: On 29 May 2023, in Valera (Trujillo), a group of demonstrators, including teachers, retired state workers, and pensioners, protested to demand better pay, pensions, and working conditions. This demonstration was one of the several simultaneous nationwide protests held on the Venezuelan Day for Older Persons.

source: Diario Version Final (Venezuela); El Pitazo; La Patilla
notes: On 29 May 2023, in Maracaibo (Zulia), approximately 150 demonstrators, including teachers, retired state workers, pensioners, and unionists, protested to demand better pay, pensions, and working conditions, and improved access to medicines and healthcare. The protesters gathered outside the Palace of Justice. They were joined by fraud victims of the Banco Occidental de Descuento Bank, that have been demanding the return of their savings for over five years. This demonstration was one of the several simultaneous nationwide protests held on the Venezuelan Day for Older Persons.

assoc_actor_1: Labor Group (Venezuela); Teachers (Venezuela); FVM: Venezuelan Federation of Teachers
source: La Patilla; OVCS: Observatorio Venezolano de Conflictividad Social; Radio Fe y Alegria
notes: On 29 May 2023, in Ciudad Bolivar (Bolivar), a group of demonstrators, including teachers, FVM representatives, retired state workers, and pensioners, protested to demand better pay, pensions, and working conditions. The protesters gathered by the IVSS Regional Public Health Insurance Fund. This demonstration was one of the several simultaneous nationwide protests held on the Venezuelan Day for Older Persons.
On 29 May 2023, in Tovar (Merida), a group of teachers protested over pay and working conditions.
On 29 May 2023, in Higuerote (Miranda), a group of teachers marched in protest over pay and working conditions.

source: OVCS: Observatorio Venezolano de Conflictividad Social
notes: On 29 May 2023, in Barcelona (Anzoategui), a group of relatives of a girl with cancer, hospitalized in the Luis Razetti Hospital, protested to demand the repair of the equipment needed for her cancer treatment.
On 29 May 2023, in La Vela de Coro (Falcon), a group of residents of the El Calvario sector blocked the Troncal 3 road in protest to demand drinking water through pipes.

On 29 May 2023, in Puerto Cumarebo (Falcon), a group of residents of different sectors blocked the Troncal 3 road in protest over the pollution caused by the nearby INVECEM cement producing plant, which poses a serious health risk for them. The roadblock was erected with tires and branches. GNB soldiers were present but there was no intervention.

On 29 May 2023, in Merida (Merida), a group of residents protested to demand additional fuel to be distributed to local petrol stations, and against the long queues and difficulties they face in refueling. The protesters blocked the Universidad Avenue.

On 29 May 2023, in Merida (Merida), a group of residents of the La Pueblita sector blocked a street in protest to demand the Hidrologica Aguas de Merida water company to repair two potholes in the main road of the sector and one other street.
On 29 May 2023, in Boca do Acre (Amazonas), Apurina Indigenous people blocked the BR-317 highway to demand better paved roads.

Around 29 May 2023 (as reported), in San Pablo (Bolivar), unidentified armed individuals shot and killed two men in a bar in a drive-by shooting in the La Libertad neighborhood. There are no further details on the reasons for the attack or potential perpetrators, but the area is known for the presence of armed groups. 2 fatalities.

actor1: FARC Dissident: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia Dissident Faction
notes: On 29 May 2023, in the rural area of Paz De Ariporo municipality (Meta), armed men who identified themselves as militants of a FARC dissident factions abducted a cattle rancher. The victim was released the following day and handed over to his family.

On 29 May 2023, in Santa Ana de Coro (Falcon), a group of demonstrators, including retired state workers and pensioners, protested to demand better pensions, and improved access to medicines and healthcare. The protesters gathered by the IVSS Regional Public Health Insurance Fund, where they handed in a letter with their demands. This demonstration was one of the several simultaneous nationwide protests held on the Venezuelan Day for Older Persons.

On 28 May 2023, outside Petoa, Santa Barbara, armed members of the Mara Salvatrucha Gang shot and killed four family members outside of their home in the Los Vaditos village. During the clash, the victims shot and killed one of the assailants and wounded another as they were attempting to repel the attack. The exact reason for the killing is unknown. 5 fatalities. 1 wounded.

Around 28 May 2023 (as reported), outside Triunfo de la Cruz, Atlantida, an indigenous Garifuna man member of the commission monitoring compliance with the Inter-American Court of Human Rights (IACTHR) ruling and a collaborator of the Triunfo de la Cruz Land Defense Committee was found dead in the Gama River. The Black Fraternal Organization of Honduras (OFRANEH) has repeatedly reported instances of death threats made against members of the land committee, suggesting the killing might be politically motivated. 1 fatality.
On 28 May 2023, in Baracoa, Cortes, a group of residents protested demanding the restoration of electricity in their neighborhoods after experiencing persistent power outages.

On 28 May 2023, in San Juan, Intibuca, a group of residents protested denouncing the poor state of road infrastructure in the south of the department of Lempira and demanded authorities for road repairs.
On 28 May 2023, in La Chorrera, Panama, residents of La Valdesa staged a protest against the opening of a new pit in the area.

On 28 May 2023, in Nejapa, Nejapa, members of Nejapa Locos Salvatruchos Gang shot and killed a man in colonia San Felipe. The victim was riding his motorbike when the gang members opened fire on him for no apparent reason. The motivation for the attack is unknown. The attackers were arrested the following day. 1 fatality.

On 28 May 2023, in Recife (Pernambuco), a man was shot and killed in the Pina neighborhood by two armed individuals. One suspect, an adolescent, was detained. Attack motivation is unknown. 1 fatality.

On 28 May 2023, in Campinas (Sao Paulo), families, nurses, and health workers held a protest outside the Renascenca Maternity Hospital, resisting the hospital's policy to deny entry of obstetric nurses during childbirth.

On 28 May 2023, in Aripuana (Mato Grosso), two armed individuals on a motorcycle intercepted an ambulance that was taking a patient to a hospital. The suspects forced the emergency responders out of the ambulance, shot and killed the patient. There are no reports on the identity of the perpetrators or the attack's motivation. 1 fatality.

On 28 May 2023, in Contagem (Minas Gerais), a man was shot and killed in the Jardim Industrial neighborhood by two armed individuals. A civilian couple were injured by stray bullets. There are no reports on the identity of the perpetrators or the attack's motivation. 1 fatality.

actor1: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
source: Folha de S. Paulo; G1; R7
notes: Property destruction: On 28 May 2023, in Palmital (Sao Paulo), the military highway police seized more than 12.6 tons of marijuana from a vehicle on km 413 of the Raposo Tavares highway. The seizure was the largest in the history of the state. The driver was arrested.

On 28 May 2023, in Rio de Janeiro - Central Zone (Rio de Janeiro), unknown shooters exchanged fire in the Morro da Caroa community, Catumbi neighborhood, and in the Gloria neighborhood. Unknown casualties.

On 28 May 2023, in Rio de Janeiro - North Zone (Rio de Janeiro), unknown shooters exchanged fire in the Morro dos Macacos community in the Vila Isabel neighborhood and in the Colegio neighborhood. Unknown casualties.

On 28 May 2023, in Altamira (Para), a man was shot and killed in the Buriti neighborhood by two armed individuals who fled on a motorcycle. There are no reports on the identity of the perpetrators or the attack's motivation. 1 fatality.
On 28 May 2023, in Rio de Janeiro - West Zone (Rio de Janeiro), unknown shooters exchanged fire in the Morro do Tirol community, Freguesia neighborhood. Unknown casualties.
On 28 May 2023, in Fortaleza (Ceara), three members of a drug trafficking shot and killed a member of a rival group in the Barroso neighborhood. All three perpetrators were arrested. 1 fatality.

On 28 May 2023, in Palmas (Tocantins), two men were shot and killed in the Jardim Aureny IV sector by four armed individuals. There are no reports on the identity of the perpetrators or the attack's motivation. 2 fatalities.

On 28 May 2023, in Maceio (Alagoas), people carried out a march against LGBTQphobia and to demand inclusive policies geared towards the LGBTQ+ community. State administrators, such as the state secretaries of culture, women and human rights also took part in the event.

On 28 May 2023, in Cacapava (Sao Paulo), six armed suspects shot and killed a man in the city center. The victim had issues with drug traffickers and was involved in drugs. The victim might have been killed by drug traffickers. 1 fatality.

Around 28 May 2023 (as reported), in Manaus - North Zone (Amazonas), a member of a drug trafficking group was killed by unknown individuals and his body was found in the Aguas Claras housing complex, Novo Aleixo neighborhood, with gunshot wounds and hands tied up. The deceased had switched gangs, which might have motivated his killing. 1 fatality.

On 28 May 2023, in Contagem (Minas Gerais), a member of a drug trafficking group was killed in a drive-by shooting in the Riacho das Pedras neighborhood by armed individuals in a car. Police believe in rivalries between drug trafficking groups as the motivation for the killing. 1 fatality.

On 28 May 2023, in Manaus - North Zone (Amazonas), a man was tied up, stabbed 20 times, and killed in the Cidade Nova neighborhood by individuals who invaded his private residence. The victim was the cousin of a drug trafficker who was found dead in the Novo Aleixo neighborhood (coded separately), which is why police believe the victim was killed in the context of rivalries between drug trafficking groups. The victim was not involved in illegal activities. 1 fatality.

On 28 May 2023, in Recife (Pernambuco), dozens of people carried out a protest in the city center to demand more effective emergency response to landslides, following the death of residents buried under landslides during a storm.

On 28 May 2023, in Guararapes (Sao Paulo), an unknown suspect passing by on a motorcycle shot and severely injured a person in the Industrial neighborhood (drive-by). The victim was a drug user and was shot six times. There were no fatalities.

On 28 May 2023, in Sao Miguel dos Campos (Alagoas), a man was killed and his wife was injured in a drive-by shooting in the Nossa Senhora de Fatima neighborhood by armed individuals in a car. There are no reports on the identity of the perpetrators or the attack's motivation. 1 fatality.

On 28 May 2023, in Joao Pessoa (Paraiba), a man was killed in a drive-by shooting in the Cristo Rei neighborhood by two armed individuals on a motorcycle. Authorship and motivation of the attack are unknown. 1 fatality.

On 28 May 2023, in Manaus - North Zone (Amazonas), a man was shot at least eight times and killed in a drive-by shooting in the Mutirao neighborhood by armed individuals in a car. Authorship and motivation are unknown. 1 fatality.

On 28 May 2023, in Itacoatiara (Amazonas), a man was killed in a drive-by shooting in a square at the city center by two armed individuals on a motorcycle. The victim's girlfriend and another civilian were injured by stray bullets. Authorship and motivation are unknown. 1 fatality.

On 28 May 2023, in Macapa (Amapa), friends and family members of a taxi driver who was shot to death during a military police intervention (coded separately) gathered in front of a military police unit to demand justice for his case.

actor1: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
notes: On 28 May 2023, in Porto Velho (Rondonia), a clash between unknown armed individuals and the military police took place in the Jardim Eldorado neighborhood. One civilian was injured by stray bullets. There were no fatalities.

On 28 May 2023, in Campo Belo (Minas Gerais), a man was shot and killed in a drive-by shooting in the Feira neighborhood by armed individuals in a car. There are no reports on the identity of the perpetrators or the attack's motivation. 1 fatality.

On 28 May 2023, near Colegual (Los Lagos), families from rural sectors protested on the route against lack of electric supply. Protesters stated that they have been without electricity for five days and their food for the month was spoiled, as well as their insulin.

source: El Espectador; El Tiempo (Colombia); El Universal (Colombia); UNOCHA
notes: On 28 May 2023, in the rural area of Jamundi municipality (Valle del Cauca), unidentified armed individuals abducted three people who were on vacation in the area. The bodies of the victims were later found on May 30 (coded separately). Although the perpetrators have not been confirmed, the area is known for the presence of the Jaime Martinez FARC dissident faction.

actor1: FARC Dissident: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia Dissident Faction
notes: On 28 May 2023, in the rural area of Ricaurte municipality (Narino), militants of a FARC dissident faction clashed with ELN militants in La Milagrosa Cuaiquer Viejo indigenous reserve area. Indigenous people in the area were caught in the crossfire. The clashes have been affecting at least 10 different AWA indigenous reservation areas, displacing more than 180 families in the municipal capital and the Mallama municipality. Casualties unknown.

source: El Heraldo (Colombia); El Universal (Colombia); W Radio
notes: On 28 May 2023, in Juan Jose (Cordoba), unidentified armed individuals shot and killed a member of local farmers' organization. The victim worked providing transport to residents in the area and he was part of the Illicit Crops Substitution Program (PNIS). Although the perpetrators have not been confirmed, the area is known for the presence of Gulf Clan. 1 fatality.

On 28 May 2023, in the rural area of Mallama municipality (coded to Piedrancha, Narino), unidentified armed individuals opened fire on a family near the El Arco vereda, killing a young man and wounding his mother. There are no further details on the motives for the attack or the possible perpetrators, but the area is known for the presence of armed groups. 1 fatality.

actor2: FARC Dissident - Dagoberto Ramos: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia Dissident Faction (Dagoberto Ramos)
notes: Defusal: Around 28 May 2023 (as reported), in Santander De Quilichao (Cauca), police forces deactivated an explosive placed by presumed FARC dissidents of the Dagoberto Ramos front in the municipal park. Pamphlets related to this armed group were found in the area.
On 28 May 2023, in Santa Elena (Antioquia), dozens of residents protested against the demolition of houses that, according to the district, did not have the required building permits.

source: Diario Version Final (Venezuela); Noticia al Minuto
notes: On 28 May 2023, in Punta de Palmas (Zulia), CICPC police forces clashed with several members of the Los Matos Gang. During the armed confrontation, a stray bullet injured a resident of the area; she was taken to hospital for treatment. There is no further information at this point in time. There were no fatalities.
Around 28 May 2023 (as reported), in Camaguan (Guarico), a group of cheese producers protested to demand a fair price for their products. The protest was staged in the Puerto Carrizalero sector.

On 28 May 2023, in the rural area of Simiti, Bolivar, a merchant woman was killed because she refused to pay an extorsion. The area is known for the presence of armed groups. There are no reports on the identity of the perpetrators. 1 fatality.

On 27 May 2023, in Ladyville, Belize, two armed men attacked two other men on the Manta Ray Boulevard. The victims were socializing when the two armed men turned up and opened fire for no apparent reason. The motivation for the attack is unknown. No more detail is provided by the source. There were no casualties.

Around 27 May 2023 (as reported), in Tegucigalpa, Francisco Morazan, a man was killed and his body was found bound by arms and legs inside black plastic bags in the Villa Olimpica neighborhood. Witnesses suggested the body was thrown from a moving vehicle. The identity of the victim and the motive for the crime remain unknown. 1 fatality.

On 27 May 2023, in Talanga, Francisco Morazan, several unidentified armed men shot and killed two men while they were parked in a car in front of a local store. The reason for the killing is unknown. 2 fatalities.

Property destruction: On 27 May 2023, outside La Masica, Atlantida, military forces seized and incinerated a coca plantation measuring 5.6 hectares and containing 56,000 coca bushes, in the mountainous sector of the Texiguat Wildlife Refuge National Park.
On 27 May 2023, in Tegucigalpa, Francisco Morazan, hundreds of evangelical Christians marched along the Suyapa Boulevard in protest against same-sex marriage.

On 27 May 2023, in San Pedro Sula, Cortes, residents and members of over 50 neighborhood committees organized in the Confederation of Neighborhood Committees of the Cortes department marched in protest on the occasion of the Day of the Citizen, demanding land allocation for peasant groups.

On 27 May 2023, in Formosa (Formosa), workers at the recycling plant of the San Antonio neighborhood, some retired and others beneficiaries of the Empower Work government program, blocked Route 11 in the Namqom sector to demand the resignation of the director of the Integral Management of Urban Solid Waste Department (GIRSU). They had claims of labor harassment against the director and also said that he has threatened them with making them lose the benefits of the government program.

On 27 May 2023, in Comodoro Rivadavia (Chubut), residents and animal rights advocates gathered at 16th Square to protest against animal cruelty. They also demanded an efficient animal health system and public policy and justice for cases of animal cruelty.

On 27 May 2023, in Cochabamba (Cochabamba), supporters of the mayor of the city (Sumate) staged a demonstration in 14 de Septiembre square against the designation of the president and secretary of the municipal council for being part of Movement for Socialism (MAS).

source: Crimes News RJ; G1; Informe Agora
notes: On 27 May 2023, in Campos dos Goytacazes (Rio de Janeiro), a group of heavily armed Amigos dos Amigos drug traffickers opened fire on six people at a bar in the Jardim Aeroporto neighborhood, Guarus district. The same group also shot and killed two men in separate instances, in the Sao Silvestre and Codin neighborhoods. These were described as executions. Police pursued the suspects and seized a vehicle, ninja caps, and ammunition. The events were related to a dispute with the Pure Third Command, but it is not known whether the victims were civilians or suspects. One suspect was arrested the following day. 2 fatalities.

On 27 May 2023, in Barra do Garcas (Mato Grosso), a man was shot and killed by armed individuals on the Ana Claudia street, Pitaluga neighborhood. The suspects introduced themselves as police agents. Attack motivation is unknown. 1 fatality.

On 27 May 2023, in Castanhal (Para), a man was shot and killed inside a barber shop in the Santa Lidia neighborhood by two armed individuals. There are no reports on the identity of the perpetrators or the attack's motivation. 1 fatality.

actor1: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
notes: Property destruction: On 27 May 2023, in Nhandeara (Sao Paulo), military highway police seized 2.5 tons of marijuana from a truck on the Washington Luis highway. The driver was arrested.

On 27 May 2023, in Rio de Janeiro - Central Zone (Rio de Janeiro), unknown shooters exchanged fire in the Botafogo and Gloria neighborhoods and the Morro da Caroa community, Catumbi neighborhood. Unknown casualties.
On 27 May 2023, in Rio de Janeiro - North Zone (Rio de Janeiro), unknown shooters exchanged fire in the Pavuna and Vila Isabel neighborhoods. Unknown casualties.
On 27 May 2023, in Rio de Janeiro - West Zone (Rio de Janeiro), unknown shooters exchanged fire in the Vila Valqueire neighborhood. Unknown casualties.

On 27 May 2023, in Palmas (Tocantins), an adolescent was shot and killed in the Aeroporto sector by two armed individuals. There are no reports on the identity of the perpetrators or the attack's motivation. 1 fatality.

On 27 May 2023, in Manaus (Amazonas), a man was shot and killed inside a sports arena by armed individuals. Police believe the attack was motivated by rivalries between drug trafficking groups. The victim had taken part in the killing of a woman in 2019 (circumstances not reported). 1 fatality.

Around 27 May 2023 (as reported), in Juiz de Fora (Minas Gerais), an inmate was killed inside a detainment facility and his body was found with a rope around his neck. Prison guards believe his death was part of an ongoing dispute between rival drug trafficking groups inside the facility. 1 fatality.

On 27 May 2023, in Juatuba (Minas Gerais), a man was stabbed, tortured, and killed by at least two individuals who invaded his private residence. The victim had been receiving death threats from drug traffickers, which is why police believe in drug trafficking disputes as the attack motivation. 1 fatality.

assoc_actor_2: Former Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
notes: On 27 May 2023, in Ananindeua (Para), a former military police officer was shot and killed by an armed individual who invaded his private residence in the 40 Horas neighborhood. The suspect fled with accomplices in a car. One suspect, a drug trafficker, was arrested on 29 May 2023. 1 fatality.

On 27 May 2023, in Cubatao (Sao Paulo), residents and women held a protest march through the city, resisting domestic violence. The march also commemorated the death of a female pharmacist by her partner one month prior.

On 27 May 2023, in Naque (Minas Gerais), a man was shot and killed by an armed individual who then fled with an accomplice on a motorcycle. The shooter was arrested. Earlier that day, the victim had a feud with a person over a drug debt, which might have motivated the attack. 1 fatality.

On 27 May 2023, in Maceio (Alagoas), armed individuals in a vehicle opened fire aimlessly at people in a drive-by shooting in the Benedito Bentes neighborhood. A homeless man was shot and injured. There are no reports on the identity of the perpetrators.

On 27 May 2023, in Petrolina (Pernambuco), a woman was killed in a drive-by shooting in the Loteamento Recife neighborhood by unknown armed individuals on a motorcycle. Attack motivation is unknown. 1 fatality.

On 27 May 2023, in Piracicaba (Sao Paulo), residents held a protest outside an inactive Emergency Care Unit in the Vila Cristina neighborhood, denouncing inaction from the city in improving health provision. Residents displayed a coffin at the protest site and complained that people in situations of homelessness had occupied the building.
On 27 May 2023, in Natal (Rio Grande do Norte), people blocked avenues to protest against the building of a highway extension.

actor1: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
notes: Property destruction: On 27 May 2023, in Goiania (Goias), military police agents seized three tons of marijuana hidden inside a truck loaded with flour during an operation in the Chacara Sao Joaquim neighborhood. One person was arrested.

On 27 May 2023, in Rondonopolis (Mato Grosso), a man was abducted, beaten up, tortured, and injured by three unknown individuals. The victim was rescued by military police and the suspects escaped. The victim died from the injuries hours later. Attack motivation is unknown. 1 fatality.

On 27 May 2023, in Abel Figueiredo (Para), a man was killed in a drive-by shooting in the city center by two armed individuals on a motorcycle. There are no reports on the identity of the perpetrators or the attack's motivation. 1 fatality.

On 27 May 2023, in San Antonio (Valparaiso), more than 100 locals marched through Barros Luco avenue against tobacco consumption in the context of the 'No Tobacco Day'. The march was organized by the Seventh-day Adventist Church. Protesters held banners with slogans such as 'If you don't stop smoking, the cigarette will kill you!'.

On 27 May 2023, in Santiago (Metropolitana), teachers members of the College of Teachers Union protested against the Mental Health Plan promoted by the Ministry of Education in public schools. Protesters stated that it's insufficient and that it does not match what is happening inside the educational facilities.

On 27 May 2023, near Coronel (Biobio), tens of locals protested blocking La Madera Road against the burial of sea lions that died of bird flu near the Patagual valley. Protesters held banners with slogans such as 'Patagual is not a cemetery or a garbage dump' and 'take your corpses from our valley'. The burial of these animals is taking place on a private property. Protesters stated that the works are carried out near underground water springs, which are used by them to supply themselves with water generating a serious health problem.
Around 27 May 2023 (as reported), in Puerto Rico municipality (Caqueta), two unidentified armed groups clashed. There is no further information on this event. Casualties unknown.

Around 27 May 2023 (as reported), in the rural area of Teorama municipality (Norte de Santander), two unidentified armed group clashed in the Jurisdicciones vereda near a local school. Casualties unknown.

On 27 May 2023, in the rural area of Santander De Quilichao municipality (Cauca), unidentified armed individuals shot and killed a young man in a drive-by shooting near the Altos de San Luis vereda. There are no further details on the reasons for the attack or potential perpetrators, but the area is known for the presence of armed groups. 1 fatality.

Around 27 May 2023, in Dosquebradas (Risaralda), a person was beaten by a mob after being suspected of having participated in a robbery in the Milan neighborhood. The victim died due to the severity of his injuries after being handed over to police officers. 1 fatality.

Around 27 May 2023 (as reported), in Pereira (Risaralda), riots broke out when the police responded to a public disturbance call. Residents, apparently intoxicated, attacked officers and damaged police motorcycles. One of the rioters attempted to snatch an officer's weapon and was injured in the incident.

actor1: FARC Dissident - Carlos Patino Front: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia Dissident Faction (Carlos Patino Front)
notes: Non-violent activity: Around 27 May 2023 (weekend of), in Huisito (Cauca), members of the Carlos Patino FARC dissident group forced all community leaders and other residents of the area to participate in the celebration of the anniversary of the armed group.

Around 27 May 2023 (as reported), in Luruaco municipality (Atlantico), students protested in San Juan de Tocagua corregimiento. The group claimed that a water cut had been affecting the school for several days, and also demanded better infrastructure and the appointment of a director for the institution.
On 27 May 2023, in Dosquebradas (Risaralda), young people protested to demand the legalization of marijuana for medicinal use.
On 27 May 2023, in Mariano Roque Alonso (Central), a group of residents protested against the bad state of the roads and demanded solutions from the mayor of the municipality.

On 27 May 2023, in Achipampa (Junin), more than 1,500 residents captured, beat up, and burned alive four men for robbing houses. They also captured and locked eight authorities in the communal offices to capture the men and punish them. 4 fatalities.

On 27 May 2023, in Iquitos (Loreto), unionized workers members of the Regional Education Sector Administrative Workers Federation (FERTASE) staged a demonstration outside the Loreto Regional Education Management (GREL) to voice their grievance about not being considered for a bonuses of recognition of their work.

source: Diario Version Final (Venezuela); El Diario de Guayana; Noticia al Minuto
notes: On 27 May 2023, in San Francisco (Zulia), two unidentified crime group suspects on a motorcycle shot and killed a man, in a drive-by shooting in the La Coromoto neighborhood. The victim was working in a fast food stand. Another person was injured. It is thought that the victim could be related to members of criminal groups, and that the killing could be a settling of scores. There is no further information at this point in time. 1 fatality.

assoc_actor_1: MAB: Movement of People Affected by Dams
notes: On 27 May 2023, in Mariana (Minas Gerais), members of MAB and residents of Bento Rodrigues community carried out a protest to demand repairs in the community church, which was affected by the Mariana dam collapse in 2015.

assoc_actor_2: Police Forces of Colombia (2022-); Indigenous Group (Colombia)
source: El Tiempo (Colombia); El Universal (Colombia); Sucesos Cauca
notes: On 27 May 2023, in the rural area of San Joaquin corregimiento (Cauca), suspected militants of the ELN abducted a police officer who was on his way to Balboa to carry out a surveillance assignment. The victim, a member of an Indigenous group, was off duty at the time of the incident. Armed men intercepted the officer's private vehicle near the Curacas vereda and subsequently took him to an unknown location. The victim was handed over to a humanitarian commission around 4 June.

Around 27 May 2023 (as reported), in Teresina (Piaui), a man was killed by unknown individuals and his body was found in the Parque Alvorada neighborhood with 12 gunshot wounds. The victim had a police record for drug trafficking. 1 fatality.

On 27 May 2023, in Londrina (Parana), a man was shot and killed in the Jardim Santos Dumont neighborhood by an armed individual who then fled in a car. The victim had a police record for several offences, including drug trafficking. There are no reports on the identity of the perpetrator. 1 fatality.
On 26 May 2023, in Cartago, Cartago, residents of Los Diques neighborhood staged a protest on the road to Taras to demand that authorities reconnect the water service.

On 26 May 2023, Guatemala City, Guatemala, two armed men on a motorcycle shot and killed a moto taxi driver and his passenger in zone 24. The motivation of the attack is unknown. No more detail is provided by the source. 2 fatalities.

On 26 May 2023, in Guatemala City, Guatemala, people staged a protest against the decision of the Administrative Court that provided the suspension of the political party Citizen Prosperity in the 2023 elections. Protesters, mostly supporters of the Citizen Prosperity political party demonstrated at the facilities of the Constitutional Court premises in zone 1.

On 26 May 2023, in Guatemala City, Guatemala, a prosecutor of the General Solicitors' Office was arrested and accused of non-compliance with duties and misfeasance. The detainee was one of the prosecutors against corruption. Since 2022, the Public Prosecutor's Office has conducted arrests against former members of courts and tribunals who have investigated corruption schemes in the national administration.

On 26 May 2023, in Morazan, Yoro, Honduras, two unidentified armed men shot and killed two men as they were riding a motorcycle in the Lempira neighborhood. The reason for the killing is unknown. 2 fatalities.

On 26 May 2023, in Yoro, Yoro, unidentified armed men on a motorcycle shot and killed a man in front of his house in the Santiago neighborhood in a drive-by shooting. The reason for the killing is unknown. 1 fatality.

On 26 May 2023, in Danli, El Paraiso, a group of journalists marched through the streets of the municipality on the occasion of Journalist's Day, in protest demanding press freedom and justice. The journalists marched with the slogan 'No to the muzzle law!', expressing their rejection of a proposed law by the National Congress (CN) that would impose restrictions on the press.

On 26 May 2023, in Tegucigalpa, Francisco Morazan, hundreds of retired teachers from various departments of the country protested outside the Presidential House of the Republic demanding payment of 60 pension installments. The protesters also called for the fulfillment of other benefits that were granted to them under the 2012 regulations.
On 26 May 2023, in Comayaguela, Francisco Morazan, police forces arrested a high-ranking member of the Mara Salvatrucha Gang in the Nueva Capital neighborhood.

On 26 May 2023, in Quebrada de Arena, Colon, unidentified armed men shot against a peasant leader, as he was driving on the CA-13 highway (drive-by). There were no fatalities. The reason for the attack is unknown.

Other: On 26 May 2023, in Managua, Managua, the Government froze the bank accounts of the Catholic Diocese nationwide. Members of the Catholic church have been subjected to constant attacks by the government for their association with the political opposition in the country.
On 26 May 2023, in La Chorrera, Panama, people staged a protest to demand the construction of a pedestrian bridge and better road conditions at the height of Loma Brigida area.

assoc_actor_1: Teachers (El Salvador); Labor Group (El Salvador); SIMEDUCO: Union for Public Education Teachers from El Salvador; Health Workers (El Salvador)
source: Diario Co Latino; El Mundo (El Salvador); La Prensa Grafica
notes: On 26 May 2023, in San Salvador, San Salvador, dozens of teachers staged a protest at the Presidential House to demand better pensions and a reform in the current pensions law. Workers affiliated with labor unions related to education, health, justice, security, and private sector participated in the protest. The Movement of Workers of the National Police, Independent Trade Union Centre, SIMEDUCO, National Association of Teachers, Bases Magistrales participated in the protest. Protesters pointed out that infiltrators participated in the protest. No incidents were reported.

On 26 May 2023, in La Paz (La Paz), at least 500 former workers of Fassil bank marched through the city to the Financial System Authority (ASFI), the Work and Economics Ministry offices as a demonstration to demand for payment of their late salaries and social benefits, that have not been paid after the bank closed.

On 26 May 2023, in Santa Cruz de la Sierra (Santa Cruz), former workers of Fassil bank staged demonstrations outside the bank's former agencies to demand for payment of their late salaries and social benefits, that have not been paid after the bank closed.

On 26 May 2023, in Maceio (Alagoas), a man was shot to death in the Benedito Bentes apartment complex by armed suspects who chased after the victim who tried to flee going inside an apartment, and opened fire killing him. The motivation behind the attack and its perpetrators are unknown. 1 fatality.

On 26 May 2023, in Belo Horizonte (Minas Gerais), a man was shot and killed in the Palmares neighborhood by an armed individual who arrived with accomplices on a motorcycle and in a car. The victim had a police record (charges not reported). According to the police, the attack was an execution. There are no reports on the identity of the perpetrators or the attack's motivation. 1 fatality.
