On 25 May 2023, in Buena Vista (Falcon), a group of residents protested over ongoing water outages.

On 25 May 2023, in Moruy (Falcon), for the third consecutive day, a group of residents of the San Antonio sector continued blocking the main road of the village in protest over water outages, and to demand the supply of drinking water through pipes.
On 25 May 2023, in Amuay (Falcon), a group of residents protested over ongoing water outages, and to decry the overall lack of essential services.

On 25 May 2023, in Las Piedras (Falcon), a group of residents protested over ongoing water outages. They consider that the Hidrofalcon water company has failed to comply with its drinking water distribution schedule.

On 25 May 2023, in Barquisimeto (Lara), a group of demonstrators, including teachers and unionists, protested to demand better pay and working conditions. The protesters marched from the Vargas Avenue to the Lara state Education Zone Office.
On 25 May 2023, in Machiques (Zulia), a group of Yukpa Indigenous people protested over unspecified demands. They gathered in the local Machiques bus station.

On 25 May 2023, in Saint-Laurent-du-Maroni, Saint-Laurent-du-Maroni, a group of relatives held a demonstration next to a police station to demand the authorities to clarify the circumstances of the killing of a man at the hands of the police on May 23 (coded separately). Demonstrators set up a burning barricade and dragged garbage containers through the streets. They also barricaded the entrance of the Red Cross facilities with parked vehicles. Two firefighters' trucks, that intervened to extinguish the fire, were attacked by the rioters (nature of the attack unknown).

On 25 May 2023, in Panama City, Panama, students staged a demonstration on the Transismic road, at the height of the campus of the University of Panama, to protest against the high cost of living. Members of the Student Reform University Association (Aure) and administrative workers of the University participated in the protest. Police arrived and put down the protesters (methods unknown) to allow the transit on the road.

On 25 May 2023, in Salta municipality (Salta), for the second consecutive day, a group of teachers demonstrated on National Route 9 setting tires on fire, near the access to the city, to demand a raise in salaries and better labor conditions. Demonstrators clashed with police officers, who used tear gas and fired rubber bullets, and several teachers were injured as a result. 20 teachers were arrested by the police. Also, a group of teachers and health workers gathered in 9 de Julio Square with the same demands. There were no fatalities.

On 25 May 2023, in Salta (Salta), teachers marched to the headquarters of the judiciary to demand the release of the teachers arrested during demonstrations in which they demanded better salaries and working conditions (coded separately).

actor1: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
notes: On 25 May 2023, in Varzea Grande (Mato Grosso), a member of a drug trafficking group exchanged fire with military police forces in the 13 de Setembro neighborhood. The drug trafficker was killed. 1 fatality.

Security measures: Around 25 May 2023 (as reported), in the rural area of Novita municipality (Choco), an unidentified armed group imposed a curfew lasting multiple days in the areas of the municipality of Novita and Sipi, affecting the Charco Largo, Barracon, Barrancosito and Charco Hondo veredas. The incident occurred the same week that clashes were reported between the ELN and the Gulf Clan (coded separately).

On 25 May 2023, in Puerto Gaitan (Meta), unidentified individuals on a motorcycle threw a grenade into a public area, injuring four people. Although the perpetrators have not been confirmed, authorities believe that the incident is related to extortion payments to armed groups.

Property destruction: On 25 May 2023, in the Coast of Tumaco (Narino), military forces seized and destroyed more than 3.3 tons of marijuana being transported in a semi-submarine. There is no further information on who the drugs belonged to, but the armed groups operating in the area finance themselves through drug trafficking. Three Colombian nationals were arrested.

On 25 May 2023, in Barranquilla (Atlantico), rioters beat two men who were trying to enforce a payday loan at a local business. Owners, customers and pedestrians beat the two victims, who they say were aggressive and using threats when attempting to collect the loan, and attempted to set fire to their motorcycle after the two men became aggressive towards the owner. Police had to intervene to stop the attack.

On 25 May 2023, in Sachica (Boyaca), rioters attacked a man suspected of robbing a cell phone from a vehicle. Police intervened to stop the attack and transported him to a hospital, where he died due to the severity of the wounds. The victim was not Colombian, but sources did not report his nationality. 1 fatality.

Displacement: On 25 May 2023, in Novita municipality (Choco), approximately 1,091 Afro-Colombian people were displaced from the communities of Torra, Cajon, Santa Barbara and San Jose, following armed clashes between armed groups on May 21 (coded separately).

Around 25 May 2023 (as reported), in the rural area of Mocoa municipality (Putumayo), families demonstrated due to the delay in the delivery of aid to families affected by a landslide in 2017. The group of demonstrators erected and burned barricades on the road that communicates Mocoa with Pitalito (Huila) causing physical confrontations between the demonstrators and some of the drivers affected by the blockade.
On 25 May 2023, in Huancayo province (Junin), residents staged a demonstration to demand the closure of congress, calling for general elections, and for the resignation of President Dina Boluarte.

On 25 May 2023, in Palmas (Tocantins), a man was shot and killed in the Arso 151 sector by three armed individuals. The victim was wearing a monitoring anklet for drug trafficking. A civilian was injured by stray bullets. There are no reports on the identity of the perpetrators. 1 fatality.

assoc_actor_2: Labor Group (Colombia); Police Forces of Colombia (2022-); Government of Colombia (2022-)
notes: Around 25 May 2023 (as reported), in the rural area of Pereira municipality (Risaralda), a group of Indigenous people and the Guardia Indigena held several workers of the Mayor's Office and police officers captive near the Condina vereda to demonstrate their rejection of the decision of the Mayor's Office of Pereira not to provide monetary assistance for their transfer to the capital of the country.

Around 25 May 2023 (as reported), in the rural area of Buenavista municipality (Cordoba), a former member of the Armed Forces was killed and his body found on a rural road near the Mala Noche parcel. The victim had recently completed his mandatory military service in El Bagre (Antioquia), and was no longer enrolled. The body was decapitated and showed multiple signs of torture. The event occurred in an area with the presence of Gulf Clan militants and authorities pointed to this armed group as the perpetrator. One Gulf Clan member suspected of involvement in the killing was arrested around 23 June during a clash with military forces (coded separately). 1 fatality.

actor2: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
assoc_actor_2: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) UPP: Pacifying Police Unit
source: Brasil de Fato; Fogo Cruzado; Folha de S. Paulo; G1; Globo Extra; Informe Agora; O Sao Goncalo
notes: On 25 May 2023, in Rio de Janeiro - North Zone (Rio de Janeiro), drug traffickers exchanged fire with military police and UPP officers during an operation in the Morro da Fe community, Penha Complex. At least five suspects were killed, and one suspect was injured by shrapnel. Two female civilians and a third civilian were injured. At least 17 schools and a family clinic were closed. Police seized two rifles and drugs. At least 5 fatalities.

On 25 May 2023, in Rio de Janeiro - West Zone (Rio de Janeiro), unknown suspects exchanged fire in the Praca Seca, Itanhanga, and Realengo neighborhoods, and in the Morro do Sete community, Padre Miguel neighborhood. Unknown casualties.

actor1: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
notes: On 25 May 2023, in Itaborai (Rio de Janeiro), unknown suspects exchanged fire with military police during an operation in the Parque Aurora neighborhood. One suspect was killed and an officer was injured. Police seized a firearm and portions of drugs. 1 fatality.

actor1: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
notes: On 25 May 2023, in Japeri (Rio de Janeiro), there was a shoot-out between military police and armed suspects during an operation in the Guandu neighborhood. One suspect was injured and taken to a hospital. Police seized a pistol and a radio communicator. In the Engenheiro Pedreira neighborhood, an armed individual exchanged fire with military police. The suspect was injured. Police seized a pistol and a radio communicator. There were no fatalities.

actor1: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
notes: On 25 May 2023, in Mage (Rio de Janeiro), there was a clash between military police and armed individuals during a police operation. Two people were injured, but it is not known whether they took part in the clash or if they were civilians. There were no fatalities.

On 24 May 2023, in Aserri, Aserri, dozens of students staged a protest to demand that authorities fix a bridge located near their school. Protesters argued that the bridge was damaged and collapsed last year and it has not been fixed since then.

On 24 May 2023, near Mixco, Guatemala, two armed men on a motorcycle shot and killed a man at the height of the bridge de la Union (drive-by). The motivation of the attack is unknown. No more detail is provided by the source. 1 fatality.

Around 24 May 2023 (as reported), in El Carrizal, Guatemala, a man was killed and his charred body was found at the entrance of the town. The motivation of the attack is unknown. No more detail is provided by the source. 1 fatality.

On 24 May 2023, in La Lima, Cortes, unidentified armed gang members clashed with police officers in the Jerusalem neighborhood. Police forces intervened after reports of a shootout and engaged in a clash, arresting a member of the Barrio 18 Gang who was involved in the shooting. It is unclear in which circumstances the shootout started. There were no fatalities.
On 24 May 2023, in Tegucigalpa, Francisco Morazan, a group farmers from various departments in Honduras set up camp under the National Congress in protest to demand land tenure.
Around 24 May 2023 (as reported), in Olanchito, Yoro, a man was killed and his body was found bound by arms and legs in the Plan Grande sector. The reason for the killing is unknown. 1 fatality.

On 24 May 2023, in Sonsonate, Sonsonate, residents of at least 15 communities in rural areas staged a protest outside the municipal building to demand that authorities carry out projects to enable the drinking water service in their homes. Communities of Faith Organized in Action (Cofoa) participated in the protest.

On 24 May 2023, in Paso del Rey (Buenos Aires), around 15 police officers raided a house run by the Polo Obrero organization, which also worked as a community kitchen, and destroyed everything inside. The officers also tied up and beat the people present at the moment. The police claimed that they were looking for a stolen bicycle. There were no casualties.

location: San Fernando del Valle de Catamarca
notes: On 24 May 2023, in San Fernando del Valle de Catamarca (Catamarca), friends and family of a woman found dead on 25 March demonstrated to demand justice and the uncovering of the causes of death.

On 24 May 2023, in Santa Rosa (La Pampa), members of the Center of Commerce Employees protested downtown against irregularities in the payment of salaries and contracts, and labor abuse in three clothes stores in the city center.

assoc_actor_1: Labor Group (Argentina); ATE: Association of State Workers
notes: On 24 May 2023, in San Carlos de Bariloche (Rio Negro), firefighters of Rio Negro and Chubut provinces associated with ATE marched to the Civic Center to demand a different social security regime, the early retirement of more than 900 firefighters affected by work-related diseases, an increase in salaries and more staff.

On 24 May 2023, in Cochabamba (Cochabamba), members of the Meritorious of the Nation Federation and their family members blocked Santianez street as a demonstration to demand the resignation of the General Cemetery manager for mistreatment, illegal charges and for not letting them place tombstones on their mausoleums.

On 24 May 2023, in Oruro (Oruro), residents of Janko Cota Sora neighborhood staged a demonstration outside the local government offices to demand respect for their land ownership rights and a halt of notifications they consider unjustified. The notifications they have been receiving claim that they are invading municipal land, which they claim is not true as existing documentation and maps can prove their ownership.

On 24 May 2023, in Santa Cruz de la Sierra (Santa Cruz), former workers of former Fassil bank staged a demonstration outside the Ambassador building, where the bank used to operate, to demand for payment of their late salaries and social benefits owed.

On 24 May 2023, in Rio Largo (Pernambuco), a man was shot to death in the Jarbas Oiticica Complex by unknown shooters who broke into the victim's house and opened fire killing him. The case was reported as an execution. The motivation behind the attack and its perpetrators are unknown. 1 fatality.

On 24 May 2023, in Manaus - South Zone (Amazonas), a gas station worker was shot and killed inside a gas station in the Petropolis neighborhood by two armed individuals who chased after him. The victim was working when the attack occurred. The victim had a police record for robbery. Authorship and motivation of the attack are unknown. 1 fatality.
On 24 May 2023, in Manaus - Central South Zone (Amazonas), state teachers gathered outside and occupied the Legislative Assembly to demand salary readjustment.
On 24 May 2023, in Rio Preto da Eva (Amazonas), a shoot-out between rival drug trafficking groups took place. An unknown number of drug traffickers were injured. There were no fatalities.
On 24 May 2023, in Rio Preto da Eva (Amazonas), a man was tied up and tortured by members of a drug trafficking group in a drug trafficking tribunal. The victim was rescued by military police.

Around 24 May 2023 (as reported), in Rio Preto da Eva (Amazonas), a man was killed by unknown individuals and his body was found near the Cristo Redentor region with signs of torture. The victim had been missing for about two days. Circumstances of death are unknown. 1 fatality.

On 24 May 2023, in Feira de Santana (Bahia), an app-driver was shot to death inside his car in the Nova Esperanca neighborhood by unknown shooters. The motivation behind the attack and its perpetrators are unknown. 1 fatality.

source: Bnews (Brazil); G1; Portal Chico Sabe Tudo
notes: Around 24 May 2023 (as reported), in Ilheus (Bahia), a man was killed and his body was found in a wooded area of the municipality. The victim was found with knife wounds and his hair was cut. He was abducted before his death by at least three armed and suspected drug traffickers in a car and was later found death. Police believe the victim was mistaken by a member of a rival drug trafficking group. A suspect of participating in the attack was later arrested. 1 fatality.

On 24 May 2023, in Nova Santa Helena (Mato Grosso), a man was shot and killed inside a bus terminal by two hooded armed individuals. There are no reports on the identity of the perpetrators or the attack's motivation. 1 fatality.

Around 24 May 2023 (as reported), in the rural area of Sinop municipality (Mato Grosso), a man was killed by unknown individuals and his body was found near Teles Pires River with his feet tied up and with a shirt around his neck, indicating asphyxiation. Circumstances of death are unknown. 1 fatality.
On 24 May 2023, in Betim (Minas Gerais), a man was shot and killed in the Petrovale neighborhood by armed individuals in the context of drug trafficking disputes. 1 fatality.

On 24 May 2023, in Governador Valadares (Minas Gerais), a man was shot and killed in front of his private residence by two armed individuals. One suspect was dressed as a street sweeper. There are no reports on the identity of the perpetrators or the attack's motivation. 1 fatality.

actor1: Police Forces of Brazil (2023-) Federal Police
notes: Property destruction: On 24 May 2023, in Londrina (Parana), federal police forces seized 2.3 tons of marijuana hidden inside a truck loaded with wheat during an inspection on the BR-369 highway. A person was arrested.

On 24 May 2023, in Petrolina (Pernambuco), locals and merchants carried out a demonstration at BR-428, Km. 185 by blocking the road and setting tires on fire, to demand the annulment of the property reinstatement of their properties in the Santo Expedito locality. Demonstrators were arguing that even though they do not have deeds, they do have sale-purchase agreements.
On 24 May 2023, in Rio de Janeiro - Central Zone (Rio de Janeiro), unknown suspects exchanged fire in the Benfica neighborhood. Unknown casualties.

On 24 May 2023, in Rio de Janeiro - North Zone (Rio de Janeiro), motorcycle taxi drivers held a protest by the entrance of the Grota community, resisting a police operation taking place in the Alemao Complex (coded separately).

Around 24 May 2023 (as reported), in Itaporanga (Sao Paulo), an armed suspect tortured a man in a drug trafficking crime tribunal. The victim was accused of cattle theft. The suspect was later arrested by the police. There were no fatalities.

On 24 May 2023, in Sao Paulo - Central Zone (Sao Paulo), 300 medical students and principals of the institution held a protest in front of the Arnaldo Vieira de Carvalho Foundation, in Vila Buarque neighborhood. The students resisted the conduct of the Board of Trustees regarding the maintenance of the institution. The protesters demanded the removal of the president of the board due to embezzlement and harassment.
On 24 May 2023, in Taubate (Sao Paulo), shopping center merchants held a protest in the Centro neighborhood, denouncing the lack of building maintenance of the mall.

On 24 May 2023, in La Serena (Coquimbo), workers protested outside of the Seremi of Culture on Regidor Munoz street in support of the national strike of workers at the Ministry of Culture. Protesters demanded labor improvements, and denounced the lack of personnel and excessive work.

On 24 May 2023, in Alerce (Llanquihue, Los Lagos), residents from Alerce Sur erected barricades and set tires on fire on Victor Jara avenue demanding the restoration of the electricity supply after three days without service. Residents from Terrazas de Angelmo, Alto Bonito and Chinquihue Alto sectors joined the demonstration.

On 24 May 2023, in Osorno (Los Lagos), food handlers marched through the streets in the city center protesting against work overload and poor service by the food companies. This protest takes place in the context of the second day of the indefinite national strike carried out by the union of food handlers, who are part of the companies that provide food to public schools.

On 24 May 2023, in Vina del Mar (Valparaiso), about 50 relatives and friends of a girl that died after suspected medical negligence protested outside of the Naval Hospital. Protesters blocked the traffic on Alessandri avenue.
On 24 May 2023, in Barranquilla (Atlantico), volunteer firefighters protested to demand more public resources for the institution.

On 24 May 2023, in Barranquilla (Atlantico), a person was beat up and injured by residents before being arrested by police. The man was suspected to have been involved in robbery minutes prior to the attack. Rioters also set fire to the victim's motorcycle.

On 24 May 2023, in Bogota - Chapinero (Bogota, D.C.), relatives of victims of state crimes protested to demand the exclusion of a military officer from the Colombian transitional justice mechanism and the benefits it provides. The group claims that the accused is not contributing to the truth.
On 24 May 2023, in Bogota - Teusaquillo (Bogota, D.C.), people protested on the NQS avenue. There are no reports on the protesters' demands.

On 24 May 2023, in Cartagena (Bolivar), tourism service providers protested against delays in the payment of compensation following the closure of their businesses due to construction work in the area.

Around 24 May 2023 (as reported), in the rural area of Jambalo municipality (Cauca), an Indigenous traditional healer and her husband were killed and their bodies found near a river, with stab wounds. The victims had been abducted two days earlier from their private residence (coded separately). Although the perpetrators have not been confirmed, the area is known for the presence of armed groups. 2 fatalities.

source: El Heraldo (Colombia); El Tiempo (Colombia); W Radio
notes: On 24 May 2023, near El Cefiro (Cauca), inhabitants and JAC members from the veredas of Santa Clara, Chontaduro, La Soledad and Parraga Viejo build barricades which were set on fire on the Pan-American Highway. The group demonstrated to demand government support for the victims of a landslide reported on 9 January 2022.

Non-violent activity: Around 24 May 2023 (as reported), in Gabriel Lopez (Cauca), ELN militants arrived in the town and patrolled the streets and demanded the departure of members of FARC dissidents, criminals and drug traffickers.

On 24 May 2023, in Pitalito (Huila), two people were beaten by a mob after they were suspected to have participated in a robbery minutes before the attack. One of the victims was shot dead, while the second remains hospitalized due to the severity of his injuries. 1 fatality.

Around 24 May 2023 (as reported), in the rural area of Fundacion municipality (Magdalena), Indigenous persons and farmers blocked the highway to protest the lack of investment in education, health and adequate road infrastructure in the area. The protests lasted two days.

On 24 May 2023, in Santa Marta (Magdalena), motorcycle taxi drivers and police forces clashed during a demonstration in which the group demanded their right to work in the city. Police arrived to intervene after the demonstrators began fighting within their own group, and the group then clashed with police.

On 24 May 2023, in the rural area of Campo Dos corregimiento (Norte de Santander), residents blocked for the second consecutive day the road linking the area with Tibu near the Monteria Ambalato vereda to protest the poor condition of the road and demand its repair.

source: El Tiempo (Colombia); RCN Radio; UNOCHA; Vanguardia Liberal
notes: On 24 May 2023, in Tibu (Norte de Santander), ELN militants set off an explosive device in the path of a police patrol near the Santander neighborhood. Ten people were injured and three were killed, including a civilian and two police officers. The blast also affected other vehicles near the area. 3 fatalities.

On 24 May 2023, in Sincelejo (Sucre), parents protested at a local school demanding the resignation of the current administrators due to poor performance of their duties. Most of the protesters are members of Indigenous communities from La Gulf, La Chivera and Barrio Prieto corregimientos.

On 24 May 2023, in Babahoyo (Los Rios), residents captured, stripped of his clothes, cut his hair and eyebrows and beat up a man that had stolen from a woman recently. They forced the man to run naked around the city as punishment.

assoc_actor_1: APE: Paraguayan Nursing Association; Health Workers (Paraguay)
notes: On 24 May 2023, in Asuncion (Asuncion), nurses associated with APE protested in front of the Social Security Institute (IPS) against cuts in the institution's budget and the eventual layoff of personnel.

On 24 May 2023, in Yasy Cany (Canindeyu), CN supporters blocked the highway to demonstrate against the results of the general elections held on 30 April. They claimed that there was fraud and irregularities with voting machines and demanded the annulment of the election result and the disclosure of voting records. They also demanded the release of the CN presidential candidate, Paraguayo Cubas, who was arrested on 5 May (coded separately). This was part of nationwide demonstrations called by Cubas after making fraud allegations.

On 24 May 2023, in Naranjito (Canindeyu), around 50 CN supporters blocked the highway to demonstrate against the results of the general elections held on 30 April. They claimed that there was fraud and irregularities with voting machines and demanded the annulment of the election result and the disclosure of voting records. They also demanded the release of the CN presidential candidate, Paraguayo Cubas, who was arrested on 5 May (coded separately). This was part of nationwide demonstrations called by Cubas after making fraud allegations.

Around 24 May 2023 (as reported), in Paraguari (Paraguari), residents marched to the municipality to protest against the installation of cell phone antennas inside the city, which they said is against municipal norms.

On 24 May 2023, in Lima - Los Olivos (Lima), residents of Armando Villanueva human settlement captured, tied to a post and beat up a man that had attempted to rob a woman. The man was later rescued by police officers and taken to a police station.

On 24 May 2023, in Lima - San Isidro (Lima), residents staged a demonstration outside the Housing Ministry to demand that potable water and sewage systems be installed in their houses, and that the provision of potable water through tanks continue until the works have been completed.

On 24 May 2023, in Punchana (Loreto), residents of Pilar Nores de Garcia human settlement marched through the city to demand a new election for neighbors authorities process to be carried out due to irregularities in the last one.
On 24 May 2023, in Maracay (Aragua), a group of teachers protested to demand better pay and working conditions.

On 24 May 2023, in Barinas (Barinas), a group of teachers protested to demand better pay and working conditions, and the cessation of the threats and intimidation against teachers for partaking in the labor action. The protesters gathered outside the Barinas state Education Zone Office.

source: Correo del Caroni; Diario Primicia; La Patilla
notes: On 24 May 2023, in Ciudad Guayana (Bolivar), a group of relatives and friends of an elderly woman that was struck and killed by a car in the Las Americas Avenue, protested to demand justice for her, and to raise awareness about the lack of road safety measures. The protesters gathered in the Las Americas Avenue.

On 24 May 2023, in Valencia (Carabobo), a group of health workers protested against the way in which the proceedings for the obtention of the retirement status and pensions for workers of their sector are being carried out. The protesters argue that the INSALUD Health Institute does not calculate pension amounts fairly, and demand the mediation of the Ombudsman. The demonstrators gathered outside the Ombudsman Office.

On 24 May 2023, in Caracas - Libertador (Distrito Capital), a group of teachers protested to demand better pay and working conditions, and the renewal of their collective labor agreement. The protesters gathered outside the Labor Inspectorate Office.

On 24 May 2023, in Moruy (Falcon), for the second consecutive day, a group of residents of the San Antonio sector continued blocking the main road of the village in protest over water outages, and to demand the supply of drinking water through pipes.

On 24 May 2023, in Barquisimeto (Lara), a group of demonstrators, including active and retired state workers, pensioners, and human rights activists, protested to demand higher pensions, and better access to medicines and medical assistance. Additionally, they announced further protests. The demonstrators gathered in the Altagracia Square.
On 24 May 2023, in Barquisimeto (Lara), a group of teachers protested to demand better pay and working conditions. The protesters gathered in the Pedro Leon Torrez Avenue.

source: OVCS: Observatorio Venezolano de Conflictividad Social
notes: On 24 May 2023, in Merida state (coded to Merida), demonstrators protested with unspecified demands on issues related to labor, justice, and political participation.

source: OVCS: Observatorio Venezolano de Conflictividad Social
notes: On 24 May 2023, in Caracas - Sucre (Miranda), a group of demonstrators, including teachers and students, protested to demand better pay and working conditions, and to defend their right to education. The protest was staged in the Carpintero neighborhood, Petare parish.

source: El Diario de Guayana; La Patilla; OVCS: Observatorio Venezolano de Conflictividad Social
notes: On 24 May 2023, in Guanare (Portuguesa), a group of demonstrators, including relatives and colleagues of a Portuguesa state police supervisor, killed by suspected CICPC police officers in unclear circumstances during a raid in his house (coded separately), protested to demand justice for him. The protesters gathered outside the Public Ministry Office.

On 24 May 2023, in Cumana (Sucre), a group of demonstrators, including teachers and unionists, protested to demand better pay and working conditions. The protesters marched to the Sucre state Education Zone Office and to the Andres Eloy Blanco Square.

On 24 May 2023, in San Cristobal (Tachira), a group of demonstrators, including teachers and unionists, protested to demand better pay and working conditions, and against the new adjustments to bonuses and benefits for state workers announced by the government, which they argue to be insufficient. The protesters also confirmed that they would be joining the two-day strike planned to begin that day. The demonstration was staged in the El Educador roundabout.

source: Diario Version Final (Venezuela); El Oriental de Monagas; La Patilla
notes: On 24 May 2023, in Maracaibo (Zulia), a group of teachers protested to demand better pay and working conditions, and the renewal of their collective labor agreement. The protest consisted of a march which they named as 'the march of silence'.

On 24 May 2023, near Salta municipality (Salta), a group of teachers demonstrated on National Route 9 to demand a raise in salaries and better labor conditions. Police officers intervened to disperse demonstrators using tear gas and rubber bullets. Several demonstrators were injured by rubber bullets fired by the officers and several were arrested. There were no fatalities.

On 24 May 2023, in Buenos Aires - Comuna 1 (Ciudad Autonoma de Buenos Aires), more than 2,000 demonstrators, including transgender people and members of political, student and labor union organizations, marched from Mayo Square to the National Congress to demand the approval of a law of historical reparation for transgender people and drag queens. They also demanded justice for LGBTQ+ victims of violence.

On 24 May 2023, in Campo Grande (Mato Grosso), an armed individual opened fire against a group of people during a party in the Los Angeles neighborhood. The target of the attack was a drug trafficker, who was killed. His brother and sister-in-law were injured by stray bullets. The shooter was also injured (unclear how). The attack was ordered by a rival drug trafficker, who had also ordered the killing of the deceased's brother in January 2021 (coded separately). 1 fatality.
Around 24 May 2023 (week of), in Almirante Tamandare (Parana), students at a state school carried out a protest against the removal of the school's director by the state department of education.

On 24 May 2023, in Lima - Lima District (Lima), members of the Peru Amnesty International organization staged a demonstration to demand the closure of congress, calling for general elections, and for the resignation of President Dina Boluarte.

On 24 May 2023, in Itauna (Minas Gerais), a man was shot 13 times and killed in a drive-by shooting in the Cidade Nova neighborhood by armed individuals in a car. The victim had a police record for several offences, including drug trafficking. There are no reports on the identity of the perpetrators. 1 fatality.

On 24 May 2023, in Presidente Olegario (Minas Gerais), a man was killed in a drive-by shooting in the Andorinhas neighborhood by at least two armed individuals in a car. The victim had a police record for homicide, theft and drug trafficking. There are no reports on the identity of the perpetrators. 1 fatality.

assoc_actor_2: Unidentified Communal Group (Colombia); JAC: Council of Communal Action
notes: Around 24 May 2023 (as reported), in the rural area of Algeciras municipality (Huila), unidentified armed individuals shot and killed a member of the JAC committee in the La Arenosa vereda. There are no further details on the attack or potential perpetrators. 1 fatality.

On 24 May 2023, in Patos (Paraiba), a man was shot to death inside a car in the city center by armed suspects who opened fire against the victim killing him. The victim had criminal records for robbery and drug trafficking. The motivation behind the attack and its perpetrators are unknown. 1 fatality.

On 24 May 2023, in Recife (Pernambuco), three men were shot to death in the Imbiribeira neighborhood by unknown shooters. The victims were taken to hospital but did not survive the injuries. Also in the Imbiribeira neighborhood, another man was shot and injured by two armed individuals who invaded his private residence. The victim was a former prisoner (charges not reported). The motivation behind the attacks and its perpetrators are unknown. 3 fatalities.

actor2: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
assoc_actor_2: Police Forces of Brazil (2023-) Civil Police
source: Brasil de Fato; Crimes News RJ; Fogo Cruzado; Folha de S. Paulo; G1; Globo Extra; Informe Agora; OTT-RJ; R7
notes: On 24 May 2023, in Rio de Janeiro - North Zone (Rio de Janeiro), Red Command drug traffickers exchanged fire with military and civil police officers during an operation in the Penha and Alemao Complexes in the Manguinhos neighborhood, and the Flexal community, Engenho da Rainha neighborhood. Suspects set fire to barricades to hinder the mobility of state forces. Four suspects were shot and killed, and one male civilian was injured by a stray bullet. Police seized three rifles, three stolen cars, a stolen motorcycle, and more than half a ton of drugs. A family clinic and 36 schools closed in the area and trains were delayed. A protest took place outside the complex (coded separately). 4 fatalities.

On 24 May 2023, in Rio de Janeiro - North Zone (Rio de Janeiro), unknown suspects exchanged fire in the Parada de Lucas, Madureira, Ricardo de Albuquerque, Tomas Coelho, and Piedade neighborhoods. Shooting was also heard in the Gogo da Ema community, Guadalupe neighborhood. Unknown casualties.

On 23 May 2023, in Valencia canton, Jutiapa, a group of people demonstrated denouncing that they had not had electricity for over 90 days. Rioters held five police officers for over 9 hours and beat at least one of them while demanded the reconnection of the electricity service in the area. The police officers, who were escorting a patrol of the electricity company, were intercepted by a group of rioters, and taken to the canton. Police officers were released after a negotiation between the rioters and security forces.

On 23 May 2023, in Tegucigalpa, Francisco Morazan, a group of farmers from the Bajo Aguan region in northern Honduras, protested at the Supreme Court of Justice (CSJ) demanding the legalization and provision of over 1,000 hectares of land that they currently cultivate. They asked for an end to repression against peasant groups and the cessation of the criminalization of workers. Additionally, they demanded respect for their right to education, health, and land donation for agricultural development.

On 23 May 2023, in Tegucigalpa, Francisco Morazan, a group of farmers from at least 12 peasant organizations set up a camp at the National Congress (CN) in protest. They demanded an end to the issuance of licenses for hydroelectric plants in the country.
Around 23 May 2023 (as reported), outside San Juan, Intibuca, a man was decapitated and his body was found on a farm in a village of El Naranjo. The reason for the killing is unknown. 1 fatality.

On 23 May 2023, in Campana, Cortes, a group of residents blocked the CA-13 highway and burned tires in demonstration. They demanded the restoration of electricity in the area, which had been out for at least 8 hours. The blackout had caused damage to electrical devices, leading to increased tension and a significant disruption of traffic between Puerto Cortes and San Pedro Sula.

On 23 May 2023, in San Jose de los Remates, Boaco, police arrested a Catholic priest at the height of KM 104 of the road to Esquipulas. Police stated that the priest was drunk and in a suspicious attitude. The priest is accused of treason to homeland. Members of the Catholic church have been subjected to constant attacks by the government for their association with the political opposition in the country.

On 23 May 2023, in Esteli, Esteli, police arrested two Catholic priests and took them to Managua. Police stated that the men were arrested under the charges of management of funds of the local Caritas. Members of the Catholic church have been subjected to constant attacks by the government for their association with the political opposition in the country.

On 23 May 2023, in Panama City, Panama, members of the Achieving Goals political party staged a demonstration against the high cost of living, unemployment, insecurity and persecution against former president Ricardo Martinelli. On 23 May 2023, in La Chorrera, Panama Oeste, members of the Achieving Goals political party staged a demonstration against the high cost of living, unemployment, insecurity and persecution against former president Ricardo Martinelli. On 23 May 2023, in La Plata - Central (Buenos Aires), students at the Normal 1 School blocked 53rd Avenue between 14th and 15th streets to protest in defense of education and against adjustment measures.

On 23 May 2023, in Abapo (Santa Cruz), for the second consecutive day, residents blocked the number 9 international route that connects Santa Cruz with the rest of the country as a demonstration to demand the Bolivian Highway Administrator (ABC) and the Santa Cruz regional government for the payment of the Losses Repositions Programs to the El Espino Charagua - Boyuibe highway project.

On 23 May 2023, in Arapiraca (Alagoas), a man was shot and injured the Olho D'Agua dos Cazuzinhos by armed suspects who broke into the victims house and opened fire. The victim was taken to hospital. The motivation behind the attack and its perpetrators are unknown.

Food handlers from the entire Antofagasta Region such as Antofagasta, Tocopilla, Taltal, Mejillones, Baquedano, Carolina de Michilla and Paposo began a strike until authorities address these problems. The mother was sued by her daughter's ex-partner, who accused her of libel and demanded a public apology after the mother stated that the case was a femicide and not a suicide. The woman died in March 2017 after sustaining serious injuries.

Protesters stated that the coordinator was trying to hide the cases and that she was not taking the necessary measures. After a meeting between parents, representatives of students, the school's board and the Provincial Director of Education, an agreement was reached and the students ended the demonstration.

Around 23 May 2023 (as reported), in Medellin - Central East (Antioquia), scriptwriters protested near the Cisneros Square against the mismanagement of the funds allocated to art and culture by the city's mayor's office.

Shootings were also heard in the Morro dos Macacos community, Vila Isabel neighborhood. Unknown casualties.

actor1: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
notes: On 23 May 2023, in Rio de Janeiro - North Zone (Rio de Janeiro), unknown suspects exchanged fire with military police in the Serrinha community, Madureira neighborhood, during a police operation. One military officer was shot and injured. There were no fatalities.

source: CR Hoy; La Nacion (Costa Rica); Teletica
notes: On 22 May 2023, in San Jose, San Jose, at least 65 employees at the Calderon Guardia hospital staged a protest against the head of the radiology department, who was accused of alleged harassment at work. The National Medical Union participated (UMN) in the protest.
On 22 May 2023, in Guatemala City, Guatemala, unidentified attackers shot and killed a moto taxi driver in zone 18. Police believe the attack could be related to extortion. 1 fatality.

On 22 May 2023, in Guatemala City, Guatemala, two members of Barrio 18 shot and killed a bus driver in zone 18, on the road to the Atlantic (drive-by). No more detail is provided by the source. 1 fatality.

On 22 May 2023, in Villa Nueva, Guatemala, unidentified attackers shot and killed a woman, while she was about to start selling tortillas in the street in zone 12. It is believed the attack is related to extortion. 1 fatality.

On 22 May 2023, near San Antonio, Jutiapa, people staged a protest against the decision of the Administrative Court that provided the suspension of the political party Citizen Prosperity in the 2023 elections. Protesters gathered at the height of KM 123 of the CA-1 East.

On 22 May 2023, near Cuilapa, Santa Rosa, people staged a protest against the decision of the Administrative Court that provided the suspension of the political party Citizen Prosperity in the 2023 elections. Protesters gathered at the height of KM 65 of the CA-1 East in a spot known as El Boqueron.
On 22 May 2023, in Escuintla, Escuintla, people staged a demonstration at the height of KM 113 of the CA-2 West. Protesters demanded the reconnection of the electricity service.

On 22 May 2023, near Santa Catarina Ixtahuacan, Solola, there was an armed clash between communal militias acting in Santa Catarina Ixtahuacan and Nahuala. As a result of the clashes, two people who were driving on a moto taxi on the Interamerican road, were killed. The report indicates that the victims were caught in the crossfire. Another report indicates that it was a direct attack against one of the victims, in a case of mistaken identity. There is a territorial dispute between the two communities over the control of a farm located between the two municipalities. 2 fatalities.

Property destruction: On 22 May 2023, in Nueva Arcadia, Copan, in the early morning, unidentified armed men shot against an office of the Honduran Red Cross and an ambulance parked in front of its facilities. No casualties were reported, with the incident resulting in material damages only. The Red Cross called on authorities to investigate the attack.

On 22 May 2023, in San Pedro Sula, Cortes, members of the Barrio 18 Gang kidnapped a lawyer and demanded a ransom of one million lempiras for his release. Police forces rescued the victim two days later and arrested several suspects.

On 22 May 2023, in Roatan, Bay Islands, health workers organized in the Union of Medicine, Hospital and Similar Workers (SITRAMEDHYS) and local teachers protested demanding full zoning payments to compensate them for working in remote locations. Protesters stated that since 2000 they have only received 10% of this benefit.

On 22 May 2023, in San Pedro Sula, Cortes, a group of workers organized in the Beverage and Similar Industries Workers' Union (STIBYS) protested demanding the fulfillment of collective contracts and respect for labor rights. After two and a half years of negotiations, the union claimed the process had been unduly delayed, with companies proposing unacceptable timelines for negotiations. Protesters argued that the use of third-party employment was being used to circumvent collective contracts, leading to unstable temporary jobs instead of secure positions.

On 22 May 2023, in Comayaguela, Francisco Morazan, parents of students attending schools in the municipalities of Alubaren and Tatumbla staged a protest outside the Departmental Education Authority, demanding the appointment of teachers in their schools.
On 22 May 2023, in Panama City, Panama, people staged a protest on the Pacora River bridge against the concession which was granted with the permission to extract sand, rocks and minerals.
On 22 May 2023, in Chame, Chame, resident of Manglarito staged a protest to demand that authorities build a road and a pedestrian bridge in the area.

source: El Mundo (El Salvador); La Prensa Grafica
notes: Around 22 May 2023 (week of), in Nueva Concepcion municipality, Chalatenango, police authorities arrested more than 30 people, including members of unidentified gangs and cliclas. The arrests were carried out since the President ordered the deployment of police and military forces in the area on 17 May 2023 (coded separately).

On 22 May 2023, in San Salvador, San Salvador, students at the Oriental Multidisciplinary Faculty of the University of El Salvador (FMO-UES) staged a demonstration to protest against the lack of publication of their subject grades. They further demanded the approval of academic processes.

On 22 May 2023, in Curuzu Cuatia (Corrientes), a hundred of people marched throughout the streets to repudiate the killing of a woman journalist in a suspected case of femicide. They demanded justice for the victim.

On 22 May 2023, in Curuzu Cuatia (Corrientes), a group of demonstrators marched from the main square to the Fernando Irastorza Hospital to protest against the death of a woman in a case of suspected medical malpractice. Police officers were present but did not intervene.

On 22 May 2023, in Lujan de Cuyo (Mendoza), around 900 students and parents at the Lujan School protested inside and outside the premises of the institution to repudiate a case of sexual abuse against a girl student with a disability that took place inside the school facilities.

On 22 May 2023, in Cochabamba (Cochabamba), dozens of District 9 residents staged a demonstration by blocking La Tamborada bridge to demand that the local government install potable water and sewage systems in the San Marcos sector.

On 22 May 2023, in Cochabamba (Cochabamba), District 15 residents staged a demonstration outside the Municipal council to demand the mayor not sign the resolution made by Mayor San Simon University (UMSS) to sell their lands. Additionally, residents of K'ara K'ara had been carrying out a vigil outside the council offices for more than 20 days to voice their concerns about the lack of fulfillment of the agreements with UMSS about these lands.

On 22 May 2023, in Santa Cruz de la Sierra (Santa Cruz), unionized transport drivers marched from Urbano park to the local government offices in 24 de Septiembre square as a demonstration to reject the vehicular reordering in the 1216 Municipal Law because it was not consulted with them.

On 22 May 2023, in Boyuibe (Santa Cruz), residents blocked the number 9 international route that connects Santa Cruz with the rest of the country as a demonstration to demand the Bolivian Highway Administrator (ABC) and the Santa Cruz regional government for the payment of the Losses Repositions Programs to the El Espino Charagua - Boyuibe highway project.

On 22 May 2023, in Abapo (Santa Cruz), residents blocked the number 9 international route that connects Santa Cruz with the rest of the country as a demonstration to demand the Bolivian Highway Administrator (ABC) and the Santa Cruz regional government for the payment of the Losses Repositions Programs to the El Espino Charagua - Boyuibe highway project.

On 22 May 2023, in Rio Branco (Acre), three people were shot and injured in the Manoel Juliao neighborhood by armed individuals who fled in a car. There are no reports on the identity of the perpetrators or the attack's motivation.

On 22 May 2023, in Rio Branco (Acre), armed individuals on a motorcycle opened fire against people in the Taquari neighborhood, in a drive-by shooting. A civilian child was injured by stray bullets. There are no reports on the identity of the perpetrators or the attack's motivation.

On 22 May 2023, in Arapiraca (Alagoas), a man was shot to death in the Canafistula neighborhood inside his business by two hooded men who arrived in a car. The men walked to the victim and opened fire, killing the victim and injuring a woman with a stray bullet, who was later taken to the hospital. The armed men escaped in a car. The motivation behind the attack and its perpetrators are unknown. 1 fatality.

actor1: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
notes: On 22 May 2023, in Macapa (Amapa), a member of a drug trafficking group exchanged fire with military police forces in the Jardim Felicidade 2 neighborhood. The drug trafficker was killed. The deceased had killed a community leader on 13 May 2023 (coded separately). Police seized a firearm and 1kg of cocaine. 1 fatality.

Around 22 May 2023 (as reported), in Manaus - North Zone (Amazonas), a man was killed by unknown individuals and his body was dumped from a car in the Novo Aleixo neighborhood. The victim's body had blunt and gunshot wounds. Circumstances of death are unknown. 1 fatality.

On 22 May 2023, in Manaus - North Zone (Amazonas), a shoot-out between members of rival drug trafficking groups took place in the Colonia Terra Nova neighborhood. One suspect was arrested by police. There were no fatalities.

Around 22 May 2023 (as reported), in Manaus - North Zone (Amazonas), a man was beaten up and killed by unknown individuals in the Cidade de Deus neighborhood. Police believes the victim was lynched. 1 fatality.
On 22 May 2023, in Manaus - South Zone (Amazonas), students and members of UNE occupied a bus terminal in the Centro neighborhood to protest against increase in bus fares.

actor2: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
source: Bahia 190; G1; Meio Norte; Portal Chico Sabe Tudo
notes: On 22 May 2023, in Conceicao do Jacuipe (Bahia), there was a shoot-out between the military police and at least one member of the Red Command (CV) gang in the Berimbau neighborhood during a police operation. The suspect was shot and injured during the clash and was taken to the hospital but did not survive the injuries. Police believes he was involved in the killing of a police officer during a robbery days before. 1 fatality.
On 22 May 2023, in Viana (Espirito Santo), about 80 people blocked the BR-101 highway to demand public lighting and the building of an overpass to reduce traffic accidents.

Around 22 May 2023 (as reported), in Nossa Senhora do Livramento (Mato Grosso), a man was killed by unknown individuals and his body was found on the MT-060 highway, in the Taruma community, with gunshot wounds and hands tied up with wire. Circumstances of death are unknown. 1 fatality.

On 22 May 2023, in the rural area of Jequitinhonha municipality (Minas Gerais), a man was shot and killed by two armed individuals. Both suspects were arrested. Attack motivation is unknown. 1 fatality.
On 22 May 2023, in Juiz de Fora (Minas Gerais), a man was stabbed nine times and killed in the Distrito Industrial neighborhood by armed individuals who fled in a car due to a drug debt. 1 fatality.

Around 22 May 2023 (weekend of), in Uba (Minas Gerais), two men were shot and killed and a third was shot and injured by an armed individual in the Habitat 1 neighborhood. The perpetrator fled with an accomplice on a motorcycle. Authorship and motivation of the attack are unknown. 2 fatalities.

actor1: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
notes: On 22 May 2023, in Capanema (Para), four armed individuals exchanged fire with military police forces in the Almir Gabriel neighborhood. One suspect was killed and another was arrested. The group was planning to carry out attacks against police agents. Police seized a firearm, ammunition and portions of drugs, indicating drug trafficking activities. 1 fatality.

On 22 May 2023, in Mocajuba (Para), a shop owner was shot and killed inside his commercial establishment by two armed individuals. There are no reports on the identity of the perpetrators or the attack's motivation. 1 fatality.

Property destruction: On 22 May 2023, in Santarem municipality (Para), unknown individuals set an Indigenous school on fire in the Sao Miguel community, near Arapiuns River. School chairs and a power generator were destroyed.
On 22 May 2023, in Tailandia (Para), municipal teachers carried out a march to demand salary readjustment and better working conditions.

On 22 May 2023, in Rio de Janeiro - North Zone (Rio de Janeiro), unknown suspects exchanged fire in the Bras de Pina, Vaz Lobo, Guadalupe, Engenho de Dentro, Cordovil, Engenho Novo, and Parada de Lucas neighborhoods and the Pedreira Complex. Unknown casualties.

On 22 May 2023, in Rio de Janeiro - West Zone (Rio de Janeiro), unknown suspects exchanged fire in the Vila Kennedy, Tanque, and Santa Cruz neighborhoods. Shooting was also heard in the Chacrinha community, Praca Seca neighborhood. Unknown casualties.

On 22 May 2023, in Itapoa (Santa Catarina), a man was shot and killed by three armed individuals who invaded his private residence. The victim had a police record for minor offences. There are no reports on the identity of the perpetrators or the attack's motivation. 1 fatality.

Around 22 May 2023 (as reported), in Sao Paulo - South Zone (Sao Paulo), unknown perpetrators tortured and killed a man, and his body was found next to a stream in the Americanopolis neighborhood. The victim had been tied up with wires on his hands and feet and had a cloth covering his mouth. 1 fatality.

On 22 May 2023, in Tocopilla (Antofagasta), parents and teachers occupied the Domingo Latrille school demanding solutions to several issues such as consumption and trafficking of drugs, sexual relations inside the school, physical and verbal attacks on teachers, among others. Protesters stated that authorities have not taken disciplinary measures to avoid these problems and that the school's director has lowered the profile of the demands. Three days ago workers at the school suspended classes and presented a public statement that included the same irregular situations that parents expressed.

Defusal: On 22 May 2023, in Santiago - Providencia (Metropolitana), unknown individuals left an explosive device in the front yard of the Paz Ciudadana Foundation. The device had a failure in its detonation system and it did not explode. Police removed the explosive device without causing damage. The group Luis Ramirez Olaechea Anarchist Brigade took responsibility for the explosive device.

assoc_actor_1: Labor Group (Chile); ANEF: National Association of Tax Employees
notes: On 22 May 2023, in Valparaiso (Valparaiso), unionized public sector workers at the Ministry of Culture and the leaders of ANEF gathered at Sotomayor square to demand an increase in their salary conditions. Workers have been on an indefinite strike for four days and have met with authorities but they did not reach an agreement. Protesters demanded the end of excessive working hours and the leveling of grades for workers who do the same jobs.

Property destruction: On 22 May 2023, in the rural area of San Cayetano municipality (Bolivar), military forces found and destroyed an ELN cocaine production complex in the Ayacucho vereda. The structure produced up to 1 ton of cocaine per month.

On 22 May 2023, in the rural area of Jambalo municipality (Cauca), unidentified individuals abducted an Indigenous traditional healer and her husband from their home in La Mina vereda. Two days later the bodies of the victims were found with stab wounds (coded separately). Although the perpetrators have not been confirmed, the area is known for the presence of armed groups.

On 22 May 2023, in the rural area of Mercaderes municipality (Cauca), unidentified armed individuals shot and killed a farmer in the El Arbolito vereda. There are no further details on the reasons for the attack or potential perpetrators, but the area is known for the presence of armed groups. 1 fatality.

actor2: FARC Dissident - 1st Front: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia Dissident Faction (1st Front - Armando Rios)
notes: Other: On 22 May 2023, in Bogota (Bogota, D.C.), the National Government suspended the cease fire with the FARC Central State (1st Front) in the departments of Meta, Guaviare, Caqueta and Putumayo, following an attack perpetrated by members of the Carolina Ramirez Front against a group of Witotos Indigenous people in Caqueta on 17 May (coded separately). The decision entails the reactivation of military operations against members of armed forces affiliated to the 1st FARC dissident front.

On 22 May 2023, in Guayaquil (Guayas), banana producers staged a demonstration outside the Zone Government offices to voice their concern about the lack of compliance with a set minimum price for bananas. They demanded the intervention of authorities to control prices and compliance with the base price.

On 22 May 2023, in Quito - Eugenio Espejo (Pichincha), residents of La Floresta, Gonzalez Suarez, La Paz, and Guapulo neighborhoods staged a demonstration outside Quito hotel to demand the new local government to guarantee that the hotel will be conserved, as it is part of the cultural heritage of the sector.

On 22 May 2023, in Pillaro (Tungurahua), residents from different sectors marched through the city as a demonstration to demand more security due to the increase of extortion cases and criminal activity in the city.

On 22 May 2023, in Encarnacion (Itapua), students and parents at the Argentine Republic National School blocked the access to the institution to protest against the bad infrastructure conditions of the restrooms. They said it had been four years since authorities promised to fix the problems.

Around 22 May 2023 (as reported), in San Pedro de Ycuamandiyu (San Pedro), students, teachers, and parents protested to demand the completion of the construction of two classrooms for the school. It has been three years since the construction works started and the classrooms were supposed to be finished the previous month.

On 22 May 2023, in Arequipa (Arequipa), residents of Hernand Bedoya Forga sector, in Cerro Colorado district, captured, beat up and killed a man that was found inside a house stealing objects. 1 fatality.

On 22 May 2023, in Iquitos (Loreto), workers of the Max Agustin stadium improvement works blocked Calvo de Araujo street with burning tires and blocking with their cars as a demonstration to demand the payment of their wages, that have been pending for more than 45 days.

On 22 May 2023, in Ayabaca (Piura), hundreds of residents of several communities marched through the city as a demonstration to reject the Rio Blanco mining projects in Alto Piura sector. The mayor of the city (Contigo Region) joined the demonstration.

source: OVCS: Observatorio Venezolano de Conflictividad Social
notes: On 22 May 2023, in Aragua state (coded to Maracay), demonstrators protested with unspecified demands on issues related to labor, justice, and petrol.

On 22 May 2023, in Punto Fijo (Falcon), a group of residents of the Las Margaritas sector blocked the Francisco de Miranda Avenue in protest against water outages going on for over a month and a half. That evening, following negotiations with the police, and Hidrofalcon water company officials, who promised them piped drinking water for that same night, the protesters lifted the road block.

actor1: Military Forces of Venezuela (1999-) GNB: Venezuelan National Guard
notes: On 22 May 2023, in Ocumare del Tuy (Miranda), GNB military forces shot and killed two unidentified crime group suspects, during an armed confrontation in the La Trilla sector. The suspects resisted authority, and a chase ensued. They were both injured in the shooting and pronounced dead in hospital. The soldiers collected two guns. There is no further information at this point in time. 2 fatalities.

source: OVCS: Observatorio Venezolano de Conflictividad Social
notes: On 22 May 2023, in Portuguesa state (coded to Guanare), demonstrators protested with unspecified demands on issues related to labor, justice, and petrol.

source: Diario de Los Andes; OVCS: Observatorio Venezolano de Conflictividad Social
notes: On 22 May 2023, in Sabana de Mendoza (Trujillo), a group of truck drivers protested to demand the liberation of four other colleagues arrested in Caracas the weekend prior, in unclear circumstances, after being accused of transporting fuel and weapons.

On 22 May 2023, in Valera (Trujillo), a group of demonstrators, including teachers and education sector workers, protested to demand better pay and working conditions, and the renewal of their collective labor agreement. The protesters gathered on Bolivar Avenue.

source: Diario Version Final (Venezuela); Noticia al Minuto
notes: On 22 May 2023, in Maracaibo (Zulia), Zulia state police forces shot and killed a member of the El Caracas Gang, during an armed confrontation in the Villa Baralt sector, Francisco Eugenio Bustamante parish. The suspect resisted authority, initiated the shooting, and was injured in the gunfire. He was pronounced dead in hospital. The deceased had a criminal record for child abuse and drug trafficking. 1 fatality.

On 22 May 2023, in Belmopan, Cayo, community members, relatives and friends of a victim of femicide staged a demonstration to demand justice. The march was organized by the Belmopan City Council and the Belize Youth Movement participated in the demonstration.

Around 22 May 2023 (as reported), in Maceio (Alagoas), a man was killed and his body was found in the Clima Bom neighborhood. The victim had a criminal record for drug trafficking. The motivation behind the attack and its perpetrators are unknown. 1 fatality.

On 22 May 2023, in Manhuacu (Minas Gerais), a man was abducted by four armed individuals. Minutes later, the victim's burnt body was found in the Sao Sebastiao do Sacramento district, rural area of the city. The victim had a police record for assault and drug trafficking. There are no reports on the identity of the perpetrators or the attack's motivation. 1 fatality.

Around 22 May 2023 (as reported), between Mirassolandia and Mirassol (Sao Paulo), a female member of the First Capital Command was captured and killed. Her body was found charred in a wooded area on 7 June. 1 fatality.

actor1: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
notes: On 22 May 2023, in Rio de Janeiro - West Zone (Rio de Janeiro), armed individuals exchanged fire with military police during an operation in the Cidade de Deus neighborhood. Two suspects were arrested. Police seized portions of crack and three trucks. There were no fatalities.

On 22 May 2023, in Cabo de Santo Agostinho (Pernambuco), a moto taxi driver was shot and injured in the Cohab neighborhood by two armed individuals. The victim was working when the attack occurred. Authorship and motivation of the attack are unknown.

On 22 May 2023, in Paulista (Pernambuco), a man was killed in a drive-by shooting in the Janga neighborhood by two armed individuals on a motorcycle. Authorship and motivation of the attack are unknown. 1 fatality.

On 22 May 2023, in Recife (Pernambuco), a man was injured in a drive-by shooting in the Bomba do Hemeterio neighborhood by an armed individual in a car. The victim was a drug user. Attack motivation is unknown.

On 21 May 2023, in Belize City, Belize, two men shot and killed a man in Lake Independence area. The victim was in his yard when the armed men turned up and shot him dead for no apparent reason. The source indicated that the attack is related to ongoing rivalry between groups that operate in the area. 1 fatality.

On 21 May 2023, in San Pedro Sula, Cortes, an unidentified armed man on a motorcycle shot and killed a VIP taxi driver in the Satellite neighborhood. The motive for the killing is unknown. 1 fatality.

On 21 May 2023, in San Pedro Sula, Cortes, two unidentified armed men on a motorcycle shot and killed a young man following a pursuit in the Larios Silva neighborhood (drive-by). The victim lost control of his vehicle due to gunshot wounds and crashed into a ditch before dying a few meters away from his car. The killers fled the scene, leaving their damaged motorcycle behind. 1 fatality.

Around 21 May 2023 (as reported), outside Tegucigalpa, Francisco Morazan, an undenied individual was killed and his body was discovered bound by arms and legs in a garbage bag in the streets of the El Tablon village. The reason for the killing is unknown. 1 fatality.

On 21 May 2023, in Comayaguela, Francisco Morazan, armed members of the Barrio 18 Gang shot and killed a sub-inspector of the National Police during an armed clash in the Buena's Nueva's neighborhood. The officer was part of a police team that had responded to an alert of a gang shootout in the area. A large police contingent deployed to the area following the clash ended up arresting seven gang members suspected for the killing. 1 fatality.

On 21 May 2023, in Santa Cruz de la Sierra (Santa Cruz), a group of residents threw red paint at the Archbishop building facade as a demonstration to reject the cases of sexual assault to children exposed in the publication of a deceased priest's diary, in which there are accounts of at least 85 minors abused.

assoc_actor_1: MAS-IPSP: Movement for Socialism-Political Instrument for the Sovereignty of the Peoples
assoc_actor_2: MAS-IPSP: Movement for Socialism-Political Instrument for the Sovereignty of the Peoples
notes: On 21 May 2023, in Warnes (Santa Cruz), during a Movement for Socialism (MAS) meeting to elect the new sectional president, members against the decisions that was being taken threw firecrackers and other objects at MAS members representatives of District 3 Buena Fe, who engaged in a clash against them.

On 21 May 2023, in Rio Branco (Acre), an adolescent was killed and his mother was injured in a drive-by shooting in the Belo Jardim neighborhood by two armed individuals in a car. The suspects were arrested and admitted they were hired by members of a drug trafficking group to kill a random person in the neighborhood. 1 fatality.

On 21 May 2023, in Manaus - East Zone (Amazonas), an adolescent was killed in a drive-by shooting in the Sao Jose Operario neighborhood by armed individuals in a car. There are no reports on the identity of the perpetrators or the attack's motivation. 1 fatality.

actor2: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
notes: Around 21 May 2023 (as reported), in Salvador - Itapua (Bahia), there was a shoot-out between the military police and armed suspects at Planeta dos Macacos community, in the Sao Cristovao neighborhood during a police operation. The area is where the Red Command (CV) gang has a presence. One suspect was shot and killed during the clash. He was suspected of being involved in the killing of a police officer in a robbery days before. With him, police seized a pistol, a pistol charger, ammunition, and portions of marijuana. 1 fatality.

On 21 May 2023, in Fortaleza (Ceara), three people were shot in the Pirambu neighborhood by unknown shooters. The victims were taken to the hospital but one of them did not survive the injuries. Minutes after this event, two other people were shot in the Cristo Redentor neighborhood, suspected to be by the same unknown shooters. The victims were taken to the hospital and police forces found a motorcycle later the same day that is suspected to have been used by the perpetrators. The motivation behind the attack and its perpetrators are unknown. 1 fatality.
On 21 May 2023, in Brasilia (Distrito Federal), people carried out a march to demand the legalization of marijuana.

On 21 May 2023, in Vitoria (Espirito Santo), family members and friends of a woman victim of femicide carried out a march in Camburi Beach to demand justice for her case and the end of gender-based violence.

On 21 May 2023, in Arenapolis (Mato Grosso), a man was killed in a drive-by shooting on the Presidente Costa e Silva street by an armed individual on a motorcycle. The victim worked as a lawyer. There are no reports on the identity of the perpetrator or the attack's motivation. 1 fatality.

On 21 May 2023, in Betim (Minas Gerais), a drug trafficker was shot at least 20 times and killed in the Laranjeiras neighborhood by three armed individuals, in the context of territorial disputes between rival drug trafficking groups. Another drug trafficker who was with the deceased was detained. 1 fatality.
On 21 May 2023, in Belford Roxo (Rio de Janeiro), Pure Third Command drug traffickers exchanged fire with the Red Command in the Morro do Amor community. Unknown casualties.
On 21 May 2023, in Rio de Janeiro - North Zone (Rio de Janeiro), unknown suspects exchanged fire in the Alemao Complex and the Sao Francisco Xavier neighborhood. Unknown casualties.

Around 21 May 2023 (as reported), in Rio de Janeiro - West Zone (Rio de Janeiro), the Red Command exchanged fire with Rio das Pedras police militia in the Pinheiro and Centrao localities, Rio das Pedras neighborhood. Two police militia members were shot and injured. There were no fatalities.
On 21 May 2023, in Rio de Janeiro - West Zone (Rio de Janeiro), unknown suspects exchanged fire in the Vargem Pequena neighborhood. Unknown casualties.

On 21 May 2023, in Porto Velho (Rondonia), a man was injured in a drive-by shooting by armed individuals on a motorcycle. A child was injured by stray bullets. There are no reports on the identity of the perpetrators or the attack's motivation.

On 21 May 2023, in Palmas (Tocantins), a man was shot and killed in the ASR-SE 105 sector by three armed individuals. There are no reports on the identity of the perpetrators or the attack's motivation. 1 fatality.

On 21 May 2023, in Sao Miguel do Tocantins (Tocantins), a shoot-out between rival organized criminal groups took place at the Bela Vista beach. One civilian man was killed and another was injured in the clash. One suspect was arrested. 1 fatality.

On 21 May 2023, near Selva Oscura (Araucania), five hooded individuals set three houses, a warehouse and a car on fire on Route CH-181. Perpetrators intimidated and hit the farmers with large weapons. The hooded men fled in a stolen vehicle. A pamphlet was found at the scene in which Mapuche Malleco Resistance (RMM) took responsibility for the attack and demanded freedom for the Mapuche prisoners transferred after the incidents in the Angol prison (coded separately). There were no fatalities.

Around 21 May 2023 (as reported), in the rural area of Novita municipality (Choco), two unidentified armed groups clashed in the Torra Zone, resulting in one civilian injured. There were no fatalities.

Around 21 May 2023 (as reported), in Santa Marta (Magdalena), residents of the neighborhoods of Maria Eugenia, San Pablo, Manzanares and Corea blocked the streets to protest against a water cut that has been affecting them for about 20 days.

source: Comision Intereclesial de Justicia y Paz
notes: On 21 May 2023, in the rural area of Puerto Asis municipality (Putumayo), three suspected militants of the CF shot and killed a young farmer near La Rosa vereda. There are no further details about the attack. The vereda belongs to the Amazonian Pearl Farmers' reserve area. 1 fatality.

On 21 May 2023, in Montevideo (Montevideo), street car washers blocked Jose Batlle and Ordonez Boulevard with San Martin Avenue to protest against police controls against these types of businesses and to demand to be allowed to work.

Around 21 May 2023 (as reported), in Mariara (Carabobo), a man was shot and killed, and his body found by the Autopista Regional del Centro Highway. The victim had gone missing two days before. It is thought that there were several perpetrators, and the killing is a settling of scores. There is no further information at this point in time. 1 fatality.

On 21 May 2023, in Valencia (Carabobo), a group of residents of the El Trigal neighborhood, in the San Jose parish, protested against power outages going on for almost a month. The protesters gathered in the Monsenor Henriquez Square.

source: Diario 2001; El Pitazo; Noticia al Minuto
notes: On 21 May 2023, in Ocumare del Tuy (Miranda), several members of the Los Pampers Gang shot and killed two twin brothers, during an attack in the Pimpineo sector, San Basilio neighborhood. The victims were thought to be thieves, who had already been threatened by the gang members not to carry out robberies in the area. The killings took place during a party in the sector. There is no further information. 2 fatalities.

source: Caraota Digital; Diario 2001; Diario Primicia; Efecto Cocuyo; El Pitazo; La Patilla
notes: On 21 May 2023, in Caracas - Sucre (Miranda), the leader of the Wilexis Gang shot and killed another fellow gang member, his second-in-command, after discovering a coup attempt against him during a meeting of high-ranked gang members. The deceased was shot in the face from close range. Other gang members obliged a civilian to transport the injured suspect to hospital, where he was pronounced dead. There is no further information at this point in time. 1 fatality.

source: El Diario de Guayana; El Pitazo; La Patilla
notes: On 21 May 2023, in Guanare (Portuguesa), CICPC police forces without identification beat a Portuguesa state police supervisor to death in unclear circumstances, during a raid in his house. The police officers were searching for the victim's son, another Portuguesa state police officer, linked to an unspecified homicide. A CICPC police patrol arrived at the victim's house, but given they couldn't find the son, they called another group of officers, without identification, who tortured and beat the police supervisor, until he died of a cardiac arrest. There is no further information at this point in time. 1 fatality.

Property destruction: On 20 May 2023, in Tumuntuco (Araucania), about 20 hooded individuals set three houses, a shed and seven vehicles on fire in the Tumuntuco-Selva farm owned by the agricultural company Huara, on Route S-443. Perpetrators broke into the farm in two trucks carrying gas cans and torches. Two workers called the police but when they arrived everything was already burned. Specifically, perpetrators burned three houses (a management house, a guest house and a house that was used as an administration office), a shed, four tractors, two trucks and a car. The identity of perpetrators is unknown but Indigenous Militias are often responsible for similar attacks in the Araucania region.

On 20 May 2023, in Puerto Montt (Los Lagos), at least 20 cars caravan protested through Los Deportistas street against the change of name of this street, formerly Regimiento street. Protesters also installed colored balloons in front of their properties and stated that the measure was adopted without consulting their opinion. Some residents covered the name Los Deportistas from the signage that indicates the new name of the street.

On 20 May 2023, in the rural area of Mariquina commune (coded to San Jose de la Mariquina, Los Rios), a group of four armed individuals set four forestry machinery on fire in the Cuyinque farm, owned by the AnChile forestry company. Perpetrators threatened three workers with firearms before the attack. When they fled, they took two workers with them in a stolen vehicle and left them abandoned 14 kilometers from the farm. The stolen vehicle was found burned and one of the workers had minor injuries. The Coordinadora Arauco Malleco (CAM) took responsibility for the attack.

Around 20 May 2023 (as reported), in Puente Alto (Metropolitana), car drivers blocked the Maipo road in protest demanding citizen security and against attacks against cars with stones suffered on the highway that damaged more than 30 vehicles during the evening of 19 May.
