On 19 May 2023, in Ciudad Tecun Uman, San Marcos, several rioters set on fire a police car, after accusing the police officers of corruption in colonia Anibal de Leon. The rioters were mostly local merchants, shrimpers, rafters, and tricycle drivers who work on both sides of the border with Mexico.

On 19 May 2023, in San Pedro Sula, Cortes, unidentified armed men who arrived on three motorcycles shot and killed a father and son in front of their home. The reason for the killing is unknown. 2 fatalities.

Property destruction: On 19 May 2023, outside Iriona, Colon, police forces seized and eradicated a coca plantation spread over 7 hectares of land and destroyed a drug processing laboratory in a mountainous area of the community of Lorea.
On 19 May 2023, in Choloma, Cortes, unidentified armed men shot and killed a taxi driver in the Lopez Orellano neighborhood. The reason for the killing is unknown. 1 fatality.

On 19 May 2023, in Amapala, Valle, a group of residents, including local business owners and fishers, staged protested due to the poor conditions of the road between the Pan-American Highway and the municipality of Coyolito and demanded for its pavement.

Property destruction: On 19 May 2023, in San Pedro Sula, Cortes, unidentified armed men burned down a taxi unit in the Rivera Hernandez neighborhood as a measure of intimidation towards the payment of extortion. There were no fatalities.

On 19 May 2023, in Tegucigalpa, Francisco Morazan, for the second consecutive day, employees of the National Professional Training Institute (INFOP) occupied the institution's premises in protest, demanding the establishment of 200 job positions and essential resources for teaching.
On 19 May 2023, in Intibuca, Intibuca, a group of doctors, nurses, and auxiliary employees occupied the Departmental Health Authority in protest demanding the payment of five months of back wages.

On 19 May 2023, in Penonome, Cocle, parents of schoolchildren and teachers staged a protest and blocked a main street in the city. Demonstrators demanded that authorities cancel the agreement with the company in charge of carrying out the reforms in the school finishes their project, as they do not trust the quality of the materials used.

On 19 May 2023, in Atulapa, Chiquimula, two armed men in a van opened fire on a group of police officers standing at the checkpoint on the road to Honduras at the height of the KM 228 of the road. The attackers ran over a police officer who was in the area. No more information was provided by the source.

On 19 May 2023, in Playa Grande Ixcan, Quiche, hundreds midwives staged a demonstration on the occasion of the National Midwife Day. Demonstrators demanded respect for their work, an increase in the budget and the end of discrimination.

assoc_actor_1: UTEP: Union of Workers of the Popular Economy; CCC: Class Combat Movement; Barrios de Pie; FPDS: Popular Front Dario Santillan; Evita Movement; Labor Group (Argentina); PO: Workers' Party; FIT: Workers' Left Front
notes: On 19 May 2023, in Mendoza (Mendoza), UTEP, PO and FIT members marched to city hall to protest against adjustments in social and food government programs and against the agreement between the government and the International Monetary Fund (IMF). They also protested against high inflation rates, unemployment and poverty. UTEP is formed by CCC, Barrios de Pie, FPDS and the Evita Movement. This was part of nation-wide demonstrations.

On 19 May 2023, in Oruro (Oruro), workers of the Oruro Technical University (UTO) marched through the city as a demonstration to demand the resignation or removal of the departmental work manager, who had declared their strike for labor regularization and salary increase was illegal.

On 19 May 2023, in Rio Branco (Acre), a man was stabbed, shot and killed by at least five armed individuals who invaded his private residence in the Eldorado neighborhood. The victim's wife was injured by stray bullets. There are no reports on the identity of the perpetrators or the attack's motivation. 1 fatality.

On 19 May 2023, in the rural area of Santana do Mundau municipality (Alagoas), a man was shot to death in an ambush by unknown shooters in Cacambinha (Cacimbinha) region. The motivation behind the attack and its perpetrators are unknown. 1 fatality.

On 19 May 2023, in Carauari (Amazonas), a man was abducted, tortured and injured by members of a drug trafficking group due to a drug debt. The victim was taken to a hospital and one drug trafficker was arrested.

actor1: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
notes: On 19 May 2023, in Ipixuna (Amazonas), two drug trafficking suspects exchanged fire with military police forces in the Porto Rico region. The drug traffickers escaped. The pair had taken part in the killing attempt of a public attorney (circumstances not reported). Police seized a firearm, ammunition, portions of drugs, a precision scale and material to process drugs. There were no fatalities.

On 19 May 2023, in Manaus - East Zone (Amazonas), a man suspected of robbing a bus was beaten up and injured by bus passengers on the Grande Circular avenue. The suspect was taken to a hospital and then arrested by police.

actor1: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
notes: On 19 May 2023, in Manaus - East Zone (Amazonas), members of a drug trafficking group exchanged fire with military police forces in the Puraquequara neighborhood. Two drug traffickers were arrested. Police seized firearms and ammunition. There were no fatalities.

actor2: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
notes: On 19 May 2023, in Feira de Santana (Bahia), military police forces from the Rondesp unit exchanged fire with drug traffickers in the Campo do Gado neighborhood during police patrol in the area. One suspect was shot and killed during the clash. Police seized a pistol, a charger, drugs, and a cell phone. 1 fatality.

On 19 May 2023, in Feira de Santana (Bahia), a man was shot to death in a drive-by shooting in the Sao Joao neighborhood by armed suspects who opened fire from a car killing the victim. The motivation behind the attack and its perpetrators are unknown. 1 fatality.

actor2: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
notes: On 19 May 2023, in Salvador - Tancredo Neves (Bahia), there was a shoot-out between the military police, Rondesp unit and armed suspects in the Pernambues neighborhood during a police operation. One individual, suspected to be involved in the killing of a military police officer the day before during a robbery, was shot and killed during the clash. With him police seized a firearm. 1 fatality.

On 19 May 2023, in Salvador - Cajazeiras (Bahia), two men were shot to death in the Cajazeiras neighborhood by two armed men who arrived on a motorcycle and opened fire killing the victims, fleeing after the attack. The motivation behind the attack and its perpetrators are unknown. 2 fatalities.

actor2: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
notes: On 19 May 2023, in Salvador - Suburbio/Ilhas (Bahia), there was a shoot-out between the military police and drug traffickers in the Plataforma neighborhood during a police operation. One suspect was shot and injured during the clash and was taken to the hospital but did not survive the injuries. With him, police seized a handcrafted machine gun, ammunition, and portions of drugs. 1 fatality.

On 19 May 2023, in Aparecida de Goiania (Goias), artists, teachers and lawyers carried out a protest against the resignation of an arts teacher from a school. The teacher was fired after she wore a T-shirt with an image of a painting by a Brazilian artist which said 'be an outcast, be a hero'.

actor1: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
notes: On 19 May 2023, in Girassol district (Aguas Lindas de Goias, Goias), a member of the PCC exchanged fire with military police forces during his arrest operation. The PCC member was killed. The deceased had taken part in the killing of a CV member on 18 May 2023 (coded separately). 1 fatality.

A suspect was shot and injured during the clash and was taken to the hospital but did not survive the injuries. 1 fatality.

Furniture and religious artifacts were either set on fire or destroyed. The perpetrator was detained and later released. The religious leader of the site believes it was a case of religious intolerance.

On 19 May 2023, in Viamao (Rio Grande do Sul), a drug trafficker was shot and killed in the Esmeralda neighborhood by two armed individuals. Police believes in rivalries between drug trafficking groups as the motivation for the killing. 1 fatality.
On 19 May 2023, in Boa Vista (Roraima), a Venezuelan man suspected of killing another man was beaten up and severely injured by residents in the city center. The victim was taken to a hospital.

On 19 May 2023, in Santa Barbara d'Oeste (Sao Paulo), a man suspected of killing an off-duty military police officer (coded separately) was shot and killed in a police action in the Santa Rita de Cassia neighborhood. 1 fatality.

actor1: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
notes: On 19 May 2023, in Santa Barbara d'Oeste (Sao Paulo), military police officers tortured three arrested suspects in custody. The victims were suspected of involvement in the execution of a military police officer. They had been arrested on the same day following a clash with the police forces where one of the suspects was killed (coded separately). There were no specific reports about how the torture happened. There were no fatalities.

On 19 May 2023, in Temuco (Araucania), Mapuche Indigenous people protested with banners in the city center against members of Republican Party (PR) and Chile Vamos that according to protesters are making political use of forest fires within the context of an investigative commission.

assoc_actor_2: Unidentified Communal Group (Colombia); JAC: Council of Communal Action
notes: On 19 May 2023, in Santo Domingo (Tame, Arauca), unidentified armed individuals shot and killed a social leader member of the JAC of the Guavarin vereda. The perpetrators ambushed the victim's vehicle, injuring an undetermined number of other people who were in the car. Although the perpetrators have not been confirmed, the area is known for the presence of armed groups. 1 fatality.

Defusal: Around 19 May 2023 (as reported), in the rural area of Caldono municipality (Cauca), military forces deactivated explosive devices and anti-personnel mines planted by an unidentified armed group in the Los Robles vereda. The FARC and ELN have a presence in the area.

source: Comision Intereclesial de Justicia y Paz
notes: On 19 May 2023, in the rural area of Valle del Guamuez municipality (Putumayo), a young man was shot and killed by unidentified individuals. There are no further details about the attack. Residents fear that the incident is related to social cleansing carried out by armed groups. Although the perpetrators have not been confirmed, the area is known for the presence of the CF and the FARC dissident faction Carolina Ramirez. 1 fatality.

On 19 May 2023, in Asuncion (Asuncion), CN supporters demonstrated around the National Congress to demand the liberation of the CN leader and presidential candidate Paraguayo Cubas, who was arrested on 5 May (coded separately) for calling nationwide demonstrations based on fraud allegations in the 30 April general elections. Demonstrators clashed with police officers, who used tear gas. Three demonstrators were arrested after throwing a corrosive substance at the police. There were no casualties.

On 19 May 2023, in Maturin (Monagas), a group of relatives of a woman killed in unclear circumstances, gathered to demand justice for her. The woman was found dead in her house this week in a case of suspected femicide. The protesters gathered outside the Public Ministry Office.

On 19 May 2023, in Barquisimeto (Lara), a group of demonstrators, including teachers, education sector workers, and unionists, protested to demand better pay and working conditions, and the renewal of their collective labor agreement. The protesters gathered outside the Labor Inspectorate Office, where they handed in a letter with their demands.

On 19 May 2023, in Uberlandia (Minas Gerais), a man was shot and killed in the Presidente Roosevelt neighborhood by an unknown armed individual. The victim had a police record for drug trafficking. 1 fatality.

assoc_actor_2: Labor Group (Brazil); Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
notes: On 19 May 2023, in Salvador - Centro (Bahia), a shop owner was shot and killed inside his commercial establishment in the Parque Bela Vista neighborhood by three CV members during a robbery. The shop owner was also a military police officer. 1 fatality.

On 19 May 2023, in Galindo (Bolivar), militants of the Gulf Clan abducted five workers at the oil transportation company Distracom. The victims were intercepted by two armed men when they were transporting several gallons of gas oil along the Cauca River and were forced to anchor on the riverbank. Subsequently, another 50 armed men arrived and held the victims hostage for four days until they stole all the cargo, releasing the victims on 22 May.

On 19 May 2023, in the rural area of La Gabarra corregimiento (Norte de Santander), members of the ELN abducted a soldier on leave from his house in Francisco de Paula Santander vereda. His whereabouts and state of health are unknown.

On 19 May 2023, outside Puerto Cortez, Cortes, a group of teachers blocked traffic on the CA-13 highway near the village of El Chile in protest. Their demands included dignified retirement, an end to the persecution and dismissal of teachers, and payment of zoning for teachers in the Bay Islands and Gracias a Dios departments.

Police arrested 17 suspects and seized 14 rifles, two machine guns, ammunition, grenades, and drugs. In the Pedreira community, Costa Barros neighborhood, armed individuals exchanged fire with military police during an operation. One suspect was injured and taken to a hospital. Police seized a riffle. There were no fatalities.

On 19 May 2023, in Duque de Caxias (Rio de Janeiro), two armed suspects shot and killed a woman on Presidente Kennedy Avenue, near the Corte Oito neighborhood (drive-by). The event was described as a possible execution. 1 fatality.
On 19 May 2023, in Rio de Janeiro - West Zone (Rio de Janeiro), unknown suspects exchanged fire in the Tanque neighborhood and in the Congo region, Vila Kennedy neighborhood. Unknown casualties.

assoc_actor_2: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
notes: On 19 May 2023, in Natal (Rio Grande do Norte), a reserve military police officer was shot to death in the Felipe Camarao neighborhood by at least 10 armed suspects who ambushed the officer and opened fire killing him. The victim was assumed off-duty as he was near his house. He had been threatened in the past and ordered to leave his house. Police believe the victim was killed by members of a drug trafficking group. 1 fatality.

On 19 May 2023, in Jaboatao dos Guararapes (Pernambuco), a man was killed and another was injured in a drive-by shooting in the Muribequinha neighborhood by two armed individuals on a motorcycle. There are no reports on the identity of the perpetrators or the attack's motivation. 1 fatality.

On 18 May 2023, in Quillacollo (Cochabamba), unionized members of Departmental Association of Swine Breeders (ADEPOR) staged a demonstration at the Sanitation National Service (SENASAG) offices to voice their grievance about the arbitrary closure of San Lorenzo farm in San Benito city.

On 18 May 2023, in Colcapirhua (Cochabamba), unionized merchants of San Lorenzo Association built a wall on the local government entrance as a demonstration to reject the 351 Law that requires them to move to another sector.

On 18 May 2023, in Santa Cruz de la Sierra (Santa Cruz), a group of women staged a demonstration outside the Metropolitan Cathedral to voice their grievances about the sexual assault of children cases done by priests and the cover-up carried out by the Catholic church.

On 18 May 2023, in Montero (Santa Cruz), for the third consecutive day, farmers blocked the Santa Cruz - Cochabamba highway at Amistad bridge as a demonstration to reject the 4910 and 4911 Supreme decrees that restricts the sales of gasoline.

On 18 May 2023, in Maceio (Alagoas), a man was shot in the Clima Bom neighborhood by at least one armed suspect who opened fire and shot four times in the back, injuring the victim, who was later taken to a local hospital. The motivation behind the attack and its perpetrators are unknown. There were no fatalities.

On 18 May 2023, in Feira de Santana (Bahia), a man was shot to death in the Papagaio neighborhood by unknown suspects. The victim was found with his hands tied up and at least 15 gunshot wounds. The motivation behind the attack and its perpetrators are unknown. 1 fatality.

On 18 May 2023, in Feira de Santana (Bahia), a man was shot to death in the Papagaio neighborhood by at least three armed suspects who chased the victim when he tried to flee, and opened fire killing him. The motivation behind the attack and its perpetrators are unknown. 1 fatality.

On 18 May 2023, in Joao Pessoa (Paraiba), a man was shot to death in the Colinas do Sul neighborhood by at least four armed suspects who cornered the victim while he was returning home from a local bakery with his son, and opened fire killing him. The motivation behind the attack and its perpetrators are unknown. 1 fatality.

On 18 May 2023, in Sao Luis (Maranhao), armed suspects opened fire driving-by against a rival gang member in the Vila Conceicao neighborhood. The suspect fled, but two minors who were returning from school were shot and severely injured by stray bullets. They were taken to the hospital but did not survive the injuries. 2 fatalities.
On 18 May 2023, in Sao Paulo - Central Zone (Sao Paulo), residents held a protest on Paulista Avenue, demanding an end to asylums in the city.

On 18 May 2023, in Campinas (Sao Paulo), employees of a health center held a protest, lamenting a lack of security at the site. The workers began a strike.
On 18 May 2023, in Rio de Janeiro - West Zone (Rio de Janeiro), members of the Rio das Pedras police militia shot and killed a man in the Itanhanga neighborhood. 1 fatality.

On 18 May 2023, in Teresina (Piaui), health workers gathered in front of the Karnak palace to demonstrate demanding better working conditions, better salaries, and repudiating the outsourcing of contracting.

On 18 May 2023, in Santana (Amapa), a man was shot and killed in the Nova Uniao neighborhood by approximately seven armed individuals who invaded his private residence. The victim had a police record for robbery and theft. There are no reports on the identity of the perpetrators or the attack's motivation. 1 fatality.

actor1: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
notes: On 18 May 2023, in Macapa (Amapa), a member of a drug trafficking group exchanged fire with military police forces during his arrest operation in the Macapaba housing complex. The drug trafficker was a fugitive from the penitentiary system. The drug trafficker was killed. Police seized a firearm. Moreover, in the Pedrinhas neighborhood a drug trafficking suspect exchanged fire with military police forces during a patrol. The drug trafficker was killed. 2 fatalities.

actor2: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
notes: On 18 May 2023, in Barreiras (Bahia), there was a shoot-out between the civil police and armed suspects in the Morada da Lua neighborhood during a police operation. Two suspects were shot and injured and taken to the hospital but did not survive the injuries. Police seized two firearms and ammunition. 2 fatalities.

On 18 May 2023, in Manaus - North Zone (Amazonas), a man was tied up, tortured and killed by four hooded armed individuals who invaded his private residence in the Cidade Nova neighborhood. A woman was also shot and killed. There are no reports on the identity of the perpetrators or the attack's motivation. 2 fatalities.

On 18 May 2023, in Caucaia (Ceara), a man was shot to death in the surroundings of the Sao Gerardo square by armed suspects who opened fire killing the victim and injuring two female civilians with stray bullets. The victims were later taken to the hospital. The motivation behind the attack and its perpetrators are unknown. 1 fatality.

On 18 May 2023, in Manaus - East Zone (Amazonas), three men were killed and a woman was injured in a drive-by shooting in the Tancredo Neves neighborhood by armed individuals on a motorcycle. There are no reports on the identity of the perpetrators or the attack's motivation. 3 fatalities.
On 18 May 2023, in Costa Rica (Mato Grosso do Sul), an adolescent was stabbed and injured by a drug trafficker due to a drug debt. The drug trafficker was arrested.
On 18 May 2023, in Belo Horizonte (Minas Gerais), people gathered in the Sete de Setembro square to demand the end of child sexual abuse and sexual exploitation.

On 18 May 2023, in Belo Horizonte (Minas Gerais), a drug trafficker was shot at least 14 times and killed in the Conjunto Jardim Filadelfia neighborhood by two armed individuals. Police believe territorial disputes between rival drug trafficking groups was the motivation for the killing. 1 fatality.

On 18 May 2023, in Sete Lagoas (Minas Gerais), a man was shot six times and killed in the Cristina Leao Ferreira square, in the Interlagos neighborhood, by two armed individuals. There are no reports on the identity of the perpetrators or the attack's motivation. 1 fatality.

On 18 May 2023, in Breu Branco (Para), a bar owner was killed in a drive-by shooting in the Novo Horizonte neighborhood by an armed individual on a motorcycle. The victim was closing down his establishment when the attack occurred. There are no reports on the identity of the perpetrator or the attack's motivation. 1 fatality.

On 18 May 2023, in Parauapebas (Para), a man was killed in a drive-by shooting in the Primavera neighborhood by an armed individual on a motorcycle. The victim was wearing a monitoring anklet for drug trafficking. There are no reports on the identity of the perpetrator. 1 fatality.

On 18 May 2023, in Benfica district (Benevides, Para), a bar owner was shot and killed in front of his commercial establishment in the Itaquara neighborhood by three armed individuals. The victim was working when the attack occurred. Police believe the victim was ambushed. There are no reports on the identity of the perpetrators or the attack's motivation. 1 fatality.

actor1: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
notes: On 18 May 2023, around Criuva (Caxias do Sul, Rio Grande do Sul), a member of a drug trafficking group exchanged fire with military police forces in a rural property. The drug trafficker was killed. Police seized a firearm, ammunition, a drone, portions of drugs and a notebook. 1 fatality.
On 18 May 2023, in Rio de Janeiro - South Zone (Rio de Janeiro), unknown suspects exchanged fire in the Morro dos Tabajaras community, Copacabana neighborhood. Unknown casualties.

On 18 May 2023, in Rio de Janeiro - North Zone (Rio de Janeiro), unknown suspects exchanged fire in the Gogo da Ema community, Guadalupe neighborhood and the Morro do Fuba community, Cascadura neighborhood. Unknown casualties.

actor2: Police Forces of Brazil (2023-) Municipal Guards
notes: On 18 May 2023, in Belo Horizonte (Minas Gerais), people blocked the entrance of the City Hall building to protest against increase in bus fares. Municipal guards dispersed the protesters.
On 18 May 2023, in Parintins (Amazonas), public school teachers carried out a motorcade to demand salary readjustments.
On 18 May 2023, in Manacapuru (Amazonas), public school teachers carried out a march to demand salary readjustment.
On 18 May 2023, in Goiania (Goias), more than 500 students from municipal schools carried out a march against abortion.

On 18 May 2023, in Silvanopolis (Tocantins), a man and his son were shot and killed by two armed individuals who invaded their private residence. There are no reports on the identity of the perpetrators or the attack's motivation. 2 fatalities.

actor1: Police Forces of Brazil (2023-) Federal Police
notes: On 18 May 2023, in Uberlandia (Minas Gerais), 58 members of a drug trafficking group were arrested by federal police forces during an operation to curb drug trafficking activities in the state.

On 18 May 2023, in Sao Joao Nepomuceno (Minas Gerais), a drug trafficker was shot and killed in the Jose Maria Fan neighborhood by unknown armed individuals. Police believe the deceased was killed by rival drug traffickers. The deceased had been the target of a previous killing attempt in March 2023 (coded separately). 1 fatality.

On 18 May 2023, in Porto Velho (Rondonia), a man was killed in a drive-by shooting in the Areal neighborhood by two armed individuals on a motorcycle. One suspect was arrested. Attack motivation is unknown. 1 fatality.

actor1: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
notes: On 18 May 2023, in Porto Velho (Rondonia), two armed individuals exchanged fire with military police forces following a chase. One suspect was arrested and the other escaped. The pair had just killed a man moments before (coded separately). There were no fatalities.

On 18 May 2023, in Montes Claros (Minas Gerais), a man was chased after, tied up and forced into a vehicle by four individuals. The victim was tortured, beaten up and injured. The perpetrators abandoned the victim in the Santo Amaro neighborhood, where he called for help. There are no reports on the identity of the perpetrators or the attack's motivation.

On 18 May 2023, in Pitangui (Minas Gerais), a man was shot and killed inside a tire repair shop by two armed individuals. The victim was working at the shop when the attack occurred. There are no reports on the identity of the perpetrators or the attack's motivation. 1 fatality.
On 18 May 2023, in Brasilia (Distrito Federal), public school teachers gathered in front of the Buriti Palace to demand salary readjustments.

Property destruction: On 18 May 2023, in Los Lagos (Los Rios), seven hooded individuals set a forestry truck on fire. Perpetrators intimidated the driver with their weapons before the attack. A pamphlet was found at the scene in which Coordinadora Arauco Malleco (CAM) took responsibility for the attack.

On 18 May 2023, in Valparaiso (Valparaiso), fishers from Concon, Quintero, and Puchuncavi arrived at Court with banners to present an appeal to try to stop the construction of a desalination plant in Puchuncavi. Protesters stated that the project will cause damage to marine fauna. Fishers have blocked the accesses to the project for 11 days hindering the works.

On 18 May 2023, in Tocopilla (Antofagasta), a group of families from the San Lorenzo sector occupied the Serviu office demanding the delivery of a housing project that had been stalled for more than 10 years. The Regional Director met with them and reached agreements that will allow the initiative to materialize in the coming months. Protesters stated that the delays are affecting 88 families.

On 18 May 2023, in Santiago - Providencia (Metropolitana), students destroyed recently installed security cameras in the Jose Lastarria school. Students have been occupying the school for the past two days demanding the complying with a list of petitions made to the school's board.

On 18 May 2023, in Valparaiso (Valparaiso), workers at the Ministry of Culture protested at their workplace with work and salary demands, including better remuneration and lack of staff, among others. Protesters stated that nearly 600 national workers began a 48 hours strike. There have been several meetings between workers and authorities but they did not reach an agreement.
On 18 May 2023, in Cartagena (Bolivar), book sellers blocked the center of the city to protest the decrease in their sales due to repair works of the public park where their businesses are located.
On 18 May 2023, in El Banco (Magdalena), students and their parents protested at a local school against the poor infrastructure of the building.

assoc_actor_2: Unidentified Communal Group (Colombia); CH: Humane Colombia; PH: Historic Pact for Colombia
notes: On 18 May 2023, in Tibu (Norte de Santander), unidentified armed individuals shot and killed a member of the CH and Pacto Historico (Historic Pact for Colombia) political party and communal leader. Perpetrators broke into the victim's house and shot him. The victim was a pre-candidate for the local council. Although the authorship of the attack has not been confirmed, the area is known for the presence of armed groups. 1 fatality.

On 18 May 2023, in the rural area of Santander De Quilichao municipality (Cauca), riots broke out when marijuana farmers confronted a group of Indigenous people who were carrying out a campaign to eradicate illicit crops in the Munchique Los Tigres indigenous reservation zone. Four indigenous people and two people supporting the group in the eradication were injured. Four injured farmers were captured by members of the Guardia Indigena.

actor1: FARC Dissident - Jaime Martinez: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia Dissident Faction (Jaime Martinez)
actor2: Police Forces of Colombia (2022-) UNP: National Unit for Protection
notes: Around 18 May 2023 (as reported), in the rural area of Totoro municipality (Cauca), militants of the dissident FARC Jaime Martinez faction opened fire on a UNP officer who ignored a stop sign from the group in the Boqueron sector. The officer was wounded after several bullets hit his vehicle. There were no fatalities.

On 18 May 2023, in the rural area of Valdivia municipality (Antioquia), Gulf Clan militants and ELN clashed in the El 15 area. The clashes occurred near a public school, leaving students caught in the crossfire. There were no fatalities.
On 18 May 2023, in Dibulla (La Guajira), nearly 200 students and teachers blocked a road to protest against the school's shortage of cafeteria and security personnel.

Around 18 May 2023 (as reported), in the rural area of Caracoli corregimiento (La Guajira), residents blocked the entrance to a hydroelectric plant in the San Juan del Cesar area to protest a power outage that has been affecting the inhabitants of the municipality for 72 hours.

actor1: FARC Dissident - Dagoberto Ramos: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia Dissident Faction (Dagoberto Ramos)
assoc_actor_2: Former FARC: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia
notes: Around 18 May 2023 (as reported), in the rural area of Silvia municipality (Cauca), suspected militants of the dissident FARC faction Dagoberto Ramos attacked a former FARC member in the Tumbarao area. The perpetrators opened fire on the victim's house. There were no fatalities.

Around 18 May 2023 (as reported), in the rural area of Simiti municipality (Bolivar), suspected members of the Gulf Clan killed a man and threw his body on a rural road. Near the body, there was a sign stating that the victim was killed for being an informant for guerrilla groups.

assoc_actor_1: Government of Ecuador (2021-); MCAT: Civic Movement for Ambato and Tungurahua
notes: On 18 May 2023, in Pillaro (Tungurahua), hundreds of residents and the city's mayor (affiliated with MCAT) marched through the city as a demonstration to demand more controls by the police to control criminal activity in the city.
On 18 May 2023, in Villa Elisa (Central), truck drivers blocked the access to the PETROPAR oil company to demand a decrease in fuel prices.

On 18 May 2023, in Huancayo (Junin), informal merchants at the Ica and Ferrocarril sectors clashed with police officers during an operation to free and reorder streets, that included the eviction of informal merchants. One merchant was injured and three were arrested.
On 18 May 2023, in Chilca (Junin), residents burned tires and boxes as a demonstration to warn people from carrying out criminal activities in their sector, or else they will be burnt alive.

On 18 May 2023, in Chiclayo (Lambayeque), parents of students and managers at Nicolas La Torre Garcia school marched through the city as a demonstration to repudiate the lack of guarantee of security for students by provincial authorities and the police.

On 18 May 2023, in Lima - Lima District (Lima), informal and formal merchants of the Mesa Redonda sector clashed after the formal merchants threw water at the sidewalks so that the informal merchants could not place their products.

On 18 May 2023, in Maracaibo (Zulia), a group of demonstrators, including active and retired teachers, pensioners and unionists, protested to demand better pay and working conditions, and the renewal of their collective labor agreement. Additionally, they rejected the new adjustments to bonuses and benefits for state workers announced by the government, which they argue to be insufficient. The protesters marched to the Maracaibo state Education Zone Office, where they handed in a letter with their demands.

assoc_actor_1: Teachers (Venezuela); FVM: Venezuelan Federation of Teachers
notes: On 18 May 2023, in Ciudad Guayana (Bolivar), a group of demonstrators, including teachers, and FVM representatives, protested to demand better pay and working conditions. The protesters gathered in the El Dorado roundabout, in San Felix.

On 18 May 2023, in Santa Maria de Upata (Bolivar), a group of residents blocked the Troncal 10 road in protest over the arrest of 18 artisanal miners of the El Cume mine by GNB military officers, in unclear circumstances, that took place on 17 May. The protesters argue that these arrests were arbitrary, and deny any involvement of the detainees with criminal groups.
On 18 May 2023, in Bruzual municipality (coded to Chivacoa, Yaracuy), a group of demonstrators marched to demand better pay and working conditions.

On 18 May 2023, in Ciudad Guayana (Bolivar), a group of workers at the state-owned Venalum aluminium producing company protested against the presence of pro-government unionists in their plant. The protesters claim that these organizations don't operate in their best interest, and accuse them of collaborationists with the regime. The protest took place at the company's premises.

On 18 May 2023, in Higuerote (Miranda), a group of demonstrators, including teachers and unionists, gathered to demand the renewal of their collective labor agreement, and to announce further labor action. The protest took place in the El Indio Square.

source: OVCS: Observatorio Venezolano de Conflictividad Social; Provea
notes: On 18 May 2023, in Barquisimeto (Lara), a group of demonstrators, including residents of the La Caruciena sector, human rights activists, and their lawyers, gathered to demand a better drinking water supply. The protesters gathered outside the Barquisimeto courthouse, where they filed a lawsuit against the Hidrolara water company, which they blame for the poor service.

On 18 May 2023, in San Jose, San Jose, more than 500 people staged a protest at the Democracy Park Square against the budget cuts proposed to the Ministry of Culture. Protesters included artists, the Federation of Students of the University of Costa Rica (Feucr), the Federation of Students of the National University (Feuna) and twenty social organizations.

On 18 May 2023, in Batan, Limon, several parents of school children staged a protest in local school against the headmaster. Demonstrators argued that the headmaster has committed mismanagement and other irregularities.

On 18 May 2023, in San Jose, San Jose, students staged a protest by blocking access to a school and demanded the dismissal of the education board. Protesters argued that they had denounced the board in the past with no luck.
On 18 May 2023, in Masagua municipality, Escuintla, police authorities arrested the third-in-command of the Mara Salvatrucha in El Salvador.

assoc_actor_1: Police Forces of Guatemala (2020-) Prison Guards
notes: On 18 May 2023, in Guatemala City, Guatemala, prison guards staged a protest to demand a salary raise. A simultaneous protest was carried out in the Fraijanes prison (coded separately).

assoc_actor_1: Police Forces of Guatemala (2020-) Prison Guards
notes: On 18 May 2023, in Fraijanes, Guatemala, prison guards staged a protest to demand a salary raise. A simultaneous protest was carried out in the prison located in zone 18 of Guatemala City (coded separately).

On 18 May 2023, in Jutiapa, Jutiapa, an armed men opened fire on the police station in Barrio Latino. As a result, police officers retaliated the attack and injured the attacker. The motivation for the attack is unknown. No more detail is provided by the source. 1 injured.

On 18 May 2023, in Mixco, Guatemala, unidentified attackers shot and killed a private security officer in zone 10. No more detail is provided by the source. The motivation for the attack is unknown. 1 fatality.

On 18 May 2023, in Catacamas, Olancho, for the second consecutive day, a group of healthcare workers from the city policlinic went on a work strike and protested on the main road of the municipality demanding the payment of four months of back wages and dignified working conditions.

On 18 May 2023, in Ilama, Santa Barbara, imprisoned members of the Barrio 18 Gang clashed with imprisoned members of the Mara Salvatrucha Gang at the maximum-security prison El Pozo resulting in at least two inmates being injured, and one dead. 2 wounded. 1 fatality.
On 18 May 2023, in Rio Nance, Cortes, unidentified armed men shot and killed a bus driver. The reason for the killing is unknown. 1 fatality.
On 18 May 2023, in Choloma, Cortes, unidentified armed gang members shot and killed a man for refusing to join their gang in the Las Pilas neighborhood. 1 fatality.

Property destruction: On 18 May 2023, outside Olanchito, Yoro, military forces seized and incinerated a marijuana plantation spread over 4.2 hectares of land and containing 24 individual plants, in a mountainous area close to the La Jaguaca village.

On 18 May 2023, in Tegucigalpa, Francisco Morazan, employees of the National Institute of Professional Training (INFOP) occupied the facilities of the institution in protest demanding the establishment of 200 job positions and essential resources for teaching.monstrated demanding the opening of the gates of the National Institute of Professional Training (INFOP) which were blocked by a group of workers who were on strike (coded separately). Police forces who arrived to control the demonstrations were confronted by LIBRE supporters who pushed one of the officers to the ground. Police arrested a LIBRE leader who had organized the counter demonstration.

On 18 May 2023, in San Salvador, San Salvador, members of the LGBTQ+ community staged a protest at the Legislative Assembly facilities on the occasion of the International Day Against Transphobia, Homophobia and Biphobia. Protesters demanded that the legislative assembly carry out a study of the Gender Identity Draft bill submitted by civil society organizations in 2021.

On 18 May 2023, in Cuscatancingo, San Salvador, there was an armed clash between at least one member of an unidentified gang and police officers. As a result of the clash, one gang member was killed. No more detail is provided by the source. 1 fatality.

On 18 May 2023, in La Paz (La Paz), members of feminist collectives staged a demonstration outside the Compania de Jesus Church to demand that cases of pederasty not be covered up, after the publication of a deceased priest's diary in which there are accounts of at least 85 minors abused.

On 18 May 2023, in Maceio (Alagoas), a man was shot to death in the Vergel do Lago neighborhood, near the police battalion, by unknown shooters. The motivation behind the attack and its perpetrators are unknown. 1 fatality.

On 18 May 2023, in Aguas Lindas de Goias (Goias), a member of the CV was shot and killed by two members of the PCC who invaded his private residence. A second person, not a gang member, was also killed in the attack. One suspect was arrested on 19 May 2023. 2 fatalities.

actor1: FARC Dissident - Dagoberto Ramos: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia Dissident Faction (Dagoberto Ramos)
notes: Around 18 May 2023 (as reported), in the rural area of Corinto municipality (Cauca), an Indigenous man was killed and his body was found on a rural road. The victim and his daughter were abducted by suspected militants of the FARC dissident faction Dagoberto Ramos near El Palo (Caloto, Cauca) on 16 May, two days later the victim's body was found. The child was later released but the adult was killed. 1 fatality.

On 18 May 2023, in the rural area of Tumaco municipality (Narino), an Awa Indigenous person and governor of the Guiza Sabalo (Gran Sabalo) Indigenous reserve area was severely injured after stepping on an anti-personnel mine planted by an unidentified armed group. The victim remains hospitalized due to the seriousness of his injuries.

On 18 May 2023, in Banos de Agua Santa (Tungurahua), residents of Pititig neighborhood captured and beat up a man that was accused of being a robber. Police officers rescued the man and took him to a police station.

On 18 May 2023, in Cordoba (Cordoba), unionized workers at the Argentinian Planes Factory (FADEA) held a protest with demands for the directors of the company, however, the is no information about the specific demands.

On 18 May 2023, in Divinopolis (Minas Gerais), a man was shot and killed in the Heleno Ramos Freitas neighborhood by unknown armed individuals. The victim had a police record for theft, handling stolen goods, and drug trafficking. 1 fatality.

Around 18 May 2023, in the rural area of Tame municipality (Arauca), ELN militants abducted a ornament maker who was working in the area. There are no details of how the abduction occurred. The victim was released around 6 June by the armed group.

source: Fogo Cruzado; G1; Globo Extra; Informe Agora; O Sao Goncalo; OTT-RJ; R7
notes: On 18 May 2023, in Rio de Janeiro - North Zone (Rio de Janeiro), armed suspects exchanged fire with police officers in the Amarelinho Complex, Acari neighborhood. A female civilian was shot and killed by a stray bullet. 1 fatality.

Police seized a large quantity of crack and marijuana. Unknown casualties.

On 18 May 2023, in Rio de Janeiro - West Zone (Rio de Janeiro), unknown suspects exchanged fire in the Freguesia de Jacarepagua, Senador Camara and in the Vila Kennedy neighborhoods. Unknown casualties.

On 18 May 2023, in Rio de Janeiro - West Zone (Rio de Janeiro), a shoot-out between members of police militias and drug traffickers took place in the Rio das Pedras neighborhood. A moto taxi driver was killed in the crossfire. 1 fatality.

On 18 May 2023, in Recife (Pernambuco), a man was shot and killed by an unknown armed individual who invaded his private residence in the Varzea neighborhood. The deceased had a police record for robbery and drug trafficking. 1 fatality.

On 18 May 2023, in Paulista (Pernambuco), a man was killed in a drive-by shooting in the Vila Torres Galvao neighborhood by two armed individuals on a motorcycle. Both suspects were arrested by police. Portions of drugs were found with the perpetrators, indicating drug trafficking activities. Attack motivation is unknown. 1 fatality.

assoc_actor_1: Piquetero Unit; Labor Group (Argentina); Polo Obrero; MST: Workers' Socialist Movement; MTL: Territorial Liberation Movement; Barrios de Pie; MLS: Freemen of the South Movement; FOL: Front of Organizations in Action; MTR: Teresa Rodriguez Movement; FAR: Red Burn Front; FOB: Federation of Basis' Organizations; UTEP: Union of Workers of the Popular Economy; CCC: Class Combat Movement; FPDS: Popular Front Dario Santillan; Evita Movement; MTE: Excluded Workers Movement; CTA-A: Argentine Workers' Central Union - Autonomous; ATE: Association of State Workers; PCR: Revolutionary Communist Party
notes: On 17 May 2023, in Buenos Aires - Comuna 1 (Ciudad Autonoma de Buenos Aires), members of the Piquetero Unit, UTEP, MTE, CTA-A, ATE and PCR marched to Mayo Square to demonstrate against adjustments in social and food government programs and against the agreement between the government and the International Monetary Fund (IMF). They also protested against high inflation rates, unemployment and poverty. Piquetero Unit is formed by PO, MST, MTL, Barrios de Pie, MLS, FOL, MTR, FAR and FOB, while UTEP is formed by CCC, Barrios de Pie, FPDS and the Evita Movement. This was part of nation-wide demonstrations.

On 17 May 2023, in Manaus - Central South Zone (Amazonas), state teachers gathered outside the Legislative Assembly to demand salary readjustments.

On 17 May 2023, in Sao Paulo - Central Zone (Sao Paulo), shop owners held a protest in the city center, demanding improvements in public security from the state government, given the ongoing unrest in the area known as 'Cracolandia'. The shop owners lamented frequent robberies and thefts.

The suspect was arrested after the clash. He is accused of homicide and to have injured an app-driver on May 16 in the Bebedouro neighborhood. There were no fatalities.

actor1: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
notes: On 16 May 2023, in Castanhal (Para), a member of a drug trafficking group exchanged fire with military police forces during his arrest operation in the Rouxinol housing complex. The drug trafficker was killed. 1 fatality.

Around 16 May 2023 (as reported), in Santarem (Para), a man was killed by unknown individuals and his body was found in the Eixo Forte region with gunshot wounds to the head. The attack had the characteristics of an execution. The victim was a drug user and had a police record (charges not reported). Circumstances of death are unknown. 1 fatality.

actor1: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
assoc_actor_1: Police Forces of Brazil (2023-) Civil Police
notes: On 16 May 2023, in Agua Azul do Norte (Para), a member of the CV exchanged fire with military and civil police forces during his arrest operation. The CV member was killed. Police seized two firearms, ammunition and two cell phones. The deceased was a fugitive from the penitentiary system. 1 fatality.

On 16 May 2023, in Rio de Janeiro - Central Zone (Rio de Janeiro), residents held a demonstration on Brasil Avenue in the Port Region. Demonstrators constructed a burning barricade of tires and interrupted traffic. The cause of the demonstration is not known.

On 16 May 2023, in Olho d'Agua (Para), a man was shot and killed in front of a bar by two hooded armed individuals. The victim had a police record (charges not reported). There are no reports on the identity of the perpetrators or the attack's motivation. 1 fatality.

source: Folha de S. Paulo; G1; R7
notes: On 16 May 2023, in Santa Barbara d'Oeste (Sao Paulo), several armed suspects attacked an armored car with a safe with valuables on the Luiz de Queiroz Highway. The perpetrators used explosives to break into the safe and opened fire with the security guards of the vehicle to facilitate the robbery. A bus was hit by the bullets and two civilians were injured. There were no fatalities.

On 16 May 2023, in Maceio (Alagoas), a man was shot to death in a drive-by shooting in the Clima Bom neighborhood by armed suspects who opened fire against the victim from a car and left after the attack. The motivation behind the attack and its perpetrators are unknown. 1 fatality.
On 16 May 2023, in Porto Alegre (Rio Grande do Sul), state public attorneys occupied the Legislative Assembly building to demand salary readjustments.

On 16 May 2023, in Ico (Ceara), a gay couple was shot to death while riding on a motorcycle in the Gama apartment complex by unknown armed suspects who fled after the attack. The motivation behind the attack and its perpetrators are unknown. 2 fatalities.

On 16 May 2023, in Rio de Janeiro - North Zone (Rio de Janeiro), Pure Third Command drug traffickers exchanged fire with Red Command in the Morro do Fuba community, Cascadura neighborhood. Unknown casualties.

On 16 May 2023, in Recife (Pernambuco), a non-specified group people gathered in the university campus area to carry out a demonstration by blocking for at least half an hour the BR-101 highway. The demands of the demonstrators were not reported.

On 16 May 2023, in Boa Vista (Roraima), two men were killed and another was injured in a drive-by shooting in the Tancredo Neves neighborhood by two armed individuals on a motorcycle. Before opening fire, the perpetrators asked if the victims had drugs to sell, but it is not known if they were drug traffickers. There are no reports on the identity of the perpetrators. 2 fatalities.

On 16 May 2023, in Campos dos Goytacazes (Rio de Janeiro), drug traffickers opened fire on a group of people in the Tapera 2 locality. Two men were shot and killed, and two civilians were hit and injured. 2 fatalities.

On 16 May 2023, in Boa Vista (Roraima), students and employees at trade schools gathered in the Anaua Park, in Estados neighborhood, to protest against the approval of a bill that would authorize transfers of part of the budget aimed at trade schools to the tourism sector.

actor2: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
notes: On 16 May 2023, in Salvador - Itapua (Bahia), there was a shoot-out between the military police and members of the Red Command in the Itapua neighborhood during a police operation. Three suspects were shot and injured during the clash and were taken to the hospital but did not survive the injuries. With them police seized a firearm, a pistol, a machine gun, chargers, ammunition, and portions of drugs. 3 fatalities.

Around 16 May 2023 (as reported), Sao Paulo - North Zone (Sao Paulo), members of the First Capital Command tied up, tortured, and killed a man and a woman in a drug trafficking crime tribunal. Their bodies were found buried in a clandestine cemetery in the Jaragua neighborhood. Six PCC members were arrested. Police seized a cell phone and a vehicle. 2 fatalities.

On 16 May 2023, in Sao Paulo - Central Zone (Sao Paulo), around 2,000 workers and patrons of the Sesc cultural center held a protest outside the Municipal Theater, resisting resource cuts directed to the institution. The cuts are a result of the approval of a law which reallocates the resources to promoting tourism.

On 16 May 2023, in Sao Paulo - Central Zone (Sao Paulo), workers of a juvenile detention and education center held a protest outside the Art Museum of Sao Paulo in the Bela Vista neighborhood, demanding for better working conditions and management.

actor2: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
notes: On 16 May 2023, in Salvador - Neves (Bahia), there was a shoot-out between the military police and drug traffickers in the Tancredo Neves neighborhood during a police operation. One suspect was shot and injured during the clash and was taken to the hospital where he eventually died. With him police seized a firearm. 1 fatality.
On 16 May 2023, in Rio de Janeiro - Central Zone (Rio de Janeiro), unknown suspects exchanged fire in the Rio Comprido and Catumbi neighborhoods. Unknown casualties.

On 16 May 2023, in Rio de Janeiro - North Zone (Rio de Janeiro), unknown suspects exchanged fire in the Morro do Salgueiro community, Tijuca neighborhood and the Furquim Mendes community, Jardim America neighborhood. Unknown casualties.
On 16 May 2023, in Rio de Janeiro - West Zone (Rio de Janeiro), unknown suspects exchanged fire in the Freguesia neighborhood. Unknown casualties.

On 16 May 2023, in Porto Velho (Rondonia), a female adolescent was tortured and killed by members of a drug trafficking group, who recorded the act. The victim's burnt body was found in the Cristal da Calama housing complex. 1 fatality.

On 16 May 2023, in Palmas (Tocantins), a man was shot and killed in the ARSE 122 sector by three armed individuals. There are no reports on the identity of the perpetrators or the attack's motivation. 1 fatality.

actor1: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
notes: Property destruction: On 16 May 2023, in Claudio (Minas Gerais), military police forces dismantled an illegal cigarettes factory. About 20 people, including 15 Paraguayan nationals, were rescued from slave labor conditions.

On 16 May 2023, in Porto Alegre (Rio Grande do Sul), members of the MNLN gathered in front of a Courthouse to demand the creation of a participatory committee to discuss housing deficit in the state. The creation of committees was suggested by the Supreme Court of Justice (STF) in November 2022.

On 16 May 2023, in Quechereguas (Araucania), unknown individuals in a van intercepted a truck and burned it down. Perpetrators hit the driver with their weapons before he managed to escape half-naked. People from the area helped him and took him to hospital. This attack takes place on the day that marks one year of the State of Exception in four southern provinces. The identity of perpetrators is unknown but Indigenous Militias are often responsible for similar attacks in the Araucania region.

On 16 May 2023, in the rural area of Traiguen town (Araucania), unknown armed individuals shot two farmers who were working in their property. The victim's truck also had bullet marks. Both farmers were transferred to the Victoria Hospital due to the injuries. This attack takes place on the day that marks one year of the State of Exception in four southern provinces. The identity of perpetrators is unknown but Indigenous Militias are often responsible for similar attacks in the Araucania region. There were no fatalities.

Property destruction: On 16 May 2023, between Vilcun and Lautaro communes (Araucania), individuals set a forestry machine on fire in the Miraflores farm. Perpetrators had to escape walking through the forest after the arrival of the police. A pamphlet alluding to the Mapuche cause and demanding freedom for the Mapuche prisoners was found at the scene. This attack takes place on the day that marks one year of the State of Exception in four southern provinces.

Property destruction: On 16 May 2023, in Quidico (Biobio), hooded individuals set an uninhabited house on fire on Costanera Avenue. A pamphlet alluding to the Mapuche cause and demanding freedom for the Mapuche prisoners was found at the scene. Perpetrators also blocked the traffic with felled trees on route P-72-S in the Ponotro sector. This attack takes place on the day that marks one year of the State of Exception in four southern provinces.

assoc_actor_1: UDI: Independent Democratic Union; Government of Chile (2022-); Indigenous Group (Chile); PDC: Christian Democratic Party (Chile)
notes: On 16 May 2023, in Ponpon (Los Rios), nearly 30 residents, including Indigenous people, and politicians affiliated to UDI (Independent Democratic Union) and PDC (Christian Democratic Party) from the Mariquina commune protested blocking the route 5 against the Ministry of Public Works for the future installation of a toll in the area. Protesters stated that this would affect the inhabitants as the toll divides the commune and that it implies an economic cost for the residents. The project aims to move the current toll located in Lanco to the Pon Pon sector. The mayor of Mariquina participated in the protest.
On 16 May 2023, in San Nicolas (Sucre), residents and members of an Indigenous community blocked the road to protest against the poor road infrastructure in the area and demanded its repair.

Around 16 May 2023 (as reported), in the rural area of Ituango municipality (Antioquia), military forces clashed with Gulf Clan militants, resulting in the death of three members of the Gulf Clan. Security forces seized multiple items of equipment from the illegal armed group. 3 fatalities.

Property destruction: Around 16 May 2023 (as reported), in Cimitarra (Santander), unidentified armed individuals threatened a group of workers and set fire to machines that the group was using to repair the local park. The incident led to the cancellation of a government meeting in the locality. The Gulf Clan has operations in this area.

assoc_actor_2: Former AUC: United Self-Defence Forces of Colombia
notes: On 16 May 2023, in Barranquilla (Atlantico), unidentified armed individuals shot and killed a former AUC militant in a drive-by shooting. The victim had served time in a U.S. prison on drug trafficking charges. 1 fatality.

assoc_actor_1: Government of Colombia (2022-); PLC: Colombian Liberal Party
notes: On 16 May 2023, in the rural area of Puerto Colombia municipality (Atlantico), residents protested to demand the dismantling of the Papiros Toll Road. A PLC deputy participated in the protests.

Defusal: Around 16 May 2023 (as reported), in the rural area of Totoro municipality (Cauca), military forces deactivated an explosive device planted by ELN members in the San Pedro sector. Indigenous communities living near the area alerted authorities about the artifact.
Around 16 May 2023 (as reported), in Valledupar (Cesar), rioters beat man after he pulled out a gun and injured a person in a local bar. The man died from the severity of his injuries. 1 fatality.

On 16 May 2023, in Buenaventura (Valle del Cauca), students protested the deficiencies in the school food program, as well as the lack of school transportation service for students and poor infrastructure in local schools.

On 16 May 2023, in the rural area of Puerto Santander municipality (Norte de Santander), bus drivers working on the Puerto Santander - Cucuta road closed the highway that connects these two municipalities to protest the lack of controls on informal transportation.

On 16 May 2023, in the rural area of Ibague municipality (Tolima), residents of the El Chembe vereda protested against the lack of adequate road infrastructure in the area. The group gathered after several trucks that are executing works for another project in the area drove through the area, causing more damage to the road.

assoc_actor_2: Unidentified Communal Group (Colombia); Women (Colombia); PDA: Alternative Democratic Pole
notes: Around 16 May 2023 (as reported), in the rural area of Calamar municipality (Guaviare), an environmental leader was killed and her body was found in the Agua Bonita vereda. The victim was a current candidate for the municipal council for the PDA party. Although the perpetrators of the attack have not been confirmed, the area is known for the presence of armed groups. 1 fatality.
tags: women targeted: activists/human rights defenders/social leaders

notes: On 16 May 2023, in Quito - Eugenio Espejo (Pichincha), hundreds of residents and supporters of CREO political party staged a demonstration at Arbolito park and outside the National Assembly to support President Guillermo Lasso after the assembly was debating an impeachment. They voiced their grievances against the assembly members and to defend democracy. The president is being investigated for an alleged crime of embezzlement.

assoc_actor_1: CN: National Crusade; Indigenous Group (Paraguay); Farmers (Paraguay)
notes: On 16 May 2023, in Asuncion (Asuncion), around 2,500 CN supporters, including members of Indigenous groups and farmers, blocked Eusebio Ayala Avenue in front of the Supreme Electoral Justice Court to protest against the results of the general elections held on 30 April. They claimed that there was fraud and irregularities with voting machines and demanded the annulment of the election result. Police officers were present but did not intervene. This was part of nationwide demonstrations that broke out after the CN presidential candidate Paraguayo Cubas made fraud allegations and called his supporters to demonstrate.

On 16 May 2023, in Ypejhu (Canindeyu), parents at the Corpus Christi School protested against the institution's headmistress. They claim she teaches to the students so-called gender ideology. They also said they were protesting because the principal does not believe in God and they claim she does not respect rules of conduct.

On 16 May 2023, in Concepcion (Concepcion), for the second consecutive day, Coalition for a New Paraguay supporters marched to the Electoral Justice Tribunal of Concepcion to demand the winner of the governor election be defined.

On 16 May 2023, in Huancavelica (Huancavelica), parents of students at Las Azules school marched towards Armas square and outside the Superior Court of Justice as a demonstration to demand a definitive sentence on the judicial process on the school's land that has been pending for 2006.
On 16 May 2023, in Tumbes (Tumbes), residents of Miraflores street captured and beat up a man who was accused of robbery. Police officers later rescued the man and took him to a police station.

On 16 May 2023, in Huamanga province (coded to Ayacucho city, Ayacucho), local residents and members of the Ayacucho Front Committee staged a demonstration to demand the closure of congress, calling for general elections, and for the resignation of President Dina Boluarte.
On 16 May 2023, in Caracas - Libertador (Distrito Capital), a group of delivery drivers of the PedidosYa food delivery company protested to demand better pay and working conditions.

On 16 May 2023, in Barcelona (Anzoategui), a group of demonstrators, including active and retired state workers and pensioners, protested to demand better pay and working conditions, and against the new adjustments to bonuses and benefits for state workers announced by the government. The demonstrators argue that these new measures are insufficient, and call instead for an increase in the minimum wage. The protesters gathered outside the Palace of Justice, where they handed in a letter with their demands.

assoc_actor_1: Teachers (Venezuela); FVM: Venezuelan Federation of Teachers
notes: On 16 May 2023, in Ciudad Guayana (Bolivar), approximately 100 demonstrators, including teachers, and FVM unionists, protested to demand better pay and working conditions, and the renewal of their collective labor agreement. The protesters gathered in the El Gallo sector in San Felix.
On 16 May 2023, in Independencia (Yaracuy), a group of residents staged a pot-banging protest from their balconies against the constant power outages they suffer.

On 16 May 2023, in Caracas - Libertador (Distrito Capital), a group of teachers protested to demand better pay and working conditions. The protest took place outside the Ministry of Education, where the demonstrators also staged a vigil.

Around 16 May 2023 (as reported), in Porlamar (Nueva Esparta), a group of residents of the Los Cocos neighborhood protested against the drinking water outages going on for at least 40 days. The protesters blocked the Juan Bautista Arismendi Avenue, by the Nueva Cadiz petrol station.
On 16 May 2023, in Tovar (Merida), a group of teachers protested to demand better pay and working conditions. The protesters gathered in the Bolivar Square.
On 16 May 2023, in Valera (Trujillo), a group of teachers protested to demand better pay and working conditions, and the renewal of their collective labor agreement.

source: La Prensa de Lara; OVCS: Observatorio Venezolano de Conflictividad Social
notes: On 16 May 2023, in Barquisimeto (Lara), a group of teachers protested to demand better pay and working conditions, and the renewal of their collective labor agreement. The protesters symbolically painted their hands white, and gathered outside the Lara state Education Zone Office.

source: OVCS: Observatorio Venezolano de Conflictividad Social
notes: On 16 May 2023, in Monagas state (coded to Maturin), demonstrators protested with unspecified demands on issues related to labor, healthcare, life, and political participation.

source: OVCS: Observatorio Venezolano de Conflictividad Social
notes: On 16 May 2023, in Tachira state (coded to San Cristobal), demonstrators protested with unspecified demands on issues related to labor, healthcare, life, and political participation.

On 16 May 2023, in Caracas - Libertador (Distrito Capital), approximately 50 demonstrators, including representatives of 250 families from Aragua state affected by floods that take place every year in the neighborhoods surrounding the Valencia Lake, and their lawyers, protested to demand property damage compensations as established in several rulings by the Supreme Court of Justice (TSJ). The protesters gathered outside the Attorney General's Office.

On 16 May 2023, in Merida (Merida), a group of teachers staged a pot-banging protest to demand better pay and working conditions, and against the new adjustments to bonuses and benefits for state workers announced by the government, which they argue to be insufficient. The demonstration was staged outside the Merida state Education Zone Office.

On 16 May 2023, in Maracaibo (Zulia), a group of former workers at companies that rendered services to the PDVSA oil company, protested to demand answers regarding their dismissals in 2018, which they deem as unjustified. The protesters claim that they were promised to be reinstated soon thereafter, and as such, they agreed to receive less compensation. They demand fairer pay-outs or their reinstatement, and payment of owed stipends. The protesters gathered outside the PDVSA office, in La Limpia Avenue. GNB military forces were present, but there was no intervention.

On 16 May 2023, in Valencia (Carabobo), a group of residents of the Santa Rosa parish protested over the constant power outages they suffer. The protesters gathered outside the Corpoelec power company.

On 16 May 2023, in Tocuyito (Carabobo), municipal police forces shot and killed a gang member during an armed confrontation in the Acapulco neighborhood. The suspect resisted authority, was injured in the gunfire, and was pronounced dead in hospital. The deceased had a criminal record for theft. Police collected a gun. 1 fatality.

source: El Pitazo; La Patilla; La Verdad de Vargas
notes: On 16 May 2023, in Los Teques (Miranda), at least two gang members shot and killed a teenage girl, and injured a boy, in an attack in the Palo Alto neighborhood. It is thought that the victims were about to buy something at a local shop when they were intercepted by the suspects who, without further interaction, opened fire on them. The day after, two of the perpetrators were shot and killed in two armed confrontations with the police (coded separately). The motivation for the attack is unknown. 1 fatality.

On 16 May 2023, in Paso Canoas, Puntarenas, parents of schoolchildren staged a protest by preventing access to the local school. Demonstrators demanded the authorities to find a solution for the migrants who camp in the park outside school.

Around 16 May 2023 (as reported), in Antigua Guatemala, Sacatepequez, a woman was killed and her charred body was found on the road to San Pedro Las Huertas. There was a note left next to the corpse, in which the attackers state they will 'terminate with all the frogs,' ('sap' or snitcher) and accusing the victim of being a gang informant. The motivation for the attack is unknown. No more detail is provided by the source. 1 fatality.

On 16 May 2023, outside La Entrada, Copan, unidentified armed men in a vehicle shot a woman while she was driving her car on the CA-11 highway causing her to lose control of her car and crash (drive-by). The woman survived the accident and was taken to a local hospital for treatment. The reason for the shooting is unknown. 1 wounded.
On 16 May 2023, in Tegucigalpa, Francisco Morazan, employees of the National Agrarian Institute (INA) went on strike and marched in protest against the Ministry of Finance demanding wage adjustments.

On 16 May 2023, in Cofradia, Cortes, four unidentified gunmen on motorcycles shot and killed a man outside his residence in the Vida Nueva neighborhood (drive-by). The reason for the killing is unknown. 1 fatality.

On 16 May 2023, in San Pedro Sula, Cortes, representatives of various international textile industry unions convened to discuss and protest against the ongoing labor crisis and recession impacting the sector across Latin America. The representatives emphasized the importance of job stability for workers in San Pedro Sula's factory industry.
On 16 May 2023, outside Nueva Arcadia, Copan, a group of residents blocked a the CA-4 road and burned tiers in demonstration against ongoing issues with the supply of electricity in their households.

On 16 May 2023, in Panama City, Panama, members of the Achieving Goals political party staged a demonstration against the high cost of living, unemployment, insecurity and persecution against former president Ricardo Martinelli. In Panama City, demonstrations were reported in 24 de diciembre, Juan Diaz, Calle 50 and Espana boulevard. Demonstrations were carried out in different municipalities and departments (coded separately).

On 16 May 2023, in Panama City, Panama, a reduced group of students of the National university of Panama staged a protest on the Transismic Road, in front of the university campus. Demonstrators protested against the mining contract signed between the government and a private company, the high costs of living and the basic basket, as well as the lack of budget for education.

On 16 May 2023, in San Miguelito, Panama, members of the Achieving Goals political party staged a demonstration against the high cost of living, unemployment, insecurity and persecution against former president Ricardo Martinelli. Demonstrations were carried out in different municipalities and departments (coded separately).

On 16 May 2023, in Pacora, Panama, members of the Achieving Goals political party staged a demonstration against the high cost of living, unemployment, insecurity and persecution against former president Ricardo Martinelli. Demonstrations were carried out in different municipalities and departments (coded separately).

On 16 May 2023, in Colon, Colon, members of the Achieving Goals political party staged a demonstration against the high cost of living, unemployment, insecurity and persecution against former president Ricardo Martinelli. Demonstrations were carried out in different municipalities and departments (coded separately).

source: Diario Co Latino; El Salvador.com; La Prensa Grafica
notes: On 16 May 2023, in El Zapote, Chalatenango, there was an armed clash between police officer and members of an unidentified gang. The police was patrolling the area when the armed men opened fire on them. As a result, one police officer was killed, and a gang member was arrested. 1 fatality.

On 16 May 2023, in Huasano (Cauca), unidentified armed individuals shot and killed an Indigenous man. The victim was shot more than 15 times. Although the perpetrators of the attack have not been confirmed, the area is known for the presence of armed groups. 1 fatality.

On 16 May 2023, in Rio Preto da Eva (Amazonas), a man was shot more than 20 times and killed by armed individuals who fled on a motorcycle. The victim had a police record for drug trafficking. Police believe that the attack is related to drug trafficking settling of scores. 1 fatality.

source: Fogo Cruzado; Folha de S. Paulo; G1; Globo Extra; Informe Agora; OTT-RJ; R7
notes: On 16 May 2023, in Rio de Janeiro - North Zone (Rio de Janeiro), drug traffickers exchanged fire with military police, civil police, and UPP officers during an operation in the Penha Complex. The operation was targeting suspects who exploded a bank branch in the llha do Governador neighborhood the week prior (coded separately). One male civilian was hit and killed, and another was injured by a stray bullet. At least one drug trafficker was arrested, and police seized marijuana, cocaine, crack, a rifle, a pistol, and a radio communicator. 13 local schools and six family clinics were closed as a result. At least 1 fatality.

actor2: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
assoc_actor_2: Police Forces of Brazil (2023-) Civil Police
notes: On 16 May 2023, in Rio de Janeiro - West Zone (Rio de Janeiro), armed suspects exchanged fire with military police during an operation in the Cidade de Deus neighborhood. Two suspects were arrested and police seized a pistol and drugs. Eight local schools and two family clinics were closed as a result. Unknown casualties.

actor1: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
notes: On 16 May 2023, in Belford Roxo - Parque Sao Jose (Rio de Janeiro), armed individuals exchanged fire with military police during a patrol in the Santa Tereza neighborhood. One suspect was arrested. There were no fatalities.

actor1: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
notes: On 16 May 2023, in Japeri (Rio de Janeiro), an armed individual exchanged fire with military police during a patrol in the Chacrinha region. The suspect was killed. Police seized a firearm and portions of drugs. 1 fatality.

actor1: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
notes: On 16 May 2023, in Rio de Janeiro - West Zone (Rio de Janeiro), armed individuals exchanged fire with military police during a patrol in the Vila Valqueire neighborhood. One suspect was arrested. Police seized firearms and ammunition. There were no fatalities..

On 16 May 2023, in Olinda (Pernambuco), a man was shot and injured in the Jardim Atlantico neighborhood by two armed individuals. The victim was taken to hospital. Authorship and motivation of the attack are unknown.

assoc_actor_1: Piquetero Unit; Labor Group (Argentina); Polo Obrero; MST: Workers' Socialist Movement; MTL: Territorial Liberation Movement; Barrios de Pie; MLS: Freemen of the South Movement; FOL: Front of Organizations in Action; MTR: Teresa Rodriguez Movement; FAR: Red Burn Front; FOB: Federation of Basis' Organizations; UTEP: Union of Workers of the Popular Economy; CCC: Class Combat Movement; FPDS: Popular Front Dario Santillan; Evita Movement; MTE: Excluded Workers Movement; CTA: Argentine Workers' Central Union; ATE: Association of State Workers
notes: On 15 May 2023, around San Miguel de Tucuman municipality (Tucuman), thousands of members of the Piquetero Unit, UTEP, MTE, CTA and ATE marched from La Quiaca municipality (Jujuy) to San Salvador de Jujuy and then to San Miguel to demonstrate against adjustments in social and food government programs and against the agreement between the government and the International Monetary Fund (IMF). They also protested against high inflation rates, unemployment and poverty. Piquetero Unit is formed by PO, MST, MTL, Barrios de Pie, MLS, FOL, MTR, FAR and FOB, while UTEP is formed by CCC, Barrios de Pie, FPDS and the Evita Movement. This was part of nation-wide demonstrations.

On 15 May 2023, in La Plata - Central (Buenos Aires), workers at the Land Registry held a protest outside the premises of the institution to demand better salaries, personnel hierarchization and to grant the retirement and pensions of some workers.

On 15 May 2023, in Buenos Aires - Comuna 8 (Ciudad Autonoma de Buenos Aires), a group of 20 residents blocked Riccheri Highway with General Paz Avenue to demonstrate against a police raid in which they claim that the officers stole some money. Police officers were present but did not intervene.

assoc_actor_1: SOEM: Union of Municipal Workers and Employees; Labor Group (Argentina)
notes: On 15 May 2023, in Comodoro Rivadavia (Chubut), SOEM municipal workers demonstrated in front of the Secretariat of Human Development and Family to repudiate a case in which a worker at that office, who is also a member of the union, was verbally attacked by the secretary, and physically attacked by a co-worker.

On 15 May 2023, in La Paz (La Paz), unionized health workers at El Alto marched through the city as a demonstration to demand La Paz regional authorities payment of their Annual bonus and to respect their union.

On 15 May 2023, in Oruro (Oruro), unionized health workers members of the Oruro Public Health Workers Union staged a demonstration to demand department authorities payment of the risk bonus for the year.

Around 15 May 2023 (as reported), in Coruripe (Alagoas), a man was shot to death front of his wife in the city center by two armed men who broke into their house and opened fire killing him. The motivation behind the attack and its perpetrators are unknown. 1 fatality.

On 15 May 2023, in Macapa (Amapa), a member of a drug trafficking group was shot and killed in the Coco square by two armed individuals. The deceased was on house arrest. There are no reports on the identity of the perpetrators. 1 fatality.

On 15 May 2023, in Rio de Janeiro - Central Zone (Rio de Janeiro), application drivers held a motorcade protest to demand for better compensation. The drivers finished the motorcade outside the offices of a ride application in the city center.
On 15 May 2023, in Sao Paulo (Sao Paulo), application drivers held a protest to demand for better compensation. The protest took place alongside a partial strike.
On 15 May 2023, in Campinas (Sao Paulo), application drivers held a motorcade protest to demand for better compensation in the city center. The protest took place alongside a partial strike.

On 15 May 2023, in Franca (Sao Paulo), application drivers held a motorcade protest to demand for better compensation outside the Fernando Costa Park. The protest took place alongside a partial strike.

On 15 May 2023, in Sorocaba (Sao Paulo), workers of a juvenile detention and education center held a protest, demanding for better working conditions and management. The protesters blocked a lane of the Senador Jose Ermirio de Moraes highway.

On 15 May 2023, in Sorocaba (Sao Paulo), application drivers held a motorcade protest to demand for better compensation in the Alto da Boa Vista neighborhood. The protest took place alongside a partial strike.

On 15 May 2023, in Maceio (Alagoas), transportation app drivers gathered at Fernando Lima Av., near Centenario square, in the Farol neighborhood to carry out a demonstration by blocking the roads in the surroundings demanding better regulations for app-transportation services and repudiating the fees such platforms retain for every ride they make. The demonstration took place on a nationwide day of demonstrations with the same demands.

On 15 May 2023, in Itapetininga (Sao Paulo), application drivers held a motorcade protest to demand for better compensation in the Marginal do Cha locality. The protest took place alongside a partial strike.

Around 15 May 2023 (as reported), in Manaus - East Zone (Amazonas), a man was killed by unknown individuals and his body was found in the Sao Jose neighborhood with signs of torture and tied up. The victim's heart was removed from the body. In another event, in the Distrito Industrial II neighborhood, a man was killed by unknown individuals and his body was found with signs of torture and tied up. Circumstances of death are unknown. 2 fatalities.
