The suspect was accused of being a gang member, having links with drug trafficking activities, and earlier the same year participated in banks robberies attempts. With him police seized a pistol, a pistol charger and ammunition. 1 fatality.

On 15 May 2023, in Rio de Janeiro - North Zone (Rio de Janeiro), around 350 truckers held a protest on Brasil Avenue at the height of Sao Sebastiao market in the Penha neighborhood, resisting the growing number of cargo thefts happening in the city.

On 15 May 2023, in Salvador - Tancredo Neves (Bahia), an unspecified group of app drivers gathered in the surrounding of the Bahia Administration Center to carry out a motorcade along the Tancredo Neves Av., demanding better working conditions as app divers, better payments per ride, and more regulations so they can earn more for their work. The demonstration took place on a nationwide day of protests with the same demands.

The identity of perpetrators is unknown but Indigenous Militias are often responsible for similar attacks in the Araucania region. There were no fatalities.

notes: On 15 May 2023, in Asuncion (Asuncion), between 800 and 1,300 CN supporters, including members of Indigenous groups and farmers, blocked Eusebio Ayala Avenue in front of the Supreme Electoral Justice Court to protest against the results of the general elections held on 30 April. They claimed that there was fraud and irregularities with voting machines and demanded the annulment of the election result. Police officers were present but did not intervene. This was part of nationwide demonstrations that broke out after the CN presidential candidate Paraguayo Cubas made fraud allegations and called his supporters to demonstrate.
On 15 May 2023, in Concepcion (Concepcion), Coalition for a New Paraguay supporters marched to the Electoral Justice Tribunal of Concepcion to demand the winner of the governor election be defined.

On 15 May 2023, in Lima - Lima District (Lima), informal merchants of the Mesa Redonda sector staged a demonstration to demand the mayor to let them work, after they were evicted in an operative carried out by police officers and municipal agents to free the sector's sidewalks from informal merchants.

On 15 May 2023, in Belen (Loreto), unionized civil construction workers blocked the Itaya River with boats, and burned tires on the boats, as a demonstration to demand the national and local government to restart the construction of the Belen Hypermarket works that have been paralyzed for more than two years.

source: El Carabobeno; El Pitazo; La Patilla
notes: On 15 May 2023, in Caracas - Libertador (Distrito Capital), approximately 30 demonstrators, including state workers and defense attorneys, protested to demand the liberation of six unionists, imprisoned in July 2022 on charges of conspiracy and criminal association. The protesters called for the support of the Ombudsman and the opening of a public inquiry, and describe the judicial process against the unionists as a clear violation of their human and labor rights. The demonstration was staged outside the Ombudsman Office.

On 15 May 2023, in Valencia (Carabobo), a group of demonstrators, including retired state workers, pensioners, and human rights activists, protested against the new adjustments to bonuses and benefits for state workers announced by the government, which they argue to be insufficient, and especially unfair on retirees and pensioners. The protesters gathered outside the Carabobeno Health Institute Foundation (INSALUD) premises and marched to the Sucre Square. The original route of the protest had to be amended following indications from the police over security concerns, but there was no intervention.

On 15 May 2023, in Ciudad Guayana (Bolivar), a group of demonstrators, including workers at the state-owned SIDOR steelmaker company, and unionists, protested to demand better pay and working conditions. The protest was staged outside the SIDOR premises. During the demonstration, a group of unionists belonging to a pro-government workers' association were evicted by the workers, who consider them traitors and collaborationists with the regime.

source: El Oriental de Monagas; La Patilla

On 15 May 2023, in Upata (Bolivar), a group of residents, users of the local Las Delicias petrol station, protested against the new fuel distribution plan implemented by the Bolivar state government. On 15 May 2023, in Arjona (Tachira), a group of demonstrators, including students' parents and student representatives, and teachers and other workers at the Escuela Nacional Arjona School, protested to demand the dismissal of the school headmistress for alleged threats and abuses against staff. On 15 May 2023, in Guatemala City, Guatemala, a group of people staged a protest against the closure of El Periodico newspaper which was closed after reporting on government corruption schemes that triggered judicial procedures against its founder. The protest was held in front of the Supreme Court of Justice facilities in zone 1.

The employees demonstrated against statements made by the journalist publicly about DINAF employees.

On 15 May 2023, near Rosita, Costa Caribe, dozens of members of the Musawas community of the Sauni As (Mayangna Indigenous group) staged a protest in the Bosawas Reservation. Protesters demanded the sanitation of their ancestral territories and justice to dozens killed at the hands of settlers. They further accused the government of ethnocide, as they believe that the central government is not looking after the indigenous communities in the country.

On 15 May 2023, in Panama City, Panama, teachers staged a protest in Calidonia neighborhood to demand better work conditions. Several teachers' organizations agreed to meet with members of the Ministry of Education about labor conditions.

The arrests were carried out after the entry into force of the State of Exception approved by the Legislative Assembly at the request of President Bukele.

On 15 May 2023, in the Pomeroon-Supenaam region (coded to Charity), a group of people held a march so-called 'Ray Dagger's Walk' to oppose a contract signed by the Guyana authorities with the ExxonMobil company in 2015. They described the agreement as lopsided and barefaced. His individual march lasted 12 days, while other participants joined the march as the protest passed through some locations (coded separately).

On 14 May 2023, in Manaus - West Zone (Amazonas), a man was shot and killed in the Taruma-Acu neighborhood by an armed individual who then fled with an accomplice on a motorcycle. There are no reports on the identity of the perpetrators or the attack's motivation. 1 fatality.

Around 14 May 2023 (as reported), in Itacoatiara (Amazonas), a man was killed by unknown individuals and his body was found in a wooded area near the AM-010 highway with signs of torture and tied to a tree. Circumstances of death are unknown. 1 fatality.

On 12 May 2023, in Manaus - North Zone (Amazonas), a man was shot and killed in the Cidade de Deus neighborhood by three armed individuals who chased after him. There are no reports on the identity of the perpetrators or the attack's motivation. 1 fatality.

On 12 May 2023, in Manaus - South Zone (Amazonas), a man was shot and killed in the Petropolis neighborhood by two unknown armed individuals. The victim had been receiving death threats from drug traffickers. 1 fatality.

actor1: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
notes: On 12 May 2023, in Aripuana (Mato Grosso), an armed individual exchanged fire with military police forces following a chase on the MT-208 highway. The suspect had refused to obey a stop order. The suspect was killed. 1 fatality.

actor1: Police Forces of Brazil (2023-) Civil Police
notes: On 12 May 2023, in Campo Grande (Mato Grosso do Sul), a drug trafficker exchanged fire with civil police forces during his arrest operation in the Tarsila do Amaral neighborhood. The armed suspect was killed. 1 fatality.

On 12 May 2023, in Uba (Minas Gerais), a man was shot and killed near a bar on the Jose Augusto Marcos street by two armed individuals. The victim had a police record (charges not reported) and had recently left prison. There are no reports on the identity of the perpetrators or the attack's motivation. 1 fatality.

On 12 May 2023, in Governador Valadares (Minas Gerais), a man was killed in a drive-by shooting in the Altinopolis neighborhood by armed individuals in a car. There are no reports on the identity of the perpetrators or the attack's motivation. 1 fatality.

On 12 May 2023, in Belem (Para), a man was killed in a drive-by shooting in the Canudos neighborhood by an armed individual on a motorcycle. There are no reports on the identity of the perpetrator or the attack's motivation. 1 fatality.

On 12 May 2023, in Rio de Janeiro - West Zone (Rio de Janeiro), unknown suspects exchanged fire in the Santa Maria locality, Taquara neighborhood and the Cidade de Deus, Bangu, and Freguesia neighborhoods. Unknown casualties.

On 12 May 2023, in Rio de Janeiro - North Zone (Rio de Janeiro), unknown suspects exchanged fire in the Manoel Reis II, Manguinhos, and Tomas Coelho neighborhoods and the Morro dos Macacos community, Vila Isabel neighborhood. Unknown casualties.
On 12 May 2023, in Sao Jeronimo da Serra (Parana), unknown individuals blew up two banks. No values were taken. There were no casualties.

On 12 May 2023, in Santiago (Metropolitana), a group of people of foreign nationalities attacked police officers with punches and kicks during a procedure in the city center. The incident occurred after police followed a suspected thief, who entered a house on Concha y Toro street. The inhabitants of the area intervened and attacked police officers trying to defend the suspected thief and hindering the procedure. More police arrived at the scene resulting in four arrests. Two police officers were injured.

On 12 May 2023, in the rural area of Puerto Amor corregimiento (Caqueta), unidentified armed individuals killed a local farmer. The incident was reported on the same day that clashes were reported between two dissident FARC factions in the area (coded separately). The perpetrators of the attack have not been confirmed. 1 fatality.

Property destruction: On 12 May 2023, in San Jose del Guaviare (Guaviare), two armed individuals set fire to three vehicles, including a vehicle used by health workers in the municipality. Police found and detained the men. Although the perpetrators of the attack have not been confirmed, the area is known for the presence of armed groups.

Around 12 May 2023 (as reported), in Sincelejo (Sucre), unidentified armed individuals shot and killed a social leader in a drive-by shooting. The victim had repeatedly denounced a land invasion in the area. Although the perpetrators of the attack have not been confirmed, the area is known for the presence of armed groups. 1 fatality.

On 12 May 2023, in Puerto Valdivia (Antioquia), citizens protested against the non-compliance of recovery projects in the municipality, following damage caused by the malfunctioning of a local hydroelectric plant.

actor2: Police Forces of Colombia (2022-) Prison Guards
notes: On 12 May 2023, in Cartagena (Bolivar), prisoners and prison guards clashed after inmates rioted in response to poor conditions inside the prison.

Around 12 May 2023 (as reported), in Soledad (Atlantico), a person was beaten up and injured by residents before being arrested by police. The man was involved in robbery minutes previous to the attack.

Around 12 May 2023 (as reported), in the rural area of Magui Payan municipality (Narino), two unidentified armed groups clashed in Rio Patia vereda. Two farmers were killed in the incident after being caught in the crossfire. The area is known for the presence of the dissident faction of the FARC. 2 fatalities.

On 12 May 2023, in Ayolas (Misiones), workers at the Ana Cua consortium demonstrated on the road that leads to the Yacyreta Hydroelectric Plan to demand the signing of a collective work contract to improve their labor conditions. Demonstrators clashed with police officers, who use tear gas and rubber bullets. 10 police officers and 10 demonstrators were injured. There were no fatalities.

On 12 May 2023, in Asuncion (Asuncion), for the fifth consecutive day, around 1,000 CN supported blocked Eusebio Ayala Avenue in front of the Supreme Court of Electoral Justice to demonstrate against the results of the general elections held on 30 April. They claimed that there was fraud and irregularities with voting machines and demanded the annulment of the election result and the disclosure of voting records. This was part of nationwide demonstrations that broke out after the CN presidential candidate Paraguayo Cubas made fraud allegations and called his supporters to demonstrate.

On 12 May 2023, in Sullana (Piura), residents of the Santa Teresita sector staged a demonstration outside the local government offices to voice their grievances about the destruction of the sewage system because of the lack of maintenance and to the rainy season.

On 12 May 2023, in Chiclayo (Lambayeque), region journalists staged a demonstration outside the cathedral against the approval of a law that they say would allow the political persecution of journalists.
On 12 May 2023, in Tumbes (Tumbes), more than 250 workers of the provincial government staged a demonstration outside the civic center to demand payment of their social benefits.

On 12 May 2023, in Iquitos (Loreto), unionized journalists members of the Peru's National Journalists Association (ANP) staged a demonstration in Armas square against the approval of a law that they say would allow the political persecution of journalists.

On 12 May 2023, in Punchana (Loreto), parents of students of Alexander Von Humboldt school staged a demonstration to demand the replacement of the social sciences teacher, whose health issues cause constant interruptions to classes according the demonstrators.

On 12 May 2023, in Iquitos (Loreto), more than 200 residents marched through the city as a demonstration to demand local authorities more security amid increasing criminal activity in the country. The demonstration was called after an infant was killed during a robbery.
On 12 May 2023, in Huancavelica (Huancavelica), close to 100 Quechua mothers staged a demonstration outside the Regional Government offices to demand their mother's day food baskets.

On 12 May 2023, in Montevideo (Montevideo), around 30 students at the IAVA high school marched on 18 de Julio Avenue to demand the reintegration of the former principal of the school. They also demanded that student organizations are respected, a multidisciplinary team at the institution, and the hiring of teachers who know sign language. They also repudiated cases of violence recently reported at schools in the city.

On 12 May 2023, in Ciudad Guayana (Bolivar), a group of residents, users of the local Centurion petrol station, protested against the difficulties they find in refuelling, and against the new fuel distribution plan implemented by the Bolivar state government.

On 12 May 2023, in Chivacoa (Yaracuy), a group of demonstrators, including teachers, and other active and retired state workers, and pensioners, protested against the new adjustments to bonuses and benefits for state workers announced by the government, which they argue to be insufficient, and especially unfair on retirees and pensioners.

source: Correo del Caroni; OVCS: Observatorio Venezolano de Conflictividad Social

source: La Verdad de Vargas; OVCS: Observatorio Venezolano de Conflictividad Social

The woman was released two days later. The five PNB police officers were arrested. 1 fatality.

On 12 May 2023, in Belize City, Belize, three men shot and injured a man. The victim was walking alongside another man, when the three men opened fire on them for no apparent reason. The motivation for the attack is unknown. No more detail is provided by the source. 1 injured.
On 12 May 2023, in Guatemala City, Guatemala, more than 1,000 merchants of the Market in zone 4 staged a demonstration in support of the local mayor (Unionist Party). Demonstrators marched to zone 1.

On 12 May 2023, in Tegucigalpa, Francisco Morazan, unidentified armed men shot and killed a man whose body was later found with a plastic bag wrapped around his head in the San Miguel neighborhood. The motive for the killing and the identity of the perpetrators are unknown. 1 fatality.
On 12 May 2023, in Puerto Pilon, Colon, parents of school children staged a protest to demand that authorities from the Ministry of Education appoint janitors and maintenance staff.
On 12 May 2023, in Panama City, Panama, parents of school children staged a protest to demand the dismissal of the geography teacher for mistreatment against the seventh-grade students.

On 12 May 2023, near Windsor Forrest, Essequibo Islands-West Demerara, a group of people joined the so-called 'Ray Dagger's Walk' to oppose a contract signed by the Guyana authorities with the ExxonMobil company in 2015. They described the agreement as lopsided and barefaced. Other citizens joined the march as protest passed through the streets. His individual march lasted 12 days, while other participants joined the march as the protest passed through some locations (coded separately).

Some reports indicate that community members handed the youths over to the armed group after accusing them of stealing cattle in the area. The victims were handed over by the armed group on May 13 to a humanitarian commission.

Around 11 May 2023 (as reported), in Avellaneda (Buenos Aires), a group of demonstrators blocked a road, however, the motives of the protest are unknown.

On 11 May 2023, in Sucre (Chuquisaca), residents and merchants of Jose Prudencio Bustillos street captured, tied to a post, beat up and cut the hair of a woman accused of robbing a purse. Police officers later rescued the woman and took her to a police station.

Property destruction: On 11 May 2023, in Collipulli commune (Araucania), between seven and eight hooded individuals intercepted a truck on Route 5 South near the Malleco Bridge. Perpetrators threatened the driver with firearms and forced him out of the truck before setting it on fire. Several witnesses stated they heard shots and one truck that was passing by at the time had bullet marks. A pamphlet was found at the scene in which perpetrators threatened police. This attack takes place in the context of the transfer of six Mapuche prisoners to Rancagua, Concepcion and Puerto Montt prisons after the riots in the Angol prison (coded separately).

On 11 May 2023, in Puerto Montt (Los Lagos), a group of people protested outside of the Puerto Montt prison against the transfer to the commune of two of the Mapuche prisoners involved in the incidents in the Angol prison (coded separately). According to social networks, protesters stated that they will return to protest in the coming days. Protesters left banners in front of the prison and argued that the transfer is illegal and arbitrary, and that it takes the prisoners away from their families and communities.

notes: On 11 May 2023, in Caracas - Libertador (Distrito Capital), PNB police forces shot and killed a taxi driver, while he was working, during an attack in the Las Flores sector. The victim was transporting two clients in his vehicle when he was intercepted by three PNB police officers that had stepped out of another car; they ordered him to halt, and immediately after shot him in the head. According to witnesses, the three officers were wearing bulletproof vests, but no police identification; after shooting the victim, they fled the area. Two of the shooters turned themselves in to the police, and were immediately arrested, while the third one remains at large. There is no information on the motivations for the attack. 1 fatality.

The leader of the protest argued that as the road is unfinished, school vans or ambulances cannot go through, affecting more than 20 families. Shortly after, the group shot at the Centenario farm, owned by a farmer who had received several arson attacks in the past. Perpetrators set a vehicle on fire. Police were complying with the protection measure on the property and repelled the shots with their service weapons. A pamphlet was found at the scene in which the armed group opposed the transfer of six Mapuche prisoners to Rancagua, Concepcion and Puerto Montt prisons after the incidents in the Angol prison (coded separately). On 10 May 2023, in Panama City, Panama, five unemployed teachers staged a protest at the Ministry of Education to demand that authorities appoint them given the lack of teachers in several schools around the country.

On 10 May 2023, in Arraijan, Arraijan, school parents and teachers staged a protest against a mother of school children who harassed a teacher and demanded justice. Protesters also demanded more security for pupils and teachers, as well as drinking water.

His individual march lasted 12 days, while other participants joined the march as the protest passed through some locations (coded separately).

assoc_actor_2: Prisoners (Venezuela); Police Forces of Venezuela (1999-) Prison Guards; Military Forces of Venezuela (1999-) GNB: Venezuelan National Guard
source: Diario Primicia; El Pitazo; La Patilla; Una Ventana a la Libertad
notes: On 9 May 2023, in Barinas (Barinas), a brawl broke out between prisoners of the Internado Judicial de Barinas prison. In a letter that the prisoners later released, they mentioned that the fight was initiated by a group of prisoners from Carabobo state, who wanted to draw attention from the authorities on themselves, to demand their transfer to an unspecified Carabobo state prison. To that effect, they picked up a fight with Barinas state prisoners. Five inmates were injured and taken to hospital for treatment. GNB military officers and prison guards intervened and de-escalated the situation shortly after. There were no fatalities.

On 9 May 2023, in Tucupita (Delta Amacuro), unidentified armed suspects exchanged gunfire, during an armed confrontation in the Santa Cruz neighborhood. There is no further information at this point in time. There were no casualties.

On 9 May 2023, in San Jose, San Jose, teachers, students and school parents staged a protest in a school in Pavas to demand that authorities dismiss the Board of Education for the mismanagement of resources. They argue that the restrooms have no doors, that there is no toilet paper, and that the school has a large taxes debt.

On 9 May 2023, in Guatemala City, Guatemala, two armed men on a motorcycle shot and killed a man and injured another in zone 2 (drive-by). The motivation for the attack is unknown. No more detail is provided by the source. 1 fatality, 1 injured.

On 9 May 2023, in Villa Nueva, Guatemala, an armed woman on a motorcycle shot and injured a man in another car in motion at the height of KM 16 of the road to Pacific (drive-by). The motivation for the attack is unknown. No more detail is provided by the source. 1 fatality, 1 injured.

On 9 May 2023, in Piraera, Lempira, unidentified armed men shot and killed a young man in the El Centro neighborhood. Police forces arrested two former mayors of the municipality for being the alleged orchestrators of the killing. The exact reason for the killing remains however still unknown. 1 fatality.

On 9 May 2023, in La Ceiba, Atlantida, two unidentified armed men on a motorcycle shot and wounded an unidentified woman who was traveling alone in a pick-up truck along the CA-13 highway (drive-by). The reason for the shooting is unknown. 1 wounded.
On 9 May 2023, outside La Ceiba, Atlantida, a group of residents of the Peru community protested against alleged plans to privatize beaches in their community.
On 9 May 2023, in La Ceiba, Atlantida, hundreds of students from the official La Ceiba Institute occupied the educational center in protest due to a shortage of teachers.

assoc_actor_1: Government of Honduras (2022-); Farmers (Honduras); Labor Group (Honduras); PLH: Liberal Party of Honduras
notes: On 9 May 2023, in Choluteca, Choluteca, more than 15,000 resident farmers and workers of different sectors, led by their mayor (from the PLH), marched in protest against recent proposals for a federal Tax Justice Law. They denounced the law would threaten jobs, particularly in the shrimp, melon, watermelon, and energy sectors. These sectors generate many jobs and export to the U.S., Europe, Asia, and China-Taiwan markets, which are already affected by diplomatic tensions. Protesters demanded lawmakers not to support these reforms.

On 9 May 2023, in Villanueva, Cortes, residents of the Dos Caminos sector blocked the CA-5 highway in protest demanding justice for the murder of the president of the Jesus de Nazareth neighborhood council. The protest was also joined by representatives of the Confederation of Neighborhood Councils of Honduras (CONAFETH) who denounced the insecurity faced by neighborhood council representatives and called for investigations into this and other murders of council leaders.

On 9 May 2023, outside Jutiapa, El Paraiso, several unidentified armed men shot and killed a woman and wounded another two individuals in the woman's home in the San Diego village in the Jamastran Valley. The reason for the killing is unknown. 1 fatality. 2 wounded.

On 9 May 2023, in Tegucigalpa, Francisco Morazan, a group of teachers from the departments of Islas de la Bahia and Gracias a Dios protested outside the Presidential House of the Republic demanding the payment of the zoning salary adjustment to compensate them for teaching in remote areas.

On 9 May 2023, in Catacamas, Olancho, several unidentified armed men shot and killed two underage half-siblings in the Valle de Agalta neighborhood. The reason for the killing is unknown. 2 fatalities.
On 9 May 2023, in Patuca, Olancho, unidentified armed men shot and killed a moto-taxi driver in the Las Americas neighborhood. The reason for the killing is unknown. 1 fatality.
On 9 May 2023, in Villa Grecia, Panama, residents of Praderas del Norte staged a protest to demand running and drinking water.

On 9 May 2023, in San Miguelito, Panama, bus drivers staged a protest at the facilities of the Central Land Transport and Transit Authority against the recent change of nomenclature in transport code, according to a report issued by the Supreme Court of Justice.

On 9 May 2023, near Mahaicony, Mahaica-Berbice, seven people joined the so-called 'Ray Dagger's Walk' to oppose a contract signed by the Guyana authorities with the ExxonMobil company in 2015. They described the agreement as lopsided and barefaced. Other citizens joined the march as protest passed through the streets. His individual march lasted 12 days, while other participants joined the march as the protest passed through some locations (coded separately).

On 9 May 2023, in Palmas (Tocantins), a man was shot and injured in the Arse 131 neighborhood by unknown armed individuals. The victim had a police record for drug trafficking. There were no fatalities.

On 9 May 2023, in Comunidad Marileo (Araucania), individuals attacked municipal workers and stole the van they were driving in the Marileo sector. The van was later found burned in the Quechereguas junction. One of the workers was injured. The identity of perpetrators is unknown but Indigenous Militias are often responsible for similar attacks in the Araucania region.

On 9 May 2023, in Sao Lourenco da Mata (Pernambuco), a former military police officer was shot to death at a local restaurant by unknown shooters. The motivation behind the attack and its perpetrators are unknown. 1 fatality.

On 9 May 2023, in Rio de Janeiro - North Zone (Rio de Janeiro), unknown suspects exchanged fire in the Morro dos Macacos community, Vila Isabel neighborhood and the Morro da Fe community, Penha neighborhood. Shooting was also heard in the Israel Complex, Bras de Pina neighborhood. Unknown casualties.

actor1: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
notes: On 9 May 2023, in Niteroi - North (Rio de Janeiro), armed individuals exchanged fire with military police during an operation in the Caramujo neighborhood. Three suspects were arrested, two of them injured. Police seized a firearm, ammunition, two radio communicators, and portions of drugs. There were no fatalities.

actor1: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
notes: On 9 May 2023, in Japeri (Rio de Janeiro), an armed individual exchanged fire with military police during an operation in the Lagoa do Sapo neighborhood. The suspect was killed. Police seized a firearm, ammunition, a radio communicator, and portions of drugs. 1 fatality.

assoc_actor_2: Former Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
notes: On 9 May 2023, in Olinda (Pernambuco), a man was shot more than 10 times and killed in the Peixinhos neighborhood by two armed individuals. The victim was the president of a local home owners association and a former military officer. There are no reports on the identity of the perpetrators or the attack's motivation. 1 fatality.

Around 9 May 2023 (as reported), in Rio de Janeiro - West Zone (Rio de Janeiro), a man was killed and decapitated by unknown individuals and his body was found in the Curicica neighborhood with gunshot wounds. Circumstances of death are unknown. 1 fatality.
On 9 May 2023, in Palmas (Tocantins), a man was shot and killed by drug traffickers. Three suspects were arrested. Attack motivation is unknown. 1 fatality.

On 9 May 2023, in Santa Ana de Coro (Falcon), a suspected unidentified crime group member opened fire on a woman, injuring her, during an attack in the La Canada sector. The victim was shot in the Genaro Chirinos street, and taken to hospital for treatment. A man claimed to be the shooter was immediately chased by a vigilante group of residents, beaten up, and handed over to the police (coded separately). The attack could be a contract killing, possibly involving criminal group activity. There were no fatalities.

On 9 May 2023, in Santa Ana de Coro (Falcon), a vigilante group of residents attempted to lynch a man who they accused of shooting a woman in the street, moments earlier, in the La Canada sector (coded separately). During the beating, the man confessed that the attack had been a contract killing attempt. Police arrived on scene, arrested the suspect, and took him to hospital. There were no fatalities.

assoc_actor_1: ATE: Association of State Workers; Labor Group (Argentina)
notes: On 8 May 2023, in La Plata - Central (Buenos Aires), a group of public workers associated with ATE blocked 13th with 37th Streets to protest against the layoff of two workers at the Superintendent of Labor Risks.

On 8 May 2023, in Rosario (Santa Fe), residents demonstrated in several parts of the city against high violence and crime levels. Friends and family of a man killed at a gas station also participated in the demonstrations to demand justice for the victim and other victims of violence in the city.

On 8 May 2023, around Las Lomitas (Formosa), members of an Indigenous community blocked Provincial Route 28, impeding access to the Banado La Estrella Natural Reserve. There is no further information about their demands.

On 8 May 2023, in Santa Rosa (La Pampa), students and parents at the Fernando Araoz and Julio Colombato Schools protested outside the premises of the institutions on Congreso and Schimitd Streets against cases of violence reported inside the facilities.

assoc_actor_1: Labor Group (Argentina); Women (Argentina); ATE: Association of State Workers
notes: On 8 May 2023, in Santa Rosa (La Pampa), a group of women workers at the Municipal Directorate of Gender and Diversity Policies associated with ATE protested at city hall to demand the relocation of the team to the Integral Territorial Center and a negotiation to agree on better salaries.
On 8 May 2023, in Villa La Angostura (Neuquen), parents and teachers marched to demand improvements in the infrastructure of several schools.

On 8 May 2023, between San Martin and Casa de Piedra municipalities (coded to San Martin, Catamarca), residents of Telaritos and Balde de la Punta blocked Route 60 to demand the normalization of drinking water services.

assoc_actor_1: Teachers (Argentina); UTE: Union for Education Workers; ADEMYS: Teacher's Association
notes: On 8 May 2023, in Buenos Aires - Comuna 14 (Ciudad Autonoma de Buenos Aires), UTE, ADEMYS and CAMYP teachers held a protest in Armenia Square, Palermo neighborhood, to demand better salaries and working conditions, improvements in school infrastructure and protest against violence against teachers.

On 8 May 2023, in Oruro (Oruro), workers of the local government construction progress entity blocked streets and marched through the city as a demonstration to reject the modification of payment slips claiming that this affects their labor rights.

source: Folha de S. Paulo; G1; R7
notes: On 8 May 2023, in Guarulhos (Sao Paulo), residents held a demonstration in the Favela da Treze community, Bom Clima region. The demonstrators denounced the death of a man by the hands of military police officers (coded separately). Demonstrators burned a bus on the road.

actor1: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
notes: On 8 May 2023, in Guarulhos (Sao Paulo), military police officers shot and killed a man in the Favela da Treze community, Bom Clima region. According to police, the victim was a drug trafficker and there was an exchange of fire. Witnesses, however, refute the police's version and claim they arrived in the area opening fire indiscriminately. A demonstration followed (coded separately). 1 fatality.

On 8 May 2023, in Pilar (Alagoas), an adolescent was shot and killed in the Cha do Pilar neighborhood by two armed individuals. The victim was a drug user. There are no reports on the identity of the perpetrators. 1 fatality.
On 8 May 2023, in Maceio (Alagoas), a man suspected of stabbing and injuring a woman was beaten up and injured by residents in the Prado neighborhood before being arrested by police.
On 8 May 2023, in Manaus (Amazonas), two suspected thieves were beaten up and injured by bus passengers before being arrested by police.

On 8 May 2023, in Nova Iguacu (Rio de Janeiro), the Zinho police militia exchanged fire with the Tubarao police militia in the Prados Verdes neighborhood, and the Km 32 and Km 34 neighborhoods. Several schools were closed as a result. A confrontation with military police followed (coded separately). Unknown casualties.

On 8 May 2023, in Manaus - North Zone (Amazonas), a man was shot and killed by unknown armed individuals in the Mutirao neighborhood. A note was left with the body stating the deceased was killed because he was a CV member. 1 fatality.

actor2: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
notes: On 8 May 2023, in Nova Iguacu (Rio de Janeiro), drug traffickers exchanged fire with military police in the Prados Verdes neighborhood. One suspect was killed. Police seized a gun, ammunition, camouflage clothing, and two cars. 1 fatality.

notes: On 8 May 2023, in Joao Pessoa (Paraiba), about 400 Potiguaras Indigenous teachers and administrative staff gathered in front of the administrative center in the Jaguaribe neighborhood to demand salary readjustment.

On 8 May 2023, in the rural area of Petrolina municipality (Pernambuco), about 100 farmers blocked the BR-428 highway with tractors and trucks to demand better access roads to farming lands.
On 8 May 2023, in Recife (Pernambuco), teachers gathered in front of the administrative center in the Pina neighborhood to demand salary readjustment.

On 8 May 2023, in Salvador - Itapua (Bahia), two men were shot and killed in the Itapua neighborhood by unknown armed individuals. At least one deceased was involved in drug trafficking activities. A couple were injured by stray bullets. There are no reports on the identity of the perpetrators. 2 fatalities.
On 8 May 2023, in Bulhoes (Resende, Rio de Janeiro), armed suspects passing by in a vehicle shot and killed a man in the Porto Real neighborhood (drive-by). 1 fatality.

notes: On 8 May 2023, in Rio de Janeiro - North Zone (Rio de Janeiro), a military police officer sexually abused a female civilian after a police operation took place in the Lins Complex. The victim was bruised and threatened with death. The perpetrator also took nude photos of her. There were no fatalities.

Around 8 May 2023 (as reported), in Nova Iguacu (Rio de Janeiro), three men were killed and their bodies were found in the Fazenda Caxias community, Seropedica neighborhood. The deaths are linked to a dispute between the Tubarao and Zinho police militia. 3 fatalities.

actor1: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
notes: On 8 May 2023, in the rural area of Pium municipality (Tocantins), an armed individual exchanged fire with military police forces during his arrest operation. The armed suspect was killed. The deceased had taken part in a novo cangaco robbery in Confresa municipality on 9 April 2023 (coded separately). Police seized a machine gun. 1 fatality.

actor1: Police Forces of Brazil (2023-) Civil Police
notes: On 8 May 2023, in Campo Grande (Mato Grosso do Sul), a member of the PCC exchanged fire with civil police forces during his arrest operation in the Jardim Inapolis neighborhood. The PCC member was killed. 1 fatality.

On 8 May 2023, in Costa Rica (Mato Grosso do Sul), a woman was abducted, tortured, and injured by three drug traffickers due to a drug debt. The suspects also shaved her head. The victim was abandoned in a wooded area, but she was able to call for help. Two suspects were arrested. There were no fatalities.

On 8 May 2023, in Betim (Minas Gerais), an adolescent was shot and killed and two others were injured in the Parque Jardim Teresopolis neighborhood by five armed individuals, in the context of territorial disputes between drug trafficking groups. Two suspects were detained. 1 fatality.

On 8 May 2023, in Rio de Janeiro - West Zone (Rio de Janeiro), two armed suspects abducted two men from the Vargem Pequena neighborhood. One victim was found dead in the Dois Irmaos locality, Curicica neighborhood, the next morning. 1 fatality.

On 8 May 2023, in Belo Horizonte (Minas Gerais), residents of the Morro do Papagaio community blocked the Nossa Senhora do Carmo avenue to protest against the enforcement of an eviction order from an energy company.

On 8 May 2023, in Rio Branco (Acre), residents of the Sobral neighborhood blocked streets to protest against flooding of their residences after a storm. The protesters demanded repairs in the water drainage system.

On 8 May 2023, in Rio de Janeiro - North Zone (Rio de Janeiro), unknown suspects exchanged fire in the Guapore locality, Bras de Pina neighborhood and the Guadalupe neighborhood. Shootings were also heard in the Alemao Complex and the Morro da Fe community, Penha neighborhood. Unknown casualties.
On 8 May 2023, in Duque de Caxias (Rio de Janeiro), unknown suspects exchanged fire in the Sapo community and the Mangueirinha neighborhood. Unknown casualties.
On 8 May 2023, in Rio de Janeiro - West Zone (Rio de Janeiro), unknown suspects exchanged fire in the Praca Seca, Senador Camara, and Tanque neighborhoods. Unknown casualties.
On 8 May 2023, in Sao Joao de Meriti (Rio de Janeiro), unknown suspects exchanged fire in the Vila Sao Joao and Vila Ruth neighborhoods. Unknown casualties.
On 8 May 2023, in Cachoeiras de Macacu (Rio de Janeiro), unknown suspects exchanged fire in the Boqueirao locality. Unknown casualties.
On 8 May 2023, in Rio de Janeiro - Central Zone (Rio de Janeiro), unknown suspects exchanged fire in the Benfica and Santa Teresa neighborhoods. Unknown casualties.
On 8 May 2023, in Niteroi - North (Rio de Janeiro), unknown suspects exchanged fire in the Cubango neighborhood. Unknown casualties.

Property destruction: On 8 May 2023, near Villa Elicura (Biobio), individuals set a house on fire in the El Voldo sector on route P-60-R. A pamphlet was found at the scene in which the Mapuche Lavkenche Resistance (RML) took responsibility for the attack and demanded respect for the Mapuche prisoners.

On 8 May 2023, in Santiago (Metropolitana), hooded students demonstrated blocking the traffic outside of the Liceo 1. Students erected barricades with chairs and tables on Compania street at San Martin street, and some others threw rocks and blunt objects from the school campus. Police tried to disperse the crowd with water cannons which made demonstrators re-enter the school.

On 8 May 2023, in Quellon (Los Lagos), representatives of students protested blocking the traffic on Route 5 demanding a solution to the teachers strike. Students have been without classes for over a month and protesters demanded the teachers to return to school, since the municipality has already reached an agreement for the payment of their pending salaries. During three days of the previous week, representatives of students partially blocked the traffic on Route 5. The protest stopped during the weekend because of election day.

On 8 May 2023, in Iquique (Tarapaca), unionized food handlers gathered at Prat square against poor working conditions. Protesters stated that there have been accidents due to lack of infrastructure and that they suffered mistreatment.

Around 8 May 2023 (as reported), in the department of Santander (coded to Puerto Wilches, Santander), members of the Gulf Clan beat rural school teachers to discourage workers from taking up their duties. Information from the governor's office assures that the armed men seek to intimidate rural school teachers in order to facilitate the recruitment of students. There were no fatalities.

Recruitment: Around 8 May 2023 (as reported), in the rural area of Cimitarra municipality (Santander), Gulf Clan have broken into local schools in order to intimidate teachers and recruit students. Similar incidents have occurred in Carmen de Chucuri, San Vicente de Chucuri, and Puerto Olaya.

On 8 May 2023, in Bello (Antioquia), rioters attacked and killed a man who killed a woman during an attempted robbery. The group beat the victim who died after one of the rioters pulled a firearm. 1 fatality.

Around 8 May 2023 (as reported), in Cartagena (Bolivar), nearly 20 mothers who are heads of households protested to demand school transportation for their hearing impaired children. The protesters claim that they have not been provided with the service, which is why a high percentage of the children have not attended classes.

Around 8 May 2023 (as reported), in the rural area of La Gabarra municipality (Norte de Santander), a man was killed and his body found. The victim had a sign announcing that he had been killed for being a drug user and rapist. Although the perpetrators of the attack have not been confirmed, the area is known for the presence of armed groups. 1 fatality.

On 8 May 2023, in Pamplona (Norte de Santander), students at Uni Pamplona blocked the traffic and the entrance to the building to protest against the lack of adequate infrastructure in the school's laboratories and classrooms.

On 8 May 2023, in Santa Marta (Magdalena), about 20 people clashed with police forces while they were carrying out an operation to close illegal bars. One person was killed and another injured when an agent opened fire on the group. 1 fatality.

On 8 May 2023, in Alto Pino (La Guajira), nearly 30 Indigenous Wayuu protested against the development of projects in their territories without prior consultation. The group demanded autonomy over indigenous reserve zones.

On 8 May 2023, in Betoyes, (Arauca), parents at a local school blocked a road to protest against alleged mistreatment of their children by one of the school's teachers. The group demanded the woman's resignation.

On 8 May 2023, in the rural area of El Palmar corregimiento (Huila), for the sixth consecutive day, farmers and raw sugarcane producers blocked a road to protest against the industry's crisis and the lack of government support. The group alleged that low taxes on raw sugar imported from other countries have affected domestic producers.

On 8 May 2023, in Huancayo (Junin), parents of students of Jose Carlos Mariategui school staged a demonstration outside the school to demand the dean provide an explanation after a woman dressed with the institution's uniform and with a criminal record was found inside the campus without no one noticing for more than four hours.

On 8 May 2023, in Huancayo (Junin), around 100 civil construction workers blocked the entrance of the Junin Regional Government as a demonstration to demand working positions and claiming that there is a biased by the regional governor on hiring only workers from the union he belongs to.

source: Diario 2001; El Carabobeno; El Diario (Venezuela); El Pitazo
notes: On 8 May 2023, in Caracas - Sucre (Miranda), a group of demonstrators, including residents, transport workers, and merchants of the Jose Felix Ribas neighborhood, in the Petare parish, protested against the increasing violence in the area, and the police abuses that have taken place during the recent security operations against gang activity. The protesters argue that they don't oppose the heavy police presence, but rather the excessive violence and repression against them exerted mainly by PNB police forces during their raids. Additionally, some demonstrators protested against a journalist that covers crime news in the area, for reporting what they deem as false information. The journalist had reported that members of the Wilexis Gang had summoned the residents to protest. The demonstrators blocked the access roads to the Palo Verde sector, and the Jose Felix Ribas neighborhood.

source: Caraota Digital; El Pitazo; La Patilla
notes: On 8 May 2023, in Caracas - Libertador (Distrito Capital), a group of demonstrators, including teachers and health workers, and other active and retired state workers, pensioners, and unionists, staged a pot-banging protest to demand better pay and working conditions, and against corruption, and the lack of action against it from the Comptroller General of the Republic. The protesters gathered outside the National Comptroller's Office.
On 8 May 2023, in Judibana (Falcon), a group of residents protested against water outages going on for at least 30 days, and demanded a daily supply of drinking water through pipes.

On 8 May 2023, in Barinas (Barinas), a group of demonstrators, including teachers and other workers at the UNELLEZ University, staged a pot-banging protest to demand better pay and working conditions, payment of owed stipends, and the repeal of the National Budget Office (ONAPRE) instruction. The protesters gathered outside the UNELLEZ University premises.

notes: On 8 May 2023, in Merida (Merida), residents of different sectors staged a pot-banging protest from their balconies to demand better pay, and against the constant outages in power, water, and telecommunications.

On 8 May 2023, in San Fernando de Apure (Apure), a group of demonstrators, including teachers and other education sector workers, protested to demand better pay and working conditions. The protesters marched from the Fetrapure Union office to the seat of the Apure state government. Police were present but there was no intervention.

source: El Diario (Venezuela); La Patilla; Reporte YA
notes: On 8 May 2023, in Maracay (Aragua), a group of demonstrators, including health workers, and teachers, protested to demand better pay and working conditions, and payment of owed stipends. On 8 May 2023, in Rojas municipality (coded to Dolores, Barinas), a group of motorcyclists protested to demand an increase in their fuel allowance. The protesters claim that transport workers receive a greater share of petrol than they do. The demonstrators gathered by the Los Llanos petrol station.

On 8 May 2023, in Merida (Merida), a group of teachers and unionists protested to demand better pay and working conditions, and observance of their collective labor agreements. The protesters gathered outside the Labor Inspectorate Office.

On 8 May 2023, in Ciudad Guayana (Bolivar), a group of teachers gathered outside the Labor Inspectorate Office to demand answers regarding administrative processes opened against them by the education authorities, that could potentially end in dismissals or suspensions without pay. The protesters claim that these proceedings are just reprisals against them, for partaking in the industrial action.

source: Correo del Caroni; El Diario de Guayana
notes: On 8 May 2023, in Ciudad Guayana (Bolivar), a group of workers at the Casima Plant, belonging to the state-owned Venezuelan Corporation of Guayana (CVG), protested against the suspension of certain benefits, and dismissal threats towards them, ordered according to them by the upper management of the company for their industrial action. The protesters continued to demand the reinstatement of laid-off staff, and payment of owed stipends. The demonstrators gathered outside the CVG headquarters, where they handed in a letter with their demands.

On 8 May 2023, in Maracaibo (Zulia), dozens of former workers at companies that rendered services to the PDVSA oil company, protested to demand answers regarding their dismissals in 2018, which they deem as unjustified. The protesters claim that they were promised to be reinstated soon thereafter, and as such, they agreed to receive less compensation. They demand fairer payouts, and payment of owed stipends. The protesters gathered outside the PDVSA office.

On 8 May 2023, in Zazarida (Falcon), a group of fishers blocked the Falcon - Zulia Road in protest against high fuel prices. Traffic was blocked in both directions. Police and GNB military forces were present, but there was no intervention.
On 8 May 2023, in Maracay (Aragua), a group of residents of several neighborhoods staged a pot-banging protest from their balconies over power outages.

On 8 May 2023, in Santa Catarina Pinula municipality, Guatemala, armed men on a motorcycle shot and killed a woman in a rural area called San Luis Puerta Negra (drive-by). No more information is provided by the source. The motivation for the attack is unknown. 1 fatality.

On 8 May 2023, in Tegucigalpa, Francisco Morazan, students from the San Jose del Pedregal Institute blocked traffic and burned tires in the El Pedregal neighborhood and occupied the facilities of their school, in demonstration. On 8 May 2023, outside Santa Ana, Francisco Morazan, two brothers were killed and their bodies found in the El Horno sector, after being kidnapped on the same day by four unidentified armed men dressed in police uniforms from their home in the La Cienega community. On 8 May 2023, near Belladrum, Mahaica-Berbice, at least three people (two residents and the man calling to the protest) joined the so-called 'Ray Dagger's Walk' to oppose a contract signed by the Guyana authorities with the ExxonMobil company in 2015. They described the agreement as lopsided and barefaced. Other citizens joined the march as protest passed through the streets. His individual march lasted 12 days, while other participants joined the march as the protest passed through some locations (coded separately).

On 4 May 2023, in Cochabamba (Cochabamba), dozens of members of citizens organizations and Sumate Alliance supporters staged a demonstration outside the municipal council offices to demand the resignation of the president of the entity and another councilmember that they claim have allied themselves with Movement for Socialism (MAS) party. They covered the entrance of the council with bricks as part of the demonstration.

On 4 May 2023, in La Paz (La Paz), municipal workers blocked Socabaya and Mercado streets in the center of the city as a demonstration to demand payment of their owned bonuses and the raise of their wages.

On 4 May 2023, in San Lorenzo (Cochabamba), for the tenth consecutive day, residents blocked the highway to San Benito as a demonstration to demand the definitive foreclosure of a pig farm due to the environmental damage caused by it. This was the last day of the demonstration.

On 4 May 2023, in Santa Martha (Santa Cruz), for the third consecutive day, residents of 16 communities and three neighborhoods of El Torno municipality blocked the highway to Santa Cruz valleys at the Santa Marta bridge as a demonstration to demand the central and regional government cancel all mining concessions in their sector, citing environmental and other concerns.

On 4 May 2023, in Santa Rita (Santa Cruz), for the third consecutive day, residents of 16 communities and three neighborhoods of El Torno municipality blocked the highway to Santa Cruz valleys at the Santa Marta bridge as a demonstration to demand the central and regional government cancel all mining concessions in their sector, citing environmental and other concerns.

actor1: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
notes: On 4 May 2023, in Sitio Novo (Maranhao), armed attackers attempted to blow up a safe in a bank. Military police arrived at the scene and there was a shoot-out. Seven people were shot and injured. Four of the attackers were shot and killed. At least seven people were shot and injured by stray bullets. 4 fatalities.

actor2: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
notes: On 4 May 2023, in Rio de Janeiro - North Zone (Rio de Janeiro), armed suspects exchanged fire with military police officers in the Vigario Geral neighborhood. A Family Clinic was hit by bullets. Unknown casualties.

The event was described as an execution and the victim owned a jewelry store, and had a record for fraud and receiving stolen goods. 1 fatality.

On 4 May 2023, in the rural area of Taquarana municipality (Alagoas), a man was shot and killed in a drive-by shooting perpetrated by two attackers on a motorcycle. The motive and identities of the perpetrators are unknown. 1 fatality.

Around 4 May 2023 (as reported), in the rural area of Limoeiro de Anadia municipality (Alagoas), a man was killed and their body was found shot and stabbed to death in the Estivas settlement. The motive and identity of the perpetrator(s) are unknown but the man had served time for drug trafficking, illegal possession of a firearm, and homicide. No recent involvement in criminal activities has been reported, 1 fatality.

notes: On 4 May 2023, in Santa Barbara (Bahia), military police teams exchanged fire with three armed drug traffickers in the Alto da Pojuca housing complex. One suspect was shot and killed. Police seized a firearm, marijuana, and ammunition. 1 fatality.

On 4 May 2023, in Parnamirim (Rio Grande do Norte), health workers carried out a protest outside the city hall on the third day of strike action. The protesters demanded a meeting with the mayor and the municipal health minister as the sector have yet to receive a response to any of their demands.

On 4 May 2023, in Itabaiana (Sergipe), a pregnant woman and a man were shot and injured on General Joao Pereira square, in a drive-by shooting perpetrated by a man on a motorcycle. The motive and identity of the perpetrator are unknown. No fatalities.

On 4 May 2023, in Caruaru (Pernambuco), residents of Saldanha da Gama road carried out a protest in the city center for the second non-consecutive day to condemn the construction of a homeless shelter in the Indianopolis neighborhood.
On 4 May 2023, in Sao Vicente (Sao Paulo), residents held a protest, denouncing the construction of a bus station in the Praca Bernardino de Campos area.

On 4 May 2023, in Maceio (Recife), residents of the Bom Parto neighborhood carried out a demonstration by blocking the Afranio Lages Avenue with burning tyres. The demonstrators had demands regarding relocation after mudslides.

On 4 May 2023, in Sao Carlos (Sao Paulo), unknown perpetrators shot and killed a man, and his body was found in the Cidade Aracy neighborhood. The victim had been shot to the back of the head and the event was described as an execution. 1 fatality.
On 4 May 2023, in Sao Francisco de Itabapoana (Rio de Janeiro), two armed suspects shot and killed a man in his workshop in the Amontado locality. The motive of the event is not known. 1 fatality.

On 4 May 2023, in Feira de Santana (Bahia), dentistry students at the Feira de Santana State University (Uefs) carried out a protest in front of the university's deanery. The students stated that they have been without the necessary materials since the beginning of the semester.

On 4 May 2023, in Natal (Rio Grande do Norte), cyclists, residents, business owners, and opposition councillors carried out a protest on the intersection between Hermes da Fonseca and Alexandrino de Alencar avenues to condemn the construction of a trench planned by the city.

actor1: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police

On 4 May 2023, in Rio de Janeiro - North Zone (Rio de Janeiro), unknown shooters exchanged fire in the Morro do Urubu community, Piedade neighborhood, and the Cascadura, Penha Circular, and Bras de Pina neighborhoods. On 4 May 2023, in Manaus - East Zone (Amazonas), a man was shot six times and killed in the Jorge Teixeira neighborhood by three armed individuals who invaded his private residence. There are no reports on the identity of the perpetrators or the attack's motivation. 1 fatality.

On 4 May 2023, in Manaus - West Zone (Amazonas), a man was shot at least 15 times and killed in the Parque Sao Pedro neighborhood by three armed individuals who invaded his private residence. The victim had recently left prison (charges not reported). There are no reports on the identity of the perpetrators or the attack's motivation. 1 fatality.

On 4 May 2023, in Manaus - West Zone (Amazonas), a shoot-out between rival drug trafficking groups took place in the Parque Sao Pedro neighborhood. A hand grenade (not detonated) was found in the area after the clash. There were no fatalities.

On 4 May 2023, in Manaus - North Zone (Amazonas), a man was shot at least 10 times and killed by armed individuals in the Cidade Nova neighborhood. Police believe the victim was killed in a drug trafficking tribunal. 1 fatality.
On 4 May 2023, in Itapemirim (Espirito Santo), a man was shot and killed by two armed individuals due to a drug debt. The victim was a drug user. Both suspects were arrested. 1 fatality.

On 4 May 2023, in Campo Grande (Mato Grosso do Sul), a man was shot and injured in a drive-by shooting in the Tiradentes neighborhood by an armed individual in a car. Moreover, in the Santa Luzia neighborhood, an adolescent was injured in a drive-by shooting by an armed individual in a car. There are no reports on the identity of the perpetrators or the attack's motivation. There were no fatalities.

One drug trafficker was shot and injured and the other escaped. The injured suspect was taken to a hospital and later arrested. Police seized 650kg of marijuana. There were no fatalities.

On 4 May 2023, in Uberaba (Minas Gerais), a man was killed and another was injured in a drive-by shooting in the Antonia Candida II neighborhood by two armed individuals on a motorcycle. There are no reports on the identity of the perpetrators or the attack's motivation. 1 fatality.

On 4 May 2023, in Castanhal (Para), a man was shot and killed in the Ramal da Sucata region by two armed individuals. The attack was described as an execution. There are no reports on the identity of the perpetrators or the attack's motivation. 1 fatality.

notes: On 4 May 2023, in Igarape-Acu (Para), a drug trafficking suspect exchanged fire with military police forces in the Portelinha region. The drug trafficker was killed. Police seized a firearm, ammunition, drugs. 1 fatality.

notes: Property destruction: On 4 May 2023, in Vila Celeste (Santa Helena, Parana), federal police forces seized one ton of marijuana hidden in a wooded area near Itaipu lake. No arrests were made.

notes: On 4 May 2023, in Porto Alegre (Rio Grande do Sul), five armed individuals exchanged fire with military police forces during a patrol in the Espirito Santo neighborhood. Four armed suspects were killed and the fifth escaped. One officer was superficially injured by shards during the clash. Police seized three firearms. 4 fatalities.

On 4 May 2023, in Juiz de Fora (Minas Gerais), a man was shot and injured by drug traffickers in the Sao Benedito neighborhood. The victim was a suspected thief and was punished by the group. The victim was taken to the hospital by military police officers.

On 4 May 2023, in San Pedro de la Paz (Biobio), police carried out an eviction procedure in the housing project which had been occupied since the week prior by a group of people. Occupants repelled the eviction with blunt objects and erecting barricades in the San Pedro de la Costa sector. A group of rioters broke the windows of a press vehicle and attacked both the cameraman and a journalist from TVN Red Bio Bio with a stick. Police managed to enter the buildings to evict the occupants and dispersed the crowd with water cannons. The group of people who took over the apartments are Chileans, foreigners and people from other communes. After the eviction, authorities found out rioters destroyed the facilities. Three people were arrested. There were no fatalities.

Property destruction: On 4 May 2023, between Icalma and Melipeuco (Araucania), unknown individuals set a backhoe on fire. Moments before the attack, workers in the area assured they heard shots coming from La Querencia farm. The identity of perpetrators is unknown but Indigenous Militias are often responsible for similar attacks in the Araucania region.

Property destruction: On 4 May 2023, in Los Angeles commune (Biobio), unknown individuals set a house on fire on Vina del Mar street in the Ciudades de Chile sector. According to the Fire Department, the fire started with an incendiary element that would have been thrown. The identity of perpetrators is unknown but Indigenous Militias are often responsible for similar attacks in the Biobio region.

assoc_actor_1: Labor Group (Chile); PCC: Communist Party of Chile
notes: On 4 May 2023, in Santiago - Providencia (Metropolitana), representatives of workers and the Chilean Communist Party (PCC) gathered outside of the Costanera Center demanding celerity for the approval of the project that aims to change the labor journey of some businesses. The project changes the operation hours of the commercial and service establishments that directly serve the public. Protesters stated that there are many people who leave their workplace late at night and they face risks in terms of security, especially women.

The incident occurred hours after Indigenous and Afro-Colombian people clashed during a protest over a land dispute (coded separately). At least 1 fatality.

On 4 May 2023, in La Floresta (Yolombo, Antioquia), members of the Gulf Clan broke into a local home in La Floresta vereda and raped a woman who was there. On 4 May 2023, in La Floresta (Yolombo, Antioquia), members of the Gulf Clan clashed with military forces. Around 4 May 2023 (as reported), in Medellin - Northwest (Antioquia), rioters attacked a drunk taxi driver in the 12 de Octubre neighborhood after the man ran over a resident of the area.

Around 4 May 2023 (as reported), in the rural area of Villa del Rosario municipality (Norte de Santander), a woman was abducted and killed by members of the gang El Tren de Aragua Gang, her body was found the following day. The victim was shot multiple times. 1 fatality.

On 4 May 2023, in the rural area of El Palmar corregimiento (Huila), for the second consecutive day, farmers and raw sugarcane producers blocked a road to protest against the industry's crisis and the lack of government support. The group alleged that low taxes on raw sugar imported from other countries have affected domestic producers.

In addition, the FARC dissidents forced the company to shut down 21 telecommunication antennas, leaving the town uncommunicated. There are no further details on the attack. 1 fatality.

Around 4 May 2023 (as reported), in Bogota - Kennedy (Bogota, D.C.), residents of the Carimagua neighborhood beat and stripped naked a man who minutes before robbed a pedestrian. The victim was hospitalized due to the seriousness of the attack.
On 4 May 2023, in Castilla (Coyaima, Tolima), hundreds of residents of the Castilla settlement protested and blocked the Pan-American Highway to demand road improvements.

Around 4 May 2023 (as reported), in the rural area of Guachene municipality (Cauca), riots broke out between Indigenous people and Afro-Colombian communities over a land dispute in the Muchilanga sector. The groups clashed when the Afro-Colombians tried to plant crops in the disputed area. Several people were injured.

Around 4 May 2023 (as reported), in the rural area of Llorente municipality (Narino), a farmer was killed and his body found. There are no further details on the reasons for the attack or potential perpetrators, but the area is known for the presence of armed groups. 1 fatality
Around 4 May 2023 (as reported), in Uribia (La Guajira), Wayuu Indigenous people protested delays in the registration of several indigenous reserve zones in the area by the local government.

On 4 May 2023, in the rural area of Pelaya municipality (Cesar), an unidentified armed group ambushed a group of police officers carrying out controls near a local tollbooth. The perpetrators opened fire from a nearby wooded area, wounding two officers. There were no fatalities.

On 4 May 2023, in the rural area of Santander De Quilichao municipality (Cauca), students at three schools protested against the lack of teachers and administrative personnel. The group blocked the international highway in the Dominguillo sector.

On 4 May 2023, in Quito - Calderon (Pichincha), residents captured and beat up with stones and sticks two men that had attempted to rob a restaurant. National police officers rescued the two men and took them to a police station.

On 4 May 2023, in Archidona (Napo), residents captured and beat up two men that were accused of being robbers. They also sprayed them with chili juice on the face as part of the punishment. There were no fatalities.

On 4 May 2023, in Hernandarias (Alto Parana), a group of CN supporters blocked Route PY07 in the San Francisco neighborhood to demonstrate against the results of the general elections held on 30 April. They claimed that there was fraud and irregularities with voting machines and demanded the annulment of the election result and the disclosure of voting records. Seven demonstrators were arrested. This was part of nationwide demonstrations that broke out after the CN presidential candidate Paraguayo Cubas made fraud allegations and called his supporters to demonstrate.

On 4 May 2023, in Monsefu (Lambayeque), transportation workers staged a demonstration outside the local police station to demand the police commissioner intervene in an illegal stop created by a transport company, that received an authorization by the previous government but could not actually give these kind of authorizations according to the demonstrators.

On 4 May 2023, in Arequipa (Arequipa), civil construction workers staged a demonstration outside the provincial government offices to demand the works that had been promised by the mayor to be carried out for them to have work.

On 4 May 2023, in Simon Bolivar municipality (coded to San Francisco de Yare, Miranda), a group of teachers gathered in protest against the new adjustments to bonuses and benefits for state workers announced by the government, which they argue to be insufficient, and called instead for an increase in the minimum wage. On 4 May 2023, in Ocumare del Tuy (Miranda), a group of teachers marched in protest against the new adjustments to bonuses and benefits for state workers announced by the government, which they argue to be insufficient, and called instead for an increase in the minimum wage. Additionally, they announced further industrial action. The protesters gathered in the El Estudiante Square, and then marched down the Ribas and Miranda avenues.

On 4 May 2023, in El Tigre (Anzoategui), a group of residents, sympathetic to the former mayor, protested against his dismissal. The protesters gathered outside the Simon Rodriguez municipal hall, and then marched to the SEBIN police intelligence office. On 4 May 2023, in Maracaibo (Zulia), a group of demonstrators, including active and retired teachers, pensioners, and unionists, protested to demand better pay and working conditions, and against the new adjustments to bonuses and benefits for state workers announced by the government, which they argue to be insufficient. Furthermore, they called for additional funding for schools. The protesters gathered in the Cristobal Mendoza sports center, in the Chiquinquira parish.

On 4 May 2023, in Merida (Merida), a group of workers of the Los Andes University (ULA) protested to demand payment of owed stipends. The protesters argue that workers of other universities received these payouts, and demanded observance of their collective labor agreement.

source: OVCS: Observatorio Venezolano de Conflictividad Social

On 4 May 2023, in Corozal Town, Corozal, there was an armed clash between two groups of armed men in vehicles (drive-by) near Copperbank Ferry. Another report states that one of the cars was chasing the other, and as the first one stopped, armed men wearing masks stepped down the second and opened fire on them with rifles. Police believe the clash was drug-related. As a result of the clash, two men were injured, and another jumped out of the car and was found dead later due to drowning. Police seized a rifle and one pellet gun. No more detail is provided by the source. 2 injured.

On 4 May 2023, in Guatemala City, Guatemala, teachers affiliated with the Union of Education Workers of Guatemala (STEG) staged a protest in zone 1. People protested against a new bill that seeks to amend the pensions of public officials' retirees. Protesters argue that this reform will impact on their salaries and their pensions, and that they were not consulted.

On 4 May 2023, in Roatan, Bay Islands, a group of teachers occupied the facilities of the Departmental Education Authority in protest demanding a zoning salary readjustment to compensate them for teaching in remote areas.
On 4 May 2023, in Tocoa, Colon, unidentified armed men shot and killed a member of the Barrio 18 Gang in the center of the municipality. The reason for the killing is unknown. 1 fatality.

On 4 May 2023, in San Pedro Sula, Cortes, unidentified armed men shot and killed a VIP taxi owner and driver after posing as passengers asking for a ride. The exact reason for the killing is unknown, but preliminary investigations indicated extortion to be a possible motivation for the crime. 1 fatality.

On 4 May 2023, in Danli, El Paraiso, unidentified armed men on a motorcycle shot and wounded a journalist for a local TV channel as he was heading home from work in a drive-by shooting. The reason for the shooting is unknown. 1 wounded.
On 4 May 2023, in Comayaguela, Francisco Morazan, parents and students at the Jose Raul Castro educational center protested against the lack of teachers in this educational establishment.

Property destruction: On 4 May 2023, in Tegucigalpa, Francisco Morazan, unidentified armed men boarded a bus and set it on fire after ordering all passengers to leave, in the vicinity of the National Autonomous University of Honduras (UNAH) sports complex. Preliminary investigations indicated the likely motive for the action to be extortion-related.

On 4 May 2023, in Tegucigalpa, Francisco Morazan, a group of drivers and assistants of local buses blocked traffic and burned tires in demonstration in the Nueva Suyapa neighborhood after a bus was burned down by alleged gang members on this same day in the same area (coded separately).

On 4 May 2023, in Tegucigalpa, Francisco Morazan, students at the San Jose del Pedregal Institute protested due to a lack of chairs, a perimeter wall, and sewage problems in this educational establishment.

On 4 May 2023, in El Progreso, Yoro, a group of residents protested against their municipal authorities for failing to repair 27 cracks in the embankments of former banana plantations caused by the passage of tropical storms Eta and Iota. They demanded the government for repairs.
On 4 May 2023, outside La Estancia, Yoro, unidentified armed men shot and killed a man from a moving vehicle (drive-by). The reason for the killing is unknown. 1 fatality.

On 4 May 2023, near Volcan, Chiriqui, for the second consecutive day, people staged a protest to demand the Ministry of Housing the construction of houses for those affected by the Iota and Eta hurricanes. Protesters blocked the road that connects Volcan with Cerro Punta.

On 4 May 2023, in Paramaribo, Paramaribo, teachers and members of the Wi Sa Strei group held a protest through the streets of the Zorg en Hoopto neighborhood and entered several school centers shouting their claims. They kept asking for a bonus of 2,500 SRD, among other labor demands. Police forces were present, although no intervention on their side was reported.

On 4 May 2023, near Cornelia Ida, Essequibo Islands-West Demerara, a group of people joined the so-called 'Ray Dagger's Walk' to oppose a contract signed by the Guyana authorities with the ExxonMobil company in 2015. They described the agreement as lopsided and barefaced. Other citizens joined the march as protest passed through the streets. This was the first day of an individual march that lasted 12 days, while other participants joined the march as the protest passed through some locations (coded separately).

On 4 May 2023, in Manaus - East Zone (Amazonas), a shoot-out between rival drug trafficking groups took place in the Valparaiso community, Jorge Teixeira neighborhood. One drug trafficker was killed. A civilian man was injured by stray bullets and died from the injuries on 21 May 2023. 2 fatalities.

On 4 May 2023, in Sao Gabriel do Oeste (Mato Grosso do Sul), a man was shot and killed in the Jardim Gramado neighborhood by two armed individuals who invaded his private residence. The victim had a police record for drug trafficking. There are no reports on the identity of the perpetrators or the attack's motivation. 1 fatality.
On 4 May 2023, in Salama, Baja Verapaz, armed men attacked the mayor for the Granados municipality for the Vamos party. The armed men shot at the victim who was unharmed. There were no casualties.

On 4 May 2023, in Palmas (Tocantins), a man was shot four times and injured inside a bar in the Taquaralto neighborhood by an armed individual. The victim had a police record for robbery and drug trafficking. In the Jardim Aureny II neighborhood, two men were killed in a drive-by shooting by two armed individuals on a motorcycle. One victim had a police record for homicide, robbery and drug trafficking. There are no reports on the identity of the perpetrators. 2 fatalities.

On 3 May 2023, in San Lorenzo (Cochabamba), for the nineth consecutive day, residents blocked the highway to San Benito as a demonstration to demand the definitive foreclosure of a pig farm due to the environmental damage caused by it.
On 3 May 2023, in Montero (Santa Cruz), hundreds of urban motorcycle taxi drivers marched through the city to the main square as a demonstration to demand the raise of their fare costs by 50%.

On 3 May 2023, in Macapa (Amapa), a man was shot five times and killed in a drive-by shooting in the Marabaixo 4 neighborhood by two armed individuals on a motorcycle. The attack was described as an execution. There are no reports on the identity of the perpetrators or the attack's motivation. 1 fatality.

On 3 May 2023, in Manaus - West Zone (Amazonas), a man was killed in a drive-by shooting in the Santo Antonio neighborhood by an armed individual on a motorcycle. There are no reports on the identity of the perpetrator or the attack's motivation. 1 fatality.

actor1: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police

One drug trafficker was killed and another was injured and taken to hospital. At least three more people were injured, but it is unknown whether they took part in the clash. 1 fatality.

On 3 May 2023, in Morros (Maranhao), two men and one woman were shot and killed in the Coelho neighborhood. According to initial investigations, the killing was to do with drug trafficking. The motive and identities of the perpetrators are under investigation. 3 fatalities.

On 3 May 2023 in Rio de Janeiro - West Zone (Rio de Janeiro), two armed suspects on a bicycle shot and killed two members of the Zinho police militia in the Recreio dos Bandeirantes neighborhood. Two male police militia members were killed, and a female civilian was shot and injured. The targets were known for extortion in the area and the event was described as an execution. 2 fatalities.

Property destruction: On 3 May 2023, in Vitoria (Espirito Santo), five armed individuals forced a bus driver and passengers out of a bus and set it on fire in the Itarare neighborhood. The act was retaliation for the death of a drug trafficker during a clash with military police (coded separately).

actor2: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
notes: On 3 May 2023, in Peruibe (Sao Paulo), armed suspects exchanged fire with military police officers in a locality known as Gueto. One military police officer was shot and injured. There were no fatalities.

Security measures: On 3 May 2023, in Vitoria (Espirito Santo), drug traffickers enforced a curfew on residents of the Morro do Macaco region in response to the death of a drug trafficker during a clash with military police (coded separately).

The motivation for the attack may have been a false accusation of theft or related to organized crime. 1 fatality.
On 3 May 2023, in Pilar (Alagoas), a man was shot and killed in the Cha do Pilar area. The man was known to police for drug trafficking. 1 fatality.

On 3 May 2023, in Fortaleza (Ceara), unidentified shooters exchanged fire in the Cristo Redentor neighborhood. A teenage boy was shot and later died in hospital. A woman was also shot and injured. 1 fatality.

On 3 May 2023, in Sao Paulo - North Zone (Sao Paulo), residents held a demonstration denouncing the arrest of two local men in the Brasilandia community. Demonstrators constructed burning barricades on the avenues.

On 3 May 2023, in Aracaju (Sergipe), a woman was shot and killed in between the Jardim Centenario and Olaria neighborhoods, in a drive-by shooting perpetrated by two men on a motorcycle. The motive and identities of the perpetrators are under investigation. 1 fatality.
On 3 May 2023, in Teresina (Piaui), dozens of cart operators carried out a protest by blocking Maranhao Avenue in the city center, condemning the seizure of their horses the previous day.

On 3 May 2023, in Boa Vista (Roraima), about 20 miners gathered outside the federal police headquarters to demand an investigation regarding eight people who were found dead in Yanomami indigenous territory on 1 May 2023 (coded separately).
