On 3 May 2023, in Santos (Sao Paulo), around 30 workers at the University of Sao Paulo's Oceanographic Institute held a protest denouncing the dismissal of university employees by occupying two research vessels.

On 3 May 2023, in Sao Paulo - North Zone (Sao Paulo), mothers, relatives, and friends held a protest in the Brasilandia neighborhood, asking for the freedom of their Afro-Brazilian sons who are jailed on allegations of participating in kidnapping and robbery. The protesters demanded justice for the innocent men, closing the intersection of two avenues.

On 3 May 2023, in Rio de Janeiro - North Zone (Rio de Janeiro), unknown shooters exchanged fire in the Morro do Fuba community, Campinho neighborhood, and the Tomas Coelho, Madureira, Jacarezinho, and Meier neighborhoods. Shootings were also heard in the Caixa D'agua community, Penha Complex. Unknown casualties.
On 3 May 2023, in Angra dos Reis (Rio de Janeiro), unknown shooters exchanged fire in the Morro da Gloria community. Unknown casualties.
On 3 May 2023, in Niteroi - North (Rio de Janeiro), unknown shooters exchanged fire in the Cubango neighborhood. Unknown casualties.

Police seized firearms, ammunition, portions of drugs, precision scales, radio communicators, and bullet proof vests. There were no fatalities.

On 3 May 2023, in Sinop (Mato Grosso), six armed individuals invaded a private residence and held the residents hostage. The residents were tied up, tortured, and injured. One person was shot and killed and another was injured. The attack was described as an execution. There are no reports on the identity of the perpetrators or the attack's motivation. 1 fatality.

On 3 May 2023, in Uberaba (Minas Gerais), a man was shot three times and killed in the Chica Ferreira neighborhood by an armed individual. The victim was a drug user and days before his killing he received death threats from a drug trafficker. 1 fatality.

On 3 May 2023, in Uberaba (Minas Gerais), dozens of family members and friends of an adolescent who passed away while in a hospital carried out a protest inside the Municipal Chamber to demand an investigation of his case. The protesters claimed it was a case of medical negligence.

On 3 May 2023, in Dom Eliseu (Para), a man was shot and killed in the Jardim America neighborhood by two armed individuals who chased after him. One suspect was arrested. Both the deceased and the suspect had a police record, which is why police believe in rivalries between drug trafficking groups as the motivation for his killing. 1 fatality.

On 3 May 2023, in Boa Vista (Roraima), two men and a child were abducted from the Cidade Satelite neighborhood by five individuals who introduced themselves as police agents. The victims were tied up, beaten up, and injured, and then forced into the trunk of a car. One victim kicked the trunk open, escaped and called the police, who released the other victims. One suspect was arrested. Abduction motivation is unknown. There were no fatalities.

Protesters stated that cemeteries have sanitary deficiencies and poor working conditions regarding safety and work tools. Workers said they feel abandoned by the authorities.

On 3 May 2023, near Hualpen commune (Biobio), unionized subcontracted workers protested at their workplace after failing to reach agreements with the Bio Bio Refinery regarding salary benefits. Workers from Hualpen and Concon are on a strike for the same reasons. Protesters stated that demands come from May 2022, when nearly 500 workers belonging to the same union went on strike for nearly 40 days demanding better salaries.

On 3 May 2023, in La Parada (Norte de Santander), militants of the El Tren de Aragua Gang kidnapped two women who were buying merchandise for their business. They claimed that there was fraud and irregularities with voting machines and demanded the annulment of the election result and the disclosure of voting records. This was part of nationwide demonstrations that broke out after the CN presidential candidate Paraguayo Cubas made fraud allegations and called his supporters to demonstrate.

On 3 May 2023, in Lima - Lima District (Lima), local residents and members of social organizations staged a demonstration outside the National Justice Board to demand the closure of congress, calling for general elections, and for the resignation of President Dina Boluarte.

The protesters gathered outside the Ateneo Arts Museum.

On 3 May 2023, in Barinas (Barinas), a group of residents of the Francisco de Miranda neighborhood protested to demand legal action against the officials responsible for the disappearance of around 400 of their gas cylinders for domestic use.

Around 3 May 2023 (as reported), in Valencia (Carabobo), a group of health workers of the Barrio Adentro Mission protested to demand better pay and working conditions, and payment of owed stipends. notes: On 3 May 2023, in Ciudad Ojeda (Zulia), six unidentified crime group suspects, armed with assault rifles, attempted to abduct a petrol station owner, in the La Tropicana petrol station, which is owned by the victim, located in the Intercomunal Avenue. The suspects were inside a vehicle, resembling clients waiting to refuel, when they suddenly stepped out the car, and tried to kidnap the victim. However, the man resisted and possibly injured one of the captors. Before fleeing the area, the suspects opened fire, injuring the target of their failed abduction. Police found the suspects' vehicle abandoned in the Libertad neighborhood, but no arrests have yet been made. The victim was taken to hospital for treatment. There were no fatalities.

The man had a criminal record for homicide, and was linked to several other killings. Police collected a gun, and seized the motorcycle. 1 fatality.

On 3 May 2023, in Concepcion (Zulia), two unidentified crime group suspects on a motorcycle, shot and killed a merchant of the municipal market, in a drive-by shooting in the El Rosado sector. assoc_actor_1: Police Forces of Brazil (2023-) Civil Police
notes: On 2 May 2023, in Sao Paulo - Central Zone (Sao Paulo), civil police officers held a protest outside city hall, demanding recognition and appreciation after a minimum wage proposal was offered by the mayor.

actor1: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
notes: On 2 May 2023, in Vitoria (Espirito Santo), a drug trafficking suspect exchanged fire with military police forces during a patrol in the Romao neighborhood. The drug trafficker was killed. Police seized a firearm, ammunition, portions of drugs, cash, and a cell phone. 1 fatality.

actor1: Police Forces of Brazil (2023-) Civil Police
notes: Property destruction: On 2 May 2023, in Joao Pessoa (Paraiba), civil police uncovered a narcotics laboratory in the Mangabeira neighborhood. A man and two women were arrested and police seized around 50 kilograms of marijuana.

actor1: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
notes: On 2 May 2023, in Cuiaba (Mato Grosso), an armed individual exchanged fire with military police forces in the Novo Paraiso neighborhood. The armed suspect was killed. The deceased was wearing a monitoring anklet for drug trafficking, but was still involved in the activity. 1 fatality.

Around 2 May 2023 (as reported), in the rural area of Sao Jose da Tapera municipality (Alagoas), a man was killed and his body was found in the Sitio Espirito Santo area. The victim was found to have been tied up with cords. The motive and identity of the perpetrator(s) are unknown. 1 fatality.

actor1: Police Forces of Brazil (2023-) Federal Police
notes: Property destruction: On 2 May 2023, in Itaum (Dourados, Mato Grosso do Sul), federal police forces seized 4,124kg of marijuana hidden inside a truck during an inspection on the MS-270 highway. Two people were arrested.

Around 2 May 2023 (as reported), in Belo Horizonte (Minas Gerais), a person was killed by unknown individuals and their burnt body was found inside a container in the Lagoinha neighborhood. Circumstances of death are unknown. 1 fatality.
On 2 May 2023, in Sao Goncalo - Ipiiba (Rio de Janeiro), residents held a protest in the Coelho neighborhood, asking for more security after thefts and robberies increased in the area.

On 2 May 2023, in Parnamirim (Rio Grande do Norte), dozens of health workers carried out a protest in front of the maternity unit on the first day of strike action. The protesters demanded a meeting with upper management to discuss pay and labor conditions.

On 2 May 2023, in Ilheus (Bahia), a demonstration took place on JJ Seabra square to condemn a rise in the price of public transport in the city. A fight broke out amongst the demonstrators after the wife of a city councillor tried to take the phone of a demonstrator who was filming the event.

On 2 May 2023, in Porto Alegre (Rio Grande do Sul), a man was shot and killed by five hooded armed individuals who invaded his private residence in the Campo Novo neighborhood. The suspects introduced themselves as police agents. There are no reports on the identity of the perpetrators or the attack's motivation. 1 fatality.

On 2 May 2023, in Pindare-Mirim (Maranhao), family of a woman whose body had been dug up from her grave violated carried out a protest demanding justice. The protesters gathered in front of the municipal public defender before marching to the local police station.

On 2 May 2023, in Boa Vista (Roraima), residents and farmers of a squat in Bonfim municipality gathered in front of an energy company and then carried out a march to demand land regularization and electricity services in the squat.

actor1: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
notes: On 2 May 2023, in Sao Paulo - South Zone (Sao Paulo), military police officers physically assaulted three Afro-Brazilian civilians with punches, kicks, and a forbidden restraining technique. The victims had minor injuries. There were no fatalities.

On 2 May 2023, in Mocajuba (Para), residents of Quilombo communities carried out a march and then occupied part of city hall to protest against the substitution of the communities' teaching staff. Protesters claim some teachers are from the communities, so they have a deeper understanding of their needs.
On 2 May 2023, in Belo Horizonte (Minas Gerais), people gathered in a square at the city center to protest against increase in bus fares.

On 2 May 2023, in Sao Francisco de Irituia (Irituia, Para), residents carried out a protest to demand the repair of a pothole on the BR-010 highway. The protesters staged a birthday party to mark one year since the issue started and has not been fixed.

source: Acre 24 Horas; Acre in Foco; G1; Informativo Placido
notes: On 2 May 2023, in Rio Branco (Acre), a man was shot 12 times and killed in the Polo Benfica neighborhood by four armed individuals. The victim was wearing a monitoring anklet (charges not reported). Police believe the attack was motivated by drug trafficking disputes. 1 fatality.

On 2 May 2023, in Foz do Iguacu (Parana), family members and friends of a man who was shot to death by military police officers on 28 April 2023 (coded separately) carried out a march and then gathered in front of a police battalion to demand justice for his case.
On 2 May 2023, in Niteroi - North (Rio de Janeiro), unknown shooters exchanged fire in the Cubango neighborhood. Unknown casualties.
On 2 May 2023, in Resende (Rio de Janeiro), unknown shooters exchanged fire in the Jardim Beira Rio neighborhood. Unknown casualties.

actor1: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
notes: On 2 May 2023, in Londrina (Parana), a drug trafficker exchanged fire with military police forces during his arrest operation. The drug trafficker was killed. Police seized a firearm, ammunition, three cell phones, and drugs. 1 fatality.
On 2 May 2023, in Mage (Rio de Janeiro), unknown shooters exchanged fire in the Parada Angelica neighborhood. Unknown casualties.
On 2 May 2023, in Rondonopolis (Mato Grosso), a woman was abducted from a bar by two individuals. Five suspects were identified, but not arrested. Abduction motivation is unknown.

actor1: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
notes: On 2 May 2023, in Marianopolis do Tocantins (Tocantins), armed individuals exchanged fire with military police forces during their arrest operation. Three suspects were killed. The deceased had taken part in a novo cangaco robbery in Confresa municipality on 9 April 2023 (coded separately). 3 fatalities.

Property destruction: On 2 May 2023, near Los Sauces commune (Araucania), unknown individuals set a house and a vehicle on fire on route R360 near Morro San Carlitos. Perpetrators arrived shooting to intimidate the owners, and after setting a house on fire, they escaped in two vehicles. One of the vehicles was found completely burned blocking the route 360. A car and a tractor were found with bullet holes inside the property. A pamphlet was found at the scene in which perpetrators demanded freedom for the Mapuche prisoners, specifically one prisoner convicted of the homicide of a police officer (coded separately).

On 2 May 2023, in Arica commune (Arica y Parinacota), individuals from several nationalities blocked the border crossing between Chile and Peru in a demonstration against the border closure. Police tried to clear the route but rioters threw stones at them. Migrants also threw stones at cars stuck in the six-hour blockade which led to arguments between migrants and individuals trying to cross the border. For the past two weeks, the Peruvian government has prevented foreigners who were in an irregular migratory situation from entering their country, which has generated a migratory crisis between Chile and Peru. Two people were arrested.

On 2 May 2023, in Santiago (Metropolitana), between 50 and 60 hooded individuals threw at least 30 Molotov cocktails and blunt objects at police units outside the National Institute. The reasons for the demonstration are unknown.

On 2 May 2023, in Santiago - Providencia (Metropolitana), hooded individuals held a demonstration outside the Lastarria High School. Unspecified acts of violence by demonstrators were reported. The reasons for the demonstration are unknown.

On 2 May 2023, in Valdivia (Los Rios), about 25 residents from several communes such as Casablanca, Morrompulli and Caman protested at the Saesa office. Protesters partially blocked the entry to the building. They met with the manager looking for solutions to lack of electrical service and power cuts that will have an important effect during winter.

On 2 May 2023, in Antofagasta (Antofagasta), residents of El Salar villa protested in front of the Housing and Urbanism Service (SERVIU) demanding the demolition and reconstruction of a housing project. There are 126 houses affected by problems in the structure, water and gas leaks and pests. Protesters stated that the complex showed deficiencies a few months after it was delivered to the 126 families.

On 2 May 2023, in Valparaiso (Valparaiso), relatives, co-workers and friends of a woman who died when crushed by a forklift protested at Civic square demanding justice and celerity in the court ruling. Protesters also demanded a revision of contracts with the companies due to poor equipment maintenance, which is suspected to be the cause of the accident eight months ago. They handed a petition letter to the Regional Presidential Delegate.
On 2 May 2023, in Concepcion (Biobio), parents and representatives of students protested outside of the Marina de Chile school demanding solutions to a plague of mice in the facilities.

actor1: FARC Dissident - 1st Front: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia Dissident Faction (1st Front - Armando Rios)
notes: Change to armed group: Around 2 May 2023 (as reported), in the department of Guaviare (coded to San Jose del Guaviare, Guaviare), the dissident faction of FARC Armando Rios splintered into two different organizations following disagreements between the armed group. As a result, two structures remained: the First Armando Rios Front and the Armando Rios Marquetalia Bolivariano Front.

Around 2 May 2023 (as reported), in the rural area of Florencia municipality (Caqueta), three people were killed and their bodies found near the Villa Hermosa vereda. Although the perpetrators and motives of the attack have not been confirmed, the area is known for the presence of the Second Marquetalia FARC dissident Faction. 3 fatalities.

assoc_actor_1: Guardia Indigena (Colombia); Indigenous Group (Colombia); Nasa Indigenous Group (Colombia)
source: El Colombiano; El Espectador; Vanguardia Liberal
notes: On 2 May 2023, in Bogota - La Candelaria (Bogota, D.C.), Nasa Indigenous people and members of the Guardia Indigenous held a peaceful protest outside the Congress of the Republic to reiterate its support for the social reforms proposed by the government of President Gustavo Petro.
On 2 May 2023, in Bogota - Teusaquillo (Bogota, D.C.), students and relatives of a killed social leader (coded separately) held a protest to demand justice and a prompt investigation of the attack.

On 2 May 2023, in Uribia municipality (La Guajira), business owners protested over power service failures. The group gathered in the Cuatro Vias area to complain that their establishments are being affected due to a two-day power outage that has affected the municipality. Moreover, residents of Uribia and Manaure municipalities blocked the railway to protest against a power outage. The group claims to have been without service for several days.

assoc_actor_2: Unidentified Communal Group (Colombia); JAC: Council of Communal Action
notes: Around 2 May 2023 (as reported), in the rural area of Balboa municipality (Cauca), a social leader was killed and his body found near the Cruce de San Alfonso area. The victim, who was a member of the JAC of the Puerto Rico corregimiento (Argelia, Cauca), was shot multiple times. Although the perpetrators of the attack have not been confirmed, the area is known for the presence of armed groups.

On 2 May 2023, in Bucaramanga (Santander), students and their parents demonstrated at a local school following multiple allegations of sexual misconduct by one of the teachers and lack of action by school administrators.

Around 2 May 2023 (as reported), in the rural area of Libano municipality (Tolima), the mayoral candidate for the PHC coalition was killed and his body was found, with several gunshot impacts. There are no further details on the reasons for the attack or potential perpetrators. 1 fatality.

Around 2 May 2023, in San Pablo (Narino), unidentified armed individuals shot and killed a man in his house in a drive-by shooting. There are no further details on the motives for the attack or the possible perpetrators, but neighbors stated that the incident may be related to a settling of scores or social cleansing. The area is known for the presence of armed groups. 1 fatality.

On 2 May 2023, in Popayan (Cauca), members of an unidentified armed group abducted six Indigenous people and members of the Indigenous Guard of the Tumbichucue Indigenous reserve. The victims were drawn to the area under false promises of a job. Days later, one of the people contacted his family to announce that they had been deceived by the armed group. Two of the victims were killed in an armed confrontation (coded separately), while the whereabouts of four others are unknown.

On 2 May 2023, in Valle Alto (Guayas), dozens of residents of Casas Viejas sector blocked the highway to the coast as a demonstration to demand authorities to solve the issue of a bridge collapsing in their sector caused by the Aneta river flooding due to the increasing rainfall.

On 2 May 2023, in Curuguaty (Canindeyu), CN supporters blocked the highway to demonstrate against the results of the general elections held on 30 April. They claimed that there was fraud and irregularities with voting machines and demanded the annulment of the election result. This was part of nationwide demonstrations that broke out after the CN presidential candidate Paraguayo Cubas made fraud allegations and called his supporters to demonstrate.

On 2 May 2023, in Asuncion (Asuncion), for the second consecutive day, CN supporters demonstrated outside Supreme Electoral Court against the results of the general elections held on 30 April. They clashed with police officers, who in turn fired rubber bullets and tear gas against the crowd. At the Operational Coordination of Customs Investigations (COIA) in the Vista Alegre sector demonstrators vandalized the building, destroyed security cameras and looted. Around 70 people have been arrested over two days in Asuncion. This was part of nationwide demonstrations that broke out after the CN presidential candidate Paraguayo Cubas made fraud allegations and called his supporters to demonstrate.

On 2 May 2023, in Catacaos (Piura), residents staged a demonstration outside the local government to voice their grievance about the poor service of the potable water company EPS Grau and demanding the reposition of the potable water service that has been lacking for ten days.

On 2 May 2023, in Montevideo (Montevideo), workers at garbage collection companies blocked the road to the Felipe Cardoso sector to protest against stricter regulations for waste disposal implemented by authorities. They said that the new regulations increase their cost of operation.

source: Efecto Cocuyo; El Nacional (Venezuela); El Pitazo; La Patilla
notes: On 2 May 2023, in Caracas - Libertador (Distrito Capital), a group of demonstrators, including workers and students of the UCV University, health workers, and other active and retired state workers, and pensioners, protested to demand better pay and working conditions, and against the new adjustments to bonuses and benefits for state workers announced the day before by the government. The demonstrators argue that these new measures are insufficient, and call instead for an increase in the minimum wage. The protest was held at the entrance of the UCV campus, in Puerta Tamanaco.

On 2 May 2023, in Barinas (Barinas), a group of teachers gathered in protest against the new adjustments to bonuses and benefits for state workers announced the day before by the government, which they argue to be insufficient, and called instead for an increase in the minimum wage. The protesters gathered in the Casa del Educador Office.

On 2 May 2023, in Punta Cardon (Falcon), a group of workers of the Frelat Ingenieria company, which renders services to the Paraguana Refinery, protested to demand payment of owed stipends. These payment delays have extended for over eight months. The protesters gathered outside the company's premises.

On 2 May 2023, in San Cristobal (Tachira), a group of residents of Palmar de La Cope (Tachira) protested to demand the fixing of the access road to their village, after being cut-off for over two months. The protesters argue that approximately 7200 people are affected. The demonstration was staged outside the Tachira state Legislative Council.

On 2 May 2023, in Ciudad Guayana (Bolivar), a group of laid-off workers at the Guacuripia Plant, belonging to the state-owned Venezuelan Corporation of Guayana (CVG), protested to demand payment of owed stipends, and their reinstatement in the company. They were laid off in April 2023, but they stopped getting paid a month before that. The protesters also demanded the implementation of security measures, and protective equipment, to be able to work safely. The protesters gathered outside the CVG headquarters, where they handed in a letter with their demands.

On 2 May 2023, in Ciudad Guayana (Bolivar), a group of workers at the Vencemos cement company, belonging to the state-owned Venezuelan Corporation of Guayana (CVG), protested to demand payment of owed stipends, and against what they deem as poor management from its president. The protesters gathered outside the Palace of Justice, where they handed in a letter with their demands.
On 2 May 2023, in Chiguara (Merida), a group of teachers protested to demand better pay and working conditions.

Around 2 May 2023 (as reported), in San Felipe (Yaracuy), a group of relatives and friends of a man killed by the police in unclear circumstances (coded separately), farmers, and residents of the Indio Yara neighborhood, protested to demand justice for the victim. The protesters gathered outside the Public Ministry Office, where they handed in a letter with their demands.

source: OVCS: Observatorio Venezolano de Conflictividad Social
notes: On 2 May 2023, in Carabobo state (coded to Valencia), demonstrators protested with unspecified demands on issues related to labor, social security, and housing.

source: OVCS: Observatorio Venezolano de Conflictividad Social
notes: On 2 May 2023, in San Carlos (Cojedes), a group of workers protested to demand better pay and working conditions.

source: La Patilla; OVCS: Observatorio Venezolano de Conflictividad Social
notes: On 2 May 2023, in Cumana (Sucre), a group of teachers protested to demand better pay and working conditions, and the dismissal of the director of the Sucre state Education Zone Office. Additionally, they rejected the new adjustments to bonuses and benefits for state workers announced by the government, which they argue to be insufficient, and called instead for an increase in the minimum wage.

source: OVCS: Observatorio Venezolano de Conflictividad Social
notes: On 2 May 2023, in Zulia state (coded to Maracaibo), demonstrators protested with unspecified demands on issues related to labor, social security, and housing.

On 2 May 2023, in Heredia, Heredia, students and their parents staged a protest by locking the doors of a local school. Protesters demanded that the Ministry of Education removes the current headmaster out of accusations of harassment.

On 2 May 2023, in Guatemala City, Guatemala, members of an unidentified gang shot and killed one woman and injured a girl and two other women in front of a church in zone 21, colonia Cerro Gordo. The attackers arrived in a motorcycle, stepped down and opened fire for no reason. Police believe that Barrio 18 could be involved, as the area is being under dispute between different gangs acting in the area. 1 fatality, 3 injured.

assoc_actor_1: Farmers (Honduras); Labor Group (Honduras); LIBRE: Liberty and Refoundation
notes: On 2 May 2023, in Choluteca, Choluteca, hundreds of employees from public and private institutions, farmers, disabled individuals, and collectives from the Liberty and Refoundation Party (LIBRE) marched in protest making various labor-related demands, in commemoration International Workers' Day. Participants held banners both in support of the government and demanding the fulfilment of electoral campaign promises.

Around 2 May 2023 (as reported), outside Omoa, Cortes, a member of the LGBTQ+ community was shot and killed and their body was found in the Santa Isabel village in the vicinity of the Cuyamel community. The reason for the killing is unknown. 1 fatality.

On 2 May 2023, in San Pedro Sula, Cortes, patients with multiple sclerosis from the Honduran Social Security Institute (IHSS) protested demanding government authorities to ensure a stable supply of essential medications for their treatments. A similar protest was held on this same day in Tegucigalpa (coded separately).

On 2 May 2023, in San Pedro Sula, Cortes, unidentified armed men on a motorcycle shot and killed a VIP taxi driver while he was driving his vehicle on the boulevard leading to Armenta (drive-by). Also, in San Pedro Sula, unidentified armed men shot and killed a taxi-driver in the vicinity of the Bermejo river. The reasons for the killings are unknown. 2 fatalities.

On 2 May 2023, in San Pedro Sula, Cortes, a group of employees of the National Agrarian Institute (INA) occupied the facilities of the institution in protest. They demanded the payment of back wages, the payment of severance to a number of retirees, the incorporation of employees into the National Institute of Pensions and Retirement of Employees and Officials of the Executive Branch (INJUPEMP), and a revolving fund, among other demands.

On 2 May 2023, in an unreported location (coded to Tegucigalpa, Francisco Morazan), police forces arrested an alleged collaborator of the Valle Valle drug cartel. The detainee had been under investigation for several years for money laundering and was now actively being investigated as part of Operation Cerbero for which several individuals had already been convicted of money laundering.

On 2 May 2023, in Tegucigalpa, Francisco Morazan, patients with multiple sclerosis from the Honduran Social Security Institute (IHSS) and the Hospital Escuela (HE) protested demanding government authorities to ensure a stable supply of essential medications for their treatments. The exact location of the protest was not reported. A similar protest was held on this same day in San Pedro Sula (coded separately).

On 2 May 2023, in Tegucigalpa, Francisco Morazan, a group of parents and students from the Luis Bogran Technical Institute protested on the North Boulevard demanding the return of teachers who had been removed or reassigned due to having interim appointments.

On 2 May 2023, in Tegucigalpa, Francisco Morazan, a group of students and parents from the Estados Unidos elementary school protested outside the school demanding the appointment of at least four teachers.

On 2 May 2023, in Tegucigalpa, Francisco Morazan, a group of residents of the San Miguel neighborhood blocked traffic on the main streets of the neighborhood in protest. They denounced the lack of potable water for 60 days, despite their timely payments for the service.

On 2 May 2023, in Zambrano, Francisco Morazan, a group of purged police blocked traffic and burned tires on the CA-5 highway in demonstration, demanding their reinstatement to the National Police. Riot police officers intervened repressing the demonstration with the use of water cannons, rubber bullets and tear gas. The police denied using tear gas during the operation.

On 2 May 2023, in Orica, Francisco Morazan, a group of residents blocked traffic on the main road leading to the department of Olancho in protest, demanding road repairs and the provision of a transportation unit from the Honduran Institute of Land Transport and Traffic (IHTT) to support public transportation services in the area.

source: France Info; Jamaica Observer; Suriname Herald; Waterkant
notes: On 2 May 2023, near Matta, Para, indigenous armed individuals set fire to around 10 wood transport trucks and a police station in Pikin Saron village as part of a demonstration against mining operations in their lands. The attack was a reprisal for activities developed by the Grassalco mining company, affecting their community. Police and military officers were deployed to take control of the situation and clashed with them. Two armed men were shot and killed, while gunshots injured another armed man and two officers. Two civilians were also injured. The indigenous armed men also kidnapped a policeman and two truck drivers. They were later released thanks to the police intervention. Four people were arrested. 2 fatalities, 5 injured.

On 2 May 2023, in Paramaribo, Paramaribo, a group of teachers and members of the Wi Sa Strei group held a protest outside the presidential palace to demand the payment of a bonus of 2,500 SRD, among other labor demands. Police forces were present, although no intervention on their side was reported.

source: Comision Intereclesial de Justicia y Paz
notes: On 2 May 2023, in the rural area of Puerto Asis municipality (Putumayo), two suspected militants of the CF shot and killed a man near La Rosa vereda. There are no further details about the attack. The vereda belongs to the Amazonian Pearl Farmers' reserve area. 1 fatality.

On 2 May 2023, in Sao Francisco do Sul (Santa Catarina), a man was shot at least eight times and killed in front of his private residence by an armed individual in a drive-by shooting. The victim worked as a lawyer and had been receiving death threats (circumstances not reported). Police believe the attack was premeditated and ordered by someone. One suspect was arrested on 31 May 2023. The suspect had a police record for drug trafficking and association to commit crimes. 1 fatality.

source: Crimes News RJ; Fogo Cruzado; G1; Globo Extra; Informe Agora; R7

Fingers of the victim's right hand were cut off and his heart was removed. Circumstances of death are unknown. 1 fatality.

notes: On 1 May 2023, in Santiago (Metropolitana), workers members of CCT (Classist Central of Workers) marched through the Meiggs sector in the Estacion Central commune towards the city center. Rioters also destroyed public property and threw Molotov cocktails at police that dispersed the crowd with tear gas and water cannons. Several metro stations such as Catholic University, Estacion Central Line 1 and Latinoamerican Union were closed due to demonstrations. Rioters robbed some office supplies from the headquarters. Victims stated that rioters had sticks, fire extinguishers and even hit some people in their faces with firearms causing them minor injuries.

On 1 May 2023, in the rural area of Uribia municipality (La Guajira), residents of Uribia and Manaure municipalities blocked the railway to protest against a power outage. The group claims to have been without service for two days.

On 1 May 2023, in Esmeraldas (Esmeraldas), unionized workers members of Popular Front (FP) and motorcycle taxi drivers marched through the city as a demonstration in commemoration of the International Workers' Day. They also demanded the resignation of president Guillermo Lasso, and for more security due to the increasing criminal activity in the country, economic reactivation for Esmeraldas and Manabi provinces, working positions and students admissions, among other demands.

On 1 May 2023, in Ambato (Tungurahua), unionized workers marched through the city as a demonstration in commemoration of the International Workers' Day. They also demanded security due to the increasing criminal activity in the country and that the central government provide with medicines and equipment to public hospitals.

source: ABC Color; La Nacion (Argentina); Ultima Hora
notes: On 1 May 2023, in Asuncion (Asuncion), hundreds of CN supporters demonstrated outside Supreme Electoral Court against the results of the general elections held on 30 April. They claimed that there was fraud and irregularities with voting machines and demanded the annulment of the election result. They clashed with police officers, who in turn fired rubber bullets and tear gas against the crowd. As a result, one demonstrator and seven police officers were injured. Nearby, demonstrators destroyed a Colorado Party campaign booth and some vehicles and attacked an ambulance. They also threw rocks at a news outlet car. Around 70 people have been arrested over two days in Asuncion. This was part of nationwide demonstrations that broke out after the CN presidential candidate Paraguayo Cubas made fraud allegations and called his supporters to demonstrate. There were no fatalities.

Around 1 May 2023 (as reported), in the rural area of Coronel Martinez municipality (Guaira), residents in the Moges Paso sector held a demonstration against indiscriminate logging and other environmental crimes they claim are being perpetrated for the installation of a sand extraction company next to the Tebicuary River.
On 1 May 2023, around Isla Yacyreta municipality (Itapua), workers at the Ana Cua consortium and fishers from Ayolas marched to demand to the company the signing of a collective work contract.

On 1 May 2023, in Piura (Piura), more than 200 residents of UPIS Vive Hogar Castilla sector blocked the Piura - Chulucanas highway to demand the ENOSA electricity company to reestablish the electricity service that was cut from their sector more than five days ago.

notes: On 1 May 2023, in Ica (Ica), unionized teachers members of the Union of Education Workers of Peru (SUTEP) and unionized workers members of different syndicates marched through the city as a demonstration in commemoration of the International Workers' Day and demand higher salaries and respect to workers with disabilities for them to access working positions.

On 1 May 2023, in Huancayo (Junin), unionized workers members of different syndicates marched through the city as a demonstration in commemoration of the International Workers' Day. They also demanded more laws to benefit workers, and more working opportunities to be given through CAS contract hirings.

On 1 May 2023, in Arequipa (Arequipa), unionized workers marched through the city as a demonstration in commemoration of the International Workers' Day. They also voiced their grievance against the president Dina Boluarte and that her government has not respected collective pacts.

On 1 May 2023, in Cusco (Cusco), CAS contract health workers marched to Mayor square as a demonstration in commemoration of the International Workers' Day. They also demanded their inclusion in the formal contract law.

On 1 May 2023, in Chiclayo (Lambayeque), CAS contract health workers staged a demonstration in commemoration of the International Workers' Day. They also demanded the fulfilment of the law that changes the CAS contract of health workers hired during the coronavirus pandemic to a regular CAS contract.

On 1 May 2023, in Chimbote (Ancash), unionized workers of Ripley stores staged a demonstration outside Megaplaza store in commemoration of the International Workers' Day. They also demanded payment of their bonuses for working on vacation days.

On 1 May 2023, in Abancay province (Apurimac), unionized civil construction workers marched as a demonstration in commemoration of the International Workers' Day and to demand the closure of congress, calling for general elections, and for the resignation of President Dina Boluarte.

assoc_actor_1: Labor Group (Venezuela); Health Workers (Venezuela); Teachers (Venezuela); FVM: Venezuelan Federation of Teachers
source: Caraota Digital; Efecto Cocuyo; El Carabobeno; El Pitazo; La Patilla
notes: On 1 May 2023, in Caracas - Libertador (Distrito Capital), approximately 2000 demonstrators, including teachers, UCV University workers, health workers, other active and retired state workers, pensioners, and FVM representatives, protested to demand better pay and working conditions, and against governmental corruption and political repression. Several groups of protesters gathered in different parts of the city, including the Venezuela and the Caracas squares, and Chacaito, and then merged into a single larger march towards the Public Ministry Office in Carabobo Park. PNB anti-riot police forces blocked them from advancing to that final destination, but there was no intervention. This demonstration was part of the dozens of simultaneous nationwide protests held on International Workers' Day.

source: Diario Version Final (Venezuela); El Impulso; El Pitazo

On 1 May 2023, in Maracay (Aragua), a group of demonstrators, including teachers, university workers, health workers, and other state and private sector workers, protested to demand better pay and working conditions, the renewal of their collective labor agreements, and the restoration of medical insurance plans. The protesters gathered in the El Estudiante Square.

On 1 May 2023, in Barquisimeto (Lara), a large group of demonstrators, including state workers of different sectors, and unionists, protested to demand better pay and working conditions, and against government corruption. The protesters gathered in the Los Ilustres Square and then marched to the Lara state Education Zone Office. This demonstration was part of the dozens of simultaneous nationwide protests held on International Workers' Day.

Around 1 May 2023 (as reported), in El Rincon (Sucre), several members of the Los Wilma Gang beat a man with concrete blocks and rocks, shortly after having an argument with him, during an attack in the Los Ranchos sector. The victim was taken to a hospital in Cumana (Sucre), where he died days later. 1 fatality.

On 1 May 2023, in San Antonio del Tachira (Tachira), a group of merchants and business owners protested against the high water bills, and to demand the cessation of the continuous power outages. The protesters argue that the service is too costly, especially when they only get water twice a month.

On 1 May 2023, in San Felipe (Yaracuy), a group of demonstrators, including state workers, unionists, and civil society representatives, protested to demand better pay and working conditions. At the beginning of the protest, a group of hooded individuals on motorcycles, accused by the protesters of belonging to pro-government colectivos, attempted to intimidate and discourage the demonstrators from staging their demonstration. Eventually, these individuals ceased trying and left the area without incident, and the protesters continued with their march to the Jose Joaquin Veroes Square. There was no violent interaction between the groups. Anti-riot security forces were also present, but there was no intervention. This demonstration was part of the dozens of simultaneous nationwide protests held on International Workers' Day.

On 1 May 2023, in San Diego (Carabobo), a group of families that have been waiting 18 years to build their houses in a construction site under ownership dispute, protested to demand the National Institute of Urban Land (INTU) authorities to officially recognize their proprietary rights to the land. The INTU institute granted them this ownership a month and a half before, but did not make the decision official, to the extent that a suspected prior owner of the land appeared, and initiated earthmoving works.

On 1 May 2023, in Belize City, Belize, people held a man after he shot another (coded separately) in Ordonez Street, in Lake Independence neighborhood. Rioters stabbed the man and surrendered him to the police. No more information or detail is provided by the source. 1 injured.

On 1 May 2023, in Belize City, Belize, an unidentified attacker shot and killed a member of the Leadership Intervention Unit (LIU) of the police force (off-duty), while the latter was returning home in Ordonez Street, in Lake Independence. The motivation of the attack is unknown. The attacker was held by a group of people after the attack and surrendered to the police (coded separately). 1 fatality.

assoc_actor_1: ANDE: National Association of Educators; Teachers (Costa Rica); Labor Group (Costa Rica); SEC: Costa Rica Education Workers' Union
notes: On 1 May 2023, in San Jose, San Jose, at least one thousand people participated in the protest on the occasion of Labor Day. Labour unions gathered in La Merced Park and marched to the Legislative Assembly. Protesters demanded more government actions on education, health, and economy, the defense of the Costa Rican office of social security and labour rights. The National Association of Educators, the Costa Rica Education Workers' Union, the Union of the Bank of Costa Rica participated in the protest.

On 1 May 2023, in Palin, Escuintla, people staged a protest on the highway Palin-Escuintla on the occasion of Labor Day. Protesters marched on the highway at the height of KM 38 towards the facilities of the local government. Protesters indicated that the demonstration was organized to verify the conditions of the highway after the end of the concession to a Mexican company.

On 1 May 2023, in Guatemala City, Guatemala, hundreds of people affiliated with labour unions, social organizations, farmers, women labor organizations, and students staged a demonstration on the occasion of Labor Day. Protesters, who marched from zone 5 to zone 1, denounced the high costs of living, the abuse of power, poor labor conditions, and demanded fair and free elections, and better salaries, among others. In addition, they denounced a widespread corruption in the country. The Trade Union of Workers of Guatemala (UNSITRAGUA), General Central of Workers of Guatemala (CGTG), the Union of workers of the Villa de Chicaco, Santa Barbara, Chuarrancho and the Union of Workers of the Office of Social Welfare participated in the protest.

On 1 May 2023, in Guatemala City, Guatemala, people affiliated with the Union of Workers, Actions and Revolution of the Supreme Electoral Tribunal (StarTSE) and the Union of Workers of the Supreme Electoral Tribunal (SITTSE) staged a protest at the Supreme Electoral Tribunal (TSE) on the occasion of Labor Day in zone 1. People protested against overpayments and illegal hiring.

assoc_actor_1: Labor Group (French Guiana); UGT: General Union of Workers (French Guiana); CGT: General Confederation of Labour (French Guiana); UNSA: National Union of Autonomous Trade Unions (French Guiana); FSU: Unitary Union Federation (French Guiana)
notes: On 1 May 2023, in Cayenne, Cayenne, around 400 workers, called by eight trade unions, held a march to demand better working conditions for the working class on the occasion of International Workers Day. The protest was joined by UGT, CGT, UNSA, and FSU members, among other groups.

On 1 May 2023, in Georgetown, Demerara-Mahaica, workers and members of the Federation of Independent Trade Unions of Guyana held a march from the National Park to demand better working conditions for the working class on the occasion of International Workers' Day.

assoc_actor_1: Health Workers (Honduras); Labor Group (Honduras); Government of Honduras (2022-); PNH: National Party of Honduras
notes: On 1 May 2023, in Tela, Atlantida, workers and members of seven labor unions including the Tela Municipal Employees Union (SIDEPMUT), the Hotel Villas Telamar Workers Union (SITRAHOVITE) and the Union of Workers of Medicine, Hospitals and Similar (SITRAMEDHYS) marched in protest from the Highland Creek neighborhood to the city's municipality, to commemorate International Workers' Day and demand respect for labor rights. For the first time in the city's history, the mayor (from the PNH) joined the protest, also addressing the crowd during the event.

On 1 May 2023, in Roatan, Bay Islands, residents and workers marched in protest in commemoration of International Workers' Day. The protesters made various labor-related demands, in addition to demanding improvements in the health care system on the island.
On 1 May 2023, in El Corpus, Choluteca, a group of residents joined by the Pastoral Social Caritas and various environmental organizations marched in protest against open-pit mining in their region.

On 1 May 2023, in Comayagua, Comayagua, workers and members of various labor unions including the Union of Workers of the Beverage and Similar Industry (STIBYS), the Union of Workers of the National Autonomous University of Honduras (SITRAUNAH), among others, also joined by around 350 members of the Union of Workers of Medicine, Hospitals and Similar (SITRAMEDHYS) marched in protest demanding salary readjustments among other labor-related demands, in occasion of International Workers' Day.

assoc_actor_1: Labor Group (Honduras); LIBRE: Liberty and Refoundation; Teachers (Honduras)

assoc_actor_1: Labor Group (Honduras); LIBRE: Liberty and Refoundation; Teachers (Honduras); Women (Honduras)
notes: On 1 May 2023, in San Pedro Sula, Cortes, more than 5,000 residents and workers, including teachers, factory employees, members of various trade unions, and supporters of the National Popular Resistance Front and the Liberty and Refoundation Party (LIBRE), marched in protest in commemoration of International Workers' Day. Their demands included various labor-related demands, in addition to an end to corruption, the provision of better healthcare facilities, better transportation, as well as an end to gender-based discrimination and violence.

On 1 May 2023, in Danli, El Paraiso, various groups including the Popular Block, political training schools of the Liberty and Refoundation Party (LIBRE) and members of the Honduran Press Association (APH) marched in protest in commemoration of International Workers' Day. The demands of the protesters included, among others, the construction of a Social Security hospital and improvements in existing health facilities, respect for freedom of expression and an end to violence against the press.

assoc_actor_1: Labor Group (Honduras); Former Government of Honduras (2022-)
notes: On 1 May 2023, in Tegucigalpa, Francisco Morazan, more than 150,000 residents and workers from various labor unions and syndicates marched from La Granja neighborhood to the Central Park in protest to commemorate International Workers' Day. They demanded better wages and working conditions, the eradication of unemployment, mitigation of migration and improved security. They also expressed their opposition to hourly employment and other proposed reforms to the Labor Code, among various other demands. Former president and husband of the current president of Honduras addressed the crowd in the capital's Central Plaza reassuring the president is working for to improve the welfare of the country's citizens.

On 1 May 2023, in Arada, Santa Barbara, unidentified armed men on a motorcycle shot and killed two young men while they were riding as passengers of a moto-taxi, in a drive-by shooting. The reason for the killing is unknown. 2 fatalities.

assoc_actor_1: Labor Group (Panama); SUNTRACS: Single Union of Construction and Associated Workers; CONATO: National Council for Organized Workers; ASOPROF: Panamanian Association of Teachers; Teachers (Panama); CONUSI: National Confederation of United Independent Unions

Demands included calls for improvements in the quality of life, the defense of the social security, more jobs and respect for union's freedom. Protesters included: Single Union of Construction and Associated Workers (SUNTRACS), National Council for Organized Workers, Panamanian Association of Teachers, Union of Workers of the Ministry of Public Works (Sintramop), Musicians Union of Panama (SITMAS), National Confederation of United Independent Unions, among others.

Security measures: On 1 May 2023, in Delgado, San Salvador, the government established police and military checkpoints to delay and prevent the access of people to the city capital to participate in the Labor Day demonstration, scheduled to take place on the same day. According to the report, police and military officers were deployed it the height of KM 11 on the road to Sonsonate. During the Labor Day demonstration that occurred during 1 May (coded separately) state forces did not intervene.

Security measures: On 1 May 2023, in San Marcos, San Salvador, the government established police and military checkpoints to delay and prevent the access of people to the city capital to participate in the Labor Day demonstration, scheduled to take place on the same day. According to the report, police and military officers were deployed in at the height of the La Paz Monument on the road to Comalapa and in the surroundings of the South Terminal. assoc_actor_1: Labor Group (El Salvador); MOVIR: Movement of Victims of the Regime; Teachers (El Salvador); Judges (El Salvador); Former Government of El Salvador (2019-); Government of El Salvador (2019-); Students (El Salvador); FMLN: Farabundo Marti National Liberation Front; NT: Our Time Party; Vamos: Let's Go El Salvador Party; ASTRAM: Salvadorian Association for Municipal Workers; CNTS: National Confederation of Salvadoran Workers
source: Diario Co Latino; El Mundo (El Salvador); El Salvador.com; La Prensa Grafica
notes: On 1 May 2023, in San Salvador, San Salvador, thousands of people staged a demonstration on the occasion of the Labor Day. People demonstrated against arbitrary detentions, demanded labor improvements, respect for the constitution and rejected the reelection of President Bukele. Civil society organizations, the Minister of Labor, teachers, judges, students, former members of Parliament, and labor groups participated in the demonstration, such as the Union of Employees of the University of El Salvador, CNTS, ASTRAM, National Association of Salvadoran Educators (ANDES JUNE 21), the Union of Administrative Workers of the Ministry of Education of El Salvador (SITADMES) and the Salvadoran Pedagogical Movement, and the Salvadoran Trade Union Unity (USS). Leftist political parties FMLN, Our Time and Let's Go Salvador, and Popular Resistance and Rebellion Bloc, MOVIR, Humanitarian Legal Aid, the Committee of Political Prisoners of El Salvador also participated in the demonstration. A group of participants set on fire the effigy of President Bukele. Simultaneously, another group of labour union members expressed their support for the current administration.

Security measures: On 1 May 2023, in San Salvador municipality, San Salvador, the government established police and military checkpoints to delay and prevent the access of people to the city capital to participate in the Labor Day demonstration, scheduled to take place on the same day. According to the report, police and military officers were deployed on the Troncal del Norte highway and on the detour to Tonacatepeque. During the Labor Day demonstration that occurred during 1 May (coded separately) state forces did not intervene.
On 1 May 2023, in Moengo, Marowijne, a group of teachers, called by the Wi Sa Strei group, held a protest to demand the payment of a bonus of 2,500 SRD, among other labor demands.

source: Folha de Boa Vista; G1; InSight Crime
notes: Around 1 May 2023 (as reported), in Yanomami Indigenous Territory (Roraima), eight people were killed and their bodies were found in the Uxiu community with gunshot wounds and arrow wounds. The killings were perpetrated by Indigenous people for the death of an Yanomami Indigenous man on 29 April 2023 in an attack carried out by the PCC (coded separately). The PCC are providing miners with heavy weaponry and machinery. 8 fatalities.

Around 1 May 2023 (as reported), in Manhuacu (Minas Gerais), a man was killed by unknown individuals and his body was found in the Francisco de Assis neighborhood with gunshot wounds. The victim was a drug user and had a police record for drug trafficking. 1 fatality.

On 1 May 2023, in Juiz de Fora (Minas Gerais), a man was shot and killed by unknown armed individuals in the Monte Castelo neighborhood. The victim had a police record for drug trafficking. 1 fatality.

source: ABC Color; La Nacion (Paraguay); Ultima Hora
notes: On 1 May 2023, in Mariano Roque Alonso (Central), around 1,500 CN supporters blocked Remanso Bridge to demonstrate against the results of the general elections held on 30 April. They claimed that there was fraud and irregularities with voting machines and demanded the annulment of the election result. Demonstrators clashed with police officers who in turn threw tear gas and fired rubber bullets injuring a demonstrator in the head, who was taken to the hospital where he remained until he died on 15 June. One child was also affected by the tear gas. A checkpoint of the National Transportation Directorate (DINATRAN) was also destroyed and looted and a police car was set on fire. Two police agents were injured. Demonstrators also temporarily held an ambulance. This was part of nationwide demonstrations that broke out after the CN presidential candidate Paraguayo Cubas made fraud allegations and called his supporters to demonstrate. 1 fatality.

actor2: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
source: Fogo Cruzado; G1; Informe Agora; R7
notes: On 1 May 2023, in Rio de Janeiro - West Zone (Rio de Janeiro), a group of armed suspects opened fire on military police officers in the Morro do Banco community, Itanhanga neighborhood. A civilian boy was shot and injured. Elsewhere, armed individuals exchanged fire with military police in the Padre Miguel neighborhood. One suspect was killed and another was arrested. Police seized a motorcycle and two gun replicas. 1 fatality.

On 1 May 2023, in Cabo de Santo Agostinho (Pernambuco), unidentified shooters exchanged fire in the Charnequinha neighborhood. A man was shot and killed, and another was injured. A pregnant woman was also shot and subsequently lost her unborn baby. The case is under investigation. 1 fatality.

actor1: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
notes: On 1 May 2023, in Olinda (Pernambuco), a military police officer shot and injured a gay man inside a bar in the Ouro Preto neighborhood. The victim believe the attack was motivated by homophobia, since the officer aimed for his testicles.

actor1: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
notes: On 1 May 2023, in Belford Roxo - Parque Sao Jose (Rio de Janeiro), two drug traffickers exchanged fire with military police in the Glaucia neighborhood. Both suspects were arrested. Police seized a firearm, ammunition, a radio communicator, and drugs. There were no fatalities.

actor1: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
notes: On 1 May 2023, in Sao Goncalo - Monjolo (Rio de Janeiro), two armed individuals exchanged fire with military police in the Jardim Catarina neighborhood after trying to fled a patrol on the BR-101 highway. One suspect was injured. Both suspects were arrested. There were no fatalities.

actor1: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
notes: On 1 May 2023, in Rio de Janeiro - North Zone (Rio de Janeiro), an armed individual exchanged fire with military police in the Penha neighborhood. The suspect was injured. Police seized a firearm, portions of drugs, and a vehicle. There were no fatalities.

On 1 May 2023, in Recife (Pernambuco), a man was shot and killed in the Ibura neighborhood by unknown armed individuals. The victim had recently left prison (charges not reported). Police believe the attack was motivated by drug trafficking disputes. 1 fatality.
On 1 May 2023, in Paracambi (Rio de Janeiro), a man was shot and killed in the Lages neighborhood by unknown armed individuals. The victim had a police record for drug trafficking. 1 fatality.

On 1 May 2023, in Santa Ana de Coro (Falcon), a group of active and retired state workers, pensioners, and unspecified political party representatives, protested to demand better pay and working conditions, and the repeal of the National Budget Office (ONAPRE) instruction. The protesters gathered in the Bolivar Square and then marched around the city. Police were present but there was no intervention. This demonstration was part of the dozens of simultaneous nationwide protests held on International Workers' Day.
